column7:
['THE COMPANY', 'Solsten is advancing the human experience by empowering companies to build deeply resonating and healthier human-centered digital experiences and products.', "At the intersection of play, psychology, and AI, our suite of products (Traits, Navigator, Frequency, and Wavelength) give companies in the Gaming and Healthcare industries the ability to understand and meet their audiences' experiential expectations at every step of their journey—ushering in a new era of technology that is better for people, and brilliant for businesses.", 'THE ROLE', "As a Senior Account Executive, you'll oftentimes be the first point of contact for our customers with our brand and our suite of products. You'll work closely with our founders, marketing, customer success, and our product team to ensure that we empower gaming companies globally with the deepest understanding of their players and the ability to provide memorable experiences.", 'WHAT YOU WILL DO', "Drive and own opportunity development and sales responsibilities for customer accounts across North America.
Build relationships and establish communication with key decision-makers in your accounts to understand their needs and priorities while establishing yourself as a trusted advisor to our customers.
Identify and qualify high-value opportunities for Solsten's suite of intelligence products
Articulate the differentiated value of Solsten to the customer and establish our ability to deliver immediate business value.
Understand the formal and informal buying process in the customer's environment, including customer approvers, decision-makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase deal confidence.
Manage the closing process including negotiations, terms, and conditions, involving Solsten domain experts as needed.
Develop a 12-month pipeline of qualified opportunities to meet and exceed your quota targets by leveraging a combination of outbound and inbound sales strategies.
Create excellent documentation for each account and customer touchpoint by using HubSpot to maintain a current and accurate pipeline of your early stage, upside, and forecast deals.
Communicate and brainstorm with Solsten management and the extended team around all aspects of account and opportunity development.
Review your opportunity funnel with Solsten management and extended team on a bi-weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
Direct accountability to meet or exceed your quarterly and annual sales quota on a consistent basis.", "WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR", 'Proven track record of selling software-as-a-service into strategic / enterprise accounts, ideally in gaming and entertainment
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
4+ years of quota-carrying software or technology sales and account management experience
Demonstrated prospecting, discovery, objection handling, planning, and closing skills
Competitive spirit and a clear drive for results
Deeply in tune with buyer needs and the modern buyer context
Trusted advisor to customers and colleagues
Demonstrated ability to proactively nurture leads through context by providing relevant information and analysis that directly address the buyer's needs
Ability to quickly identify a customer's needs and offer pragmatic solutions
Technical aptitude to master a complex, data-oriented product
Ability to clearly communicate ROI paired with strong business acumen
Independent, organized yet flexible, and able to prioritize opportunities effectively without risking any potential deals
Highly coachable and motivated by continuous learning with a healthy dose of curiosity and a strong bias for action
Excellent written/oral communication and presentation skills
Effective collaborator and influencer in a "win as a team" environment
Ideally, demonstrated experience in setting up and iterating on the sales process across all stages (e.g. lead generation, qualification, etc.)
Ideally, prior successful collaborations with marketing and growth marketing teams to drive lead generation and qualification
Passionate about games, psychology, and a deep fascination for understanding the human experience', 'YOUR SOLSTEN EXPERIENCE']

['TigerConnect transforms healthcare with the industry’s most widely adopted clinical collaboration platform – uniquely modernizing the way doctors, nurses, care teams, patients, and data connect. With solutions spanning care communication, patient engagement, scheduling, alarm notifications, nurse call, and more, TigerConnect accelerates productivity, reduces costs, and improves patient outcomes, safely and securely. Trusted by more than 7,000 healthcare organizations for user-friendly, yet enterprise-ready solutions, TigerConnect delivers 99.99% verifiable uptime for more than 10 million messages each day.', '', 'The TigerConnect team is seeking a high-achieving sales professional with experience selling enterprise level solutions. In this role you will be focused on driving new business by establishing new relationships and developing and closing opportunities. The ideal candidate will have enterprise SaaS selling experience and thrive in a fast-paced growth environment. The Senior Enterprise Account Executive will play a key role in driving strategic, new enterprise-wide sales initiatives within healthcare organizations to achieve sales goals and growth objectives. This role is expected to work within, Mid-Atlantic territory. Residence within the current geography or proximity of the territory is preferred though not required.', '', 'What You’ll Be Doing:', 'Develop & own relationships with prospects senior leaders (CMO, CNO, CMIO, CIO) and close new logo business to achieve sales objectives and quotas
Create and manage a sales pipeline of new business opportunities within a territory through inbound and outbound sales motions
Use a consultative and value selling approach from initial discovery to closing
Travel in market and lead custom face-to-face and virtual sales presentations as needed
Maintain (or develop) a thorough understanding of the healthcare industry, including industry trends, workflow, business processes, industry financial measurements, and performance indicators', '', 'What You Bring:', 'BA/BS required, MBA or graduate degree is a plus
5+ years working selling at the enterprise level (SaaS preferred)
A proven track record of exceeding sales quotas through new logo business
Track record of establishing quality senior relationships, and selling into the C-Suite with multiple decision makers and stakeholders inside and outside of IT
Solution selling mentality with the ability to develop a plan, articulate value, and navigate complexities of our clients to drive revenue
Cross-functional collaboration with internal stakeholders to execute business initiatives and drive market strategy
Energy, positivity and grit to bring into the TigerConnect culture
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication
Driven, proactive, and able to operate effectively in a fast-paced, rapidly changing growth environment
Experience in the acute healthcare industry is a plus', '']

['Postman is the world's leading collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API & streamline collaboration to help create better APIs—faster. More than 23 million developers & 500,000 organizations worldwide use Postman today. After receiving Series D funding in 2021 & releasing our biggest & best version ever of Postman in September 2022, we continue to strive humbly towards our mission of 100 million connected developers & serving companies as they seek to innovate in an API-first world.
P.S: We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture and our vision at Postman.
About the Team
This is a unique opportunity to rapidly scale a high velocity sales team within our fast-growing Enterprise business. With nearly every major Fortune 1000 company in the world using Postman at some level, we are positioned to expand our Enterprise presence exponentially over the coming year. We are looking for a passionate, energetic, value-centric Enterprise Sales Leader to grow and develop a team of Strategic Account Executives to seamlessly navigate enterprise sales cycles and effectively close deals. The ideal candidate is a seasoned sales leader who has personally driven teams to achieve significant sales growth at technical Enterprise SaaS companies.
This role will report into Postman’s Head of Enterprise Sales, Americas.
What You’ll Do
Scale, manage and mentor a team of Strategic Account Executives by fostering a culture of sales excellence through rigorous discovery, innovation, and integrity within our most strategic accounts
Drive business growth for Postman through new license and expansion sales and ensure excellence across reporting, pipeline management and overall pre-sales customer satisfaction.
Be an innovator in helping our team discover new ways to sell our product and drive new business initiatives.
Help develop and execute an effective sales strategy designed to deliver on key business metrics.
Prepare and present sales presentations to Executive and C-level prospective clients.
Guide the team on how to educate customers on the value of Postman Enterprise and to navigate key decision makers in order to grow Postman Enterprise awareness within organizations
Communicate regularly and effectively with Sales Operations, providing accurate and timely sales forecasts and maintain accurate records in all internal CRM and reporting tools.
Communicate and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, on-boarding, and technical inquiries
Collaborate and work with Solutions Engineering, Customer Success Managers, Leadership, etc. to build strategic adoption plans for customers in large accounts
Provide recommendations based on customers’ business needs and usage patterns
Listen closely and continuously work to educate and promote growth for direct reports.
About You
5 years leading an Enterprise relevant sales motion preferably in a enterprise SaaS organization
Experience selling developer and/or technical products a strong plus
Strong experience with sales training such as MEDDIC, Sandler, Miller Heiman, etc
Excellent communication skills both with customers and within an organization
Proven negotiation and closing skills, and demonstrated ability translating that knowledge to a sales team
Strong track record of navigating within large enterprise and mid-market organizations
Ability to develop senior level relationships quickly and effectively
Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-suite
Ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process
Takes an active interest in increasing customer satisfaction and deepening customer relationships
Lots of smiles
Our Values
At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency and honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.
What Else?
This role is based in Boston or New York City Area and the reasonably estimated base salary for this role ranges from $140,000 to $200,000, plus variable compensation & a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, and a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of Boston, New York City and the U.S.
Equal Opportunity
At Postman, diversity means we implement informed policies and practices to grow a company that reflects global experiences and identities while treating each person with fairness and dignity. Inclusion is the choice we make each day and with every interaction, to foster a workplace and world where people of all backgrounds not only belong but excel. We understand that together, we succeed better.
Postman is unapologetically committed to Equal Opportunity Employment. We proudly offer equal employment opportunities to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodations through the hiring process, please let us know early by emailing us: accommodations@postman.com. We want to give you every opportunity to show us the star that you are.
#LI-Remote']

column1: Senior Representative I, Client Partnership (Senior SaaS Sales)
column7:
['Looking to join a fun-loving and inclusive culture that has your back? Our fast-growing and dynamic company provides a life experience that supports your professional growth and personal well being.

With offices around the world, ServiceRocket’s five-star products and services help tech giants like Salesforce, Workplace from Meta, Digital.ai and Atlassian get the most from their software. We enable fast-growing companies to take off. And so will your career!

This role is a key member of our sales team, focused on finding and driving both short and long term opportunities with enterprise level customers. You will be responsible for identifying, qualifying and converting leads to closing new sales opportunities in solution selling, using products such as Atlassian to drive transformational services solutions to customers.', "Responsibilities
Key account acquisition by developing an interaction strategy to determine the objectives and level of effort required to effectively target assigned strategic accounts/territory
Capture all external and market-based data, current and prospective customer information, and data that could assist with the sales process
Generate leads, close business (new and renewal) to meet/exceed quota, manage pipeline, update forecast, develop and execute account plans
Hunt and identify prospective customers from business directories, participation in business communities and events
Contact and qualify prospective customers
Develop initiatives within sales to improve funnel conversion rates and increase volume of sales-qualified leads
Educate customers on the benefits (financial or otherwise) of our solution offerings
Host product demonstrations, webinars, and other online events to educate SQL's
Negotiate and close deals for assigned accounts/territory
Focus on developing initiatives and funnel conversion rates for assigned accounts/territory", 'Essential skills
Able to analyze market data to identify trends/opportunities
Experience conducting make-versus-buy analyses for partnerships/mergers/acquisitions
Has developed strategic market/product line business plans
Has developed marketing programs to support sales including identification of volume and customers
Experience identifying and developing key industry partnerships
Can develop strategic direction from market information, and create compelling market analysis presentations', 'Requirements
Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of saas sales experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or equivalent experience
Proven track record of closing large complex enterprise deals (over 100,000 USD)
Proven track record working in B2B companies.
Experience selling solutions for Tech or SaaS companies.', 'Good to have
Experience working in a global asynchronous environment
Proficiency using software similar to Netsuite/Salesforce/Hubspot
Atlassian ecosystem proficiency', '', '', 'The US base pay range for this position is between $128,669 to $171,994 per annum. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. The pay range is the base pay being offered, which may vary depending on experience and geographical location. ServiceRocket also offers all its full-time employees exceptional benefits in addition to the base salary. These may include our Share the Fruit bonus plan; stock options, Rocketeer allowances and a full range of medical, retirement, and other benefits.
ServiceRocket is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
ServiceRocket is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

With a competitive salary and career pathway to advance your skills, you’ll reap the rewards of growth with ServiceRocket’s unique Share the Fruit program and an opportunity for stock options. Our generous health and wellness benefits allow you to care for yourself and loved ones. We offer monthly stipends that support how you work and encourage a healthy work life balance. Wear the Rocket: come grow with us!']

column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) 4% Match', '401(k) matching', 'Continuing education credits', 'Dental insurance', 'Flexible spending account']
column7: ['Develop, Coach, Lead. Drive Growth.', 'CB Insights is looking for a highly skilled and experienced Sales Leader to help develop and lead our critical Strategic Account Executive team (SAE team).', "The role you'll play:", 'The Strategic Accounts team "lands-and-expands" CB Insight\'s largest global accounts through an account-based sales and service motion. This account-based model is grounded in a collaborative Strategic Account Executive (SAE), Strategic Account Manager (SAM), and Sales Development Representative (SDR) partnership that prioritizes long-term client growth. This team drives incredible retention and growth outcomes with our most important and complex client relationships.', 'The Sr. Director, Strategic Sales is responsible for inspiring, developing and engaging a high potential team of Strategic Account Executives (SAEs). In addition, this person will be relied on to build and evolve growth strategies, expanding the impressive multi-year growth trajectory of the firm.', 'About the Strategic Accounts Team:', "Working on our team is unique mostly because of our amazing clients, the problems we are helping them solve, and our team's diversity.", 'Every day our team speaks with the best and brightest people at Fortune 500 companies. Our clients are looking to us to help them solve interesting challenges on how some of the largest organizations in the world are adapting to emerging tech trends. Being a part of the CBI Strategic Accounts team means being a part of that equation.', "The uniqueness of our team is driven by our group's diversity. You can look around and you'll find very few people with similar backgrounds. We each bring our own story which creates a very special environment for creativity, fun, strategy, and success.", "What's CB Insights All About:"]

['Edlio Summary', "Hi, we're Edlio! We are a fast-paced technology company that is looking for a proven, dynamic individual to join our team. We specialize in web-based solutions for K12 schools and support communication for thousands of schools and districts nationwide. Our content management system is packed with features designed specifically for teachers and school administrators and is a perfect fit for educational organizations of any size, from small charter schools to districts with dozens of campuses.", 'Job purpose', 'We are looking for a competitive and experienced Senior Sales Executive to help us grow our business. Sales Executive responsibilities include discovering and pursuing new sales prospects, forecasting, negotiating deals, and closing business. If you have excellent communication skills and enjoy the challenge of reaching out to potential customers to demonstrate our services and discuss our solutions, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll help us to meet and surpass business objectives and contribute to our company’s rapid and sustained growth.', 'Duties and responsibilities', 'Identify and develop new business from phone, trade show, email and other communication methods
Proactively make a high volume of calls/emails to book appointments with prospects
Deliver product demonstrations, both virtually and onsite for school and school district decision makers (Principals, Superintendents, etc.)
Represent Edlio at trade shows, which may require travel to various areas of the country
Generate quotes and proposals and maintain follow up communication to close sales
Meet monthly and quarterly new sales goals
Achieve and consistently exceed monthly goals - strong work ethic and tenacity are key
Ability to negotiate and sell to every decision-making level
Generate opportunity-specific value propositions for desired business outcomes', 'Qualifications', 'At least 7+ years experience in a sales or sales related role
Must have experience in the SaaS space (EdTech experience preferred)
Proficiency in English
Understanding of sales strategies and negotiating techniques
Have a desire to learn and a passion for sales
Aptitude in delivering effective presentations
Bachelor’s degree
Salesforce experience preferred', 'Salary and Benefits', '$2,000 sign-on bonus
Base salary + variable compensation plan
401K with employer matching
Comprehensive healthcare benefits
Maternity/Paternity leave
Paid vacation and holidays
Edlio Winter Break
Travel stipend
Wellness stipend']

['Vimeo is looking for a Senior Sales Engineer to join our team! You will work with content creators and businesses, interpreting and evaluating their needs and communicating how Vimeo can help! This position is best for someone who is quick thinking, flexible, creative, and enjoys taking on new challenges.', 'Why join the SE team at Vimeo?', "You'll be part of our growing Sales Engineering team servicing the Corporate and Strategic customer base. Your key focus will be bringing the power of video to some of the largest global Enterprises, as well as content owners in the arts, fitness and entertainment industry, who are taking their business to the next level with our best in class video products. You will work closely with colleagues who are passionate about video technology, diverse, curious, and values an inclusive workplace.", "What you'll do:", "Work with companies across varying industries, evaluating their requirements and helping them solve their video hosting, monetization, and live streaming needs
Prepare and deliver value-based demonstrations by highlighting our outstanding and industry leading features as a Vimeo Expert
Document customer requirements, design and validate proposed solution workflows, and document for sharing back to clients
Work closely with prospects for planning and execution of RFPs, Product Evaluations, and security questionnaires.
Contribute to the productization of Vimeo's offerings by collecting and providing customer feedback to Product and Engineering
Grow technically and professionally in a collaborative and inclusive environment with opportunities to learn and share with others", 'Skills & knowledge you should possess:', '5+ years as a Sales Engineer, Solution Engineer, Solution Architect with SaaS experience
Enterprise industry knowledge and expertise, including technical and security challenges, integrations into SSO and sophisticated network environments
Understanding of live and on-demand video workflows and or Unified Communications
Ability to communicate and collaborate patiently and optimally with both technical and non-technical teams
You can work independently, adapt quickly and maintain a positive demeanor
Possess a strong user focus, and a passion for Vimeo and our creative community
The ideal candidate will be in the EST/CST time zones', 'Targeted Base Salary Range: $116,000 to $169,000', 'The base salary range listed above is for candidates located in the U.S., including the New York City metro area.', "At Vimeo, we strive to hire and nurture amazing talent across the globe. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience, specialized skills, internal alignment and a candidate's home base."]

column1: Senior Director of Product Marketing - (Los Angeles/New York Based)
column6: ['Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Flexible spending account', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['DISQO is changing the way that the world’s largest brands, agencies and media companies get to know their customers. DISQO is the customer experience (CX) intelligence platform for understanding every customer experience. Businesses trust DISQO to power better decisions for every customer, touchpoint, and outcome. DISQO’s insights, agile testing and advertising measurement products are powered by millions of consumers on the industry’s largest opt-in consumer data platform.

Who We’re Looking For:

DISQO is looking for a Sr. Director of Product Marketing who combines devastating marketing chops with high-initiative startup spirit. You thrive on fluidity and rapid change – valuing collaboration over ownership and bringing best practices to a young and vibrant growth company.

Along with initiative and enthusiasm, bring your track record of driving highly successful Product Marketing strategies in multi-product companies. Our ideal candidate is a strategic thinker, rigorous analyst, skilled storyteller, and expert influencer with a demonstrated ability to drive consensus across Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success teams. This new role is an opportunity to help shape the future of the company by working cross-functionally to strategize, develop and drive programs, content, and integrated campaigns that show the value of our products to our customers and prospects.

You’ll create messaging that resonates with our buyers, lead Marketing for product launches that catch attention and drive adoption, and support sales and customer success effectiveness with great enablement trainings and documentation. You will lead, develop and build a highly-skilled team of Product Marketers to synthesize industry insights and market feedback, help shape product roadmaps, and collaborate with multiple cross-functional stakeholders to set shared priorities for driving growth. You will deeply understand our industry, target customers, and segments and equip the whole team with powerful positioning, messaging, and personas.

We are looking for an individual with an entrepreneurial mindset who thrives in working in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional environment. Inspired by challenges and always seeking ways to up-level our opportunities to deliver incredible customer experiences, you are a master at traditional product marketing techniques and iterative in your approach to think outside-the-box. You will be a champion of this mindset across the broader organization.', '', '', 'What you will do:
Lead a team of Product Marketers, overseeing their development and growth in B2B SaaS marketing skills, while increasing the business impact of their efforts.
Be the in-house expert on our market and customers. Frame strategy questions, conduct competitive and market research, develop ideal customer profiles, and conduct win/loss analysis.
Lead Marketing’s portion of go-to-market efforts for new product feature launches and marketing programs; including developing positioning, messaging, value propositions, and integrated marketing plans.
Deliver a predictable calendar of product content such as articles, reports, case studies etc. that can then be used by Demand Generation and Brand & Comms to drive leads and market awareness.
Clarify, extract, and communicate product features to commercial teams through interviews with Product Management, Client Success, Sales, Data Science, and Engineering.
Create and deliver training and enablement content including playbooks, one-pagers, decks, and battle cards to support Sales and Customer Success teams.
Enhance the value of our existing products through the development and execution of product-led strategies that increase usage by current customers.
Collaborate and inspire cross-functional teams (including Marketing, Sales, Product, and Customer Success) to support launch campaigns and activations.
Coordinate with all marketing partners across Research+Insights, Demand Gen, Brand+Comms, Events, Marketing Operations, etc. to ensure smooth execution of Product Marketing strategy.', 'What you bring to the role:
10+ years of B2B product marketing experience in a high-growth environment.
Proven track record of managing, building, and coaching impactful teams.
Experience developing deep relationships with Product Manaagment leaders across multi-product companies.
Experience in successfully developing and driving integrated marketing plans, differentiated messaging, and product growth for both Enterprise (Sales or Content led) and Product-led-growth sales motions.
Demonstrated examples of content development that drives results for us in demand generation, market awareness, and SEO.
Broad analytical skills to source relevant information that informs and validates product positioning and messaging.
Proven storytelling skills with the ability to enable others to deliver memorable product narratives to be used in sales enablement and content development.
Able to draw insights from data that will influence strategy.
Clear history of enabling sales teams to succeed and exceed their goals.
Extensive experience coaching in the areas of positioning and messaging, leading product launches, and creating Sales and Marketing collateral.
Strong leadership skills and team-oriented disposition with the ability to influence key stakeholders, foster collaboration, and drive results across cross-functional teams.
Outstanding planning, communications, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced and often ambiguous work environment.
Provide and be receptive to constructive feedback.
Experience in the customer experience, advertising, or market research industries is a plus.', '#LI-RT1
#LI-Remote

Perks & Benefits:

100% covered Medical/Dental/Vision for employee, 80% for dependents
Equity
Generous PTO policy
Flexible workplace policy
Team Offsites
Life Insurance
FSA
Paid Maternity/Paternity leave
Disability Insurance
Travel Assistance Program
24/7 Counseling Services offered to Employees
Access to personal and professional growth tools - Calm App & LinkedIn Learning

Note: The benefits noted above are for full time US based employees only.

DISQO is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery, innovation, and growth are possible when we open ourselves to new possibilities, perspectives, and approaches. That’s why, at DISQO, we welcome, support, and empower individuals from diverse backgrounds. Exceptional teams are rooted in extraordinary people, each with a unique story and a compelling set of skills. DISQO does not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Recruiting firms that submit resumes to DISQO without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.']

column7:
["As the Sr. Vice President of Solution Management, you will be responsible for product strategy, execution, and life cycle from conception to launch for our WellSky Home suite of products, and for the integral role they play in the strategic plans and vision of WellSky. You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders on the short, mid, and long-term plans for the products, including clients, leadership, marketing, sales, client services, professional services, and various other groups within a matrix environment. Working closely with the GM, you’ll unify the products and the product teams across Home, moving towards a common WellSky message and experience in the market. As the Sr. Vice President, you'll manage growing teams including product analysts, managers, and executives, and ensure products address market and industry needs, align with corporate strategy, meet revenue, and achieve client-satisfaction goals. You'll play a pivotal role in helping to define the strategic direction and vision of the product line. Apply today to be considered for this exciting opportunity!", '', 'Key Activities:', 'Drive strategic and tactical direction of product development and represent the vision and plans to other leaders in WellSky; ensure consistent execution of product-lifecycle processes from concept to launch.
Provide context for the whole Home Solutions and Engineering teams to drive alignment and improve delivery productivity.
Oversee Directors and their product owners in developing client requirements, translating requirements into product plans/designs.
Adopt a “one platform” approach to the creation and adoption of new technology, leveraging inner sourcing and other enterprise capabilities to reduce redundancy in our technology stacks and eliminating tech debt.
Work closely with leadership and department leads; conduct industry analyses, gather competitive intel, identify areas for differentiation; partner with marketing, client-services teams to evaluate customer experience; work in concert with product managers, engineering, executive management to coordinate/drive product roadmaps, beta programs and product planning.
Set project priorities; work with team leads to advance projects from development through implementation, including work plans, reporting deadlines and quality standards.
Manage day to day responsibilities of product-executive teams including hiring, ongoing growth, performance evaluation, development, etc.
Help define go-to-market strategy; support Sales and Marketing to maximize penetration into targeted markets.
Work and collaborate with Professional Services, Client Support, Marketing, Sales to ensure high renewal rates of products.
Coordinate with executive leadership, Finance, Accounting to manage product P&L’s, define product pricing.', '', 'Job Requirements:', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
10+ years product-management experience in healthcare, high-growth B2B, and/or enterprise SaaS
7+ years managing large teams/span
7+ years of post-acute care experience (home health and hospice preferred)
Proven success scaling, leading product-management teams
Demonstrated success defining, launching successful products', 'Preferred Requirements:', 'Advanced degree or clinical degree with workflow experience; MBA
Thorough knowledge/expertise of industry products/services. Strong understanding of industry, key market segments
Ability to interact with diverse client groups – U.S. and globally
Knowledge of quality system regulations', '']

column7:
['Roots Automation is searching for a Senior Account Executive to join our growing Sales team.', 'Reports To: Head of Sales
FLSA Status: Exempt
Location: Remote – United States
‍
Job Summary

About The Team
Roots Automation brings together machine intelligence and human ingenuity in the form of advanced, intelligent Digital Coworkers. Think of a Digital Coworker as your ideal team member – digitized. Our Digital Coworkers are built with AI and can think, read and intuit like humans. They are pre-trained to understand and interact with data, documents, systems, and processes commonly found in Insurance. Their knowledge base is perpetually expanding with learning federated across our customers. Digital Coworkers are always on, ultra-secure, and deliver ROI from day one.

Roots Automation’s Digital Coworkers free Insurance Professionals from inefficient, repetitive, soul-destroying work, thus enabling them to be more creative, collaborative, and innovative.

The Role
Roots Automation is searching for a Senior Account Executive to join our growing Sales team. The person will partner with leaders across our team and with leaders at Fortune 1000 organizations to bring our AI-First, Industry-aware Digital Coworkers to market. As a Senior Account Executive, you will be responsible for full life-cycle sales. You nurture existing accounts and sales-qualified leads while prospecting and networking for new sales opportunities.

The ideal candidate has strong strategic and analytical thinking, experience working in or selling to Insurance companies, and has a solid track record selling SaaS or to Enterprise customers.
‍
The role reports to the Head of Sales.
‍
Responsibilities
The Senior Account Executive position is a quota-carrying position; you will own the full sales cycle from building relationships with key stakeholders to negotiating and contracting
Develop authoritative knowledge of the Roots Automation, and effectively demonstrate the value of Digital Coworkers
Sell Roots Automation offering with a consultative approach in a high energy environment and skillfully deliver virtual/in person presentations while handling objections and relating to buyers
Lead a complex sales cycle while engaging customers in business, strategy, and ROI-based discussions to communicate how Roots can help deliver value/ROI
Pipeline development through a combination of outbound prospecting, Marketing Qualified leads, and high-value leads
Meets or exceeds assigned quarterly and annual revenue sales quota.
Manage key customer relationships and find upsell/cross sell opportunities
Ensure 100% data entry/integrity across sales systems (i.e. HubSpot)
Become the go-to expert for prospects and customers alike for Digital Coworker as a Service solution
Work in tandem with Process Engineers to identify automation opportunities
Partner with marketing to develop materials for prospective customers
Attend Tradeshows/Events
‍
Position Requirements & Competencies
10+ years of enterprise technology sales experience, SaaS selling a plus
Proven track record of selling into C-Suite executives
Capability to manage the entire sales process including lead generation, qualification, discovery, solution development / presentation, negotiation and close
Demonstration of ability to sell technical solutions emotionally (high EQ)
Accurately reporting on forecast / pipeline
Experience with opportunity and account planning
Ability to balance a competitive drive for exceeding goals with the collaborative culture of Roots Automation
Demonstration of consultative selling capabilities
Experience with CRM and related sales platforms (preferably HubSpot)
Ability to navigate complex enterprise organizations and persuade key decisionmakers

Preferred Qualifications‍
Collaborative, high-energy teammate with a passion for solution selling
Coachable – always willing to learn and adapt
Experience/knowledge in Insurance vertical
Hungry – ready to make an impact, excel, learn, and succeed
Determined – will do whatever it takes to attain quota
Automation software experience (RPA/OCR/IDP/ML)
Experience working in a startup environment
Background in remote, independent work
‍
Benefits
Work in a fast-growing, VC-backed startup with a clear upward trajectory
Base Salary + Competitive Quarterly Commission (with accelerators and new account kickers)
Full benefits (dental, health, vision, etc.)
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Fully remote work
Upward mobility for high performers
Potential equity opportunity']

column1: Senior Sales Process Enablement Manager (Remote, EMEA)
column7:
['Grafana Labs is looking for a Senior Sales Process Enablement Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-To-Market (GTM) organization. In this role, you will design, develop, implement and maintain Enablement programs around Grafana’s sales process, supporting both new hire onboarding and in-seat sellers. You will also work closely with Grafana’s Sales Leadership team and other Customer facing GTM teams, to develop standardized tooling to be leveraged globally across the sales process and ensure that all teams are aligned and enabled on their responsibilities within the sales process.', 'Ideally, you have a passion for customers, sales methodology and ensuring the best possible customer experience through a sales process that optimizes for the customer journey. You should have mastery of critical selling skills and experience in training sellers on these skills. You should be comfortable in balancing strategic planning with execution, as you will regularly be in the weeds, developing and delivering blended learning solutions that are role-based, highly interactive, and innovative.', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Design and develop a stage by stage Sales Process Enablement Program for both New Hire onboarding and In-Seat ongoing enablement. This may include instructor-led training, webinars, eLearning assignments, conferences, etc.
Design, build, deliver and maintain Sales Process and Methodology enablement content, courses and presentations for both individual contributors and leaders
Engage, persuade, and build alliances with key stakeholders involved in executing the Sales Process in order to define needs, build standardized tooling and implement certification programs.
Partner closely with our Solutions Engineering and CX organization to develop enablement for all GTM customer facing teams to ensure alignment in the execution of our Sales Process.
Track and measure Sales Process enablement program and content usage, and regularly report results to key business stakeholders
Define, track, measure and report of business impact of Sales Process enablement', 'Requirements:', '2+ years of full cycle software/SaaS sales experience and regular track record of exceeding quota
5+ years of experience in Sales Enablement, preferably at a high-growth SaaS company with a technical offering
Certifications in MEDDPICC and Force Management
Program management experience delivering enablement programs with a proven impact to the business
Have solid project management skills including: planning work, managing details, keeping multiple tasks/projects on track, working with cross functional stakeholders, and navigating ambiguity to deliver results
Excellent facilitation and presentation skills across a range of learner tenures from individual contributor to senior leader
Proven creative thinker that independently generates and executes on innovative ideas for how to engage learners
We’re a high growth company, so your job duties will be varied and complex and will require strong judgment, collaboration, and leadership.', '', '', '', "About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).
Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.
A note about covid-19: All Grafanistas who wish to attend in-person events or travel for Grafana Labs must be fully-vaccinated.
Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.
We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.
For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy ."]

['United States /
United States – Commercial /
Full-time
/ Remote', '', 'WE ARE 3PILLAR GLOBAL
At 3Pillar, culture is more than a buzzword. The power of culture, teamwork, and open collaboration drive our commitment to building breakthrough software solutions that power digital businesses. Our passion for products has gained us recognition in some of software’s most innovative spaces, including a spot on the Inc. 5000 list ten times, an Institute of Excellence in Sales (IES) Premier Sales Employer winner, a three-time winner of the Washington Post Top Workplaces Award, and notable features in Forbes, Fortune, and the Washington Business Journal.

We are an innovative product development partner whose solutions drive rapid revenue, market share, and customer growth for industry leaders in Software and SaaS, Media and Publishing, Information Services, and Retail. Our key differentiator is our Product Mindset. Our development teams focus on building for outcomes and all of our team members around the globe are trained on the Product Mindset’s core values – Minimize Time to Value, Solve for Need, and Excel at Change. Our teams apply this mindset to build digital products that are customer-facing and revenue-generating. Our business-minded approach to agile development ensures that we align to client goals from the earliest conceptual stages through market launch and beyond.

WHAT WE BELIEVE
At 3Pillar, our core values – Intrinsic Dignity, Outsized Impact, Open Collaboration, and Continuous Improvement – drive our commitment to providing best in class product development services to high growth businesses across the globe. We’ve spent more than fifteen years building innovative software solutions. Our executive team has always held our values to the highest standard which has led to active participation on the Forbes Tech Council, a winner of the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a spot on the Washington Business Journal’s Women Who Mean Business list.

WE WANT YOU
We are looking for a sales professional with a hunter mentality. You love to build rapport with new prospects, understand what drives their needs, and ensure 3Pillar Global proposed solutions result in a win-win. You are able to drive business conversations that focus on outcomes and help clients build business cases that realize those outcomes. You connect, network, build relationships, and are an ambassador of our brand. Your focus will be identifying and closing new economic buyers within new client opportunities and your assigned target accounts and developing our messaging and point of view on how we become a trusted partner in creating digital software products for those clients.
Sales Executive Duties
Portfolio Alignment: You will focus on assigned Enterprise accounts in an industry based portfolio, and 90%+ of your time on driving conversations with net new prospects and new economic buyers in existing accounts. You will be responsible to deliver a minimum of $6M+ of new business annually. You are local to the prospect/client and meet in person with the prospect/client frequently. You will be asked to work closely with Engagement Directors on existing accounts to drive conversations with new economic buyers. You will report to the SVP of Sales and be measured on activity, opportunity pipeline, and sales bookings. Sales bookings will drive your variable compensation plan.
Drive Prospecting Activity: Allocate time daily to build relationships with new greenfield prospects and existing clients. Generate your own leads through cold calling, blitzing, research, networking, and any other means necessary, driving your territory as aligned to portfolio. Use prospecting tools effectively, including phone, email, sales automation tools, LinkedIn, etc. Leverage prospecting techniques to increase the number of conversations. Achieve meetings with prospects - working hard to create and establish connections, and regularly “get to yes” when asking to meet with new prospects. You are fearless in asking your network and clients for references and introductions.
Engage as a Trusted Advisor and Thought Leader: You build strong executive relationships with clients and are responsible for providing insight about how 3Pillar Global can help them drive and improve their business outcomes. Aligned to your matrixed portfolio, provide industry thought leadership and perspective to clients that establish you as the go-to partner to discuss how they achieve their business goals. Collaborate with partners in our Industry Portfolios and Product Development to represent the best of 3Pillar Global to prospects and clients, advocating internally and externally.
Build and Grow Pipeline: Quickly identify and prioritize quality potential new clients by developing meetings into identified pipeline. Clearly articulate the needs of the prospect/client, build trust with them and position our team to propose how we can work to solve that need. Consistently build and refresh the pipeline by qualifying deals through each stage of the sales cycle. Field inbound leads with the ability to quickly identify and reach decision makers. Navigate internal political structures in a way that results in introductions and opportunities to connect with key decision makers.
Qualify Deals: Accurately pinpoint prospect/client needs, exercising exceptional judgment in asking the right questions, creating and presenting sound business hypotheses, exhibiting genuine curiosity, and ultimately building a solid understanding of what your client wants and what they don’t. You integrate Engagement Leaders into the pursuit and give them context for the prospect/client as you work together to position a solution. You manage the qualification of the deal through the sales stages and validate that prospects/clients have the will, the means, the sponsorship, and a compelling reason to act.
Manage Pursuits: An exceptional team player - you rally and lead the pursuit team through the sales process, convey the prospects/clients’ wants and needs accurately, remain laser focused on what will solve your prospects/clients pain point, and ensure that the pursuit process balances quality and expediency. You position the proposal, usher proposals through the process, and ensure proposals speak the clients language, provide the value they seek, and adhere to 3Pilar’s messaging and brand standards. You will collaborate with Engagement Leaders who are ultimately responsible for structuring and solutioning the engagement.
Close Deals: You are a tenacious seller and you don’t let go until you get to yes. You drive for results and you love to win, but you know winning takes discipline. You manage the prospect/client and our internal process simultaneously and drive communication on how we finalize our solution, contract, negotiate, and get the work started. You broker relationships with the prospect/client so that Engagement Leaders are set up for success in delivering business outcomes.
Ensure Data Hygiene: You are responsible for your book of business including data hygiene, inclusive of (but not limited to), prospecting volume, pipeline activity, qualification, forecast accuracy, campaign/event, activity/logging and prospect/client account level data, etc.
Seasoned Professional: You organize and balance activities appropriately (prospecting, selling, pursuit management) and exercise exceptional judgment in making tradeoffs that drive tangible results. You provide the voice of the prospect/client and industry to our internal teams and help us align our messaging and offerings to what prospects/clients want to buy. You accurately forecast your business and keep systems updated with relevant information about your prospects/clients
Key Competencies and Skills
Proven hunting mentality that leads to results through an activity driven approach.
Experience using digital tools for prospecting and engagement.
Build and execute multi-level account plans - Know what must be done and why, have and follow clear action plans, determine possible obstacles and overcome them, reevaluate regularly to ensure goals are met.
Prospecting Expertise: Finding needs in the marketplace keeps the pipeline full of potential customers for new business. It’s essential to research industries, uncover the main friction points, and define the ideal customer profile. Ability to comprehend various businesses and the related challenges of the sectors, a talent for asking the right questions, even the tough ones, and get prospects to “quantify the pain.”
Hold a Confident Posture: Has a strong self-image that is not rocked by hearing “no”. Able to fail and use it to drive future success. Asks tough questions and won’t accept unclear statements. Drives to clarity. Creates good up-front mutual agreements.
Build Rapport: Displays sincerity, trust, believability, and warmth. Helps prospects/clients to open up, and becomes a thought partner. Builds inside “sources” (coaches, champions) in accounts.
Discover why Prospects Buy: Understand prospect’s business and related pain points. Has internalized “issue finding” “discovery and motivation” questions. Is not afraid to ask tough questions and to help prospects get to the root of their “pain” that is driving the need for our services.
Qualify Proposals: Makes sure that they understand all key players and decision criteria, and continuously influence decision making. Deeply understands where 3Pillar Global stands, and where we could win or lose the deal. Understands the decision making process, timeline and competition, and helps coach pursuit teams to success.
Demonstrate industry experience and product knowledge.
Exhibit exceptional lateral, upward, and downward influence - creating strong teams and partnership to deliver great results together.
Exhibit positive energy and a get-it-done attitude.
Communicate clearly and motivate others as a leader with passion for the business

#LI-Remote
Qualifications
Eight (8) years of selling experience with a proven track record of attracting, engaging, and securing new economic buyers
Four (4) years of selling experience in services or software or IT management experience, including one (1) year in a client services / technology consulting (mobile applications, mobile web, big data, web, other)
Must be knowledgeable in the latest product development, technology and advanced analytics trends in the [portfolio specific] industry and be able to speak intelligently on those topics
Strong business management acumen understanding market and industry technology trends
Proven ability to identify business opportunities and position technology project investments
Project management, planning, and organizational skills
Experience working with a globally distributed product teams and a matrixed organization
Willing to travel up to 50% of the time
3Pillar Benefits, What We Offer:
Employer funded medical plan for employees and their dependents.
Employer funded dental plan for employees and their dependents.
401K retirement savings plan with 100% match of the first 3% of employee contributions and 50% of the next 2%.
Company paid disability and life insurance and the option to purchase additional coverage for yourself and family.
Unlimited PTO Policy
12 Company paid Holidays
Generous Parental Leave
Global Health and Wellness Program (Coming in 2022)
3Pillar is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.']

["At H1, we believe access to the best healthcare information is a basic human right. Our mission is to provide a platform that can optimally inform every doctor interaction globally. This promotes health equity and builds needed trust in healthcare systems. To accomplish this our teams harness the power of data and AI-technology to unlock groundbreaking medical insights and convert those insights into action that result in optimal patient outcomes and accelerates an equitable and inclusive drug development lifecycle. Visit h1.co to learn more about us.

As a Senior Enterprise Account Executive, you will help drive our business with strategic customers. You will be working with stakeholders across the organization to understand our business, the markets we’re in and the needs of our users. You will engage with customer stakeholders, showcase the value of our platform and partnership, and help H1 expand our position as the market leader.

WHAT YOU'LL DO AT H1
Manage and stimulate revenue through complex, multiple go-to-market strategies
Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs
Actively seek out new opportunities through cold calling, networking and social media
Set up meetings with potential clients to understand their needs and use case
Engage with C-suite executives and align with their strategic roadmap
Prepare and deliver professional presentations on products and services
Negotiate and close deals as well as address concerns or objections
Develop and implement customer account plan and relational strategy
Lead H1's extended sales team in strategically selling and expanding customer use cases, and, manage overall customer baseline growth including upsell, renewals and retention
Partner with Customer Success on overall account health, strategic planning and progress
Support marketing team to identify and execute plans for market awareness, client case studies, and vertical market growth within assigned accounts

ABOUT YOU
You are a seasoned sales professional, with experience selling enterprise B2B SaaS technology. You have proven success prospecting and closing new logo opportunities. You know how to gather requirements, understand customer use cases, set proper expectations, demo the H1 platform, and manage an enterprise sales cycle.


REQUIREMENTS
10+ years proven success selling B2B SaaS technology to enterprise companies
You have experience managing & closing complex sales-cycles, including prior success in closing $1M deals and managing multiple large accounts
You have a strong portfolio of C-Level contacts within Enterprise accounts
You are a strong communicator and collaborator
You have experience managing customers through a renewal cycle
If you have experience selling to Life Sciences that’s a plus

Not meeting all the requirements but still feel like you’d be a great fit? Tell us how you can contribute to our team in a cover letter!

COMPENSATION
This role pays a base salary of $140,000 to $150,000 per year based on experience. This role also offers uncapped variable commission, based on performance, in addition to stock options.", "H1 OFFERS
Competitive compensation package including stock options
Full suite of health insurance options, in addition to generous paid time off
Pre-planned company-wide wellness holidays
Retirement options
Health & charitable donation stipends
Impactful Business Resource Groups
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from anywhere
The opportunity to work with leading biotech and life sciences companies in an innovative industry with a mission to improve healthcare around the globe

H1 is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with equal opportunity for all applicants and teammates. Our goal is to recruit the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex (including pregnancy), age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
H1 is committed to working with and providing access and reasonable accommodation to applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please reach out to your recruiter once you've begun the interview process. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.

#LI-H1"]

["WorkRamp is the All-in-One Platform that powers learning as a growth engine for today’s top organizations. Our mission is to reshape the corporate learning category by helping our customers tie learning to concrete and measurable business impact. Top companies like Box, Outreach, and Reddit trust WorkRamp to drive business outcomes and organizational scale for their customers, partners, and employees.

Why WorkRamp?

Recently raised a $40M Series C led by Salesforce Ventures, Slack Fund, and Susa Ventures
Named Among Best Workplaces in Software by Inc. Magazine for 2022
Ranked #873 on this year’s Inc. Magazine 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America
Made Fortune’s Best Workplaces for Women™ list 2022
Mogul’s Top 100 Companies with Inclusive Benefits in 2022
Great Place to Work® Certified August 2022
- August 2022- Named a 2022 Y Combinator Top Company
#1 Top-Rated LMS by The Motley Fool
JMP Securities Hot 100 Startups: The best privately held software companies 2022
#1 on Inc's 2021 Best Workplaces List for Startups
Top 100 fastest-growing SaaS companies of 2020 by SaaS Mag

This is an exciting time to join WorkRamp as we build the team for the next stage of growth.

What’s the opportunity?

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be a key member of WorkRamp’s Product and Design team. This is an exciting opportunity for creative problem solvers who are passionate about user experience and building the best products in our class. You will lead a product in WorkRamp's platform as we grow our product offering to better support employee and external customer education. If you love talking to customers, building products to scale, and working on a fast-moving team, we'd love to meet you!

What will I be doing?

Own, develop, and drive the roadmap and business requirements for your dedicated product area
Deeply understand our users by participating in research. You will be meeting directly with our customers to understand their needs
Develop solutions and efficiently execute in partnership with design, engineering, and other teams to deliver impact for our customers and business
Collaborate across the organization at all stages of the product lifecycle: communicating your vision and strategy, ensuring all the loose ends are tied up when executing, guiding the go-to-market in partnership with marketing and sales, and reporting on outcomes
Track and report on feature adoption and impact, and use data to recommend feature enhancements

What skills do I need?

5+ years experience in a PM role for a digital (ideally B2B SaaS) product working with PMs, designers, and engineers
An entrepreneurial mindset. You take ownership, operate well in ambiguity, and get things done
Effective communication skills. You know when to escalate critical decisions early
A track record of successfully delivering strategic and tactical initiatives
A track record of advocating and innovating on behalf of customers to make their daily jobs easier

Perks
- Fully Remote - Work from anywhere in the US
Flexible Time Off & 17 company-wide holidays including a winter break
Equity with annual refreshes
Full healthcare coverage
100% paid short-term & long-term disability insurance, plus life insurance
Stipend for remote work setup & DeskPass account
Annual stipend for professional development
401K
Mental Health and Wellness Resources including a free subscription to Calm Premium & access to 2 Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
Employee Resource Groups (Mental Health, Womxn of WorkRamp, WorkRamp Asian/Pacific Islander, WorkRamp Afro-xxx/African-American/Black, LGBTQties, Juntos Latinx, WorkRamp Pride)
Access to Well-Being Benefits including: One Medical, Gympass, Carrot, & Headspace

This role is fully remote and can be based anywhere in the US
At this time, WorkRamp does not sponsor work visas", 'Compensation
WorkRamp is committed to fair, equitable, and transparent compensation. Final compensation will be determined by a variety of factors such as your relevant work experience, education, certifications, and skills. The salary range for this role is $170,000-$200,000.

Employees at WorkRamp may be eligible for additional compensation, such as a bonus, commission, and stock grants. Employees may also be eligible for a wide range of other benefits, including medical, retirement, financial, wellness, time off, employee perks, and others. The full comp package designated for this role can be discussed with your Recruiter during the interview process.

Not sure if you should apply?
Find yourself checking some of these boxes but doubting whether you should apply? At WorkRamp, we are committed to creating the most talented, diverse workforce, supporting a growth mindset for our team members through all stages of their careers. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply. If you meet some of the requirements and you share our values, we’d love to hear from you! As part of our ongoing commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace, we’re invested in building teams with a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, and experiences.']

["At Klaviyo, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo (we call ourselves Klaviyos) brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. If you're a close but not exact match with the description, we hope you'll still consider applying. Want to learn more about life at Klaviyo? Visit careers.klaviyo.com to see how we empower creators to own their own destiny.", 'At Klaviyo, the Strategic Sales team prides themselves on being marketing and product experts. While most companies hire SAs to just give demos, fill out questionnaires, and only explain setups, that makes us yawn. As a Solution Architect for Strategic Sales, you will be responsible for facilitating long term, deep relationships with the prospects to help drive our market-leading position in the owned marketing space.', 'So what do we do? We work directly with our customers, as technical representatives, to accelerate our relationships with prospects to drive value. We dive deep, build against complex systems, and develop a long term strategy with the Strategic Sales team to ensure long term success. We use these engagements as an opportunity to learn, prototype, and ship meaningful improvements to the Klaviyo experience. We look for interesting problems and aim for solutions that are extensible and reusable.', 'A few things our team has recently built as part of engagements include: new productized integrations; modular ETL packages; test/demo environments that continuously update with real-time data; and a custom Chrome extension. In short, we are problem-solvers and builders. We believe simple things should be easy and hard things should be possible.', "If you're a creator that gets excited by driving technical success and prototyping new solutions - all within the context of influencing direct strategic sales - this could be for you. What you'll get in return is the opportunity to be part of an extremely high-performing, strategically-important team that works at the exciting intersection of engineering, sales, and customer engagement.", 'We are looking for this Solution Architect to be based on the West Coast to support our West Coast customers and sales team. Mountain time or Pacific time zones are preferred.', "How You'll Make a Difference:", "You will be playing a critical role in the training and development of our internal Strategic Sales team as we work to hit Klaviyo's revenue targets.
You will work as a liaison between SAs within our organization (Customer Success, Customer Growth, Partnerships).
Become a complete expert in the Klaviyo experience, from understanding the data pipelines and code base of our integrations to understanding technical tradeoffs between different implementations.
Be the go-to internal technical resource, educating team members as well as prospects/customers to provide a consistently positive Klaviyo experience.
Develop and maintain personal relationships during engagements across many different prospects simultaneously.
Act with urgency and precision to give users best in class support in troubleshooting issues as they arise.
Effectively balance a range of core functions in support of constantly striving to help increase the output and efficiency of Klaviyo.
Be a voice of our emerging customer needs while working closely with our Developer Experience team and Product teams.
Solve problems manually as needed and automate future solutions and/or collaborate with Product and Engineering to proactively improve the Klaviyo product over time.", 'Who You Are:', 'Proven ability to track, and learn from, the ever-changing technical landscape and incorporate modern, optimized solutions to high-value problems.
Impress prospects at any level, from executive to developer with the capability to persuade technical stakeholders.
Make and meet commitments.
3+ years in a role leading technical, project-based teams, ideally within a high growth SaaS company
Embrace failure as an opportunity to improve
3+ years production experience as a developer with web development languages (e.g. HTML, CSS, Javascript); REST APIs; web app development frameworks (e.g. React, Node, Angular, Vue, etc.); and/or with a general-purpose programming language (e.g. Python, Ruby, PHP, etc.) are great bonuses.']

['At COMPLY, we are looking for enthusiastic and motivated Sales Development Representatives (SDR) to join our US team!', 'The Role', 'As a SDR, you will be the tip of the spear, leading our outbound demand generation efforts and scheduling conversations with prospects. This role offers opportunities for rapid training and promotion in recognition of your success as a SDR. You must be comfortable reaching out to and qualifying prospective C-Suite executives in a fast-paced environment as the organization continues to experience a stellar growth trajectory.', 'What you’ll do:', 'Uncover potential opportunities by having conversations and setting meetings with prospective buyers.
Calling and emailing compliance professionals within a designated territory.
Partner with an account executive and collaborate on how to best generate sales opportunities.
Become an expert on the needs of our prospects and our software.
Work closely with senior team members and leaders to help discover new areas of opportunity.
Track and forecast all activities via Salesforce and Outreach.
Represent the COMPLY porfolio of brands with integrity in all internal and external communications.', 'Who we are looking for:', 'Enthusiasm for working on a fast-paced team in a high growth company setting.
Desire to learn, be coached, and succeed in outbound tech sales.
Willingness to make targeted outbound calls as a major part of the prospecting process.
Ability to write succinct and thoughtful emails, while researching to include personalization.
High level of organization and self-motivation.
Customer-facing role in retail or hospitality is a plus, previous experience in SaaS sales preferred.
BA/BS degree or equivalent.', 'The compensation range for this role is specific to the United States and takes into account a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, training, licensure and certification, and experience. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role would be $40,00-$45,000 plus applicable commission / benefits offerings, etc as those similarly situated within the Company.']

column7:
['Harness is a high-growth startup that is disrupting the software delivery market. Our mission is to enable the 30 million software developers in the world to deliver code to their users reliably, efficiently, securely and quickly, increasing customers’ pace of innovation while improving the developer experience. We offer solutions for every step of the software delivery lifecycle to build, test, secure, deploy and manage reliability, feature flags and cloud costs. The Harness Software Delivery Platform includes modules for CI, CD, Cloud Cost Management, Feature Flags, Service Reliability Management, Security Testing Orchestration, Chaos Engineering, and continues to expand at an incredibly fast pace.

Harness is led by technologist and entrepreneur Jyoti Bansal, who successfully founded AppDynamics. We recently raised $230M in our Series D at a $3.7B valuation. We’re backed with $425M in venture financing from top-tier VC and strategic firms, including Norwest Venture Partners, IVP, J.P. Morgan, Capital One Ventures, Citi Ventures, ServiceNow, Splunk Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Unusual Ventures, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Alkeon Capital, and many more.

POSITION SUMMARY

We’re looking for a Senior People Business Partner to join our Global People Operations team! The ideal candidate thrives in the startup environment, is very hands on, naturally curious and highly collaborative. This is a great opportunity to join a great team culture and support our Go-To-Market teams. This position reports to the Director, Strategic People Business Partners.', 'KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Able to deliver full-cycle programs/projects (start to finish) and results in a timely manner.
Execute on company-wide Talent Management Programs with client groups, including Annual Performance Reviews, Talent Reviews, and Career Development
Coach managers to enhance their leadership skills and proactively address performance issues and career progression
Perform investigations in a timely manner with minimal exposure to the business and escalating to senior People Operations leadership or Legal when needed
Assist managers with addressing employee relations issues through weighing risks and alternatives, exploring legal and company compliance concerns, and offering balanced recommendations
Identify and work with Learning & Development to drive training plans and programs for both individual contributors and people leaders
Partner with the People Experience team to ensure participation in employee programs and to monitor and report on employee engagement
Partnering with the CRO, Sales leadership and the Talent Acquisition team on organizational structure and department expansion; particularly international expansion plans
Lead client group to maintain a high bar for performance by reviewing trends in management of underperformance. Based on insights, keeps senior leadership apprised of performance management trends and hot spots.
Work with Total Rewards and Talent Acquisition to ensure key trends and retention levers are addressed and used effectively.
Be a team player who acts with a sense of urgency and adapts to a fast-paced and ever-changing environment and create an environment of open communication for employees to provide feedback and express concerns.', 'ABOUT YOU
You possess 8+ years experience as strategic People Business Partner; preferably for Sales/GTM and/or Customer-Facing organizations
Experience working for a SAAS company a plus
Experience supporting a global and remote workforce
Expert-level experience in a variety of HR competency areas such as organizational design and development, leadership development, coaching, change management, performance management, and employee relations
Track record of developing effective people strategies that align with and support company/team objectives
Be able to solve complex problems; resourceful and take initiative to seek internal and external resources when problem-solving
Excited to work in a fluid startup environment
Excellent interpersonal skills with a desire to work in a collaborative environment', 'WHAT YOU WILL HAVE AT HARNESS
Competitive salary
Comprehensive healthcare benefits
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Paid Time Off and Parental Leave
Monthly, quarterly, and annual social and team building events
TGIF- Day Off program
Remote office stipend
Monthly internet reimbursement
Monthly Food & Beverage Reimbursement Program
#LI-REMOTE']
