column7:
['Why Lytx:', '', "Are you a savvy, strategic sales professional with a proven history of outperforming your sales goals? As a Senior Account Executive for our Mid-Market sales team, you're the point person on sales pursuits, independently preparing and orchestrating sales strategy by aligning cross-functional support to influence and win deals. If you love the hunt as much as you love to close, then this role is for you! If you're excited for a new challenge and want to be part of an outstanding team, join Lytx!", '', 'You’ll Get To:', 'Ensure the achievement of sales goals to include evaluating current business, leverage data analysis, identifying new sales opportunities, develop strategy to achieve targets and develop and implement action plans
Maintain a professional presence, and possess the ability to articulate ideas that will make valuable contributions to clients
Sell solutions from Lytx by developing relationships with clients, focusing on solving their business issues, and recommending solutions
Ability to transition from selling current Lytx safety solutions and services to AiO expertise in delivering innovative new products that are influential in corporate strategy
Partner with Demand Generation and Marketing leadership on campaigns, providing recommendation to leadership to incorporate into future efforts
May serve as mentor to team members impacting top line through others
Other duties as assigned', '', 'What You’ll Need:', 'Minimum 6 years of successful consultative selling, SaaS based environment
An undergraduate degree in a related field is preferred
Successful experience selling into the Mid-Market space (sales cycle 3-6 months)
Possess results driven, metric oriented sales mentality, partnering cross-functionally, establishing relationships and using key partners to consistently meet quotas/goals
Articulate sophisticated technical and business context in formal presentations
Strategically and thoughtfully identify and tackle complex problems through the application and integration of analytical skills, using creativity and judgment to convert interested prospects into clients
Strong work ethic; ability to adapt and switch gears between a range of duties (sourcing new prospective clients, building pipeline, maintaining product knowledge, managing current client critical issues as needed, addressing clients, maintain client data in SalesForce, etc.)
Up to 25% travel may be required', '']

['Your work days are brighter here.', '', "At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.", '', 'About the Team', '', '', 'About the Role', '', 'We are looking for a fast learner to join us as we manage the heavily used business user facing modules in the platform. Our ideal candidate has outstanding product management skills along with extensive experience delivering large features or new products in a SaaS ecosystem.']

column1: Senior Director, Global Partner Success and Programs
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) 4% Match', '401(k) matching', 'AD&D insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Employee assistance program']
column7: ['This is a US Remote Opportunity', 'Cradlepoint was born in Boise and built for wireless. We are a team of authentic, hard-working, and innovative people driven by a shared vision to Connect Beyond the limits of wired networks. We help customers — big and small, across industries and around the world — utilize LTE and 5G cellular technology to connect people, places, and things, anywhere. We’re at the forefront of the Wireless WAN and 5G — the next big waves in networking — and we remain as hungry and humble as the day we started. If you’re hungry to be part of something big, come join us.', 'How Will You Contribute to the Company?', 'The Senior Director of Global Partner Programs is responsible for developing and managing transformational strategic programs that will help our partners to accelerate and grow. Reporting to the VP of Global Distribution and Partner Programs, you will have experience working globally across multiple routes and geographies, with building world class partner programs and incentive portfolios. Developing a three-year roadmap, you will have the collaborative and relationship skills to build relationships across routes including Ericsson and relevant teams. This is a critical and exciting role within Cradlepoint and requires leadership, self-motivation, drive, and innovation.', '', 'This role is instrumental in driving both sales acceleration and execution via a two-tier eco-system in our market and requires ten plus years of experience in a relevant partner program and success leadership role with demonstrated organization and communication skills.', '', 'Cradlepoint is “all partner, all the time” and we are looking for a senior, experienced leader who understands channels, partnering, and the value of a two-tier route to market. Join us to innovate, build and be impactful.', '', 'What Will You Do?']

['Here at Ellucian, we are motivated by a mission ~ the power of education to transform lives and change the world. We are the global market leader in EdTech for Higher Education, serving more than 2,900 customers and reaching over 26 million students in 50+ countries. We are dedicated to helping Higher Ed thrive by transforming their institutions to agile, digitally connected campuses that enable student success.', '', '', 'We are looking for an ambitious Sales Enablement Expert who would like to re-imagine their future to be a change agent within the world’s leading provider of Higher Ed technologies. This is a pivotal role supporting our SaaS Transformation through Sales Enablement and a great opportunity to join our established, high-performing Sales Enablement Team with a vibrant culture and exciting plans for the year(s) ahead.', '', 'In this role, you will manage relationships with key stakeholders, including sales operations, regional Sales VPs, solutions consulting and proposal team leaders, product marketing, product management, and services with a focus on developing and implementing seller enablement. This individual will be responsible for overseeing the development and delivery of our global sales enablement programs, curriculum, and procedures; ensuring that all sales personnel have the required knowledge, content, skills, processes, and behaviors to optimize every interaction with buyers. Programs will include, but are not limited to, New Hire On-Boarding for Field AEs, Inside Sales, and Services Sales; Sales Process; SaaS Readiness and Product training; Sales Leadership Coaching; and Value creation methodologies and skills.
Where you will make an impact
Oversee the ongoing creation and maintenance of standard processes for Sales, Sales Enablement, including Sales & Sales Support Playbooks with a focus on continuous improvement
Manage the rollout, adoption, and delivery of training for existing/ new sales tech best practices
Review the existing sales content strategy and partner in identifying the best way to organize and manage marketing collateral and sales content on a go forward basis. Identify content gaps and work with sales enablement specialists and Marketing to prioritize and develop the materials.
Provide leadership in transforming the existing sales on-boarding/bootcamp plans (including the sales process) and take it to the next level, decreasing ramp times, while ensuring our new reps and global sales organization are aligned, consistent, and confident in our Go To Market processes, positioning, and proof points.
Take ownership and proactively drive cross-functional training initiatives that impact sales productivity by building out cross-sell enablement courses, consolidate and manage all cross-sell content, develop certification process for new sellers, run regular training booster sessions to enable role-specific guidance for the sales teams
Audit sales calls and meetings to analyze reps’ acumen and identify areas for improvement
Identify the enablement offerings that require certification, testing, or other assessment methodologies to support objectives for our new and existing sales professionals
Recommend new operational processes and enablement programs to fill competency & skill gaps
Implement a Sales Enablement Team governance for building and working to strict project plans and deadlines while ensuring high standards of excellence across all programs.
Accelerate innovation through a culture of piloting and experimentation, scaling successful initiatives while also “failing fast” and taking learnings from unsuccessful initiatives
Establish a regular calendar & cadence of sales enablement offerings for knowledge and best practice sharing and ongoing updates (including Spotlight30 oversight)
Partner with Product Marketing to ensure all sellers know how and when to leverage value-based sales content and assets in every deal cycle
Partner with sales leadership to set the priorities for our sales enablement initiatives as well as optimize and deliver the content, agenda, and logistics for sales kick-off event(s), quarterly enablement programs, sales bootcamps, and additional L&D initiatives
Partner with sales operations to lead the effort to ensure all programs are data-driven; designing and implementing metrics to ensure consistent evaluation and measurement of enablement activities.
Provide leadership as you direct and lead the sales enablement team and sales org through transformation. Acting as a positive change agent as you help to ensure transformational success across the team and the sales organization
Your success will be measured by your ability to effectively decrease time to ramp, improvement in conversion rates & time within each stage in the sale funnel and effective training delivery. (as measured by survey feedback, knowledge retention metrics, and certification achievement)', '', 'What you will bring', '10+ years of combined Sales, Sales Enablement, and/or Sales Learning & Development
5+ years of experience in Sales Enablement for enterprise software companies
Excellent people leader, able to hire, inspire, hold accountable, and develop an elite team
Understanding of Value Based Sales Methodologies and Knowledge of best practice for GTM strategy.
Consistent and provable history of content creation / curriculum development/ training/ delivery with specific examples
First-rate presentation skills both (online and in-person)
Proactive, Initiative-taker, someone ready to roll up their sleeves and get things done.
Excellent communicator who knows how to navigate complexities in a large and varied organization.
Excellent executive presence, ability to drive adoption and credibility with senior leadership
Knowledge of key Sales Enablement technologies and tools. (e.g. Salesforce, Seismic, ZoomInfo, Klue, Slack, SharePoint, Confluence, Conversational Intelligence, etc.)
Experience in executing change management initiatives with measurable experience having a positive impact on transformational business outcomes and metrics
Skilled in capturing and understanding value-based performance metrics & KPI’s
Driven by operational improvements with a heavy focus on innovation and transformation
Proven experience in driving End to End Projects to completion and complex Project Management
Must be a quick learner, self-starter and have the ability to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
Adaptable with the ability to pivot as needed and remain flexible with the ever-changing software industry
Able to assess and make decisions effectively and quickly
Highly organized with exceptional eye for detail
Resilient and positive
Open and Inquisitive mind
Quota carrying and selling experience is preferred
Ability to travel as necessary', 'Comprehensive health coverage: medical, dental, and vision
Flexible time off
Thrive Flex Program that allows you to contribute towards your health, financial or learning']

['Our goal is to provide an easy to use email marketing tool to help small businesses engage with their audience.', 'We are searching for a driven, hard-working, and adaptable team player to join our sales team. This role will be instrumental in developing and powering our revenue acquisition through partnership and association outreach efforts, outbound pipeline building, and engaging with marketing driven leads. We are excited to have a candidate with creative ideas to achieve results, is able to gather data on loss and win reasons and share with marketing to drive change, while also being persistent and relentless around how to better serve small businesses to convert them to loyal customers.', 'This role will:', 'In depth knowledge of the benefits of email marketing.
Ability to create relationships within email marketing space and cultivate partnerships.
Execute on the outbound B2B sales process from initially qualifying a prospective buyer to closing the sale.
Collaborate with the marketing to determine the best approaches to capture new customers.
Respond to customer inquiries supporting their use of our products and services.
Understand target markets, including industry, company, and contacts around which market strategies can attract new clients.
Receive and work leads from marketing.
Meet and exceed quarterly quota.
Other duties as assigned.', 'Qualifications:', 'Proven 3+ years work experience in SaaS
Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls)
Well-spoken, highly inspired/motivated and goal orientated
An understanding of common sales cycles
Experience in prospecting and discovery
Pleasant communication and negotiation skills
Experience with Salesforce and outbound lead generation tools
Team player with strong organizational and time management skills']

["WalkMe pioneered the Digital Adoption Platform (DAP) to empower business leaders to realize the promise of technology in today's overwhelming digital world. Through WalkMe's guidance, engagement, insights, and automation, employees are more efficient, executives have better visibility into digital usage, and organizations maximize the full value of their digital assets to empower digital transformation.

About the Role

WalkMe is looking for an experienced and motivated Account Executive to manage sale cycles to ensure WalkMe's continued growth. As a Named Account Executive at WalkMe, you'll report to the Director of Sales and seek new logos and cultivate highly strategic accounts. You'll use Salesforce, Clari, LinkedIn and other applications to run your sales process from introduction to close. You will partner with our Sales Engineering, Account Management, and BDR teams, among others. WalkMe Account Executives lead a consultative sales cycle, based on Value-Selling, across multiple partners and departments within each client.

Strategic Account Executive....will cultivate existing accounts across WalkMe's Named Account segment", "What You'll Own
Manage sales activity and forecasting of revenue in SalesForce.com
Manage the entire sales process from introduction to close over the phone
Work with all levels of the target organizations, including senior executives at Enterprise accounts
Maintain weekly sales forecast and achieve quarterly quota based on annual targets
Identify and close new sales opportunities within targeted accounts as well existing customers
Present WalkMe solutions using a value-selling approach and methodology
Owns top accounts, including Microsoft
ALMOST UNLIMITED TAM / SCOPE OF OPPORTUNITY AT EACH AND EVERY ACCOUNT", 'What You Need to Succeed
10+ years experience in Enterprise SaaS sales (Experience with Microsoft preferred)
Experience closing 6-7 figure deals within Fortune 100/500
Experience engaging at the Executive level across an Enterprise
Experience navigating complex technical discussions with IT at various levels
Ability to implement our value-selling methodology
Experience working with cross functional teams', "What you will love about us!
Comprehensive Health Care Coverage - Medical, Dental, and Vision for Employees and Families, 401(k) with matching program, Parental Leave, and a vacation policy to encourage a healthy work-life balance.
WalkMe is a hybrid workplace - offices are open for those who chose to come (vaccines required) with in-person and virtual social activities to promote positive employee engagement
WalkMe is recognized as a Star Performer in DAP for the 2nd year in a row
WalkMe helps international companies such as: IBM, LinkedIn, Walgreens, Microsoft, Adobe, Hershey's, Quest Diagnostics and more", "At WalkMe, we approach Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) with the same level of collaboration, innovation and accountability that we bring to the rest of our business. We believe in the value of diversity and are committed to ensuring an equitable and inclusive workplace where every employee has an equal opportunity to achieve success.

We've made this commitment not only because it's the right thing to do, but also because we know that having diverse perspectives, experiences and identities on our team helps us to better meet the diverse needs of our global clients. While we're not yet where we want to be, our goal is to create a workplace as fair and inclusive as our business is category defining. And at WalkMe, we achieve our goals.

How We'll Take Care Of You

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base pay for this role is between $125,000 and $200,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, benefits, and RSUs as part of our competitive total rewards package.

TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: WalkMe does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to WalkMe employees or any other company location. WalkMe is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company for this specific role."]

['Postman is the world's leading collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API & streamline collaboration to help create better APIs—faster. More than 23 million developers & 500,000 organizations worldwide use Postman today. After receiving Series D funding in 2021 & releasing our biggest & best version ever of Postman in September 2022, we continue to strive humbly towards our mission of 100 million connected developers & serving companies as they seek to innovate in an API-first world.
We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture & our vision at Postman.
About the Team
With so many organizations using Postman, we are looking for exceptional Solutions Engineers to join our team & to help us to efficiently support & grow our enterprise business. You will partner with our Sales team to promote an API-first development culture, nurture customer relationships, & guide Postman users on how to most effectively leverage our platform to build their APIs. Ideally, we are looking for someone who lives & breathes APIs, is comfortable with JavaScript, has experience in enterprise sales, & is an expert Postman user already!
In addition to working with a product that customers already know & love, you will be well-supported in this role by our Sales, Customer Success, Developer Relations, & Engineering teams.
What You’ll Do
Help drive enterprise sales by nurturing prospects & supporting Strategic & Enterprise customers
Conduct discovery, qualification, technical demos, & proof of value workshops with prospective customers looking to shift to an API-first development culture
Handle Postman technical questions or objections & provide solutions or workarounds to address customer needs
Understand deeply our customers workflows today & how they can adopt API-first development best practices
Share customer feedback with appropriate teams & provide general customer advocacy
Remain up-to-date with the competitive landscape, current trends, & challenges in the API market
Create proof of concept integrations, tooling, & workflows as needed to support prospective customers
Maintain & develop customer sandbox environments & best practices of working with the product
Act as a technical intermediary between sales & other teams to best fit our customers needs
About You
6+ years of enterprise sales/solutions engineering experience
2+ years of software development experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or relevant work experience
Remote work friendly, with ability to travel up to 40%
Loves teamwork & collaboration in a fast-paced environment
Customer facing experience & comfortable engaging all levels of technologists including individual developers, QA, product, & engineering leaders
Experience engaging senior management & executive audiences to convey Postman's value proposition
Capable of forging deep, long-lasting relationships with Strategic customers
Strong understanding of APIs, & experience with producing & consuming with APIs across different domains
Strong understanding of modern development methodologies & DevOps with an appreciation of the software development life cycle
Comfortable with the enterprise SaaS sales process & common security concerns of cloud services
Experience executing enterprise sales strategies & sales methodologies like MEDDIC, Challenger Sale, Command of the Message, etc.
Excellent listener that seeks to understand what a customer is trying to achieve rather than pre-supposing solutions
Familiar with typical developer tooling: IDEs, Git, CI/CD, monitoring services, microservices, containers, cloud computing services, etc.
Fast learner, excited & willing to learn new technology on an ongoing basis
Great communication skills (presentation, verbal & written)
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
Lots of smiles
Our Values
At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency & honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.
What Else?
This role is based in the San Francisco Bay Area & the reasonably estimated base salary for this role ranges from $170,000 to $230,000, plus variable compensation & a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, & experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, & a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of the Bay Area & the U.S.
Equal Opportunity
At Postman, diversity means we implement informed policies & practices to grow a company that reflects global experiences & identities while treating each person with fairness & dignity. Inclusion is the choice we make each day & with every interaction, to foster a workplace & world where people of all backgrounds not only belong but excel. We understand that together, we succeed better.
Postman is unapologetically committed to Equal Opportunity Employment. We proudly offer equal employment opportunities to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, & more. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodations through the hiring process, please let us know early by emailing us: accommodations@postman.com. We want to give you every opportunity to show us the star that you are. Join us, why dontcha?
PS: Here's a timeline of Postman’s journey in becoming an API Platform.

#LI-REMOTE']

column1: Sales Executive Senior Specialist - Nasdaq Fund Secondaries
column7:
['', 'Coordinate LP, GP and partner outreach, working with sales team and subject matter experts to drive awareness of service offerings
Originate LP-led block sales, and support deal execution including coordination of GP engagement
Provide support for existing buyer relationships, while working to expand active universe of buyers to increase participation for liquidity events
Cultivate client insights to help improve the product offering, directing client conversations and gathering feedback to define new feature requirements
Coordinate with the product team and organizational entities to identify and monitor issues, risks, impacts and dependencies
Effectively collaborate with internal stakeholders including technology, legal, sales, implementation, etc.
Show aptitude for learning new software products and mastering the functionality of SaaS-based system(s)
Remain up to date on recent product enhancements to ensure coherent messaging to clients
Demonstrate effective time management skills in order to handle tight deadlines and multiple clients’ demands', '', 'Required Education: Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience
Required Licensing: FINRA Series 7 licensed; willingness to obtain others as necessary
Required Experience: minimum of 3-5 years of similar business experience, including client service in the financial industry, with a strong preference for prior experience with private markets and alternative assets classes
Preferred Experience: Background in private equity (fund management, fund administration, legal services, etc.), with experience in secondaries transactions a plus (e.g., institutional GP-led or LP-led transactions such as tender offers, fund restructurings and portfolio divestitures; Wealth Management liquidity, etc.)', '', 'Come as You Are', '', 'Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.', '', 'We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.']

column7:
['Who is Tenable?', 'Tenable® is the Exposure Management company. 40,000 organizations around the globe rely on Tenable to understand and reduce cyber risk. Our global employees support 60 percent of the Fortune 500, 40 percent of the Global 2000, and large government agencies. Come be part of our journey!', 'What makes Tenable such a great place to work?', 'Ask a member of our team and they’ll answer, “Our people!” We work together to build and innovate best-in-class cybersecurity solutions for our customers; all while creating a culture of belonging, respect, and excellence where we can be our best selves. When you’re part of our #OneTenable team, you can expect to partner with some of the most talented and passionate people in the industry, and have the support and resources you need to do work that truly matters. We deliver results that exceed expectations and we win together!', 'Your Role:', 'Tenable is looking for a Senior Backend Software Engineer having a strong experience in building reliable and performant APIs for complex SaaS platforms. This is a remote role that can be based anywhere on the East Coast of the United States. Tenable’s core mission is to empower all organizations to understand and reduce their Cybersecurity risk. With the emergence of cloud-oriented applications, Tenable enables companies to measure their exposure and react to the modern threats. By applying to this position, you will be joining the team in charge of protecting cloud identities. Your main role will be to own the design and the implementation of the framework aiming at collecting cloud assets to review their current security state. As part of this position, you will have to deal with scalability and real-time processing challenges. Part of the Engineering department, your work will eventually lead to a totally new product designed to face the evolution of threat actors. You will report directly to the Feature lead and will play a pivotal role in the future of Tenable’s products by building the foundation of a new cloud-oriented security.', 'This is a remote position. JOB REQUIREMENT: Must be based in East Coast (EST), United States', 'Your Opportunity:', 'As a Tenable Senior Software Engineer, you will oversee the technical design and the implementation of a new APIs a for large-scale SaaS application
Design high availability and APIs to streamline the processing of a large set of data
Integrate an early-stage taskforce working with lightweight develop workflows and requiring a high-level of autonomy
Constantly interface with the teams involved in the project to ensure a high-quality product release', "What You'll Need:"]

['', '', 'Opportunity Summary:', '', "Build positive working relationships with customer stakeholders including their sales leadership, education and enablement teams
Demonstrate expertise in sales strategy and guided selling, sales and account planning methodologies, opportunity management, process design and automation, global technology deployments.
Share best practices on adoption, enablement and change management, value messaging, executive alignment, sales/revenue KPIs (leading and lagging)
Assist with the customers’ set up and configuration of Altify to ensure it is optimized for each customer-facing team
Ensure internal and external stakeholders are informed of their roles, responsibilities and deliverables (e.g, Single Sign-on, technical services, training, etc.)
Support the internal sales team by providing implementation overviews to new prospects
Lead Altify workshops and engagement meetings tailored to each customer to maximize each team's success with Altify (e.g., discovery and planning/strategy workshops)
Collaborate and effectively communicate with internal teams (Altify Solutions Consulting, Customer Success, Sales, Product and Engineering, others) using Altify and Salesforce internally
Scope engagements and create Statements of Work (SOWs)
Resource planning across multiple engagements
Lead engagements with customers from kickoff to go-live
Develop detailed engagement project plans
Manage deliverables and lead team to execute and hit targets
Provide product feedback received during engagements to Altify product and engineering team
Identify future training needs and partnering with SME to create a curriculum to facilitate that training
Tailor training materials and approach as needed by customers", 'Required Skills:', 'Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent experience
5 or more years of enterprise sales/revenue team training facilitation
5 or more years of experience with Salesforce as a user and/or administrator
10 or more years of customer-facing experience at a B2B tech company
Excellent presentation skills
Proficient in the concepts & theories that drive effective adult learning.
Strong public speaking skills- able to convey complex concepts verbally, and engage an audience, both live and via distance learning.
Deep understanding of a SaaS customer engagement
Significant experience with complex sales process and deal pursuit principles
Deep understanding of complex account and portfolio management principles
A track record of success building relationships with large complex enterprise customers
Strong organizational/time management skills and the ability to manage multiple customers and projects simultaneously
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Senior Strategy Consultants must communicate effortlessly with all roles at each customer, including VPs and c-level executives
Strong interpersonal skills. Senior Strategy Consultants must form positive relationships with multiple stakeholders at each customer and internally at Upland
Strategic thinking. Senior Strategy Consultants must strive to understand each customer’s unique sales/revenue and customer organization in order to lead amazing engagements for customers
Senior Strategy Consultants must shoulder the responsibility of making each customer successful and welcome that level of ownership
A demonstrated history of successfully selling, delivering, and growing revenue
Experience working with regional and global accounts of all sizes
The drive for self-development, the ability to collaborate, and an action-oriented work ethic', '', 'Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. To learn more, visit', 'www.uplandsoftware.com']

['At Human API, we exist to radically accelerate the pace of health innovation for everyone. That is our vision. We unlock siloed health data from everywhere and put it directly into the hands of the consumer, right when they need it: enabling a meaningful transaction that creates value in their lives. Some call us the "PayPal" of health data, but our dreams are bigger.

To name a few examples, we help rapidly screen participants for clinical trials, enable life-changing software through accurate wearable data, and we accelerate the buying process for important insurance products. Tomorrow we will inspire the innovation of impactful digital health products to maximize human longevity and potential. We are looking for talent who are equally inspired by these big ideas and have the grit and determination to make them come to life.

The SVP of Sales will oversee Human API’s new business organization. This person is fundamentally responsible for driving revenue growth. Reporting to the CEO, our Sales leader will sit on the executive leadership team, taking full accountability for company-wide new business success.', "What you'll do
Own and drive top-line revenue growth through hands-on new logo acquisition
Build and promote a performance-driven revenue culture focused on delivering delivering outcomes
Hire, onboard, and oversee a small sales team of exceptional account executives.
Evolve our deal strategies to maximize revenue and minimize sales cycle time
Build and continuously run a rigorous deal process to support visibility, alignment, predictability, repeatability, and scale
Develop and communicate pipeline health and deal health through quantitative, metrics-based approaches
Participate in strategic planning to develop thorough, bottoms-up revenue projections for annual budgets and multi-year projections", 'About you
Experience leading a B2B SaaS sales organization selling to large enterprises, preferably into a regulated industry (healthcare, insurance, banking)
Experience selling value to enterprises, and developing and owning business cases to support and demonstrate that value; delivering on 7-figure deals with C-level executives
10+ years of sales experience with a proven track record of driving growth and exceeding quotas
5+ Senior sales management experience
Proven success driving significant (50% YoY) topline growth in early-stage organizations
Strong leadership and management skills with experience building out a sales framework
Ability to operate in an environment of uncertainty with conviction and urgency
Entrepreneurial attitude; you get the strategies and tactics needed to develop and grow new business opportunities', 'The national compensation range for this position is 200-275 annual salary. OTE will be largely based on targets set and outcomes, splitting around 50/50

We’re built by strong venture backing from Andreessen Horowitz, Blue Run Ventures, SCOR Global, Allianz, Guardian Life Insurance Company, and Samsung Ventures and currently serve some of the largest financial and health companies in the world from Prudential, Allstate, John Hancock, Omada Health, Thrive Global, AAA, and many more.

We have thousands of API integrations into enterprise health record systems, wearable devices, as well as health and wellness applications, that all benefit the end consumer and our enterprise customers. We’re looking for independent thinkers who care deeply about the problems we’re trying to solve. At Human API, we welcome people of all backgrounds.

#LI-remote, Trabajo remoto']

column7:
['Who You Are:

You are a highly motivated Sales Professional looking to have an immediate impact on the systems, processes and technology of markets that are often called the engine of the US economy. You have 1+ years of sales or business development experience under your belt and are excited to join an experienced team of leaders that value excellence, independent thinking, teamwork and curiosity to create value for our customers.

You are eager to play an essential role in generating new business opportunities for Polly and be on the forefront of our customer facing team. You have experience being the first point of contact of sales efforts, and have a track record of proven success in creating interest, generating demand and developing relationships with contacts and prospective customers.

Does this sound like you? If so, apply today & let’s start the conversation!', 'What You’ll Do:
Make outbound calls and emails to C-Levels, VPs and other decision makers to communicate the Polly value propositions
Develop relationships with high value prospects to understand their business needs
Qualify leads based on specific criteria and convert them into qualified opportunities
Work closely with the sales team to design and execute strategic customer engagement initiatives
Generate new business opportunities and own the entire top of funnel pipeline
Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly business development objectives
Diligently update Salesforce, our CRM, to stay current on leads and follow ups
Understand the product inside and out to become a trusted advisor to our customers and prospective customers', 'What You Have:
1+ years of sales or business development experience. Bonus for phone-based selling roles as part of a SaaS or B2B company.
Recent graduate that is driven, eager to learn and thrives in fast-paced, mission-oriented environments in lieu of professional experience.
Highly motivated, resilient and a tenacious passion for winning
Experience or interest in managing the top of funnel sales pipeline
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable communicating and interacting with C-Level executives and decision makers via phone and email
An eagerness, willingness and ability to learn about mortgage capital markets and Polly’s software offerings
An entrepreneurial attitude with a strong desire to be an early and integral piece of a fast growing start-up', 'Why Join Polly?
We are attacking a trillion-dollar market with gross inefficiencies and seeking to transform the way an entire industry operates
You will have an impact on the design, architecture and implementation of markets that are often called the engine of US economy
We value drive for excellence, independent thinking, teamwork and curiosity
You will work with both government backed and industry leading companies to create a digital pipeline that facilitates real time trading of loans
We have an experienced leadership team that previously built large and impactful platforms
Outstanding opportunity for professional growth and upward mobility
Direct engagement with the decision makers and senior business leaders
Competitive salaries
100% paid medical/vision/dental/disability/life insurance
Unlimited PTO
Remote environment', 'About Polly:

Polly was founded in 2019 by a seasoned team of technology and mortgage experts. We are transforming the mortgage industry by automating and streamlining the mortgage transaction lifecycle through data science and machine learning. Lenders and other mortgage stakeholders trust us to optimize performance by automating manual workflows, improving loan profitability, and yielding actionable insights through our next generation BI analytics layer. Polly is backed by prominent Silicon Valley venture firms including 8VC, Meritech, Menlo Ventures, Khosla, Base10, NYCA, Fifth Wall, and Conversion Capital.

Polly is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy status, disability status, veteran status or any other legally protected status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.']

['About the company
Agritask, is a well-financed startup whose agronomic Intelligence & Analytics platform helps the world’s largest Food & Beverage Enterprises create a more sustainable and predictable world. Agritask is an agronomic intelligence & analytics platform that has the mission to provide Global Food & Beverage Enterprises, with greater control over supply by:
Guiding, monitoring, and enforcing sustainable and agronomic practices at scale
Forecasting yields and detecting supply risks early, leveraging historical & in-season data
We are unique in our ability to aggregate & structure agronomic data from multiple sources. Data analytics on the platform provides actionable insights and alerts at portfolio and plot levels, enhancing agronomic reach with an adaptable, engaging workflow.
The Impact of climate change on global food systems, and specifically on the Food & Beverage industry, is becoming ever more apparent. Yield reduction and volatility patterns in food crops compromise and break supply chains. This, combined with growing concern for farm communities and the environment by both manufacturers and consumers, is pushing the industry to adopt solutions that will help the transformation toward predictable and sustainable supply chains and production practices.
The company is in a high growth phase of its development and the immediate requirement is to maintain and accelerate this growth. The company is therefore looking to identify and hire an exceptional Senior Sales executive, a hunter with a proven track record of regular overachievement.

About the role
We are looking for a Head of Sales for EMEA territory, preferably with experience in Food & Beverage companies or enterprise software, to join our global business. An ideal candidate will possess the agility and credibility to engage confidently at all levels across client and partner organizations, an understanding of client business problems, and an ability to map technology solutions to those problems. Dedicated hunter with a reputation for exceeding expectations.

You will
Increase sales from:
New Business- Create a strong opportunity pipeline by researching, pursuing, developing, and negotiating new, long-term direct business - "Target to Cash"
Account Management -Manage an existing account's portfolio and generate new revenue opportunities through relationship enhancement, customer satisfaction, and account expansion
Partner management- Day-to-day management of partner relationships, including pipeline, commercial, legal, financial, and marketing considerations.
Report to the CBO
Work closely and harmoniously with internal functions such as product, business operations, presales, customer success, and marketing to deliver upon partner and customer expectations

Requirements
A proven track record of over-achieving quota in technology sales roles with at least 10 years of experience
Background in Enterprise/SaaS/PaaS sales with a preference for background in Data, Analytics, BI, ERP, or similar solutions Knowledge of, or ideally experience in the Food & Beverage Sector
Understanding technology and converting that value into business benefits and selling strategies for all levels of a client's organization.
University degree
Creative, strategic thinker, startup speed, and agility are a must

Nice to have
MBA Degree']

column1: Senior Manager/Principal Product Manager, Business Model Strategy

column7:
['About DoorLoop
Certified as a Great Place to Work®, DoorLoop is the easiest property management software used by landlords and property managers in over 100 countries worldwide.
As a SaaS company with $30M in funding, 3 offices worldwide (Miami, London, Israel), and hundreds of thousands of units being managed, we are one of the fastest growing prop-tech companies with over 400% growth this year!
We know what it takes to build a world-class company – and it all starts with a world-class team. If you want to work with a fast growing tech startup that values transparency, feedback, and growth, DoorLoop is for you.', 'The Role
Senior Account Executives (AE) are one of the most important roles in our business. A lot of time, attention, and training will be given to ensure your success.
Hate prospecting & cold-calling? So do we! You will receive high quality inbound leads that schedule demos on your calendar daily.
Wasting time following up? We automate the entire email process with Outreach.io and send the highest converting emails that are always AB tested.
Want fast commission? With our proven scripts and demos, you will have super high demo conversion rates for a 1 day sales cycle.
Want to handle more leads on autopilot? We automate most processes with SalesForce, Outreach, Aircall, Intercom, Slack, and more.
Looking to lead an outbound team? This will be a potential career path for this role!', "About You
People that do best in this role have these personality traits and work habits:
Experience in SaaS sales, hitting and crushing sales targets and goals, and breaking sales records
Sociable, personable, friendly, patient, and always willing to help and go above and beyond to ensure customer happiness
Organized and focused
Honest and ethical, treats others with respect
Team player, open to helping your peers, teaching them, and learning and listening from them
Hates being micromanaged and loves freedom and autonomy
Puts the company's best interests first
Willing to adapt and change as the company grows and the role changes", 'Qualifications
More than 5 years experience working in SaaS sales.
Must be able to legally work in the US and in our office full-time in South Beach
1601 Washington Ave, Suite.200, Miami Beach, FL 33139
You can relocate from another City, State, or Country if needed.
Fluent in English reading, writing, and speaking
Experience doing outbound sales
Types at least 45 words per minute
Tech-savvy and good with computers.', 'Bonus Points
Any experience in the real estate or property management industry is a MAJOR plus
Multiple languages is a plus, but not necessary', "Benefits
Unlimited paid time off with unlimited personal, vacation, and sick days.
401k with 4% matching. No time delays with instant vesting. Enroll and keep all money on day 1.
100% paid health insurance including medical, dental, and vision on Cigna's PPO Open Access Plus plan, and 25% covered for dependents.
Company expense card and monthly stipend for any business expenses (training courses, certifications, equipment, whatever you want!).
World class training program where you're paired with an onboarding buddy to ensure your success.
Monthly investment classes from our co-founders on how to invest your money in a diversified portfolio of real estate, stocks, IRA, 529 Plans, and more.
Work on Lincoln Road (for those working in our Miami office), the most vibrant street worldwide with great restaurants, activities, and walking distance from the beach.
No micromanagement - We believe responsible people thrive on freedom.
Great equipment - Ergonomic chairs, stand-up desks, Mac or PC laptops, dual monitors, and more.
No rules - No dress code, policies, or handbooks. Just do great work & have fun!
Get paid bi weekly with Gusto payroll - Split paychecks between different bank accounts, save money automatically towards a travel or emergency fund. Get a high-interest savings account, free payroll advances, and more.", "Israel Benefits
Unlimited paid time off with unlimited personal, vacation, and sick days.
Annual bonus based on your performance over the last 12 months.
Free daily lunch and a micro kitchen with unlimited healthy snacks in our office prepared by Cibus.
Annual company retreat in the US with our Miami team (all expenses paid).
Work from our Miami or Israel office as much as you want, or work a few days from home on a hybrid schedule.
Complimentary training in our Miami office for up to one month.
Career development with unlimited access to Udemy's courses and other growth opportunities.
‍World class training program where you're paired with an onboarding buddy to ensure your success.
Monthly investment classes from our co-founders on how to invest your money in a diversified portfolio of real estate, stocks, crypto, NFT, & more.
Work in Tel Aviv, the most vibrant city worldwide with great restaurants, activities, and walking distance from the beach.
No micromanagement - We believe responsible people thrive on freedom.
Great equipment - Ergonomic chairs, Mac or PC laptops, dual monitors, and more.
No rules - No dress code, policies, or handbooks. Just do great work & have fun!", "Additional Information
The pay is a combination of a guaranteed base salary plus commission. We expect you to make anywhere from $135,000-$185,000 OTE annually.
If you are able and willing to put in the hard work to become the very best, there is unlimited potential for how much you can earn (no commission caps).
Please only apply if you're very serious. As an equal opportunity employer with a non-biased interview process, you will be asked to complete an application, followed by a 25 minute assessment to make sure you're an A Player who also takes this process seriously.
You will work directly with our co-founder and VP of Sales, Adam Mait, and can learn more about us from https://www.doorloop.com/careers

If you're looking to grow EXTREMELY fast in your career, come jump on the rocket ship with us!"]

['Here at Ellucian, we are motivated by a mission ~ the power of education to transform lives and change the world. We are the global market leader in EdTech for Higher Education, serving more than 2,900 customers and reaching over 26 million students in 50+ countries. We are dedicated to helping Higher Ed thrive by transforming their institutions to agile, digitally connected campuses that enable student success.', '', '', 'About the Opportunity', 'As a member of the Revenue Management Team at Ellucian, the Sr Manager Sales is responsible for delivering assigned sales quotas, creating alignment of the new logo acquisition team with the organization’s growth strategies, and developing a results-driven sales team that is passionately committed to achievement.', 'Where you will make an impact', 'Leading a sales team to increase revenue growth through acquisition of new accounts that subscribe to multiple products
Reinforcing overall accountability to top-line growth for the organization, while shaping the focus to continue to drive toward longer-term goal attainment.
Creating and managing processes to optimize coordination within the sales team, and across other Ellucian functions.
Building accountability and urgency across teams by setting appropriate performance metrics that drive desired behaviors and results.
Balancing short-term goal achievement and success with long-term growth strategies to expand the Ellucian presence within the territory.
Assisting team members in navigating a complex, enterprise solution sale with a 6 month to 18 month purchasing cycle.
Supporting the team in bringing opportunities to successful closure by engaging in validation planning and contract negotiations, when appropriate.
Building relationships within the region’s financial aid and enrollment community by attending on-site meetings, industry trade shows, and ed-tech conferences.
Keeping abreast of competition, market dynamics, and industry dynamics.
Report to the VP, Specialty Sales', 'What you will bring', 'Have B2B enterprise sales experience, preferably in a SaaS business.
Be analytical and have expertise in SaaS metrics.
3-5 years experience in EdTech/Higher Education.
Possess significant career history with 5+ years in leading sales teams to success and goal attainment.
Have a demonstrated track record of building exceptional teams.
Be known as a leader who drives trust and values authenticity, while driving urgency and results.', '']

column1: Senior Sales Executive for North America

column7:
['Vibes, the technology leader powering the direct-to-consumer mobile engagement revolution, is helping brands like Ralph Lauren, Joann, Redbox, Chipotle, and LEGO to grow, activate, and optimize consumer relationships with timely, relevant, high volume mobile messaging at global scale. The company’s intelligent mobile messaging platform enables marketers, consumer loyalty professionals, and operations teams to connect with consumers using a unified native platform of SMS, MMS, dynamic wallet, mobile push notifications, app inbox and performance analytics. These tools become the backbone for brands’ overall digital engagement strategies. Vibes has been consistently recognized as a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms. To learn more about Vibes, visit www.vibes.com.', 'Mobile Marketing is at the forefront of a great Marketer’s toolkit, but so many don’t realize its potential or power. Working at Vibes places you at the intersection of essential technology for all Marketers and cutting-edge innovation. The mobile engagement space is dynamic. We have the chance to support the world’s best Marketers and guide their mobile strategies – we help chart the future of marketing and steward the industry towards customer-centric, delightful interactions. The industry is evolving rapidly, so you will need to bring your curiosity and passion for adapting!', 'Vibes is looking for a passionate, organized, and compelling Customer Strategy Manager to help guide our customers towards best-in-class mobile engagement execution, resulting in a deeper partnership with Vibes. The goal of the Customer Strategy Manager is to delight customers by leading and prescribing a value realization path with large enterprise marketing and loyalty teams through the power of our mobile engagement platform. The Customer Strategy Manager will report directly to our Senior Director, Customer Strategy.', 'The ideal candidate has a proven track record in B2B SaaS, working with enterprise brands, leading renewal conversations, and exceeding sales targets using data-driven decisions.', 'Vibes cares about character and creating an inclusive culture as much as competency. We strive to build a workplace where people are excited to come to work every day and feel empowered and motivated to do their best work.', '', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Own and cultivate relationships with your customers by finding new and creative ways to drive value and revenue for their businesses and become a trusted partner
Contribute thought leadership to best-in-class B2B SaaS practices within our growing Customer Success team
Build strategic relationships within your book of business to leading renewal conversations while managing potential risks to achieve and exceed the quarterly renewal target and minimize churn
Identify and support upsell and cross-sell opportunities through strong relationships and deep understanding of each customer’s business objectives
Secure strategic-level relationships with senior customer contacts within your book of business
Act as the voice of your customers internally at Vibes, providing feedback and insights on how Vibes can better serve our customers
Work to deepen and expand relationships with customers, while identifying new booking opportunities in partnership with sales
Act as an internal liaison between Sales, Marketing and Product on how to best position our solutions
Identify and share opportunities to create use case studies from customer insights for Sales, Marketing and the Product teams for product optimization
Assist customers in achieving their goals through a deep understanding of their business objectives; use our Value Realization Playbook to ensure customers’ mobile engagement initiatives produce meaningful ROI; provide strategic recommendations on best-in-class mobile marketing, our platform’s best practices, use cases, and organizational workflow
Maintain a customer first attitude focused on driving sustainable long-term account value and retention through renewals
Proactively identify value-adding opportunities that lead to adoption of new use cases for Vibes', 'Requirements']

['#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.', '', 'About the Role:', 'As a leader of the Customer Onboarding Team, you’ll lead a team of talented Onboarding Specialists who work with new CrowdStrike customers globally to ensure onboarding success. Successful onboarding is a key milestone in the customer lifecycle. You’ll be responsible for ensuring your team is able to guide customers through their deployment, acting as a key technical resource, escalation point for support issues, and a trusted advisor to ensure the customer is set up for success', '', 'What You’ll Do:', 'Build, develop, and support a customer-focused team of Onboarding Specialists who support CrowdStrike customers throughout their onboarding journey
Drive improved results for KPIs, including license consumption, configuration health, module adoption and operational health of customers
Collaborate with Customer Success Architects to develop success plans for core and emerging subscription modules
Partner with the Customer Value Management office to identify key success criteria for CrowdStrike customers and build corresponding success plan templates
Drive execution and standardization using success plans in Gainsight
Achieve high CSAT/NPS scores for onboarding engagements
Coordinate with the Operations team to define data, reporting and automation needs to achieve objectives
Partner with internal teams including Sales, Support and Product to deliver a world class customer experience
Collaborate with internal teams and customers to identify optimization opportunities for the customer onboarding workflows to deliver a delightful experience at every step of the onboarding journey', '', 'What You’ll Need:', 'Bachelors degree (technical degree preferred)
3-5 years experience with SaaS in Technical Account Management, Implementation or Service Delivery
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, including experience meeting with and presenting to senior leadership
Excellent organizational skills
High EQ/interpersonal skills in working with diverse stakeholders, including internal account teams, service delivery teams, customer teams and customer IT leadership
Strong knowledge of Customer Success and/or Customer Support
A lead from the front attitude, ability to act as a player/coach']

['Postman is the world's leading collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API & streamline collaboration to help create better APIs—faster. More than 23 million developers & 500,000 organizations worldwide use Postman today. After receiving Series D funding in 2021 & releasing our biggest & best version ever of Postman in September 2022, we continue to strive humbly towards our mission of 100 million connected developers & serving companies as they seek to innovate in an API-first world.
P.S: We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture & our vision at Postman.
The Opportunity
With so many organizations using Postman, we are looking for exceptional Solutions Architects to join our team and help us to efficiently support and grow our enterprise business. You will partner with our Customer Success team to nurture customer relationships, guide Postman users on how to most effectively leverage our platform to build their APIs and promote an API-first development culture. Ideally, we are looking for someone who lives and breathes APIs, is extremely comfortable with JavaScript (including live coding in front of customers), has experience in managing large Fortune 100 enterprise customers, and is an expert Postman user already!
In addition to working with a product that customers already know and love, you will be well-supported in this role by our Customer Success, Enablement, Developer Relations, and Engineering teams.
What You’ll Do
Act as trusted advisors to consult, teach, and guide customers towards increased API lifecycle maturity
Help to drive value and adoption of Postman by assisting customers to understand how Postman can solve their business and API-related needs
Build and nurture strong customer relationships with assigned accounts
Always be curious and constantly conduct discovery to understand customer use cases and pain points in order to then best position the Postman API platform in response
Be strong customer advocates and act like an extension of the customer's team
Partner closely with Customer Success Managers to devise success plans for assigned accounts
Collaborate with Sales and Customer Success to identify outreach targets to drive expansion opportunities
Guide customers along their API journey via education, technical consultation, and general enablement to help them achieve their development and business goals
Establish liaisons with the Product team to stay abreast of product developments and roadmap
Listen for and qualify customer feedback and share with the Product teams internally so that Postman can continue to best support our customers
Aid in producing enablement resources that lead customers towards realizing the full value of the Postman API platform
Build solutions for customer problems/needs that improve their user experience to show the “art of the possible”
About You
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering, a related field, or relevant work experience
6+ years of enterprise solutions architecture or sales/solutions engineering experience
2+ years of software development experience
Comfortable engaging and working with all levels of technologists from individual developers, development teams, QA teams, architects, product managers, and engineering and product management leaders
Experience with engaging senior management and executive audiences to convey Postman's value proposition
Capable of forging deep, long-lasting relationships with customers
Strong understanding of APIs, and experience with producing and consuming with APIs across different domains
Strong understanding of modern development methodologies and DevOps with an appreciation of the software development life cycle
Comfortable with the enterprise SaaS sales process and customer relationship management
Excellent listener that seeks to understand what a customer is trying to achieve rather than pre-supposing solutions
Familiar with typical developer tooling: IDEs, Git, CI/CD, monitoring services, microservices, containers, cloud computing services, etc.
Fast learner, excited and willing to learn new technology on an ongoing basis
Great communication skills (presentation, verbal and written)
Enjoys a fast-paced environment and loves teamwork and collaboration
Lots of smiles!
Our Values
At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency & honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.
What Else?
This role is based in Boston or New York City and the reasonably estimated base salary for this role ranges from $157,250 to $212,750, plus variable compensation & a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, and a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of Boston and New York City and the U.S.
Equal Opportunity
At Postman, diversity means we implement informed policies & practices to grow a company that reflects global experiences & identities while treating each person with fairness & dignity. Inclusion is the choice we make each day & with every interaction, to foster a workplace & world where people of all backgrounds not only belong but excel. We understand that together, we succeed better.
Postman is unapologetically committed to Equal Opportunity Employment. We proudly offer equal employment opportunities to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, & more. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodations through the hiring process, please let us know early by emailing us: accommodations@postman.com. We want to give you every opportunity to show us the star that you are. Join us, why dontcha?
#LI-Remote']

['Job Requisition ID #', '', '', 'Senior Director, Business Operations', 'As the leader of the Business Operations team, you will manage the teams that deliver operational programs in support of global sales and customer success organizations. Reporting to the leader of Global Revenue Operations, you are a member of the leadership team and will actively participate in annual planning cycles.', '', 'In this highly visible role, you will be leading a globally dispersed team focused on helping drive sales and customer success activities spanning the customer lifecycle from first acquisition through renewal. Our goal as a global revenue operations organization is to improve performance by finding process inefficiencies and developing programs that can amplify sales and customer success activities. You will partner with the leadership of the different sales and customer success organizations to understand their goals and objectives and work with your peers on the Global Revenue Operations team to leverage their resources to help meet those objectives.', '', 'The Business Operations team is at the forefront of all requests and helps to define business requirements and translate them into functional requirements (policies, programs, and procedures) that inform our technical and enablement teams. Using your experience in working with revenue operations, you will help guide your leaders to define and develop not only the programs but also the metrics that measure their success.', '']

['#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.', '', 'About the Role:', 'We are seeking to hire a Vice President of Field Sales, who will oversee our Enterprise and Majors segment. Reporting up to them will be a team of Regional Sales Directors in the Central area that will help push initiatives and achieve company sales targets.', '', "What You'll Do:", 'Provide management oversight to your team within the Region to drive all pertinent issues related to sales strategy and goal attainment.
Participate in strategic planning sessions with the sales management team on a quarterly and annual basis.
Communicate corporate strategy to employees within your Region.
Plan and direct activities including planning and implementing forecasts, marketing program development, relationship development, customer satisfaction and collateral material development and distribution.
Establish short-term and long-term goals and quotas in line with objectives.
Identify needed resources for supporting sales strategy and develop a proposed budget for Senior Management review.
Select, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure sales goals are met.
Keep senior leadership informed of key issues and changes which may impact expected business results.', '', "What You'll Need:", '5+ years of experience in leading/managing senior sales teams with a complex product and solution sales approach.
Ability to sell in direct touch approach and via the channel.
Proven track records in working with multimillion-dollar targets.
Expert knowledge of the full sales cycle and working at C-Level.
Background in selling Security or SaaS products is a plus.
Technical aptitude and ability to learn new concepts quickly.
Experience working with Salesforce.com or other CRM is a plus.
Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Second-line management experience essential
Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.
Passionate relationship building and negotiating skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with functional peers across functions including the Channel, Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Services Customer Support, and Product Development.
Strong understanding of Cybersecurity technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems.
Experience in leading multiple teams in various locations with a track record of exceeding assigned sales quotas.
Demonstrating experience working with Sales organizations and technical teams.
Experience with developing budgets and predicting project costs.
Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude.
Ability to work remotely and able and willing to travel.']

['At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.', 'As part of our continued expansion at Bluebeam we are looking to hire an Inside Sales Representative within a central or eastern time zone. This position will be primarily remote, with occasional travel.', 'You will be assigned a list of existing customers to land and expand their Bluebeam footprint, and to acquire and close New Logos. This role partners with other departments at Bluebeam, including Technical Sales Engineers, Customer Success Managers, Sales Operations, Technical Support, Marketing, Professional Services and Legal/Security to effectively guide customers through purchasing of Bluebeam products and services. The Inside Sales Representative is primarily responsible for securing new and upsell business, as well as renewing and growing existing customer accounts.', 'Properly executed, efforts will result in revenue growth, logo acquisition and retention and customer satisfaction.', 'About the role:', 'Take ownership of expanding assigned customers and prospect new customers
Partner with Marketing to uncover and acquire new logos
Ensure 100% of annual quota is attained or exceeded
Ensure all new leads are contacted within 24 hours
Maintain a proactive consultative approach with all customers on assigned list
Be the initial Bluebeam contact point for all assigned accounts
Proficiently use Salesforce to record events in assigned accounts and individual key metrics
Maintaining Pipeline and accurately forecasting is required', 'About you:', '2+ years inside sales experience. SaaS experience preferred
Self-accountability: you will be handling a high-volume amount of accounts and are highly detail oriented
AEC Technology knowledge/experience preferred
Strong communication skills, (written and verbal)
Strong problem-solving skills and adaptable to change
Strong Experience in using Salesforce or other CRMs
Good understanding of internal business software applications eg Microsoft Office, Salesforce, PowerBI, Slack etc.', 'What we offer:', 'People-focused, entrepreneurial start-up culture with the backing of a stable, global, corporate entity - Nemetschek
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Work-life balance fostered through a culture of diversity, inclusion, and appreciation of individual lifestyle needs
You will have the opportunity for continuous professional development']
