column7:
["At Center, we’re building forward-looking technology to simplify how people work. Our transformative expense management solution is purposely built and offers three important advantages: it eliminates expense reporting for employees, radically reduces the amount of time needed to process expenses in the finance department, and offers real-time reporting and insights to drive cost-savings, analyze trends, and hit budget targets.
The Center team believes that great businesses are built by people who share common values. For us that means a passion for invention, a deep commitment to the customer, integrity, and operating with a sense of care and respect for one another. Working at Center you'll be joining a team that is intellectually curious, has a high degree of personal ownership and accountability, and values teamwork and collaboration.
Why Center?
Center is a hyper-growth SaaS company backed by the co-founder of Concur. We constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees to thrive and do great work. We are a distributed workforce and have two amazing workspaces in Bellevue, WA and Minneapolis, MN.

This position will generate greater sales by qualifying a high volume of viable leads for the sales team.", 'Responsibilities:
Prospect for new customers leveraging existing leads as well as building your own target lists based on key segments of interest. Creative use of social media and other selling tools is highly encouraged
Sell to new customers, explaining Center’s value proposition and providing initial demonstrations of our product
Qualify prospective leads using Center’s best practice methodology
Work with counterparts on the product, sales and marketing teams to help develop and deliver customer proposals and responses to RFPs and RFIs.
Orchestrate discussions around business needs with senior leaders for prospective customers
Strategize and work with top-producing Account Executives
Map prospective accounts and engage in targeted leads
Leverage CRM tools to manage a growing pipeline in an efficient and productive manner
Other duties and projects as assigned
Ability to travel as needed', 'Qualifications:
One year of directly related experience preferred with a clear track record of exceeding goals
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, particularly via phone and virtual meetings
A history of evangelical sales is highly desirable
Prior experience using Salesforce or other CRM tool(s) to manage leads, activities and your pipeline
Proficient on the Microsoft suite of software', 'Personal Attributes:
Passion for the customer
Fast learner, with an open mind, and a team-oriented mentality
Self-starter, with the ability and willingness to grow
An entrepreneurial spirit: flexible and willing to pitch in where needed
Ready to have fun, keep perspective and be part of an amazing team', 'We offer an excellent compensation package for all Center employees. This includes competitive salary, variable commissions, generous paid time off, comprehensive health benefits and 401(k) participation.
The Business Development Representative pay transparency OTE range is $70k-$90k annually and the equity value of option grants is $7k-$10k. In addition, Center offers a Self-Managed PTO plan, 9 Paid Holiday’s, Paid Parental Leave, Commuter Stipend, and health care benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term Disability, Base Life, AD&D, FSA, Commuter and 401(k).']

['The Role:
As a Cloud Sales Executive, you join Cloud7Works experiencing exponential growth. We seek an experience and capable sales professional that excels at all stages of the sales cycle. Position locate in Ashburn, Virginia
Requirements:
Cloud Sales Executive position responsibilities includes but is not limited to:
Prospect potential clients, identity opportunities, and interface with technical staff
Propose solutions to address complex client business problems with key decision makers
Pursue assigned vertical market to with cloud solutions and offerings
Manage lead generation and appointments
Maintain a pipeline of closeable opportunities
Expand existing relationships and position for future opportunities
Provide opportunity, closed business, and planning reports
Qualifications
B.S. degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 4 years sales experience in PaaS, SaaS, and/or IaaS
Sales experience in private and public sectors
Excellent verbal communication skills with senior level IT executives
Past sales training courses a plus
Highly motivate and goal driven
Proficiency with CRM
Strong phone presence
We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.']

['Hi, We’re AppFolio.', 'We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based powerhouse that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating.', 'We love where we work, and you can, too.', 'What You’ll Do', 'As the Sr. Manager - Sales Operations and Strategy, you will be responsible for architecting, measuring, and reporting on the sales performance and growth. As a thought leader within the organization, your work will include the following key areas:', 'Partner with Sales leadership and Sales Operations Sr. Director to define Strategy & Planning including org structure, go to market motion, KPIs, HC requirements, investments, and training needed for success in all segments.', 'Deliver Operational Excellence in Pipeline, Forecast, and Reporting by delivering analytics and insights to Sales, Marketing and Finance leadership that measure key business drivers.', 'Lead Data governance/stewardship for Sales and how they interact with business partners including evolving all processes, Rules of Engagement (ROEs), and systems to measure execution and forecast in each market segment.', 'Help build a compensation strategy that drives performance for a ‘growth mindset’ by delivering a full, recommended compensation to compete for top talent in partnership with the Total Rewards & Finance Sales teams.', 'Optimize and implement technologies in support of sales organization productivity by defining, implementing, and driving adoption of tech stack needed for growth; Recommend technology investments with clear ROI and implementation plans.']

['Bellevue, WA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA', 'Minimum qualifications:', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in product management, co-founder or related technical role.
3 years of experience building and shipping technical products.
Experience developing/launching products/technologies within one or more of the following: Cloud, SaaS, enterprise, internal tools, and/or supply chain networks.", 'Preferred qualifications:', '3 years of people management experience with direct reports.
Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions.
Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.
Experience in one or more of the following: cloud infrastructure, SaaS, big data, security and privacy, development and operations, or artificial intelligence/machine learning.
Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance, or Marketing.
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.', "About the job
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google Cloud helps employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business. As a Google Cloud Senior Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with cross-functional teams to define and deliver on the next phase of cloud services. Additionally, you will develop product solutions, Mergers and Acquisitions, go-to-market, and business relationships to execute on the market potential and benefits possible from applying Google’s technologies in the enterprise market.

By applying to this role, you'll be considered for all teams working on Enterprise, including Google Cloud Platform, Google Workspace, Unified Fulfillment Optimization, Google Cloud Systems, Google Cloud Security, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud AI/ML, Developer Product Group, and Internal Tools.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.", 'Responsibilities
Understand the cloud ecosystem markets, competition, and user requirements in-depth.
Launch new products and features, test their performance, and iterate quickly.
Work collaboratively with engineering, marketing, legal, UX, and other teams on cutting-edge technologies.
Develop solutions to problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions.']

['Senior Financial Analyst', 'The Finance group is looking to add a Senior Financial Analyst to help support the growth and fast-paced environment of LeadVenture. We are looking for a go-getter willing to take on any challenge thrown at them. This role will be on the front lines of a major investment of new systems and processes to build the ability for the back office to scale with the business. This role will be primarily focused on the analysis of the company’s revenue.', 'Here is more of what you’ll get to do:', 'Analyze financial data by collecting, monitoring and creating financial models for decision support
Develop monthly forecast models and assist in the development of the annual operating budget
Report and analyze SaaS revenue trends and metrics including ACV, ARR/MRR, CAC, renewal rates, churn, ASP, etc.
Assemble and summarize sales and revenue data, prepare reports, present analysis; ensure data accuracy and integrity
Develop and provide monthly/quarterly reporting for executive team, analyzing financial results and performance to budget plan and forecast
Provide financial modeling assistance for potential mergers and acquisition activity
Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis/special projects to assist senior management in driving business performance
Clearly communicate conclusions, analytical findings, and value-added information to internal stakeholders
Proactively seek and streamline processes to add efficiencies', 'You’ll thrive in this role if you have:', 'At least 4 years business experience, with a focus in FP&A
Advanced proficiency in Excel
Adaptive Planning and/or Power BI experience a major plus
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Experience with management and analysis of large data sets as well as financial models using tools such as Excel, ERPs, Power BI, etc.
Experience with reporting financial data in a concise and organized manner
Ability to multi-task and work in a challenging, fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Maturity, professionalism, and high level of discretion are required
Strong work ethic with a positive, can-do attitude
Independent worker and analytical thinker with ability to conduct research, data analysis and resolve complex problems
Strong presence with the ability to interact with Senior Leadership
SaaS experience a plus
Salesforce experience a plus', 'Does this position sound like something you would enjoy and be successful at, but you’re not sure you have the exact qualifications to be considered? While our job descriptions are an outline for the type of candidate we’re looking for, it is not a checklist. We encourage you to apply!', 'Who are we?', 'LeadVenture is the market-leading SaaS provider of digital retailing, eCommerce, digital marketing and eCatalog solutions for dealerships across 12 industry verticals including powersports, marine, RV, pre-owned auto, agriculture and more.', 'Our family of brands includes Dealer Spike, ARI Network Services, Inc. (ARI), Dealer Car Search, Frazer, TCS Technologies, Net Driven, Direct Communications, Inc. (DCi), Auction123, Powersports Support, Level 5, PSM Marketing, Monroney Labels, and Interact RV.']

column1: Sr. Enterprise Account Executive - Document Cloud

column7:
["As a Sr. Account Executive for Vimeo, you will be responsible for selling Vimeo's Enterprise Tools and platforms in the Western region. In this quota-carrying role, you will convert prospects to paying customers by handling both inbound leads as well as outbound prospecting. The Vimeo Sr. Account Executive should have strong communication skills and a desire to help customers achieve their business goals. The ideal candidate is highly driven, persuasive and passionate!", "What you'll do:", "Exceed sales quota targets by selling Vimeo's Enterprise Tools and platforms (https://vimeo.com/enterprise)
Convey Vimeo's unique value proposition to customers and handle objections
Position solution against contending offerings in marketplace
Work directly with leading brands and media companies to help them tackle their online video needs
Maintain CRM data and pipeline within Salesforce.com
Actively handle leads pipeline and campaigns in order to meet goals and objectives
Demonstrate Vimeo product capabilities to customers
Support the RFI/RFP process by providing responses to business requirements", 'Skills and knowledge you possess:', '4+ years experience generating new SaaS sales
Knowledge of online video, livestreaming, OTT, advertising, payment, analytics, and technology companies
Proven sales foundation built through sales training and practical experience
Strong verbal and written communication, time management, organizational as well as presentation skills
A great teammate that will thrive in our fluid, fast-paced, dynamic, scaling environment
A highly motivated and results-driven self-starter
Ability to operate with a sense of urgency and values accountability
Passion for Vimeo and our creative community', 'Targeted Base Salary Range: $83,000 to $121,000', 'The base salary range listed above is for candidates located in the U.S., including the New York City metro area.', "At Vimeo, we strive to hire and nurture amazing talent across the globe. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience, specialized skills, internal alignment and a candidate's home base.", "Base salary is just one component of Vimeo's total rewards philosophy. We offer a wide range of benefits and perks that appeal to the variety of needs across our diverse employee base! Other rewards may include bonus or commission, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), paid time off, generous 401k match, tuition reimbursement, wellbeing resources, and more.", "Vimeo (NASDAQ: VMEO) is the world's leading all-in-one video software solution. Our platform enables any professional, team, and organization to unlock the power of video to create, collaborate and communicate. We proudly serve our growing community of over 260 million users — from creatives to entrepreneurs to the world's largest companies.
Vimeo is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. At Vimeo, we believe our impact is greatest when our workforce of passionate, dedicated people, represents our diverse and global community. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer where diversity, equity, and inclusion is championed in how we build our products, develop our leaders, and strengthen our culture.
Learn more at www.vimeo.com
Learn more at www.vimeo.com/jobs"]

column1: Senior Business Development Manager, Technical Partners
column7:
['Our Mission', 'At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity and our organisation as we are.', 'We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.', 'Your Career', 'You will manage technology partnerships for our NGFW and Security Services product offerings that will solve security business challenges and manage integration pipeline and evaluation and recommendations for partnership to move to our higher tiers. This individual will work with both Business Development technical leads, as well as GTM, marketing and Product Management teams , along with partner counterparts to drive efforts from onboarding partnership to evaluating and presenting on recommendations for emerging partnerships that can drive joint value and co-sell opportunities. The role will focus on delivering measurable results, including, analysis and recommendations for potential emerging partnerships validation pipeline, event metrics, opportunity influence, and focused GTM efforts that will drive co-sell opportunities.', '', 'Your Impact', 'Work closely with product management and go-to-market sales and marketing teams to define the partnership ecosystem for product segments within the Strata product group and partner verticals (current focus is Core NGFW group and Cloud-Delivered Security Services group, which can change with the product and go-to-market needs and internal focus future changes)
Build and execute a plan for the segments of the product partnerships ecosystem defined above
Qualify, onboard, and manage relationships with strategic emerging and focus integration partners to generate clear and significant business value (brand recognition, metrics of the opportunities pipeline created, influenced, and direct revenues)
Build an end-to-end partnership with clear business and customer value that have significant measurable value for all parties
Build and execute business plans with emerging partners
Oversee and support technical integration work, use case built, integration guides, and solution briefs
Build, coordinate, and lead various go-to-market initiatives including internal, intercompany, intra-companies, and external activities (customer, channel, and other routes to market we can amplify in the ecosystems team such as GSIs, MSSPs, SPs)
Build relationships with senior and management-level leadership internally and with partner companies
Drive and Work on complex “coopetition scenarios” with partners, defining areas of cooperation or technical integration work for customers or partners’ needs', 'Your Experience', '3+ years of experience in business development and driving Integration technology partnerships and ecosystems
Drive to grow existing business and develop innovative, and disruptive partnerships
Ability to multitask and operate to manage critical partnerships and support the development of a low touch model of partnerships
Experience in SaaS Subscription, cloud-delivered offering and Security Markets
Experience in building meaningful technology partnerships and ecosystems
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Business, Engineering, Computer Science,
Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Economics or Finance) or equivalent practical experience or equivalent military experience required
MBA or graduate degree in management or technical field (optional)
Experience with MS-office, G-suite, SFDC, PRM tools
Ability to independently create, design, and develop solutions very successfully in a high-visibility role and in an extremely fast-paced, dynamic environment
Self-directed, professionally assertive, and self-driven
Strong problem finding and solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems, and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution
Effective and persuasive communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills, both internally and externally
An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems
Ability to travel up to 15% of the time (post-COVID-19 world)']

column1: Senior Manager, Product Marketing at Yelp for Restaurants
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Employee stock purchase plan', 'Flexible spending account', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['We are looking for an experienced Product Marketing leader to join the growing team at Yelp for Restaurants. Yelp for Restaurants is an internal SaaS marketplace startup that helps local and mid-market restaurants meet, greet, and seat the millions of diners booking tables online. You’ll work closely with the leadership team at Yelp for Restaurants to shape brand narratives, product positioning, pricing, and go-to-market strategies that accelerate Yelp’s restaurant evolution from an incredible online Ads program to an additional suite of operational SaaS tools. You will lead a small team tasked with driving adoption of the tools and technology Yelp for Restaurants is providing for restaurant owners to meet the evolving demands of the hospitality industry.', '', 'We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.', '', 'This is a full time role located in the United States.', 'Where you come in:', 'You will lead and mentor a small team of product marketers who partner with product, marketing, sales, and CS to drive adoption of Yelp Guest Manager.
You will work with the Yelp for Restaurant leadership team to shape narratives and customer strategies, including audience definition, willingness to pay, end-to-end product positioning, and comms architecture.
You will equip the product team with customer insights to deliver the right products and experiences for restaurants and diners.
You will equip sales teams to use the best messaging to both close pitches and earn loyalty.
You will oversee effective GTM plans and growth strategies including pricing and packaging models that maximize value capture.
You will partner closely with sales leadership to develop content that empowers the sales team to close deals more effectively, elevate both perceived and contract value.
You will partner with channel marketing, brand, PR and partner teams to produce best-in-class communications to support product launches and customer acquisition programs.
You will own GTM strategies for new features, integrations, and product opportunities. Not just announcements, but ingraining new features and products into the way sellers sell and marketers market.', 'What it takes to succeed:', 'You have experience leading and mentoring a small team.
You have a strong leadership presence and experience influencing PM, CS and Sales.
You have demonstrated experience developing successful multi-product packaging and pricing strategies. Even more specifically, you have experience building SaaS pricing strategies for both SMB and mid-market audiences.
You are highly collaborative and able to unite diverse sets of teams to execute integrated plans seamlessly.
You have 7+ years of work experience with at least 5 years experience in Product Marketing roles.
You have experience working on tech solutions targeting the SMB segment, bonus if that experience is in the restaurant industry.', "What you'll get:"]

column6: ['Health insurance', 'Paid sick time', 'Paid time off', 'Parental leave']
column7:
['At Siemens Digital Industries Software, you will join a globally distributed team that’s driving the future of marketing. The Senior Manager, Marketing Operations & Process position will be responsible for end-to-end process, data needs, and system flows. We are looking for an experienced SaaS marketing professional to advise on digital demand processes, QA and testing of data flows, analytic services of all marketing platforms and processes with a global impact.', '', 'The position will manage projects around analytics, process creation, operations and more. The ideal candidate will possess hands-on campaign execution and tool knowledge around digital marketing. Having an entrepreneurial approach and ability to work both independently and collaboratively to conceptualize campaign improvements through process management, analytics, and systems.', '', 'Responsibilities:
Create and optimize marketing business processes across differing functional areas and marketing platforms
Analyzes complex business problems using data from internal and external sources
Provides actionable insight to decision-makers to influence strategy and performance
Identifies and interprets trends and patterns to attribute key business drivers
Analyzes and defines metrics that tie back to business performance and initiatives
Will be a proponent of test/learn culture by enabling and supporting experimentation
May provide consultation and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues
Stakeholder and project management', 'Manage projects from start to end: build timelines and important milestones, provide regular updates to Marketing Management partners and achieve delivery against agreed upon specs', 'Directly produce processes and operational flows mapping to marketing business requirements
Understand common pitfalls and caveats when designing and evaluating marketing technology and processes.
Empower the marketing team to execute go to market strategy with chosen technology
Gain a good understanding of internal and external tools, have clarity on program goals, campaign strategy and execution
Support the execution of effective cross-channel (email, in-app, push notification, sms) marketing campaigns to achieve business objectives and improve the customer experience
Building measurement frameworks and processes around reporting/ sharing out key KPIs consistently across the team and capturing learnings and insights across the team, fueling a learning culture and an ongoing focus on optimization of discipline specific and cross-functional processes & workflows
Identify organizational barriers and build processes and tools to overcome those
Comfortable establishing systems, experience developing processes where little exists', '', "Qualifications:
Master’s or Bachelor's degree in a relevant field of study
10+ years of top tier marketing operations and processes management
Expert communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with internal teams in a cross-cultural and
cross-functional environment. Ability to conduct rigorous analysis and communicate conclusions to both technical and nontechnical
audiences
Hands-on experience with managing and running a marketing tech stack
Advanced skills with major marketing platforms such as Eloqua or Marketo
Experience with Analytics, dashboards, and reports including Tableau, QlikView or similar
Experience with marketing or sales analytics a huge plus
Excellent communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience, technical and non-technical
Experience with delivering marketing process recommendations to senior leadership and executive level audiences
Hands-on to get things done fast and ability to work without continual guidance
Excellent time management skills, attention to detail and ability to prioritize work
The salary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role is eligible to earn an additional 5-10% in variable pay. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).
At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow’s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds
#LI-PLM
#DISW
#LI-Remote", 'Organization: Digital Industries']

['GRUBBRR is changing the way the world does commerce. We are a mid-stage startup exploding with growth! We are embarking on partnerships with some of the most well known brands. We need extremely talented Full Stack developers, who are strong on front-end, to help design SaaS solutions.', '', 'Why work at GRUBBRR:', 'Great culture. Awesome people. We have a fun, collaborative environment where everyone shares a passion to win
We are an industry leader with a cutting edge product that is in high demand - your work will be seen by millions of people around the world
Excellent Leadership Team
Beautiful, newly renovated office space – modern and fun, invites creativity & collaboration - complete with an indoor park and an indoor-basketball court
Be a true entrepreneur and an owner. Everybody gets stock in the company and it could be very lucrative
The opportunity to be part of something that is revolutionizing industries
Be at the forefront of AI, machine learning, facial recognition, digital sensors, and other emerging technologies', '', "Don't miss out - you could not join at a better time!", '', "We're looking for developers who can write clean, elegant code with beautiful, modern UI. Projects will include developing API Driven web applications, integrations with 3rd party APIs, Restful Web Services. This person will get to work on cutting edge products and make a huge impact to the company.", '', 'Requirements']

['PLEASE NOTE: Databook will consider remote work for candidates located in any of the following states: Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Idaho, Illinois, Iowa, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Utah, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington, Wisconsin. Remote work requires periodic travel to our headquarters in Palo Alto, CA every 2-3 months.', 'The annual base salary range for this role starts at $150,000 USD with an opportunity for an annual performance based bonus.', 'About Databook', 'Databook is the world's first AI-powered enterprise customer intelligence platform. Dubbed "Moneyball for Sales", Databook was founded in 2017 to give enterprise sales representatives and go-to-market teams a differentiating advantage. Today, leading enterprise companies rely on Databook to help their teams engage as experts – improving the buying experience for customers and accelerating revenue acquisition. Our customers include Microsoft, Salesforce, Databricks, and more. We are a Series B company backed by Bessemer Ventures, DFJ Growth, M12 - Microsoft's Venture fund, Salesforce Ventures and Threshold Ventures. We are a customer-focused, innovative, and collaborative learning organization. We are headquartered in Palo Alto, CA with a distributed team working across the globe.', 'About Our Strategy & Operations Team', "The Customer Value team at Databook is composed of two functions: Strategy & Operations (S&O) and Value Architecture. Our S&O organization functions as the face of Databook for our end clients across the globe. We act as strategic partners to help drive transformation in our customers' sales organizations and align Databook usage across their sales cycle to drive increased pipeline, higher close rates and larger deal sizes. We are a team of individuals passionate about building an exceptional customer experience and bring enthusiasm for all things analytics, process and operations.", 'The Opportunity', 'The Customer Strategy Director leads a team of individual contributors, Strategy & Operations Managers and Consultants. You will be responsible for a book of business and will work directly with our customers on a regular basis - sales leaders at some of the largest and fastest-growing tech and consulting companies in the world. Operationally the Director is a core contributor to driving operational excellence for the S&O organization at Databook - they will be supporting projects and initiatives that enable scalability for this rapidly growing team and company.', 'In this role, you will:', 'Lead a team of Managers and Consultants overseeing a portfolio of clients as a senior level stakeholder to drive customer success outcomes
Work alongside the C-level sales leaders within accounts to create data-driven solutions for supercharging sales
Help to define a data-driven approach to customer success and management to drive account growth as well as employee development
Collaborate with customer value leadership to drive growth and scalability through ongoing internal Databook projects and initiatives
Collaborate with internal Databook stakeholders to achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes consistently and on time
Provide mentoring and coaching to develop team members and support career growth']

['To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.', '', 'Job Category', '', 'Job Details', 'Experience Services builds the user experience platform that powers Salesforce. From the components and services that make up the Lightning experience UI and mobile app, Experience Cloud product suite, through the Salesforce Slack integration platform. We are Salesforce’s digital experience platform.

Are you passionate about building platforms that enable low- and pro-code developers to build compelling business solutions? Do you have a background in working closely with developers or developing yourself? Are you a technically strong product manager who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? If this describes you, we would love to consider you for this opportunity!

Salesforce is looking for a senior product professional to drive product innovation around lifecycle management on our platform offerings. The ideal candidate has experience building platforms for developers and understands how enterprises build systems that house data and automation processes. Knowledge of Salesforce Lightning Platform is a strong plus.', '', 'Role Overview', '', 'You will be apart of the team that will be driving the implementation of a lifecycle management solution, including draft, preview, and publishing of sites and storefronts built with the Salesforce platform. The ideal candidate is someone who can build platform capabilities, advance a broader platform vision and implement a roadmap to add versioning and lifecycle management to the core platform. You will guide one or more engineering teams to deliver highly scalable products that demonstrate and extend the power of the Salesforce platform.

You will also work to support our Salesforce Slack platform team as they continue to innovate the next generation integration between Salesforce platform and Slack.

Critical to the success of this role is the ability to identify, articulate, and focus your customers on what platform capabilities customers (internal and external developers and end users) need to build experiences that can deliver B2C scale performant, fully tested site experiences.']

column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'AD&D insurance', 'Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Health savings account']
column7:
["Overjet is on a mission to improve oral health for all.
Our cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology encodes dentist-level training and analysis into scalable software tools. Today, our flagship products are used by some of the country's largest insurance companies, dental support organizations, and dental practices to enable the best patient care.
We're building an ambitious team of data scientists, software engineers, clinicians, and business thinkers and doers.
Overjet is backed by an amazing consortium of Venture Capital including General Catalyst, Insight Partners, Crosslink Capital and the E14 Fund. The company has raised nearly $80 million in capital to accelerate talent acquisition and product development driven by strong demand for Overjet's dental AI.
The Team", "Our product development team comprises engineers, data scientists, technical project managers, clinicians, and product manager. We are small enough that it is easy for everyone to talk to each and collaborate seamlessly. We err on the side of reaching out directly to whoever we need to talk to, to get things done, without any layers in between. We exhibit a bias for swift action and learning. We practice radical candor and support each other's learning.", '', 'The Role', 'As a Product Manager, you will increase the impact of our insurance product by identifying the top user problems to solve and the best ways to solve them. You focus on outcome over output and orient product development accordingly. You relish the opportunity to spend your day listening to customer feedback, working side-by-side with a cross functional team to define how the best ideas from your team or elsewhere come to life.', '', 'Responsibilities', "Inspire and support your product team to build products that delight users and produce tangible business value
Develop product vision and strategy based on analysis of market segments, product traction, complex customer needs and competitive products and secure buy in from your team and leadership
Understand user pain points and describe the problems to solve to your engineering team, in the context of your product strategy
Collaborating and planning with stakeholders across the business on all aspects needed to bring solutions to market
Leading business and technical validation sessions with internal stakeholders and customers
Setting adoption and engagement targets for products and articulating metrics against which success can be objectively measured
Maintain an outcome oriented roadmap that is updated at a regular cadence so we know what bets we're making now-next-later
Communicate the impact of your product to clients and prospects directly and indirectly by enabling sales", 'Qualifications', '4+ years of product management experience
Enjoy working in a high growth, fast paced startup
Experience with SaaS Products
Ability to deliver with Enterprise products and customers (Health-tech or Insurance preferred)
Experience navigating the nuances of enterprise workflow problems
Bias to lead with user empathy
Proven track record of bringing clarity to product vision, strategy, roadmap, prioritization
Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical audiences, with engineers and C-level execs with ease
Preferred: Demonstrable product experience building new products or enterprise B2B experiences']

column7:
["For other positions, some roles may be based outside of our Denver office (as stated in the Job Title). Roles based outside of our Denver office can sit in any of the following 28 states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, ID, IL, KS, MA, MD, MI, MN, NC, NJ, NV, NY, OH, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, and WI. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.
-
At Guild, we uphold our Core Values in everything we do. Our team emphasizes our Core Values in the following ways:
Nurture A Learner's Mindset - using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and development areas
Build Shared Success - building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Be an Owner - holding self and others accountable to meet commitments
Create Belonging - recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to our company", 'Guild Education is hiring a Senior Legal Counsel who will be responsible for supporting our academic partnership ecosystem and education marketplace, with a primary focus on overseeing related complex commercial contracting negotiations, risk mitigation strategies, standards, and processes.', 'We are looking for an individual who thrives in an environment driven by mission, agility, and high-growth who can partner with and support our team in navigating complex legal and regulatory issues. Our ideal candidate is driven by collaboration, problem-solving, and practicality in partnership with all levels and functions at Guild; and brings deep expertise and experience in complex commercial contracting from either a firm or in-house environment.', 'The Senior Legal Counsel will partner closely with all business teams at Guild (including sales, account management, solutions design, engineering and product development, accounting and finance, and more). This is a senior level position that will report directly to the Senior Vice President of Legal and will be a member of the legal leadership team. Additionally, the Senior Legal Counsel will be instrumental in mentoring and advising other members of the team.', "This is an incredible opportunity to join the legal team supporting a core offering for an iconic public benefit corporation with a double-bottom line mission to unlock life-changing opportunities to America's workforce through education and economic mobility.", 'Responsibilities:', "Draft and negotiate complex legal agreements with sophisticated academic partners, universities, colleges, edtech platforms, and other learning providers
Develop, manage and improve our education marketplace commercial contracting processes, including crafting deal desk parameters, legal terms playbooks and policies, standard form agreements and documents, and risk-management policies
Collaborate with internal and external clients on contract status, legal risks and considerations related to numerous concurrent negotiations and finalized contracts.
Foster strong working relationships with internal business clients, as well as external customers, partners, and other third parties and their counsel
Monitor, research and anticipate legal and regulatory developments or other issues that could impact the company and help resolve legal and other compliance issues.
Provide legal support in the development and launch of new education benefits products, services and pricing models
Assist in the development and provision of legal training programs on the contracting and legal processes and standards, company policies, regulatory landscape, and other legal topics
Assist in our legal department's continued growth as the company expands, including with hiring, training, and strategic planning of the department", '', '', 'Qualifications:']

['Customer Success Manager- West', 'We are open to hiring someone remote that sits in PST or MST only *', 'Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like DocuSign, LinkedIn, Slack, Instacart, Broadcom, and Hearst to move forward on what matters.', 'Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why Built In named Moveworks the #1 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area.', 'This is a unique chance to join the team as a key player in our growth strategy. If that sounds like fun, we can’t wait to start this journey together!', 'What will you do?', 'You partner with our initial customers to drive product value
You develop trusted advisor relationships with executive sponsors to ensure they are achieving full business value
You partner cross-functionally to translate business needs and product requirements into new solutions for customers
You will evolve and iterate on our customer onboarding strategy
You work with internal teams and customers to drive adoption, engagement and growth
You will help customers identify, quantify, and work toward transformational goals in partnership with Moveworks
You will adapt quickly to product changes and limitations, and communicate these strategically to stakeholders
You will act as the voice of the customer, gathering customer feedback and helping share the product roadmap', 'What do you bring to the table?', 'You have 2+ years of account management, implementation, or sales experience in software/SaaS
You have experience in explaining technical solutions, establishing goals, developing opportunities, building + selling business cases, and improving customer experience
You have experience supporting deployments with large enterprise customers
Process focused with strong problem-solving ability - always searching for a smarter, better way to achieve a goal
You have experience building strong internal and external relationships, including with senior-level executives throughout companies
You are diplomatic, have tact and you are poised under pressure
You possess a voracious appetite to learn and grow
You have completed a Bachelor’s degree
You are willing to travel 10-25% of the time', '']

column7:
['Smartcar is on a mission to make it easy for everyone to use the apps and services they love with their car. We build developer-friendly APIs which makes it easy for businesses to integrate their products with vehicles of any brand using a single integration.

Founded in 2015, Smartcar has raised $36M from Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, and Energize Ventures. We are now the leading developer platform for mobility businesses across North America and Europe serving amazing customers including brands like British Petroleum (BP), Turo, NRG, and more.

Innovative mobility companies use our API platform to verify mileage, issue digital car keys, manage EV charging, monitor fleets, and much more.

You will have an exciting opportunity as an Enterprise Account Executive to help pioneer a new industry and bring Smartcar’s data-rich technology to the world.

Feel free to check out what our interview process looks like.

This role is remote within California, Texas or New York. We’d love for you to join us!', 'Key Responsibilities
Own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close for Enterprise businesses across multiple verticals
Pitch and demo Smartcar to both technical and non-technical stakeholders using value-based selling
Adjust pitch decks for vertical-specific use cases
Maintain a strong pipeline and CRM hygiene
Contribute to strengthening Smartcar’s sales process and sales tactics to fuel the company’s growth
Share customer feedback with Customer Success, Product, and Engineering
Collaborate with Customer Success during the testing and implementation stage to ensure timelines are on track and expectations are met', 'Who You Are
8-11 years of experience in a high performing B2B SaaS closing role
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and present technical topics
Exemplary writing, speaking, and presentation skills
Diligent with researching and understanding each opportunity
Team player who is collaborative, thoughtful, resourceful, and coachable
Confident with value-based selling methodologies and a winning mindset', 'Manager
Laura Huddle, Chief Revenue Officer', 'Your Team
Chris Coppe
Paige Harris
Madeline Allen
Suraj Sampath
Katarina Galambos
Marium Ali
Alexandrea Nied', 'Compensation and Benefits Package
Base salary determined by years of experience: $130,000-$150,000
OTE: $260,000-$300,000 OTE (50/50 split)
Competitive equity
Remote work within California, New York or Texas
Health, Dental and Vision covered at 90% for all plans and 80% coverage for dependents, which amounts to approximately $11,000 a year
401K matching at 4%
Unlimited PTO and 10 days of paid holidays
Wellness stipend of $50 a month
Cell phone and Internet stipend of $50 a month
$300 yearly learning and development stipend
$350 work-from-home stipend
8 weeks of 100% paid parental leave with a 1-week half day ramp back time and a 5 week Freshly subscription
10 days of paid bereavement leave', 'Sponsorship
We do not currently support any new sponsorship opportunities or sponsorship transfers for this role', 'Recruiter For This Role
Steven Stone', 'Smartcar is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to reach out, in confidence, to mathilde@smartcar.com with how we can help make your interview process as comfortable as possible and how we can provide reasonable accommodations.']
