column7:
["SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.", '', 'Job Description', '', 'SS&C Eze Head of Engineering (Head of Development)', '', 'SS&C Eze is seeking a Head of Engineering in its Boston headquarters. As the leader of our Engineering organization, the person will provide strategic direction and vision for the team and work collaboratively with the leads of the Product, Service, Sales and Marketing teams. This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated leader to manage a strong team with deep domain knowledge and technical capabilities as they build software solutions designed to maximize investment and operational alpha for the entire institutional investment community. This role requires a self-starter with ability to motivate and guide others, with urgency, toward a common goal: someone who will champion new process and structure and mentor development leaders and staff.', '', 'Job Functions:', 'Oversee Engineering strategy and US-based Engineering resources across all SS&C Eze software products
Formulate, execute and articulate our software development philosophy and strategy
Set vision and direction for the team to drive technology and product innovation to exceed client expectations
Cross-organizational collaboration within SS&C to create best of breed solutions
Regularly update various stakeholders on this vision, strategy and progress
Push the boundaries of speed-to-market while maintaining world-class quality
Actively engage with product managers to set roadmaps, align priorities and monitor progress against an aggressive roadmap
Lead from the front line to achieve goals and commitments and exceed expectations
Actively seek to leverage leading-edge proven technology to improve or create new products']

column1: Finance & Strategy Senior Analyst - Strategic Initiatives
column6: ['AD&D insurance', 'Caregiver leave', 'Employee stock purchase plan', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
["We are looking for a new Senior Analyst on our team who will help scale our Emerging Initiatives. We launched these initiatives to grow Block's mission of economic empowerment by reinventing the way people work with and access financial services. These initiatives are in their early stages, so you will partner with leaders across multiple departments and providing unique insights to each initiative to shape their business strategy.", 'You will report to a manager within the Strategic Initiatives team and support our Emerging Initiatives, though we anticipate there will be opportunities overtime to work on other Strategic Initiatives projects based on your career goals and our capacity / needs.', 'The Strategic Initiatives function on the Finance & Strategy (F&S) team was formed in 2021 to focus on three things:', 'Lead strategy for "Emerging Businesses" for Block. Be the voice of where the market is going and where there is an opportunity for Block to take part, and help educate relevant partners, leading towards a plan for if & how Block will get involved (build, buy, partner). Over the past year, we have helped stand up 4 new initiatives (TBD, Bitcoin Wallet, Bitcoin Mining, and Lightning payment infrastructure) and we work with those teams to help define their strategies and make important decisions on product, partnerships, go-to-market, operations, and more.
Build the operating muscle for Block to succeed as it scales user growth and adds more business lines. Help us define how we want the company to operate at a corporate level and ensure that we find the balance between enabling our BUs / ("Blocks") to operate independently and creatively while maintaining a strong corporate culture. Lead efforts to enable operational efficiencies to support rapid scaling.
Serve as the Finance & Strategy voice on cross-Block initiatives including (but not limited to) corporate development (M&A, partnerships, investments), Treasury, Tax, Capital Markets, Counsel and People businesses', 'Job Duties:', 'Forecast and analyze financial performance, including managing the forecast model for the Emerging Initiatives, and communicating important takeaways to senior partners through regular performance review meetings
Prepare materials for product partners, senior leadership, investor relations, and our board to help bring understanding of performance to all partners
Partner with accounting and financial operations teams to run the monthly close process and report on variances in performance
Establish and improve our finance tools and systems to communicate performance
Build models, including impact and scenario analyses for new products, to understand short and long-term cost/benefit tradeoffs and size financial impact of contemplated launches or product changes
Manage ad hoc analyses and special projects as requested by the Emerging Initiatives teams and Finance partners related to our performance/metrics, P&L analysis, among other topics
Assess the viability of new business opportunities, strategic initiatives, and partnerships', '', "3+ years of relevant industry experience (e.g. management consulting, investment banking, private equity, investments, strategic finance, corporate finance)
Excellent proficiency in financial modeling and Excel (can perform complex functions - you should be prepared for a case study)
An ability to execute independently and work with team members of all levels
Consistent track record of success and career progression
Basic understanding of the financial services industry and a commitment to Block's mission", 'Even better:', 'Strategic finance experience strongly preferred
Experience with crypto, hardware, semiconductor, consumer finance, payments, small business finance, or consumer SaaS companies']

['When you join Verizon', '', "Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.", '', 'What you’ll be doing...', '', 'Verizon is undergoing a transformation from a telecommunications company to a technology company, and we are in search of the next generation of Product Managers (PM) to help us drive forward. An important piece of this initiative is transformation to an API-first approach. With products at different stages of this journey—monolithic, API-last, API-first—we need PM’s who can help set the right culture, process for this transformation.', 'Business capability describes the entire suite of business capabilities composing your business. The business capability model defines the problem space for every API an organization would build.', 'As an API Evangelist, the person will be responsible for:', 'Mentoring and coaching team on API-first best practices and skills.
Defining how a world class API team operates and drives business impact.
Driving the editorial calendar and support the team’s creation of engaging content around Verizon’s open-source engagements and products.
Engaging with developers and participate in developer forums; create samples, guides, tutorials, and blogs to ensure an excellent experience, both for internal and external developers.
Working closely with partners and open-source communities, such as CNCF, GraphQL Foundation, to coordinate marketing collateral and initiatives.
Being an evangelist for the Verizon development platform, Development Portal, and open-source projects both internally and externally by speaking at conferences, meetups, community meetings.
Acting as the voice of developers and Verizon’s customers in creating and operationalizing world-class SaaS platforms.
Helping improve our products by providing feedback on API design, platform usability, and functionality.
Participating in and grow the communities around Verizon’s involvement in open source.
Building strong cross-functional partnerships at multiple levels within the company, including commercial, engineering, marketing, sales, and services.']

['With over 100 million end-users in more than 70 countries, Microblink develops scalable solutions that harness artificial intelligence to power state-of-the-art computer vision and data extraction technology.', 'In just eight years, Microblink has transformed from start-up into a global growth company and we are just getting started. Our mission is to bring the benefits of AI to every person on earth and to enable trust when we come together online.', 'Our Digital Identity solutions deliver safer and better experiences for all of us across a wide variety of activities and industries, including travel, financial transactions, e-commerce, and employee onboarding.', 'We know our technology is only as good as our team, so to support our continued growth, we’re looking for a creative, curious and highly ambitious product leader to deliver a world-class self-service experience for our customers.', 'This Brooklyn-based role is inherently cross-functional, working collaboratively with international teams in Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Design, Marketing, Sales and Customer Success.', 'As a Senior Product Manager, you will:', 'Define and align strategy for Microblink’s developer and partner hubs - from conception through execution - by creating roadmaps, identifying and prioritizing requirements & resources, outlining specifications & scope of work and drive results against ambitious timelines.
Immerse yourself in customer discovery, by defining use cases, monitoring the competitive landscape, tracking emerging trends and identifying opportunities for innovative features and functionality that deliver value
Optimize product performance to drive adoption, optimize utilization, retain customers, maximize recurring revenue and propel profitability.
Develop hypotheses, success metrics & KPIs, run experiments, analyze data, and make improvements to core machine learning models, measuring how each iteration impacts revenue.', 'You might be right for us if you:', 'Are an ambitious, achievement-oriented intrapreneur with 4+ years of experience driving product growth in a rapidly scaling B2B SaaS organization, shipping disruptive products that break the boundaries between what’s been done and what’s only been dreamt of.
Are excited about the potential inherent in AI and data-intensive, ML enabled solutions.
Have a bias to action with a high risk tolerance and thrive in a culture of innovation, where ideation, experimentation and iteration are encouraged.
Are an organized and analytical systems thinker with exceptional technical writing skills.
Have high standards, a growth mindset and a commitment to continuous improvement in pursuit of excellence.', 'We might be right for you, if you’re looking for:']

["Datavant is a rapidly growing healthcare technology company with a mission to connect the world's health data. By eliminating data silos in the healthcare industry, we aim to unlock opportunities to accelerate clinical data exchange, medical research, and help organizations design better ways to facilitate access, affordability, and quality of care leading to better patient outcomes.", "Datavant is looking for experienced sales executives who thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, understand what it takes to create a book of business and achieve quarterly sales goals and share our drive to transform the healthcare industry. By joining Datavant today, you're stepping onto a highly collaborative, fully remote team that is passionate about creating transformative change in healthcare. We invest in our people and believe in hiring for high-potential individuals who can rapidly grow their responsibilities as the company scales.", 'Datavant is a distributed, remote-first team (no office locations) and we empower Datavanters to shape their working environment in a way that suits their needs - learn more here!', 'In this role, you will be part of a fast growing team with significant upside. Life Sciences is one of the fastest growing markets for Datavant with a lot of potential for growth. In the role you will work with Pharma to help them solve some of their most pressing use cases by enabling them to link Real-World Data (RWD). You will gain knowledge on the vast RWD ecosystem and how Pharma thinks and unlocks value through this network. RWD is the future of Healthcare. Join us in the revolution!', 'You Will:', 'Own the prospecting, engagement, and acquisition of high value pharma/biotech prospects for companies in the Northeast (CT, MA, RI, VT, NH, ME)
Create results-driven plan with focus on revenue generating prospecting activity
Identify sales opportunities and lead all aspects of deal execution
Lead negotiations, address concerns, and close deals
Manage and own the end-to-end sales cycle, must be comfortable closing 6-7 figure deals
Achieve and exceed quarterly revenue targets
Collaborate cross-functionally with our implementations, product, and engineering teams
Present to C-level executives confidently', 'What You Will Bring To The Table:', '5+ years of experience in a combination of business development, sales and/or management consulting with a leading healthcare related business or high-growth enterprise tech start-up
Prior healthcare-related SAAS, middleware and/or data sales experience strongly preferred
Strong contacts in the leading pharma/biotech companies
Knowledge of drug development life cycle
A consistent track record of exceeding aggressive sales quotas
Excellent interpersonal and prioritization skills with keen analytic and quantitative skills
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to clarify and summarize complex issues in all forms: written, conversational, negotiations, and presentations
Unwavering focus on delivering customer satisfaction
Self-starter with relentless energy and positivity
Thrive in a fast-paced environment and willing to hustle to get things done
Willingness to travel', 'We are committed to building a diverse team of Datavanters who are smart, nice, and get things done where every Datavanter is empowered to bring their authentic self to their work. We are all responsible for stewarding a high-performance culture in which all Datavanters belong and thrive. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and experiences.', 'Our compensation philosophy is to be externally competitive, internally fair, and not win or lose on compensation. Salary ranges are developed with the support of benchmarks (competitive San Francisco rates for US-based roles) and industry best practices.']

column1: Senior Product Manager (Open to US and Canada)
column7:
['What We’re Building
Honeycomb is built to help engineering teams deeply explore and understand their own production systems — in real time. It’s a service for the near and present future, where distributed systems are the new default, every service is a platform, and empowered generalist software engineers are the new ops. We are passionate about consumer-quality developer tools and excited to build technology that raises our industry’s expectations of what our tools can do for us. We’re working with well known companies like Hello Fresh, Slack, LaunchDarkly, and Vanguard and more across a range of industries. This is an exciting time in our trajectory, as we’ve closed Series C funding, scaled past the 150-person mark, and were named to Forbes’ America’s Best Startups of 2022! In this Senior Product Manager role, you’ll be a joining a growing Product team focused on customer empathy and building the new generation of tracing-first observability.

If you want to see what we’ve been up to, check out these blog posts about our recent features and the impact this team is making with BubbleUp.

Who We Are
We come for the impact, and stay for the culture! We’re a talented, opinionated, passionate, fiercely inclusive, and responsible group of bees. We have conviction and we strive to live our values every day. We want our people to do what they truly love amongst a team of highly talented (but humble) peers.

How We Work
We are a remote-first company, which means we believe it is not where you sit, but how you deliver that matters most. We invest in our people and care about how you orient to our culture and processes. At the same time we imbue a lot of trust, autonomy, and accountability from Day 1.', "What You'll Do
You’ll own driving the work and outcomes on core product features such as tracing, metrics, and querying wide events, as well as collaborating closely with engineering and design in a triad-based working model.
You’ll build relationships and facilitate impactful technical conversations across the company, including partnering with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success.
You’ll naturally gravitate toward empathetically understanding users, what pains them and pleases them, and you’ll be relentless in advocating for their best interests in the product.
You’ll be taking directional guidance from key stakeholders and using it as the basis for chartering your own product discovery adventures.
You have an aspiration to synthesize and distill signal to create focus. You will not be easily distracted by streams of information incoming from many directions.
You’ll contribute to a community of practice with your fellow Product Managers, fostering a culture of cohesion and knowledge-sharing.", 'About You
You’re endlessly curious - a proactive problem solver. You seek data to inform your decision-making and allow that to inform how you prioritize work. You never stop asking questions and you seek answers from your customers, your colleagues and your own research.
You’re a thoughtful communicator and product leader. We see clear and regular communication (including a willingness to give and receive feedback) as a fundamental skill, not just a nice to have — and we hope you do too. This role sits at the intersection of several teams and our users, making communication especially important.
You are equally at home setting a vision and identifying small pieces of value that can be delivered iteratively and quickly. You enjoy shepherding product work through its entire lifecycle, from early prototype to GA.
You find ambiguity inspiring and are driven to navigate your way through it to a place of clarity. You value making space for learning before pushing toward a solution.
You’re comfortable or interested in technically complex spaces, whether it’s a background being a developer yourself or a history working on technical SaaS products. A strong preference to have experience working in or as a user of tracing, metrics, monitoring, or analytics software.
You’re excited to build the next generation of tracing technology!', 'What You Get When You Join the Hive
Base pay (range) of $200,000 - $230,000 (Senior) USD
A stake in our success - generous equity with employee-friendly stock program
It’s not about how strong of a negotiator you are - our pay is based on transparent levels relative to experience
Compensation benchmarked to San Francisco market - no matter where you live (or move)! #LI-Remote
401k plan to help you plan for your future
A remote-first mindset and culture (really!)
100% employee coverage for Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
Time To Recharge - Unlimited PTO, paid sabbatical, 19 US Holidays in 2023 (which includes a company wide break at the end of the year to help you relax and recharge for the new year), and one 3-day weekend per month
Pick Your Perk - $600 a year to spend on the perks that you care about most
Work Life Balance and Flexible Schedule options
The tech you need AND a $500 Home Setup Stipend
$200 Reimbursement for Cell/Wifi/CoWorking
$1500+ Annual Professional Development Allowance
Up to 16 weeks of paid parental leave, regardless of path to parenthood
Maven Inclusive Family-Building benefit including unlimited virtual appointments, coaches & counselors, and $10K ‘wallet’ to support adoption, surrogacy, IVF, and egg/sperm freezing
Semi-annual performance conversations (we call them Review & Rewards conversations) - so you know where you stand, and how you’ll be rewarded for your impact
Annual compensation review, benchmarking to industry and inflation changes', "Diversity & Accommodations:
We're building a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other, and welcome nontraditional candidates, and people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. You don't need to be a millennial to join us, all gens are welcome! Further, we (of course) follow federal and state disability laws and are happy to provide reasonable accommodations during the application phase, interview process, and employment. Please email Talent@honeycomb.io to discuss accessible formats or accommodations. As an equal opportunity employer our hiring process is designed to put you at ease and help you show your best work; if we can do better - we want to know!"]

["Senior Product Marketing Manager
Do you thrive in a startup vibe? Were you built for a small, nimble and dynamic team that's ready to win? If you answered yes, we want to talk to you! We are now going back to our roots as a standalone business unit to focus on our SaaS business—an area where we see growth potential. This business unit is unique, and we certainly aren’t afraid to stand out from the crowd and tackle the bigger competitors.

As the Senior Product Marketing manager, you will play an instrumental role in designing and executing the go-to-market strategy, including messaging and positioning, for ShareFile to support a +$200M business realizing double digit growth in a fast-growing market. Your goal: Create and implement a successful go-to-market strategy for ShareFile workflow products and features.
Role Overview:
Now, let’s get to the details. The Product Marketing manager is the buyer and market expert for ShareFile workflow features and products, shaping how the market and buyer understand our workflow portfolio and the value it can deliver. This includes:
Building the buyer personas, messaging, and positioning through primary and secondary research in target segments
Developing go-to-market strategy for products and features of ownership
Gathering win/loss information, leveraging insight to tweak go-to-market strategies
Working close with product management to develop the business case for new features
Collaborating with sales enablement to deliver compelling and successful sales training and content
Partnering with marketing to build marketing campaigns, from awareness through nurture
Understanding marketing trends, proactively adjusting positioning to capture emerging opportunities
Involvement in passion projects and opportunities within ShareFile

Your Superhero uniform Includes:
Collaborate with customers and internal teams
Prioritize across multiple projects
Project manage and collaborate with groups outside of product marketing to meet quarterly and yearly goals
Effectively network across multiple groups
Identify growth opportunities in feedback
Communicate with various stakeholders and team members to meet KPIs
Present effectively to both internal and external groups
Develop written content for internal audiences
Demonstrate curiosity and a desire to grow
Ability to navigate ambiguity and change

Your Superhero Uniform includes:
A Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Marketing, or any related quantitative discipline preferred, but not required
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university
6 years of marketing/product management/product marketing with specific experience in B2B and/or SaaS welcome"]

column1: Digital Sales Manager or Sr. Manager – SaaS & Hosted Services
column7:
['At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.', 'We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.', 'Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.', 'AECOM is seeking a Digital Sales Manager or Sr. Manager to support our Digital team. This position will be remote/virtual and can be based from a variety of locations in the United States.', 'This Digital Sales Manager / Sr. Manager role reports to the Director of Digital Solutions, and is part of the Digital SaaS / Hosted Services team responsible for selling Digital AECOM software solutions to our large existing customer base and new prospects globally. The individual is a take-charge, proactive, executive-level sales representative with the following focus strengths:', 'Drive a technology sales process through and with internal and external channels to market
Develop strong deal strategies that maximize growth
Thrive in a consultative sales role
Understand and Communicate Software value propositions in a B2B environment (with focus on SaaS)
Able to easily establish rapport with internal commercial stakeholders as well as customers/prospects with the end goal of being a trusted advisor.
Continuously look to improve sales processes and find routes to grow.', 'Overview/Summary', 'Partner with AECOM regions and business digital stakeholders to define, measure and execute sales strategies and drive opportunities in support of Software Product’s business case realization.
Closely work with Key Account Managers in the identification, definition, and closure of digital opportunities, ensuring common and simple tools, standards and processes are established and continuously improved to drive global growth.
Develop and apply an understanding of Digital AECOM software products, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques, and customer base to sell to end users.
Accurate and timely manage a global sales pipeline, engaging a matrix of stakeholders and opportunity owners in a proactive way, providing coaching and support to maximize win rate.
Achieve sales targets and demonstrate progress towards achieving account strategies with regional and business counterparts.
Establish relationships with key Technology stakeholders (IT/OT Offices) in the target industries and customers.
Establish relationships with key channel partners, system integrators, and any other external stakeholders that can serve as Digital AECOM’s expanded channels to market.
Provide support, coaching and insights to KAMs and regional teams to properly identify economic buyers, stakeholders and gatekeepers and establish proper winning deal strategies.
Identify and develop opportunities across different product groups to leverage sales opportunities.
Identifies short- and long-term market and industry trends, competitive positioning and moves in the segments Digital AECOM products are placed.', 'Minimum Requirements', 'For Manager:']

['At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way. As a member of our team, you can too.', 'We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.', '', 'We actively look for prospects who:
Are passionate about client success.
Enjoy collaborating with others.
Strive to exceed expectations.
Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.', '', 'Job Description:', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Senior Counsel will be responsible for general legal matters, including commercial legal advice and contracts, in support of the Sending Technology Solutions business of Pitney Bowes, including SaaS software, hardware and service offerings. The Senior Counsel will work independently and under the supervision of the Deputy General Counsel. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: working on general commercial matters for business units; drafting, reviewing and negotiating complex agreements including software licenses, technology agreements, web-based terms and conditions, sales, service and maintenance agreements, leases, non-disclosure agreements and various other types of agreements; researching and drafting legal memoranda; communicating and negotiating with clients and vendors; advising business unit clients regarding legal matters and potential disputes; working on special projects with senior management, other members of the Legal Department, and outside counsel as necessary. This position will be located in the company’s Stamford, Connecticut office.', '']

["With a long legacy of success, innovation and customer awards, Advantest America, Inc. (AAI) is the North American subsidiary of Advantest Corporation, the world's largest provider of automated test equipment (ATE) to the semiconductor industry. We lead the way in developing new and innovative test and handling solutions for the global electronics industry. Advantest America, Inc. (AAI) has experienced record growth in the US and is parent company to Advantest Test Solutions Inc., Essai, Inc., R&D Altanova, and other US and foreign based subsidiaries.", '', 'This person will report to the Advantest America, Inc. General Counsel and will support internal business units primarily by drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and advising on a wide variety of commercial contracts, licensing and related technology focused agreements in accordance with Advantest America, Inc policies to effectively and efficiently serve many internal clients while protecting the interests of Advantest.', '', 'The ideal candidate is a pro-active, critical thinker, who can work cross functionally, timely, independently and in collaboration with a larger team in a fast paced, growing technology and manufacturing company. Must be licensed to practice law and in good standing in the state of California or any other US state (with eligibility as CA Registered In House Counsel).', '', "This is a full-time position and intended to work primarily at Advantest America, Inc's headquarters in San Jose, CA. Alternate work locations in established, alternate AAI office locations in the western US may be possible, but preference to those who can and will work from the San Jose, CA Headquarters. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.", '', 'Specific Responsibilities', 'Draft, review and negotiate terms and conditions in a variety of agreements, but with a particular emphasis on those concerning equipment and engineering sales and services, software and eBusiness related services and licensing (e.g. Saas, Paas, Iaas), technology development agreements, licensing and similar intellectual property related agreements and other company agreement for assigned internal clients.
Review defined contract terms, limitation of liability, intellectual property indemnity, license grants and warranty, revising accordingly consistent with Advantest policies and procedures.
Interpret and clarify for internal clients and other parties concerning contract terms and conditions
Review contract requirements and advise on associated legal and compliance issues
Participate in design, implementation and education concerning legal issues, as assigned
Conduct research and provide counseling on contractual, compliance, intellectual property and other matters
Coordinate frequently with subsidiaries of Advantest America, Inc. and globally with companies in Advantest Group
Other duties in connection with the foregoing']

column7:
['Full-Time
,
Seattle or Remote', 'About the role:

Lexion is seeking an Account Executive to grow the business. You will be responsible for managing deal cycles from generation to close, both by prospecting and targeting key accounts from scratch, as well as taking a steady funnel of incoming leads and helping organizations.
We are looking for individuals who can help in-house legal teams, sales orgs, and finance teams understand the value that Lexion can provide: gain insights about what’s in their contracts, measure the productivity of legal departments, and scale their business and legal operations.
You will be the primary contact with the customer and have the responsibilities of, demoing Lexion, providing technical assistance, successfully navigating the sales process, and negotiating contracts. This position works closely with the rest of the Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams.
You’re comfortable communicating with senior business leaders and C-suite executives, while managing a large funnel, and working within a team environment. You will be meeting with legal and operations professionals looking to improve the management of their contracts and scale their legal operations.
Successful candidates must be solution-focused, customer-centric, data-driven, possess an aptitude for learning and using new software, and be able to communicate clearly and effectively.

Responsibilities:
Work full-cycle deals from prospecting to demo to close.
Research and target in-house legal teams at mid-sized companies.
Develop and deploy a diverse prospecting strategy focused on building relationships.
Learn and demonstrate Lexion to new prospective customers.
Negotiate contracts.
Record and document all sales activities in a CRM.
Qualities we look for:
Minimum of 5+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience selling to users and decision makers in the mid-market space, ideally to a G&A function such as legal, HR, or accounting/finance.
Experience selling “transactional” SaaS product(s), where ACVs are $15k-$50k with 30-60 day sales cycles.
Strong drive to win deals and create happy customers.
Ability to understand the product you are selling as an expert.
Well organized, and you know how to qualify, prioritize, and multi-task effectively.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Leadership qualities we can use as we keep growing.
Strong understanding of how to outbound prospect with or without a dedicated territory.
Track record of forecasting accurately and have strong pipeline management skills.
Experience with CRM tools and sales engagement platforms (such as Hubspot and Outreach) for effective pipeline management.
Experience working closely with BDRs.
What we offer:
A fast-paced, inclusive and collaborative environment
Build category-defining products
Work with world class talent (ex Facebook, Google, Amazon, Microsoft, SurveyMonkey, The Allen Institute for AI).
A chance to be an early member of the team, with equity to match
Make an impact, and help make everyone more efficient at their job
Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage
401k plan
Unlimited PTO policy
Salary range: $80,000 - $100,000 plus commission
About Lexion:
Lexion is a fast growing AI-first startup that is changing the game for how companies track and manage key business documents in the enterprise and companies of all sizes. We use best in class natural language processing technologies to make it 100x easier for lawyers and other corporate leaders to find the information they need in their contracts fast. Our solution is also incredibly intuitive and simple to implement.
We are a spinout of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen’s artificial intelligence research institute (AI2) and we’re backed by the same venture capital firm that helped launch Amazon (Madrona Venture Group). We’re also backed by one of the best law firms, Wilson Sonsini. With a top notch and experienced team from Microsoft, Facebook, Google, AI2, and Amazon, we built a company that CB Insights ranked the #1 most promising artificial intelligence legal tech startup in the world two years in a row (2020, 2021). Most importantly, fantastic brands trust Lexion to manage contracts: Outreach, OfferUp, Brooks Running, Blue Nile, and many more.']

column7:
['Egnyte’s secure content collaboration and governance platform serves over 2,000 financial services companies across all sub-industries, including such market leaders as NASDAQ, NFP and Lincoln Financial. Banks, exchanges, broker-dealers, PE firms, VC firms and wealth management companies everywhere rely on us to manage regulated data, collaborate internally and externally, and to protect their data. For Egnyte, the financial services industry is an area of intense focus given the criticality of compliance and security.', 'We are now starting a dedicated team of professionals to build on our success and scale growth in the Financial Services industry. The Senior Business Development Manager - Fintech will be a key player in driving the growth effort. As a founding member of the Financial Services team, you will help define, build, and execute our strategy to expand Egnyte’s customer base in Financial Services and greatly grow our business in the industry.

What You’ll Do (but is not limited to)', 'Help develop and drive Egnyte’s financial services strategy definition and execution
Work cross-functionally with all parts of Egnyte’s Financial Services organization to drive initiatives and grow the business
Capture the voice of the customer and collaborate with Egnyte’s marketing team to highlight winning use cases. Collaborate with Egnyte’s Product team on new product features and directions.
Leverage an in depth understanding of industry workflows, complementary software solutions and trends to improve Egnyte’s position and market offering
Support key sales cycles as a subject matter expert', '', 'Your Qualifications', 'Go to market expertise: 5+ years participating in sales, strategy or marketing within organizations in the financial services industry or in consulting roles serving the industry.
Domain expertise: meaningful experience working with or for SaaS vendors serving the financial services industry.
Intrapreneurial: Have a desire to build new initiatives inside a larger, high-growth organization
Entrepreneurial: Highly productive self-starter with the passion and motivation to grow the financial services business
Problem solver: Can identify and solve difficult problems creatively
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Analytical: Can analyze large volumes of data to extract and refine the underlying trends and to use such knowledge to drive strategy decisions within the organization
Collaboration: Team player effective at working with a wide range of both internal and external stakeholders, vendors, and functional experts, including sales, marketing, product, and operations
Influence: Ability to build trusted advisor partner relationships through effective consultation, strategic input, advice, domain expertise, and best practices
MBA a strong advantage', 'Our Benefits', 'Competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits & pre–IPO stock options
Flexible hours, generous time off (RTO, Responsible Time Off) to help support your work-life balance
Full offering of paid holidays and sick time
Paid family leave to help you grow your family (12 weeks for birth parent, 10 weeks for non-birth parent, 10 weeks for adoption)
Gym, cell phone, internet and commute reimbursement
401(k) Retirement Plan (Traditional and Roth)
Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Wellbeing programs to help you feel healthy and balanced including memberships to Aaptive, Ginger, Headspace and more
Perks including discounted pet insurance, electronics, theme park tickets, travel, and more
SoFi online financial services: student loan refinancing, personal loans, and investing
Free personal Egnyte account for life', 'Equal Opportunity Employment', 'At Egnyte, we celebrate our differences and thrive on our diversity for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers, our investors, and our communities. Employment at Egnyte is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition, or any other basis protected by law.']

column7: ["At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.", '', 'Job Description', 'Title: Senior Operations Manager (Process Improvement)', 'Reporting To: Associate Director, Onboarding', '', 'The Company:', 'talech is an innovator in the POS space for small and medium businesses (SMB). The Palo Alto-based software company helps SMB, predominantly in the Retail, Restaurants and Services verticals simplify operations and make better decisions through an integrated point-of-sale system. In late 2019 it was acquired by US Bank and is now a division of the company. Within US Bank, talech is tasked with leading the charge on the digital transformation required to enable the development and execution of a comprehensive digital experience for SMBs where the interface to the customers is the talech POS and from it a comprehensive set of additional solutions (software and banking alike!) are enabled to the customers. Ultimately, we aim to empower business owners with the tools and insights needed to grow their business and achieve their goals.', '', 'The Customer Success Function:']

column7:
['As a Senior Program Manager for Business Operations, you have a demonstrated track record of excellence managing sophisticated cross-functional workstreams and leading transformational programs focused on enabling action, accountability, and efficient execution. You will be a trusted business partner to R&D teams, and lead the implementation strategic initiatives. This role has a highly cross-functional vantage point and voice and plays a critical role in delivering on organization’s strategy! This role reports to the Head of the Program Management Office within R&D organization.', '', "This position requires a well-rounded individual who won't miss details, while guiding multiple teams. Someone who thrives in an unstructured, collaborative environment and can distill complex problems into actionable work and help to drive the teams to completion. If you thrive working in an environment where diversity is embraced, and change is inevitable, while getting the opportunity to work on Products that positively impact people's lives - what are you waiting for? Apply today and join our dynamic PMO team!", '', "What You'll Be Doing", "You'll act as a liaison between product, engineering and R&D stakeholders such as sales, ops, and marketing.
You will successfully run one or more strategic programs with minimal oversight, consistently delivering on time and quality.
You'll draft and socialize communication plans to support communication needs for your assigned initiative to ensure clear lines of communication are maintained and program delivery is smooth and effective.
You are experienced and comfortable conversing with senior leadership, including ELT as needed.
You'll track and report KPI's on project/sprint progress and track and drive the resolution of issues.
To meet desired milestones, you'll provide schedules and track projects, releases, upgrades, and maintenance.
Often acts as a facilitator or a leader. Possesses the ability to seek out, recommend, and implement continuous service improvements
You'll work in an open and collaborative environment with your peers to oversee related or dependent release activities and deliverables to align with R&D guidelines.
Lastly, you'll make sure that your team has the resources and support needed to be successful!", '', 'Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified', "5+ years experience in software, project management or closely related roles. Working with internal teams, implementing large scale programs (multi-location settings a plus)
You have experience with enterprise software and; have a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle.
A proven history of running multiple concurrent software projects involving cross-functional groups and/or release management.
You have strong skills in documentation, Agile management, and Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket).
You're great at decision-making, consensus building and conflict management. You're a natural problem-solver.
You are a master communicator and a strategic thinker - you're able to communicate and act upon risks appropriately and effectively.
You possess strong technical acumen, with fundamental knowledge of key SaaS platforms and delivery models. This knowledge doesn’t need to be practical, but at a level of understanding needed to lead development or release tasks, and identify and resolve issues in projects as they arise.", '']

['Your work days are brighter here.', '', "At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.", '', 'About the Team', '', '', '', '', '']

column7:
['As a VP, Strategic Accounts, you will be responsible for the strategic engagement focused on our top 20 pharmaceutical clients. You’ll be reporting directly to our Chief Commercial Officer and will have responsibility for developing and executing a strategic plan to sell HealthVerity’s capabilities within R&D, RWE and commercial audiences. You will oversee the entire sales process from prospecting, generating qualified opportunities, winning new business to managing relationships with key customers. With your healthcare data and analytics background, you will deliver the most innovative data and technology solutions to answer key executive stakeholders’ most pressing business and research questions.', '', 'What you will do', 'Develop a strategy and account plan to position HealthVerity as a preferred technology and data provider in R&D, RWE and commercial audiences within assigned accounts
Develop and close large multi-million strategic deals within assigned accounts
Drive all stages of opportunity development from coordinating product proposals, RFIs, RFPs to contract negotiations and execution
Creatively connect customer’s business needs to HealthVerity’s solutions and create solutions that solve the clients business needs
Effectively and credibly present healthcare data and licensing solutions by delivering product presentations, demonstrations, conference calls, technical discussions/due diligence, executive discussions, web seminars and related activities
Work closely and cross-functionally with Pre-Sales, Product Development, Marketing, Strategy & Innovation teams to develop solutions that solve for client business needs', '', 'About You', 'You have 5+ years of extensive experience selling healthcare data research assets (medical claims, prescription claims, EMR, etc.), related analytic applications (e.g. commercial analytics, real-world evidence/HEOR, Clinical operations and trials) and SaaS based technology solutions
You are a seasoned consultative seller successful at uncovering and developing sales opportunities within commercial, RWE and R&D of with top 20 Pharmaceutical Manufacturers
You are passionate about solving your client’s most pressing business questions with data or technology
You have the ability to operate effectively in a complex white-space, concept-oriented environmentYou have engaged senior audiences and sold large strategic engagements
You are an overachiever with a consistent track record of annual sales quota/revenue achievement
You excel in the ability to manage the client relationship from lead through implementation
You desire to work in an innovative, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial environment', '', 'Desired Skills and Experience', 'Familiar with the R&D, RWE, and commercial pharmaceutical SaaS environment and a working understanding of how and why different types of healthcare data are created to support pharmaceutical clients through the product lifecycle from Clinical trials through Commercialization
Ability to translate software, technology, and data into a resonating value proposition from c-suite to end users at all levels across the enterprise
Willingness to travel up to 40%']

column7:
['DESCRIPTION', '', 'SENIOR CONSULTANT SFM
We are looking for an SFM (Service Fulfillment Management) Consultant to join Syncron’s US Expert Services and broader Customer Excellence team. As a consultant, you will advise our customers on their agenda to transform their service and after-sales business into a competitive differentiator. Relying on the Syncron service platform that offers domain-fit solutions for
inventory optimization,
pricing strategy and
service lifecycle management (e.g., warranty management, field service management, service parts (master data/order/RMA/catalogue) management, knowledge management)
you will help define, configure, test, and deploy game changing business solutions in state-of-the-art architectures. Our international customers are leading companies from the construction equipment, automotive, agriculture, aviation industry, and other related fields.
During the ramp up period you will get familiar with Syncron’s products and processes by utilizing our eLearning platform and participating in actual customer projects. Your personal mentor and the members of your international project team will support you to quickly learn what you need. As you grow you will be given more senior responsibilities. Our career framework offers guidance, whereas you have strong impact on proactively designing your personal development.
WHAT YOU WOULD DO
You are in the first line to ensure Syncron customers realize the most value from our solutions, by
Designing business processes based on Syncron’s standard software solutions
Gathering, analyzing, and documenting customer requirements
Setting up Syncron’s solutions to enable customer value
Modeling and fine-tuning business parameters to optimize solution fit
Validating configuration and enabling users to realize customer value
Identifying needs and additional services to optimize customer value
Developing and maintaining relationships with customers, stakeholders, and other team members to ensure effective communication and collaboration
Leading customer stakeholders through the implementation project
Collaborating with Syncron Customer Success Managers to drive customer satisfaction
Collaborating with Product Management department to improve Syncron solutions
WHO YOU ARE
You are an awesome colleague who always sees the possibilities and accepts challenges to grow your horizon. You
have completed university with a qualified degree, preferably in Industrial Management, Economics, Engineering or Business Operations
worked a minimum of 4 years in an after-sales service lifecycle environment
are interested in leveraging Information Technology to achieve business objectives
take accountability for your customer’s needs and aim to deliver best results for your clients
can understand and document customer requirements
explain complex processes to be easily understood
enjoy presenting to a group and lead through a workshop to achieve set objectives
have a structured work approach and stick to your goals
professionally communicate in person and in writing
are happy to travel up to 50% to spend time directly with your clients, and to spend a couple of days in the office weekly.
THE ICING ON THE CAKE
You can bring your application to the top of our list, by having
Experience building business solutions based on standard software
Experience working with SaaS solutions
Strong experience in after-sales domain
Experience working effectively across time zones in a global environment.
WHO YOU JOIN
As a member of Syncron, you’ll be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace, where we want you to be yourself. Our truly global team is committed to supporting one another from locations all over the globe; be it Tokyo, Hyderabad and Bangalore, Chicago, Tampa and Atlanta, or Stockholm, Munich, and Warsaw. Along with continuous learning, you’ll have the chance to work and interact with innovative people from different cultures. We gain passion from our team spirit whether it’s during a typical Swedish Fika (a fun tradition we took over from our headquarters), virtual coffee breaks, vivid workshop discussions and impulses, or our epic events (that will hopefully also be back in physical shape soon). This is how we stay innovative!

To support our societies on their way to a sustainable future, at Syncron we are creating a new world for manufacturers by helping them leverage state of the art technology towards extended product lifespan and repairability in a future of Product as a Service. From industry leading investments in research and development, to providing the fastest time-to-value, Syncron’s award-winning, cloud-based service parts inventory, price and uptime management solutions are designed to continually exceed customer expectations. Top brands from around the world trust Syncron to transform their after-sales service operations into competitive differentiators. For more information, visit syncron.com.

#LI-SYNCRON #LI-HYBRID #LI-REMOTE #BI-SYNCRON #BI-REMOTE #BI-HYBRID', '', '', 'As data controller of your personal data, we are required to provide you with several information to foster your data privacy rights. Please read them here.']

column1: Senior Director Finance - Sales and Strategy
column7:
['Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva’s software helps our customers bring medicines and therapies to patients faster.', '', 'We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation. As a PBC, we are committed to making the industries we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.', '', 'Veeva is a Work Anywhere company which means that you can choose to work in the environment that works best for you – on any given day. Whether you choose to work remotely from home or work in an office – it’s up to you.', '', 'The Role', '', 'The Senior Director of Finance for Sales and Strategy will have the opportunity to lead our FP&A business partnership with our Global Sales and Strategy teams. This role will be responsible for leading and scaling the people, processes, and systems that grow the insights and support that finance provides to our Sales and Strategy teams.', 'What You’ll Do
Be the strategic finance business partner and provide thought leadership to our Sales and Strategy teams
Be the Finance lead in the ACV, ARR, and other key top-line metrics planning and forecasting for the company in connection with the annual planning and quarterly forecasting processes, including related modeling and sensitivity analysis
Gain expert knowledge of the sales pipeline and guide forward strategy, decision-making, and external investor guidance ranges in line with the go-to-market strategy
Drive standard and ad hoc analysis critical to maximizing the effectiveness of the Sales and Strategy organizations in the near, medium, and long-term
Be the thought partner to Sales Leadership to ensure commission plan design drives desired outcomes, and ensure the commissions can be properly forecasted and calculated
Drive scalable and consistent processes to enable operational excellence in business planning, forecasting, reporting, and deep insights/analytics for Sales and Strategy
Manage operating expenses of Sales and Strategy organizations
Build, develop, and manage a team of 4 financial analysts
Requirements
10+ years experience in an FP&A role, preferably sales finance
Bachelor’s degree in business or finance-related majors
Strong analytical skills combined with the ability to communicate clearly and succinctly in presentations to multiple levels in an organization
Strong project management & organizational skills
SaaS industry experience is highly desired
Nice to Have
Adaptive, NetSuite, Salesforce.com, other financial planning, and reporting/BI systems experience']

column1: Senior Product Owner, Product Line Solutions
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) 4% Match', '401(k) matching', 'AD&D insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Employee assistance program']
column7:
['This is a US Remote Opportunity', '', 'Cradlepoint was born in Boise and built for wireless. We are a team of authentic, hard-working, and innovative people driven by a shared vision to Connect Beyond the limits of wired networks. We help customers — big and small, across industries and around the world — utilize LTE and 5G cellular technology to connect people, places, and things, anywhere. We’re at the forefront of the Wireless WAN and 5G — the next big waves in networking — and we remain as hungry and humble as the day we started. If you’re hungry to be part of something big, come join us.', 'How Will You Contribute to the Company?', '', 'Cradlepoint is actively seeking a qualified individual to join the Product Line Solutions team as a Product Owner. As a NetCloud Product Owner, you will play a critical role in working cross-functionally to develop products and solutions valued by our customers and differentiates Cradlepoint from the competition. Using an Agile-Scrum development model, you will be working with R&D, IS, Operations, Sales, and Marketing daily to quickly define, build, test, and iterate on external features as well as internal automation and tools to improve efficiency and scale. This position can be located at our headquarters in Boise, Idaho, Cradlepoint’s Silicon Valley office, or a remote location.', '', 'What Will You Do?', 'Understand the problem to be solved and create a vision of how that problem could be solved—not the technical solution, but the true need to Introduce cutting-edge features and solutions
Equally value input from all cross-functional team members as well as that of the stakeholder to ensure the best solution is put forward
Participate in all Agile ceremonies and the phases of development are second nature
Share and communicate feedback effectively
Understand how to be agile and realize the fact that requirements will change with time, and how to adapt to the changes without breaking the cadence of the team
Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories and epics to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with the Product organization’s strategy
Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories
Bring evidence-based decision-making to your communication
Be a ruthless prioritizer while balancing the needs of the business and stakeholders
Be able to say “no,” and explain why in terms that stakeholders understand based on analysis, data, and business objectives
Be transparent about your prioritization, design, and roadmap process', 'Minimum Qualifications:']

['About Venminder', '', "Venminder offers a world-class SaaS platform that guides and streamlines third-party risk management. Venminder’s platform helps users collaborate on all thing's vendor-related and guides through critical processes such as oversight management, contract management, risk assessments, due diligence requirements, questionnaires, SLA management, vendor onboarding, and more.

About the opportunity

Sales Development Representatives (SDR) at Venminder will use new ‘Sales 2.0’ prospecting techniques to develop qualified leads for the business. To develop the lead, you will need to do research, reach out to prospects, and have consultative discussions to create qualified sales opportunities for the closing team.
The SDR will generate new business opportunities by following proven processes to prospect into business accounts. You will learn how to identify and research lists of companies to target, and how to develop email and telephone campaigns to generate new business opportunities.

The SDR will conduct initial, high-level conversations with senior executives about their business, their vendor management issues and their operations. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical, tenacious, and can effectively interact with a team. The compensation package includes a commission structure.

Compensation: 50k base with the potential to earn up to 100k with OTE

What you’ll do :


Learn and execute proven processes to generate new sales opportunities
Strategize with top-producing sales managers on specific vertical industry expertise
Develop and execute outbound prospecting campaigns through email and outbound phone calls
Engage executives in target prospect accounts to understand business operations and vendor management issues
Orchestrate discussions with senior executives on business need and escalate to assigned Account Executive for closing
Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects
Leverage CRM tools to prospect into targeted vertical accounts

What you’ll bring :


Bachelor’s degree (preferred but not required)
1+ years of business development experience
Enterprise SDR experience prospecting into Tier 1 companies
Proven record of sales development and revenue assignment success
Experience with lead qualification at all levels within organizations – managers, directors, VPs, executive
A commanding desire to learn and succeed in consultative selling
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a proven ability to influence others
Desire to work in a competitive and fast-paced environment
Preferred experience selling in software/SaaS Solutions or other related tech spaces
Experience with Salesforce, Salesloft, ZoomInfo, and LinkedIn for prospecting & social selling
Drive sales through data and uses analytics to achieve high performance
Understanding of complex enterprise sales cycle

Our Benefits:

Competitive Salary
Quarterly Mental Health Days
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Paid Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability
Competitive Health, Dental, Vision etc.
401K Match
And much more!", '', 'We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusivity within our organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Venminder encourages everyone to apply for our available positions, even if they don’t necessarily check every box on the job description.']

column7:
["About Tekmetric
Tekmetric is a cloud-based auto-repair shop management system with an easy-to-use workflow and a modern approach to customer care. Tekmetric champions transparency, integrity, innovation—and above all—a service-mentality that puts customers first.
Founded in Houston, Texas in 2015, Tekmetric has been providing reliable, fast customer service to shops from day one. Our team is growing quickly, but our service philosophy of listening to customers still remains a core value.
We're looking for hungry candidates to help us strengthen our industry-leading team. We're building our software to be more intuitive. We're building more integrations that make our customers' lives easier. We're building better internal processes to make our globally distributed organization run more smoothly. We're building stronger relationships with the best and brightest partners in our industry.
Our customers love our products. We love serving them. And we love the journey we're on together.
Come build with us!", "What You'll Do", 'Our Inside Sale Representative will partner with our BD and Marketing teams to implement sales and pipeline-building strategies. This role plays an integral part in driving the growth of our customer base and revenue through handling already qualified leads.

The Inside Sale Representative is responsible for the intake and maintenance of inbound leads via phone, email, and online chat to schedule appointments for the Account Executive team. During these interactions you gather and share relevant, high-level information that sets Tekmetric up for success.', 'You will be responsible for:', 'Serving as the liaison for potential customers as they interact with different sales roles on their buying journey (i.e. booking demos, demo reminders, follow-ups after demo, etc…)
Building out and refining information about leads in a CRM, to assist in lead qualification
Providing useful details to the sales team so they can deliver a tailored demo experience.
Collaborating and keeping active lines of communication with other sales team roles that play a part in the customer journey.
Ensuring all potential customers receive exceptional service from start to finish', "This is an exciting entry level and rewarding role for anyone that wants to develop or even kick-start their career in sales! There are many opportunities for career development and progression – with successful Inside Sale Representative's becoming outbound SDRs, Senior SDRs, and ultimately Account Executives.", '', '', "What You'll Bring", 'No prior sales experience required, though sales and/or SaaS experience a plus
Experience with following defined processes using CRM (HubSpot, a plus)
Innate interest in startups, sales, and technology, with a strong desire to be a top performer
Strong interpersonal skills and friendly professional demeanor on the phone
Strong organizational and time management skills
An honest and genuine approach to helping potential customers
Strong desire to grow personally and professionally in Sales
Strong communication skills.']
