column7:
['Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.', 'When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.', 'Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.', 'As a Product Strategy Manager, you will have a leading role in setting our strategy in terms of product positioning and go-to-market model for the US market. You will be part of defining the overall product and commercial positioning, drive market research, become a domain expert for a select vertical in open banking products, and support in key commercial customer discussions. In this role, you will work with a select number of product areas and act as the area expert to set the product and commercial roadmap.', 'As Product Strategy Manager, you will work closely with our Product, Sales and Marketing teams as well as Visa’s commercial teams to ensure successful collaborations that lead to a market leading offering. To be successful in this role you will need to successfully handle stakeholder management on different levels across the organization, in a global environment. You will have an integral role in establishing Tink as a future leader in the fintech industry on the US market, while leveraging on what has already been built in Europe.', 'Responsibilities', 'Become a domain expert in your area that can help and guide our product and commercial organization in decisions around product roadmap development and go-to-market models
Drive key strategic initiatives to identify new growth opportunities with the highest product-market fit, including leading market key research efforts
Support key discussions with key strategic customers as an expert to help our sales team navigate new opportunities
Support product teams in their roadmap prioritization to ensure it is aligned with our overall commercial agenda', 'Basic Qualifications', '5 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 4 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA)
Experience from strategy / business development at a high growth tech company (e.g. SaaS or Fintech) or management consulting firm
Strong business acumen, strategic thinker, and a customer-centric mindset. You are naturally curious and with a willingness to become and expert in your domain
Data-driven and result-oriented with an ability to break down complex problems to drive towards clear actions
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with senior internal and external stakeholders with strong communication skills
An entrepreneurial mindset and willing to play a key role in scaling our operations in the US', 'Preferred Qualifications']

['Remote', "Your Opportunity
As the Sale Operations Director at Solutions By Text, you will manage the overall strategy for Salesforce use by the CRO and CMO teams. You will partner with others on the CRO team as well as the users across the organization. You will work closely with our Salesforce administration and technology team responsible for the development and maintenance of all functions of Salesforce and integrated solutions.
This is a key role, which will lay the foundation for SBT’s Pay by Text market business for years to come. As a successful candidate, you will have experience in establishing and driving software/technology/ISV projects and people related to strategic revenue growth. This is an operational process management role, reporting to the Senior Sales Director. You will also work closely with SBT’s sales, product, finance, marketing, operations, and support teams in USA and India.

This role is visionary in nature, which requires deep knowledge and experience in building and growing technology, software, and ISV relationships, driving joint sales and marketing success and negotiating key commercial agreements. The successful candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and entrepreneurship is necessary. An understanding of the economics of the payments space and the bill payments ecosystem would be a bonus. Solutions by Text (SBT) has changed the way compliant businesses communicate and transact with their customers via mobile devices. Since adding its first client, SBT has quickly become the leading text provider to consumer finance companies and various other regulated industries. Recognized as an Inc 5000 fastest growing companies, SBT continues to grow and expand through the addition of great employees who desire a growth culture.

Responsibilities
Serve as key support for Sales Leaders from forecasting and operational perspective
Collaborate with members of management to define, document, and implement new processes
Create reports and dashboards in Salesforce
Assist in monitoring data quality, integrity, and hygiene
Analyze data to identify best practices
Works closely with the Executive leadership and deliver business recommendations based on analytics
Support forecasting & pipeline management
Assist sales personnel with pricing and quote generation
Interface between sales and finance to ensure that the SFDC data is available to support commission calculation and payment
Work closely with sales, client success and channel partner leaders, marketing, support, and product organizations to rally around new partnership opportunities and existing partner growth
Collaborate closely with sales leadership to inspect sales process quality and prioritize opportunities for improvement leading by example of select partnerships.
Work with engineering and product to develop roadmaps for Salesforce with key technology players internally and third-party partners
Work across teams at SBT’s to develop strategic and technology value propositions and realizations, including SDR sales playbooks and revenue tracking
Report out on a regular weekly, monthly, and quarterly cadence to all key stakeholders, with a strong analytical approach and crisp communication style
Manage sales force automation including assessment, implementation, and integration of third-party vendor tools as required
Oversee a reboot or replacement of the SFDC Organization instance

Qualifications/Skills/Experience
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of relevant work experience
Master’s degree a plus
5+ years of managerial experience
Experience managing employees and contractors in other geographies (India a plus)
Previous experience working within a SaaS Technology provider
Extensive experience working with SFDC
Analytical, able to interpret data and present trends/observations
Ability to work under pressure and fast-paced working environment
Ability to work proactively and independently to interact with stakeholders, understand needs, and present findings, and documents with clarity verbally and written
Experience documenting specifications, such as source to target mappings, and business rule and data validation requirements
Self-driven team player with ability to learn quickly, and apply new tools and techniques
Strong computer knowledge and skill of Microsoft 365 apps: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, Power BI…Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to communicate with both internal stakeholders

Location
S. – Corporate Offices based in Dallas, TX
Flexible/Remote working available

Personal Characteristics
Energetic, assertive, tenacious with great attention to detail and a strong sense of grit and
Team player highly adept at building strong relationships internally and developing staff to do the same; possesses a willingness to receive and provide coaching for continuous personal Shows the highest level of integrity, intent, ability, and results in all endeavors, building trust with all stakeholders
General Duties and Responsibilities
Adhere to the Company's Code of Conduct/Ethics
Create and maintain effective working relationships with other Company employees
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Project a professional and appropriate Company image in all dealings with clients, vendors, business partners, and
Ensure security of information in all matters about the company, client, and consumer information
Support the efforts of senior management and sales staff by maintaining a business network of contacts as clients change roles and companies.

About Solutions by Text
Solutions by Text (SBT) was founded in 2008 with the mission to deliver impactful conversational messaging and convenient payment partner solutions that are rich, real-time and compliant. Built on SMS industry best practices, the company is the only compliance-first provider of enterprise texting solutions in the market. More than 1400 consumer finance organizations, including leading brands in auto finance, banking and lending, trust SBT to ensure convenient, effective and compliant relationships with their millions of consumers. SBT is headquartered in Dallas, TX with remote teams and offices around the US and in Bangalore, India. For more information, visit ttps://solutionsbytext.com/.

Game-changing Technology Built for Growth
Solutions By Text (SBT) has changed the way compliant businesses communicate and transact with their customers via mobile devices. Since adding its first client, SBT has quickly become the leading text provider to consumer finance companies and various other regulated industries. Recognized as an Inc 5000 fastest growing companies, SBT continues to grow and expand through the addition of great employees who desire a growth culture.

Solutions By Text is committed to promoting the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it is through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances."]

['We’re looking for a Sr. Sales Engineer that will help us build our sales engineering team, design and assist our sales team to deliver our new FinTech system with best-in-class tools. Lead the technical sales effort at Peach by engaging with our customers, understanding their needs, and architecting a solution that will fit their needs.

Join a small team of experts and make a huge impact on the rapidly growing industry.', 'Responsibilities
Build our sales engineering team.
Assist sales teams in technical overviews of Peach solutions.
Work closely with Account Executives as a crucial member of the sales team on deal strategy and tactics.
Be the product expert within the sales team understanding the features and functions of Peach products.
Listen to product and technical challenges presented by prospects and determine how Peach can address them.
Communicate and listen to clients to understand their pain points and prescribe solutions.
Coordinate product and technical questions and issues with internal stakeholders.
Be the “voice of the customer” for the product and development teams.', 'Requirements
5+ years solution engineering or product experience at an enterprise SaaS company
Adept at demonstrating and explaining complex enterprise solutions.
Working with FinTech lenders or banking infrastructure Collaborative with sales, product, and leadership teams.
Team player and ability to juggle multiple responsibilities.
Ability to understand technical API-driven solutions.
Start up experience is a plus
Product Management experience is a plus', '', 'Benefits/Perks
Work in the East-Bay or remote!
Be part of the first professionals in a rapidly-growing team.
Shape the overall product and culture.
Full benefits, including healthcare, parking and/or commuter benefit, gym membership, and more.
Small & friendly work environment.']

column7:
['Remote, United States', "Hi, I'm Shilpa M your Recruiter. At CSG, we choose to see beyond a resume paper. We put your story, perspective, background, and what you have to offer first. While the traditional approach works for some, many miss out on fantastic talent like yourself, and we refuse to make that mistake. Instead, we believe that by channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary.", 'Channel the power of YOU as the next Full-time Senior Counsel at CSG.', 'Who will love this job', "A hybrid – you excel when you can choose your work style - remote, in-office, or a combination of both
A strategist – you have a consulting mindset that allows others to contribute and work toward a shared vision
A collaborator – you love to work on projects that have functional workflows
A producer – you're comfortable quickly switching context and adapting
An empath – you know how to connect and communicate with different audiences worldwide", "What you'll do", "You will report to VP & Associate General Counsel to help provide legal support to CSG's Payments business team (CSG Forte Payments)
You will structure, draft and negotiate commercial agreements, including SAAS Agreements, sales partner agreements and vendor agreements for the Payments business
You will support AGC in providing general legal advice to CSG internal clients on a variety of regulatory and client-support matters
You will collaborate with other team members and outside counsel to support regulatory compliance, litigation, privacy, and other payments business matters
You may travel up to 10%", 'You should have', "Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting fewer requirements. Channel the power of YOU and apply to discover if we're a match.", 'Juris Doctor degree in law and licensed to practice in the United States
Proficiency in English in a business environment
5+ years of relevant legal experience at a law firm, in-house legal department, or government agency with a primary focus on US payments and financial services contracts or SAAS contracts
Experience advising business clients on regulatory issues related to the payments industry']

column7:
["Bloomreach is the world's #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including:
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising
Content, offering a headless CMS
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions
Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI-optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com.", '', "We are seeking a motivated Senior Account Manager who loves driving revenue growth and successful outcomes for some of the world's leading companies including but not limited to Staples, Puma, Neiman Marcus, Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, REI, Sabra (part of Pepsi Co) and Capital One.", "In this role, you'll be helping customers optimize their investment in Bloomreach's market-leading, algorithm-driven approach to creating a truly connected customer experience. You are passionate about growing your book of business with successful customer renewals, upsells and cross-sells. You are a resource quarterback, partnering with internal teams (Product, Marketing, Engineering, Services) to drive meaningful results for your customers. Come join us and be part of the evolution of the digital customer experience!", 'Your job will be to:', 'Act as the "CEO" of your customer book of business, responsible for driving Bloomreach revenue growth with successful renewals, upsells and services growth
Identifying and executing on expansion opportunities within your portfolio of clients that are a part of a large corporate group or government.
Use your digital technology experience to understand and discuss complex products and identify ways to optimize product performance
Leverage your business acumen to analyze key account metrics, develop strong customer relationships (IT, Marketing), understand customer goals, and identify opportunities for growth
Drive customer success, incremental sales, and secure renewals by partnering with Technical Services, Business Services, Support to drive successful customer outcomes
Operate with a sense of urgency with an outcome + results-oriented approach to customer success', 'Your success story will be:', "In 30 days, you will be familiar with the Bloomreach Content product, the team and our internal processes for Account Management. You will have met the internal team and joined them for client calls.
In 90 days, you will be comfortable with the exact expectations from you in your role, know what resources you have at your disposal to make you successful and have understood your future portfolio, goals and targets.
In 180 days, you will have taken over your own portfolio, running your client QBRs, regular meetings etc. You will have a plan of how you achieve your targets and contribute to the team's success.", 'Professional experience', '8+ years of experience in Account Management, Customer Success, Sales or Consulting, leading large enterprise customers. Focus on platforms providing business value such as commerce, CRM, ERP, HCM, are a plus. Commerce or Digital Experience backgrounds strongly encouraged
Has a proven ability to drive enterprise sales software deals, exceeding targets in past and current position(s);
Strong understanding of account planning and leveraging an ecosystem, including partners, internal stakeholders, execs, and others to meet objectives
Highly collaborative leadership profile. Action and outcome oriented
Martech | Adtech | Search knowledge is a plus
Subject matter expert in understanding the complex needs of IT and Marketing buyers - and leveraging that knowledge to build strong business relationships with executives. Must have executive presence and understand how to communicate with and deliver wins for executives
Outstanding ability to use your written and communication skills to demonstrate SaaS investment value/ROI
Sales is an important component of this role. Must be a professional enterprise seller with a proven history of hitting and exceeding quota. Knowledge and use of CRM and forecasting tools is required
Is a great team player who takes the lead in driving initiatives, working across teams (Product Management, Services, Inside Sales, Field Sales, Engineering, Marketing) and structuring approaches to sales opportunities']

['REMOTE (US) /
CUSTOMER TEAM – CUSTOMER OPERATIONS - MARKETX /
FULL-TIME
/ REMOTE', 'As a Customer Success Manager at FORM MarketX, you will advocate for, consult with, and empower our customers to make the most of the FORM MarketX platform. You’ll be involved with your customers' onboarding experience from kick-off to go-live, provide training and support to new client-users, and encourage adoption and engagement throughout the customer lifecycle. You’ll get your hands dirty, diving into your customers' data and business rules, and emerging with actionable recommendations on FORM MarketX best practices, configuration, and data integrity. And most importantly, you’ll build authentic and trusting relationships with key stakeholders in your portfolio, reinforcing the value of our partnership today and in the years to come.
What We'll Achieve
We’ll empower our customers to own and expand their use of FORM MarketX.
We’ll provide thoughtful FORM MarketX solutions and recommendations to help resolve new and existing customer pain points.
We’ll provide customer training on the FORM MarketX platform and consultation to help the customer maximize their use of the solution and minimize platform pain points/short comings.
We’ll provide managed services to the customers either directly or via the CS Operations team to augment the customer’s role in administration and management of their platform solution.
We’ll consistently communicate our value and demonstrate FORM MarketX’s ROI for our customers throughout their lifecycle.
We’ll have more than enough thrown at you from customers, but your ability to prioritize and deliver on the highest value items is what will distinguish your performance.
Through Executive Business Reviews, Strategic Planning sessions, and day to day communication, we’ll reinforce the value our customers receive from FORM MarketX.
We’ll retain and grow our portfolio organically; thanks to the solid foundation you’ve established for your accounts.
Who You Are
You have 2-3 years’ experience managing B2B SaaS customers. Bonus points for managing a customer revenue portfolio of $2M or more.
You are comfortable working directly with executives and senior-level management.
You’ve managed simultaneous projects in a customer-facing role where you were directly accountable for delivering data-driven results.
You love data and may have been a data analyst in a past life. You can explain relational database concepts, have advanced Excel skills and have even written a SQL query or two over the years.
Your written communication is exceptional: concise, persuasive, and empathetic.
Your verbal communication is exceptional: clear, on-point and confident.
You have a proven track record of building successful relationships with customers, and one or two them would even be willing to serve as a reference.
You have a history of retaining and growing you customer portfolio.
Having too much work and not enough time doesn’t make you come unglued - You understand how to prioritize and focus on what is important.
You look forward to collaborating and building relationships with many other teams throughout the company.
You’re ahead of the game if you have experience working in retail and know terms such as end-cap, planogram, point-of-sale, display compliance, brand ambassadors, goal based attainment, etc. Bonus points for having experience within the beer/wine/spirits industry.
You have completed a bachelor’s degree. Bonus points for anything beyond that!
You appreciate and align with our company values.
Total Compensation
The annual compensation for this role is between $70,000-$80,000 based on experience, plus a bonus based on company and team performance objectives
100% employer-paid employee medical, dental, and vision
Company paid Life and Disability Insurance
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible vacation policy - take the time you need when you need it!
100% Remote Work Environment
Casual work environment
Promotions from within
Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that those in underrepresented groups, such as women and those in our BIPOC communities, tend to not apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement and qualification. At FORM, we are dedicated to building diverse, inclusive, and an authentic workplace- So, if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be the right candidate for this or other roles at FORM!

About FORM
FORM powers the world’s 2 billion mobile workers as they change companies and industries for good, with mobile technology that improves execution from the frontline. FORM activates and connects teams in the field – with leaders, missions, and each other – so they can deliver success in the enterprise. The FORM field execution platform serves as a digital assistant for frontline teams by guiding daily tasks, streamlining data collection, facilitating real-time communication, and providing leaders with real-time intelligence to drive faster actions and better decisions. FORM offers the world’s only integrated task management and image recognition platform and enables smart audits on more display types than any solution in the market, plus industry-leading field communications and photo reporting capabilities. FORM solutions have been deployed by Fortune 500 companies around the world.

OUR SOLUTIONS:

FORM OpX
FORM OpX empowers teams to improve operational compliance by digitizing audits and inspections to reduce risk and improve safety and quality from the frontline. FORM OpX mobile workflows make it easy to capture the right data, at the right place, at the right time – every time. Teams stay connected with instant frontline communications on mobile, and real-time insights allow leaders to spot and fix issues quickly and measure trends over time so teams can take action on the opportunities that move the business forward.

FORM MarketX
FORM MarketX unleashes the power of field teams to drive market execution with the only mobile solution that combines dynamic task management, industry-leading image recognition, photo reporting, field team communications, and advanced reporting – all within one easy-to-use platform. Guide teams, improve execution, and drive sales while creating a shared view of the field that helps leaders make better decisions, faster. Sell more with FORM MarketX, the field execution app that guides, tracks, and improves performance in real-time.

Who We Are
We are innovators: We’re here to free mobile workers from the mundane and open up new worlds of possibility and prosperity, powered by the people.
We are partners: We’re only as successful as our customers. We provide exceptional support, strategic partnership, and personalized account management to ensure they’re successful.
We are problem-solvers: We believe business will help solve the complex challenges facing our planet today. We build products centered on helping them succeed so they can do just that.
We are flexible: We believe in a "Work Your Way" Employment Policy. Employees who can effectively perform their job functions remotely may do so indefinitely.
Humble + hungry. We measure success by how we help customers win. And we've been in the game a long time (in software years). Every interaction gives us the chance to deliver better service and more value. Along the way we've picked up a few awards, and for that, we're thankful.

FORM offers competitive salaries and full benefits for full-time employees and is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer-welcoming all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.']

['Automox is seeking a seasoned product manager to help drive the Automox product strategy and execution.', '', "Successful candidates will collaborate with product management, engineering, marketing/sales, and customers to identify, build, and deliver the right themes and features for Automox's cyber hygiene solutions. You will own features from concept to delivery, seeking customer input as much as possible. Independence and a willingness to find the best solution for the problem or opportunity are core to this role.", '', 'Strong experience with the product development process, Saas fundamentals, UI/UX, and the software development lifecycle is required. Familiarity with enterprise software development and cybersecurity or a technical background are preferred. Successful candidates are team-oriented, work collaboratively inside and outside of the building, and bring a passionate and driven attitude to structured product development.', '', 'The ideal candidate may currently be a Product Owner or Product Manager.', '', 'THE FUN STUFF', 'Be a passionate advocate for customers
Own complex and innovative features from concept to release, setting specific requirements and direction
Apply Saas product principles to Automox’s core product, working to streamline conversions, user behaviors, and ease of use
Team up with the rest of product management to turn the roadmap into sprint plan, while surfacing areas to improve the product, process, and experience
Seek and integrate feedback from internal teams, including marketing, sales, and engineering
Work independently to prioritize features and improvements against the Automox roadmap and vision
Conduct empathy and feedback interviews with customers, prospects, and the wider community to glean insights and new feature ideas
Help Automox drive positive product experiences that deliver value quickly and delight customers
Own the feedback loop for your features, driving customer validation and fast iteration into requirements
Contribute actively to the global Automox product roadmap']

['Vibes, the technology leader powering the direct-to-consumer mobile engagement revolution, is helping brands like Ralph Lauren, Joann, Redbox, Chipotle, and LEGO to grow, activate, and optimize consumer relationships with timely, relevant, high volume mobile messaging at global scale. The company’s intelligent mobile messaging platform enables marketers, consumer loyalty professionals, and operations teams to connect with consumers using a unified native platform of SMS, MMS, dynamic wallet, mobile push notifications, app inbox and performance analytics. These tools become the backbone for brands’ overall digital engagement strategies. Vibes has been consistently recognized as a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms. To learn more about Vibes, visit www.vibes.com.', 'Mobile Marketing is at the forefront of a great Marketer’s toolkit, but so many don’t realize its potential or power. Working at Vibes places you at the intersection of essential technology for all Marketers and cutting-edge innovation. The mobile engagement space is dynamic. We have the chance to support the world’s best Marketers and guide their mobile strategies – we help chart the future of marketing and steward the industry towards customer-centric, delightful interactions. The industry is evolving rapidly, so you will need to bring your curiosity and passion for adapting!', 'We are looking for a senior Marketing leader to optimize and drive our next phase of revenue growth and market penetration. Our ideal candidate is a customer-centric, data-driven generalist who can create value across Demand Generation, Content Marketing and Product Marketing. This person is an inspiring storyteller who understands how to cultivate action and attention from customers, prospects, and employees. We desire a seasoned team-builder with a strategic and creative mindset, a passion for leadership, and strong focus on making our customers’ lives better. This marketer will demonstrate a committed passion for B2B Enterprise marketing, with significant understanding of the MarTech space.', 'At Vibes, we understand that growing our business takes a team-mindset. A strong candidate will have a track record of building strong relationships across functions, levels, and communities. This person will build trust – for themselves and our brand – and lead with authenticity, vulnerability, and integrity.', 'This position will report to the Chief Innovation Officer and work remotely based in the United States.', '', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Marketing Team Results & Leadership', 'Manage overall marketing operations including marketing budget, demand generation technology, reporting, and dashboards to demonstrate revenue impact and ROI
Build and develop a high-performing, collaborative team
Drive excellent execution across all facets of marketing – able and eager to jump in to execute, as well as lead strategically
Foster strong, collaborative relationship with Sales; establish mutual trust, effective communication, and consistent agreements between teams
Be a strategic partner with the executive team; share learning and marketing best practices, continually improve processes and content, and provide clear and consistent communication to broader stakeholders and the company
Inform the business by providing weekly analysis, reporting, and dashboarding of marketing performance and calendar
Serve as a collaborative, solution-oriented, supportive internal leader, ensuring positive, effective cross-functional teamwork']

['Our Purpose', '', 'We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a\nculture of inclusion\nfor all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.', '', 'Job Title', '', '', '', '', '']

column7:
['Vasion is driving the future of Digital Transformation with our business process automation cloud platform that empowers users to ensure compliance, create accountability, and eliminate costly IT infrastructure.

The ideal candidate is an expert in all things Salesforce, Marketo, and B2B marketing operations. This person, in collaboration with the marketing team, is responsible for understanding business requirements and delivering high-quality technical solutions that enable the marketing team to use the full functionality of our ever-growing tech stack.', '', 'What You’ll Do', 'Manage the day-to-day operations of our marketing tech stack, including Salesforce, Marketo, Drift, and LeanData. If something breaks, you are the person who we turn to.
Partner closely with sales and marketing leadership, revenue operations, and business analytics teams to continually improve lead scoring, lead flow process, and ensure optimal flow through the lead lifecycle.
Manage and monitor audience segments and make recommendations on areas for optimization and changes to strategy.
Identify and evaluate data sources required to expand our marketable database in our target segments.
Monitor email KPIs and make recommendations to improve delivery, opens, and engagements. Ensure strong domain and list health, and create monthly audits.
Collaborate with the marketing team to provide technical recommendations using the full features and functionality of Marketo.
Work from ideation and strategy phase through to execution of new automated prospect nurture programs, including driving strategies to increase email engagement, frequency, and velocity.
Oversee ongoing monitoring of prospect nurture programs to ensure they are working properly, and make recommendations for efficiencies.', '', '', 'Requirements', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
3+ years of experience with Salesforce, ideally holding a current Salesforce administrator certification.
3+ years of experience with Marketo, or similar marketing automation platform, ideally holding a current platform.
3+ years of experience with marketing campaigns, ideally in a B2B environment
3+ years of experience within a SaaS company.
Self-starter and able to work fully remotely, collaborating with team members globally.
Trustworthy and can be relied on to get the job done.
Experience in business analysis, operations, or B2B service is a plus.
Adept at debugging and solving problems.
Digitally savvy, with exceptional analytical, quantitative, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Strong ability to organize, analyze, interpret, and disseminate information.
Ability to work under pressure and change direction as needed.
Ability to make decisions, prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, and keep stakeholders informed on progress.', '', '']

column7:
['The Senior Corporate Accountant will be responsible for assisting with the day to day accounting operations including financial audits, month end close, technical accounting, general ledger, accounts payable and sales taxes. The skills required to succeed in this role include strong accounting and communication skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment.', 'You will
Responsible for Accounts Payable, including set up and maintenance of Purchase Orders and Invoicing
Manage payments through Bill.com and vendor sites
Setup of wires from bank
Own the sales tax process with external tax group
Set up and maintenance of tax calendar
Preparation of journal entries and reconciliations for various accounts - monthly, quarterly, annual
Own monthly accrual process
Maintain intercompany entries, including elimination and consolidation
Perform monthly and quarterly close activities
Ensure integrity of financial records and prepare for annual financial audits including preparation of various audit schedules
Responsible for maintaining internal controls and integrity of all balance sheet accounts
Play an active role in process improvement projects including implementation of enhancements to our ERP systems and processes
Participate in the ongoing development/establishment of Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) documents for accounting policies and regulations
Assist in the preparation of GAAP financial statements, including document preparation, data analysis, integrity validation and reconciliation processes
Support management in completing special projects, ad-hoc reporting and analysis requests, and other tasks as assigned', 'You are
A self starter
Someone who has ownership: ability to drive projects to completion when starting with unknowns, competing priorities and other challenges in a fast-growing environment
Analytical: High attention to detail, organized with exceptional time-management skills
Proactive and independent: must be eager to drive best practices, initiatives, and continuous process improvement while always curious and learning', 'You have
Senior level Accounting and Finance experience (Experience in a small SaaS company is a huge plus)
Start-up and real estate experience strongly preferred
Experience with relevant cloud-based software on small and medium enterprises (e.g., NetSuite, Bill.com, etc.)', '#LI-Remote

Benefits
Memorial Tree credit
Medical (subsidized), dental, vision, and 401(k)
Flexible PTO
Connectivity/mobile phone stipend
The hardware you will need to do your job
Employee Referral Program - $2,500 per referred hire!
Family assistance program
Paid Parental Leave
Cigna Member Assistance Program (MAP)

Fair Hiring Practices
At Better Place Forests, we value diversity and treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected status. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to recruiting@betterplaceforests.com. We will treat your request as confidential information. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.']

column1: Senior Product Designer, Consumer Post-Purchase (Remote - USA)
column6: ['Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Stock options', 'Unlimited paid time off']
column7:
['THE COMPANY
FEVO’s mission is to make shopping feel human in a virtual world. We do that by building innovative, intuitive checkout experiences that allow shoppers to interact with friends and followers throughout the purchase process. Our team is made up of innovators and self-starters who move fast, have fun and harbor a deep-seated hatred of the status quo. All in a day’s work.

FEVO is seeking a Senior Product Designer to lead our post-purchase consumer experiences, touching the millions of consumers that purchase tickets to live events on our platform! Post-purchase is the most critical factor in driving retention and instilling trust in our consumers that they will have a world class experience after they purchase tickets from us—before, during, and after they attend their live events. You will advocate for what best serves the consumer when it comes to CX around accessing orders, pre-event communication, secondary purchases, post-event follow-up and more!', 'WHO YOU ARE:
4+ years of experience in one or more of the following product spaces: ecommerce, payments, online checkout.
Strong career progression in product design and experience as a Senior Product Designer at modern tech, consumer or SMB-facing app, SaaS, and/or fintech companies.
Passion for solving product problems while balancing all facets of a user experience (strategy and research, information architecture, interaction design)
A deep understanding of the end-to-end iterative design process including how to develop and use design research, job stories, journey mapping, content modelling, wire-framing, prototyping, user testing, and high-fidelity visuals to achieve human-centered design solutions
Proficiency in interaction design for web and mobile applications
Experience collaborating closely with multiple disciplines including product and engineering
Proficiency with current industry design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Sketch, Github, etc.', 'WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Obsess over the consumer post-purchase experience: accessing tickets, entry into events, secondary sales, delight around accessing customer success paths, loyalty programs, and more. You’ll own projects from start to finish, while leading various UX initiatives including running design sprints to define and explore consumer problems and JTBD, content mapping, sketching, wireframing, low and high-fidelity prototyping, and leading stakeholder reviews
Partner with product and data team members to help your team develop empathy for our consumers and advocate for their needs.
Collaborate with different disciplines. You will work closely with engineers, product managers, researchers, and front-end developers to explore, build and ship your designs. You will help other disciplines understand the value design can bring to a project and ultimately build and ship the best products
Be a mentor to less-experienced designers and make your team stronger. You’ll provide feedback to your peers to help strengthen your team and Shopify as a whole. You will help your teammates build context, strong decision-making skills, and empathy for our consumers
Ship valuable and high-quality work without sacrificing speed
Collaborate with multiple teams. Designing for cross-product, cross-platform foundational features, you will be leveraging and incorporating the domain expertise of teams focused on specific consumer workflows', 'THE GOOD STUFF!
Competitive salary range of $180-200k
Unlimited PTO
Amazing holiday schedule
Stock option program
Generous benefits including full health and dental
Apple products such as Airpods and iPads
Stipend for going to live events
6 months parenthood leave
2 weeks paw-ternity leave for adopting a pet
Annual FevoFest conference usually in a tropical location
Too many other things to mention!', 'FEVO provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

To Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our company does not accept unsolicited CVs or applications from agencies. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs or applications and explicitly reserve its right to contact candidates presented in such unsolicited CV or application.']

["Our people love the exciting and meaningful work they do, the cutting-edge resources and technology they have access to, the benefits we offer and the great community we’ve built. Want to join them?
MAIN PURPOSE OF THE ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES IN THE BUSINESS:
Our vision is to create a world-class business development and marketing capability for Kainos, fueled by a diverse range of highly talented and motivated professionals working collaboratively and innovatively to ensure we continue our growth trajectory.

We do this via an open and supportive environment where colleagues can share information, learn from one another, and excel in their own career. With consistent ways of working aligned to industry best practice, we build sustainable and predictable sales pipelines for our market-leading offerings.

As a Senior Sales Development Representative (Senior Associate) at Kainos, you will initiate long-standing relationships with prospective customers and executive sponsors. You will employ effective selling strategies to successfully position the Kainos Smart suite of tools.

Your key responsibilities will include:
Driving prospecting and opportunity qualification activities – you will work independently to engage with prospects through multiple mediums such as outbound calling, email, and social media.
Educating customers on the Kainos Smart product – you will support in demonstrating and presenting the product to prospects. You will also explore the complex customer challenges and business pains to demonstrate the value of Kainos Smart solution.
Developing Kainos as a business – you will generate new leads and progress assigned leads with a view to these maturing into sales opportunities.
Being an external Kainos ambassador - you will be expected to competently describe Kainos and its offerings at a high level to prospects. You will formally present to prospects and customers in a manner that positions Kainos as a professional and market leading supplier.
Building trust with prospects – you will be expected to utilise a consultative selling approach based on taking the time to properly understand our customers and their challenges/opportunities. Empathy, active listening, being responsive and creativity all play a part here.
Delivering against our targets – you will deliver and exceed upon our quarterly opportunity and revenue team targets by producing a high-quality pipeline focused on net new business
Ensuring strategic alignment – you will work closely alongside our Marketing team and Territory Managers to create and execute demand generation for identified and prioritized strategic account lists within specific territories and sectors.

MINIMUM (ESSENTIAL) REQUIREMENTS:
Familiarity with consultative selling methodologies including the ability to understand the competitive landscape and customer needs to effectively position Kainos Smart
Ability to build early stage pipeline, develop prospect accounts, call into prospect accounts, and build trusting relationship
Provide support for marketing activities and events
Prior experience in inside sales or sales development
Solid commercial awareness and understanding of successful Business Development dynamics, with a keen interest in sales and a passion to learn about the market
Broad technology experience with an interest of technology trends and their potential impact on business, society, and people
Capable of prioritizing tasks while operating in a highly competitive environment and deliver to tight deadlines in accordance with business requirements
Ability to communicate and build strong and trusted relationships with a variety of stakeholders (both internally and externally)
A self-starter who is highly motivated, confident, focused, disciplined with a drive to succeed, whilst upholding Kainos values
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good presentation skills with the ability to create and deliver compelling presentations
Show resilience and persistence with the ability to learn from mistakes plus guidance and coaching from colleagues
A good team-worker who is results focused with a ‘can do’ attitude

DESIRABLE:
Experience in creating and executing demand generation campaigns using technology stacks such as DiscoverOrg, ZoomInfo, SalesLoft, Sales Navigator or equivalent
Ability to understand and effectively explain the benefits of a SaaS Automated Testing Product
WHO YOU ARE:
Our vision is to enable outstanding people to create digital solutions that have a positive impact on people’s lives. Our values aren't abstract; they are the behaviours we expect from each other every day and underpin everything that we do. We expect everyone to display our values by being determined in how obstacles are overcome; honest when dealing with others; respectful of how you treat others; creative to find solutions to complex problems and cooperative by sharing information, knowledge and experience. These values, applied collectively, help to produce an outstanding Kainos person, team and culture."]

['Congruity360 Benefits', 'Competitive compensation packages
Growth & development opportunities
Community & volunteer opportunities
Health benefits including medical, dental, and vision
Life insurance
401K with employer matching program
Casual, diverse, and inclusive work environment', 'Position Overview', 'Responsible for outlining and developing project plans associated with the internal and external services provided by Congruity360. Owns the day-to-day management of project plans, communication with both internal and external parties associated with the project, quality, and ultimate success around delivery of services provided by the organization. Work in conjunction with the Service Delivery & Engineering around resource and workload management and capacity planning within the Security Operations team. Collaborate with internal and external sales teams to design, implement, and document technology solutions for our clients.', 'Essential Responsibilities', 'Fulfill the role as a hands-on Delivery Manager for projects within a portfolio with a large software development team
Apply modern delivery processes, tools, and work within established frameworks to drive efficient implementations of business requirements
Foster a collaborative agile environment with focus on continuous improvement and delivery of working software
Act as a primary point of contact with customers for all planning purposes
Collaborate with both internal and external parties to set expectations and document project deliverables
Collaborate with both Product Management and Customer Success teams to proactively address ongoing customer needs and ensure rapid resolution to open issues
Create comprehensive project plans for:', 'Tracking overall project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of customer short-term and long-term goals
Tracking costs, time, and communication with customers
Provide timely status and project tracking to programme leadership
Performs risk management to mitigate project risks
Assumes additional responsibilities subject to business need', 'Assign project tasks to the appropriate team and/or resource to ensure the project goals are met within a timely fashion.
Formulate and implement a strategy on how project objectives can be met efficiently in the right sequence, by a group of people with unique skills within project constraints (time, budget, quality, etc.)
Display professionalism, quality service and a “can do” attitude to internal members/departments of Congruity360 as well as external clients and vendors via electronic and print correspondence, over the telephone and in-person.', 'Required Skills and Qualifications', 'Expert knowledge of multiple technology areas including several of the following:
Solid technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in infrastructure, software development and cloud technologies
10+ years’ experience leading enterprise level projects
Expert knowledge of project management / collaboration tools such as Jira, Confluence, Asana, Trello, or other project tracking software
Experience with process improvement and resource management
Working knowledge of MS Office suite
Excellent partner and client-facing communication skills
Enable, motivate, and inspire the team to meet deliverables within project constraints by demonstrating commitment, expertise, confidence, genuine concern, and ability to help everyone solve challenges and achieve goals
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Fill knowledge gaps through active research or by directly engaging subject matter experts as needed']

column1: Senior Director of Platform Marketing, Glofox
column7:
["It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!", "We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.", '', 'Job Description', '', 'The Director of Platform Marketing is a strategic role that leads the product marketing, channel, partner marketing, and responsible for the overall communication strategy in a matrix company organization. This position is instrumental in defining the go-to-market (GTM) of our Glofox platform through compelling product launches and channel alignment. This leader will have experience crafting end-to-end product launches while optimizing available inbound, outbound, and indirect programs. This candidate will manage a team of high-performing product marketers, work collaboratively with global demand generation, performance marketing, marketing analytics, and sales operations to help plan, coordinate, and execute the plan that educate our buyers, attract the right audience, and generate interest. The position reports directly to the Glofox Platform Growth Leader with a dotted line to Chief Marketing Officer.', '', 'What’s in it for you:', 'High growth, highly collaborative, exciting environment
Purpose led company with a Values focused culture
Remote-First
Well established market leader with a start-up vibe
People focused benefits
Open PTO', '']

['Blue Yonder Title: Head of Global Business Intelligence', '', 'Other comparable title: VP of Global Business Intelligence and Analytics', '', 'Location: Primary residence on East Coast Time Zone required', '', 'Overview', 'As Head of Global Business Intelligence, you will report into the office of the COO, and will own the Data Analyses and Business Intelligence function across the company. The objective of the Global Business Intelligence Group is to design and own the overall measurements, approaches, and metrics, set the data infrastructure, and conduct BI Analysis on user behaviors, market insights, and business performance for the company to make the accurate, data-driven decisions.', '', 'What you’ll do']

['About Hexagon
Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future. Hexagon’s Manufacturing Intelligence division provides solutions that utilise data from design and engineering, production and metrology to make manufacturing smarter.

Vacancy Name
Senior Full Stack Engineer

Vacancy No
VN4429

Work Location
US Remote

Location Country
United States

Basis

Employment Type

Duration (if Temporary Contract)

Main Tasks & Requirements
Description
Our Company
For more than 25 years, we’ve been at the service of quality-driven people. Every day, we help people and organizations push further and make change happen by offering them the right technology and knowledge to manage risk and protect lives.
ETQ, part of Hexagon, is the leading provider of quality, EHS, and compliance management SaaS software, trusted by the world’s strongest brands. More than 600 customers globally, spanning industries such as pharmaceuticals, electronics, heavy industry, food and beverage, and medical devices, benefit from ETQ to secure positive brand reputations, enable higher levels of customer loyalty and enhance profitability. ETQ Reliance offers built-in best practices and powerful flexibility to drive business excellence through quality. Only ETQ lets customers configure industry-proven quality processes to their unique needs and business vision. ETQ was founded in 1992 and has main offices located in the U.S. and Europe. To learn more about ETQ and its various product offerings, visit https://www.etq.com/
Our Employees
We ensure that each employee is not only aware of our strategic vision; they are a part of it.
This is because we know that our employees are critical components of ETQ’s ever-growing success.
Words to describe our culture: caring, driven, integrity, passion, committed, thoughtful, diverse, family-oriented, supportive, welcoming, and fun!
Summary
At ETQ we believe deeply in diversity, equity, and inclusion. Quality is best when everyone has a voice. Quality at ETQ is born through diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our company celebrates inclusiveness and encourages employees to bring their authentic selves and unique experiences to ETQ. All of our employees add value to our culture, products, and customer experience.
As part of our journey to build new microservices and improve our cloud deployment & architecture, we are seeking a Full Stack software engineer to join a fast-paced, highly collaborative engineering team. You will be part of a scrum team, adhering to well-structured & defined agile principles. Our software uses a best-in-class tech stack, and we are pushing towards embracing more cloud-native services.
In this position, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and building of the necessary testing that ensures a high quality of deliverables.
Development
Design, develop and modify software systems and custom components using a modern dev stack.
Demonstrate ownership of assignments & tasks.
Debug applications, trace code, and fix bugs as well as identify software flaws, spot wrong implementation, and propose effective solutions.
Actively participate in grooming meetings to define the feature specifications.
Implement unit test cases that exercise and test the produced code.
Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot interactive Web and Mobile applications when needed, using Angular, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS.
Regularly update user stories including progress, status, and documentation (Release Notes & Modified Settings) for projects.
Handle customer feedback on the delivered projects.
Communicate with customers when applicable, to address and troubleshoot reported issues, which requires excellent skills in managing customer meetings, phone etiquette, etc.
Effectively use the different development tools necessary to do the required job. For example, IDE, HTML editors, debugging tools, DB clients, SQL editors, … etc.).
Demonstrate high-quality technical and business documentation skills.
Develop and maintain web applications using Java technology and based upon the ETQ Reliance platform.
Develop and maintain Java classes and other resources to implement requirements and features.
Maintain the security and privacy of ETQ’s information assets.
Ability to travel occasionally for company offsites or business critical meetings.
Required Skills:
6+ years of experience implementing enterprise/SaaS applications with more focus on the back-end side.
Experience with the Java programming language.
Excellent understanding of the programming principles, design patterns, and OO best practices.
Knowledge of RBDMS is required.
Front-end programming skills include Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, or other frameworks.
Experience working with Agile development practices is a plus.
Experience building microservices (Spring Boot, Swagger) is a plus.
Exposure to one of the Cloud providers (AWS/Azure/GCP) is a plus.
Experience with RESTful APIs.
Nodejs knowledge is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, verbal, and written.
NoSQL experience is a plus.
Experience developing cross-browser and cross-platform compatible solutions is a plus.
B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science or relevant degree.
The base cash compensation range for this role is $130,000 - $145,000*
Please note: Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise and geographic region & may vary from the amount above. This range does not represent additional compensation benefits (such as sales commissions, short- and long-term incentive packages, 401K match, medical, dental or vision insurance).
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)']

column7:
['About DAT', 'DAT is an award-winning employer of choice and a next-generation SaaS technology company that has been at the leading edge of innovation in transportation supply chain logistics for 44 years. We continue to transform the industry year over year, by deploying a suite of software solutions to millions of customers every day - customers who depend on DAT for the most relevant data and most accurate insights to help them make smarter business decisions and run their companies more profitably. We operate the largest marketplace of its kind in North America, with 227 million freight posts in 2021, and a database of $126 billion of annual global shipment market transaction data. DAT is headquartered in Denver, CO. We have a second campus in the Portland, OR area, where we got our start four decades ago, and we have additional offices in Springfield, MO and Bangalore, India. For additional information, see www.DAT.com/company.', '', '', 'The Opportunity', 'DAT is looking for a Senior Salesforce Developer to join our team in Denver, Colorado.', '**This position can be fully remote!**', "What You'll Do", 'Develop automated and customized solutions within the Salesforce platform to support critical business functions and meet project objectives, client requirements and company goals.
Communicate with team, internal customers, and other developers to design cohesive project strategies and ensure effective collaboration throughout all phases of development, testing and deployment.
Contribute to an agile development model and adhere to DAT & Salesforce best practices for the deployment of changes.
Interact directly with business analysts and internal business users as necessary to analyze project objectives and capability requirements, including specifications for user interfaces, customized applications, and interactions with internal Salesforce instances.
Provide administration support of internal and customer-facing Salesforce environment, especially related to customized applications, user permissions, security settings, custom objects, and workflow.', "The Skills and Experience You'll Bring"]

['TigerConnect transforms healthcare with the industry’s most widely adopted clinical collaboration platform – uniquely modernizing the way doctors, nurses, care teams, patients, and data connect. With solutions spanning care team communication, scheduling automation, alarm management and event notifications, nurse call, patient engagement and more, we accelerate productivity, reduce costs, and improve patient outcomes, safely and securely. More than 8,000 healthcare organizations trust us to deliver enterprise-ready solutions, making this possible with the right group of dedicated, thoughtful trailblazers. Today, private practice doctor’s offices, small and large hospice centers, and some of the largest healthcare organizations in the United States rely on TigerConnect. We’re a fun, hungry, smart, innovative group of eclectic people who are passionate about transforming the way clinical care teams work and communicate.', '', "The Sr Client Success Manager will own and oversee relationships with some of TigerConnect’s largest and most strategic customers. This person needs to be an active listener and strategic thinker who can strike the appropriate balance between the customer’s needs and the company’s business objectives. They will thoroughly understand their clients' strategic priorities and provide meaningful insight on how clinical communication and collaboration can be improved through the use of TigerConnect products and services.", '', 'What You’ll Be Doing:', 'Establish and maintain strong partnerships as a trusted advisor for 10 - 20 of our top tier clients
Partner with customers to understand their strategic business goals, timelines, priorities, and metrics of success
Collaborate with project managers and clinical SME colleagues to capture client return on investment and success stories using TigerConnect
Proactively identify high-risk customers and make recommendations about how best to remedy any issues that arise
Analyze and monitor customer usage data to draw insights regarding the client’s internal workflows with the product and how to generate value/return on investment
Communicate usage data to the client to improve user behavior, increase user productivity, drive further adoption, and recommend other TigerConnect products and services to assist the client in their Clinical Communication and care team collaboration goals
Proven track record working in a customer-facing environment leading to increased client engagement and satisfaction
Experience with Salesforce or other related CRM technology.
Previous experience in SaaS, mobility, cloud, or healthcare industry sales environment, preferably within a high-growth company
Experience managing multiple tasks or initiatives simultaneously and prioritizing strategically', '', 'What You Bring:', 'BS/BA in Communications, Marketing, Business Administration, Clinical or related field preferred
1 year of experience working in a clinical environment, preferably in a sales, account management, marketing, or project management capacity
Must have healthcare experience, preferably as a clinician and/or in performance improvement or hospital operations management
Excellent relationship skills, as well as effective communication skills across all levels of management and product users
Ability to analyze customer usage data and develop recommendations based upon those data insights
Strategic thinking and problem solving – able to focus on big picture goals and not get stuck in the day-to-day details
Ability to navigate ambiguity and operate effectively, even when things are not defined or the way forward is not certain – makes sound decisions, even in the absence of complete information', '']

column1: Senior Marketing Strategy and Operations Manager
Senior Demand Generation Manager (SF, NY or Remote)
column7:
['At Tecton, we are on a mission to bring world-class Machine Learning to every product and customer experience. Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform. In pursuit of bringing ML to every production application, we have since brought the leading commercial feature store to market and built the most popular open-source feature store.', '', 'We are funded by Kleiner Perkins, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz and have a fast-growing team that works out of SF, NYC, and remotely. Our team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at leading tech companies like Uber, Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Twitter, and Quora, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.', '', 'As a senior member of our Growth Marketing team, you’ll drive Demand Generation initiatives for the Tecton Feature Platform, our core product that is redefining the future of data for real-time Machine Learning.', '', '', 'As trailblazers of a new market category, we have more opportunities for new demand-generation strategies and tactics than we can execute. Your mission will be to identify the best ideas, prioritize based on impact, execute, iterate and scale demand generation activities to reach and exceed our goals.', 'Responsibilities', 'Plan, drive, and execute demand gen activities (webcasts, digital events, in-person events, gated content…) in collaboration with Content and Product Marketing and other departments
Own technical setup for demand generation activities: set up forms, landing pages, marketing emails, webinars, digital events, etc.
Build, run, and monitor paid, email, and digital campaigns; measure and report on campaign effectiveness and ROI
Collaborate with the Sales team to align objectives and targeting, and kickstart ABM activities
Improve, implement and scale lead nurturing strategy
Maintain a regular feedback loop with product and content marketing to drive ongoing improvements in campaign performance and conversion rates
Own and manage our in-person event sponsorships/attendance
In partnership with content marketing, identify 3rd-party conferences, podcasts, digital channels, or publications, to submit Tecton speakers/content and manage the submission process
Optimize website for conversion
Own attribution, data collection, lead scoring, and analytics']

column1: Sr. Director, Portfolio and Endpoint Detection & Response Product Marketing (Remote)
column7:
['#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.', '', 'About the Role:', 'We are looking for a Sr. Director, Portfolio and Endpoint Detection & Response Product Marketing to own the messaging, positioning, category creation, and Go-to-Market strategy for the core security categories of CrowdStrike Falcon Platform, including Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR), eXtended Detection & Response (XDR), IT SecOps, Data Protection, and Identity Protection. This strategic role will lead a team of senior product marketers (Directors, Sr. Managers, Sr. PMMs) and partner across the company with senior leaders in product management, business development, marketing, and sales to drive growth and deliver value to our customers.', '', 'You will work with the best in the industry, and we need you to bring your creativity, imagination and energy to this high-profile position. To be successful, you’ll need to be a strong leader and subject matter expert across multiple domains of cybersecurity.', '', 'Additional Responsibilities:', 'Category creation: Own the category evolution to continue dominating existing markets, and drive category creation for new offerings.
Messaging & positioning: Create compelling and differentiated messaging and positioning for the CrowdStrike Falcon modules and platform with a clear understanding of the target customer and the core capabilities of the offering.
Team leadership: Lead, manage and elevate a team of skilled marketers to deliver compelling messaging, content, and sales tools that enable sellers to tell the Crowdstrike story.
Product Launch: Lead the planning and launch of new offerings, capabilities and releases and participate in managing the cross-functional implementation of those plans.
Content Creation: Lead a team to develop fresh content including collateral, thought leadership assets and solution presentations, website content, videos, blogs, by-lined articles and more to execute communication strategies and accelerate the buyer’s journey.
Sales Enablement: Work closely with sales and alliances teams to ensure the value proposition, assets, training, support structures, and incentive plans are all in place for a strong sales motion in line with our platform and ecosystem capabilities.
Market and Competitive Intelligence: Be the expert on target buyers, market trends, and competitive offerings across the cybersecurity landscape and how this intersects with our offerings. Use this to drive differentiation and influence overall planning.
Strategic planning: Engage with cross-functional teams to help design, plan and execute the go-to-market strategy that drives measurable results.
Executive leadership: Engage with the executive team to develop a long term marketing strategy and product positioning.
Thought leadership: Serve as an evangelist for our products through thought leadership and blogging, social media, and speaking.', '']

['Job Description', '', 'Tricentis is searching for a Senior Program Manager to join our team and support cross-functional initiatives that drive change and transformation across the business. The candidate for this role owns, defines, plans, and delivers cross-departmental program management for business-critical, time-sensitive projects through all aspects of the project lifecycle, from initiation through completion. Focuses on the design and overall execution of programs and establishes a results-oriented, metrics-driven programmatic approach to deliver on strategic initiatives. We are looking for candidates with excellent project/program management, communication, and organizational skills.', '', 'Responsibilities Include:', 'Own and lead the project process and deployment to ensure on time, quality delivery
Define and own the program (mission, vision, tenets), create project plans and charters and oversee their execution, set objectives, analyze and report data, drive improvements that are quantifiable and measurable, and influence resource allocation.
Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members. Run daily stand-ups/project meetings with distributed teams. Ensure notation and communication of action items and update project plans accordingly.
Lead, actively participate in, and collaborate with project- related cross-functional teams on requirements gathering, Sprint planning/retrospectives, design review, and pressure test proposals.
Ensure projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is appropriately maintained. Assess gaps and build out as needed.
Identify impediments and remove project barriers and blockers; escalate and communicate blockers to senior leaders as required.
Ensure projects are completed efficiently and effectively including documentation, training, status updates, escalation paths, etc. Contribute to defining and monitor KPIs to measure team performance and drive process improvement.
Through effective cross-functional communication and collaboration with stakeholders across marketing, product, sales, and other functions, provide a thorough understanding of customer needs and the impact on their business operations.', '', 'Qualifications', 'Must have:', 'Excellent communication skills to effectively liaise with both technical and non-technical staff; excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
Extensive project management skills with experience managing global project deployments; attention to detail and focus on quality; experience in strategic planning, risk management and/or change management
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Must be a collaborative leader comfortable working in a matrixed environment; ability to work independently and in a team setting
Ability to navigate culture and politics across multiple functions
Ability to quickly grasp complex business issues and translate objectives to goals and measurements; strong analytical acumen
Ability to act decisively and work well under pressure; adaptable to change and evolving environments']
