column7:
["Our mission: eliminating every barrier to mental health.
Spring Health is a comprehensive mental health solution for employers and health plans. Unlike any other solution, we use clinically validated technology called Precision Mental Healthcare to pinpoint and deliver exactly what will work for each person — whether that's meditation, coaching, therapy, medication, and beyond.
Today, Spring Health equips over 800 companies, from start-ups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading and preferred mental health service. Companies like General Mills, Guardian, Bain, and Instacart use the Spring Health platform to provide mental health services to thousands of their team members globally. We have raised over $300 million from prominent investors including Kinnevik, Tiger Global, Northzone, RRE Ventures, Rethink Impact, Work-Bench, William K Warren Foundation, SemperVirens, Able Partners, True Capital Ventures, and a strategic investor, Guardian Life Insurance. Thanks to their partnership, our current valuation has reached $2 billion.", 'We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who will build new experiences to drive broader adoption with business customers, especially in the enterprise segment. You will help our customers improve the overall health, well-being and satisfaction of their employees and dependents, prevent burnout, increase productivity, reduce sick absenteeism, and attract and compete for top talent. And we will demonstrate clear, world-class ROI to customers. The candidate will directly impact revenue and customer satisfaction. You will join a blossoming cross-functional Product team, focused on and measured by outcomes, and empowered to drive KPIs and business results.', "What you'll do:", "Contribute to our vision to eliminate every barrier to mental healthcare and establish Spring Health as global center of excellence for behavioral health
Cultivate a deep understanding of our members throughout their journey, and advocate for solutions based on their needs and pain points
Be the expert in understanding of customer (businesses) current and future needs, and build the strategies and roadmaps that delight customers and meet our company's objectives
Develop deep relationships and partner closely with cross-functional teams (i.e., strategy, sales, customer success, and marketing) and customers to gain an understanding of the key problems to focus on and how we plan to solve them
Present data-driven insights about the competitive environment and our users and propose solutions that have a meaningful impact on core metrics for the business
Work with the leadership team and the wider product organization to define, prioritize, and own a roadmap, based on user and business impact
Scope, plan (i.e., product requirement documents, sprint plans, epics, and user stories), and execute with your pod (design, engineering, and data science) to launch valuable and high quality experiences across our platform
Determine and optimize the key performance indicators for your team
Drive and improve the product development process with your team, ensuring that features shipped are high-quality and on-time
Lead agile software development ceremonies including daily standups, grooming, planning, and retrospectives", 'What We Are Looking For:', "You've worked for 7+ years in a product management capacity at a technology-driven organization with data scientists, engineers, and product designers
You have successfully shipped consumer experiences in business-to-business products that have driven high user satisfaction and engagement
You have deep experience building products for the enterprise, developing compelling roadmaps that inspire customers, and delivering value and ROI to the end users and their business
You understand and learn technologies and have lead growth for B2B SaaS products targeting enterprises
You empathetic - listening, understanding, and anticipating the needs of customers and users
You're an analytical, metrics-driven thinker who is deeply empathetic and leads with a user-centered approach
You have experience with hypothesis-driven product development and A/B testing
You have an outstanding track record of owning a complex set of product features, defining a 6-12 month strategy for a product area, and consistently delivering on OKRs
You are comfortable in an ever-changing environment and have a passion for successfully s with business priorities, and drive detailed trade-offs over the product life cycle
navigating ambiguous problem areas
You are not afraid of getting your hands dirty and are equally comfortable balancing tactical and strategic execution
You have the mental resilience to know that we're just at the start of a long journey in which change is constant
You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and have a proven track record of building strong relationships with stakeholders
You possess strong organizational and project management skills, and are careful and accurate with details
You possess excellent product judgment; ability to prioritize competing opportunities, balance stakeholders need", 'Bonus Qualifications', "Experience working in healthcare
Experience working on both web and mobile applications
Quantitative background (e.g., mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering)
Master's degree or MBA", '', '']

column7:
['Join us as we scale our business in the US by replicating our tremendous success around the world. The massive database market is going to double over the next few years (the IDC estimates it to be $119B+ by 2025) and PingCAP is a global player positioned as a major disruptor with TiDB Database and Database as a Service offering.

TiDB is an open-source, cloud-native, distributed SQL database for elastic scale and real-time analytics. Large and high-growth organizations in markets as varied as financial services, logistics, gaming, e-commerce and software as a service have successfully deployed and expanded their TiDB footprint on mission-critical applications.

Our strong open-source community roots (32,000 stars on GitHub), innovative products and inclusive culture draw passionate and dedicated people to our company. Learn more about PingCAP careers and join our team to be at the forefront of innovation and growth.', 'What you will do:
Develop an end-to-end demand generation engine to help our sales teams achieve the NA growth goals.
Own, develop and drive our demand generation calendar with specific activities that drive measurable results.
Develop and drive marketing campaigns.
Working with product marketing and our content team, develop a thematic approach to our go-to-market motions, in line with our messaging architecture.
Develop an ABM (account based marketing) playbook to align with sales goals.
Own and drive an integrated approach of all demand generation tools, including social, AR/PR, inbound and outbound leads
Own demand generation platform from design all the way to implementation and KPI, helping increase the efficiency and effectiveness of leads.
Reporting on all performance metrics and implementing improvement throughout the demand generation life cycle.', 'What we are looking for:
10+ years of industry experience in demand generation for SaaS, Cloud platforms with preference for the database, open source markets.
Deep understanding and experience in demand generation tools and their effectiveness in the customer lifecycle.
Experience having implemented best practices for demand generation programs and campaigns.
Solid working knowledge of the buyer’s journey for SaaS, Cloud and Database technologies.
Demonstrable experience and knowledge in the latest modern demand generation tools and social media platforms.
A natural cross functional leader with the ability to drive consensus amongst diverse teams.
Ability to make decisions and drive results in a rapidly growing and evolving environment.', 'What you will gain:
Opportunity to build and shape a powerful, industry-changing database product from the get-go;
Working with a globally team of passionate (and compassionate) developers, hackers, and open-source fanatics;
Competitive salary;
Meaningful equity in a fast-growing enterprise startup;
In-office catered lunch (every day), snacks, and drinks;
Commuter benefits;
Employee referral bonus program;
Awesome, supportive coworkers with a good sense of humor.', "The annual anticipated base salary range for U.S. candidates for this role is USD $120k to $175k. The actual individual base pay will depend on various factors such as the complexity and responsibility of the role, work locations, job levels, and relevant experience and skills. This role is also eligible to participate in PingCAP's Bonus and Equity Plan, as well as our Sales Compensation Plan if it is a sales role. In order to comply with local legislation and provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base salary ranges on all US job postings regardless of desired hiring location. Please note that actual salaries may vary and fall outside of this range depending on factors such as a candidate's qualifications, geographic location, skills, experience, and competencies. Other benefits include health insurance, flexible vacation time, paid holidays, and parental leave. Salaries for candidates outside the U.S. will vary based on local compensation structures."]

['Tinuiti is looking for a Senior Director, Strategic Marketplace Services of Amazon to join our commerce and retail media team! In this role you will report to Group Director, Strategic Marketplace Services and be responsible for the successful management of our Amazon relationship, strategy and achieving client and Tinuiti business objectives. This role combines a well-rounded understanding of Amazon Search and other key Amazon offerings like Amazon DSP, Marketing Cloud and more nascent programs like Attribution, Stream, Posts and Live. This role will provide guidance on growth opportunities and ensure execution of client specific strategies on Amazon.', 'The ideal candidate is an experienced senior level Amazon Search teammate who is ready to own and innovate a mature program with excellent client communication skills and the ability to pivot quickly amongst many competing priorities.', '', '', "What you'll do:", "Be the owner of the Amazon Search and DSP relationship as a partner manager for Tinuiti
Including, but not limited to, day to day communications, maintaining partner network status, event (digital and in person) collaboration and ownership, marketing initiatives and cross-Amazon relationship management
With the Group Director, work to build a collaborative relationship with all Tinuiti channel partner leads in product, marketing and sales efforts.
Ensure that client delivery, strategy and success for internal stakeholders in your purview allows the Commerce department to meet or exceed the Financial objectives of the department
Collaborate on overall strategy and services with the rest of the Amazon stakeholders (Search, DSP, Operations, Creative) in order to unify the Commerce strategy and delivery.
With the Group Director, collaborate across Tinuiti teams outside of Commerce to create synergy across tech stacks, performance and visibility.
Serve as a leader on the Commerce team by leading or coordinating internal trainings on industry changes that affect account teams' work and as a way to further the development of our Account Team's customer service, approach to strategy, and concepts that aid in deepening relationships with clients
Own, support & participate in assigned Amazon Sales pitches
With the product team, own assigned Amazon product development support pieces such as (but not limited to) product marketing (for externally facing roadmap and sales needs), features and functionality feedback (UAT) and ongoing communications with the channel's product team.
Understand and be able to prioritize requests with the product team, see long term effects and value, balancing out table stakes, technical debt and building use cases.
Represent Tinuiti as a thought leader to external partners as requested, including but not limited to activities like analyst relations, Tinuiti hosted events, eMarketer or other type publications or presentations.
Proactively identify & provide innovative ideas and use cases to enable Tinuiti to scale and grow through technology or partnership.
Accountable or Consulted on Amazon partnerships that benefit our overall Tinuiti Amazon partnership (Examples: Buy with Prime, Amazon Attribution, Posts)
Responsible or Informed on 3rd party relationships that support the Tinuiti Amazon relationship (Profitero, Zeta, Helium10, PageOne)", '', '', 'Who you are:', '8+ years experience at Amazon, brand, digital agency or SaaS - dedicated to Amazon Advertising
Ready to work collaboratively with key stakeholders in our department & across the organization
Self-starter with an ability to work with key stakeholders to turn an idea into a capability that enhances the service we provide to our clients
Enjoy a fast paced, figure it out environment
Resourceful - using 3rd party applications, sourcing solutions, collaborative']

['Requisition ID
999007150', '', '', "Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps generate the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and optimize outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at www.medidata.com and follow us @medidata.
Our Team:
Medidata is looking for individuals who will help us tackle some of the most complex questions facing the industry today using our proprietary platform and advanced analytics. At Medidata, we never work alone. This role will partner heavily with all of the key stakeholder functions including product, delivery, data science, engineering, partnerships, and biostatistics. Successful Medidata AI candidates will be skilled in analytical/quantitative thinking, structured communication, and excited about building the next horizon of Medidata’s mission to power smarter treatments and healthier people.
Who We're Looking For:
You are a developer with 4-6+ years experience building automation for deployment and management of cloud-based web applications or services. You’ll demonstrate a passion for your craft, be self-motivated and eager to engage in high impact, challenging engineering problems while continuously raising the standard of quality in our products and services in a full solutions-oriented SaaS environment.
Your responsibilities will include hands-on implementation and development with continuous integration, continuous deployment, infrastructure as code, and advanced monitoring tools running on Amazon Web Services. The services you build will enable seamless deployment and management of cloud-base systems that make up Medidata’s newest generation of solutions. You will be comfortable working with Product Managers to turn great ideas into detailed requirements. You will also design how features should be implemented and help determine the best architecture to use in each situation.
Strong DevOps skills including Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Test Automation, and Infrastructure as Code - on the AWS platform
Understanding of source control management (Git/GitHub)
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment
A passion to stay current with new technologies and engineering concepts
Hands-on cloud expertise (preferably AWS) with strong understanding of SaaS model
Requirements (Education & Experience):
4-6+ years experience automating build, deployment, and test automation for web based applications and services
Be responsible for building CI/CD pipelines including installation for all components in an end to end life sciences solution which is comprised of multiple software products
Design, development, and operation of all automation requirements to support the develop/test/deploy process
Contribute to the team’s roadmap and project planning process, partnering with stakeholders to develop business objectives and translate those into action
Work with other Agile team members to build in test automation from the ground up for every part of the system
Work with system architects to develop data flows and align to application integration standards
Ensure efficiency, quality, resiliency of the integrations
Monitoring the processes during the entire lifecycle
Continuous integration and Continuous deployment with tools such as GoCD, Travis, GitHub Actions, AWS CodeDeploy, Terraform and CloudFormation
Production operations in support of web-based applications in a service oriented architecture
B.S. or M.S. Computer Science, Engineering, related field or relevant experience
Bonus Points:
Developing services supporting mobile applications
Clinical research knowledge or worked in a regulated environment
AWS certification(s)
The salary range posted below refers only to positions that will be physically based in New York City. As with all roles, Medidata sets ranges based on a number of factors including function, level, candidate expertise and experience, and geographic location. Pay ranges for candidates in locations other than New York City, may differ based on the local market data in that region. The base salary pay range for this position is $96,000 to $124,000.
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission under the terms of applicable plan documents, while many of Medidata’s non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Additionally, Medidata provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and should help you care for those who matter most. For that reason, we provide an array of options to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.
#LI-ME1
#LI-Remote
Equal Employment Opportunity
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Covid Statement
Our Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine."]

['About Us
If you’re looking for an exciting sales position and growth opportunity with an early stage SaaS company that has a first-in-world platform, with a pipeline waiting for you to come and close it, look no further.
PartnerOptimizer is looking for a high energy, dynamic all-hands-on-deck Sales Account Executive to manage a pipeline from lead to close.
Our Culture
We embrace the startup vibe of being agile, remote and diverse, with open communication and teamwork. We’ve created a virtual work environment where you’ll let your creative juices flow, have your voice heard and be able to see the impact that you make. In short, we move fast, we learn from our mistakes and we want people who take initiative and enjoy being part of something bigger than themselves.
Job Role (Fully Remote)
As a SaaS Account Executive for PartnerOptimizer, you will be managing a sales pipeline from lead to close.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage prospects from lead to close and/or pre-qualified by a BDR
Executing discovery calls and demos with qualified leads via Video Conferencing.
Following up with opportunities and handling objections, sending relevant sales enablement material.
Have a true sales “hunter” and “closer” mentality, and conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social to connect with new prospects
Provide an exceptional customer experience.
Cultivate lasting relationships with customers.
Requirements
3+ years of relevant work/closing experience.
Previous SaaS and enterprise software experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, and well-organized.
A strong team player but still a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment.
Comfortable speaking with C Suite and senior management prospects.
What you bring to the table…
Characteristics of resiliency, relentlessness, curiosity, resourcefulness, and charisma
Fast learner, with some experience and knowledge of channel partnership organizations
Team player with the ability to overcome the challenges of and thrive within a remote work environment
Positive and energetic phone communication skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills
Willingness to share insights and improve the sales process, playbook, and in building out the sales team.
Company Perks…
Competitive compensation
Generous commissions
Fully Remote
Room for growth and promotion
Performance based stock options
Compensation…
This is a 1099 contractor position. Base and commissions commensurate with experience.
PLEASE SUBMIT A RESUME + SELF INTRODUCTION VIDEO (USE LOOM – ITS FREE) to careers@partneroptimizer.com
Applications without videos will not be accepted.
TIPS for loom video:
Be succinct, use clear concrete examples.
Keep the video under 4 minutes in length.
Tell us who you are, what you’re about, and what motivates you.
What appealed to you in this job description to make you want to apply?
What makes you unique from the crowd?
Highlight 2 – 3 experiences that showcase how you’re a fit with this role.
Go to our website and try out our app at telemetrytv.com, tell us what do you think the main challenges are from a sales perspective – what would you do to fix that challenge?

Good luck, we can’t wait to hear all about you!
Job Type: Contractor, full time or part time']

['American Express Global Business Travel is dedicated to providing expert travel management service and industry-leading technology for clients to realize the greatest value from their investment in travel. American Express Global Business Travel delivers consulting expertise, strategic sourcing, supplier negotiation support and traveler service available around the world, around the clock resulting in increased cost savings, spend control, and outstanding customer service.', '', 'We’re leading our clients to a thoughtful return-to-travel by introducing new products, services, and strategies that will revolutionize the travel industry and bring greater value to our business customers. Their success expands our success, so we put heart and soul into helping our clients achieve results that exceed all expectations. As the world’s largest travel management company, we build and maintain alliances with key travel leaders and suppliers throughout the world, strengthening our position as a quality provider to companies of all sizes.', '', 'If you have exceptional experience in new business development and seek the opportunity to generate new business within a regional territory, build influential relationships with partners and prospects, and develop a web of influence at senior levels, all while achieving true work/life balance; navigate your great at American Express Global Business Travel. With over 150 years of innovation behind us, our future could not look more promising as business travel returns around the world.', '', 'The Manager of Business Development (MBD) will be responsible for the generation of new sales acquisition of SME businesses. This is an individual contributor role. The successful candidate must have knowledge in technology tools and a keen ability to deliver client specific solutions. Responsible for delivering integrated, customized travel management to help corporations manage and maximize their travel investment. The Manager of Business Development is responsible for building and maintaining relationships with key internal stakeholders, partners, along with building and developing senior-level client contacts. The key role objective is to grow and increase revenue through a combination of skills:', 'Aggressive prospecting and documentation
Executive Presence and exceptional relationship management and consultative sales to C-Level executives
Ability to conduct deep Discovery with CFOs, Procurement Leaders & Corporate Travel Managers to provide customized solutions, proposals, presentations and technology demos that articulate how GBT can meet the prospect’s long-term travel management needs.
Understanding a P & L, financial acumen in order to articulate cost of program benefits
Active development and management of pipeline to achieve goals and targets, and the ability to articulate needs and solutions to internal partners and leaders to grow your business
A strong understanding of the travel management landscape and deep knowledge and delivery of the power of the GBT value proposition.', '', 'Responsibilities:']

['Company Overview', 'DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.', '', '', '', "What You'll Do", 'The Area Vice President of Enterprise Sales will lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives towards attainment of individual sales quotas within the Federal sales space. This sales leader must be able to empower, measure, monitor and hold the team accountable for monthly quota attainment as well as lead by example. This strategic leader collaborates with the AEs in opening doors and closing on new business – partnering on account calls, assisting in account health monitoring, and effectively maintaining strong account relationships while also reducing churn and growing new business. This leader is a mentor as well as a coach; and, is a true evangelist for the needs of the business.', '', 'This position is a people manager role reporting to the Vice President of Enterprise Sales, Public Sector and is designated Flex.', 'Responsibility']

column7:
['Listed on the Philadelphia 100 as one of the fastest-growing companies in the area, GLOBO is adding to our talented team. We are an 11+-year-old technology company and we’re going places! Our platform, GLOBO HQ, enables real-time connection with best-in-class translation, interpretation, and transcreation services, 24/7 in over 450 different languages.

What’s it like to work here? Well, we’re a close-knit team with big ideas and ambitions. We’re entrepreneurial, smart, and successful – plus we’re just a lot of fun to work with. At GLOBO, everyone is invested in our mission, and individuals are recognized for their contributions and achievements. We’re always on the hunt for people who bring energy, ideas, and personality to our growing organization.

About the Role:', '', "As a Senior Account Executive (SAE) at GLOBO, you'll join the New Business Sales Team in pursuit of our mission of “Helping people communicate when it matters most.'' You will bring competitive and innovative tactics to acquire New Logo and Enterprise Level customers and capitalize on sales potential.", 'Primary responsibilities include prospecting, effective execution of solution demonstrations, preparing and presenting profitable pricing proposals, and meticulous management of CRM, best practices, and GLOBO’s Sales Process. An SAE needs to be a coachable sales professional and leader, able to work closely with the Director of Sales, and demonstrate a “can-do” attitude as you attack each day focused on exceeding your Weekly Sales Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).

Compensation:
Base salary for this role is $100,000. On target earnings (OTE) are estimated at $250,000+; earning potential is uncapped.', 'Responsibilities:', '', 'Source your own Direct Sales New Logo Deals
Develop and maintain GPO, Channel Sales, and Direct End User customer relationships.
Achieve, at minimum, an OTE (on-target earnings) New Business Sales Quota as determined by management
Position the value of GLOBO’s service offerings to large and strategic accounts businesses
Develop a deep understanding of GLOBO, our capabilities, and the language services industry
Educate and guide prospects through the buyer’s journey to help them learn how GLOBO can grow their business
Manage a true and robust pipeline of inbound and self-sourced leads to identify, engage, and develop relationships with potential buyers
Qualify prospects’ business goals to determine if GLOBO can be a strategic investment for their business’ growth, all through consistent application of our “Winning By Design” Sales processes.
Maintaining an active presence on Linkedin including doing the following on a weekly basis by 1) posting 5 articles where they include a summary of the “so what” of the article and use hashtags and tag people and 2) Make at least 3 comments on things their target prospects have posted.
Provide meaningful input into Outbound sales proposals
Update and maintain Hubspot in a timely manner
Other duties as assigned', 'Requirements:', '', 'Bachelor’s Degree
8 to 10 years of B2B, technical SaaS Enterprise Sales Experience, preferably with at least 5 years of Language Solutions experience
At least 3 years of the above experience must be in a Senior Account Executive role with an emphasis on hunting new logos
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Word and PowerPoint and superior knowledge of Excel
Experience with Google Docs and Apple/Mac Operating System preferred

Authorized to legally work for any employer in the United States
Willingness to submit to any requested background checks
Fluent in English']

['Position Summary:', 'This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of an industry leader and have a significant impact on future growth of our Field Force Operations Center of Excellence. The IQVIA FFO CoE empowers our customers to transform HCP engagement through solutions that improve business processes, drive tailored communications, and optimize sales resources. IQVIA offers a range of services and technologies focused on continuous enhancement of HCP engagement as well as the overall HCP experience. Whether planning field force resources, designing & managing complex incentive programs, delivering end-to-end speaker bureau strategy and management, or optimizing every HCP interaction, IQVIA Technologies enable healthcare companies to engage HCPs more effectively. Our solutions combine diverse data sources to deliver insights from advanced analytics and artificial intelligence in the management, coordination, and optimization of resources in support of HCP engagement.', '', 'As Sales Representative, you will engage your accounts, understand their business needs, and provide strategic recommendations that range from foundational local needs to robust global enterprise aspects. We will assist in acclimating you to our internal and client sales & business processes. You will generate leads, manage accounts; generate deep/wide relationships with key decision makers at the prospects and clients you are assigned.', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Serve as a consultative technology solution sales representative for IQVIA’s SaaS based FFO portfolio
Present IQVIA’s overall value proposition with a specific focus on our portfolio of technology solutions which include:
Orchestrated Customer Engagement (OCE)
OCE Personal (Engage MSLs, HCP & Account Managers)
OCE Optimizer (Optimize HCP Engagement Planning)
OCE Connect (Self serve portal for HCPs)
OCE Digital (Enable Multichannel marketing journeys)
Next Best Action
Incentive Comp 360
Centris Direct & HCP/O Engage (Platform)
Engage (Meetings & Engagement)
Connect (HCP Portal)
IQ (Reporting & Analytics)
Services (BPO)
Smart Meetings
Focuses exclusively on new business/new account acquisition.
Develops prospects through individual efforts and by participating in organization-sponsored events and campaigns.
Prospects for new accounts, secures appointments, determines needs, delivers sales presentations, negotiates terms and conditions, overcomes objections, and closes sales.
Develops strategies focused on expanding client base within defined market segments.
Proactively build deep and strategic relationships at high levels within the accounts
Assure the execution of strategic account plans
Lead client prospecting, site presentations, negotiations, contract development and account business reviews with key stakeholders.
Utilize CRM to document actions regarding planning and sales activities (ie, sales calls, customer events, opportunities, e-marketing campaigns) and shares account intelligence with internal members during account strategy meetings
Act as a liaison between prospect/customer and IQVIA Services and Delivery teams as necessary
Present sales opportunities to management and work with the internal departments/team members to close large complex sales
Participate in preparing Requests for Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and be responsible to ensure they are completed in a timely and accurate manner
Keep well-informed of assigned industry trends, technological and process changes, new developments, services and other general information related to the assigned accounts and market scope
Collaborate with Client Partners and Tech Client Partners to establish integrated solutions
Provide required status reporting and updates to management
Demonstrate a high level of personal accountability
Proven achiever', '', 'Education & Experience:', 'Bachelor’s Degree with 10+ years of similar industry or relevant sales experience
Desire to learn the pharmaceutical marketplace and commercial operations processes.
Minimum of 4-5 years progressively responsible sales experience. You have exceeded quota. You have been a difference maker.
Skilled in negotiations and sales techniques
Demonstrated success accessing your market, the major players and decision makers.
Ability to confidently interact with senior management and executives both internally and externally
Exhibit solid communication skills; ability to present accurate and compelling presentations
Well-developed business acumen
Computer literate']

['Who We Are', 'Build a brighter future while learning and growing with a Siemens company at the intersection of technology, community and sustainability. Our global team of innovators is always looking to create meaningful solutions to some of the toughest challenges facing our world. Find out how far your passion can take you.', 'What You Can Expect', 'The Senior Manager, Sales is a proven performer tasked to grow revenue within our loyal customer base. In this role, we need talented, hardworking individuals with great energy and initiative to drive awareness of our new and existing product offerings.', 'As a Senior Sales Manager you will be responsible for providing leadership and guidance in the development and success of a team of Enterprise Account Executives, Senior Account Executives, and Account Executives. Your overall goal will be expanding our existing client base in your designated market segment through new client acquisition and upsell strategies. You will work collaboratively with other Sales Managers along with Marketing and Client Success teams to acquire, expand and retain customers.', 'What You Will Do', 'Generate and execute New Client Acquisition (NCA)
Upsell, and implement Cross-Sell strategies/business plan in order to target market segment accounts focused on exceeding sales quota
Develop and lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives that can effectively penetrate and win at the high end of our marketplace. Participate on high level sales calls and help the team engineer deals that win upmarket.
Develop, mentor and coach sales talent to help them achieve quota and increase their productivity.
Monitor Quota Carrying Sales (QCS) productivity and motivate team to reach daily, monthly and annual goals
Master the manufacturing vertical strategies and discover targeted initiatives and potential partnerships.
Lead Team Metric Meetings – review of pipeline, target quotas, calls, demos
Ensure that complete and accurate information is being tracked in SFDC and sales processes are being followed accordingly
Resolve interpersonal issues within team and escalate when needed
Report to Sales Leadership on metrics, opportunities, and potential threats.', 'What You Need to Have', 'Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or another relevant field
3-4 years of relevant Inside Sales experience
Prior management experience
Strong track record of closing opportunities
Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals
Carries a passion and commitment to personal, team, and company success
Strong time management and organizational skills
Ability to maintain a high and consistent level of productivity and leadership', 'What Makes You Stand Out']

['Working at Atlassian

Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

We're looking for an accomplished commercial transactions attorney to join our Commercial Legal team! As a member this team, you'll draft and negotiate a variety of agreements with Atlassian's enterprise customers, all while contributing to team projects and culture. This is a great opportunity to join a growing legal team and support strategic transactions for Atlassian.
We're open to hiring in the Central, Mountain and Pacific US Time Zones for this remote position. We call this "Team Anywhere."', "What You'll Do:
Join our growing Commercial Legal team, which supports Atlassian's largest and most complex customers with the opportunity to coach and mentor other members of the team.
Provide balanced, business-minded guidance on contract-related issues. We're not looking for academic analysis!
Cultivate trusted relationships with other teams (like Sales, Privacy and Revenue) to drive customer deals and design scalable processes for implementation.
Negotiate enterprise cloud and license agreements for Atlassian's products and services.
Develop and deliver trainings and other materials to educate our Sales teams on contract terms and other legal issues.
Lead special projects and team process improvements, including projects designed to expand the market for Atlassian's cloud products and move our existing customers to the cloud.", 'More about you:
You take ownership and accomplish tasks with appropriate support.
You build relationships to strengthen the connection between your team and the business.
You bring empathy and understanding to your conversations with customers, clients and peers, driving a path forward that balances company risk and customer needs.
You enjoy negotiating and closing deals and mentoring teammates.
You understand how to navigate a decentralized, multinational organization.
You have a strong understanding of software and cloud services, associated business models, and technology industry trends.
You think creatively beyond the "legal" box to offer solutions for the business, a skill you've honed over the long term.
You see the bigger picture, understanding not only contractual terms but also business and operational impacts.', "On your first day, we'll expect you to:
Be qualified to practice law in a US state.
Have 7+ years of experience as a transactional lawyer, with at least 4 years in SaaS and/or similar software licensing agreements.
Have experience finding balanced solutions that can scale to meet growing business and customer needs.
Have expertise in common issues that arise in commercial negotiations, including data privacy, IP, security and revenue recognition.
Be curious about Atlassian's products, culture, and business model.
Understand how to succeed in a dynamic environment.
Be willing to handle new responsibilities.", "Compensation
At Atlassian, we tie our base pay ranges to role and level. In the United States, that means your base pay ranges will fall into one of three geographic pay zones depending on your location. Please see here for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.
Our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:
Zone A: $178,500- $273,700
Zone B: $160,600 - $246,400
Zone C: $148,100 - $227,200
Within each range, base pay is ultimately determined based on your skills, expertise, and experience. This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and/or equity.

Our perks & benefits

To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.

About Atlassian

The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub."]

column1: Senior Software Solutions Product Manager - API and SaaS Integrations
column7:
['', 'Set and own the strategic direction of software product solutions and features for VSP Global’s customers

Provide executive leadership with key recommendations to improve the effectiveness of the software solution for our consumers and the business

Communicate the software solution strategy, tying software solution deliverables to corporate and line of business goals

Solve hard customer and business problems while leading within the constraints of the business

Prepare, prioritize, negotiate, and maintain roadmap items that define software solution improvements for short- and long-term releases

Ensure cross line of business alignment for online delivery of software solutions

Lead all stages of software solution’s lifecycle including strategic alignment, discovery, prototyping, iterations, upgrades, release execution, performance tracking, maintenance, and end of life

Expertise in working directly with; end users (internal and external) to identify pain points, designers to visualize new features, and engineers to transform stories into new software solutions and features

Serve as the central resource and subject matter expert with respect to; Modern day product management techniques, the software solution, the market, and industry, as well as the consumer

Develop and when necessary deliver concise and meaningful presentations for internal and external audiences, including education and training of sales staff, training of support groups, train the trainer programs, and presentations at trade shows, conferences, and key customer accounts

Continuously monitor and analyze the software solution performance and usage. Provide company-wide reporting on software solution success, including market, financial, operational, and satisfaction success

Job Specifications

Typically has the following skills or abilities:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering, Software Design or related field or equivalent work experience. MBA preferred.

Minimum 6 years of experience in software solutions product management, technology solution product management or customer-focused health care product management

Experience leading in an Agile environment

Demonstrated ability to lead broad, complex, and unstructured tasks ranging from strategic to analytical in nature

Demonstrated ability to analyze market research and financial information, evaluate profitability and identify trends

Expert knowledge of modern-day product management methodologies

Experience leading discovery sessions with UX and engineering to prototype solutions

Proven ability to work directly with end users to discover operational pain points and effectively perform root cause analysis

Highly skilled at managing software solutions across operational divisions

Highly skilled at accomplishing objectives through others via influencing, delegating and building strong working relationships

Ability to effectively communicate information, facilitate meetings and negotiate to a wide variety of technical and non-technical individuals or groups at all levels of the organization

Thorough understanding of business implications, project interdependencies and system interfaces

Regularly exercise discretion and independent judgment while performing job duties', 'Preferred Skills', '', 'Ability to create and lead the API product strategy and vision', '', 'Advocate for APIs and technology-focused solutions', '', 'Using Product management best practices to prioritize criteria for making API eco-system decisions', '']

['USA, Remote
Join us to advance data science and machine learning.
Comet is accelerating the machine learning development process for data science and ML teams. From the individual data scientist tracking training runs to the enterprise team moving hundreds of models into production, Comet is the platform used by some of the most innovative builders in the industry. We started Comet to make it possible for teams to manage and optimize models across the complete ML lifecycle and achieve business value faster.
You’re welcome here
Working in Comet’s fast, dynamic startup environment is challenging and fun. We are looking for people who are customer-focused, work collaboratively, and want to be a voice in advancing Comet’s leadership in the marketplace. If you are excited about empowering technology innovators around the globe in creating world-changing machine learning models, Comet is the right place for you.
Comet is backed by more than $63 million in venture-capital funding, and we are the MLOps platform of choice for teams at Ancestry, The RealReal, Uber, WorkFusion, and Zappos. We are a remote-first company with offices in New York City (U.S.A.) and Tel-Aviv (Israel). And we’re just getting started. CRN featured Comet as one of the 10 hottest machine learning and data science startups in 2021.
Comet is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, uniform service member status, marital status, pregnancy, age, medical condition, physical or mental disability, genetic information/characteristics, and any other characteristic protected by State or Federal law.
The VP of Marketing will be responsible for driving the GTM and growth of Comet in collaboration with sales and product teams. The VP of Marketing will work closely with the executive team to develop and execute marketing campaigns, manage budgets and resources, and analyze market data to make informed decisions about dynamic marketing strategy and execution. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record of developing and implementing successful marketing campaigns and ABM strategy, excellent communication and leadership skills, and a deep understanding of digital marketing trends related techniques.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement ABM and PLG marketing strategies and plans that align with the overall business goals of Comet
Lead the marketing team to define positioning and messaging, execute campaigns and demand initiatives that drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention
Analyze market data to adjust marketing strategy and take data-driven decisions
Manage budgets and resources effectively to maximize the impact of marketing resources and efforts
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, sales, and customer success, to drive growth and determine effective launch and communications strategies
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and incorporate new marketing techniques, tools and technologies
Lead the development and execution of content marketing efforts, including email marketing, social media, digital and and blog content
Develop strong product positioning and clear narratives
Develop demand generation strategy
Tackle complex challenges with a strategic mindset, creating and executing thoughtful recommendations and action plans
Work closely with sales and product to refine and optimize the first and last touch points across the funnel with the goal of improving conversion from leads to an active opportunity
Drive PR and AR communication by creating PR and AR presence, along with media and Analysts’ interviews / bylines and reports
Qualifications:
Experience in a SaaS (cloud first) developer tool company
10+ years of marketing experience, with at least 3 years in a senior leadership role
Experience working at early or growth stage startups
Proven track record of developing and implementing successful ABM strategy
Experimental mind-set. Ability to test ideas quickly and iterate
Strong analytical skills and experience using data to inform marketing strategy
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Experience managing budgets and resources effectively
Proficiency in digital marketing techniques and technologies
Familiarity with content marketing, email marketing, and social media marketing
Hands-on, get the job done type of person, with a “can do” attitude
This role will be fully remote or based in New York City and working with a global team (large presence in Tel Aviv and Europe).
Base Salary range : $200- 270K']

['Helping careers take flight. Reshaping an industry. Enable your career to be Made on Duck Creek.', '', 'WHO WE ARE:', 'Duck Creek Technologies is the intelligent solutions provider defining the future of the property and casualty (P&C) and general insurance industry. We are the platform upon which modern insurance systems are built, enabling the industry to capitalize on the power of the cloud to run agile, intelligent, and evergreen operations. Our modern SaaS solutions help insurers set a new standard and revolutionize how consumers interact with insurance companies.', '', 'Authenticity, purpose, and transparency are core to Duck Creek, and we believe insurance should be there for individuals and businesses when, where, and how they need it most. Our market-leading solutions are available on a standalone basis or as a full suite, and all are available via Duck Creek OnDemand. With more than 1,000 successful implementations to date, Duck Creek removes the IT burden for insurers so they can focus on the business of insurance.', '', 'We have a flock of more than 1,800 employees across the globe and are proud to be a Flexible-First employer. We empower our employees with the choice to work from an office, from home, or on a hybrid schedule. Our flexible-first environment fosters productivity, inclusion, collaboration, and ensures a consistent employee experience regardless of location.', '', 'If working in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving company that is transforming one of the world’s oldest and largest industries sounds exciting, let us know. We are excited you are considering Duck Creek as a future employer and hope you decide to join “The Flock”!']

["Datavant is a rapidly growing healthcare technology company with a mission to connect the world's health data. By eliminating data silos in the healthcare industry, we aim to unlock opportunities to accelerate medical research, and help organizations design better ways to facilitate access, affordability, and quality of care leading to better patient outcomes.", "By joining Datavant today, you're stepping onto a highly collaborative, fully remote team that is passionate about creating transformative change in healthcare. We look for people who are smart, nice and get things done. We invest in our people and believe in hiring for high-potential and humble individuals who can rapidly grow their responsibilities as the company scales. Datavant is a distributed, remote-first team (no office locations) and we empower Datavanters to shape their working environment in a way that suits their needs - learn more here!", "As a member of our Product Success team, you will be at the forefront of our discussions with our clients — understanding their needs, architecting solutions, and project managing the end-to-end process to implement our solutions across all of Datavant's customers. You will also work alongside our Sales, Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to support customers in implementing Datavant's products. Your work will be critical to growing our business, which will ultimately improve patient outcomes.", 'You Will:', "Partner with the Sales and Services teams by providing your technical support, product vision, and expert perspective
Manage the end-to-end process of getting our clients set-up with Datavant, both technically and from a user perspective
Ensure successful client onboarding as soon as a deal is signed and overall high client satisfaction, technically setting up the clients and understanding the client's systems and workflows
Provide exceptional client service and support, constantly considering ways we could better serve clients through new features, use cases, and products
Identify and support automation of repeatable implementations and customer support processes
Provide continual feedback to the Product team on how we can improve our product suite", 'What You Will Bring to the Table:', "Consistent ability to ramp up quickly on technical aspects of Datavant's software and how it can be used for various end uses
High customer empathy, both for internal and external customers; ability to work in highly regulated environments and push through bureaucracy when necessary
Extremely organized and detail-oriented with an exceptional ability to handle multiple client projects simultaneously, including systematic follow up and responsiveness to client requests
Proven ability to operate efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and to navigate ambiguity with considerable success
Proven ability to communicate cross-functionally with different personas across internal teams (including Go To Market [GTM/Sales], Services and Product Operations, Product Management, Engineering and Marketing)
Consider yourself highly motivated and driven to deliver results and work through challenges which are typical of a high-growth, fast-paced start-up environment
Bonus but not necessary: prior experience in implementing SaaS solutions or APIs in large, complex organizations", 'We are committed to building a diverse team of Datavanters who are smart, nice, and get things done where every Datavanter is empowered to bring their authentic self to their work. We are all responsible for stewarding a high-performance culture in which all Datavanters belong and thrive. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and experiences.', 'Our compensation philosophy is to be externally competitive, internally fair, and not win or lose on compensation. Salary ranges are developed with the support of benchmarks (competitive San Francisco rates for US-based roles) and industry best practices.', "We're building a high-growth, high-autonomy culture. We rely less on job titles and more on cultivating an environment where anyone can contribute, the best ideas win, and personal growth is driven by expanding impact and less by title. This means we default to simple job titles (e.g., Software Engineer) rather than complex ones (e.g., Senior Software Engineer). The range posted is for a given job title, which can include multiple levels. Individual rates for the same job title may differ based on their level, responsibilities, skills, and experience for a specific job. The estimated salary range for this role is $130,000 - $180,000."]

column7:
['Harness is a high-growth startup that is disrupting the software delivery market. Our mission is to enable the 30 million software developers in the world to deliver code to their users reliably, efficiently, securely and quickly, increasing customers’ pace of innovation while improving the developer experience. We offer solutions for every step of the software delivery lifecycle to build, test, secure, deploy and manage reliability, feature flags and cloud costs. The Harness Software Delivery Platform includes modules for CI, CD, Cloud Cost Management, Feature Flags, Service Reliability Management, Security Testing Orchestration, Chaos Engineering, and continues to expand at an incredibly fast pace.

Harness is led by technologist and entrepreneur Jyoti Bansal, who founded AppDynamics and sold it to Cisco for $3.7B. We’re backed with $425M in venture financing from top-tier VC and strategic firms, including J.P. Morgan, Capital One Ventures, Citi Ventures, ServiceNow, Splunk Ventures, Norwest Venture Partners, Adage Capital Partners, Balyasny Asset Management, Gaingels, Harmonic Growth Partners, Menlo Ventures, IVP, Unusual Ventures, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Alkeon Capital, Battery Ventures, Sorenson Capital, Thomvest Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank.

POSITION SUMMARY

Harness is looking for an experienced Product Manager to drive the definition, development and adoption of a new Harness product in the DevSecOps domain. In this role, you will define, build and bring to market the product while ensuring its end-to-end success. This is a high impact, high visibility role that requires immense cross-functional execution spanning Engineering, Sales, Marketing, UX, Research, Customer Success and Support.', 'KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Own the "whole" product experience
Engage with customers, develop insights into what is possible, and uncover unarticulated customer needs to drive customer success
Build product roadmap based on customers needs, market, and technology trends
Define product specs, user stories, mockups, and acceptance criteria in collaboration with other module PMs, engineering or independently
Interact and collaborate with Support, Customer Success, and field teams, to understand customer issues and drive business outcomes
Collaborate with Engineering, QA, SRE, and release teams to plan, drive and execute product releases cycles.
Collaborate with product marketing to support the creation of customer-driven messaging and content', 'ABOUT YOU
You are a hands-on product owner driven by data and research
You are a creative and passionate problem solver
You are able to think big while charting small steps towards the end goal
You are obsessed with customer research and design thinking
You can bring qualitative and quantitative insights together to drive sound decision making
You are obsessed with the little details and constantly optimizing for simplicity
3+ years of experience in DevSecOps or Software Supply Chain Security
Solid understanding of how developers and security teams use vulnerability scanners (such as SonarQube, Snyk, Palo Alto Prisma, Black Duck), SBOM generators (such as Anchore syft, Microsoft Salus) and SBOM standards (such as CycloneDX, SPDX)
5+ years of experience in product management with SaaS / Cloud companies
Good understanding of AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure
Strong analytical skills and data-driven product decision-making mindset
Strong communication skills, verbal and written', 'WHAT YOU WILL HAVE AT HARNESS
Competitive salary
Comprehensive healthcare benefits
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Paid Time Off and Parental Leave
Monthly, quarterly, and annual social and team building events
TGIF-Off program
Remote office stipend
Monthly internet reimbursement
Monthly Food & Beverage Reimbursement Program
#LI-REMOTE']

column1: Senior Field Marketing Manager – North America
column7: ['Worker Sub-Type:', '', 'Job Description:', '', 'Are you the person we are looking for?', '', 'BlackBerry QNX is a global leader in the embedded software industry. We are a well-respected and established software provider, trusted across multiple high performance industries. With increasing demand for complex embedded software systems BlackBerry QNX is well positioned for continued growth.', '', 'We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager, in a newly created role, to build and execute regional marketing programs across North America. This role requires experience working in a similar Business-2-Business environment and the ability to frame technical products in a compelling way for our target customers.', '']

['As a Technical Sales Consultant, you will be responsible for understanding detailed customer needs, defining how Origami solutions can meet those needs both in RFPs and in person, configuring and presenting complex solution demonstrations, and leading technical discussions. You will work side by side with the prospective customers translating technical and integration strengths and weaknesses to product management and engineering staff throughout the sales cycle.', '', 'Starting base pay for this role is between $100,000 and $125,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as transferable skills, work experience, business needs, training, location, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role will also be eligible for bonus and benefits.', '', 'Origami Risk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We thrive and benefit from diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees. We do not discriminate against any individual based upon race, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, color, sex, national origin, age, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.', 'Serving as a subject matter expert in the core operations of an enterprise partner looking to better risk management and Environmental Health and Safety practices.
Ability to engage in business consulting activities, capable of conducting detailed prospect discussions. Architecting solutions to address customer’s business requirements
Presenting customized demonstrations tailored to customer requirements. Preparation, configuration, and delivery of demonstrations
Contribute to / write customer-specific Origami proposals and Management Summary.
Contribute and support SOW generation.
Partnering with client business and technical teams to understand business objectives and integration requirements
Delivering business-oriented presentations to all levels of the customer organization including board level.
Leading or supporting prospect POCs as required
Leading the benefits assessment process and developing customized ROI/ROR analysis
Assist marketing with support for events, PR, seminars, and campaigns Help articulate cloud visions and SaaS offerings to new and existing clients', '5+ years of Technical Sales, Sales Engineer Consulting, or Implementation & Support experience required
Experience configuring demonstration systems built using modern software technology (application servers, relational databases, XML, etc.)
Knowledge of web and cloud technology (TCP/IP, HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, RESTful APIs)
Experience presenting across a range of audiences: front line personnel to senior executives
Bachelor’s Degree Required', '', 'Who We Are', '']

['Mclean, VA', "Exiger Government Solutions helps US and International governments and Defense Industrial Base companies surface and mitigate their supply chain, customer and vendor risk exposures which, undetected, present critical threats to the safety and well-being of their most valuable assets.
We are expanding our sales organization, and require skilled SaaS Sales Executives passionate about making the world a safer place to do business. With unlimited upside, Exiger’s go-to-market team arms clients with technology solutions powering their critical business decisions with speed and confidence. This quota-bearing role suits ambitious and self-propelled individuals who are capable of prospecting, following up on leads quickly, actively listening, conveying the value proposition of newly introduced technology, and forming strong relationships with their clients.
Exiger is in the middle of a period of explosive growth requiring dynamic team members who are excited to be part of building and shaping a winning and mission focused team. While the ability to work autonomously is a must, commitment to team and culture is just as important.
Key Responsibilities:
Meet sales quotas
Call on and pitch senior executives with confidence
Prioritize outcome-focused activities like prospecting, pitching and closing
Learn value proposition of Exiger’s technology-enabled solutions and effectively position with knowledge of a target’s biggest risk priorities
Become proficient with Exiger suite of SaaS tools and capable of delivering tailored and compelling demonstrations
Develop relationships across the business to support the overall mission of Exiger
Commit to a mindset of delivering excellence through continuous improvement
Grow relationships across new clients to mine for expanded partnership opportunities
Utilize CRM tools actively to manage leads, campaigns and pipeline
Learn elements of competitive products and effectively sell-against them
Own responsibility for progress to plan, pipeline value and personal conduct
Thrive in a fast-paced, high performing environment
Professional Experience Required:
Bachelor’s degree
2 years experience in new-logo B2B SaaS sales role with proven track record of success – ideally with US Government Federal Civilian markets.
US Citizen with ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance
Extensive customer service experience.
Ability to increase customer engagement.
Knowledge of customer relations management software and MS Office.
Outstanding communication and negotiation skills.
Analytical and time management skills.

This position is remote eligible within the United States, excluding residents of California, Colorado, or New York.
Exiger is revolutionizing the way corporations, government agencies and banks manage risk and compliance with a combination of technology-enabled and SaaS solutions. In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law."]

column7:
['How you will help', 'As a Director, Business Development, you will be focused on cultivating strategic and commercial relationships with industry partners who serve life sciences customers. You will drive new relationships with leading digital health, consulting, analytics, technology and other services firms. You’ll join our growing Partnerships and Real World Data Solutions team and be responsible for prospecting contacts, uncovering qualified opportunities, and winning new business. You will successfully expand our presence in assigned accounts by constantly looking for ways for HealthVerity to support our clients’ needs, at times shaping and driving deeper strategic partnerships. You will have a deep understanding of the healthcare data and analytics space, particularly around selling technology and data to senior-level stakeholders and end users.', '', 'What you will do', 'Generate revenue through new and existing relationships with the technology and services firms serving biopharmaceutical companies
Identify, evaluate and uncover preferred partners in the healthcare ecosystem to develop new relationships based on strategic initiatives
Position yourself as a consultative subject matter expert and the single point of contact between HealthVerity and your customers
Confidently and credibly present healthcare data and licensing solutions by leading product presentations, demonstrations, conference calls, technical discussions/due diligence, executive discussions, web seminars and related activities
Drive all stages of opportunity development from coordinating product proposals, RFIs, RFPs to contract negotiations and execution', '', 'About you', 'You are deeply knowledgeable about healthcare data (e.g., medical claims, prescription claims, EMR, lab) and how this data supports pharmaceutical companies through the product life cycle
You are deeply knowledgeable about life sciences-focused analytics (e.g, real-world evidence/HEOR, clinical operations and trials, commercial analytics) and related SaaS-based technology solutions
You are a seasoned consultative seller successful at uncovering and developing sales opportunities within top services and/or technology firms
You excel in the ability to manage the partner relationship from lead through implementation, as well as in “landing and expanding” in the pursuit of future opportunities
You have the ability to operate effectively in a complex white-space, concept-driven environment, and desire to work in an innovative, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial environment', '', 'Required skills and experience']

['OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY', 'Together Carbonite and Webroot form the SMB and Consumer Division of OpenText. The mission of our joint offering is to make cyber resilience simple, reliable and accessible in the connected world. We foster a thriving, dynamic environment rich with inventive minds and entrepreneurial spirit and our employees are empowered and encouraged to build their careers at OpenText.', '', 'The Opportunity', 'The combined Product Marketing team is seeking an experienced Product Marketing Manager to help us expand our product presence with small and medium businesses. For this highly visible and influential position, we want a superstar to become a product expert to define the direction and positioning of our SMB cyber security and data protection products as a holistic solution. The majority of our SMB sales are focused on Managed Service Provider (MSP) integration which we sometime sell to directly or through resellers such as Value-Added Distributors and Remote Monitoring & Management. Our business model is SAAS so an understanding of seat-based subscription pricing is desired.', '', 'In this role, you will leverage market and competitive analysis, champion end user viewpoints and drive go-to-market strategy in collaboration with your marketing peers. Your technology background and ability to clearly articulate value and differentiation for our sales team is highly desired in this role. As a practitioner of win/loss analysis you are adept at creating counter-selling tactics and kill sheets.', 'As a Product Marketer, you will be an integral part of a cross-functional team. You must possess a solid understanding of adoption models and business value for multiple channels. In addition, you have demonstrable experience developing and executing successful product growth strategies. You’ll bring your ability to analyze and recommend high potential opportunities, conduct primary and secondary market research, and define the sales enablement messaging for our portfolio and individual services.', '', 'Product Messaging:']
