column7:
['RingCentral is the #1 global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We’re a $1.5 billion company that’s growing at 30+% annually and we’re expanding our Partner Team to make sure we stay way ahead of the competition.', '', 'Ready to join the most innovative Marketing Program in the industry? RingCentral’s award-winning Marketing Team is a collaborative, goal-oriented organization that invests heavily in its people. Third parties like IHS Markit, Frost & Sullivan, and Aragon Research consistently list RingCentral.', '', 'To accelerate revenue growth within our existing customer base, the Customer Growth and Revenue team is seeking an experienced and strategic-minded senior manager. In this role, you will define, develop, and manage marketing programs with the goal of monetizing the satisfaction, loyalty, and growth of our upmarket customers. You must be comfortable performing a wide variety of tasks and working with multiple systems, teams, and KPIs in a fast-paced environment.', '', 'To be successful and effective in this role, your resourcefulness will be key. If you are a self-starter with great attention to detail and the ability to multi-task, then the role in this global, fast-paced environment definitely fits you!', '', 'What you get to do in this role:', 'Develop and execute customer demand gen strategies with a focus on the UpMarket segment and priority industry verticals to drive incremental revenue within the customer base through upsell/cross-sell motions.
Execute highly targeted multi-touch, multi-channel campaigns (1:1, 1:few, 1:many) that span from lead gen to sales opportunity.
Manage funnel conversion from customer engagement to lead creation to deal close and be accountable for pipeline and revenue goals.
Work cross-functionally to prioritize target accounts based off of propensity and account data models.
Partner cross-functionally with stakeholders including international marketing teams, marketing operations, product marketing and sales leadership to align marketing, business and customer priorities.
Communicate, educate, and update project health to key stakeholders on strategies, plans, and results.']

['Location:', 'Remote (USA)', 'About DispatchTrack', 'DispatchTrack is the leading solution provider of right-time delivery management software, helping top brands around the globe power successful deliveries 180 million times a year. Since 2010, DispatchTrack’s scalable SaaS platform has made delivery organizations more connected, agile, and intelligent, using highly-configurable capabilities designed to empower better delivery management from end to end. Our proprietary AI-powered routing algorithm ensures 98% ETA accuracy in last-mile deliveries. We’re constantly innovating to improve performance and better serve our 2,000+ customers, including Wal-Mart, Coca-Cola, Ashley, Ferguson Enterprises, and many others. When businesses make promises to their customers—DispatchTrack makes sure they deliver. Promise. Deliver. Delight.', 'Your Role as Senior Account Executive, Commercial Sales', 'As an Account Executive, Commercial Sales you will identify and close sales opportunities within a core portion of our market. You are a HUNTER and a self-starting closer who values strong and successful customer relationships. You understand the value of focused effort coupled with high activity. Working in tandem with the Sales Development Representative (SDR) team, you will quickly build a large sales pipeline, primarily within NEW LOGO accounts. Working with the balance of the team you create winning sales propositions and close business. Your responsibilities will include:', 'Build and execute a plan that drives ACV within a list of named accounts or geographic territory
Meet and exceed monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets
Generate new business opportunities through professional networking and cold calling
Quickly and aggressively follow up on leads generated by Marketing or the SDR team
Follow our MEDDIC sales methodology and maintain accurate opportunity pipeline and forecasting within Salesforce.com
Educate prospective customers on the value of the DispatchTrack solution and advise them on the most effective way to use the platform
Ensure 100% customer success and satisfaction; zero churn', 'Requirements', '4+ years of experience selling SaaS applications in a B2B environment
Track record of consistently meeting/exceeding sales quota
Experience selling to the Director/VP/SVP level
Strong preference for experience with delivery, logistics and/or transportation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be self-motivated; able to work independently and as part of a team
Must be comfortable in a rapidly changing, startup environment
Bachelor of Arts/Science degree strongly preferred
Once conditions permit, must be willing to travel (50%)', 'DispatchTrack is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state, and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status, and other protected classifications.']
['Company:', '', '', '', 'Zip Code:', '', '', '', 'Minimum Level of Education:', '']

['OUR VISION: THE WORLD. SUBSCRIBED.', "Customers have changed. They're looking for new ways to engage with businesses. Consumers today have a new set of expectations. They want outcomes, not ownership. Customization, not generalization. Constant improvement, not planned obsolescence.", "In the old world (let's call it the Product Economy) it was all about things. Acquiring new customers, shipping commodities, billing for one-time transactions. But in today's new era, it's all about relationships. More and more customers are becoming subscribers because subscription experiences built around services meet consumers' needs better than the static offerings or a single product.", 'Our vision is "The World Subscribed" where one day every company will be a part of the Subscription Economy® (a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo and author of the best selling book Subscribed).', 'YOUR MISSION :', "Lead, Inspire, and deliver Zuora's pricing function, including cross functional alignment, pricing and package strategy, product portfolio management , profitable growth and governance.", 'THE OPPORTUNITY (AKA: Why you want this role over any other out there)', "The Senior Director of Pricing Strategy will be responsible for the overall pricing strategy for Zuora's portfolio of new and existing products and packages. This includes defining the strategies for monetization, pricing and customer adoption. Other activities include developing models and tools to aid sales in setting pricing for products and services. Analyze market price trends to ensure product prices are set competitively", 'Who are you? You are part of the finance team who will partner closely with Product Management, Product marketing, Sales, Revenue accounting and others to analyze product requirements, develop pricing proposals, set policies, implement best practices, define playbooks and ensure pricing compliance. The role will require someone who has a SAAS background or experience working with the industry.', 'You will have a high level of executive visibility and significant responsibility, being the subject-matter expert for pricing for all Zuora products and packages.']

column7:
['360Learning is looking for a Senior Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our US Outbound team. Your role will consist of generating opportunities from 360Learning top priority, highest potential accounts. As the owner of these accounts, you will be in charge of developing personalized outreach strategies to connect with target personas and transform intent signals into a sales pipeline.

More specifically, you will be in charge of your territory to create and qualify cold outbound leads and contact potential customers through cold-calls, email, and LinkedIn. Throughout your conversations, you will detect customer pain points, understand their context, and how we can help. You will evangelize collaborative learning in the market, and pitch the 360Learning value proposition.

To achieve your goals, you will benefit from top-notch ABM capabilities: every day, you will receive insights into which accounts to target based on their web activity, and a pre-built list of contacts to reach out to, as well as inbound leads generated from the interest you have created at accounts. Working in close collaboration with your coach, marketing operations, demand gen, and sales, you will benefit from thorough onboarding and continuous learning & coaching opportunities as you grow.', 'Within 1 month, you will:
Finish onboarding and begin your core role as a senior BDR
Master the pitch and qualification methodology
Start qualifying leads and create your first opportunities', 'Within 3 months, you will:
Fully master our tool stack and ramp up on outbound
Own 360Learning top priority accounts based on intent and company profile
Create your first opportunities on 360Learning top priority accounts', 'Within 6 months, you will:
Be fully ramped on ABM and outbound methodologies
Reach 100% of monthly targetDetect & share opportunities to improve our ABM and outbound processes', 'Within 12 months, you will:
Be eligible to transition to a BDR coach or AE role
Contribute as a subject matter expert on sales development, ABM and outbound and share your knowledge with the rest of the organization', "The Skills Set
Previous experience of at least 9-12 months hitting targets as an Enterprise BDR/SDR in a B2B SaaS environment
Previous experience in outbound and/or account-based marketing
Strong written and oral communication skills
Passion for learning and education
Preferred but not mandatory: experience using Salesforce, Salesloft, and Gong
Bachelor's degree
Enthusiasm about the idea of working in our Culture of Convexity", "What We Offer
Compensation: Competitive salary which includes a variable component and equity
Benefits/Perks: Comprehensive medical, vision and dental insurance, 401k matching starting the 1st day. Generous parental leave policy. Level up your skills with our very own platform. View our CSR charter.
Balance: We offer 20 days of annual PTO + 5 days for sick leave + holidays! We are remote-friendly and promote flexible work hours.
International team: Offices in London, New York and Paris
Culture: A framework that will make you successful - envision what's it like to join 360Learning from onboarding to ramp-up, and beyond: https://360learning.com/blog/360learner-journey/", 'Interview Process
Call with our recruiter (30 mins)
Discovery Interview with the coach (30 mins)
Discovery Interview with a member of our sales team (30 mins)
Case study with the team (30 mins)
Culture Fit with a founder (30 mins)
Offer!', '', 'Who We Are
360Learning enables companies to upskill from within by turning their experts into champions for employee, customer, and partner growth. With our LMS for collaborative learning, Learning & Development teams can accelerate upskilling with the help of internal experts instead of slow top-down training. 360Learning is the easiest way to onboard and upskill employees, train customer-facing teams, and enable customers and partners–all from one place.

360Learning powers the future of work at 1,700 organizations. Founded in 2013, 360Learning has raised $240 million with 400+ team members across the US and EMEA.

Learning Includes Everyone.
In concert with our culture, 360Learning believes learning includes everyone and that means embracing the strengths of diversity, connectedness, and inclusion. Through conscientious efforts, our global footprint celebrates cultures, perspectives, and experiences from all over the world to support our platform that is built for all regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. Thus, 360Learning is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we commit to continue this throughout our processes for recruitment, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion, and all other conditions and terms of employment. We want to learn from and with you!']

['We are building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make - every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there is an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation.', "Avalara is investing in building out its Global Analytics & Insights team to actively engage partners to help envision and define strategies to drive growth, enter new markets, create new business models, and improve operational performance by leveraging Avalara's platform and capabilities. The Insights Team is responsible for engaging and advising senior leaders from our customers on how to grow their SaaS business and deliver additional value to their customers and partners leveraging Avalara.

Our Insights Team combines their practical experience in business transformation with strong analytical skills to align with executives on critical priorities and prescribe solutions to meet their objectives, such as: Creating new business models and driving operational efficiency using Avalara's capabilities. This team builds and develops trusted advisor relationships with customers, partners, and internally across Avalara. The team's experience and thought leadership is shared through executive interactions.

Responsibilities", "Empower Customer Success (CS) organization with actionable insights around customer satisfaction, customer journey, and operational efficiency, thereby enhancing CS contribution to company's strategy
Deliver real-time data and KPIs to help CS execs better understand customers behavior, optimize customers' use of products and services, increase retention/reduce churn by anticipating issues and identifying opportunities, and proactively improve customer support
Work closely with the data platform and data visualization teams to implement an analytics framework required for marketing and sales insights
Collaborate with CS organization to set the roadmap and prioritization for the CS data insights team. Look beyond the immediate tasks on the team to prioritize initiatives that will enable the team to scale to meet its future needs
Manage, nurture and grow our CS insights team. Develop their skills and experience through investing time in detailed reviews of their work, coaching specific skill areas and collaborating on career development paths
Develop executive engagement models, executive readouts, and business case content, as well as systems, to scale and measure and drive consensus among decision-makers
Proactively identify and surface opportunities to increase marketing efficiency, improve conversion rates and optimize customer acquisition cost", '', 'Key Activities Include', 'Build strategic vision for insights at Avalara to support Customer Success organization (over 700+ people departments)
Provide comprehensive day-to-day analytics support to customer success teams, develop tools and resources to empower data access and self-service so your expertise can be leveraged where it is most impactful
Develop prototypes to surface insights and share findings, make specific and actionable recommendations to influence business decisions', '', '', "Minimum of 12 years of work experience in data analysis, analytics, or business intelligence is required.
Bachelor's degree in technical or STEM major
Minimum of 4 years work experience with exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing
Minimum of 5 years work experience using SQL or other data analysis languages to drive insights from data
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Highly adept at navigating cross-functional business processes and industry trends
Successful history of developing and growing strategic relationships at the senior level
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with deep experience presenting to senior management
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and impacting results", 'Preferred Qualifications']

column1: Global Head of Charging Sales, Ford Pro
column7:
['About Ford
Ford Motor Company was built on the belief that freedom of movement drives human progress. It’s a belief that has fueled our passion to create great cars and trucks. Today, it drives our commitment to become the world’s most trusted mobility company, designing vehicles for a smart world that helps people move more safely, confidently, and freely. We are dedicated to delivering distinctive products/solutions, having an “always on” relationship (Ford+) with customers and continuously improving user experience.', 'The Opportunity', 'The Global Head of Charging Sales is responsible for the strategic and day-to-day operations of the Ford Pro Charging sales team and will be responsible for growing and leading an established successful team (managers and individual contributors) who prospect and sell to new and existing Ford Pro customers. The Global Head will be accountable for setting the strategy, establishing goals, motivating the team, and developing staff across all levels to build a repeatable, predictable, and scalable model to help hit product portfolio sale targets, globally.', 'Key aspects of the role include developing and continuously improving the team dynamics, people, culture, and processes with an end to providing a high-quality pipeline and corresponding reproducible revenue streams.', 'The Team/Organization', 'Ford Pro is the global business and brand within Ford dedicated to delivering products and services to commercial and government customers of all sizes to accelerate productivity, growth, and sustainability. They integrate a digitally powered suite of Software, Charging, Service and Financing for work vehicles. Our Ford Pro Solutions Team simplifies the fragmented fleet system and makes it easy for customers by designing and selling the right end-to-end solution for their business. Our Ford Pro Intelligence then brings together everything the customer needs in one suite of digital services under our proprietary cloud-based platform. Our end-to-end products and services work across gas, electric, and even non-Ford vehicles.', 'Position reports to Dave Prusinski, Global Chief Revenue Officer, Ford Pro, who reports to Ted Cannis, Chief Operating Officer (CEO), Ford Pro. This r ole will consider candidates who are remote/hybrid, based in the United States.', 'What you’ll be able to do:', 'Based on your previous experience in the EV Charging / Fleet industry you work in close collaboration with the leadership team to develop the go-to-market approach, propositions, and pricing strategy per targeted market.
Continually refine the customer acquisition strategy for Ford Pro Charging by providing a positive and efficient purchasing experience for buyers from initial engagement through purchase completion. The goal should be to orient the sales process around the buyer’s journey.
Build a sales culture that fosters integrity and excellence while focusing on executing against objectives in an efficient sales cadence
In conjunction with Sales Operations via CRM, develop and report board level key sales metrics weekly/monthly including opportunity conversion, sales velocity, prospecting, closed won and lost sales and revenue/unit attainment by reporting period.
Lead revenue forecasting by analyzing business tactics, performance analysis and sales strategies, market research and competitor analysis.
Work with your existing sales management team to build, scale and coach the sales team to effectively service existing Ford customers and new prospects
Identify and implement processes and technology solutions that improve the sales process and customer journey while increasing conversion and lowering cost of acquisition
Work with marketing to align go to market materials and programs that support customer engagement and lead generation campaigns
Work with sales leadership, finance, and sales operations to implement target and commission structures that drive quota exceeding results
Work with customer success to ensure a world class customer onboarding experience while focusing on continual churn reduction
Be a part of and contribute to the Ford Pro Intelligence leadership team regarding strategic planning, shared best practices and process / product development', 'The Person']

['At Rebound Communications, we know that putting the right people in the right seats is essential to our success, and with the right people on board, anything is possible. The experience, integrity, and commitment that our employees bring to the table are key to our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay ahead of their competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for Rebound Communications and for the people who work here.', 'Senior Consultant, Event Project Management:', 'The Senior Consultant, Event Project Management is an integral part of the Rebound consulting team and is responsible for working with client B2B marketing leadership to successfully execute in-person, virtual and hybrid events. Depending on the size of the event, this position may work independently or with other members of the Rebound and client team from the initial conception of the event to its successful completion. This role requires excellent project management skills to define project milestones and deadlines, coordination with internal client teams, and relationship management with industry event organizers to ensure a successful event presence that meets organizational goals and expectations.', "This position will start off as contract, with the potential to go full-time/permanent. Once full-time, this person will also have responsibilities within Rebound. The Senior Consultant may be a component of the sales process, working with leadership to create presentations and proposal responses demonstrating Rebound's capabilities and expertise to meet client needs. Other responsibilities may include onboarding and mentoring event consultants, training cross-functional teams on the Rebound approach to virtual events and developing and/or updating internal playbooks to reflect Rebound processes and best practices.", '', 'Core Responsibilities:', 'Client Relations & Billable Work', 'Understand the business challenge and what the client wants to achieve with in-person and virtual events
Types of events may include client participation at industry events and client-hosted events (including national sales meetings and thought leadership conferences)
Manage all event logistics
For in-person events this may include coordination of venue selection, transportation, lodging, entertainment, etc.
For virtual events this may include managing timelines and deadlines related to abstract submission, speaker presentation development, pre-recorded speaker sessions, coordination with Marketing Automation for promotional activities, alignment with sales, and coordination with marketing teams for post-conference nurture campaigns
Utilize Rebound playbooks and processes to ensure a consistent deliverable
Provide project management and reporting for client engagements', 'Internal Rebound Responsibilities', 'Contribute to the development of proprietary Rebound models (e.g., tools, accelerators, processes etc.) and intellectual property (e.g., playbooks) to ensure consistency of delivery across clients
Contribute to the development of practice area collateral, offerings, and supporting sales materials']

column1: Senior Manager Sales Performance Management (SPM) System

column7:
['Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favorite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organizations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organization. With Confluent, organizations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.

We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to roll up their sleeves and help realize Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.

About the Role
Confluent is looking for an experienced professional with a blend of product marketing, strategy, and GTM skills to fill a highly visible role for our Product Marketing team. The Senior Product Marketing Manager role will help drive the end-to-end GTM success of our products, partnering across Product Management, Growth & Marketing, and Sales & Field Operations to prioritize and orchestrate key GTM activities. The responsibilities of this role include driving the segmentation, targeting, and positioning for our products, leading cross-functional GTM initiatives, defining the adoption and monetization strategy for the product, and identifying any feature/functionality gaps inhibiting GTM success.

As a successful candidate for this role, you have a proven track record of leading cross-functional initiatives to drive customer adoption, monetization, and retention of a technical product, particularly for high-tech companies with subscription and/or SaaS/Cloud business models. You also have a strong ability to think strategically, communicate clearly in both verbal and written form, and are an eager self-starter who is comfortable working in a rapidly growing company with a fast-paced working environment.', 'What You Will Do:
Define and prioritize key GTM activities across our product portfolio to complement the product roadmap and meet product-attach success metrics
Drive cross-functional product launches and marketing campaigns, ensuring the Field and other GTM teams are properly enabled to execute
Partner with key stakeholders to define the adoption and pricing/packaging strategy of key product areas to increase customer adoption and product revenue
Craft compelling persona-based messaging and sales assets to convey the value of Confluent to our prospects and customers
Assess the effectiveness of GTM and adoption initiatives, leveraging analytics and benchmarking for data-driven prioritization, and create action plans to address hotspots
Identify any product gaps inhibiting GTM success and work with Product Management to prioritize customer needs into the roadmap', 'What You Will Bring:
5-7+ years of experience in enterprise software (subscription and/or SaaS/Cloud) GTM; Product Marketing, Product Management, or top-tier Management Consulting experience preferred
Strong technical foundation and ability to pick up and understand product/tech concepts (e.g., engineering degree and/or product experience)
Distinctive problem-solving, strategic, and analytical capabilities (Excel required, SQL nice-to-have)
Ability to navigate and succeed in a fast-paced, dynamic, hyper-growth business environment with track record of building trusted relationships with senior stakeholders
Strong communications skills required – both verbal and written
Demonstrated record of working both independently and with a team to own cross-functional initiatives and exceed performance expectations & metrics
MBA or equivalent experience (e.g., management consulting) and technical undergrad degree (e.g., computer science, engineering, applied mathematics, economic)', 'At Confluent, we are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry standards. We analyze and carefully consider several factors when determining compensation, including work history, education, professional experience and location. This position has an annual estimated salary of $174,500 - $200,700 USD, an annual bonus, and a competitive equity package. The actual pay may vary depending on your skills, qualifications, experience and work location. In addition, Confluent offers a wide range of employee benefits. To learn more about our benefits click HERE.

#LI-MT1

Come As You Are

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Confluent requires all employees (in office and remote) in the U.S. to be vaccinated for COVID-19. Consistent with federal, state, and local requirements, Confluent will consider requests for reasonable accommodation based on medical conditions/contraindications or sincerely-held religious beliefs where it is able to do so without undue hardship to the company.

Click here to review our Candidate Privacy Notice, which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of job applicants and prospective employees.

#LI-Remote']

['Type of Employee: Full Time', 'Druva enables cyber, data and operational resilience for every organization with the Data Resiliency Cloud, the industry’s first and only at scale SaaS solution. Customers can radically simplify data protection, streamline data governance, and gain data visibility and insights as they accelerate cloud adoption. Druva pioneered a SaaS-based approach to eliminate complex infrastructure and related management costs, and deliver data resilience via a single platform spanning multiple geographies and clouds.', 'Druva is trusted by thousands of enterprises, including 60 of Fortune 500, to make data more resilient and accelerate their journey to the cloud. Visit druva.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.', 'The Role & The Team:', 'Druva is looking to hire a Sr. Sales Engineer based out of the Atlanta Metro Area. This Sr. Sales Engineer will be a key technical advisor to Druva customers as they develop their cloud backup solution and be able to articulate Druva’s technical and product positioning to a variety of business and technical stakeholders throughout the sales cycle, forging strong relationships with them.', 'In this role, you will drive the technical evaluation stage of the overall sales process, making you a critical driver of customer success as data governance becomes more important and necessary in the modern enterprise. You will be the key technical advisor to the Sales teams and work closely with our Product teams, Professional Services and Customer Support teams.', 'The ability to effectively scale your interactions from highly technical I.T. staff to key stakeholders at the Executive level is a must. Flexibility in your current skill set and a demonstrable eagerness to learn new things are key criteria to any candidates for this position. You will work in a team of individual contributors who are empowered to make decisions and run their day to business.', 'The ideal candidate must be self-motivated with a proven track record in software/technology sales or consulting. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges. We are looking for candidates who are comfortable at the intersection of technology and business.', 'What You Will Do:', 'Deliver awe-inspiring technical product presentations and demos, provide timely and insightful responses to customer queries, and recommend creative ways Druva can solve customer problems
Understand and participate in answering the functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
Perform remote installations, training, and ensure the success of customer POCs
Effectively communicate customer requirements to the Product management team
Meet business objectives, working in collaboration with Sales Executives in the region']

['SALT LAKE CITY, UT /
R&D – PRODUCT /
FULL-TIME
/ HYBRID', "OUR MISSION
At Artemis Health, we are dedicated to helping fix the broken health care system by empowering U.S. employers, their advisors and payers to optimize health benefits using data. We offer the most innovative and easy-to-use benefits analytics technology on the market today. More than 10 million employees and their families are receiving better, more affordable healthcare because their employers are leveraging insights from Artemis. Together we can bring America's runaway healthcare costs more in line with the rest of the world.

OUR CULTURE
Artemis is committed to being compassionate and caring in the way we treat our customers and our employees. We work hard at what we do because we know we are making a difference in the lives of the people we work with. We take ownership in what we do, and we are transparent with our team members as well as our customers. We are building a team in which diversity is valued, equity is striven for, and inclusion is embraced.
WHO YOU ARE
Artemis Health is looking for a Senior Director of Product who will report to our General Manager. You have an excellent ability to connect the dots across the healthcare domain using data and analytics solutions, around reducing cost, improving quality and driving patient/consumer outcomes. You love to discover new ideas and build business cases! You excel at partnering with peers and your teams to determine viability of the solution. Most importantly, you are passionate about using your healthcare domain knowledge and technology skills to deliver software products that delight end-users and bring ROI to buyers!
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Perform in-depth healthcare market analysis:
Become the resident domain expert in healthcare data/analytics trends
Develop strong understanding of target market/customer needs
Track competitive landscape to identify differentiating value propositions
Articulate the impact/opportunity for our business

Develop business cases:
Engage with anchor clients, executive/customer advisory teams and strategic partners for discovering and validating solution opportunities
Create and maintain an idea backlog for new opportunities; validate and prioritize on an ongoing basis
Develop business cases and strategy proposals for targeted opportunities, including build/buy/partner feasibility, go-to-market, financial ROI and business/technical/operational KPIs; partner with product leads on detailed scope, MVP design and roadmap

Partner across teams to bring maximum product value to our customers:
Ensure right technical decisions are being taken for growth and scale
Partner with the product leads to prioritize roadmap to balance new innovation, necessary enhancements to features that clients love, and platform scalability
Communicate progress against roadmap and engage in prioritization discussions with customers and internal stakeholders
Use utilization analytics and invest in user engagement to inform the roadmap
Raise the bar continuously for predictable, high-quality product releases
Lead the team in a shared accountability model with clarity of context and goals
Coach and mentor team members to grow in their respective career paths

Evangelize product strategy:
Partner with Marketing to enable innovation and strategy message
Collaborate with Sales on targeted prospect/client outreach on strategy/innovation partnership
Continuously connect the dots with healthcare outcomes for R&D team on the context for their priorities of new products and scaling existing
Dissemination of critical market/industry trends and impact/opportunities for our business to internal stakeholder teams, incl. C-suite

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
WHAT YOU’LL HAVE:
5+ years of experience working in a leadership role in a Healthcare SaaS or a healthcare technology company, and/or a in a similar role at a healthcare payer/provider
10+ years of proven experiences in B2B technology – concept, strategy, build vs buy, discovery, scoping, requirements, prioritization, program/project management, release management, training, documentation, internal/external evangelism
Excellent speaking and writing skills, including published work and event presentations
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and manage priorities in order to deliver on goals
Results driven with great communication and collaboration skills
Self-starter who is willing to go above and beyond
Ability to travel ~25%"]

['Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 25,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.', '', 'We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!', '', 'Job Description', '', 'Rockwell Automation is an industry leader in Industrial automation. The industry and market are transforming as part of digital transformation efforts. Bringing in edge to cloud enabled industrial automation with simplicity at the forefront will be a game changer in the industrial world. Our organization and company will be at that forefront.', '', 'We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager with a technical background in descriptive and diagnostic analytics who has demonstrated experience working closely with engineering teams, and is business savvy with an understanding of pricing, positioning, and go to market of products.', '']

column7:
["Blue Sky eLearn is hiring a Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) with an exceptional track record of success to help lead the Company through its next phase of growth. Reporting to the CEO, the mission of the CRO will be to develop and lead an industry leading go-to-market team and optimize the sales and marketing functions to drive new bookings and ARR growth. The CRO will serve as a strategic business partner to the Senior Leadership Team and Board of Directors and be a key contributor to the Company's growth initiatives and strategy.", 'The right person for this role is a high energy, hands-on, data-driven, and accountable leader who can work with department leaders across the company to achieve the business goals of pipeline generation, customer engagement, retention, and ARR growth.', 'This position will be based out of Southern California with remote work options available.', 'Responsibilities', 'Create and execute a comprehensive go-to-market strategy. Lead with best practices and processes to optimize sales & marketing strategies.
Drive performance and alignment of the sales and marketing functions.
Collaborate with Customer Experience Department to develop retention and expansion strategies.
Collaborate with R&D and Customer Experience teams to incorporate customer feedback into product roadmap.
Employ a data-driven approach and ROI mentality to evaluate, execute, and monitor go-to-market activities.
Be accountable for results, focusing on both long- and short-term strategies; take responsibility for accurate forecasting and meeting/exceeding agreed upon bookings and ARR targets.
Scale the sales and marketing organization by recruiting, training, and retaining a highly skilled, diverse, and accountability-focused team.
Collaborate with sales management to optimize the selling process, including forecast methodologies, sales strategy, sales management systems, and compensation programs; develop and implement effective operational processes and discipline.
Use data-driven approaches and concise reporting to develop marketing strategy, and more importantly, execute on those strategies by turning them into quantifiable outcomes that improve efficiency, conversion rates, pipeline, and bookings.
Leverage market research to define the Company’ s ideal customer profile and assess additional verticals for new business generation and continued expansion.', 'Requirements', '10+ years of successful sales leadership experience offering B2B SaaS and services with experience scaling and managing all aspects of go-to-market.
Proven track record of growing revenue through new product development, marketing, branding, and partnerships.
Significant general management and P&L experience.
Proven experience developing and executing an effective business strategy.
Significant experience creating, defining and operationalizing go-to-market strategies.
Team oriented collaborator with excellent communication, presentation, and executive presence.
Track record of success building and motivating sales teams and consistent ability to deliver quarterly bookings and ARR targets.
Experience with a CRM and sales enablement tools in support of building, analyzing, and optimizing the sales process.
Four-year degree required.', 'Benefits', 'Part-time, remote work available
100% employer paid medical and dental for employee only coverage with the option to upgrade to premium plans as well as obtain dependent coverage
100% employer paid short-term disability and basic life insurance
Competitive paid time off package including dedicated vacation, sick, volunteer and bereavement leave
11 paid company holidays (8 regular + 3 floating holidays)
Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave to welcome a child to your family
A 401(k) program with employer match to help support your long-term financial plans
Annual professional development reimbursement', 'About Blue Sky eLearn']

column7:
['Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.', "Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future. Too often it's because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium-sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.", 'Revenue Marketing & Enablement is the backbone of the Revenue team, supporting Sales, Partnerships, Customer Onboarding, and Customer Success. This dynamic team is seeking an imaginative, adaptable, and self-starting Instructional Designer who wants to create meaningful learning experiences through practical, effective and scalable training. The Senior Instructional Designer will work closely with Revenue leaders, Partner Marketing, and other Enablement team members to design, develop, and maintain the future of our impactful learning programs. This role reports to the Manager, Instructional Design & LMS.', "You're the right fit for this role if you have a passion for the adult learning process, seek out collaborative environments, thrive on problem-solving, and default to action. And as we go 24,791 mph, you should be comfortable with change.", 'What you get to do every day', 'Tackle projects of greater complexity and assume responsibility for larger numbers of deliverable assets related to a common outcome. When a gap can't be adequately addressed with single-threaded instruction, keep designing until all the angles are covered
Collaborate with facilitators, field leaders, and subject matter experts (SMEs) to design and develop innovative online, blended, and web-enhanced courses
Lead and oversee course design and development projects
Facilitate course review process to ensure alignment with field expectations and needs
Regularly assess, adjust, and create learning materials to ensure our learning solutions are up to date and keeping pace with product changes/releases
Lead stakeholders through the design process and make key recommendations for design with learner's needs in mind
Identify and recommend the use of instructional design strategies, technologies, and applications
Leverage rapid, agile development techniques and processes to produce content quickly
Research new and emerging instructional design innovations and trends
Facilitate "Train the Trainer" sessions for new and existing content resulting in consistency in delivery
Maintain a deep understanding of key Human Interest products and develop learning experiences that help clients leverage this service to achieve their business objectives
Strive to continually innovate the learning experience', 'What you will accomplish', 'Demonstrate the effectiveness of instruction by aligning training assets with measurable indicators across a comprehensive program, show how tough problems can be addressed with international learning activities
Improve our ability to solve by partnering with operational leaders to enhance team member skills
Increase velocity by building best in class training programs that empower Human Interest to continue scaling the organization at a rapid pace, without sacrificing the quality of the training and onboarding experience
Create and execute training solutions that augment existing programs and launch brand-new offerings that support the launch of new teams, processes and products', 'What you bring to the role', 'BA degree or equivalent years of experience required
5+ years of experience in Instructional Design or related Learning and Development position
Minimum two years experience designing sales-centric training content
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in an organized, efficient manner in a fast pace with changing requirements
Strong attention to detail, project management skills, and can work independently with cross-functional teams
Well-versed in problem identification, needs and learner analysis, educational strategies, curriculum strategies and requirements scoping, adult learning theory, implementation strategies, and effective evaluation and feedback methods
Experience in Docebo is a plus
Startup and SaaS background is preferred']

["WalkMe pioneered the Digital Adoption Platform (DAP) to empower business leaders to realize the promise of technology in today's overwhelming digital world. Through WalkMe's guidance, engagement, insights, and automation, employees are more efficient, executives have better visibility into digital usage, and organizations maximize the full value of their digital assets to empower digital transformation.

About the Role
As an Enterprise Account Executive at WalkMe, you will report to a Regional Director of Sales and seek new logos while expanding revenue in existing accounts. You will use Salesforce, Clari, LinkedIn and other best of breed applications to run your sales process. WalkMe Account Executives lead a consultative sales cycle, based on Value-Selling, across multiple stakeholders and departments within each account.", "What You'll Own
Manage sales activity and forecasting of revenue in Salesforce
Manage the entire sales process from introduction to close, over the phone/video and in person
Work with all levels of the target organizations, including senior executives at Enterprise accounts
Maintain weekly sales forecast and achieve quarterly quota based on annual targets
Present WalkMe solutions using a value-selling approach and methodology", 'What You Need to Succeed
5 years of experience selling a SaaS Solution to Enterprise accounts
A deep domain experience (ex: Banking/FSIs/Healthcare) or a combination of vertical and industry experience
You have a curiosity for uncovering your customer needs
You are passionate for solving customer challenges with new technology
If you have used WalkMe, let us know that too!', "What you will love about us!
Comprehensive Health Care Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision for our Employees and Families, 401(k) with company matching program, Parental Leave programs, and a vacation policy to encourage a healthy work-life balance.
WalkMe offices are open for those who chose to come (vaccines required) with in-person and virtual social activities to promote positive employee engagement
WalkMe is recognized as a Star Performer in DAP for the 2nd year in a row
WalkMe helps international companies such as: IBM, LinkedIn, Walgreens, Microsoft, Adobe, Hershey's, Quest Diagnostics and more", "At WalkMe, we approach Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) with the same level of collaboration, innovation and accountability that we bring to the rest of our business. We believe in the value of diversity and are committed to ensuring an equitable and inclusive workplace where every employee has an equal opportunity to achieve success.

We've made this commitment not only because it's the right thing to do, but also because we know that having diverse perspectives, experiences and identities on our team helps us to better meet the diverse needs of our global clients. While we're not yet where we want to be, our goal is to create a workplace as fair and inclusive as our business is category defining. And at WalkMe, we achieve our goals.

How We'll Take Care Of You

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base pay for this role is between $112,500 and $180,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, benefits, and RSUs as part of our competitive total rewards package.

TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: WalkMe does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to WalkMe employees or any other company location. WalkMe is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company for this specific role."]

['As a Senior Technical Engineer (as a part of the Customer Success team), you will handle customer technical support efforts by investigating and resolving technical issues involving our existing customer base as well as presales prospects. Become a subject matter expert on our platform, lead and engage customers while acting as a focal point on Cavirin’s Sales and Engineering teams.', 'Duties:', 'Demonstrate our product’s capabilities and its ability to solve specific customer problems, while contributing to build referenceable accounts and positive brand awareness. Help meet revenue targets and help upsell the installed base, while also focusing on customer success and satisfaction by attending customer meetings, and sharing your learnings about how they work with the sales team. Be a pro-active team player, aiming to get the best out of those around you. Participate and work closely with engineering teams to continue to build your technical expertise. You will also:', 'Be the main technical resource to answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration / on-boarding
Understanding the technical complexities of our product and our platform and be able to “dig in deep” alongside our engineering team to resolve issues
Assume the responsibility of the quickly solving technical issues affecting our customers and presales prospects
Partner with our customer’s engineering teams to investigate resolve technical issues
Represent Cavirin’s technology and provide understanding and clarity to technical issues and questions
Use a lab and test environments to investigate situations and scenarios that may arise in the field
Review new product releases and provide feedback to our product and engineering teams
Document resolutions to solved issues and generally contribute to the technical and engineering knowledge base and roadmap
Help customers plan and understand the best way to utilize the Cavirin platform based on business needs and plans
Help define and/or optimize Cavirin’s customer success procedures and best practices
Work with customers and finance to understand and ensure license renewals', 'Responsibilities:', 'Handle customer support issues and paths for escalation
Win customer confidence
Proactively follow up and close open issues with customers (i.e., checking back)
Participate in and sometimes develop customer training in conjunctions with sales and engineering
Coordinate with sales and engineering teams
Provide feedback to product management for customer feature requests
Participate in sales, marketing and partner events, and contribute to overall team success', 'Requirements:', 'Bachelor’s degree and or experience in working in a customer success or pre-sales role in the software industry
Quick learner in understanding technologies relating to customer environments
Ability to troubleshoot issues and provide solutions
Strong selling skills and impressive communication skills (written and oral)
Technical knowledge and experience with security, IP networking, DevOps concepts, IT Infrastructure, scripting (i.e., python), the public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google), SaaS delivery models, Windows, Linux and virtualization such as VMware', 'Technical Expertise:', 'Expert level expertise with:']

column1: B2B Senior Revenue Operations Manager, North America
column7:
['We are looking for a Senior Revenue Operations Manager to support our growing B2B team in the US market. You will be a key player in our team as we accelerate our growth in this strategic revenue channel.', 'About Babbel:', "At Babbel, we believe that everyone should have the chance to learn a new language. Our products are available worldwide across multiple platforms and support those who take joy in learning outside of work or school. Millions of users are benefiting from 9,000+ hours of language content created by Babbel's team of in-house language experts. Our professionally-designed courses are available for 14 languages via the Babbel website as well as on mobile devices, podcasts, and in live virtual classes through our new Babbel Live product.", "Babbel has been recognized on the GSV EdTech 150 list for multiple years. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app-based and virtual-class language learning. More than 750 team members from 68 countries share in Babbel's mission to enable everyone to learn a new language. Babbel is headquartered in Berlin and has an office in New York City.", 'About this role:', 'Reporting to the Director of B2B Sales and Customer Success with a dotted line to our global RevOps team in Berlin, this role is responsible for ensuring a smooth and efficient revenue process for the US team.', 'If you love making revenue happens, eliminating blockers, and driving insights while working with a highly motivated team, read on!', 'In this role you will:', 'Create, implement and optimize the processes, data and applications that support the B2B team in the US
Work closely with the US Director and other team managers to optimize processes and make strategic decisions based on data
Collaborate closely, yet remotely, with the Revenue Operations team in our Berlin headquarters
Ensure accuracy of all data, reports and sales forecasting in the CRM
Support data-driven decision making within the organization by acting as key stakeholder for reports and ad hoc analyses of US B2B performance
Increase GTM effectiveness and sales productivity by simplifying and automating existing processes
Help drive adoption of new and existing tools, software, and processes through documentation and training
Improve lead-to-deal processes, proposals, and sales enablement
Facilitate knowledge sharing, documentation of processes, sharing of best practice, and training within the sales team and other relevant stakeholders
Collaborate with accounting to ensure accuracy of compensation and incentive plan data for the US team using the tool CaptivateiQ
Support our Pre-sales, Sales, and Customer Success teams and executives, including with deliverables such as board reviews, monthly dashboard reporting, OKRs, strategic planning, and more', 'You have:']

column7:
['Our Mission', 'Sharebite is the leading food ordering platform built for companies to feed their employees. Our platform allows their employees to place meal orders with their favorite restaurants while helping to combat food insecurity in local communities. Every meal ordered on Sharebite results in a meal donation through local partners like Feeding America and City Harvest, and to date, we have donated over 5 million meals.', 'The Role', 'We are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our Corporate Sales team and focus on exciting enterprise customers and brands with 5,000+ full-time employees. As a key senior sales team member, you will develop yourself as a trusted advisor that empowers and enables our clients by coaching them on the set of tools and solutions that Sharebite offers.', "What You'll Do", 'Establish and develop a strategy for identifying and closing net new sales opportunities
Own the prospecting process in partnership with your assigned sales development representative to identify the best path to the sale
Collaborate and lead the successful execution of sales activities through contract negotiation and signed contracts with internal and external teams
Target buyer personas and stakeholders (primarily HR / People, Workplace Experience Teams, Benefits, & Finance) that are looking for solutions as the workplace evolves to meet the needs of a post-pandemic economy
Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas of the product
Maintain pipeline activity in CRM, regularly updating for the Executive team and Board', 'Required Skills & Experience', '', 'Verifiable record of top performance in a full cycle B2B sales role with at least 2 years selling to Enterprise accounts
Experience selling to HR, benefit, workplace, and finance leaders
Experience with a solutions-focused sale is a plus (primarily SaaS)
Must be data-driven and dynamic thinking with business acumen to build value
Experience presenting and selling to "C" level executives
Strong attention to process and the technical aspects of the Sharebite platform
Highly proficient with productivity tools, including G-Suite, Salesforce, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
Ability to be flexible, adaptive, and resilient', "At Sharebite, we are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry and market standards. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate including but not limited to skill set, years & depth of experience, and location.

The base compensation range for this role is $90k - $150k per year, however actual salaries can vary based on a candidate's qualifications, skills and competencies.

Salary is just one component of Sharebite's total compensation package, which includes equity, multiple health insurance options, and a wide range of benefits."]

column7:
['WalkMe pioneered the Digital Adoption Platform (DAP) to transform how people learn, use and support digital technology. By seamlessly overlaying the User Interfaces of enterprise, mobile and web applications, WalkMe guides users through any digital workflow, across one or more applications, with an intuitive and aptly-automated experience that is tailored for each individual and appears only when and where needed. As an enhancement to any application’s UI, like a GPS it navigates users through complex and ever evolving processes and policies for better experiences and behavior. The outcome is improved process compliance, efficiency and application ROI.

This tailored and contextual guidance, governance and automation is rapidly built with a visual, no code workflow editor, and managed with built-in instrumentation and analytics. It provides executives visibility into application usage, and improves data quality. It makes applications easier to use and processes easier to follow, driving adoption and the promised value of digital transformation.

As a Senior Advisory Solution Consultant for the Alliances and Channels team at WalkMe, your role is to inspire and enable the WalkMe partner ecosystem to sell and deliver WalkMe value. You will design and implement the sales engineering framework and processes for your region. You will guide GSIs, SIs, and VARs delivering our technology, and ISVs embedding it in their products, prototyping and demonstrating solutions that realize their business vision and strategy. This is an active presales role that includes both strategic planning and tactical execution, with an immediate opportunity for leadership and career growth. You will report to the VP, Global Alliances Sales Engineering.', "What You'll Own
Discover the partner's business models, needs and gaps, along with the strengths and weaknesses of underpinning technologies and workflows that they and their customers employ
As a product expert, present WalkMe technology, roadmaps and value propositions in the context of a partner's business, to both executives and practitioners
Build and demonstrate WalkMe solutions tailored to the use cases and outcomes valued by the partner and their customer base, and manage technical evaluations
Working with partner experts, define joint value propositions, go-to-market strategies and presales methodologies that will deliver WalkMe solutions and value based outcomes to the partner's customer base
Enable and motivate the partner's sales team over the life of the partnership as a trusted and respected advisor
Participate in demand generation activities such as industry events, webinars and blogging
Provide feedback on product and process improvements
Collaborate with the Global Alliances Sales Engineering VP in the development of the A&C sales engineering program", 'What You Need To Succeed
Minimum of 8 years of experience in SaaS sales working with enterprise customers in one of the following roles: technical pre-sales, sales engineer, functional / technical consultant, process consultant
Experience building and presenting live demo environments for customers at all levels - engineers to C level executives
A deep understanding of enterprise technologies and business value
Leadership', "What You'll Love About Us!
Comprehensive Health Care Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision for our Employees and Families, 401(k) with company matching program, Parental Leave programs, and a vacation policy to encourage a healthy work-life balance.
WalkMe is a remote and hybrid work environment for those who chose to come to regional offices (vaccines required) with frequent in-person and virtual social activities to promote positive employee engagement
WalkMe is recognized as a Star Performer in DAP for the 2nd year in a row.
WalkMe helps international companies such as: IBM, LinkedIn, Walgreens, Microsoft, Adobe, Hershey's, Quest Diagnostics and more!", "At WalkMe, we approach Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) with the same level of collaboration and innovation that we bring to the rest of our business. We believe in the value of diversity and are committed to ensuring an equitable and inclusive workplace where every employee has an equal opportunity to achieve success.

We've made this commitment not only because it's the right thing to do, but also because we know that having diverse perspectives, experiences and identities on our team helps us to better meet the diverse needs of our global clients. While we're not yet where we want to be, our goal is to create a workplace as fair and inclusive as our business is category defining. And at WalkMe, we achieve our goals.

How We'll Take Care of You

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base pay for this role is between $115,000 and $200,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, benefits, and RSUs as part of our competitive total rewards package.

TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES:
WalkMe does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to WalkMe employees or any other company location. WalkMe is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company for this specific role."]

column7:
['Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.

We are looking for a driven Senior Manager of Sales Operations, Channels & Alliances to join a high-impact, high-performing Global team that delivers strategic analysis and operational rigor to our Business Development and Channels leadership team. The ideal candidate has a passion for driving key objectives for the business and turning data-driven insights into actions. This person excels at
balancing strategic planning with execution and is comfortable working with details. This well-rounded leader also thrives on driving cross-functional (Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT, Compensation, etc.) projects, negotiating alignment and managing
multiple stakeholders with competing priorities.

This person should have experience building operational models and plans, analyzing large and complex data sets. This person will help redesign and improve our data and analytics foundation including executive reporting, dashboards, and KPIs. As a key leader this person will make a large impact on our rapidly growing business.', 'Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Serve as the trusted advisor and sales operations lead for our Business Development and Channels organization
Proactively deliver regular data insights and analytics to SVP of Business Development and his/her leadership team
Partner with management to develop monthly and quarterly business reviews, metrics, and presentations
Track all partner metrics (pipeline, bookings, deal registrations, adoption Certifications, etc.); identify trends and recommendations for channel management
Collaborate with Couchbase’s Business Development Managers in the field to resolve operational issues impacting their partners
Collaborate cross-functionally with peers in sales ops to ensure best practices are followed
Understands how to work with cloud service providers and their operational tool sets (e.g., AWS ACE opp reg system). Own partner systems technology stack
Knowledgeable of diverse partner types since Couchbase works across many different types of partners
Own and maintain process and training documentation for channel applications, reports, and business processes experience required', 'Experience required
5+ years of experience in sales operations, Business Development and Channels; software/SaaS experience preferred
Understand routes to market via cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
Strong collaborator; comfortable operating in a matrix organization and rallying disparate groups
High level analytical and complex problem solving skills in their functional area, with the ability to influence as a leader across functions
Intellectual curiosity and agility to navigate ambiguous circumstances
Paranoia for accuracy and detail
Ability to present, articulate, and defend analyses, diplomatically, on a routine basis to a broad range of stakeholders
Excellent working knowledge of SFDC, CPQ, Channels Apps, Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.

Education/Experience
BA/BSor equivalent educational background is preferred (MBA is a plus)', 'The anticipated starting base pay range for this role is $130,000-$150,000 per year. Base salary is not the only component of our competitive total rewards package - you will also be eligible for bonus, equity, and other benefits as described below. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, licenses and certifications, and specific work location.

Why Couchbase?

Couchbase is named one of DTBA’s top 100 companies that matter in data. At Couchbase, we believe data is at the heart of the enterprise. We empower developers and architects to build, deploy, and run their most mission-critical applications. Couchbase delivers end-to-end technical solutions for all our customers with high-performance, flexible and scalable modern databases that run across the data centers and any cloud. Many of the world’s largest enterprises rely on Couchbase to power the core applications their businesses depend on. See our recent awards to learn what makes Couchbase such a great company to work at.

We are honored to be a part of the best workplace award in the Bay Area. In 2022, Couchbase is recognized as the best workspace in the Bay Area. Couchbase offers a total rewards approach to benefits for the value you create here, so that you in turn may best serve yourself and your family. Some benefits include:
Unlimited time off (DTO)
Matching 401K contributions
ESPP
Medical, Dental & Vision
Monthly credit towards a lifestyle spending account
An ergonomic and comfortable in-office setup, with food and supporting technology, to assist in the setup of an efficient WFH and office environment
And much more!

Learn more about Couchbase:
News and Press Releases
Couchbase Capella
Couchbase Blog
Investors

Disclaimer:
Couchbase is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join an impact initiative group and experience the amazing feeling of Couchbase can-do culture.
By using this website and submitting your information, you acknowledge our Candidate Privacy Notice and understand your personal information may be processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice following guidelines in your country of application.']

['General information

Full Time', "Description & Requirements
FORVIS' Technology practice is growing and needs more professionals! We are currently looking to add a Senior ERP Implementation Consultant to join our growing Sage Intacct practice. The successful candidate will have a passion for enabling companies to operate their business more effectively using leading technologies and industry best practices.

How you will contribute:
Perform primarily remote consulting services to implement Sage Intacct accounting and project functionality
Translate client business pains, needs, and requirements into system design and deliverables
Provide business process consulting and best practices to clients as they implement Sage Intacct
Configure Sage Intacct to meet client requirements
Manage client engagements and relationships
Utilize ERP implementation standards, tools, and documentation
Provide ongoing support services to existing clients as needed

Minimum Qualifications:
Degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent professional experience
5 years or more of functional experience with NetSuite, Intacct, Financial Force, or other cloud-based accounting/ERP applications
Ability to travel minimally
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work as an effective member of a team
Demonstrated ability to establish and manage multiple priorities

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelors or Masters degree in Accounting, Business, or Management
Experience in presenting and communicating to client management throughout the sales and implementation delivery cycle
CPA license
Sage Intacct certifications
2 years or more of demo experience
5 years or more of SaaS consulting experience

#LI-AQ1 #LI-IND #LI-KCMO #LI-HOU #LI-DFW #LI-CHI"]

column7: ['We are hiring an Enterprise Account Executive to drive new business at Hyperproof, working with prospects from initial interest through contracting and implementation.', '', '', 'We pride ourselves in our ability to move quickly and get the job done, and we are committed to ensuring every team member is set up to exceed expectations and learn and grow in their role. This role will report to Sr. Director of Sales and works cross-functionally to ensure the business is positioned for success.', 'Who You Are', 'You have a passion for winning new business and making an impact as an early member of a high-growth startup. You inspire others around you, work well across departments, and collaborate with team members of varied experiences. In addition, you thrive in enigmatic situations and can construct a logical path forward without material oversight.', '', '', "You're a constant learner, curious and creative, and you enjoy problem-solving, whether tactics to increase deal velocity or strategies for clients to help them achieve their business goals. You are a natural collaborator and someone who enjoys partnering with a team.", "What You'll Do"]

['The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers – and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency. We are proud of the culture we have built. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day.', '', 'So, if you are talented, driven, creative, and eager to join a dynamic, globally-connected team, then we want to talk!', '', 'What You’ll Do:', 'Lead a roster of accounts, operating as a “small business owner” to grow clients’ business
Become an expert on The Trade Desk platform and offer insights to clients on how to implement creative marketing strategies
Collaborate effectively with the Sales & Trading functions to develop existing accounts and achieve client goals and objectives
Develop and cultivate relationships with brand and agency clients as a consultant to their business
Own the training plan for onboarding new clients, continuing programmatic education, platform improvements, and new channels and markets within the industry
Able to lead, not just manage tasks; think multiple steps ahead to move an account forward
Represent client needs by providing feedback to Product Management and Partnerships to identify and define features, integrations and product improvements to The Trade Desk platform
Develop standard methodologies within Client Services, collaborate with Product Marketing to develop effective training collateral and customer facing guides, and train and onboard new teammates', '', 'What You’ll Bring:', 'Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year university
At least 5 years of client-facing experience required in a media or advertising setting
Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a dynamic environment
Consistent track record of growing accounts by developing a strong relationship with clients, understanding their business objectives and recommending the best strategies for implementing solutions
Effective time management skills – ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Expertise with working in online advertising platforms or a SAAS platform a plus
Excellent presentation and communication skills (written and verbal) and confidence speaking to large groups
Past experience in mentorship roles either personally or professionally preferred
Solid experience in Excel and MS Office and ability to use large data sets to build insights and strategy recommendations', '#LI-AS2']
