column1: Director/ Sales and Business Development, North America- AppSealing
column7:
['INKA Entworks is a content and application security software company established in 2000 with headquarters in Korea, offices in LA and Mumbai.
We’re seeking an experienced leader to take on responsibility for driving the transformation of our global sales function for AppSealing business in our US office.
AppSealing is a security as a service that provides easy, fast, and robust RASP (Runtime Application Self Protection). Anyone can secure Android apps within 10 minutes without any coding and it provides iOS and Hybrid app security as a service as well.
Game developers, Fintech/financial app service providers are important customers for AppSealing. They see a constant stream of hacking and fraud attacks against their titles and services. So they are looking for simple and cost-effective solutions to this problem so that their own internal development teams can focus on adding additional monetizing features.
This is a new role within the team, so you will be expected to be ready to help us achieve critical business objectives, actively develop and lead execution of the go-to-market strategy and provide strong sales leadership across business development and account management functions.
Reporting to the CEO, you will work collaboratively with product management and marketing team leaders along with other key internal stakeholders across the AppSealing team.
This is a great opportunity for an entrepreneurial sales leader to take on a new challenge in a senior position within a small but growing global company.
Opportunity to work from home due to the COVID-19 situation.
What you will do
Lead sales execution & performance
Take ownership of achieving the overall revenue target for the AppSealing team
Penetrate and develop major strategic accounts and new prospects in chosen business segments.
Perform sales presentations to those prospects, negotiate contacts, and close new business deals. Create a network of finders, resellers, and distributors to expand AppSealing business
Proactively seek out and seize opportunities to collaborate with partners across the business to ensure the voice of the customer influences our efforts and investments in product, innovation and to further drive & leverage cross-sell opportunities
It must be you if you had
10+ years in sales leadership, preferably in a SaaS service environment and with a demonstrable record of driving growth in revenue, customer acquisition, and customer lifetime value
Understanding and strong business network with mobile gaming, fintech/financial, and mobile app. ecosystem
Ability to use data and customer feedback to set long-term business strategy
An entrepreneurial attitude, with the ability to actively contribute to strategic discussions through strong critical thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Understanding of sales in software, workflow, and content technology environment strongly preferred
Strong execution focus and ability to develop solutions and strategies to further accelerate growth in untapped markets
Executive-level interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to successfully influence and quickly build credibility to maximize organizational growth and profitability', 'Role: Business DevelopmentInformation TechnologyPartnershipsSales
Job Type: Full-time
Job Location: Los AngelesNorth AmericaUnited states
Job Category: Information TechnologySales']

column7:
['Welcome! You made it to the job description page!', '', 'At Zappos, we look for people who will show up as their whole self because we value diversity and inclusion, as well as people who enjoy fun and maybe even a little weirdness. So be sure to check on whether you’re aligned with our company values and culture. If you think you can see yourself delivering WOW as a member of the Zappos family, then check out the job description below!', '', 'Company Culture is at Our Core', "Our
10 Core Values
are more than just words, they're a way of life. We know that companies with a strong culture & a higher purpose perform better in the long run.
Do our values speak to you?", '1. Deliver WOW Through Service
2. Embrace and Drive Change
3. Create Fun and A Little Weirdness
4. Be Adventurous, Creative, and Open-Minded
5. Pursue Growth and Learning
6. Build Open and Honest Relationships With Communication
7. Build a Positive Team and Family Spirit
8. Do More With Less
9. Be Passionate and Determined
10. Be Humble', 'We Focus on Four C’s', 'Company Culture
Customer Service
Commerce (the "E" kind in our case)
Community', '']

['Blackbird ApS is a spin-off from the consulting company emendo- which specialises in lean manufacturing consultancy. We monitor and collect data in real time from production lines, and enable organisations to immediately start downtime analysis, performance tracking, condition monitoring, OEE, receive alerts for predictive maintenance and much more in order to make continuous improvements in factories. We solve the problem of wasted resources and inadequate capacity utilization of existing production lines through data insight. We are trusted by some of the leading brands within Parma, Food, Beverage and Automotive to significantly improve and stay on top of their OEE. In a world of increased competitiveness, wasted resources and demand for sustainable production, Blackbird is the solution to ensure maximum output from a production line.', "We support remote work for applicants who reside in the following states: Arizona, Indiana, Illinois, Ohio, Texas, Louisiana, Michigan, and Utah.

What we are looking for
A true sales professional with a solid track record of meeting and exceeding targets. As a Senior Account Executive, you will manage the end-to-end sales process for mid-market & enterprise organizations. Your ambition is through the roof, and besides continuously hitting targets, you're motivated by supporting the people around you and helping us build a fantastic company.
Our headquarters are in Morristown, New Jersey, but we are looking for professionals in Arizona, Indiana, Illinois, Ohio, Texas, Louisiana, Michigan, and Utah. This Sales Engineer role will report to our Head of Sales EMEA.

In this role, you'll
As our Senior Account Executive for the United States, your tasks will include, but are not limited to:
Manage the end-to-end sales process
Build and maintain a strong pipeline
Become a market expert and understand the dynamics of the IIoT space
Work methodically with a consultative and professional approach to ensure strong relationships with prospects
Understand and convey feedback from the market and prospects to relevant stakeholders at Blackbird, e.g., product feedback, competitor feedback, etc.
Maintain exceptional data discipline in CRM and other relevant systems
Help build and define the sales strategy and sales organization

What you'll need to succeed
5+ years of experience in sales for the US Market, consistently meeting or exceeding targets.
Experience in selling to senior stakeholders (C-suite and decision-makers) in large organizations. B2B.
Experience in IIoT, production, manufacturing, and solution selling is a plus.
Ability to comprehend complex customer needs and present solutions to meet their needs and requirements.
Strong understanding of own performance and the ability to use data and insights to optimize performance.
Excellent verbal and written skills in English. Great interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Problem solver with the ability to adapt quickly to a fast-paced environment.

Who we are
Blackbird is an IIoT and data collection software company (SaaS) that helps manufacturers tackle the biggest challenges in their production processes.
We give companies an edge and boost productivity and efficiency by collecting and providing real-time production data analysis. Our plug-and-play hardware can be installed in minutes and, when combined with our proprietary web-based software, gives you unprecedented insights from anywhere and on any device.
Blackbird ApS is a spin-off of Emendo Consulting Group, which provides expertise and hands-on services at every product lifecycle stage. Blackbird solutions are sold in over 25 countries, with offices in Denmark and the US. After a recent funding round, we are currently scaling significantly across the globe.

Perks and benefits
An Employee Equity Program.
Flexible working hours.
Flexible paid time off/holidays
Skills development and growth opportunities. Plans for career growth, tailored training, mentorship, and cross-team cooperation.
Competitive salary.
Great and structured onboarding - we want to teach you the best practices of a good sales approach.
An international, diverse and inclusive culture. We have 13 different nationalities here at Blackbird!
You choose your gear.

Your base salary will be based on your experience. Blackbird offers medical, dental, vision, an open vacation policy, sick days, short-term disability, long-term disability, maternity/bonding, parental leave, tuition reimbursement, paid holidays, 401K, and life insurance.
We hire the best people, wherever they are. You can travel when you want, stay at home, or work from co-working spaces or coffee shops. You decide!

Ready to meet us? Great! We'd love to hear from you.
We'd love to hear from you. Applications are reviewed continuously, and we hire when we've found the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible.
We encourage all relevant applicants to apply. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, or another status. All qualified applicants will be given equal opportunity, and the selection is based on job-related factors.
Or maybe you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our Interview process
You apply with your CV and cover letter. Continuous interviews will be conducted. Therefore, we recommend using it as soon as possible.
A 30-minute call with Khristel, our recruiter, to discuss Blackbird and learn more about you. We'll set expectations for the rest of the process and provide a question-and-answer period.
You will be invited for a second interview with our head of sales, Christian Lindvall
The last interview with our CCO. Søren Traumer Schønnemann. Closing talk with our leadership team in which you will agree on compensation, starting date, and all other practical details.

For questions, please get in touch with Khristel Marie Bråthen at khma@blackbird.online"]

column7: ['Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. With Equinix Metal, customers can rapidly deploy automated single-tenant infrastructure and interact with 2,000+ networks and 3,000 cloud and service providers. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.', '', 'At Equinix, we help the world’s digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people’s lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.', '', 'We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Product Solution Expertise', 'Be a digital product and services expert. Sharing your knowledge of industry best practices, our digital service product offerings, and their benefits to customers\nSupport building digital expertise and new products growth across field sales. Partner with Sales Account Executives on digital customer fit, pitch, personas, uses cases, common pain points, potential competitors, and how to handle objections\nActively maintain and grow your expertise in leading transformational technology concepts and methodologies', '']

['Job Requisition ID #', '', '', 'Position Overview', 'As a Product Manager within Autodesk Construction Solutions at Autodesk, you are responsible for building tools that are transforming the construction industry. Product Managers on our team sit at the intersection of software development, design, and business strategy. We shape high-level product goals but also get our hands dirty. On an average day, you might present a product concept to customers, work with designers to conduct user research, prototype a new feature, iterate on a spec, analyze usage data, assist group leads to pitch a concept to senior leadership, collaborate with internal teams on new initiatives and pair with an engineer on implementation. We have the ultimate responsibility for understanding our client needs, influencing business strategy, feature specification, and working with engineering to develop our software.', '', 'To ensure that the growing product family and ecosystem delivers best-in class, analytics and insights, Autodesk is seeking a passionate and experienced product manager to join our Data Delivery group. As the Product Manager in the Data Delivery group, you will be responsible for the customer-facing insight platform that enables analytics capabilities across the Autodesk Construction Cloud ecosystem. This role requires you to develop and maintain roadmap, and detailed execution plans that prioritize requirements across a complex set of stakeholders including small to large customers, and internal product teams.', '', 'Responsibilities', "Own and execute a product area that solves business problems and delivers delightful experiences to our customers
Understand Autodesk's strategic position and deliver innovative products that align with this strategy
Work directly with customers to unearth pain points and understand their most pressing needs
Collaborate with leadership to develop overall product strategy and define the vision, goals, and prioritized roadmap for the product
Interpret customer requirements, and write detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, and Jira tickets to ensure that your team can execute effectively
Work closely with the cross-functional team leads including design and engineering to manage execution and delivery
Manage the product backlog, do weekly scrum planning with team, and validate that all new features meet functional, performance, and experience requirements
Work closely with internal stakeholders including product teams from various parts of the organization, marketing, support, customer success etc. to drive the research, launch, and adoption of product features
Work with support to resolve any escalated customer support issues that require engineering intervention"]

column1: Sales Enablement Manager – sales methodology consultant
column7: ['Company Description', 'At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.', "With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies® 2022.", 'Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.', 'Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.', 'Job Description', 'As an integral member of ServiceNow’s Global Sales Enablement team, the Sr Sales Enablement Manager – leadership coaching programs is responsible for developing coaching and enablement programs for sales managers across the entire sales journey with a developmental and question-based management approach. This is a highly collaborative role that involves working with key stakeholders in Sales and Sales Leadership, as well as across the various Enablement Teams. The role is focused on elevating manager performance by developing and delivering effective enablement programs for ServiceNow sales leaders.', 'Job Responsibilities', "The Sr Sales Enablement Manager – leadership programs will be responsible for developing and deploying enablement programs and initiatives that enable customer-facing Managers to coach and develop the members of their team, especially as it relates to selling and revenue performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong sales and sales leadership background or considerable experience in coaching and/or training sales leaders and sales enablement experience. Global experience is preferred as the role encompasses coaching salespeople and sales leaders across the globe with a diverse customer base. We're looking for a top-notch team player with experience in the design and delivery of highly effective sales enablement programs that focus on improving sales effectiveness, sales productivity, and overall sales results.", 'Responsibilities include but are not limited to:']

['', 'This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.', '', 'Job Description:', '', "Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
HPE GreenLake is at the vanguard of HPE's current and future strategy to become the industry leader in Edge to Cloud platforms. Launched over 2 years ago, the GreenLake brand has since grown to become the market leader for on-premises IT-as-a-service, leading the category with over 35% global unaided awareness. HPE GreenLake brings the modern cloud IT experience to the data and applications clients can't or won't put into the public cloud.
The HPE GreenLake Cloud Platform (GLCP) team allows you the opportunity to collaborate with both creative and engineering types to build HPE’s next generation cloud platform. Combining agile methodologies and a continuous integration and delivery pipeline, the GreenLake Cloud Platform partners with all of HPE and powers HPE’s transformation as a true cloud provider. It’s the cloud that comes to you! You will build innovative cloud platform capabilities that enables the delivery of rich HW and SW aaS solutions to customers.
The Senior Product Manager, designs, plans, develops and manages a product or portfolio of products throughout the solution portfolio lifecycle: from new product definition or enhancements to existing products; planning, design, forecasting, and production; to end of lifecycle.
In a typical day as a Senior Product Manager, you would
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, secure and reliable HPE GreenLake Platform
Understand your users and build a delightful customer experience. Be the voice of the customer to bring engineering, services and UX teams
Own product roadmap and manage the backlog through constant prioritization. Manage product management requirements coming from various cross functional teams
Define target sales audience and guide content creation
Manage product lifecycle of functionalities on HPE GreenLake Cloud Platform
Build the Go To Market strategy and communicate your product’s value proposition and drive adoption
If you are…
Good at partnering, innovating, and making things happen. You are aligned to our core values.
Holding a first level university degree in IT, computer science or related area of study. MBA or advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience
10+ years in a product management role
Having a proven ability to define and execute a business strategy that drives operational excellence & profit
Highly experienced with Agile methodology, backlog planning and Product management process
Experienced with SaaS business model
Skilled using public cloud offerings from AWS, Azure, GCP
Having Product Management experience from Enterprise SaaS products, Enterprise networking, MSP preferred
Having Management or Technology Consulting background
Able to drive initiatives across multifunctional organization and align diverse stakeholders towards a common outcome
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, discussion, and organizational skills
Excellent in verbal and written communication and presentation", '', 'Join us and make your mark!', '', 'We offer:']

column7:
['Description', 'The Opportunity
Registria is the leader in developing post-purchase ownership experiences for brands. Hundreds of the most recognized brands in the world use Registria’s award-winning technology to onboard and better support their customers. Our platform, expert analytics, and engagement programs enable brands to deliver a rewarding experience to every product owner.
Registria is seeking a highly motivated Senior Client Success Manager to join our rapidly growing company. The ideal candidate will be adept at developing strong client relationships to drive operational success, define and track success metrics, identify opportunities to implement best practices and increase ROI using Registria solutions with some of our most strategic brand clients.
The ideal candidate must have a combination of experiences in SaaS, brand/retail, digital marketing, eCommerce, and CRM in client-facing roles such as Management Consulting or Customer Success Management. Experience in these areas is key to bringing added value to our clients and subject matter expertise to the organization as we grow.
Success is based on helping clients achieve their objectives and KPIs, as well as net revenue retention, product adoption, consultative relationship management, and operational success.
Note: This is not a business development or sales role.
What You’ll Do
Become a subject matter expert of assigned client base by understanding their defined success metrics and how Registria solutions can fulfill their requirements.
Maintain existing relationships and broaden those across client organizations to create long-term client sustainability and reduce risk for single point of failure.
Track, understand, and communicate on a regular basis with clients regarding operational success, risks and metrics for optimum performance, and ROI.
Utilize consulting skills to identify opportunities for growth and product expansion and then support our sales team to upsell these strategic solutions.
Deliver business reviews, manage regular customer meetings, and prepare detailed client updates outlining successes and opportunities.
Partner with our implementation team to ensure that client projects are delivered according to requirements and Best Practices.
Work closely with internal teams including implementation, engineering, product management, support, marketing services and QA to ensure our clients receive the best solution for their business.
Complete all required administrative functions for tracking customer communication, issues, and metrics.
Some travel may be required.
What’s Required to be Successful
Passion for technology and being part of a fast-growing SaaS company combined with technical and analytical skills.
An effective team player with a high level of initiative and the ability to work well in a team environment.
Experience in working with complex, multi-divisional, multi-geographical clients.
Strong client skills combined with project management, time management, problem solving and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities at the same time with a focus on results.
Impressive executive presence and communication abilities.
Ability to create structure in ambiguous situations and design effective processes.
Ability to perform under pressure, meet deadlines and work across organization boundaries to create a successful outcome.
Exemplary communication skills (persuasive written, compelling oral).
Experience
Must have at least 7 years’ experience in managing enterprise client relationships and project management.
Experience in SaaS, brand/retail, digital marketing, eCommerce, extended warranty and/or CRM.
Client facing experience in roles such as Management Consulting, Customer Success, Account Management.
Familiarity with tools such as Saleforce.com and Jira
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
What We Offer
Competitive salary range: $95,000 - $110,000, plus equity and bonus eligible
Comprehensive benefits package, including medical (100% premium paid for employee), dental, vision, life, short-term disability, 401(k) retirement plan.
Unlimited PTO (we encourage employees to take time off and our requirement is that employees take at least 2 weeks annually)
Paid parental leave
Employee Assistance Program
Opportunity to work remote
And much more, including an opportunity to work with great group of teammates and clients.']

column6: ['Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off', 'Travel reimbursement', 'Vision insurance']
column7:
["One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
We are looking for a Strategic Finance Senior Manager to drive corporate-level strategic projects and long range planning, and to support planning and forecasting for our Commercial team. This role requires exceptional financial modeling capabilities, business acumen and communication skills. It is a high visibility role on our Strategic Finance team that is integral to getting Hinge Health public-company ready.
The Senior Manager will work directly with and present to various executive leaders including our CFO, President of Hinge Health, Chief Commercial Officer, VP of Growth Marketing, VP of Business Operations and others.. Exposure and the ability to influence executives provides development opportunities and visibility critical to career progression and driving a positive impact at Hinge Health.
As part of effectively driving strategic initiatives, the Senior Manager will gain a comprehensive view of every aspect of the financial planning processes at Hinge Health. The new hire will also have the opportunity to play a key role in near- and long-term revenue planning, and the revenue module implementation of Adaptive Insights. The candidate will effectively collaborate with leaders across Finance, including Accounting and Revenue Cycle Management, and key partners across the broader organization.
Given the hyper growth of Hinge Health, there are significant opportunities to lead strategic analysis in areas such as assessing GTM strategies, sales capacity modeling, LTV/CAC analysis, and cost structure optimization and benchmarking.

The ideal candidate will be an expert in financial modeling, who is capable of incorporating business strategy into financial statement analysis and forecasting. The candidate should possess strong business partnering skills and desire, capable of transforming data into insights and articulating technical financial contents to cross-functional business partners. Capabilities such as building and adeptly analyzing 3 statement financial models, analyzing and influencing long-term optimal cost structure, analyzing and influencing GTM strategies, and SaaS metrics modeling and reporting, are ideal. Investment banking experience, experience at a hyper growth company, Sales Finance experience, working knowledge of Adaptive Insights or another similar tool, and full cycle budgeting and planning knowledge all would be a plus.

#LI-KC2", '', '', "WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
Systems thinker - highly analytical, able to break down a problem. Builds robust models / frameworks aimed at solving problems. The right hire will have excellent analytical, modeling and communication skills, in-depth experience with financial analysis and a strong understanding of corporate finance concepts
Meticulously organized and detail-oriented individual who has the ability to multitask; an independent and flexible problem solver who can cope positively with ambiguity while maintaining strong attention to detail and speed
Exceptional interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. A good listener with outstanding influencing qualities and a natural, effective consultative style
Strong sense of prioritization - someone who is able to execute on projects within prescribed timelines in an environment with competing demands
Extensive knowledge of Excel and G-Suite
Demonstrated prowess in business partnering, including budgeting, forecasting, reporting, financial modeling and analysis", 'WHAT YOU’LL ACCOMPLISH
Support the Strategic Finance Director in enhancing our Long Range Plan, collaborating with partners across Hinge Health and incorporating strategy into financial analysis and output
Successfully drive strategic projects including Hinge Health builds towards an optimal cost structure, and efficient Commercial efficiency (LTV to CAC, magic number, rule of 40 etc.), and other ad hoc initiatives.
Provide finance business partnering to Commercial leadership in support of their decisions and growth strategies.
Build financial models and processes for revenue, sales commissions and partner revenue share planning and forecasting
Project management - Adaptive Insights revenue module implementation in collaboration with various members of the finance and forecasting team, as well as with our external consulting partners
Identify and lead initiatives to continuously improve, automate and scale forecasting and reporting tools, processes, and methodologies', "WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT US
Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge", 'BONUS POINTS
Experience with Adaptive insights or similar forecasting tools as well as with business analytics solutions such as Mode Analytics or Tableau
Knowledge of Netsuite, and Workday', "The range of base salary for the position is between $130,400 - $195,600, plus equity, and benefits. Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.

About Hinge Health:
LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us.

Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you."]

['Who We Are', 'CBORD and Horizon are the world’s leading providers of integrated technology solutions powering housing, access, foodservice, nutrition, eCommerce, and card systems for K-12 and higher education, acute care, senior living, and business campuses. Our success and growth is directly attributed to our DREAMteam. Our culture is built on integrity, respect for our people, and continuous personal development. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit, where creativity, innovative problem solving, and learning agility drive our day-to-day actions.', '', '', 'The Senior Manager, Customer Success will be responsible for building and setting direction for the CBORD/Horizon Customer Success team across all lines of business. This includes defining our customer success principles and best with a focus for renewals and product expansion. Partner with many other teams in the organization (i.e Sales, Marketing, Professional Services, Support, and Development) as we design, build, implement and maintain solutions to help our customers operate and scale more effectively.', 'Your success will be measured through:', 'Retention
Upsells and Expansions
Product Adoption
Customer Health Score', 'A key focus of the Senior Manager, Customer Success is on people management, career growth, and team culture development. This is a working manager position so there is an expectation that this leader this individual will also manage a portfolio of strategic/high profile customers.', 'What You’ll Be Doing', 'Grow, develop, and scale the customer success team at CBORD/Horizon.
Build clear structure, processes, playbooks, and reporting that enable Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to successfully drive business value specific to a customer.
Build our customer success practice including regular Business Reviews, creating external executive level relationships and internal executive sponsorships.
Set performance targets for the Customer Success organization based on deployment, adoption, and consumption of our solutions.
Identify and analyze customer relationship risks through the course of the customer engagement/interaction.
Partner closely with other leaders to create a seamless customer journey from implementation through renewal and beyond.
Collaborate heavily with Sales and Product Management functions.
Partner closely with Marketing to develop customer case studies, testimonials, and messaging.
Proactively communicate customer stories, insights, value propositions, and feedback to help everyone at our company get better.
Administer onboarding and customer success technologies.
Establish the CSM role as trusted advisor.
Provide direct management of CSMs.
Build, drive and manage a high-performance culture to achieve superior results and for which passion for continuous improvement is innate.
Recruit, hire, develop and retain high quality talent.
Act as an escalation point for high severity customer issues that arise from within the team.
Actively manage your portfolio of customers.']

["Vareto is reimagining both how companies evaluate the past and plan for the future. Today, companies make their most important decisions using spreadsheets, presentations, legacy tools, and countless meetings and emails. Executives make decisions with limited data, teams waste time aligning on metric definitions instead of collaborating, and analysts debug Excel files instead of generating insights.
Vareto is building a next-generation reporting and planning platform that changes all of that. Our product helps companies standardize their business data, derive and share insights, and build connected cloud-based financial plans - all so companies can make better, faster decisions.
We're a remote-first team (hiring in the US, Canada, Latin America, and Europe) and we're backed by top investors and industry leaders including GV, Menlo Ventures, and over 100 angels.", 'Sales at Vareto', 'Our sales philosophy at Vareto is to think long-term and focus on customer value above all else.', 'Like other companies, we set quarterly revenue goals to provide structure to our sales activities. However—unlike other companies—our fundamental belief is that the score takes care of itself. When we meet a prospective customer, our top goal is not to sign a contract together, but to understand their needs and be as useful as we can. We focus on adding value first, trusting that contracts will come later. As long as we keep doing this, Vareto will continue to grow at a rapid pace and our customers will continue to be our biggest fans and cheerleaders.', "Here are the three tenets of Vareto's sales approach:", "Be quiet (at first). Listen, and then take a consultative, advisory approach. No blind selling here. If Vareto isn't the right fit for a prospective customer, then say so and suggest alternatives.
Be respectful. Our prospective customers are sharp, strategic, and super busy. So don't waste their time. Show them exactly what they need to see and give them succinct, accurate, and helpful answers.
Be useful. Try to add as much value as possible, and not just through Vareto's products and services. Introduce our prospective customers to relevant people, communities, and resources.", "What you'll do:", 'Partner closely with finance teams and their business stakeholders to understand their business objectives, and act as their trusted guide to select an FP&A solution (usually Vareto, but not always).
Listen to our potential future customers and use this information to personalize demos and point out details that would be most useful for them to know.
Support our Product team in their quest to build the best, most delightful product by sharing feedback from sales conversations and helping with roadmap prioritization.
Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers. Create as much value for them as possible by introducing them to relevant people, communities, and resources.
Ensure customer happiness and success working closely with the Customer Success team.
Since this is a founding Sales role, expect to do "full stack" sales. This includes everything from generating your own pipeline to being present at every meeting with a prospective customer, and finally working with their security and legal teams to get Vareto approved and contracts signed. (As we build out our GTM functions, you'll have increasingly more help with various aspects of this.)
Ability to travel when required to meet prospective customers in person and attend certain conferences and social events.
Build the company you want to work at.', "What we're looking for:", '4+ years of mid-market and/or enterprise B2B SaaS sales experience, preferably with price points above $50K ACV.
History of hitting sales objectives and exceeding quota.
Ability to align technology solutions to complex, multi-stakeholder business problems and utilize strategic thinking skills to solve customer problems.
Strong network, with an ability to create opportunities and build your own pipeline.
Demonstrated success in strategic territory management, with the ability to prioritize among a high volume of opportunities and build a consistent 12-month rolling pipeline.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment, solve problems creatively, think on your feet, and be comfortable in new situations working with multiple stakeholders.
[Bonus] Existing relationships within Finance, Business Operations, Sales Operations, and/or Revenue Operations organizations.']

column1: Director Product Marketing - Cloud Data Services
column7: ['', 'This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.', '', 'Job Description:', '', 'Your Opportunity:', 'Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.', '', 'Job Description:', 'Director of Product Marketing, Cloud Data Services']

['Company Description
Global brands hire us to align sales and marketing systems to make their data processes make sense, and to align sales and marketing teams—so it all works together. We help evolve and transform your data into best-in-class customer journeys that allow you to deepen customer relationships and to drive revenue.', 'Job Description
Xcel Agency Inc. is seeking a Senior Content Manager with strong project and account management skills to manage and implement content strategies for a Fortune 500 client company in the Bay Area, CA. Candidates must be able to prioritize rapidly shifting priorities, have excellent time management and communication skills, and be able to manage multiple complex projects at once with an emphasis on rapid content deployment.
Responsibilities and requirements:
Define, execute, and measure client-backed marketing initiatives, tests, and business strategies to drive conversion, revenue, and lead growth for the business unit
Identify, gather, and manage program assets, tests, and approvals for deployment; manage production timelines and project resources
Partner closely with managers, executives, and cross-functional teams to create effective and impactful programs, landing pages, and communication flows
Manage client business relationships with key stakeholders and identify revenue opportunities to grow client retainer value
Create strong, scalable processes and demonstrate effective project management skills to drive efficient and accountable execution across multiple teams, internal and external; continuously iterate on those processes for improved efficiency
Establish metrics for success defined by business unit leaders based on campaign results to drive measurable, sustained growth
Consult and share best practices, test results, and campaign results to assist with further developing and refining client marketing strategies
Identify risks in programs and processes, and implement protocols to mitigate avoidable points of failure', 'Qualifications
At least 5 years minimum of content marketing, project management, and VIP account management experience (ideally at a technology company)
Deep, functional knowledge of the following tools: Workfront, Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Analytics
A proven track record of highly effective content strategy and program management, driving dramatic growth through successful execution
Analytical and problem-solving orientation with clear examples of using data actively for targeting, measurement, ROI analysis, and recommendations
Ability to collaborate effectively within the organization through excellent communication skills, and to build strong relationships to deliver outstanding results
Minimum Bachelor’s degree required
Bonus skills: HTML/CSS, Adobe Creative Suite, and familiarity with other standard web-based SaaS applications', 'Additional Information
This is a remote, contract position. Must reside in the United States.']
['Lead Contracts Senior Manager', '', '', '', '', 'The Team', '', '', '', '']

column7:
["This is a hybrid/remote role (within USA), with the option to work from any of Newfront's office locations.

Insurance is a trillion dollar market that is fundamental to society, yet it has not modernized — until now.

Newfront is building the modern insurance experience.

We've reimagined the experience for clients, prospects, and employees, altering the way people create, understand, select, transact, and use insurance. We're changing the approach so that it starts and ends with the client, not the product, and empowering people for moments that matter.

Our unique approach recognizes both the vast potential of technology and the fundamental role of insurance experts. We're a technology-driven company with DE&I in our DNA and strong values; we believe people matter most.

Our mission is to define the future of the insurance industry, while instilling a high performance culture in combination with living our Work, Love, Play ethos each day. We value balanced lives and are passionate about creating a culture of wellness that results in healthier, happier, and more productive employees, and more successful clients.

The Role

Reporting to the Chief Marketing Officer, the Senior Director of Product Marketing is a storyteller with a passion for bringing products and service lines to life with words and can build and lead/influence teams to support Newfront’s rapid technology development roadmap. The successful candidate brings significant experience in developing customer-friendly messages and leading impactful go-to-market strategies that result in wide adoption and high client retention within a B2B context. This leader will serve as the primary liaison between product development/management, marketing, and the business lines (sales) to ensure maximum mind share, market share, technology adoption, and revenue growth.

Given the highly cross-functional nature of this role, our ideal candidate will own the positioning and launch plans for our platform and practice lines while enabling our insurance producers to win key deals. This role is instrumental in capitalizing on market opportunities and realizing our results oriented commercial objectives in 2023, and beyond.

#LI-Remote", 'Responsibilities
Build our product marketing function (and core processes) with a focus on driving pipeline, solution value, and customer value realization
Be the specialist on our producer needs as well as their potential buyers and influencers/partners
Cultivate a solid understanding of our shifting competitor landscape by developing and sharing market insights on key competitors
Establish the positioning of Newfront’s technology, including developing and maintaining our key differentiators, value propositions and messaging
Work with product ops to coordinate and lead the development and implementation of end-to-end launch plans for new features, solutions and technology integrations
Enable our client-facing teams with materials such as win/loss analysis, battle cards, objection handling, pitch decks, RFP templates, website copy and content, one-pagers, stats and facts, and demo videos
Support the development of our Brand and Demand Generation function by understanding content messaging gaps and developing custom positioning and materials to engage target accounts
Support the Content Marketing function in setting our thought leadership and demand content agenda in line with our commercial objectives
Manage and ensure the success of client marketing initiatives including advocacy, references, community and be a strong contributor to successful upsell strategies
Set clear goals and product marketing Key Performance Indicators with support from the team
Drive the strategic GTM direction for segment growth, including development of core use cases, buyer messaging, sales plays, and industry approach
Build and support analyst relationships (Gartner, Forrester, etc.) and act as a company spokesperson across product areas', 'Qualifications
10+ years of product marketing experience in enterprise SaaS and/or services, ideally in insurance or financial services. Experience in positioning for the Finance and/or People Operations functions in insurance/employee benefits (or similar) is most ideal
Proven record in successfully developing and leading complex go-to-market strategies for enterprise SaaS products
Consistent record of extracting value-based messaging from technical product specs; experience in digital marketing or content marketing ideal
A highly collaborative leader with penchant for creatively partnering with and influencing cross-functional teams especially Product and Commercial Strategy
Expert at designing and presenting different types of content (one-pagers, sales decks, website content and demo videos); good online copywriting skills are crucial
Strong organizational and project management skills to effectively manage multiple partners and projects with tight deadlines
A doer who thinks strategically and acts tactically
Experienced with people and/or team management including external vendors', 'What We Offer
An opportunity to work on technology and solutions that are scaling very rapidly and changing the insurance industry as we know it
A chance to join a high-growth company at an early stage
The ability to impact the growth of our company, we value all comments and suggestions!
Transparency across teams and interaction with multiple departments
Competitive pay, employer-paid healthcare, equity', 'At Newfront, we are committed to hiring diverse talent and supporting an inclusive workplace environment. If you are excited about a role at Newfront but feel you’re missing a few of the qualifications, we still encourage you to apply and tell us about yourself. You may just be the next Newfront team member that we are looking for!

Newfront is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Diversity is in our DNA and we believe that creating an inclusive workplace elevates the value we are able to bring to our customers and employees alike. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law.
The pay range for this position in California, Washington, Colorado and New York at commencement of employment is expected to be between $178,600 and $267,800/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus, restricted stock units, and discretionary awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

If you require reasonable accommodations throughout the application or interview process, please contact us at careers@newfront.com. For information regarding how Newfront collects and uses personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.']

['Job Details', 'What you will do', '', 'OpenBlue is a complete suite of connected solutions that delivers impactful sustainability, new occupant experiences, and respectful safety and security that combines our 137 years of building expertise with innovative technology. The OpenBlue suite is part of the new Digital Solutions (DS) business at Johnson Controls (JCI).', '', 'Johnson Controls’ “Digital Solutions” focus on connecting systems, gathering data from building sensors and other relevant data streams, and generating operational efficiency, savings, and a converged occupant experience for our customers. Our solutions are based on a flexible, open, and scalable cloud-based digital platform that can help customers to realize its vision in data transformation. The Platform solves the challenge of integrating Operational Technology (OT) and Information Technology (IT).', '', 'We are looking for an experienced Regional Sales Manager to manage the Sales support of our OpenBlue Digital software in North America. You will act as the liaison between internal and external customers and our digital solutions management teams. As a key member of digital solutions business development organization, you will be responsible for the growth and continued adoption of the Digital Solutions software. In this role you will have an emphasis on sales support, voice of the internal and external customers, and become a key partner to the North America Sales team with dotted line reporting to the Regional Vice President of Digital Sales.', '', 'How you will do it']

['About Starburst

Starburst is the fastest, most efficient analytics engine for a data warehouse, data lake, or data mesh. Our software provides fast and easy access to data, no matter where it lives, with a best-in-class MPP SQL engine that shortens the path to value for data. The Starburst Enterprise Platform leverages the power of the open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL) to query data across any database, making it instantly actionable for data-driven organizations. Our SaaS offering, Starburst Galaxy provides all the benefits of Trino and Starburst in an easy to use, fully-managed enterprise-ready multi-cloud SaaS platform designed by Trino’s original creators and experts.

With Starburst, teams can lower the total cost of their infrastructure and analytics investments, prevent vendor lock-in, and use the existing tools that work for their business. Though Starburst has achieved a unicorn status and raised $414M in venture funding from top investors, we were founded with customers and revenue from the very beginning. Our customers love us, we operate globally, and we are proud to be named a Best Place to Work. Come join our team of All-Stars!

About the role

A key value driver for Starburst is its streamlined, easy-to-use, delightful user interfaces and workflows. As a full-stack engineer on Starburst Galaxy, Trino or Starburst Enterprise team, you’ll share ownership of building out the user experience. You’ll work closely with UX, and product management to design and build back-end and front-end components to implement new features our customers will love. Daily tasks include developing and supporting new and existing product features, working with fellow engineers around the world, learning new technologies, designing complex systems, and collaborating with various stakeholders across the organization.', 'What you’ll do as a Full-Stack Engineer
On the Data Products and Governance team, you’ll build features and functionality that allows our Enterprise customers to treat data as a first-class product, with rich metadata and social features, alongside a native built-in access control experience.
On the Growth team, you’ll share ownership of the user experience of billing while completing tactical work which defines, tracks, and improves the key customer growth metrics for Galaxy in partnership with our sales and marketing.
On the Connect and Query team, you’ll unlock the value of distributed data by making it easy to query data from Starburst, regardless of where it lives.
On the Observability team, you will build out our Galaxy product stack for the introspection and administration of the Galaxy product by collecting data and providing insights.', 'Responsibilities
Design and develop components to Starburst products, including a comprehensive, fully featured web-based user interface
Participate in projects from concept to completion
Continuously improve our engineering processes, tests, and systems that allow us to scale the code base and productivity of the team
Collaborate with teams globally and operate in a fast paced environment
Provide exceptional customer support for both internal and external customers', 'Some of the things we look for
Passion for Software Engineering
Experience developing software in Java
Experience implementing web based user interfaces in TypeScript using a modern web frontend framework (React, Angular, Ember, etc)
Prior experience building SaaS (especially for our SaaS product, Galaxy)
Demonstration of ownership, grit, and bias for action - core values at Starburst', 'The base salary range for this US full-time position is $140,000 - $230,000, subject to standard withholding and applicable taxes. All candidates receive equity (ISO) and access to a comprehensive benefits offering. The base salary range reflects the minimum and maximum target for candidates across all US locations. Work location, skills, experience, and any relevant education or training determine the compensation awarded to the candidate. The Recruiting Team or Hiring Manager can share more about the specific salary range with you during the recruitment process.

Benefits

At Starburst, we’re constantly striving towards building a place where people come first by creating an environment of transparency, honesty, and respect. We take care of our global workforce by making sure employees enjoy competitive salaries and attractive stock grants, remote-friendly work options, access to quality and affordable insurance, and flexible and generous paid time off to start a family, travel, or just relax!

Headquartered in Boston, MA with offices in Warsaw, London, Palo Alto and Tel Aviv and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.

Starburst provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

#BI-Remote #LI-Remote']

["Invicti is an application security leader empowering organizations to continuously secure their web applications and APIs through all stages of the software development lifecycle. Exclusively focused on this space for more than 15 years, Invicti's products Netsparker and Acunetix bring security and development teams together to protect company data from breach through industry-leading Discovery, Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST), Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST) and Software Composition Analysis (SCA).
Invicti's proprietary Proof-Based Scanning technology is the first to deliver automation verification of vulnerabilities and proof of exploit, returning crucial time to development and security teams for critical projects and innovation. Invicti serves more than 3,500 companies and public sector agencies worldwide including NASA, Samsung, IBM and Verizon.", 'Who You Are:', "As the Federal Customer Success Team Manager you will report to the VP of Customer Success and you will be responsible for Customer Success Managers building and maintaining strong customer relationships. You will need to make sure your team builds relationships with key stakeholders, acting as an escalation point for issues that impact client success and responding to retention risks and opportunities. As a Team Manager, your responsibility will be to make sure your team aims to expand their customers' adoption, retention, and ultimately, success.", "What You'll Be Doing:", "Professionally manage your team of Customer Success Managers to build customer relationships with a portfolio of assigned accounts.
Make sure your team meets and exceeds customer retention and expansion goals.
Provide accurate forecasts for retention and expansion revenue.
Act on gaps identified during the process of forecasting.
Build and maintain strong, trusted working relationships with each member of the team.
Gain a thorough understanding of the team's time management and how they are handling their regions and clients.
Develop and execute retention plans for customers who may be at risk.
Drive resolution of escalated account issues in coordination with Billing, Support, and other departments.
Gain and maintain expert knowledge of Invicti's products and services.
Be a voice for accounts internally and help senior leadership understand product concerns, shortcomings, and missing features that are retention risks.
Manage contract-related inquiries, questions, and issues from clients and other departments.
Liaise with other team managers to make sure that Invicti's clients are getting the best service possible.", "What You'll Need:", '2+ years of experience working with the federal government, government contractors, and government-specific channel partners.
4+ years proven success in Customer Success, Account Management, or Sales at an IT or SaaS company.
Must have at least 2+ years of experience of managing a team, leading from the front. Excellent communication and relationship management skills.
Generating reports on a regular basis for your team, with revenue forecasting a necessity.
Experience with account portfolio planning, management, and prioritization.
High attention to detail and willingness to get "in the weeds" to fix a problem.
Knowledge of customer success best practices.', 'Why Invicti?', 'Gartner Magic Quadrant Recipient 2021 (Application Security Testing)
No. 16 on Inc. Magazine's List of the Fastest-Growing Private Companies in Texas
Competitive compensation
100% employer-paid health benefits & 401k match
A culture that emphasizes personal and professional growth
Adult-life balance is deeply important to us - we have a discretionary time off policy & flex-remote work approach
We're a social bunch - from office ping-pong tournaments to virtual concerts (aka the "new normal")
Office space that cultivates creativity through an open and collaborative workspace', 'Invicti is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.']

column7:
['Uniphore is the global leader in Conversational Automation. Every day, billions of conversations take place across industries — customer service, sales, HR, education and more. Whether they are human to human, human to machine or machine to machine, conversations are at the heart of everything we do, and the new currency of the enterprise.

At Uniphore, we believe companies that best understand and act on those conversations will win. We have built the most comprehensive and powerful conversational automation platform that combines conversational AI, workflow automation, and RPA (Robotic Process Automation) with a business user-friendly-UX (User Experience) in a single integrated platform to transform and democratize customer experiences across industries.

Uniphore is growing! We recently raised a $400M Series E round and were recognized by Frost & Sullivan as the innovation leader in conversational automation. Uniphore is leading the charge in the conversational service automation industry and is looking for smart, driven, and ambitious people to shepherd the company through this next phase of growth.

This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in the United States.
Uniphore is looking for a Senior Counsel to join Uniphore’s dynamic and collaborative legal team and to lead its worldwide commercial efforts.

The person in this role will be a key hire for Uniphore, in a hands-on position leading the negotiation of the Company’s biggest dollar and highest-impact deals and providing thought leadership around commercial strategy and streamlining sales processes.

This position will have high visibility and interaction with the C-Suite so it requires someone with the maturity and clear communication skills to distill complex concepts into actionable items. Initially, there will be two people that report into this position, so management experience is a plus.

The ideal candidate in this role will have deep SaaS experience, a working knowledge of revenue recognition as it relates to software, but most importantly, be driven, with a strong focus on customer success.
This role will report directly to Uniphore’s General Counsel.', 'Primary Responsibilities:
Lead the drafting and negotiation of enterprise customer agreements, including SaaS agreements (and related data privacy addendums), technology license agreements, development and collaboration agreements, professional service agreements, and consulting services agreements.
Serve as the escalation point to counsel reporting into this position.
Develop and iterate the Legal team’s commercial strategy to scale with the company.
Support our Finance, Sales, Delivery and Product teams by providing legal guidance and contract interpretation.
Manage outside counsel and other teammates as needed.
Seek ways to streamline and improve on inefficiencies, including continual improvement of forms and processes in response to customer concerns or internal demands.', 'Required Experience:
Prior experience negotiating SaaS/Software contracts is a must. The successful candidate in this role will have 5+ years of experience autonomously negotiating agreements for a high growth company.
Team player with exceptional people skills who has the demonstrated ability to collaborate and build strong relationships at all levels of an organization.
Pragmatic, business focus with an understanding of business goals, and the ability to assess and creatively manage risk.
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and successfully manage competing deadlines.
Strong understanding of IP ownership and data protection/privacy issues in the context of technology/commercial transactions.
Outstanding legal and business judgment, capable of making smart decisions in ambiguous situations.
J.D. from an accredited law school.', "Compensation & Benefits
The anticipated base salary hiring range for this position is:
California: $213,100 - $230,000
All other US locations: $177,600 - $230,000
The specific rate will depend on the successful candidate's qualifications and prior experience.
In addition to competitive base pay, this position also includes an annual [bonus/commission] based on target achievement, pre-IPO stock options, benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with a match, and more, plus generous paid time off, paid holidays, paid day off for your birthday and other paid leave policies to support employees through all phases of life.

Uniphore is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
For more information on how Uniphore delivers business value using Conversational Automation, please visit www.uniphore.com

All applicants - to review our privacy notice, please click here"]

column7:
['Osano is hiring an experienced Sr. Account Executive - Mid-Market to join our growing team. The ideal candidate is competitive by nature, enjoys connecting prospects to insights + products to solve their business challenges, and has sold a SaaS, B2B solution in the data privacy, security, or compliance industries.', '', 'This role serves as a key champion in the customer lifecycle, so we’re looking for someone who will enthusiastically represent our people, product, and ideals. You’ll receive warm leads via our SDR and marketing teams, as well as create your own leads in marketing, compliance, data security, and legal target companies of all sizes. You’ll leverage your research, intuition, creativity, and personality to form authentic relationships. You’ll also be in direct control of your success as the compensation for this role is a combination of base + uncapped commission (plus accelerators for going above + beyond!).', '', 'Osano is an Austin area, venture-backed startup focused on creating transparency in data. Osano is a B-corp (public benefit corp), which means that, although we are a for-profit company, we are mission-oriented, and we wake up every morning with the goal of doing well by doing good.', '', "At Osano, we value candidates from all walks of life and are focused on building a diverse team. If you don't exactly meet all of the below requirements, don't let that keep you from applying. We're looking for people who are eager to learn and grow with us. If you're interested in being part of our inclusive, mission-driven, venture-backed tech startup, say hi!", 'The Role', 'Sell Osano’s proprietary consent management, subject rights, data discovery, vendor monitoring, and privacy program applications to companies seeking to satisfy regulatory requirements (i.e. GDPR and CCPA) and build a trusted brand using transparent, automated data privacy software.
Uncover goals, challenges, and requirements of prospects and customers, including budget constraints and decision-makers.
Deliver compelling presentations, demos, and proposals.
Negotiate pricing and contractual agreements.
Meet and exceed individual targets + contribute to the overall team success.
Provide account analysis and revenue forecast to Sales Leadership on a regular basis.
Manage a robust pipeline, including running with high-intent leads + hunting across target accounts with the support of a world-class sales development and marketing team.
Nurture our supportive culture by building relationships across Osano and working closely with others to ensure clients’ success/satisfaction.
Stay up-to-date with privacy trends + our technical products, services, pricing model, and value proposition.
Travel, if safe, may be required for large deals or market opportunities (do what you need to do to close the deal; travel is expected to be <15% of this role)', 'About You']
