column7: ['Our world is transforming, and PTC is leading the way. Our software brings the physical and digital worlds together, enabling companies to improve operations, create better products, and empower people in all aspects of their business.', '', 'Our people make all the difference in our success. Today, we are a global team of nearly 7,000 and our main objective is to create opportunities for our team members to explore, learn, and grow – all while seeing their ideas come to life and celebrating the differences that make us who we are and the work we do possible.', 'About PTC:', "PTC enables global manufacturers to realize double-digit impact with software solutions that enable them to accelerate product and service innovation, improve operational efficiency, and increase workforce productivity. In combination with an extensive partner network, PTC provides customers flexibility in how its technology can be deployed to drive digital transformation – on premises, in the cloud, or via its pure SaaS platform. At PTC, we don't just imagine a better world, we enable it.", '', 'Technical Architect, Senior', '', 'Location: Remote, North America\n\nPTC is looking for talented, enthusiastic, and career-minded individuals to join our Global Services consulting organization where you will have the opportunity to travel regularly while working with a well-established and growing number of companies in a range of industries. From Aerospace & Defense to High Tech to Industrial Products and Footwear & Apparel, PTC’s customer base is as far reaching as the products you use every day.', '']

column1: Senior Director of Product Management - HSM
Sr. Manager, Sales Enablement Strategic Programs (Remote)
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Opportunities for advancement']
column7:
['Requisition ID
530204', '', "Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps generate the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and optimize outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at www.medidata.com and follow us @medidata.
Your Mission:
We are seeking a highly motivated and energetic Enablement professional to help drive sales enablement programs. The ideal candidate is passionate about accelerating the success of our teams. This is an amazing opportunity to have a significant impact on increasing business productivity. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, highly engaged environment.
This position requires constant collaboration across the enablement team, sales leadership, product marketing, operations, talent, learning, and development teams to continue to refine and execute enablement programs and events.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Works closely with the enablement team to plan, deliver, manage, and constantly iterate updates to the high-priority enablement programs and events
Create and manages program communications and project plans for all enablement programs
Implements metrics and assessments to track key milestones
Runs a metrics-focused program, communicating updates on a quarterly basis
Collaborates to react quickly to any decrease in metrics, putting a plan into place to make immediate improvements
Creates experiential exercises to drive a high level of interactivity and retainment
Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations in the field of learning and incorporate it into the program.
Creates and documents regular check-ins with hiring managers to assess each new hire's progress during the onboarding journey.
Curates existing and creates new learning content for each program as needed.
Plans all production needs for programs and events
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE / SKILLS PREFERRED
BA/BS Degree (or equivalent relevant experience)
Strong working knowledge of Salesforce CRM / Tableau preferred.
Strong knowledge of B2B SaaS software sales cycles and sales processes
Proven track record in creating, delivering, and training successfully with measurable results in fast-paced environments
A minimum of 3-5 years of sales enablement experience preferred
Healthcare or Pharmaceutical Industry experience is a plus.
3-5 years of employee communications and project management experience, which must include the development and execution of strategic plans and narratives
Consistent track record of cross-group collaboration, the ability to influence corporate and local teams at multiple levels of the organization respectfully and professionally
Strong organization and program management skills, consistently meet milestones, tight deadlines, and communicates status on concurrent projects
Proven track record of working with and influencing sales reps and executives
Excellent writer, capable of understanding how various initiatives fit into a larger strategy (i.e. “connecting the dots” for employees)
Creative flair for developing presentations for sales teams and executives.
Deadline-driven self-starter with good judgment
Strong attention to detail, business writing, project management, and interpersonal communications
Strong ability to represent concepts as well as summarize and communicate complex ideas into a curriculum with a strong sense of how sales professionals think, operate, and absorb training
Self-motivated with the ability to work with minimal supervision
Candidates will be required to participate in an enablement case study / presentation as part of the final interviewing process. Details will be provided as needed.
As with all roles, Medidata sets ranges based on a number of factors including function, level, candidate expertise and experience, and geographic location.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the NYC Metro Area is $96,000-$128,000.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the California Bay Area is $141,000-$189,000.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the Boston Metro Area is $132,000-$177,000.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in Texas or Ohio is $118,000-$158,000.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in all other locations within the United States is $120,750- 161,000.
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission on the terms of applicable plan documents, and many of Medidata’s non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Medidata believes that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and provides best-in-class benefits, including medical, dental, life and disability insurance; 401(k) matching; unlimited paid time off (subject to management discretion); and 10 paid holidays per year.
#LI-LT
#LI-Remote
Equal Employment Opportunity
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Covid Statement
Our Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine."]

['Your work days are brighter here.', '', "At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.", '', 'About the Team', '', '', 'About the Role', '', 'Responsibilities:']

column7: ['UserGems is the future of outbound sales. We apply artificial intelligence to help companies identify who to best target for their sales and marketing outreach. We’re growing 3X year-over-year and recently raised a $20M series A from Craft Ventures, Uncork Capital, Battery Ventures, Tiger Global, and more.', "As a Senior Product Manager you'll you will be owning the vision, strategy and roadmap for one of our key products.", '\u200d', 'What is UserGems', 'We monitor a company’s existing customer list for job changes and alert their sales teams whenever someone moves to a new company.', 'Each month, our customers get a list of people they should reach out to – identified and ranked by our proprietary algorithm. This algorithm combines thousands of data points to generate the best possible prospecting list, uniquely tailored to them.', 'Example: Jared was using AWS when he worked at Hooli. Now that he’s working at Pied Piper, he could be interested in using AWS again. We’ll alert AWS’ sales team of Jared’s job change. Jared already knows AWS and might be interested to hear what AWS has to offer for Pied Piper.', '', '\u200d', 'What our customers say']

['Job Details', 'Level
Experienced
Job Location
Remote - Portland, OR
Remote Type
Optional Work from Home
Position Type
Full Time
Job Category
Sales', '', "At LegitScript, we are passionate about making the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent. We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. To do this, LegitScript combines big data with the world’s leading team of experts skilled in highly regulated and complex sectors, including transaction laundering detection, pharmaceuticals, online gambling, and more.

The result? Unmatched accuracy and deep risk analysis that identifies which commercial entities play by the rules, and which do not. Our diverse industry partnerships provide unique insights that keep businesses and governments at the forefront of emerging trends. That’s why LegitScript is trusted by the world's largest search engines, internet platforms, payment companies, and regulatory agencies.

We are seeking a Senior Account Manager to join our growing Sales team. This individual will engage with current clients in the Enterprise segment to identify how LegitScript can help them drive key business and growth objectives. You will be responsible for maintaining client relationships, developing and executing expansion, add-on, and renewal opportunities, and helping build the overall strategy of the sales department.

We're looking for a motivated, self-starter who is comfortable wearing multiple hats and thrives in a dynamic environment. You must be flexible, highly-collaborative, and able to think on your feet. This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly accelerating organization.

What you'll do:
Work cross-functionally to manage a pipeline of potential opportunities, navigate closing processes, and consistently achieve individual sales quota for both revenue retention and upsells.
Engage current clients via phone, email, and video communication platforms to perform regular wellness checks, ensure top-tier service quality, retain current partnerships, and assist with expansion and add-on opportunities .
Accurately forecast sales activity and revenue achievement through the use of sales tools.
Understand prospect pain points and develop a value proposition specific to the customer's needs and business goals.
Navigate sophisticated procurement cycles with multi-stakeholder sign-off including executives, legal, information security, etc.
Develop and negotiate proposals and contracts.
Be comfortable presenting products to prospective clients, both in person and virtually
Serve as a trusted advisor and consultant to all client partners throughout the entire sales and onboarding process
Be competitive in nature with strong passion to exceed personal and professional goals
Have an aptitude to understand and articulate key business drivers and overcome potential client partners objections by effectively communicating the LegitScript value propositions
Be team oriented and collaborative with all departments
Be open to consistent, formal coaching from leadership, sales coaches and peers

What you'll bring:
8+ years of B2B, Enterprise SaaS sales or relationship management experience in a quota-carrying role.
Consultative sales or relationship management experience for products/solutions that affect multiple partners and areas of a customer organization.
Ability to develop, implement, and execute a client retention and expansion strategy with minimal oversight or direction.
Knowledge of market research, sales and negotiating principles
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in lieu of degree
Skilled in verbal and written communications
Exceptional organization skills and time management
Proven experience adapting and thriving in a constantly changing environment
Positive, entrepreneurial attitude
Knowledge of CRM software (eg. Salesforce)", '', "This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. We cannot support international remote work.

In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package:
Multiple Medical plans (one with $0 employee premium option), Dental & Vision plans
401k with company match and immediate vesting
Generous paid time off package and 11 paid holidays
And much more!

If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in LegitScript’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes."]

["Senior Product Marketing Manager
Remote - Northeast United States
What makes ThoughtSpot a great place to work?
To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo. We are very deliberate about building a culture focused on selfless-excellence, continuous learning and improvement (2% done) achieved through diversity (balance-for-the-better) and inclusion.
What is the role?
Senior Product Marketing Manager
We’re looking for an experienced product marketer to join our dynamic PMM team. In this role you will tell compelling stories, build lasting partnerships, engage our customers around the world, and showcase our product in new and exciting ways.
What you'll do:
Create product positioning and messaging that solidifies ThoughtSpot’s position atop the modern data stack.
Craft highly differentiated presentations and collateral for our field teams and strategic partners.
Enable ThoughtSpot sellers and our partners on the latest product positioning, case studies, and campaign messaging.
Write and deliver creative demos showcasing the latest ThoughtSpot product features and enhancements.
Present at industry conferences, trade shows, and customer events.
Engage with press, analysts, and key influencers.
What you bring:
4+ years of experience in B2B product marketing, ideally a SaaS focused role.
Proven track record of working cross functionally, including with Product, Design, Engineering, Sales and Marketing teams.
Gifted story-teller with excellent written, visual, and verbal communication skills; public-speaking experience is a must.
Ability to think strategically and navigate ambiguity, with experience breaking down broad, complex problems and thinking about them in a structured way.
Analytical and data-driven, with experience generating qualitative and quantitative insights and using them to inform strategies and decision-making.
Sales-oriented “always be closing” mentality.
Experience working with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery) a plus
MBA or advanced degree preferred, but not required.
#LI-MS5
#LI-Remote
ThoughtSpot for All
Building a diverse and inclusive team isn't just the right thing to do for our people, it's the right thing to do for our business. We know we can’t solve complex data problems with a single perspective. It takes many voices, experiences, and areas of expertise to deliver the innovative solutions our customers need. At ThoughtSpot, we continually celebrate the diverse communities that individuals cultivate to empower every Spotter to bring their whole authentic self to work.
We’re committed to being real and continuously learning when it comes to equality, equity, and creating space for underrepresented groups to thrive.
Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
To all recruitment agencies:
ThoughtSpot does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ThoughtSpot employees, or any other organization location. ThoughtSpot nor its employees are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
About ThoughtSpot
ThoughtSpot is the Modern Analytics Cloud company. Our mission is to create a more fact-driven world with the easiest to use analytics platform. With ThoughtSpot, anyone can leverage natural language search and AI to find data insights and tap into the most cutting edge innovations the cloud data ecosystem has to offer. Companies can now put the power of their modern data stack in the hands of every employee, extend the value of their data to partners and customers, and automate entire business processes. ThoughtSpot’s web and mobile applications improve decision-making for every employee. With ThoughtSpot’s developer-friendly platform, customers can also embed consumer-grade analytics into their SaaS offerings or build entirely new interactive data apps that engage users and keep them coming back for more. Organizations like Walmart, BT, Daimler, Medtronic, Hulu, Royal Bank of Canada, Nasdaq, OpenTable, Workato, and Nationwide Building Society rely on ThoughtSpot to transform how their employees and customers take advantage of data."]

["Who we are:
Motive builds technology to improve the safety, productivity, and profitability of businesses that power the physical economy. Motive combines IoT hardware with AI-powered applications to connect and automate physical operations. Motive is one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world, serving more than 120,000 businesses, across a wide range of industries including trucking and logistics, construction, oil and gas, food and beverage, field service, agriculture, passenger transit, and delivery.
Motive is built on four foundational attributes; Own It, Less but Better, Build Trust, and Unlock Potential. This has taken our company to great heights, including being recognized by Fortune for Best Workplaces, Forbes Best Startup Employers, and Comparably for our Best Global Culture, Sales Team, Leadership Team, Career Growth, and CEO for Diversity. We're proud to receive an employee net promoter score of 63 (according to Comparably) which places Motive in the top 5% of companies with 4,000 employees or more.
Today, our team is made up of more than 4,000 employees, located across the world, providing support to a wide range of customers. While most of our employees are remote, many have the opportunity to work on-site at any of our 8 global office locations. Visit our careers website to learn more about opportunities at Motive.", 'About the Role:', 'As an Enterprise Sales Engineer, you will have the opportunity to play an active part in increasing effectiveness, productivity, and revenue growth in the Sales Team. The Senior Sales Engineer will report directly to the Manager of Sales Engineering. They will be expected to have excellent interpersonal communication skills, technical comprehension, product expertise, business acumen, and overall industry knowledge.', "What You'll Do:", "Partner and strategize with Enterprise Account Executives for discovery calls, product demonstrations, POC support and onsite meetings
Will be capable of providing customized demonstrations of the Motive product offering to prospects spanning a multitude of roles
Successfully match customer pains and requirements to proposed solutions
Become an expert on Motive's competition, lending your expertise to Enterprise AEs working on displacement deals
Product expert, not only on Motive's current offering but our roadmap as well
Work with Enterprise AEs to respond to RFIs and RFPs
Sales liaison between multiple internal organizations, including; Product, Engineering, Customer Success and Product Marketing", "What We're Looking For:", "Minimum 5+ years working with sales prospects in a pre-sales/sales engineering capacity (SaaS and Hardware experience is a plus)
Excellent communication skills
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Consistent track record selling complex solutions
Experience with Enterprise sales cycles
Experience in the Transportation & Logistics industry is a plus
Experience with APIs and integrations
Bachelor's Degree required, Bachelor's of Science preferred, MS a plus", 'The compensation range for this position will depend on where you reside. Motive uses three geographic zones to determine pay range: Zone 4 (workers who live in San Francisco), Zone 3 (workers who live in select U.S. metropolitan areas: Los Angeles, San Diego, New York City Area, Seattle, Washington D.C.), and Zone 2 (workers who live elsewhere in the United States). For this role, the compensation ranges are:', 'USA 4: 184,000 - 276,000
USA 3: 166,000 - 248,000
USA 2: 147,000 - 221,000', 'Your compensation may be based on several factors, including education, work experience, and certifications. Motive offers benefits including health, pharmacy, optical and dental care benefits as well as 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Learn more about our benefits by visiting https://www.comparably.com/companies/motive/perks-and-benefits']

['Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions power the digital strategies of companies like Google, eBay, and Adidas.', "We help our customers succeed in today's digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights, competitive benchmarks, strategic analysis, and more.", "In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven't stopped growing since!", "We're looking for a Senior Field Marketing Manager who will lead and execute Similarweb's events and marketing campaigns for both physical and digital activities in the Americas. As a core member of the Marketing team, this role will have a great deal of autonomy to develop a framework for repeatable execution of revenue-driving events and programs that support the America's pipeline goals. This role will report to the Director of Marketing.", 'Why is this role so important at Similarweb?', "The Americas is one of Similarweb main target markets, therefore it's crucial for us to have a strong marketing presence in the region. The opportunity in this role will be to help to develop and execute the marketing strategy in the region, working closely with the regional leaders, the local sales team, and global marketing partners.", 'So, what will you be doing all day?', 'Your role as part of the Marketing team means your daily responsibilities may include:', "Work closely with the global marketing team to ensure campaign alignment, pipeline targets, successful regional deployment of budget and demand generation
Develop field marketing events and programs consistent with sales goals and market segment messaging and priorities
Work directly with sales to support territory planning and marketing alignment within the region or team
Leverage a deep understanding of internal and external market positioning and our target audiences to inform event & program decisions
Ensure all activities achieve standards, adhere to current messaging, and remain within branding guidelines
Manage our trade show and field event presence in the Americas, including but not limited to tradeshows, customer-facing events, webinars, conferences, dinners, etc.
Build and manage the event program planning and execution, including but not limited to defining event goals and key performance indicators, promotional strategy, accountability and accuracy of budget and spend, contracts, timelines, on-day support, evaluation of results against goals, wrap-up reports, and generate learnings for improvement
Develop and execute an engagement plan for each event including reviewing attendee lists, working with other marketing members and the sales team to develop outreach content, owning booth design, and identifying opportunities for Similarweb to amplify it's presence
Execute on event communications including event landing pages, pre-and post-event follow-up, social, etc. with our global marketing team
Manage marketing campaigns for the region, including but not limited to webinars, landing pages, videos, advertisements, and creatives
Partner with cross-functional team leaders in sales and marketing to drive program strategies, approaches, and success criteria metrics
Forecast, evaluate measure, and report on marketing campaign effectiveness and ROI
Ensure lead campaigns are created within SFDC and routed correctly to the Sales teams
Monitor key marketing performance metrics in SFDC
Identify customer success stories to achieve maximum exposure and leverage toward both building the brand and providing valuable sales tools", 'This is the perfect job for someone who:']

["At Bluebeam, we're committed to building a better life for those who build our world. That's why we create smart, easy-to-use software solutions that help teams save time and money, project after project.", 'What we are looking for:', 'On a typical day, the Sr. Channel Account Manager might develop a sales plan to help a reseller achieve a goal, organize, and lead a quarterly business review, forecast the business, drive pipeline calls, highlight best practices to the team, secure investments from partners, identify industry trends, holds a partner accountable or share ideas for a new training activity.
You will manage a select group of partners to build a sales pipeline and strategy to exceed sales goals, mentor Account Managers, investigate industry trends, and lead as a problem solver that can identify and drive projects.', "What you'll do:", "You'll accurately forecast on behalf of your partners by understanding their business opportunities and strategy, as well as lead quarterly business reviews to discover, define, maintain, and execute on meeting or exceeding mutually defined goals in the partnership.", '', 'You will lead weekly pipeline reviews to maintain visibility into opportunities and coach partners as a Bluebeam expert on our sales methodology.
A critical piece to your success is having strong follow through and a commitment to meeting deadlines.
You thrive on identifying sales opportunities and gaps within reseller relationships to encourage investments.', '', 'What we would like to see in you:', '5+ years in Channel Management.
Keen communication skills to motivate different levels of Leadership. Everything from Sr. level leadership to C-Suite.
Build strong relationships within each reseller.
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite.
Accurate forecast and pipeline management.
Ability to demonstrate knowledge of the industry and channel trends.
Project Management experience.
You thrive on identifying sales opportunities and gaps within reseller relationships to encourage investments.
BA/BS']

column7:
['Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.', '', "Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:", '', '1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.', '2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.', '3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.', '', '', 'Exceed annual sales targets
Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for each enterprise account, then drive the execution of that plan to success
Prospecting, building pipeline and selling Coupa cloud-based spend management solutions to enterprise Coupa clients
Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and quarterback the deal to closure
Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
Provide pro-active, trusted thought leadership to target accounts
Orchestrate client and internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that Coupa will deliver and the investments the client will need to make
Create and execute Field Sales Campaigns to create demand
Develop and deliver world-class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
Implement our Coupa Sales Best Practices
Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%)
Maintain the system of record in Salesforce.com
Develop and deliver world class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and drive deals to closure
Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model (http://www.executiveboard.com/exbd-resources/content/challenger/index.html)
Align overall value messaging targeted towards the chief economic buyer in target accounts
Build out an account penetration model that encourages multi-angle access into key accounts']

column7:
['Our Enterprise Supplier Sales team is growing! Due territory expansions in 2023, we are adding multiple Account Executive roles. In this role, the Enterprise Account Executive (EAE) will work among large supplier accounts ($150 million + in annual revenue) to upsell and cross-sell their current account base and respond to incoming leads from a variety of sources. The Account Executive will work collaboratively with a Strategic Account Executive as well as other account team members to effectively create and uncover new sales opportunities. This position will use your business acumen and corporate savvy to demonstrate and prescribe SPS solutions to current clients.', 'This is a quota carrying role: 80% Direct Sales/20% Indirect Sales.', '', 'Does this sound like you?', "Results matter and you hold yourself to a high standard of performance. This shines in your fluent development of comprehensive partner go-to-market strategies
Obsessed with customers is how you work. You're an innovator with excellent communication, interpersonal and customer engagement skills as someone who can work cross-functionally as well as across different levels of leadership
You have mastered translating technical and business information to a variety of audiences and partner management is your true calling. You work with a sense of urgency without sacrificing the quality of the work you are providing
You work smarter and harder by thriving to hold stamina through a complex solution sales process. You often identify a problem, create a solution and bring it to a state of completion – with others or even on your own.", 'Why Join SPS?', 'We solve retail supply chain problems by cutting through inefficiency with innovation and automation. At SPS we empower retailers, suppliers, distributors, grocers and logistics partners to work better together with our people, our process and our tech products.', '', 'We have the world’s largest retail network, and we don’t just lead the industry, we are the industry. At SPS, we believe every employee makes a difference. We ensure employees have the tools, resources and training to explore new ideas and execute them. Our success comes from playing as a team.', '']

column1: Workday Consultant/Senior Consultant (Total Rewards) - Virtual North America

column7:
['RealPage is changing the technology real estate industry and our teammates know how to think big and leave their mark. If you want to join a globally progressive and inclusive company devoted to excellence, we are looking for you!', 'We are the leading global provider of software and data analytics to the real estate industry. We navigate clients toward the right decisions with data and technology insights they can only get from RealPage. Serving our clients is our highest priority and RealPage teammates are our greatest asset.', 'Come join a team where your work makes an impact every day!', 'We’re passionate about helping hard-working entrepreneurs grow their property management and real estate investment businesses. We’re a collective of uniquely talented individuals who are at the top of our game and are determined to get better at what we do every day all while having fun in the process. Our determination to make our customers’ lives better and break records is contagious—you find yourself becoming intensely passionate about the work that we do, even if the property management and real estate industry was never on your radar before you got here.', '', 'You’ll be a member of RealPage’s Marketing Strategy Team, whose members work directly with the sales organization and whose primary focus is to define the marketing strategy to achieve the business objectives for their respective segments/verticals. As this team continues to stretch and evolve, you will have the opportunity to try new tactics, embrace new technologies, validate assumptions, and be part of the evolution of how we go to market and continue to demonstrate leadership in this space. #LI-BW1 #LI-Remote', 'If you love the Big Apple, this is for you! We are hiring a Senior Marketing Strategist to support our New York/Urbran Markets sales teams by developing and managing marketing initiatives. Our team has recently restructured to be more customer centric and better align with our sales and company focus areas. Senior Leadership is extremely supportive and excited about this realignment. This is a high visibility role and focus area. Investment Management is a hot topic with extreme potential and opportunity due to our solution which is a market differentiator. In this role, you will develop a comprehensive marketing plan including targets, focus areas, prioritized programs and levers and budget allocation. Working directly with internal stakeholders, you will develop a deep understanding of the business, objectives, market trends, and buyers to ultimately develop marketing strategies that create differentiation and drive closed sales. You must be able to clearly define campaign strategies, goals, target audience, and be adept at articulating personas that help drive creative messaging and approach. You will work directly with the campaign team who will drive the development and execution of the individual program elements.', 'Work closely with sales leadership and team members to fully understand business goals, sales priorities and focus areas
Work with product marketing, events and campaign marketers to develop and execute strategic marketing plans for your business segment
Understand and have experience with marketing a product or solution including marketing strategy, planning and execution, positioning, messaging, sales enablement, and reporting results.
Effectively work within a cross-functional, matrixed team environment
Ensure consistency of messaging and positioning across all mediums.
Present plans and results to sales teams and executives.
Responsible for driving awareness, demand and delivering quality leads', '8-10 years marketing experience; real estate industry experience/knowledge is a plus.
Strategic planning – ability to translate end goals into actionable plans. Proven track record driving new strategies and programs within an organization
Critical thinking – ability to understand business objectives, assess market opportunities, determine likelihood of success and prioritize resources
Sales and customer focus – understand sales priorities and motions; be able to articulate customer pain points and our value proposition
Results and action oriented - analyze and report on results to sales teams, pivot as needed based on demand and performance
Experience developing B2B content, email campaign strategies, video scripts, articles, strategic communications, sales collateral, and more.
Strong attention to detail with ability to manage multiple projects within strict time frames and deadlines.
Enthusiastic and collaborative with solid emotional intelligence.
Excellent command skills with experience presenting to executive-level leaders.
High integrity, energy, and a desire to work in a results-oriented, fast growth environment
Ability to clearly communicate results, key learnings, and areas of opportunities', '']

column7:
['Location: San Mateo, CA | New York
About Jivox
Jivox is transforming the way the world experiences digital marketing. We connect brands with their audiences in the most personalized way: using big data, AI/machine learning, Dynamic Creative Optimization (DCO) and customer journey optimization technologies to deliver omni-channel precision marketing. More than serving relevant messages in consumers’ purchase-intent micro moments across all channels, brands can track, measure, and optimize customer paths–starting from a brand website, email, or exposure to an advertisement–that are driving engagement and conversions. Recognized as a leader in creative advertising technologies, only Jivox delivers 1:1 messaging throughout the customer journey, seamlessly linking paid and owned media. Jivox is trusted by hundreds of leading companies including Marriott International, Toyota, Sony, AirBnB, Mazda, Pepsi and more. Jivox has been recognized by Forrester as a leader in creative advertising technologies, and is able to offer large global brands both experience and maturity.
About You
You will need to capture the attention and sell into the largest brands in the world. It will take a solid understanding of programmatic, marketing technology and creative management as well as the ability to understand a SAAS enterprise sales process.
The position targets senior marketing executives at the largest companies nationally. If hired you will learn a lot, have fun doing it and work with some of the world’s largest brands.
Desired Skills & Experience
A successful candidate will possess 5+ years experience in the online advertising marketplace in a sales capacity.
You MUST be aggressive in all the right ways. Wallflowers please do not apply
You MUST have experience selling directly to brands – not agencies
3+ years martech/programmatic media experience
Ability to tap past relationships within brands, media and creative agencies.
Must possess strong interpersonal and communication skills
Must possess strong prospecting and closing skills
Knowledge of business organization structures, buying influences and purchasing processes
Sales affinity, including curiosity, competitiveness, customer care/win-win attitude
College degree and/or equivalent experience
Computer skills and aptitude: You can use Salesforce and Excel.
This is a San Francisco based position working out of our San Mateo office
The role can be seen as a mix of Account Management and Consulting. The right candidate should have an aptitude for analytics/critical thinking and have some experience with a client-facing role. The role also involves international travel.
Compensation & Benefits
Compensation includes base salary and commission paid quarterly based on performance. Competitive salary packages offered. Jivox provides excellent benefits including Flexible Time Off, Medical, Dental and Vision coverage, Disability Insurance, 401K program, Basic Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)…. Not to mention free lunches and snacks.
How To Apply
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their resume in Word or PDF format to careers@jivox.com with the job description in the email subject line.
Jivox is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)']

column1: Head of Global GTM Sales Strategy
column7:
['Head of Global GTM Sales Strategy', 'Location: Eden Prairie (Remote), MN, US', 'Job ID: 51950', 'Category: Sales and Business development', '', 'Stratasys is a world leader in 3D printing!

Stratasys is leading the global shift to additive manufacturing with innovative 3D printing solutions for industries such as aerospace, automotive, consumer products and healthcare. Through smart and connected 3D printers, polymer materials, a software ecosystem, and parts on demand, Stratasys solutions deliver competitive advantages at every stage in the product value chain. The world’s leading organizations turn to Stratasys to transform product design, bring agility to manufacturing and supply chains, and improve patient care.

The Head of Global GTM Sales Strategy is a key partner to the Chief Revenue Office (CRO) responsible for driving sales productivity up, improve efficiencies across all Go-To-Market functions, and provide data driven insights and analytics to Sales Leadership. This is a critical role that interacts with multiple departments across the organization, including corporate strategy, finance, sales, marketing, and customer success.

What you will be doing:
Market alignment
Align GTM investments with market growth and potential. This is a leadership role that collaborates closely with corporate strategy in the definition of target markets, segments, and verticals; dynamically adjusts sales coverage including the channel; and provides a roadmap to the CRO and Sales Leadership to make sure that the right sellers are working in the right activities with the right customers at the right point of the sales cycle.
Own customer segmentation for all GTM functions (sales, marketing, customer success)
Continuously work with Stratasys’ Industry Market Leaders to stay at the forefront of industry trends and redefine GTM strategy based on how these industry trends impact additive manufacturing.

Sales acceleration
Work with various executive leaders in sales, marketing, product, and finance to define short and long-term growth targets. Support the CRO and represent sales during annual planning.
Devise data-centric initiatives to accelerate the growth of our software business, which is an integral part of our GTM strategy. Initiatives shall improve adoption and increase number of application users, renewal rates, and software-driven Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR).
Provide sales leadership with frequent update identifying key areas to accelerate growth
Develop and maintain the official list of sales strategic initiatives. Prioritize the initiatives and determine which ones shall transition to execution. Work with Sales Leadership to create an execution plan for each initiative

Sales performance metrics, reporting, analytics & insights
Standardize and drive consistent data & analytics frameworks for all GTM functions
Evaluate existing sales management reporting architecture, metrics, KPIs, OKRs for reliability, integrity, and optimal alignment with business goals

People Management
Manage a high-performing team of seasoned GTM analysts

Must have for this role:
10+ years of professional work experience in strategy or related field, with 5+ years supporting software business growth
Experience managing large-scale sales strategy projects as the leader of a high-level cross functional team. End-to-end segmentation experience is a plus.
Demonstrated ability to bridge the science and the art, validating analytics & data models with sales leadership and the field
Demonstrated ability to take large amounts of data and build an informed, influential, and easy to understand perspective on how to improve the impact of GTM investments
Experience managing teams of Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Business Analysts. Experience as a manager of managers is a plus.
Experience and understanding of software/ SaaS sales cycle
Exceptional people skills. Ability to engage and influence people across teams, including senior company executives (SVPs, VPs, CFOs, Presidents, and C-Level Officers)
Uses ethical principles to guide decisions and actions; demonstrates honesty and integrity in managing people and resources; and treats others with respect, fairness, and concern for their welfare.
Ability to quickly develop and maintain a reasonable level of knowledge of company products, services and solutions and remain expert on current product knowledge.

What you will be part of:
Company Overview https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/history/
Our Culture and Values https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/culture/
Our Sustainability “3D Printing a Better Tomorrow” https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/sustainability/
Our Locations https://www.stratasys.com/en/contact-us/office-locations/
Check out our https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wmDfmt2bNI

Additional Information:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Stratasys will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Stratasys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected Veteran or disabled status and will not be discriminated against for their race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.']

column7: ['Your work days are brighter here.', '', "At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.", '', 'About the Team', '', '', '', '', 'About the Role']

column7:
['Ready to be a Titan?', 'The Sr. Manager of Marketing Strategy, New Segment Expansion is an integral role on the revenue team contributing to ServiceTitan’s successful expansion into new segments. They will (1) help identify opportunities in new segments, (2) craft the strategy to go-to-market in those segments and (3) oversee the full-lifecycle execution of the segment entry in conjunction with cross-functional partners across the Revenue team. This is a hybrid of a strategic and execution role with heavy cross-functional partnership to drive results across the customer life-cycle. The individual has a well-rounded background - including analytic rigor, project management, and a mix of strategic and operational work. They will be able to quickly jump in and take day-to-day ownership of key strategic initiatives and their outcomes.', '', 'The Marketing Strategy team is the strategic / product marketing arm of the Marketing organization - responsible for product marketing, customer acquisition and driving expansion efforts across the broader Revenue organization.', "What You'll Do:", 'Ideate and lead deep dives / analysis (in collaboration with cross functional partners) into highest priority strategic topics (e.g. market entrance, expansion and leadership strategy)
Own high impact initiatives and drive from opportunity identification/strategic incubation to ongoing execution and iteration
Drive day-to-day operations, program management and strategic pivots for your initiatives
Partner cross-functionally with Product, Demand Generation, Sales, Post-Sales, Operations, and Finance as a steward of the programs you own and their full-lifecycle outcomes
Support development of priorities, resource planning, goal setting for the broader Marketing and Revenue teams, including but not limited to setting and advocating for the priorities of your initiatives
Present insights, status updates and recommendations to senior leaders and cross-functional stakeholders to drive decision making', '', "What You'll Bring:", '5-8 years of work experience in a combination of high growth tech companies and/or management consulting
Functional experience in marketing, operations, product marketing, or market strategy within the SaaS space is preferred
Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses (e.g. customer research, data analysis, customer segmentation strategies, competitive assessments etc.)
Ability to distill complex issues into concrete action plans; manage execution; and drive results
Energized by ambiguity and dynamic working environments that provide a diverse experience and opportunity to tackle different problems
Knows how to balance getting the details right while still moving fast
Demonstrated excellence in cross-functional communication, with the ability to simplify and explain complex problems to stakeholders of all levels', '']

['As the epicenter of cutting-edge data solutions, Egen is a data engineering and cloud modernization firm helping industry-leading companies achieve digital breakthroughs and deliver the future, today. We help our client-partners grow with our relentless pursuit of excellence.
As Sales Development Leader, you will be a part of a culture which uses the power of data to inform and transform business, all while achieving aggressive growth. We are proud of our recent awards which include an Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Company (7 times!), recently recognized on the Crain’s Chicago Business Fast 50 list, and recognized as a Chicagoland “Great Place to Work” 3 times. We are disruptors, game-changers, and innovators who play an important part in moving the world forward.', 'Key Responsibilities:

Ensuring high Quantity of Leads
Prospect and manage a healthy top of the funnel to create a sustainable business pipeline
Actively participate in industry events, so as to network and uncover opportunities
Offering day-to-day leadership to the sales team with sprints, account reviews, MQL generation
Enhancing Quality of Leads
Collaborate with Marketing to strengthen middle and bottom of the funnel
Prepares Sales reports, Conducts business analyses, performance analyses, competitive analyses
Acting as true partners to our clients and anticipating their needs and pain points, pitching new ideas
Create high value offerings and collaterals for Egen to take to customers
Quality to close deals
Primary responsibility for delivering on Egen’s top line revenue expectations
Achieving a robust funnel conversion rate
Provide thought leadership and create outbound content like whitepapers, blogs
Work with cross functional teams for creating and strengthening a unified Egen Brand strategy
Regularly review pipeline and strategies with senior leadership, to brainstorm on how to maximize sales and increase Egen’s presence in the market.

Here’s What We’re Looking For

Proven success with building ‘trusted advisor’ relationships with C-suite at client companies
Demonstrated success in B2B and consultative sales with enterprise, cloud-based solutions
Experience scaling and managing high-performance sales development teams
Proven Sales hunter and closer - ability to build a pipeline and achieve revenue targets
Strong relationship builder - skilled at leading large cross-functional teams to drive scale
Strong analytical skills - excellent at using data to solve problems and drive decision making
Passion for achieving impact and results that are driven by an entrepreneurial mindset
Passionate about Egen’s mission and the impact we can make to our clients
Education: A Degree in Sales, Marketing, Finance, or any other business / technical field. An equivalent of the same in working experience is also acceptable for the position.
Experience: A candidate must have 7-10 years’ experience in sales development in a high-growth B2B, SAAS company. The candidate must demonstrate a successful record of accomplishing and exceeding goals in their managerial positions.']

['We are looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer who will join the engineering team of our client from the USA which is a leading working capital partner built for early and growth stage businesses in eCommerce, Food & Beverage, General CPG, and SaaS. Partnering with this company means a quick turnaround, efficient decision-making, and an expert take on the industry — this is attributed in part to the sophisticated use of technology, and in part to industry specialization. Their lines of credit are structured for equity-funded or bootstrapped businesses by covering all working capital needs to fuel growth. This company has built a team and process that serve the demands of a rapidly scaling business by reducing the hassle of ongoing reporting and adding a partnership element similar to that of an equity partner. Join them to work with a team of technical professionals and to make a success together!', 'Experience / Skills required:', 'Must to have:', '', '5+ years of overall development experience, including
2+ years of experience with React
3+ years of experience with Typescript
2+ years of experience with Node.js (Express)
2+ years of experience with Postgres SQL database and CSS
Experience with TypeORM
Experience building/integrating with REST API endpoints
Being hardworking and proactive, positive and collaborative
Ability to perform complex tasks with no supervision and to mentor other engineers
Upper-Intermediate/Fluent level of English', 'Good to have:', '', 'Fintech, insurtech or other B2B experience
Strong attention to detail for self-review and peer review
Familiarity with the Material UI component library', 'Responsibilities:', 'Work with the product owner, end users, and other developers to understand business/technical requirements
Architect and design solutions that maximize for security, scalability, and usability
Design data models and workflows that leverage Dwight’s proprietary data and machine learning algorithms
Build features in Javascript/Typescript, React/Redux, and Node.js, all hosted on AWS
Produce clean, efficient code that provides lift in the sales process, proactively identifies risk to the business, and increases process efficiency
Write effective unit tests and achieve good coverage
Propose technical / architecture designs that are scalable
Providing reasonably accurate estimates based on business requirements & technical design']

column1: Senior Global Cash Management and Operations Manager (Remote, USA or Canada)
column7:
['Shopify is the leading omni-channel commerce platform. Merchants use Shopify to design, set up, and manage their stores across multiple sales channels, including mobile, web, social media, marketplaces, brick-and-mortar locations, and pop-up shops. The platform also provides merchants with a powerful back-office and a single view of their business, from payments to shipping. The Shopify platform was engineered for reliability and scale, making enterprise-level technology available to businesses of all sizes. Headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, Shopify currently powers over 2,000,000 businesses in approximately 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.', 'Shopify has redefined commerce, raising the standard for how businesses of all sizes manage, market and sell their products and services. Powered by the most innovative platform on the market, we continue to grow rapidly while constantly looking for new ways to impact and disrupt markets.', 'About the role', 'Our Treasury team is looking for a Senior Treasury Operations Manager to lead Shopify’s cash operations and banking relationships to drive outstanding results. The successful candidate is passionate about treasury operations, cash management and constant improvement. This person will bring passion, business acumen, and a get-it-done attitude to the role.', 'The Shopify Treasury team sits in the center of the global finance organization, linking together different functional groups both strategically and operationally. This person will act as one of the primary sources of context for the team to drive Treasury decision-making, support the business in pursuit of growth, and ultimately help our merchants succeed.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Oversees global cash functions, including cash positioning and forecasting, liquidity structuring, wire payments, bank account setup and maintenance, and global bank relationship management
Leads execution of global banking roadmap in support of business and product priorities
Recommends and implements improvements to cash management processes
Supports M&A and Capital Markets activities through cash planning and forecasting
Works with peers to set priorities for ongoing development and automation of Shopify’s treasury management system (Kyriba) and other technology projects
Leads Treasury activities in support of month-end, quarter-end and year-end closes
Champions effective governance and controls that enable business growth without exposing Shopify to undue risk
Supports & partners on M&A integration efforts
Builds scalable Treasury processes that simplify, align & drive accountability/ownership
Coaches, develops, and empowers a world-class team
Leads forward-thinking special projects, as appropriate', 'Requirements for the role:', 'Demonstrated success in leading corporate cash management operations across many countries and currencies, with 8+ years of Corporate Treasury and/or FP&A experience
Advanced understanding of banking services, standards, best practices, clearing systems, and payment technologies
Strong track record of execution and accelerating impact in a series of progressive experiences
Experience managing Treasury professionals and excitement to develop and lead a team of professionals to new successes
Outstanding communication and relationship building skills, with team oriented focus
A history of building positive, trust-based relationships with colleagues in Finance (e.g., Tax, Payroll, Accounts Payable, Accounting and FP&A) and in related business lines.
Strong analytical, decision-making, project management, planning, and organizational skills
A passion for excellence, ownership, and continuous improvement
Entrepreneurial spirit and an ability to thrive in a fast-moving, ambiguous work environment', 'It’d be great if you have:']

["Airwallex is a global payments fintech company transforming the way businesses move and manage money globally. We have built a global financial infrastructure platform to help businesses transact, collect and pay across 130+ countries and 50+ currencies, without the constraints of the traditional global financial system. We've grown to 13 global locations and have raised over $900 million in funding. To support our ambitious growth plans, we’re looking for smart, collaborative and passionate people who are looking to make a genuine impact.

The role:
The Airwallex legal team is looking for an experienced, creative, and talented legal counsel to partner closely with our global product teams and US commercial teams as they expand Airwallex’s presence in the US and Americas markets. You’ll advise on new product launches and initiatives, lead some of the company’s most complex deals, and have the opportunity to own a variety of other legal team projects and initiatives.
If you want to take the next step in your legal career by helping one of the world’s most dynamic and ambitious fintechs scale around the world, then this could be an exciting opportunity for you.", '', '', 'What you’ll do:
Partner with Airwallex’s dynamic, globally distributed product development teams as they develop, launch, and continuously improve Airwallex’s products and services in the US and Americas
Become an expert in Airwallex’s unique product platform and offerings, as well as in the company’s technology, operations, and regulatory and compliance obligations, to provide strategic and practical legal advice on new and existing products, features, and initiatives
Advise on and resolve a wide range of US legal and regulatory issues related to payments and financial services
Manage a wide variety of complex commercial deals originating in the US, many with significant cross-border elements: draft and negotiate outbound SaaS commercial agreements, strategic partnership agreements, and key vendor agreements
Build a strong, collaborative working relationship with our sales and partnerships teams in order to close deals efficiently; help our sales teams scale by working with them to improve legal processes, playbooks, and templates on a continuous basis
Work closely and effectively with Airwallex’s global legal, compliance, and risk teams on deals and projects that involve multiple jurisdictions
Handle a variety of other projects and requests as the need arises
Make positive contributions to the culture of the Airwallex legal team, the US team, and the company as a whole', '', '', 'What you’ll bring:
J.D. degree (or foreign equivalent) and active membership in at least one US state bar (California or New York preferred)
7+ years of experience in an in-house legal department and/or a well-respected law firm advising on legal issues related to financial services and technology platforms. Experience at a fintech or high-growth and/or globally distributed company is a significant plus
Excellent communication, drafting, negotiation, and writing skills
The ability to explain complex legal concepts to various (often non-legal) audiences, and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and deals
High motivation and the ability to operate independently and pivot quickly within a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
A learner’s mentality: you are consistently looking to take on new and diverse challenges and expand your knowledge beyond your current areas of expertise
A collaborative and empathetic mindset, a good sense of humor, and a keen understanding of how to work effectively with colleagues from different teams and backgrounds', '', '', 'At Airwallex you’ll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. We organize regular team building events, encourage flexible/remote working, and we give our people the freedom to be creative.

Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don’t regard color, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters.

Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.']

['Req ID
FY23|G&A|#4764
Location(s)
Irvine, California, USA; Los Angeles, California, USA; Portland, Oregon, USA; Sacramento, California, USA; San Bernardino, California, USA; San Diego, California, USA; San Francisco, California, USA; San Jose, California, USA; Santa Rosa, California, USA; Seattle, Washington, USA; Sunnyvale, California, USA; Vancouver, Washington, USA;
Work arrangement(s)
Fully Remote (works exclusively from home), Hybrid (works from home and New Relic office throughout the week), Office (works primarily in a New Relic office)', "Your opportunity
Are you an experienced professional who wants to join a collaborative Finance team looking to build the infrastructure for our next leg of incredible growth? We seek someone who will embrace the challenges and opportunities of joining a fast-growing company aiming to become a $1B enterprise!

We are seeking a finance professional who is proactive and can challenge the norm, but who will also listen to others and collaborate to support the company goals. The Senior FP&A Manager of R&D reports to the FP&A Director and will be a key partner to the R&D team! This is a highly visible role that includes frequent interaction with senior management. The Senior FP&A Manager will have the ability to interact effectively across the company and within the R&D organization.

Opportunity to work from a remote office may be available depending on applicant location.
What you'll do
Lead day-to-day partnership across Engineering, Product Management Sales Operations to drive profitability
Act as the Finance business partner to one or more key R&D team leaders and represent FP&A.
Own, maintain and evolve product COGS, unit costs and Gross margin models
Identify and drive cost efficiencies including resource optimizations and partner with deals desk on pricing recommendations
Partner with Engineering to optimize timing and magnitude of cloud investments
Drive prioritization of investments establish path towards steady state cost goals
Manage the financial health of products and regions through insightful reporting, accurate forecasting, and long range planning aligned to steady state gross margin targets
Develop financial models, track, and analyze financial KPIs, uncover trends and assess business risks and opportunities to provide recommendations to senior leaders
Ensure organizational accountability through performance management of operating expenses and investments to support productivity initiatives
Partner with Corporate FP&A to address recurring reporting and analysis, align around planning approach, and collaborate on monthly close cycles
Prepare succinct and clear executive presentations that simplify complex topics and are often time-sensitive
Ensure quality and accuracy of deliverables
Seek opportunities for operational improvement across the organization
This role requires
7+ years of finance experience in the technology sector, specifically SaaS, including time served in leadership roles
Experience managing spend on one of the major Cloud Service Providers (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP)
Analytical and problem-solving skills and experience resolving complex business problems with well-structured analytics and Excel modeling
Ability to adapt to a dynamic, constantly evolving business environment
Outstanding presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities, that will drive alignment and resolution of critical business issues
Strong executive presence and ability to deliver compelling messages to executives to drive effective decision making
Bonus points if you have
Demonstrated strategic thought leadership
Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional initiatives
Team-oriented, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible
Proven ability to be decisive and committed regarding decisions affecting the business and the team", "We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.
We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.
Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic at www.newrelic.com/blog/how-to-relic/future-of-work
Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/FCO%20poster2020.pdf

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.", "Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 135,000 - $ 169,000
Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. The base pay range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high end base pay range for the listed position. This role may be eligible for the corporate bonus plan (or, if a sales role, a commission plan as defined in the sales incentive plan document), participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards that may be applicable. In addition, New Relic provides a variety of benefits to employees. The range provided may also represent candidate ranges and may not reflect the full range or geographic differential for an individual tenured employee.
Wage - midpoint
169,000
Wage - minimum
135,000", 'This field has no functionality and it was added so that we could display the separator above']

['#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.', '', 'About the Role:', 'CrowdStrike is seeking a dynamic and accomplished Field Marketing leader to drive planning and execution for North America Enterprise & Mid-market. Partners with regional sales and partner leaders to achieve business goals and revenue targets.', '', 'Responsible for defining, deploying and ongoing management of a world-class, Americas field marketing strategy and team, focused on prospect acquisition, partner marketing, pipeline generation and acceleration to achieve region goals.', '', 'Reporting to the Senior Director of Americas Marketing, the ideal candidate is a strong leader with proven field and partner marketing accomplishments, thrives on making data driven decisions and an enabler of scalable programs that generate brand awareness, new opportunities and accelerate existing pipeline.', '', 'The successful candidate will have a solid understanding of the B2B technology space, strategic planning and integrated marketing programs execution. Excellent organizational and communication skills and the proven ability to work cross functionally is key to success in this role.']
