Come join us as GRUBBRR transforms the way customers interact with businesses moving forward. We produce sleek, beautifully intuitive products such as:']

['Remote', "Summary
We are looking for a Sales Development Representative to act as the liaison between our Marketing and Sales teams. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.
To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal. You will also ensure proper after-sales service. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we would like to meet you.

Job Specific Suties and Responsibilities
Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities
Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails
Present our company to potential clients
Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services
Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction
Build long-term trusting relationships with clients
Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Account Executives
Report to the Direct Report on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results
Stay up to date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans
Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative, Sales Account Executive, or similar role
Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls)
Track record of achieving sales quotas
Experience with CRM software (e.g., Salesforce)
Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts)
Understanding of sales performance metrics
Excellent communication skills
Ability to deliver engaging presentations

Education and Experience
Two or more years of experience in a Sales Development role within SAAS technology driven organization.
Have a strong work ethic, excellent writing, communication, and organizational skills
Excellent organization and follow-up skills including the ability to handle competing priorities and meet all deadlines and
Experience at working both independently (remotely) and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem- solving.
Excellent verbal and written communication

Physical / Special Requirements
This role operates remotely and in a standard office environment, and routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Generic Duties and Responsibilities
Adhere to the Company's Code of Conduct/Ethics
Create and maintain effective working relationships with other Company employees
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Project a professional and appropriate Company image in all dealings with clients, vendors, business partners and visitors
Ensure security of information in all matters pertaining to Company, clients, and consumer information
Support the efforts of senior management and sales staff by maintaining business network of contacts as clients change roles and/or companies

Job Specific Knowledge
Demonstrate knowledge of Sales, Client Care, and Sales Development Processes
Demonstrate familiarity with content and function of SBT corporate web site
Demonstrate knowledge of all current standard UI reports and Salesforce CRM
Ability to read and understand technical and legal language
Self-motivation, strong leadership skills with excellent oral and written communication skills
Developed business judgement, sense of urgency, integrity, and accountability
Team skills, training experience and exceptional presentation skills

Language Skills
Spanish language a plus
Job Specific Reasoning Skills
Able to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule
Able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid

Computer Skills
Able to use MS Outlook to send and retrieve emails and to schedule events
Able to create documents on MS Word
Able to create slide shows on MS PowerPoint
Able to create spreadsheets on MS Excel
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SalesForce CRM system

Featured Benefits
Employer-provided
Medical insurance
Vision insurance
Dental insurance
401(k)

About Solutions by Text
Solutions by Text (SBT) was founded in 2008 with the mission to deliver impactful conversational messaging and convenient payment partner solutions that are rich, real-time, and compliant. Built on SMS industry best practices, the company is the only compliance-first provider of enterprise texting solutions in the market and has changed the way compliant businesses communicate and transact with their customers via mobile devices. More than 1,400 consumer finance organizations, including leading brands in auto finance, banking and lending, trust SBT to ensure convenient, effective, and compliant relationships with their millions of consumers. Recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies, SBT continues to grow and expand through the addition of great employees who desire a growth culture. SBT is headquartered in Dallas, TX with remote teams and offices around the US and in Bangalore, India. For more information, visit https://solutionsbytext.com/.

Solutions By Text is committed to promoting the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it is through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances."]

['Job Family:', 'Sabre Corporation is a leading technology provider to the global travel and tourism industry. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre operates offices in approximately 60 countries around the world. At Sabre, we make travel happen. Positioned at the center of the business of travel, our platform connects people with experiences that matter in their lives. Today, Sabre is creating a new marketplace for personalized travel. It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs or our airline, hotel and travel agency customers. Join our journey!', '', 'TEAM DESCRIPTION', 'As a key member of the Sabre Hospitality Solutions (SHS) Strategy & Operations team, you will play a critical role in driving operational performance across the Hospitality organization. The Strategy and Operations team has three pillars:', 'Product Strategy: Enables our leaders to define and execute compelling Product Strategies
Operations & Transformation: Drives Sabre Hospitality towards excellence in the execution of our Software Development Life Cycle
Go-To-Market Management: Maximizes product launch success', '', 'Members of this team routinely work on cross-functional topics and interact with senior leaders across the Sabre Hospitality organization. The direct manager of this team has top tier consulting experience and highly prioritizes coaching/development.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES', 'This role will be instrumental in delivering the following programs in close collaboration with the Director of Product Strategy & Operations and senior leaders in Product, Development, Sales, and Delivery Management.', 'Lead cross-functional transformation initiatives – you will spearhead Sabre Hospitality’s largest improvement programs by designing collaborative solutions and coordinating execution across the organization. This gives you high visibility in the organization and great agency to implement your solutions into our operating model.
Support continuity of Software Development Life Cycle transformation programs – Sabre Hospitality runs several optimized processes and initiatives to increase business effectiveness. You would provide managerial and advisory support across organizational functions to ensure ongoing improvement initiatives are delivered or maintained successfully.
Collaborate with senior leaders to review and define product vision and strategies – Creating compelling product experiences for our customers is a critical part of the success of our Product Organization. You will be at the core of the decisions shaping that product vision.
Performance tracking to improve drivers of operational success – We are always looking to better understand and benchmark our business vs. other successful SaaS companies. Measuring our current business performance and identifying areas of opportunity allows the product strategy team to focus their effort in the right areas.']

["We're a diverse group of committed individuals empowered to thrive on challenge, share ideas, and pursue our ambition to transform the way commerce works.
So what about you? Do you want to help shape the future? Join us and you'll open the gateway to a world of endless possibilities.
At Productsup you'll be an intrinsic player in a vibrant culture that brings together people with opportunities, ideas with implementation, and ambition with achievement.
You can make great things happen in your career by making great things happen in commerce.
Productsup - the place where people are empowered to shape the future of commerce.", 'Your role and goals', "The Productsup Field Marketing team's mission is to make Productsup the top-recognized solution for product data management, and we're currently looking for Team Leader Field Marketing North America to help us make this mission a reality.", 'Productsup is looking for a highly motivated, sales-focused field marketing leader to support our Sales Teams, within an important high-growth region. As a senior member of our field marketing team, you have a strong understanding of sales-focused marketing as well as how to leverage marketing programs and tactics to drive awareness and ultimately, pipeline conversion for the North American region. You enjoy working with sales leaders to understand the needs of the sales team, our customers, and prospects, and meeting those needs through effective partnership, strategy, and execution.', 'In this role, you will help build our presence in the North American market and drive the Productsup business in an exciting growth region - take the challenge and join us as Senior Field Marketing Manager, North America!', 'In your first 3 months you will:', 'Get to know the marketing and sales teams and develop a strong understanding of the goals and initiatives that are key to success in the region
Develop and own the NAM strategic marketing plan and calendar
Ensure successful execution of the local marketing activities, own tracking and communication of plans and outcomes
Build the plan, pipeline, and brand in close cooperation with the various central marketing resources: corporate communications, marketing operations, marketing programs, digital/social, customer, and partner marketing', 'In your first 6 months and beyond you will:', "Leverage and localize the central inbound/outbound and online/offline programs and create locally-relevant programs by leveraging the content, getting partners for sponsoring, and customer references
Be the first point of contact and sparring partner for the NAM sales team and jointly work on the funnel development.
Own pipeline targets (MQL, SQL, opportunities) and other related awareness-specific targets
Create partnerships with 3rd media parties and associations
Own the NAM event initiatives from planning to execution and organise Productsup's own events in the region with partners and customers", 'What you bring to the team']

['Position: Full Time', 'Job Description:', 'Nforcepro is seeking a Senior Sales Engineer, this is an exciting opportunity to help drive continued growth for an innovative, rapidly growing GRC software company. Strong written and verbal communication skills
3+ years prior experience selling GRC software solutions into targeted accounts

Experience configuring and delivering software demonstrations is a plus
Experience selling either Compliance, Risk management, Contract Management, Document Management ,or Supplier Relationship Management or related products is a plus
4 year University degree is required', 'Location: SunnnyVale , CA', 'Other Info: Telecommuting not available, Travel not required.']

['For more than 20 years, PointClickCare has been the backbone of senior care. We’ve amassed the richest senior care dataset making our market density untouchable and our connections to the healthcare ecosystem exponentially more powerful than those of any other platform.

With Collective Medical & Audacious Inquiry, we’ve become the most expansive, full-continuum care collaboration network, offering care teams immediate, point-of-care access to deep, real-time insights at every stage of a patient’s journey.

For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.

Job Location: Baltimore, Salt Lake City, or Greater Toronto metro areas preferred

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Director, FP&A, Acute & Payer (A&P), this position will be responsible for working alongside leaders from all functions within the Acute & Payer business unit and Strategic Advisory, providing financial information, tools, analysis, and insights to help drive operational excellence and execution against business objectives. Through collaboration with team members throughout the business unit and in shared functions, this person will be asked to gain an understanding of the market, strategic objectives, and operational challenges, including those related to efforts to integrate Audacious Inquiry resources into the Acute & Payer ecosystem, and to design, implement and execute on integration, reporting and KPI initiatives, driving efficiency, accuracy and visibility into performance, trends, areas for development, and other meaningful metrics.
The ideal candidate will have experience in financial modelling and management of several complex FP&A cycles (budgeting, forecasting), as well as a focus on data, systems, and business insights. They will also have a proven track record of leveraging financial modelling and scenario analysis to identify underlying drivers of business growth, and of demonstrating the ability to effectively partner with business teams across Sales and Growth Ops, Marketing, Professional Services, Customer Operations, Customer Support, Product, Data Science, and Finance Operations in strategic analysis, KPI reporting and operational improvements.', 'Key Responsibilities:
Partner with Director, FP&A, Acute & Payer, to establish, execute against, and manage the short-term and long-term Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) of the Acute & Payer FP&A team
Partner with FP&A team to establish and execute against the short-term and long-term OKRs of the Corporate Finance / FP&A team
Drive, with support from Finance Operations, the process for integrating financial reporting, including data analysis and SaaS and operational metrics of Audacious Inquiry into the Acute & Payer environment and processes
Drive, with support from FP&A counterparts, the process for defining and executing against the reporting roadmap, with the goal of delivering meaningful reporting that is standardized across the PointClickCare business units and automated
Collaborate with Financial Operations to drive discipline, visibility, consistency and operational improvements in contract management, revenue operations, backlog conversion, customer retention, and billing and collections.
Conduct actual vs. forecast / budget financial variance analysis on monthly basis with meaningful insights to management to support decision making, understand financial implications to rolling forecasts, and enable business partners to manage to their respective budgets / forecasts
Actively manage the Profit & Loss Statement to provide support and insights to the business for all A&P functions and Strategic Advisory
Prepare monthly and quarterly Board, Management, and Business Unit reporting packages / inputs and presentations
Manage and support full budget cycle process for all A&P-designated functions, including A&P initiatives owned by shared functions, as well as Strategic Advisory ensuring transparency and cross-functional collaboration to tie financial performance to strategic objectives and OKRs
Leverage FP&A tools, develop and maintain comprehensive financial forecast models to support various financial planning initiatives, including but not limited to 12-month rolling forecast, quarterly re-forecasts, annual budget, and long-term strategy planning, for Acute & Payer.
Partner with functional leaders to perform ad hoc analyses or create new tools to help drive operational excellence. This will include but is not limited to:
o Business casing to help effectively compare and decide on the correct initiatives
o Collaborate with team members to improve operational efficiency and to identify cost saving opportunities
Support the evaluation and implementation of new SMBP tool and complementary integrations through data sourcing, exploration, cleanup, manipulation, design, and testing
Gain and leverage understanding of the A&P business to identify opportunities for improvements in both Finance / FP&A and operational processes and outputs', "Required Experience:
Prior technology / SaaS industry background and full P&L exposure
Healthcare experience is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or related
MBA or a financial designation is a plus
3 to 5 years of experience in Finance or Accounting
A growth mindset, a builder’s mentality, and a proven track record for execution
A willingness to understand and work a process from end to end
Proven success leading diverse teams through multiple Change Management initiatives,
Advanced understanding of different financial and management reporting principles and frameworks, and deep knowledge of financial accounting practices pertaining to data flows for FP&A system outputs
Ability to thrive and navigate effectively through change and ambiguity in a fast-moving, complex business environment.
Advanced MS Excel skills, with experience working with PivotTables and Power BI
Highly outcome-focused, with the proven ability to work with challenging deadlines and deliver on commitments.
Experience with various tools manipulating and modelling large quantities of data to derive actionable insights actionable business insights.", '#LI-TW1
#LI-Hybrid

It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.

When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team: recruitment@pointclickcare.com

PointClickCare is committed to Information Security. By applying to this position, if hired, you commit to following our information security policies and procedures and making every effort to secure confidential and/or sensitive information.']

['Company Overview', 'DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.', '', '', '', "What You'll Do", 'As the Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Senior Account Executive (AE), you are a highly motivated self-starter who thrives in a high growth, fast paced, collaborative environment. You are eager to learn, determined to adapt quickly, and comfortable with some ambiguity. You are responsible for developing and closing new business and expanding our footprint in current customers by selling additional products and services within an assigned geographic territory or vertical. You are accountable for exceeding quarterly and annual quotas, proactive deal management, forecast accuracy, and driving adoption and usage with customers and prospects in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Corporate Sales and is designated Flex.', '', 'Responsibility', 'Drive success of the company’s goals and objectives through achieving individual sales quotas
Build and manage a sales pipeline through prospecting efforts into a geographic territory or within the core verticals
Craft and deliver customized sales presentations and product demonstrations, by phone and via online demo
Develop and negotiate enterprise level proposals and contracts
Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements accurately through proper use of sales tools
Collaborate effectively and engage various pre/post sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Market Development Representatives, Solutions Engineers, Enterprise Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, Renewal Managers, Partner Account Managers, as well as Legal, Security, Professional Services and Customer Support
Travel as necessary, typically 10%']

['About The Role
The Company – Medisafe
Every day, thousands of patients across the country and around the world take their medications at the wrong time, in the wrong amounts, in doubled doses, or not at all. These human oversights have a cost. In the US alone, 125,000 people die every year due to preventable medication mistakes. They cause a health emergency every forty-five seconds. The US healthcare system spends $300 billion per year addressing the crisis. We’re here to solve this problem. Our technology fosters patient well-being and saves lives—it helps patients manage their medications and provides visibility into their daily behavior. We use this data, gathered from the actions of millions of patients, to generate insights that promote collaboration and smart decision making at every level of the healthcare industry. This leads to better outcomes for all.
The Position:
This is a highly important sales role within the organization (virtual/home office based). The Sales professional will lead the growth and development of their Accounts. She/he will play a key role within the company, having responsibility for developing new partnerships with brands, patient support services, digital, innovation and market access functions within pharmaceutical manufacturers. On top of their own efforts, they will have both sales development representative and marketing lead generation support, and are expected to drive the entire sales cycle from warm prospecting into companies, to securing meetings with senior-level decision-makers. She/he will take the account through a needs analysis, develop and present Medisafe’s solutions and then will be tasked with closing the sale. This position is focused on new business development, and the cultivation and growth of such accounts after they have been penetrated. As a business builder and leader within the company, the Sales professional will be a key member of Medisafe’s growing team, work closely with their Partner Success colleagues supporting current customers and work closely with their sales development representative to support lead generation. This is a remote role but would like candidates in the So CA, No CA regions, or other western states ideally.
Ideal Candidates:
5-10+ years of outside sales experience calling directly on pharmaceutical brands/patient services/analytics/ commercial operations functions with a proven track record of success meeting and exceeding annual sales/revenue targets.
Experience selling solutions to brand marketers, commercial leaders, consumer focused roles, patient services, analytics functions, and leadership teams at any level of a pharma.
Has designed, developed and executed multi-million-dollar deals.
Has sold strategic, complex offerings into Pharma. Digital channel experience a plus.
Technology and SaaS-based sales experience is a plus.
Hunter who excels in developing new business accounts.
Brings in own contacts and book of business and responsible for own lead generation along with support from SDR. Contacts within the agency world is a plus.
Comfort both constructing and negotiating MSAs, SOWs.
Conversant in pharmaceutical secondary data assets and advanced analytics solutions.
Expertise in developing senior-level, trust and performance-based relationships by identifying products/services and sell opportunities that best meet client’s needs.
Passionate about selling and creating value for customers.
Experience utilizing Salesforce.com for maintenance of opportunities, lead and account updates.
Able to travel throughout the region (post pandemic)
Works well in a fast paced, ever changing environment']

['ATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. Our leading-edge products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and support technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries.
We are backed by Accel-KKR, a technology-focused investment firm with over $11 billion in assets under management, and ParkerGale Capital, a private equity firm based in Chicago that invests in founder-owned technology companies - both with a strong history of growing companies in partnership with leadership teams.

Why We Need You – The Mission

As Sr. Manager, Product Marketing for ATP, you’ll be critical in shaping how we position our suite of products to a wide target audience made up of multiple ICPs and personas. You’ll work closely with our product teams to inform their roadmap with market and buyer research, and help develop compelling messaging and sales materials that differentiates ATP’s core functionality in the aviation industry.
You’ll develop deep expertise in our ICPs and target personas – understanding their key use cases and pain points – to equip the GTM team with messaging and materials that will enable us to successfully sell our solutions.
Reporting directly to our VP of Marketing, and collaborating with Product Management, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success, you’ll serve as the glue for all internal and external communications regarding our products. You’ll love this role if you’re passionate about defining, influencing, and driving strategy for disruptive software solutions.

What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives
Within your first 3 months, you will become an ATP product and client expert. You will:
Build rapport with your core colleagues from Product, Marketing, Sales and Customer Success.
Gain an understanding of our product roadmaps.
Attend basic training for our core products and understand the problems we solve and why customers buy.
Conduct market/competitive research, gather sales feedback, and interview customers to develop a deep understanding our buyers. Use new learnings to help refine our ICPs and develop buyer personas for our suite of products.
Understand and document our buyer’s journey, including where they get information, and the who, what, when, and why behind the decisions they make. You’ll use these learnings to drive changes to our sales and marketing processes.
Begin to drive our GTM strategy for launches of new products and significant product enhancements.
Within your first 6 months, you will have positioned the ATP products successfully, and continue on with efforts to optimize and improve. You will have:
Demonstrated thorough product knowledge by completing a SWOT analysis for each core product and further refining the product canvases as your knowledge deepens.
Understand the competitive landscape for our products; be an expert on our competition and how they are positioned
Refine and develop battle cards as needed for at least 6 competitors that you identify as our priorities based on your SWOT analysis for each product.
Created an established cadence and improved process for running successful Win/Loss analysis.
Assist the team in hitting major milestones as outlined in the ATP Product Roadmap.
Partnered with Product, Marketing, and Customer Success to launch ATP’s first Customer Advisory Board.
Created materials and demos for our sales teams; iterating based on sales and customer feedback.
Within your first 12 months, you will have guided a substantial increase in market penetration in our core market spaces. As witnessed by having:
Operational, tried and true processes for everything mentioned above.
Established yourself as “the” person to go to for help with messaging and positioning.
Planned and successfully led launches of new products and features per our corporate objectives and timelines.
Established yourself as someone who gets things done, on time, and with grace.
Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies
GTM Whiz: 5+ years of work experience in relevant product marketing, technical consulting, or product management roles; preferably 4 years of product marketing experience in the B2B SaaS space. You’re a self-starter with the ability to succeed in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Great Collaborator: You’re a team player who thinks big, is hands-on, organized, and solves problems. You easily inspire, lead, and align cross-functional teams to get things done.
Storyteller: Ability to create compelling, customer-centric messaging that resonates with buyers. You have stand out verbal, written, and visual/presentation skills.
Project Manager: You have impeccable organizational skills and a strong bias for action. You’re a project management whiz who sets optimistic, but reachable deadlines and leverages project and time management skills to meet them.
Skilled Communicator: The team wins and loses together - and for that reason you don’t have a problem giving and receiving constructive feedback. You have the ability to be clear and concise in all methods of communication with an understanding that effective communication is key given the remote state of most of our employees and clients.
How we work – The Core Values that Define Our Culture
One ATP: By thinking beyond myself, my department, my product
Find a Better Way: For today and tomorrow (when we are twice the current size!)
Assume Positive Intent: Through interactions, healthy conflict, opportunities, and different points of view
Driven to Exceed: We take pride in our work and exceeding expectations.']

column6: ['401(k)', 'Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['It’s time to join a venture who sees you for the talented and complex individual you are: someone with both professional ambitions and personal aspirations in life. As an AI company, we’re disrupting the hottest category in tech with leaders who know how to make history — and who want to help you make your own. Welcome to Pryon, a place for people who want to define the state of the art: real AI (oxymoron intended), developed by real pioneers, solving real problems of consequence. Our company was built by some of the most well-known experts in the field, whose DNA lives on in Alexa, Siri, Watson, and virtually every other AI product on the market. But the best part of the story is still to come: We’re creating a world-class culture fueled by intellectual curiosity and radical technology — to reduce the distance between knowledge and people', 'This is an opportunity to lead our marketing efforts, and design, implement and monitor effective marketing strategies that align with well-defined business goals and objectives for sales.', 'Pryon is seeking an experienced and talented marketing professional with a successful track record owning, performing, and driving direct marketing campaigns and strategies that result in positive metrics for demand generation, leads, and opportunities for sales. The successful candidate will possess a strong track record of collaborating with sales and cross-functional teams to develop, execute, and measure strategic, integrated programs that result in a qualified pipeline for revenue growth. In conjunction with our Product and Go to Market organizations, this hire will develop compelling product positioning, messaging programs, go-to-market strategy and execution, corporate and field marketing, industry thought leadership, and awareness among our target customers, partners, analysts, and press audiences.', '', 'The ideal candidate will bring a "roll-up-your-sleeves” mindset and attitude with prior experience building, scaling, and mentoring an end-to-end Marketing team across content, demand gen, product marketing and PR/communications/analyst briefings. Additionally, they will recognize, research and pursue new markets, verticals and use cases where Pryon can leverage its solutions for the benefit of its customers and itself, with the goal of generating demand in previously untapped areas.Candidates must possess strong technical knowledge and engineering experience of knowledge or document management markets along with AI and ML principles and practices. He/she will have proven abilities to work jointly with AI engineers, data scientists, and development teams to build the next generation of AI-first knowledge management systems, document processing workflows, and question/answer chatbot applications. A strong work ethic, agility, and the ability to work under pressure are essential.', '', 'Your Responsibilities:', '', 'Lead all aspects of the company’s marketing initiatives, including brand strategy and positioning, B2B marketing, and digital strategy; operate as a senior leader as well as an individual contributor
Develop and implement a cohesive marketing plan to increase brand awareness
Manage MQL end-to-end analytics and attribution for all lead generation while executing to key KPIs for new net revenue
Own and deliver the top-of-the-funnel demand generation for all sales channels and efforts
Collaborate with Solutions Engineering, Product, and Sales teams to understand existing and potential customers’ needs and deliver marketing collateral that resonates with our different market segments and buyer personas
Develop the strategic vision for Pryon’s brand and ensure flawless execution of our mission
Evaluate the overall marketing function and design a scalable organization structure to keep pace with expected growth; grow and manage a Marketing team that will execute the strategies that support company revenue goalsBuild relationships with media and stakeholders through creative PR strategies
Provide direction and set standards for creation of tactical content to support strategic objectives
Generate internal enthusiasm and training to enable the field team to take messaging to the market
Monitor all marketing campaigns and improve them when necessary
Create metrics to demonstrate value of marketing efforts and provide a blueprint for course correction as needed
Prioritize marketing projects and allocate resources accordingly
Conduct market analysis to identify challenges and opportunities for growth
Provide guidance and ideas to organize effective marketing events
Forecast hiring needs for the Marketing department
Participate in the quarterly and annual planning of the company’s objectives
Track competitors’ activities
Create metrics to demonstrate the value of marketing efforts and provide a blueprint for course correction as needed
Drive data-driven decisions and establish effective frameworks, metrics, and strategies to inform the company’s approach to direct and channel marketing', '']

column1: Strategic Sales Executive, Pay Equity Solution
column7: ['Strategic Sales Executive – Gapsquare - XpertHR – Home Based', '', 'XpertHR (a LexisNexis® Risk Solutions Group (RSG) company) offers a range of solutions in the HR compliance and total reward markets. Established in 2001 and with offices in London, New York, New Jersey, Chicago, and Amsterdam, XpertHR has quickly established itself as the leading online resource for all HR information, benchmarking and pay equity needs. XpertHR is the most comprehensive source of compliance, good practice, and benchmarking information available. Our award-winning team of in-house editors, lawyers and subject specialists work with more than 100 expert contributors to produce and update the resources that HR professionals need to do their job, whatever their role. Our total portfolio includes exciting products such as Cendex, Gapsquare and Aptifore at the heart of our human capital strategy.', '', 'Gapsquare (\nhttps://gapsquare.com/\n) joined the XpertHR family in 2022', '', 'Gapsquare is leading the change for pay equity. Empowering organisations through AI-powered, data-driven solutions that take the complexity out of achieving workplace equality.', 'Our CEO Gapsquare Dr Zara Nanu, MBE was recently quoted as saying', '“The pay equity and wider workplace social agenda is constantly evolving. From inception, Gapsquare identified that technical, data-driven solutions sit at the core of building a more equitable workplace. Today, the success of our clients is the success of our mission – building not only a more equitable future but also the business case for equality, in our lifetime.”', '']

['As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager on the commercial team, you will be advisor, strategist and implementer of our product offering to customers. You will own the engagement with ~30 strategic accounts, partnering during every stage from onboarding to expansion, including proactive data research, analysis, consultative support, and thought leadership. Additionally, this role will help support Windfall’s continued growth by helping to implement systems and processes to scale our business.', '', '', 'Why Windfall?', 'Windfall is a high-growth startup working with data-driven sales, marketing, and analytics teams to help them identify, understand and engage target customers. Our company works with rapidly growing companies, along with iconic Fortune 500 consumer brands.', '', 'The Windfall Customer Success team is a high-caliber unit of achievers looking for the best next step in their careers. We are incredibly supportive and collaborative - especially for a remote environment - and work together to make our customers and our team successful.', '', 'Our mission is to change how organizations perceive and use people data. And we hold true to our core values of: (1) Be an excellent communicator; (2) Operate with transparency; (3) Provide leverage, not optimization; (4) Make a difference every day; and (5) Act with integrity and trust.', 'Responsibilities:']

column1: FP&A Director, North America Sales Finance
column7:
["Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations secure and manage their data, while unlocking limitless value. As a leader in data security and management, we make it easy to secure, protect, manage and derive value from data—across the data center, edge, and cloud. At Cohesity, we're a group of builders and go-getters who are committed to doing the right thing. We encourage you to come as you are, as our differences make us stronger.

We've been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN's Coolest Cloud companies.
Join us and we'll lead the way together.", '', 'FP&A Director, North America Sales Finance', 'United States - Remote', 'The Go-To-Market Finance team serves as trusted financial advisors to the Sales, Marketing and Customer Experience organizations globally. As a senior member of the team, the role will partner with the senior leadership of the Americas Sales org, setting the strategic vision for the business. Alongside key stakeholders and cross-functional partners, the FP&A Director will lead the strategic planning process from a finance stance, to include the annual operating plan, quarterly forecasts and the long-range planning activities.', 'The candidate for this role will demonstrate a strategic approach, collaboration skills, financial proficiency, excellent business intuition, and the capability to work at multiple levels, including high level strategy and day-to-day financial details.', 'This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the VP, GTM Finance.', "How You'll Spend Your Time Here", "Build strong business partner relationships with senior leaders across the America Sales organization; establishing trust and gaining an understanding of relevant business drivers
Collaborate closely with cross-functional partners in Revenue Operations, Talent Acquisition and HR to form rounded perspectives of the strategic direction of the org
Partner with the broader FP&A team to understand dependencies for growth, understanding topline metrics, product roadmap, location strategy etc
Gain deep knowledge and understanding of Cohesity's business performance across geographies and user segments
Own annual budgeting, monthly close, and forecast processes inclusive of headcount and discretionary spend related to the America Sales Organization
Define metrics and leading indicators of business performance and partner with the Analytics team to develop tools and dashboards to make these metrics widely accessible across Cohesity
Develop robust financial models to streamline decision-making and highlight key drivers of past, current and future business performance
Be results and service oriented; comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Undertake ad hoc strategic projects", 'Key Skills/Experience']

['Dynatrace is looking for a Senior Digital Marketing Analyst to join our global Marketing Analytics team. This role will report to the Director of Marketing Analytics & Operations and will play a critical role in building a culture of data-driven decision making for teams. You will also be responsible for contributing to the strategy and planning of the Marketing team by providing business-critical insights and ensure cross-functional alignment of goals and execution.', 'Job Description', 'In this role you will use your technical skills, business acumen and communication skills to generate ideas that drive growth, while maintaining a high bar for thoughtful, impactful analyses. Successful candidates will have experience and understanding of the B2B Marketing Funnel and Digital Marketing channels. The ideal candidate would be passionate about creating data-driven, cross-channel insights to fuel our strategy and maximize the efficacy of our paid search programs. Additionally, the ability to work collaboratively and drive participation, engagement with marketing, sales and other internal stakeholders will be vital to this role.', 'Key Responsibilities:', 'Partner with the digital marketing teams and the larger marketing team to understand strategic objectives, media mix across all channels
Build measurement plans based on the strategic objectives and media strategies; Perform analysis of all digital tactics and share key learnings to help guide future direction
Provide regular campaign analysis and insights using a defined set of KPIs across all paid media campaigns', "Work in concert with the larger marketing analytics team for measurement of all aspects of campaigns - landing pages, keywords, creative, multi-touch modeling, etc.
Build reporting that will allow the digital marketing team to rapidly identify trends and improve efficiency
Assist with strategy and campaign planning of all aspects of Dynatrace's paid search, paid social and programmatic advertising", 'Qualifications', 'Required Qualifications', '5-7 years of experience in digital marketing analytics with at least 2-3 years of experience in analysis of paid search programs
3-5 years of experience with web analytics platforms (GA360 or Adobe Analytics) and data visualization platforms (Tableau, Google Data Studio)
2+ years of experience working with data warehouse platforms (BigQuery, Snowflake)
2+ years of experience with SQL to extract and manipulate data from data warehouse platforms
2-3 years of experience with attribution tools (e.g. Calibermind, Bizible)', 'Knowledge of the B2B lead lifecycle and the objectives of each channel of each of the stages of the lifecycle (TOFU/MOFU/BOFU)
A detail-oriented approach with quantitative and research skills, and proven data interpretation capability
Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
Passion for digital marketing, marketing technology, emerging trends in the digital landscape
Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, computer science, software engineering, or related technical field']

['Scope AR is the pioneer of enterprise-class augmented reality solutions, delivering the industry’s only cross-platform AR tools for getting workers the knowledge they need, when they need it. The company is revolutionizing the way enterprises work and collaborate by offering AR tools that provide more effective and efficient knowledge-sharing to conduct complex remote tasks, employee training, product and equipment assembly, maintenance and repair, field and customer support, and more.

The company’s device-agnostic technology supports smartphones, tablets and wearables, making it easy for leading organizations like Johnson & Johnson, Danaher, Lockheed Martin, Honeywell, and others to leverage AR as a new way to scale their organizations globally, with greater efficiency.

Working at Scope AR provides you the opportunity to have a real and major impact on the way products around the globe get created and how work gets done.

The Head of Partnerships will have responsibility for the execution of the VP of Sales approved partner
strategy. Reporting directly to the VP of Sales, the Head of Partnerships will lead the team responsible for securing
distribution scale via partnering with the biggest partners in the world, ensuring ScopeAR has a deep commercial and
technical relationship with these organizations which drive exponential user and revenue growth for ScopeAR.
The individual will be a hands-on leader in executing on all aspects of the strategy across acquisition, implementation,
enablement, and management of our partners.

Generate new business and retain existing accounts by building and enhancing the partner network
while maintaining a strong balance between revenue goals and the long-term strategic objectives
Have ultimate accountability for revenue generated from this channel and the associated
forecast/reporting/metrics associated
Have accountability for both the acquisition, management and retention of ScopeAR’s Partners
Manage the integration prioritization and co-ordination for new partners
Manage the direction of the acquisition strategy
Build and maintain strong relationships with partners and associated stakeholders
Track, monitor, and report to the VP of Sales and the Executive team progress against agreed goals with excellent
oral and written communication skills and a proven track record of successfully briefing team members at all
levels of an organization
Support Partners in the creation and execution of a go-to-market strategy for ScopeAR products.

Experience and Education:
5+ years of experience in running or being a senior member of a channel partner program
Exposure to the learning and development space, whether from a consultancy or a vendor specifically
Experience leading product or segment businesses preferably within a SaaS environment either B2B or B2C
High exposure to the contracting processes within partnerships
Understands sales and has had exposure working with cross-functional sales teams
Results-oriented; demonstrated history of exceptional work that has a direct impact on business results
A passion for emerging technology, new channels, innovations, and trends

Competencies:
Excellent communication skills (listening, explanatory, persuasion, negotiation)
Strong commercial skills and being able to navigate complex discussions relating to agreements
High ability to empathize and be likable, on the phone, by email, chat, and in person
An ability to open and convert sales/upsell opportunities with partners
Strong process implementation
Co-ordination and management come naturally to you

Excellent interpersonal skills. You will be working with other business professionals and are expected to convey
the value of our product and the culture and beliefs of our company outward to our partners.
Ability to think about process and scale above all else to work efficiently and effectively with multiple partners
collectively and cohesively.
High alignment to the ScopeAR Values:
Strong internal drive to provide excellent work and an excellent user experience
Bias toward action
Demonstrates creativity and candor
Can work and be part of 1 single team across the entire company (collaboration, teamwork)', "We're growing our team quickly, so if you like solving hard problems, want to have real influence at work and have the skills listed above, we'd love to hear from you!"]

['Koniku is an early-stage, rapidly-growing company based in Silicon Valley. We build smell cyborgs by merging genetically modified living biological neurons with classic devices. Our flagship device, the Konikore™, detects smells using GPCR\'s or olfactory receptor proteins hosted in biological cells. There are dynamic applications in healthcare, security, synthetic flavors & foods, and much more.\nWe partner with a range of Fortune 500 companies as Technology Integrators and have been recently featured by The Financial Times, CNN, Bloomberg, TechCrunch & others. Notable partners, customers and investors include: Airbus, BASF, Thermo Fisher Scientific, Fraunhofer Institute Stuttgart, P&G, SoftBank, Platform Capital, IndieBio (SOSv).\nBeyond the numerous B2B opportunities, we aim to have a Konikore in ten million homes as a real-time disease diagnostic tool within the next decade. Koniku is a face-to-face company and our campus & culture are the nucleus of the Koniku spirit. Our headquarters include a next-generation deep technology Wetlab and a robust manufacturing facility, alongside our corporate, administrative & customer support teams. We are driven by a fundamental belief that "Bio is Tech™".', 'Job Summary', '', 'The Head of Finance Operations will be the first full-time accounting hire at Koniku and report directly to the CEO or COO until the CFO role is filled. This role will be responsible for a majority of accounting functions including building out budgeting and reporting processes, establishing strong internal controls, and executing timely and accurate monthly close and reporting systems, as the company rapidly expands the client base with new accounts.', "We're searching for a candidate with solid bookkeeping and accounting experience but is also open to diving into other non-accounting projects as they arise. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who will continuously improve upon the processes however feel comfortable recommending and instituting new, more effective policies that become visible as needed as we scale.", '', 'Why it Matters', 'This role represents a significant growth opportunity for a highly-motivated, analytical individual to be involved in the building out of a vital department within the company, post the completion of our Series A funding round. This round and the to-be deployed capital, represent a very notable growth period for Koniku and this team member will be instrumental in ensuring the appropriate accounting and financial processes are in place and efficiently managed.', '', 'Responsibilities']

['#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.', '', 'About the Role', 'CrowdStrike is seeking a SMB Account Executive to hunt for new logos in the small to midsize business segment. In this role, you’ll be managing the full sales cycle from beginning to end with the goal of acquiring new accounts to meet your sales quota. We are looking for passion in the cybersecurity space, strong sales acumen, and a tenacious attitude.', '', 'Locations – This role is 100% remote in the following cities: Austin TX, Dallas, TX, Houston, TX, Sunnyvale CA, San Francisco CA, Los Angeles CA, Orange County CA, San Diego CA, Denver, CO, Phoenix AZ, Raleigh NC, Chicago IL, and Boston, MA. Surrounding locations with a reasonable commute to the cities listed will be considered.', '', 'What You’ll do', 'Run a full sales process from prospecting to close.
Collaborate with our Inside Sales Engineers (ISE’s) to close business.
Partner with our channel partners to drive net-new business.
Forecast and report updates to management team.
Become an insider within the cyber security industry and become an expert of CrowdStrike products.
Stay well educated and informed about CrowdStrike’s competitive landscape and how to sell the value of our solutions and services when compared to the relevant competitors in the Next-Generation Endpoint market space.
May require modified work hours to accommodate accounts in other time zones, and minimal, but occasional travel for accounts that require a higher touch to achieve closure.
Develop your career and sales skills through leadership engagement, Sandler Sales Training and mentorship from senior Account Executives.', '']

column7:
["About the Company
Kiddom builds technology enabling teachers and learners to unlock their full potential. Education technology is increasingly fragmented across various applications, undermining utility and causing cognitive overload, frustration, and ultimately, rejection. Kiddom is building a collaborative learning platform for educators to integrate content, curriculum, and analytics in one place.

About the Product Management Team
Our product team is obsessed with supporting teachers, helping them increase student outcomes, and creating the conditions whereby classroom learning is fun and engaging. Our product team sits at the center of the Kiddom organization because it’s their task to prioritize what we build to enable teachers and learners.
Kiddom’s product managers work closely with end users (educators), designers, and engineers to define, test, deploy, and measure the impact of new and existing features. Our product managers use data, interviews, and testing to conceptualize, create, and deliver solutions to meet the unique needs of our users.

About the Role
As a Senior Product Manager at Kiddom you’ll be part of a close-knit cross-functional team including engineering, design, product marketing, support, sales and customer success—working together to build a truly impactful platform. You will be the loudest champion of our users and use your strong business acumen and in-depth understanding of our users to set a clear vision and strategy for your projects.

We’re looking for product managers who excel at navigating ambiguity and thrive in environments of high ownership and independence.

About You
You have extensive experience setting an agile roadmap and bringing SaaS products to market and passion for building product experiences that impact teachers and students. A background in education and/or edtech is ideal but not required.
Most importantly, everyone we hire believes in leveraging education's substantial impact for the betterment of society.", 'You will:
Become an expert on your product area through analyses of metrics and a wide range of inputs including customer needs and market conditions, prioritizing this work so your team is always working on the most impactful projects
Develop the strategy and roadmap to deliver highly impactful products for the K-12 market that save teachers time and improve student learning outcomes
Be responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions for our users
Experiment with new tools to advance the boundaries of how education leaders understand and guide their schools, staff, and students', 'You have:
5+ years of relevant experience in product management
Experience at a quickly growing startup
Demonstrated experience managing the end-to-end lifecycle of a SaaS product
The ability to balance stakeholder needs, market opportunity, innovation, and moving quickly
The ability to influence, lead, motivate, justify, and simplify', 'Salary range is dependent on Geography and demonstrated role related ability during the interview process.

Potential range: 120k-200k

What we offer
We are a passionate, collaborative team focused on building transformative education technology and making a measurable impact in K-12 education.
We strive to create an inclusive, positive team culture where everyone is respected and valued for everything they bring to Kiddom, not just what they produce.

Full time permanent employees are eligible for the following benefits from their first day:
Competitive salary
Meaningful equity
Health benefits: medical (various PPO/HMO/HSA plans), dental, vision, disability and life insurance
10 paid sick days per year
Unlimited vacation time policy (subject to internal approval). Average use 4 weeks off per year.
Paid family leave after birth/adoption of caretakers and minimum of 16 paid weeks for birthing parents. Meant to supplement benefits offered by State.

COVID Vaccination Policy
Kiddom policy requires employees to be vaccinated before they visit an office or attend company events..
We have remote roles but in certain positions where office attendance is deemed to be essential to the role, offers of employment shall be conditional upon proof of vaccination.']
