column7:
['How you will help', 'You will be responsible for selling HealthVerity integrated SaaS solutions to Life Sciences companies targeting the R&D, IT and RWE verticals. You will work with our existing account teams to identify, develop and close sales opportunities for our enterprise SaaS solutions.', '', 'What you will do', 'Utilize a value-based selling approach to sell HealthVerity’s SaaS solutions across the enterprise with a vision of being a trusted partner to your customers
Know and understand the customer’s strategic issues and how HealthVerity supports it with software and data.
Engage senior level leadership within the R&D and IT functions in Life Sciences to demonstrate HealthVerity capabilities
Work with our solution engineers to conceptualize and build solutions to solve our customer strategic issues in identity resolution, consent management, data ingestion & normalization and privacy
Meet and exceed pipeline generation and revenue targets
Manage multiple large complex sales cycles, leverage internal and external resources', '', 'About You', 'You are a motivated salesperson with a proven track record of building relationships and generating revenue within the Life Sciences industry.
You are well versed in the issues affecting Life Sciences to be able to engage senior level decision makers.
You understand the evolving needs of R&D and RWE organizations.
You are also able to convey complex concepts, simply and to both a business and IT stakeholder
You have a consultative mindset that allows you to develop solutions to benefit your clients.
You collaborate well with internal stakeholders that allows you to effectively deliver successful outcomes for the client.', '', 'Desired Skills and Experience']

['Our team focuses on North American based clients using our back office cloud applications. Our resources are primarily located in North America and India. We’re growing fast, and we need consultants ready to bring their unique skills, energy, and creativity to help us continuously innovate how we deliver world-class client experiences on cloud applications projects.', 'The role of an ERP Senior Cloud Project Manager requires an experienced project management professional with strong business acumen, technical competency in SaaS-based software and leadership skills for successful delivery of Oracle ERP solutions (software + services).', 'The ERP Senior Cloud Project Manager works closely with Delivery teams, Solution Architects, Sales, Customer Success Managers, and Services Operations to ensure customer technology deployments & projects are delivered on time, within budget and according to the project plan scope. The ERP Cloud Project Manager will also identify and mitigate any risks throughout the project(s) s/he manages.', 'The ERP Senior Cloud Project Manager must be able to manage cross-functional teams from different Oracle departments and demonstrate diplomacy and the ability to manage demanding customers. They must demonstrate leadership and motivational skills and mentor other members of the PMO. The ERP Cloud Project Manager actively contributes to continuous PMO process improvements and publishes contributions to the knowledge base.', 'When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.', 'We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.', 'Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.', 'We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you would like accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know at +1.888.404.2494, Option 1.', 'Disclaimer:', '']

column1: Senior Director, Product Marketing, Marketplace & ISV Journey
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Disability insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['The Global Demand Center (GDC) within the Cloud Marketing Group leads the marketing transformation of Microsoft’s largest and fastest growing commercial businesses. We acquire millions of new contacts annually, nurture them into leads and sales recommendations using modern, computational marketing, advanced analytics, and marketing automation. Our globally scaled programs create highly personalized and relevant experiences and content across the customer’s buying journey, delivering a connected sales and marketing experience.', '', 'Come be part of the Marketplace & ISV Journey team, which is focused on guiding Technology Partners, often referred to as Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) from discovery and building on our cloud, and ultimately to publication on our marketplace, growth, and success. The Marketplace & ISV Journey team defines and drives the execution of our ISV and Marketplace business strategy. We will unify cross-Microsoft efforts to create opportunity and growth for breadth ISVs and a rich marketplace experience for customers using exceptional digital marketing, merchandising and commerce capabilities that make it easy to find, try and buy ISV applications.', '', 'This specific role will lead commercial consumer product marketing for our ISV segment of products within our Commercial marketplace. This includes identifying, developing, and leading several commercial consumer marketing initiatives to create transactional opportunities and marketplace platform business growth.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Defining and building the marketing strategy, customer segmentation, and go-to-market activities required to scale our Commercial Cloud Marketplace product marketing functions.
Driving a connected marketing plan & Go To Market plan for commercial marketplace which enables organizations to work / learn remotely whilst increasing productivity
You are the spokesperson of the entire Microsoft Cloud portfolio towards IT audiences, Developers, Business Decision Makers Procurement professionals and market influencers
You will orchestrate the marketing launches of new products and features.
Creating strategic plans and financial modelling for key marketing initiatives and owning the process of review with senior executives, leading to a set of discrete priority projects
Building marketing product definition & work plan building capabilities required to help grow the business and eliminate bottlenecks
Building the team, by assessing the, designing the org, prioritizing hires, hiring, onboarding, training, and setting each individual up for success.
Working on cross-functional initiatives across our Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Field Ops, Data teams.
Support Field Sales and Marketing training for effective worldwide roll-out of new initiatives and programs
Owning and project managing the initiatives, reporting on the progress, performance, and recommended optimization in senior stakeholder forums
Demonstrating ability to engage with and influence business teams to drive alignment, change and ultimately results.
Innovating new internal and partner-facing ‘market-making’ capabilities to leverage, data, workflows, ML/AI to streamline, scale, and increase the efficacy of our marketing activities.', '', 'Qualifications']

column6: ['Health insurance', 'Stock options', 'Unlimited paid time off', 'Work from home', 'Work from home stipend']

column7:
['OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY
As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.', '', 'The Opportunity', 'We are looking for a Senior Revenue Operations Analyst to serve as a trusted advisor and business partner to our Sales leadership. As part of the Sales Forecasting & Compensation team, this role’s primary responsibility will be overseeing compensation plan administration and commissions & attainment reporting. In addition, the Senior Revenue Operations Analyst will have an opportunity to work on a diverse set of projects including sales forecasting, data modeling and analysis, and pipeline modeling.', '', 'You Are Great At', 'Administering and serving as project manager for our annual compensation planning cycle
Administering commission reports, including monthly data collection and review, incentive compensation calculations, submitting commissions attainment to finance, and commission reporting to sales and business development reps
Fielding questions and requests from employees on incentive compensation plans, and serving as a liaison on commission-related matters.
Tracking and managing bonuses and spiffs for teams on incentive compensation plans, partnering with leaders to develop monthly and quarterly programs, ensuring appropriate tracking and reporting, and calculating eligible performance-based payments.
Assisting with ad hoc projects, such as:
Sales forecasting & modeling
Board presentation preparation
Project support
Data audits and analysis
Managing multiple projects while effectively balancing the priorities of the business
Enabling self-service tools and automation wherever possible
Designing and building reporting metrics and tools to inform business decisions, improve forecasting, and better analyze outcomes
Obtaining a thorough understanding of our data sources and collection methods
Ensuring the data quality and consistency with monitoring and support, and playing an active role in establishing data governance', '', 'What It Takes', 'Knowledgeable
BS or BA in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, or a related field
4+ years of experience in Revenue Operations or related fields required
Experience in compensation plan administration and reporting a plus
Experience with CRM tools and Salesforce
Previous experience with reporting tools and Tableau
Previous SaaS or e-commerce experience a plus
Strong Internet, email, and electronic document management skills (MS Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) required
Analytical - You possess strong logical, problem-solving, and Excel modeling skills.
Efficient - You are extremely organized and attentive to detail, with excellent prioritization skills that allow you to consistently deliver quality results on time.
Strong Communicator - You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex business analysis in a clear and concise manner
Flexible - You learn quickly, are responsive to feedback, and can work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, while also being willing to say you don’t know.
Collaborative - You have the ability to forge strong bonds, work collaboratively with, and influence internal partners such as other Sales channels, Finance, and Business Applications.
Personable - You are a high-energy professional with a resiliently positive attitude that exudes a strong sense of teamwork by working effectively, respectfully, and efficiently with all team members']

["Ozmo is seeking an exceptional and savvy Business Development Manager to join our growing team. As the Business Development Manager, you will be focused on selling our SaaS platform by developing new prospects and stewarding deals through all facets of the sales process to enterprise customers. You will report directly to the Head of Business Development, North America and work alongside Product, Marketing and other New Business Development team members to increase sales of Ozmo's SaaS products and services.", 'As a growing technology company, Ozmo’s focus is on solving tech support at scale. We build best-in-class software products that are used around the world to improve the lives of tens of millions of people each year by making technology more accessible. Ozmonauts are motivated to continuously improve and love to learn. We pride ourselves in doing exceptional work that delivers real value by transforming the way people think about technology.', 'Responsibilities', "Establish relationships with customers to sell Ozmo's SaaS products and services
Penetrate target accounts in key North American communications service providers, insurance, OEM, retail, and large enterprise sectors
Steward deals through all facets of the sales process
Successfully navigate complex corporate customer organizations and cross-functional business units
Develop and maintain trusted, long-term business relationships with decision makers and key influencers at target accounts and industry sectors
Maintain a rhythm of regular communications with decision makers and key influencers
Develop and implement sales plans to meet or exceed assigned sales and billed revenue objectives
Generate new sales opportunities through various prospecting and account penetration strategies, including professional introductions, customer referrals, partner relationships and cold calling
Continuously feed and maintain a new sales pipeline with enough sales opportunities to consistently meet/exceed revenue objectives
Customize and deliver live sales presentations and proposals to prospects that demonstrate the long-term business value of Ozmo SaaS products and services
Participate and provide leadership in customer requested meetings and calls
Utilize internal tools to accurately track and maintain accurate data for pipeline, forecasts and activity tracking
Act as a strong customer advocate with internal Ozmo stakeholder groups
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify areas of improvement for Ozmo's offering
Stay abreast of the competitive landscape and emerging technologies to help position Ozmo in the marketplace
Actively promote and position Ozmo for success within our targeted industry sectors", '', 'Requirements and qualifications', "Senior business development leader with the ability to manage C-level relationships in the industry's largest companies
Strategic thinker with the ability to design and execute complex sales plans
Strong technical acumen
Proven ability to succeed in unsupervised environments
Self-motivated to maintain regular contact with customers, management, and peers
A rare combination of sales hunter with the ability to create and manage long-term relationships
Ability to manage multiple contract negotiations and relationships simultaneously in a startup environment
Experience with reading and comprehending legal documents
Proficient working knowledge of the telecommunications industry and landscape
Proven experience as a business development professional selling enterprise SaaS solutions
Experience selling to any of the following is a plus: mobile operators, OEMs, customer care organizations and large enterprises
Proven and consistent record of closing complex, multi-year SaaS product and services sales opportunities and exceeding sales goals
Thorough understanding of executive relationship management and the strategic sales process
Strong business and financial acumen with an understanding of the economic drivers of communications service provider and large enterprise sectors
Solutions oriented with ability to extract customer requirements and position value-added solutions that address customer needs
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
Customer focused with outstanding customer service and customer relationship skills
Exceptional customer presentation and meeting management skills
Excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail
Functional understanding of mobile and IoT technologies
Willing to travel as needed based on needs of the business
Proximity to a major airport", '', 'Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. Ozmo does not sponsor employment visas.', 'Ozmo participates in the E-verify program.']

['Intro
Perimeter 81 is looking for a highly professional, personable and tech-savvy person to join our rapidly expanding, venture-backed startup with offices in Santa Monica, CA.
The Account Manager will be responsible for maximizing customer adoption and ensuring the expansion of Perimeter 81’s services, all while giving value to the customer. You will act as a trusted advisor and guide customers through their SaaS journey — from service onboarding to product review — ensuring all customers get the full value of their investment with Perimeter 81.
If you are a skilled communicator, thrive on building customer loyalty, and are passionate about promoting account growth, this job is for you.', "About Perimeter 81
Perimeter 81 radically simplifies cybersecurity with the world’s first Cybersecurity Experience (CSX) Platform. We’ve been recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor and Forrester New Wave Leader™, and have raised over $100M from tier-1 investors such as Insight Partners, B-Capital, Toba Capital, and more. We have over 200 employees based in offices in Tel Aviv, New York and Los Angeles.
Our holistic, cloud-based solution allows organizations of all industries and sizes to support the immediate desires of digital nomads, by transforming the outdated, complex, hardware-based network security technologies into one unified, easy-to-use and scalable software solution. Our 2,000+ clients include SMBs to Fortune 500 businesses and industry leaders across a wide range of sectors. Our partners are among the world's leading integrators, managed service providers, and channel resellers.", 'Job Description
As the Account manager you will be responsible for:
Developing and maintaining a close relationship with the customer throughout the whole customer lifecycle
Promoting Perimeter 81’s services and driving customer adoption of newly released product features
Working closely with the Sales team on building customer strategies, ensuring new opportunities are identified and managed
Taking part in the pre-sales process and handshake with Sales to ensure a smooth customer on-boarding
Advocating customers’ needs within Perimeter 81, and influencing the product roadmap according to customers’ priorities
Ensuring customers are ready to be a reference for Perimeter 81’s Sales & Marketing efforts
Maintaining and overseeing product knowledge-base guides and leading the development of a support community', 'Requirements
Experience as a Sales Executive or Account Manager.
knowledge in CSM/Account management or similar customer-facing position, preferably working in the SaaS or cybersecurity sector
Proven ability to develop and cultivate lasting customer relationships
Technological mindset – able to have a technological discussion with IT managers and senior stakeholders, as well as high-level technical meetings
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical messages in a clear and simple way
Strong team player and collaborator
Degree in a related field such as: Business, Computer Science or Information Technology
Perimeter 81 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, or disability']

column1: Head of Business Development & Sales – Magic Products
column7:
['Magic EdTech is looking for a dynamic sales leader to continue to accelerate its growth. Over the past few years, Magic EdTech has seen exponential growth and is looking to hire senior leaders to amplify the same.
Head of Business Development & Sales will represent the market leading Digital Learning Products division of Magic EdTech globally. This leadership role will own the whole process to win happy customers, from identifying prospects in the market, building suitable partnerships, helping identify alternate segments and areas where these products can be sold, to generating sustainable revenue for the business. You would also be responsible to manage the global sales team of Magic Products spread across North America and India.
Visit www.getmagicbox.com to know more about our products – MagicBox, MagicSync.
If you are a hands-on, driven sales leader that can drive revenue and strong partnerships with the customer base and the larger market, then this is the opportunity for you.
Location: New York/Washington DC preferred or remote
Experience Range: 10+ years
Role/Job Description
Primary responsibility is generating revenue; product sales; SAAS platform License sales/contracts.
Overall accountability of sales and revenue growth for the Magic Products, including self and sales team targets.
Build a strong annuity revenue stream to ensure recurring revenue.
Generate leads through networking, campaigns, and other channels like Events/Conferences
Drive sales strategy for winning large enterprise customers and help the team refine, execute on their account strategies and plans.
Partner with the marketing team to devise strategies to gain brand recognition, thought leadership, and leads
Partner with the customer success and product team to develop strategies, roadmap for customer retention and increasing market share.
Qualifications/Experience/Background
Exposure in managing Institutional/corporate (B2B) product sales in either Education or corporate training is a must
Functional Knowledge of technology to be able to answer questions about the product
Rolodex, past experience of generating leads/sales in Professionals Services/ Learning and Education businesses.
Experience in selling SAAS/Cloud/Product sales, License contracts, Implementation / Professional Services and solutions.
Hands on Experience to price a solution, write proposals, do presentations, and negotiations.
About Magic
Magic Software (www.Magicsw.com) is committed to its mission for enabling “humanity’s pursuit of happiness by making lifelong digital learning equitable, affordable, and sustainable”. Magic EdTech is an educational technology company that partners with the world’s leading publishers, universities, educational and training companies to build next generation Digital Learning products for an international audience.
Magic has a market leading digital distribution platform and has already built a strong team of leaders and SMEs in consulting, technology services – specifically to help in building digital learning products by bringing immersive content and leading-edge learning technologies. Our cloud-based platform serves over 5.5 million students with the latest digital learning content. We serve clients globally across North America, UK, Europe, Asia, Africa, and Latin America. Magic Software is owned by a US-based PE firm Solmark (www.solmark.com).
Visit us at www.magicedtech.com, www.getmagicbox.com, and www.solmark.com to know more.']

column1: Senior Software QA Engineer (Hybrid - Mesa, AZ)
column7:
['Job Overview', '', "The Sr Software QA Engineer will support ongoing development efforts for one of IQVIA's flagship SaaS products, Orchestrated Customer Engagement (OCE). Part of this suite is OCE Sales that is changing the way customer information is managed in order to drive measurable market results. It is being used by some of the world’s leading healthcare and life-science organizations and is regarded as one of the most innovative cloud-based customer relationship management (CRM) solutions available. Our continued growth has opened up new opportunities.", 'Our Mission', 'We exist and love to come to work because we are passionate about solving complex technical challenges, we love to work with the members in our team, we learn from each other every day, and we value working as a team more than working individually.', 'What We Value', 'Empathy
Pragmatism
Curiosity
Stealth innovation
A love for learning
Accountability
Ship early, ship often
Happiness and positivity
Excellent communication skills', '', 'Job Responsibilities:', 'Be a QA Engineer who can test a complex solution and work independently
Review functional and design requirements to ensure full understanding of individual deliverables to enable development of good test scenarios
Provide good and clear test cases with traceability to requirements and defects
Identify defects and impact on the solutions
Help deliver high quality software that matches technical requirements in a time frame that matches business needs
Collaborate with globally distributed Product Management and Agile Development teams
Function as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in areas of software
Perform manual testing, create test cases, or create automation test scripts, depending on the need of the team
Have the ability to quickly automate test scenarios is a plus']

['Quest is an award-winning IT management software provider offering a broad selection of solutions that solve some of the most common and most challenging IT problems. We are currently looking for a Renewals Senior Territory Representative to support our Renewal business. This position will be based out of our Dublin, Ohio office. This is an entry level position on the renewals team with potential for Career Development.', '', 'Quest strives to be the best of the very best in everything we do. We are fanatically customer focused and are proud to support the most complex customers who have the highest IT demands in the world. It’s exciting, it’s rewarding, it’s hard work and offers career and personal growth.', '', 'The primary responsibility of the Renewals Senior Territory Representative is to maintain and grow revenue with our existing subscription and SaaS customers. This is inclusive of managing current renewals and creating growth via upsell, cross sell, and upgrade opportunities. The Renewals Senior Territory Representative will create strong working relationships with the Quest Sales team, Customer Success team, and other internal teams to ensure complete customer satisfaction.', 'Ownership for subscription and SaaS renewals within an assigned territory.
Run a proactive end to end renewal sales cycle with a focus on maximizing ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue) and net retention rates. Inclusive of, but not limited to, quote management, forecasting, negotiations, obtaining purchase orders and order submission. With a primary focus on ensuring on time renewal.
Maximize account growth by identifying upsell, cross sell and upgrade opportunities while working the renewal sales cycle.
Achieve quarterly assigned sales quotas for both renewal and new license (growth)
Develop relationships with your customer base as a trusted advisor and schedule check points between renewals to ensure high level of customer satisfaction.
Leverage and build relationships with primary cross-functional resources to achieve results and meet customer needs. Specifically: Field Sales, Customer Success, Deal Desk and Product Management.
Maintain and update an accurate rolling forecast in your territory. Identify risk early and work with appropriate cross functional resources to determine resolution.
Follow best practices for internal processes inclusive of: opportunity management, data quality, activity logging, CRM hygiene, quote pricing and forecasting.
Completion of product training courses as assigned for your territory/business unit will be critical to your success. Ongoing training as technology is updated will be required to ensure knowledge stays relevant for growing footprint within existing accounts.
Collaborate with other internal teams such as sales support, order processing, tech support, renewal operations, etc, to drive successful outcomes for our customers and internal practices.', 'Requirements', '2+ years of renewal or customer success experience, ideally working with subscription and/or SaaS renewals
Experience with a quota carrying role
Ability to strategically identify growth opportunities in existing customer accounts
Strong process management with the ability to enforce strict policies
Passion for building strong customer relationships, excellent communication and follow-up skills
Strong organization skills with an emphasis on account and territory management
Experience working in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Must be able to work from our office located in Dublin, OH', '', 'Preferences']
