column7: ['Our Purpose', '', 'We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a\nculture of inclusion\nfor all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.', '', 'Job Title', '', '', '', '', '']

["We are looking for an experienced leader who brings a strong mix of leadership, operational rigor and business acumen to help establish the vision and drive the execution of Vimeo's Trust & Safety operations. This role will report into the VP of Customer Support and will span all of Vimeo's products and business segments.", 'You will build out and lead the Trust & Safety team to ensure the safety of our global Vimeo community in crafting, sharing and growing their businesses with video. Furthermore, you will use your experience to balance the operational realities of a fast-growing business against continuously evolving policies while working to build an outstanding customer experience. You will partner with Engineering for tool development, Product Management to drive improvements into the product roadmap, Sales and Business Development on new opportunities and last but not least collaborate with Legal on policy and compliance.', "What you'll do:", 'Responsible for global Trust & Safety operations and customer experience
Advocate and build awareness for Trust & Safety across the company
Define measurements for Trust & Safety impact and performance
Lead cross functional global strategic projects to ensure continued operational improvement and regulation compliance
Act as a global escalation point for emergency content safety-related cases and provide suitable follow-up root cause and corrective action plans', 'Skills and knowledge you should possess:', '6 - 8+ years of overall experience in Trust & Safety with technology or SaaS experience preferred
Experience leading senior contributors and managers as well as matrixed and outsourced resources
Experience working with Business, Legal, Engineering and Product teams
Extremely high EQ with sensitivity and respect for other cultures, religions and orientations
Track record of proven results in fast paced and demanding work environments
In depth knowledge of content moderation, legal compliance and abuse protection practices and industry standards
Experience with escalation and crisis management and ownership
Extensive experience with data analysis, insights, visualization and communication', 'Targeted Base Salary Range: $137,000 to $202,500', 'The base salary range listed above is for candidates located in the U.S., including the New York City metro area.', "At Vimeo, we strive to hire and nurture amazing talent across the globe. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience, specialized skills, internal alignment and a candidate's home base.", "Base salary is just one component of Vimeo's total rewards philosophy. We offer a wide range of benefits and perks that appeal to the variety of needs across our diverse employee base! Other rewards may include bonus or commission, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), paid time off, generous 401k match, tuition reimbursement, wellbeing resources, and more."]

column1: Senior Associate - Corporate Development and Strategy

column7:
['Circa is committed to bringing local talent and business together through innovative recruitment software solutions to enhance the livelihood, diversity, and growth of our communities nationwide. As a sales organization, we’re committed to building strong sales careers. Account Executives at Circa complete a thorough training program, and are a part of ongoing learning, development, and mentorship to achieve success.', 'As a Senior Account Executive, you will leverage The Challenger methodology to develop new business and prospect to close within a specific territory, no travel involved. Our team is passionate, goal oriented, and looking for talented individuals to join us!', 'About You', 'You are a disciplined, successful, and established sales professional with a track record of achieving goals. You’re a skilled communicator, comfortable with cold calling and building rapport and trust with decision makers. Fast paced environments are just your speed and you love learning new things. You’re tech savvy, pick up new things quickly, and have a method for time management and organization.', 'You have a few years of proven success in a consultative business-to-business sales position, preferably focused on new prospects. Software or technical sales experience a plus! You have built strategic prospecting skills over the course of your career and might even practice the Challenger methodology. You’re self-motivated, independent, and goal oriented.', 'About the Position', 'As a Senior Account Executive at Circa, you will identify and qualify prospective customers and key decision makers, secure business meetings through cold calling, email, and outbound campaigns, and close deals. You will be selling our OFCCP product line, targeting government contractors within your territory. You’ll effectively manage your sales pipeline, creating a sense of urgency in the sales process to bring deals to close. You’ll establish our value and differentiation via online business presentations, executing effective sales strategies to meet and exceed your sales goals. Your average deal size is $10k-15k, with a sales cycle between 30 and 50 days.', 'Our Sales Team:', 'We are a growth minded organization with a focus on pursuing new business
We operate at a high velocity – focused on the intangible business impacts of our solutions (vs features and functions)
Our team members are empowered, entrepreneurial, and autonomous
We leverage Challenger methodologies for success
We use Salesforce CRM, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Groove', 'Day in the Life']

['Sr. Technical Customer Success Manager', '', 'Harmonic is the industry leading solution for the transformation for video, cable and media companies, with smarter, faster, and simpler video streaming and broadband services. We are at the forefront of industry innovations, with simplified streaming using the cloud or software as a service, or next-generation gigabit services for the cable market. To learn more, go to “About Harmonic”.', '', 'Role Description', 'Harmonic is hiring for a Technical Customer Success Manager/Sr role. You will be reporting to Sr. Director, Technical Customer Success', '', 'Location', 'Remote – this position is Remote with periodic travel.', '']

column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Opportunities for advancement']

column7:
['Mclean, VA', "Who Are You?
You describe yourself as a quick learner, self-starter, organized, and self-motivated. You have a bias for action and are meticulous about details. You enjoy being in a customer facing role and can converse easily with all levels of management. You’re comfortable with technology and enjoy learning new tools, datasets, and analytic techniques. You have a passion for continuous learning—you enjoy learning about each customers’ unique pain points and helping them find creative solutions. You are not easily intimidated by a challenge and enjoy wearing multiple hats. You can assess the utility of a technological tool and understand and communicate its functions to both explain and improve it. Your friends and family describe you as friendly but also tenacious and outgoing. You take pride and ownership in your work and enjoy being the face of the professionals in the background. You work well independently or in a cross-functional team.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing complex software deployment projects for the US Government.
National security, intelligence, government, or military department experience preferred
Current Security Clearance Holder, SECRET or higher or ability to get and maintain one.
Experience in supply chain risk management (SCRM)
Must be a U.S. citizen with an existing TS/SCI or the ability to get and maintain such.
Extensive experience using analytical research and/or industry tools to manage and analyze data
Ability and confidence to draw high-level assessments from research and data
Ability to write and speak clearly to brief complex analytical matters to all levels
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize and work under pressure
Strong interpersonal skills with practical and positive leadership qualities
A Day In The Life- Senior Manager
Your daily mission as a Senior Manager is simple; it is to:
Make your clients successful in their unique mission and
Grow Exiger by providing value to your customers and peers
Everything you do revolves around this mission, which means every day is different because your clients’ needs are always changing and evolving. On a given day, you could do any of the following:
Develop a presentation that outlines Exiger’s core technology
Onboard new users and brief them on all the capabilities we can provide
Imagine new ways to apply the technology based on their mission and work with the internal team to test and roll out
Conduct training (in-person or virtual) on how your clients can apply the technology to their mission
Attend a conference about Supply Chain Risk concerns
Advise your clients on how best to utilize the software and tools they’ve purchased
Conduct initial troubleshooting on any technical issues your clients are having and work with the tech team to resolve
Translate your clients’ needs and mission into products Exiger can offer and confidently propose those ideas to the client
Ask how your clients are doing and get to know them on a personal level when appropriate
Mentor junior analysts, peers, and leadership
Provide internal trainings or education on Exiger processes or certain subject matter
Manage junior managers and analysts, growing them in their careers and helping them to be more successful
Provide support to the sales team to talk about the great work your clients are doing as a thought leader in the SCRM world
Analyze data in Exiger holding to make informed recommendations to each customer based on their value drivers
And much, much more!
Benefits
Health. Dental, and Vision Insurance
401K match
Flexible hybrid, in-office or remote, work from home arrangements possible
16 weeks paid maternity/paternity leave
Discretionary time off
Access to holisticly.co, a subscription service that allows you to pick wellness benefits

This position is remote eligible within the United States, excluding residents of California, Colorado, and New York.
Exiger is revolutionizing the way corporations, government agencies and banks manage risk and compliance with a combination of technology-enabled and SaaS solutions. In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law."]

column1: Sr. Director, Platform Product Management & Operations
column6: ['401(k)', 'Dental insurance', 'Flexible spending account', 'Health insurance', 'Health savings account', 'Life insurance']
column7:
['Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.', 'When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.', 'Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.', 'The OnDemand Services and Automation organization is focused on the design, development and delivery of OnDemand solutions that elevate the client experience, making engagement with Visa simple, intuitive, and rewarding. The team manages Visa Online (VOL), a global extranet platform that provides secure access to Visa content, products and services for Visa clients and employees around the world.', 'The Senior Director, Platform Product Management and Operations is responsible for driving the vision, strategy and roadmap for the global enterprise platform. S(he) will keep abreast of best practices for B2B platforms as well as emerging technology trends and leverage those findings to inform platform enhancements. The Senior Director will envision and communicate the platform’s desired future state for enablement of clients, partners and employees. S(he) will partner with OnDemand Product Management, CX Design and Technology teams to bring new self-service experiences to life through the portal. S(he) will focus on continuous value creation and will execute on value capture opportunities. In addition, the Sr Director will be accountable for the development of the platform roadmap, including detailed backlog of features and capabilities. Lastly, s(he) will manage the VOL Operations team responsible for a broad set of activities including but not limited to UI service/product integrations, onboarding of new web services and certificate management, client access and delegated administration, etc.', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Portal Vision and Strategy
Research, explore, and assess B2B platforms in the marketplace and distill best practices to guide Visa Online enhancement plans
Work closely with the CX Design and Insights team to understand customer’s needs, pain points and aspirations through Voice of Customer as well as secondary research
Assess opportunities to leverage Visa Online platform to deliver delightful and intuitive digital OnDemand solutions
Develop vision and compelling narrative about platform modernization and expansion to better support Visa clients, partners and non-traditional players in an ever-evolving digital ecosystem
Portal Development and Delivery
Manage VOL enhancement roadmap including backlog of features and capabilities
Ensure the portal product roadmap supports the goals and strategy of the business and reflects market and customer needs
Partner closely with Technology to identify, size and allocate resources for investment priorities that drive value to clients and to the business
Ensure requirements and user interfaces are properly implemented by Technology
Partner with other client facing portal owners to develop consistent OnDemand client experiences across Visa portals
Work with cybersecurity teams to implement security enhancements for portal apps and services, and address portal’s security findings
Sales Enablement and Commercialization
Develop and execute platform/service monetization strategy as well as implementation of billing solutions
In collaboration with Marketing, produce sales enablement resources and marketing collateral to accelerate platform usage
In collaboration with Finance, monitor platform’s contribution to top line and ROI
Communications and Evangelism
Amplify VOL awareness among partners and stakeholders, articulating the value it provides to clients and to the enterprise
Communicate the platform vision and value story, and build support across matrixed organization and executives for continued investments in the platform
Be the face of Visa Online both for internal and external stakeholders
Contribute unique ideas within cross-functional workshops and brainstorming sessions and bring them to life through story-telling skills
Platform Operations
Manage the VOL Ops team, responsible for UI service integrations, onboarding of new web services and certificate management, client single sign access, client delegated administration, etc.
Monitor platform’s KPIs and progress towards stated Objectives and Key Results (OKRs)
Leadership and Team Building
Create a team culture that embraces innovation, collaboration, and a growth mindset
Set development and performance goals for the team and model the way', 'This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office two days a week, Tuesdays and Wednesdays with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% of the time based on business needs.', '', '']

column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Cell phone reimbursement', 'Dental insurance', 'Gym membership', 'Health insurance']
column7:
['At ASAPP, we are on a mission to build transformative machine learning-powered products that push the boundaries of artificial intelligence and customer experience. We focus on solving complex, data-rich problems — the kind where there are huge systemic inefficiencies and where a real solution will have a significant economic impact. Our CX performance platform uses machine learning across both voice and digital engagement channels to augment and automate human work, radically increasing productivity and improving the efficiency and effectiveness of customer experience teams.

We are looking for an experienced, seasoned Technical Project Manager to work closely with our Engineering Operations team to develop strategic technical processes for launching and supporting ASAPP’s products at scale.

This role is onsite or hybrid flexible, working out of our office in New York City.', "What you'll do
Work on key problems the domain or area needs to solve, such as scaling, improved planning and road mapping, and setting minimum expectations and gates for process
Work with managers, domain leads, and other stakeholders to determine new process and build out the ASAPP roadmap
Be responsible for the strategy and construction of frameworks for ASAPP engineering best practices, visibility, measurement, and standards of productization
Help establish governance of the application of quality and process standards, as well as tracking adherence to company goals and OKRs
Act as a centralized resource for TPMs on unified strategy and best practices, mentorship, and career growth
Act as an extra TPM help on complex projects and programs", "What you'll need
At least 7-10 years of experience in a Project Management role in software development
An ability to simultaneously manage multiple, fast-paced initiatives
Experience leading, mentoring, and coaching TPMs
Proven strong written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Excellent understanding of product release methodologies
Familiarity with Agile software development and deployment processes
Ability to grasp new concepts and technologies quickly in a fast-paced environment", "What we'd like to see
An advanced technical degree or MBA
CSM / Certified Scrum Master
Experience in SaaS software development", 'Benefits
Competitive compensation with stock options
Comprehensive medical, vision, and dental insurance
401k matching
Fitness and wellness stipend
Mobile phone reimbursement
Mental well-being benefits
Professional learning and development stipend
Parental leave, including adoptive and foster parents
3 weeks paid time off (increases with tenure) and unlimited sick leave', "ASAPP is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status. If you have a disability and need assistance with our employment application process, please email us at careers@asapp.com to obtain assistance.

The information below is provided for those hired in Colorado or New York City only. Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado or New York City as well.
If you are a Colorado applicant:
- The estimated pay range for this role, based in Colorado, is $187,000 - 205,000.
If you are an NYC applicant:
- The estimated pay range for this role, based in NYC, is $205,000 - 240,000.
For Sales positions: this role is eligible to earn commissions and eligible to participate in ASAPP's equity plan.
For Non-Sales positions: this role is eligible to participate in ASAPP's equity plan.
The actual salary may be different depending upon non-discriminatory factors such as qualifications, experience, and other factors permitted by law. The range listed is just one component of ASAPP’s total compensation package; other rewards may include short- and long-term incentives, including the benefits listed above. #LI-SL1 #LI-Hybrid"]

['Work At Home
Immediate', 'Job Description', '', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Lead and encourage the Enterprise Application Team to engage with the business and identify new functionality, develop compelling business cases, prioritize projects, and develop plans that maximize return on investment for the company
Implementation and ongoing support and maintenance of enterprise applications including integrations; current state holds 40+ systems primarily SAAS based with custom integrations
Manage a multi-year roadmap in alignment with IT cost models that delivers tangible/bottom line business value.
Publish executive level dashboards for status and progress reporting
Member of the Senior Leadership Team of the company and expected to collaborate professionally with your peers to develop common vision and buy-in
Your team may consist of business analysts, software developers, data warehouse developers, reporting specialists, and other necessary support personnel required to accomplish your goals
Engage with business leaders across all functions to influence and create the right security solutions to lower risk while focusing on minimal impact to business operations
Effectively coordinate and lead high priority projects to completion which meet/exceed timelines and objectives
Seek out, validate, and bring to the technology organization innovative standard methodologies and ideas from the outside, with an emphasis on application development methodologies', '', 'Basic Qualifications', 'A minimum of 10 years in managing enterprise applications, project management, process development and resource management. 8+ years of technical execution experience in both enterprise business systems for a remote work at home workforce in a globally distributed company. should know ATS, HCM, ERP and CRM areas well and how to meet security and compliance demands as well
Requires a minimum of 5 years of related or equivalent experience in sales or recruiting role, preferably with publishing, technical recruiting, or similar; or 3+ years with an advanced degree
Subscription billing, pricing and software bundling, Contracts and related lifecycle management
Has optimally led the development and delivery of multiple complex business technology solutions into production that have achieved or surpassed business goals
Deep knowledge of system architecture, technical design, and system and software development technology
Superb communication skills with multi-functional teams, and able to handle various tasks and priorities', '']

['Company Overview', 'ConcertAI’s mission is to accelerate insights, advance research, and improve patient outcomes in oncology and across life sciences. ConcertAI’s leading real-world evidence, AI technology and software-as-a-service solutions support healthcare decision-making across clinical research & development through commercialization. Top biopharma sponsors, clinical research organizations, healthcare providers and institutions rely on ConcertAI’s evidence-generation and digital transformation capabilities to advance precision medicine and medical innovation.', '', 'Role Summary', 'The VP/SVP, Head of Sales will lead and manage a direct sales team working with executive leaders and project sponsors within top pharma/Life Science companies to market and drive ConcertAI solution sales.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Develop, refine and execute detailed strategic account plans to achieve bookings, upsell and renewals
Drives booking tactical plans daily, acting as a player coach as required
Facilitate sales enablement sessions with Product experts training Sales executives
Work closely with Sales Operations and Finance to keep tab on progress against goals
Provide weekly reporting of pipeline and forecast updates and management calls
Provide a quarterly forecast on an assigned cadence basis
Oversees reports of performance and clear sales analytics e.g. W/L to ConcertAI senior leadership
Effectively lead a sales team to sell ConcertAI solutions, inclusive of funnel and pipeline development, strategy and tactics development
Lead a sales team of 6-8 Strategic Account Executives to exceed assigned key sales metrics, including bookings, pipeline growth and customer retention
Practice clear, transparent, and effective communications with team members, management, customers, and supporting team members
Effectively communicate the value proposition of ConcertAI products as well as their market differentiators
Ensure the sale team is representing and communicating the vision for our company, through formal presentations and informal customer discussions
Remain abreast of market trends, competition, competitive issues, products and customer needs', '', 'Requirements']

column6: ['401(k)', 'Health insurance', 'Opportunities for advancement', 'Paid time off', 'Referral program', 'Stock options']
column7:
["Canary Technologies is a fast-growing enterprise hospitality technology company that provides hotels with innovative solutions to drive efficiency and enhance the guest experience. Our core solutions get rid of antiquated technology in hotels. With backing from some of the top investors in Silicon Valley, including Y Combinator, Canary Technologies is trusted by thousands worldwide and serves some of the world’s largest and most iconic hotel brands.

This opportunity will provide close interaction with senior leaders and founders. Our founders are alums of the Cornell Hotel School, Columbia University, and The University of Pennsylvania- Wharton. They have previously built software companies and have worked at firms such as Bain & Company and Starwood Hotels & Resorts.

We are an organization that strongly believes in meritocracy and performance. There is significant opportunity for advancement and growth in this role, both of which are based on performance and talent.

About You

You are passionate about both growth and community marketing - and are excited to work in the travel & hospitality industry. You're detail-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You have demonstrated success in running marketing campaigns from start to finish, creating community engagement, coordinating with stakeholders, and driving results.

About the Role

This role is an integral part of our Marketing team. The ideal candidate can both drive strategy and execute - and is passionate about growth marketing and customer relationships. You will need to be an independent contributor who can work well cross-functionally (Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Product, etc.) and globally.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining our brand's community, both online and offline. The job requires engaging audiences on a variety of outlets including email, online forums, social media platforms, in-person groups and events, and more to reach all audiences where they are. We are looking for an agile, autonomous team player who enjoys rolling up their sleeves.", "Responsibilities
Collaborate cross-functionally with sales, marketing, customer success, and product to drive revenue growth
Own and build customer cross-sell campaigns, identifying potential areas for cross-sell opportunities
Refine the customer referral program, which includes both nurture programs and coordinated referral campaigns
Build strategies for a customer reference tracking system Create and execute our community strategy to grow our reach and engagement
Jump-start educational and community initiatives and create a place where customer marketing practitioners and industry leaders refine their craft and augment their careers
Develop a Canary Certification program in coordination with the Customer Success and Support team
Develop client-proof points and advocacy assets, strengthen relationships with existing clients, and build brand awareness
Provide monthly metrics and insights to track impact & growth
Develop strategies to share content on community-focused sites and platforms Planning and implement social media campaigns that align with an organization's marketing strategies
Sharing images, status updates, and video content on the company's social media accounts
Monitoring for any mention of the brand online and working with the Customer Success team to ensure engagement with customers in a timely manner
Working closely with the marketing and PR teams to ensure brand consistency
Building relationships with customers, potential customers, and industry professionals", 'Qualifications
2 years of Marketing experience in a B2B environment
Must be able to generate and interpret key metrics in order to get insight into the Canary brand community
Able to interpret qualitative as well as quantitative data from projects
Must be able to write well in order to communicate clearly with customers and other members of their audience in blog posts, emails, and social media', 'Pluses
Working in a SaaS environment', 'Benefits
Health Care Plan
401k Plan
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Canary vacation days. Includes at least 1 3-day weekend every month + the last week of December off
Stock Option Plan', "Canary Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis

Most importantly, we work hard to ensure Canary is a fun and exciting place to work. How do we do this?

First, we've added Canary Days to the calendar as company holidays to ensure that the team has 1 long weekend each month.

Second, we have a list clubs and perks listed below that create space for us to hang out!

Self Improvement Club: We meet each month and share our personal goals for the month. We are able to expense $75 towards any purchases that helped us achieve these goals.

Fireside Chat: We meet each month to discuss a wide range of issues. This group was started focused on women's issues and has expanded in scope over the last several months.

Donuts! : Each week a Slackbot called ‘Donut’ pairs us up with a random teammate.

$50 to stay at any hotel that uses Canary Check-inBook a trip at one of the hotels that has Canary Checkin, stay there, leave a review on TripAdvisor/Google and get a $50 reimbursement!

$500 travel reimbursement: We get up to $500 if we want to make a trip to SF or NY for personal reasons. We will spend at least 3 days of that trip working at a wework with fellow Canaryites!"]

column1: Senior Demand Generation Manager (Open to Remote)
column6: ['401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Gym membership', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['Daxko powers health & wellness throughout the world. Every day our team members focus their passion and expertise in helping health & wellness facilities operate efficiently and engage their members.', 'Whether a neighborhood yoga studio, a national franchise with locations in every city, a YMCA or JCC-and every type of organization in between-we build solutions that make every aspect of running and being a member of a health and wellness organization easier and delightful.', 'Daxko has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Demand Generation Manager to join our marketing team. In this remote role, you will work with a talented team to develop and execute integrated campaigns that drive awareness, engagement, and qualified leads that convert into marketing sourced and influenced pipeline and revenue.', 'You will take ownership of marketing programs and work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders, such as Product Marketing, Business Development, Sales, and Marketing Operations, to drive measurable results.', 'We’re looking for a marketer with a keen understanding of B2B buyers/buying groups and nuances of distinct personas. You will have a deep knowledge of how to engage prospects and bring them through the buying process via multi-channel marketing campaigns. You’re the ideal candidate if you are passionate about using technology and data to identify, segment, educate, and convert buyers and influencers. You are focused, creative, and numbers-oriented, with a fun-loving attitude and a desire to drive change.', '', "Track record of success developing and executing integrated B2B marketing campaigns, including goal setting, budget management, and results measurement.
Experience in building inbound funnels and account-based marketing (ABM) programs.
Expertise across inbound marketing channels including organic SEO and website CRO, email marketing, content marketing, webinars, events, PPC, paid and organic social, etc.
Agile, passionate, focused, driven, creative, fun-loving, with a desire to drive change.
Data-driven. Proven ability to build A/B test strategy, drive reporting frameworks and assess and analyze performance to drive optimization.
Must have outstanding customer focus for both internal and external stakeholders.
BS in Marketing, business, or related technology area.
4+ years' experience in B2B technology/ SaaS.", 'Essential Duties/Responsibilities:', 'Develop and execute multi-channel campaigns aligned to targeted audiences and sales objectives to support pipeline and revenue goals.
Build marketing plans that span across affiliate networks, paid acquisition, paid search, email, mobile, and onsite, among other traditional channels.
Work collaboratively with designers and copywriters, providing feedback and insights that help the team deliver on the campaign strategy.
Manage the tactical implementation of marketing campaigns across functional teams, regularly report on campaign performance and provide recommendations for improvement.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to translate campaign strategy into marketing briefs, competitive analyses, and campaign recaps that allow us to learn and optimize.
Be viewed as a complete business partner by Sales and as someone who drives consistent achievement and measurable outcomes that positively impact the bookings number.
Manage the strategy for paid media in collaboration with the paid team.
Collaborate with fellow Demand Generation Managers to integrate new campaigns into our email nurture strategy.
Partner closely with Business Development and Marketing Ops on the lead handoff and follow-up, including driving outreach cadence plans, monitoring lead follow-up.
Develop efficient workflow and processes within the team and socialize across the larger organization.
Build a reporting plan for all A/B test and campaigns, drive optimizations, improve performance to key KPIs.', '']

column6: ['401(k)', 'Dental insurance', 'Disability insurance', 'Employee stock purchase plan', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off']
column7:
['TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.', "Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At TriNet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.", 'JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW

TriNet is a leading provider of human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). Our HR solutions simplify managing human resources so businesses can focus on core activities and growth. We provide full-service HR solutions that include payroll, benefits and compliance all delivered through a unified technology platform and service team.
The Sr. Product Marketing Manager plays a central role throughout the product lifecycle, conception through commercialization, for an exciting and industry leading portfolio of HR products and solutions. As a Sr. Product Manager, you will manage the product marketing for several of TriNet’s most strategic and revenue producing products. The role requires a deep understanding of the customer and product, and an ability to translate this insight into go-to-market strategies, compelling messaging, and impactful launches. You will advise and provide valuable input to leadership across marketing, sales and product management.
If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.', 'ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop positioning, messaging, and value proposition that differentiates TriNet and is resonate with key personas
End-to-end planning and launch of products and releases; cross-functional implementation of the product marketing plan
Design and develop go-to-market plans
Develop market research including segmentation, personas, buyer journeys, buyer preferences and competitive intelligence
Provide insight to PR and Corporate Marketing teams for program and campaign development
Create product materials (sales decks, videos, web pages, datasheets, etc.)
Support our sales channels; train them on the problems we solve for our buyers and users; develop internal tools and external collateral and teach them how and when to use it
Study sales and customer response data as it becomes available and adjust plans and/or design new approaches
Develop content and thought leadership (blogs, white papers, presentations, etc.) that integrate with marketing programs
Manage work of others including delegation, instruction and feedback
Oversee suppliers including due diligence, selection and management of execution', 'JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Education:
Bachelor’s degree; MBA preferred

Training Requirements (licenses, programs, or certificates):
none

Experience:
5+ years of related marketing and/or product management experience
3+ years product marketing experience
Experience with cloud-based solutions (SaaS) is a plus

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Excellent verbal, written, visual/presentation skills
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills
Compelling storyteller
Project management
Facilitate productive meetings
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and take initiative
A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace', 'WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION ( Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)

Minimal travel required
Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.', 'This position may be performed remotely anywhere within the United States', 'As an applicant seeking to work in the state of California, city of Cincinnati, Ohio, state of Connecticut, state of Maryland, or state of Rhode Island you are entitled to information about the salary range for this role. Please contact recruiting@trinet.com for further information.', 'COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: For applicants in the state of Colorado, city of Jersey City, or city of New York the salary range for this role is $105,000 to $236,400. A candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, and experience.', 'A candidate’s compensation may also include bonuses consistent with TriNet’s corporate bonus plan.']

["Mendix – the leading low-code application development platform:
The Mendix Platform uses visual modeling to abstract long-form coding out of application development. Our customers use Mendix to create and deploy better software for the enterprise, faster. Mendix is collaborative - the people who use the software and the people who build the software work together throughout the development process.

Read our Customer Stories to learn more about the wealth of software and solutions global organizations have built with the Platform.

At Mendix we strive to maintain a diverse, open, and safe working environment where people can be their true selves. We value every voice, celebrate individuality, and appreciate the diversity of thought and experience. People who work here are driven, smart, and really good at what they do.

As this market evolves, we encourage people of all skill levels to work with the platform, both for clients and candidates. Apply today to discover how you can make a meaningful impact with Mendix.

Job Description:
We're investing to accelerate our momentum and we're looking to grow our global team. If you constantly strive for excellence, are passionate about innovation, and want to work with a collaborative, energetic team - then Mendix is for you. We are looking for a creative, innovative, and inspiring personality with a passion for customer success and expansion. As a (Senior) Customer Success Manager, you will join our rapidly growing company and become an integral part of an exceptional team who is transforming the way companies focus their digital transformation effort.", 'Responsibilities:
Building and sustaining customer relationships while driving the adoption and expansion of the Mendix platform in order to exceed our revenue goals. The Customer Success Manager will work closely with Account Executives to establish and build long-term business relationships within designated accounts and execute on-account plans jointly made.
Leading the post-sales effort in building Enterprise Success Programs through which you will deliver consistent value to your customers.
Becoming a Mendix platform-adoption expert so that you can intelligently discuss and teach the value and purpose of each part of the Mendix platform as well as the adoption roadmap.
Applying your domain expertise with customers in best-practice discussions that can either be specific to the use of Mendix or more general regarding enterprise success.
Your focus will be on customer intimacy as you deliver business impact and innovation to customers by truly understanding their key business drivers.
The Customer Success Manager is a high-impact and very visible role responsible for ensuring the pervasive enterprise adoption of the Mendix platform and for closing enterprise contracts within an', 'Requirements:
Demonstrable experience in executive-level account management. Starting with pre-sales through the full lifecycle within a high-growth technology environment
8-10 plus years of consulting and/or SaaS based technical account management experience
Experience as the customer facing leader responsible for the management of successful Professional Services operations for a fast-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) business or related technology. (Cloud Industry and IT Systems Management knowledge is strongly preferred.)
Hands on software development or IT experience strongly preferred
Accountability for driving additional revenue through customer expansion
An understanding of technology and an ability to distinctly explain technological and business concepts
Proven effectiveness in complex digital transformation projects
A strong digital transformational vision
Exceptional executive-level communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
Strong experience with customer onboarding and customer success', '#LI-AB1

If you see a job description and think, “I’d be perfect for that” but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with the qualifications – don’t let that hold you back. We’re always eager to hire talented, passionate candidates – so give it a try and apply.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Mendix/Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.

EEO is the Law
Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision
Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

California Privacy Notice
California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.']

['Grow your career with a growing organization', '', 'Whether they’re helping people reach their long-term financial goals or providing personal wealth management strategies, every associate contributes to changing the lives of those we serve for the better. When it comes to job satisfaction, that’s hard to beat. And from a personal satisfaction perspective, you’ll enjoy the freedom to support causes that matter to you and experience a truly inclusive work environment. Your future starts now.', '', 'JOB SUMMARY:', 'Provide and develop solutions for complex business process design powered by APIs in direct support of Empower Retirement’s Data and API strategies. Deliver high quality, efficient and performant APIs taking advantage of standard patterns for consumption by variety of systems in support of internal processes and external partners. In this rapid paced environment, the person must possess a "can-do" attitude while demonstrating a strong work ethic. This person should have a strong aptitude to help drive decisions and implement solutions using company selected technology stack engineered on top of open-source and SaaS software deployed on AWS.', '', 'The ideal candidate will leverage her/his technical skills with the development organization to be able to prove technical concepts quickly using a variety of tools, methods, & frameworks.', 'What you will bring:', '3-6 years developing solutions architected across multiple architecture domains (application, data, integration, infrastructure and security) involving multiple of the following technologies and architecture styles: APIs, integration/middleware, mobile, web technologies, and service-oriented architecture
Solid 3-6 year experience with one or more of the following technologies: Java (Spring, SpringBoot), Web Services (JSON/XML), RESTful architectures, AWS API Gateway, Lambda, NodeJS, Python
Good understanding of front-end and web frameworks such as React and Angular and how they integrate with APIs and backend services
Experienced in modern deployment models using Jenkins and CI/CD pipelines
Proficient with source code version control such as GitHub/GitLab/BitBucket
Strong SQL knowledge, RDBMS experience on any recognized database (Postgres, Redshift, Aurora, MySQL, Oracle …etc.) and exposure to data warehouse principles
1+ year experience on the AWS platform and services and other cloud products
Knowledge of modern Software Development Life-Cycle (SDLC) and the agile methodology
Excellent verbal skills and ability to influence and build relationships at all levels of the organization (capable of communicating clearly and effectively to with technology team members and internal business partners)
Detail oriented, self-starter with strong organizational skills to multitask and ability to work independently or as part of a team
Able to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines while remaining professional and courteous
Able to keep knowledge up-to-date in the appropriate technical and business related areas
Collaborates with colleagues regarding development best practices and/or application issues
Advises and works on strategic initiatives to mitigate and/or alleviate core data application issues, including opportunities for process automation
Operates independently with some latitude for un-reviewed actions or decisions. Completes other duties as assigned.
Demonstrated competency applying architecture frameworks and development methods']

['Summary', 'We are seeking a Senior Manager of Product Marketing who will be responsible for executing successful go-to-market strategies that result in our products and services “fly off the shelf.” You will be the product evangelist and will play an integral role in organizing product launches. You know our competitors: what they do today and what they plan to do in the future. You also know our buyers, including how they make their buying decisions. You back up strategic insights with market evidence and then use that knowledge to drive the development of positioning and messaging that resonates with buyers and empowers our sales channels to be successful. You will collaborate with your marketing colleagues and the sales team to develop innovative programs that drive demand. An attention to detail and eye for quality are critical to your success, along with an ability to grasp and present our product’s value proposition in a way that resonates and clearly articulates how we solve our buyers’ problems.', 'Responsibilities', "Craft clear, compelling, and differentiated product messaging, positioning, and proof points based on a deep understanding of the customer and our marketplace
Develop a deep understanding of our target market, including buyer personas, key use cases, and customer needs. Serve as the subject matter expert (SME) on the company's value propositions, core capabilities and market landscape
Design and own the sales enablement strategy to include product education, competitive intelligence, and the creation of high-value sales tools (first call decks, battlecards, solution guides, etc).
Own the go-to-market product process and strategy, and align product initiatives across the customer lifecycle
Partner closely with leadership across product, design, sales, and marketing to drive and influence product pricing, product roadmap development, and the customer experience
Synthesize market, product, and customer insights to influence the roadmap and ensure a consistent, compelling customer experience
Work closely with the Demand Generation team on marketing campaigns to drive and accelerate pipeline
Define, track and report on success metrics and demonstrate the impact Product Marketing has on business goals
Lead and develop a small team of full-stack product marketer", 'Requirements', '4+ years’ experience in product marketing in the B2B SaaS space
Cross-functional product marketing leadership with a track record of delivering on high-impact goals-marketplace experience is a bonus!
Previous experience bringing Saas B2B products pricing, packaging, messaging and positioning to market
Experience leading and growing a team of high-performing product marketers
Strategic mindset and ability to frame problems and develop ambitious solutions, while balancing the demands of executing at speed and scale
Strong eye for business, as well as strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to draw conclusions based on data
Self-starter with the ability to succeed in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Stand out verbal and written communication skills
Ability to operate independently to build out new programs and initiatives
Thorough understanding of the sales process and how best to support sales teams and equip them for success
Previous start-up experience is a huge plus
Previous pre-sales experience is a plus', 'Additional information', 'All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Qualified applicants will be asked to complete a 30-minute online assessment as a part of your application.']

column1: AVP, North America Secure Access Sales
column7:
['Absolute Software is currently looking for a result driven, self-motivated Area Vice President, North America Secure Access (‘AVP’). This is a second-level management resource in place to execute the company sales plan and help drive success across Canada and the US. The AVP manages 2 Regional Directors, and their teams, which comprise of Enterprise and Corporate Account Executives, along with Inside Sales representatives.', 'All of our Regional Directors/Area Vice Presidents report to the Vice President, North America Sales. Based out of your home office, the AVP serves two key functions; first as a leader for our North American Secure Access Regional Directors generate new annual recuring revenue (ARR) within Named Accounts in the US and second, as a management partner for the OEM and VAR teams.', 'Accountabilities Will Include:', 'Drive New ARR business – The AVP works with their peers to implement and execute the company sales plan, and is responsible for leveraging sales assets to drive and grow net/new sales.
Management partner – The AVP will work to understand each region’s business strategies and supporting activities required from each of their direct reports. The AVP drives those activities in their territory and manages issues as they relate to lack of execution and sales productivity.
Drive customer satisfaction – The AVP gains a deep understanding of our large prospects’ requirements and need of our products, while managing a team of six sales account executes helping them to work with their available resources to deliver high levels of customer engagement ultimately resulting in a sale.
Interdepartmental Leadership - The AVP will play a leadership role, representing the Secure Access business across our Product, Marketing, Channel and Finance teams. Acting as an advocate and escalation path for any Secure Access issues.
Share communications between Account Executives (AE) and across regions – The AVP will manage a weekly meeting in which AEs can share experiences, get updates from other departments, discuss issues gleaned from peers and identify selling issues and concerns so the AVP can potentially spot trends across the business and escalate. The AVP leads meetings and is committed to keeping those meetings relevant and on point.
Share communications across departments - the AVP will have a quarterly business review with the head of sales. This will help bridge communication gaps between Sales and other company departments. At a minimum, the AVP will present the QTD sales data, and with it, the AVP will present a snapshot of our sales by region, by product, etc. The AVP may also use the Sales forecast to provide insight into short-term and long-term future business. Considering there may be other relevant topics that surface, the AVP can dynamically work them into the agenda as required.
Champion for our systems - The AVP will take responsibility for driving usage of our CRM tool Salesforce.com across their teams and other KPIs as identified.', 'What You’ll Need:', 'A College/University Degree
A proven track record of 5 to 7 years of successful sales management, managing a field sales team. In addition, a minimum of 5 years of working with Fortune 1000 Enterprises.
Experience in the technology, security or SaaS industry, preferably in software or services
The ability to negotiate long-term license agreements directly with customers or through our partners
Experience using Microsoft Office & Salesforce.com
Highly organized with a burning desire to win.
A high degree of intelligence.
A strong drive for results.
An ability to communicate with people at all levels inside organizations.
The ability to see the big picture, and the ability to achieve goals through others.
Force Management – Command of the Message would be a plus', 'The AVP should have a proven understanding of:', 'Large opportunity sales,
Driving peak performance,
Coaching for success,
Performance review processes, and
Interfacing with management-level and senior staff members.', 'Why Work For Us:', 'You’re resilient and passionate about securing the Work from Anywhere era.
So are we.']

['About Us', "At Hiya we are on a mission to modernize voice with trust, identity, and intelligence. We're protecting everyday people from spam and fraud calls, connecting businesses with their customers, and helping carriers secure their networks for all. In 2015, Hiya founder, Alex Algard, saw the increasing need for innovation in the voice channel and began building the first caller ID and spam blocking apps for mobile while at Whitepages. In early 2016, Hiya spun out of Whitepages and brought its technology to market through Samsung Smart Call, the first-ever network-based spam solution with AT&T, and the Hiya consumer app. Three years later in 2019, we brought Hiya connect to market, a B2B branded call service that enables enterprise companies to connect to the consumers they are trying to reach. The combination of Protect, Connect, and the Hiya app has resulted in the world's largest Voice Performance Platform with over 200M monthly active users.", 'About the Position', 'We are seeking a Sr. Product Marketing Manager to join our Product Marketing Team and accelerate our growth. This person will lead our regional go-to-market efforts for Hiya Protect, heading up sales enablement and partnerships.', 'This means keeping an active pulse on market dynamics (i.e. market news, key carriers, relationships with technology partners and local legislation, customs, competitors in key markets) and being able to provide an understanding of implications as well as strategy suggestions.', "What You'll Do", 'Present internally and externally to partners and customers as an expert on our products & services.
Manage and track a growling pipeline of ongoing conversations with carriers in our target markets.
Own and lead the launch of new carriers and technology partner relationships.
Bring to life the value of Hiya by working with customers to create compelling carrier launch stories and ongoing proof points.
Partner with Carrier Marketing to create regional & ABM marketing programs.
Create & maintain sales playbooks that enable business development teams to sell to carriers in our target markets.
Bring the voice of the customer and market insights to Product Management and into the product planning process.', "What You'll Need to Succeed / Qualities that will make you successful: (choose one)", "You are comfortable creating clarity where it does not currently exist
You are both analytical and creative at solving complex problems
You follow-through on initiatives
You don't sacrifice good for great
You are collaborative, inclusive and decisive
You can wear multiple hats to get the job done
You are undaunted by a startup environment (high ambiguity, high urgency, fast-paced, low support structure), and eager to be part of building something new and important", "The person in this role must embody Hiya's key values of: Serving our customers, Doing rather than observing, Improving ourselves and our business, Owning and holding ourselves accountable for success and Leading by showing up with a POV, engaging in discussion, listening respectfully to others opinions and committing to decisions."]

['Who We Are:', 'At Calm, we have a simple, albeit BIG mission: to make the world a happier and healthier place. Through our website, blog, and app—filled with meditations, sleep stories, music, movement, and more—we’re redefining what mental care looks like in 2023 and beyond. With over 100 million users worldwide, 100,000 new users daily, and our growing partnerships with major companies, we’re having a positive effect on more and more people each and every day. And while the heart of Calm is digital, we are growing and expanding offline with a variety of products and services to help deliver on our mission of health and happiness, the world over.', 'What We Do:', 'Calm is the world’s #1 brand for mental fitness and our Calm Business team is furthering our mission to make the world happier and healthier by bringing our offering into the employee benefits space. Calm Business is helping companies build a more resilient organization by promoting better sleep, reducing stress and anxiety, and developing consistent mindfulness practices. We offer accessible and effective content to meet the needs of any diverse workforce. With our proven launch strategy and marketing resources, plus ongoing engagement programs and account support, we take the stress out of employee benefits.', 'What You’ll Do:', 'As Calm continues to grow its footprint with employers, we are looking for a strategic, experienced marketer who is skilled at bringing B2B/B2C products and features to market. You will work with cross-functional teammates (product, engineering, sales, marketing, customer success, data science, revenue operations) to gather customer insights, set brand/product positioning, create go-to-market (GTM) plans, alongside field enablement, and drive Calm Business as the leader in the mental health space when it comes to corporate wellness solutions. You will own the marketing plan from concept to execution and be looked to as a core leader of a multi-stakeholder GTM team.', 'Understand our business deeply, inclusive of buyer persona journeys, the products/solutions that customers are looking for, and how we can continuously refine the value proposition that Calm Business brings to the workplace
Lead cross-functional teams through our GTM strategy to launch best-in-class products that delight employers and internal workflows that accelerate growth with prospects
Develop clear messaging and resulting marketing tactics (e.g. pitch decks, 1-pagers, website content and copy) that allow us to effectively acquire new customers and motivate buyers to consider increases in contract value
Conduct competitor research and continually stay up-to-date with market trends to inform positioning and white space opportunities
Act as a thought partner to Product as a “voice of the customer,” allowing us to prioritize meaningful product roadmap development to build the future of Calm Business
Partner with our Calm Consumer product/content/marketing teams to pull-through meaningful user-level enhancements into our Calm Business narrative and campaigns', 'Who You Are:', 'Track record for successfully developing customer strategy, copywriting promotional messages/providing design direction on marketing tactics, and executing go-to-market campaigns with field teams
Able to excel in a fast-paced environment with strong organizational and project management skills to manage multiple projects within tight deadlines
Technically proficient and fluent in navigating business processes to interface and collaborate with all levels and disciplines within the Calm Business organization
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, visual) to collaborate and influence a large universe of internal partners/stakeholders
Creative and innovative - you are interested in bringing new ideas to life that will truly impact our employers and their employees when it comes to mental health
Experience driving new business or tailoring campaigns to meet the needs of unique customer segments
Detail oriented, data-driven, and not afraid to pilot new ideas with set goals/KPIs
5+ years of B2B or B2C SaaS product marketing experience, preferably at a high-velocity growth company
Proficient in developing enablement of larger sales teams (over 50+ individuals)', 'Nice-to-Haves:']

['Asset Tracking
Track the location of high-value assets indoors & outdoors.', '', 'Remote Monitoring
Monitor the status of high-value assets for efficiency & compliance.', '', 'Service Tracking
Enhance your service delivery and exceed customer expectations.', '', 'Workflow Automation
Optimize & automate your workflows to streamline operations.', 'Job Description', "Our mission is to build a flexible and powerful IoT software stack that lets companies bring IoT solutions to market quickly & provides robust customization as they grow their business. We accelerate time to value and lower the total cost of ownership without sacrificing the inherent flexibility required for different use cases and verticals. Companies like Google, Yamaha, and Cox Communications leverage our stack to power their commercially available IoT solutions and platforms.
‍
As a Sales & Marketing Manager at Leverege, you'll be an essential part of helping Leverege to grow and market our different product offerings. This is a unique, hybrid, customer-facing role with elements of product marketing, IoT product enablement, and consultative sales. We’re looking for a builder—someone who’s proactive in addressing gaps early and ensuring we're learning as a company. You’ll help us write the playbook and redefine success for marketing & sales teams.
‍
‍Responsibilities
Lead assessment calls with prospective customers to identify their IoT goals
Act as the bridge between our prospective customers and our product team, helping to provide market & feature insights
Schedule and present effective sales presentations & product demonstrations
Continuously improve client and sales outreach strategies with other departments in the organization to optimize the business development process
Understand the competitive landscape and customer needs
Manage, track, and report on all sales & marketing activities and results
Become a Leverage product expert with the ability to fully demo the product to agency prospects by qualifying and selling our value
Maintain social media and email marketing campaigns
‍
Success Profile
You are a builder with ambition who wants to grow with the company
You have experience in a customer-facing role, ideally working with enterprise clients and senior executives
You have sales/upsell/cross-sell experience, ideally at a product-product led growth or SaaS business
You enjoy consultative selling and diving headfirst into learning new technologies and how they can be applied to customer problems
You use data for storytelling as well as identifying and collaborating on priorities
You get things done and can take projects from ideas to reality
You take ownership of your work and prefer to work remotely and asynchronously. We’re a remote-first company with a bias for fewer meetings, fewer interruptions, and more time spent on deep work
‍
Bonus Points
Prior startup experience is a plus, ideally in the B2B SaaS space or IoT space
Ability to assess customer needs in real-time and provide back a vision for where IoT can take them
Consultative sales experience
‍
The Details
Remote-First Company U.S. Based Company
Employee Stock Options
Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance
Flex Vacation. At least 3 weeks of vacation per year are encouraged
‍
Note: Research says men tend to apply even if they only meet ~60% of the job qualifications, whereas women and other marginalized groups are hesitant to do so. If you don’t match 100% of the job qualifications but think you’d be a great fit, we encourage you to apply"]

The RVP of Sales role entails consulting with C-Level executives in the multi-family real estate industry and helping them understand how Leo247 can positively impact their on-site operations and bottom line.', '', '', 'We are looking for sharp, energetic, and detail-oriented people who are passionate about implementing solutions that transform the status quo. column1: Head of Product Management for Capital Manage and Cloud/SaaS
column6: ['Health insurance', 'Paid sick time', 'Paid time off', 'Parental leave']
column7:
['Company: Siemens
Job Title: Head of Product Management for Capital Manage and Cloud/SaaS
Job Reference #: 322449
Job Location: US – Remote, or Europe - Remote
Siemens Software is a global technology powerhouse. With some of the best-known brands in the world using our electrical, systems, networking and embedded tools, Siemens has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality, and reliability for more than 165 years. We are looking for dynamic leaders who can contribute on our journey to build the Integrated Electrical Systems (IES) portfolio. If you are interested in leading a talented team that works with the best companies around the globe, we’d be excited to know more about you.
Position Overview:
Siemens Software is looking for a passionate and experienced senior Product Management leader to head the Manage Domain team. This role is responsible for guaranteeing the commercial success of the Capital Manage solutions portfolio. The portfolio contains solutions for the automotive and transportation, aerospace and defense, medical devices, industrial machinery, and other industries. A key goal is to increase revenue for existing products and to create and launch new products by offering differentiated solutions that satisfy customer needs and stand above the competition. She/he will drive data-driven strategic decisions based on corporate and segment-level business objectives, market and competitor analyses, and customer feedback. The selected candidate will be an integral member of the Integrated Electrical Systems (IES) team, leading the development of E/E data management, programmatic data access, schematic view generation technology for electrical systems and integrations between model-based electrical tools developed by IES and all leading MCAD and PLM systems.
Reporting to the Head of Product Management, this position involves responsibility for driving the development of a profitable software product suite for electrical data management and integration, as well as products and services that deliver the underlying architecture as a framework to other tools in the suite. The successful applicant will develop insight of the key trends impacting the business and will use this to create product strategies and market messaging. They will interact closely with our technical development organization helping to define and deliver the product roadmap, will work closely with our marketing organization developing tactics and building collateral, and will be an evangelist for the products, enabling account teams serving key customers and incubator accounts while developing our approach to the broader market. They will be responsible for boosting the market attractiveness of the products by developing a surrounding ecosystem of integrated Siemens and 3rd party products, and by studying possible acquisitions, partnerships and services. They will actively seek out opportunities to leverage the domain’s technology platform into new areas and articulate the business case for investing. They will drive the transition of Capital to Cloud/SaaS business models by formulating and efficiently implementing effective and holistic strategy that has been developed in close collaboration with Product Management, Product Engineering and Business Leadership. This transition will leverage your Cloud/SaaS experience to open up new markets for us, and new value for our customers and further the position of Capital as a market leader in electrical and electronic systems design.
Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to the following:
This role will define and drive the investment strategy and roadmap for the portfolio’s applications and solutions. This requires active participation and leadership in the annual strategic planning process, quarterly business reviews, annual Capital release planning and execution, and other planning activities.
Collaborate with senior management and key stakeholders within the strategic product planning processes to define investment strategies and product roadmaps.
Be the go-to person for insight into SaaS/Cloud software and provide support for field teams and customers as needed
Work closely with sales and customers to achieve revenue goals, support product adoption, and understand customer requirements.
Work with product development to facilitate planning and execution of the investment strategy and to realize roadmap objectives.
Support, lead and develop a global team of technical product managers.
Conceptualize pricing and packaging models for products and solutions.
Develop go-to-market strategy and training collateral for the product and collaborate to develop the collateral necessary for product marketing and sales.
Evangelize the product and solution vision to create excitement among internal and external stakeholders and customers.
Partner with industry and sales teams to demonstrate product capabilities to customers and prospects to grow business revenue.
Maintain and apply awareness and knowledge of competitive offerings to create differentiated offerings and to increase market share.
Develop positive working relationships with all levels of management and other departments within the company.
Work collaboratively with corporate functions and other business segments.
Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience
We are seeking an individual who is a business and technical thought leader in this field and is a recognized authority in this area. Candidates preferably have 10+ years’ experience in the electrical design industry (ideally automotive or aerospace) with a focus on Data Management and inter-tool integration.
Necessary skills and experience for this position:
Bachelor’s in engineering, Computer Science or other technical discipline required.
Enthusiasm for software technology, ideally with experience specifying new software products and/or deploying IT systems.
An ability to think in business terms and to drive business initiatives.
Strong customer-facing and relationship building skills coupled with the ability to communicate in clear, business-oriented terms. Fluent spoken & written English is mandatory.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions are required.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate well with different types and size of audiences is required.
Quick learner, who adapts well to changes in a fast-paced environment and has a strong interest in learning and applying new technology to solve problems through teamwork and innovative solutions. Must be familiar with
Enterprise Agile and Scrum development practices
Must have experience working with both on-premises and SaaS software solutions
Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience
Advanced degree e.g., MBA
Expert knowledge of the use of software to manage complex electrical data.
Extensive working experience on modern Cloud/SaaS solutions and ideally also including traditional desktop products (preferably 5-10 years)
A track record of publications or presenting at conferences in this domain.
Experience dealing with data models and inter-tool integrations.
Experience working in discrete manufacturing industry a plus
The salary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and this role is eligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

#LI-PLM

At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow’s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds', '', 'Organization: Digital Industries', 'Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.', 'Experience Level: Experienced Professional', 'Full / Part time: Full-time', 'Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.

EEO is the Law
Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision
Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

California Privacy Notice
