["At Deputy we’re on a mission to change the way the world works & we are looking for fantastic people to help us do that. Our mission is to simplify shift work, with a future state vision to enable thriving workplaces in every community.

Deputy is a SaaS Workforce Management Product company. HQ'd in Sydney (AU), with offices in Melbourne, London (UK), Atlanta and San Francisco (USA). We’ve helped hundreds of thousands of people across all industries in 70+ countries save time and money managing their hourly workforce so they can focus on what they do best, and be amazing.

Currently, our employees are working in a remote hybrid world with centralized flexible office space in San Francisco.

You do not need to match every listed expectation to apply for this position. Here at Deputy, we know that diverse perspectives foster the innovation we need to be successful, and we are committed to building a team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.

The Deputy Partnerships / BD team is seeking a motivated Sr. Manager Partner Programs & Marketing that is excited about building and growing a unique partnership plan with a clear strategy.

What we are working towards on the Deputy BD / Partnerships team will be game changing for the industry. The growth here is going to provide you access to diverse opportunities that will set you apart to run your own BD orgs.

We love to have fun, laugh, support one another, and celebrate each other. We hope that you bring your whole self to work and continue to influence our team and company culture. At the end of the day, we’re not saving lives (but we are making them better).

The Sr. Manager Partner Programs & Marketing will report to the Sr. Director, Global Partnerships and will work closely with the partner team, sales, marketing, to build a scalable partner program at Deputy.

The Manager, Partner Programs & Operations will have two core Program responsibilities: referral program & Integration Partner Infrastructure. Partnerships cover ISV Product Partnerships (Payroll, POS, HRIS) and long-tail referrals (bookkeepers, accountants, HR consultants)

This is a remote role (working from home), so we are totally happy for you to be based anywhere in the USA.", 'Job Duties
Build a 0 to 1 low-touch / automated Referral program using Partnerstack in the US (think bookkeepers / accountants, HR consultants, staffing firms)
Own and maintain our newly implemented PRM (Partnerstack) including creating custom cadences, self-serve onboarding program, automate engagement with long-tail partners
A/B test and optimize content, incentives, and campaigns to drive the programs revenue growth
Measure, socialize, and update the company on progress with the Referral Program
Work closely with Strategic Partner Managers to build an outward facing program material
Operationalize internal processes to unlock Partner Manager capacity where they can focus on partner strategy / revenue outcomes
Set a foundation to scale Product Partnerships enabling long-tail integration partners to self-serve and manage lead registration, enablement, rev-share
Create repeatable, high-value partner enablement tools
Build and manage Partner Marketing roadmaps, working with regional Marketing teams to quarterback and execute on co-marketing initiatives. Measure relentlessly.', 'Qualifications
3-5+ years’ experience working with partner programs + marketing
Strong operational and organizational experience taking concepts to repeatable execution plans
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong relationship/team building and account management skills
Leadership qualities that reflect a self-motivated individual with the ability to work as part of a team
Demonstrate ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment with a dynamic range of people
Ability to think and plan strategically, and use data to make decisions
Must be a self-starter, with the ability to work well independently and collaborate effectively with a team
Must be detail-oriented and understand how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders in a complex environment and focus on the delivery of results', 'Bonus Points for:
Experience with Workforce Management, HR Tech.
Experience with top-tier consulting firms and or operations in a marketplace technology company in an operations capacity (ie Uber, DoorDash)
Have ever started your own company, regardless of whether it was a “success” or “failure” (who gets to decide that anyway).', 'The pay range for this position takes into account multiple factors that are all considered to determine the compensation offer that someone will receive for the position. These factors include, but are not limited to, experience level, technical and non technical skills, education, certifications, and other business acumen. The following range is an estimate to include multiple geographies and so does not reflect any applicable adjustments that would be made for the location of where an individual is based. At Deputy, compensation decisions vary from case to case. This range does not include any potential incentive programs, such as individual or organizational performance bonuses. The reasonable pay range for this position is $139,000 - $160,000.

PERKS

Employee Stock Ownership
Competitive Compensation Packages
Annual Development Budget
Fully Paid Health benefits (for individuals)
Company outings
Commuter Reimbursement Program
Flexible Work Schedule

WHY JOIN DEPUTY?

Deputy bring in $81M series B
No. 5 on Forbes Cloud 100 for 2018: Rising stars
Why IVP invested in Deputy
Check out why our customers love us GetApp and G2Crowd.

Deputy believes in equal opportunity and that inclusiveness and diversity promotes innovation. Our global team members are from a variety of cultures. And we welcome different perspective and skills.

Interested? Apply now']

["ResMed has always applied the best of technology to improve people's lives. Now our SaaS technology is fueling a new era in the healthcare industry, with dynamic systems that change the way people receive care in settings outside of the hospital–and tools that work every day to help people stay well, longer. We have one of the largest actionable datasets in the industry, creating a complete view of people as they move between care settings. This is how we empower providers–with vital insight to deliver the care people need, right when they need it.", '', "We're also ensuring that our health solutions connect to other companies' networks. Because when objectives align, everyone wins. And as we work today to drive better care and lower costs, we're developing more personalized solutions for tomorrow, utilizing machine learning, intelligent care paths, and predictive protocols. If you are an innovator who wants to make an impact we want to talk to you! We have exciting opportunities supporting Brightree by ResMed and MatrixCare by ResMed!", '', 'The Vice President, Enterprise Sales is a work from home, remote based opportunity responsible for generating revenue through direct sales to enterprise organizations in the facilities out of hospital market. Target organizations include skilled nursing facilities, assisted living providers, CCRCs and diversified owner or operators in the senior care market. The VP will be required to establish and maintain high-level professional relationships with key decision-makers, implement and execute sales and marketing strategies in order to achieve sales objectives. Additional responsibilities include appropriate coordination between sales, marketing, contract administration, and operations. If you are very organized, self-directed and enjoy selling, this is a fantastic opportunity.', '', 'Let’s talk about Responsibilities', 'Identify, target, and generate a consistent revenue stream from qualified long-term care clients through effective and systematic, sales execution
Develop and implement market-specific strategic sales and marketing plan to achieve objectives for areas of responsibility
Establish and maintain relationships with key area healthcare executives and professionals in the market
Attend and coordinate state and national industry Trade Shows
Participate in professional societies and activities related to the health care industry, as appropriate
Identify both new business opportunities and new customer call points within the market served for additional revenue opportunity
Build, maintain and update Salesforce CRM, as required
Coordinate joint sales & marketing efforts as appropriate
Champion the concept, principles, and services of MatrixCare', '', 'Let’s talk about Qualifications and Experience']

As the main point of contact for our existing clients, you will work closely with our sales and product specialist teams to maximize the experience for our end users.', 'The ideal candidate for this role is a self-starter with high energy and a passion for helping others who can learn quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment. column1: Senior Product Manager - Endpoint Privilege Management
column7:
["About BeyondTrust
BeyondTrust is the worldwide leader in Privileged Access Management (PAM), empowering organizations to secure and manage their entire universe of privileges. Our integrated products and platform offer the industry's most advanced PAM solution, enabling organizations to quickly shrink their attack surface across traditional, cloud, and hybrid environments.

Job Summary
Do you want to see local admin on endpoints banished? Do you want to work on the industry’s leading least privilege endpoint management technology helping make that a reality? If you answered yes to both of those questions, this may be the role for you. The Sr. Product Manager for EPM will be primarily focused on enhancing BeyondTrust’s Endpoint Privilege Management solutions which are designed to ensure an organization can achieve a least privilege security posture by removing local admin rights but ensure end users remain productive.
As a member of the Beyond Trust product management team, the Senior Product Manager for EPM is responsible for planning and execution throughout all phases of the product lifecycle. The SR. Product Manager will have a focus on Linux endpoint privileged management and a significant role in determining the mission and strategy for the Linux EPM space, and accountability for the product roadmap to achieve that vision and mission. In this role, you will work with a variety of Linux technologies alongside critical adjacent technologies, such as on-prem and cloud native identity providers, public and private cloud platforms and containerization technologies, all of which are used to deliver our solutions to our customers.
The right candidate will have technical expertise in Linux operating systems and their use within the enterprise and the wider business landscape, both on-premise and in private/public cloud. You will also have a strong background in Windows and Mac endpoint systems as well as directory services like on-prem Active Directory and more modern directories like AzureAD. You must have experience in delivering SaaS products to market and have expertise in the typical cyber security threats which Linux environments face. You will build the product strategy for Linux EPM, though market, customer and user research, which you will be expected to help define, from which you will determine roadmap, priority, use cases, and requirements. You will oversee execution and delivery of these requirements to our customers across cross-functional stakeholders, working to remove blockers along the way. You will work closely with the engineering team to support release cycles to continuously improve BeyondTrust’s Linux EPM capabilities for its customers.
The right candidate will be expected to demonstrate strong business acumen, in the form of creating and sharing business cases and obtaining subsequent buy-in for delivery of innovative new solutions. Strong management of pipeline generation in conjunction with Product Marketing is expected, and tactical working with sales to help shepherd deals through the pipeline to complete is essential.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Take ownership and accountability for the Linux EPM product vision & mission, and creation and execution of the strategy to deliver on that vision & mission, whilst making sure to continually validate your plans both internally and with the wider market.
Conduct strategic business opportunity analysis - including epics and user stories, win/loss research, working with industry analysts, customers & market surveys, customer advisory boards, and performing on-site visits with customers and prospects - to aid in defining the product direction.
Evangelize your product in market through direct to customer channels such as webinars, conferences and user groups.
Use frameworks such as the Jobs-to-be-Done model to collect, prioritize and internally communicate product requirements, define product features, manage and communicate product roadmap and future versions
Solicit input for new platform enhancements from customer-facing internal partners: product management, R&D, sales, solution engineers, marketing, customer support, engineering.
Create and maintain a backlog of proposed platform enhancements to be utilized to analyze and select what will comprise a new platform release.
Develop financial justification analyses, utilize standard scoring criteria and obtain low-fidelity effort scoping to rank order and decide on which enhancements will be represented in a release.
Work with other Product Managers, UX Designers & Researchers, Product Marketers, Solutions Engineers, Sales Account Executives, and Software Developers to build great software.
Assist Product Marketing and Marketing in helping to properly position and launch new versions of BeyondTrust products and services
Support pre-sales engagements with complex or unique customer installation questions in a timely, efficient and professional manner, and support sales enablement activities.
Conduct post-release research to ensure the quality and market-fit of released enhancements.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field
4+ years in product management
Technical experience and, ideally, certifications for Linux software, including the common operating systems deployed for business use across server and desktop environments
Experience in the information security industry and with security software products
Strong technical acumen, with a solid understanding of infrastructure and open-source software and modern application architectures
Desirable Skills
Master’s Degree in marketing, product management, or computer science
Have a passion for design and excellent UX in your product
Team player with a “let’s do this” approach
Willingness to travel
Proficiency working within a Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), specifically with scrum/agile approaches
A Note on Covid-19
It’s paramount that you feel safe and secure throughout our hiring process and, if successful, as you onboard into the business. In response to the current Covid-19 pandemic, whilst the majority of our offices remain open, we are recommending that our employees work from home where possible. All of our interviews are taking place virtually over Microsoft Teams or Zoom and we are onboarding all-new global hires on a remote basis.
We understand that the world of work is evolving and we are a company that prides itself on our adaptability and ability to provide an inclusive and flexible environment that embraces all team members regardless of whether they are based in one of our offices or at home.
BeyondTrust is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets Employer and an equal opportunity employer, offering a competitive salary with excellent benefits. We welcome all candidate applications who meet the minimum qualifications listed above.
What truly makes BeyondTrust special are the people – people who keep the culture strong and make working here exciting, rewarding, and ultimately fun!"]

column7:
['Splunk is growing rapidly worldwide — we’re hiring self-starters who want to help top companies take on huge challenges by Turning Data into Doing. At Splunk, your skills won’t go stale. Work with people you like while building, selling, and supporting products people love.', 'As a Sales Engineer for Splunk’s Observability, or “O11y” for short, you will be part of a world-class pre-sales team. You provide technical expertise and thought leadership on application-focused solutions to the sales organization and to Splunk’s prospects and customers.', 'A Day in the Life of a Splunk O11y Sales Engineer:', 'You focus on customers while acting as the authority across your O11y solutions including the Observability, Splunk On-Call, and other Splunk technology products. You will consistently be delivering product demonstrations that directly address customer pain and emphasize our outstanding value proposition.', 'You enjoy the opportunity to work directly with your Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to share your knowledge and experiences to ultimately improve our business and our customers’ success.', 'You succeed at working with all levels of an organization from the C-suite down to individual developers and SRE’s.', 'You love the idea of guiding prospects through trials and POCs, demonstrating Splunk’s ability to meet and exceed customer requirements, and building a positive relationship that will go beyond the initial transaction and provide value to our customers for years to come.', 'What you bring:', 'We can guide you on the technology, help you with soft skills, and educate you on processes. You bring a strong sense of self-motivation and an unbridled curiosity about what “is possible” with technology, the desire to work with an exciting team, and a positive, fun-loving demeanor.
7+ years’ experience in customer-facing roles. Sales roles are a power-up.
3+ years’ experience working in engineering/software development roles working with current programming languages including Java, Python, PHP, .NET, Ruby, Node.js, Go, etc.
Experience selling and working with pure SaaS solutions in multi-tenant architectures.
Hands-on experience working with containers or microservices on the AWS, GCP, and Microsoft Azure platforms where you are certified or eager to become certified.
Familiarity with various monitoring tools like AppDynamics, Datadog, New Relic, and Grafana, is a real advantage in this role. Be prepared to discuss this.
Potential travel is approximately 25%, focused primarily in the region.', "Are you looking for a marvelous place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership, and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits including wellness programs, bonus programs, and company rest days. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as we are about our customers' success."]

['Overview:', "Wonders is seeking a Marketing Operations Manager to play a critical role in the company's growth strategy. In this role, you will be responsible for developing a strategy for a world-class marketing operations function, optimize deployment, and develop analytics to provide insights and trends for data-driven planning. You will partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, IT, and Finance to continue the evolution of the technology stack, business processes, program execution, database management, and web/digital analytics to support the company's fast growth plan.", '', '', "What you'll do:", 'Define the Marketing Operations tools and systems that enables intelligent decisions using data to accelerate acquisition / pipeline growth and improve team performance
Own the marketing operations roadmap, ensuring marketing technology is evaluated, selected, implemented and customized to meet the needs of a high-growth global marketing department
Deliver effective change management and communications for technology implementation, data policy, and process re-engineering within marketing
Drive standard cadence of operational meetings to share insights on marketing performance, maintain alignment, transparency, and accountability across a variety of key business priorities and stakeholders
Improve, monitor and maintain marketing data quality, ensuring accuracy and minimizing bad or incomplete data
Partner with core marketing and sales team to refine and improve MQL processes and metrics using data insights and feedback (e.g. lead scoring, workflow handoffs, lead sourced/influenced ratios), etc.
Collaborate with growth marketers to execute programs, testing and optimization of core programs that fuel demand generation
[Nice to have] Develop and deploy best practices for managing healthy SMS deliverability rates, while keeping team within confines of GDPR, CCPA, and any new marketing communications regulations', '', '', 'What we look for:', '5+ years experience in a Marketing Operations role, ideally at a SaaS company
Experience in SMB marketing
Extensive experience with Salesforce.com, Marketing Automation solutions, and Google Analytics (G-Suite). Deep understanding of how to optimize the infrastructure, workflows, and analytics
Strong analytics experience with analytics and data analysis (BI tools - Tableau, Looker, SQL skills) • Experience working closely with senior executives to tackle challenging business problems; Ability to credibly and compellingly present and debate recommendations with senior leadership
Demonstrated experience designing an innovative marketing technology stack
Experience owning and developing marketing dashboards, taking action based on it, and explaining takeaways (including corrective action)']

['The private capital market hosts 14 trillion dollars of investment funding massive innovation around the world; yet much of it still operates on manual processes and fragmented legacy systems.', "Anduin's mission is to be the driving transformation engine for workflow automation, data processing, and systems integrations in this industry. Our products have powered over $41 billion in investments for 22,000+ investors across hundreds of funds.", 'Anduin’s founding team was composed of leading technologists from Palantir, Addepar, and IBM. We have brought together world-class talent in engineering, product, and business development to actualize the next generation of GP-LP transactions in the private markets.', 'As a Senior Manager of Customer Success, you will be responsible for owning and growing our Customer Success team. You will manage a distributed team of 7 across the US and in Vietnam. You and your team will provide implementation and maintenance support to Anduin’s clients, provide input to the Product team, and contribute to building and deepening relationships, and implementing new programs and processes to help Anduin grow.', 'Key components of this role:', 'Manage a distributed team of 7 currently in the US and Vietnam with additional members to be added in Europe in 2023
Evolve Anduin’s Customer Success strategy and define new annual and quarterly KPIs
Scale the Customer Success function, including process improvement, hiring, training, developing and retaining a strong team of Customer Success professionals
Build strong working and strategic relationships with clients, acting as a knowledgeable and trusted advisor for Anduin’s product offerings and roadmap.
Ensure Anduin’s CS team provides customers with best-in-class service from onboarding through renewal, ensuring that customers receive maximum value from our product
Collaborate internally with Sales, Partnerships, Product, and broader cross functional groups to drive continuous product and process improvement
Act as an escalation liaison between the customer and Product/Engineering to help resolve technical issues
Communicate to Anduin leadership in a proactive and concise manner.
Traveling for in-person client and team meetings required - approx 20%
Anduin is a global company with customers in North America, Europe, Latin America, and continuous expansion into new geographical regions. Our team is located mostly in North America and Vietnam. This role will require early morning and late evening meetings.', 'Your Skills:', '4+ years of managing Customer Success at a growing company
Experience managing, developing, training and mentoring teams
Proven ability to increase efficiency through automation or templatizing of repetitive work
Skilled at using data reporting and analysis to identify and implement measurable improvements
Collaborative approach working with various internal and external stakeholders
Experience successfully driving multiple projects at once
Exceptional communication skills with a strong attention to detail
Tech-savvy and experienced with SaaS tools including workflow management, CRM, collaboration tools, and training
Bachelor’s degree in operational management or a related field', 'What we offer:', 'Competitive compensation (salary and equity)
Fully remote work environment
Unlimited time-off policy
Rich insurance package
401k plan']

['Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions power the digital strategies of companies like Google, eBay, and Adidas.', "We help our customers succeed in today's digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights, competitive benchmarks, strategic analysis, and more.", "In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven't stopped growing since!", 'We are looking for a Senior Account-Based Marketing Manager to join our marketing team. The role will be responsible for the strategy and implementation of effective Account Based Marketing programs that generate pipeline and accelerate existing opportunities exclusively for a top target account list in the US.', 'What You Will Do:', "Partner with the Strategic Sales teams to develop account specific playbooks including: Outbound prospecting, lead generation campaigns, nurturing, social media, live/online events and more.
Collaborate and partner with core marketing functions on campaign concept, custom content requirements, digital marketing support/message testing and creative development to ensure campaign effectiveness.
Report on the analytics and progression of activities as part of measuring the ROI as well as the constant optimization of the campaign effectiveness
Develop and execute strategic end-to-end multi-channel ABM campaigns to drive adoption and expand usage within named accounts
Align closely with Enterprise Sales and Account Managers, to identify, plan and execute adoption & expansion opportunities for named accounts
Identify creative ways to reach our Named Account customers, show value, and identify expansion opportunities
Map organizational decision-makers and identify key contacts within each named account
Analyze customer marketplace, company, firmographic, technographic, and intent data to inform a strategy to engage and support the customer
Develop personalized marketing campaigns to foster engagement, improve reputation, and grow the customer's total lifetime value
Provide regular updates on industry, company, and contacts to assigned sales account teams to identify potential selling opportunities
Identify and create the customized content needed for use in ABM campaigns, programs, and other initiatives, collaborating and work cross-functionally with our Strategic Account Management, Product Marketing, digital marketing, and corporate marketing team
Define measurement criteria and report on metrics on a regular basis; learn, modify and work to continuously improve the performance of the account-based programs
Own the marketing communication strategy to the named-account customer base
Drive new ABM capabilities - vendors and tools - that enable sellers to act as marketers, nurturing and reaching out to their customers in a curated, simplified way", 'This is the perfect job for someone who has:', "5+ years of proven multi-channel B2B marketing experience within software/SaaS
3+ years of experience with building and execution 1:1 or 1:few account-based marketing programs
Analytical mindset with the ability to track and report on campaign performance metrics, pipeline management, as well as revenue and ROI
Ability to work effectively with senior leaders and other key stakeholders throughout the organization
Solid project management, planning, and organizational skills with attention to detail in a fast paced environment
Quantiative skills, comfortable working with numbers, making sense of metrics and processing figures with spreadsheets
Positive attitude, customer-focused, goal-focused, self-starter, problem solver, detail-oriented, organized, ability to multi-task and effectively manage time, excellent verbal and written communication skills
Writing and presentation skills to translate detailed content into impactful go-to-market materials including web, email, and social content
Experience planning, directing, and delivering digital marketing campaigns and social media strategies
Demonstrated ability to achieve hands-on results working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, and product teams
Bachelor's degree required (graduate degree a plus)
Willingness to travel 25%+ primarily in North America", '*All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model, so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face to face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.*', "Why you'll love being a Similarwebber:"]

["About Us\nBanyan Security is an innovative Security Service Edge (SSE) start-up headquartered in San Francisco with visionary founders, top-notch VC partners, Fortune 500 flagship customers, that is disrupting the $10B VPN remote access market. Our mission is to deliver a security platform that enables a modern enterprise's workforce to securely access services in today's hybrid and multi-cloud environments.", 'About Us', "Banyan Security is an innovative Security Service Edge (SSE) start-up headquartered in San Francisco with visionary founders, top-notch VC partners, Fortune 500 flagship customers, that is disrupting the $10B VPN remote access market. Our mission is to deliver a security platform that enables a modern enterprise's workforce to securely access services in today's hybrid and multi-cloud environments.", '', '', 'About the Job', 'This is an incredible opportunity to get in early at a Pre-IPO Cyber Security company on a mission to revolutionize network access and enterprise security. As the Sr. Director of Content Marketing, you will drive awareness and sales of our award winning zero trust secure remote access products and services. This is an individual contributor role, where you will be responsible for the development and execution of our content marketing strategy and the distribution of creative content across various platforms and innovative channels to engage prospects and generate new leads.', 'This is the ideal role for a security marketing expert who is innovative, passionate about startups, familiar with SaaS-based enterprise security solutions and an expert at identifying and executing content creation and distribution strategies that result in business growth. You should be comfortable finding creative ways of building an online presence, as well as using analytics in the formulation of a content strategy. You will work cross-functionally and with the marketing department to manage the creation of impactful content for our audience of security professionals.', '', '']

['Job Information
Industry
Legal
Remote Job', 'About us
MaxVal started as an IP services company in 2004, with a keen focus on efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and continuous improvement through metrics-based processes. Our focus on these core values led to the tech-enablement of our offerings even before this buzzword became an industry standard. Over the years, MaxVal developed many internal applications to increase our quality and efficiency, and customer satisfaction. As these systems grew and became more sophisticated, we have productized them and offered them to our clients. Today, MaxVal serves over 600 clients across the full IP life cycle with the industry’s leading products and services. Our 300 plus employees represent the most IP and tech-savvy individuals in the industry." At MaxVal, we do the right things and innovate ceaselessly as a winning team to achieve customer success and employee success.

This is a remote position.
Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, Regional Sales Managers (RSMs) will be part of a dynamic team that is selling the industry’s premier IP products and services. RSM’s will be responsible for developing and driving their territory’s sales strategy, identifying and qualifying leads while consistently closing business on a monthly/quarterly basis – all in order to meet or exceed their annual sales quota. RSM’s will sell MaxVal’s complete range of products and services. Ideal candidates will can consult with customers, identify requirements, present technical information in easily understood terms, demo the solution and develop quality revenue relationships that meet/exceed customer' needs. T his is an outside sales role that will require the individual to work remotely from our headquarters, which are located in Los Gatos, CA.


Unlike many start-up opportunities, MaxVal has:
An existing market, ripe for disruption
Market momentum with multiple marquis customers
Weak competition
Strong management team and a history of profitability



Requirements
Responsibilities

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

- Consistent, on-plan quota achievement

- Skilled prospecting, deal qualification, pipeline management, deal close and transition to customer service

- Development of territory sales strategy

- Development of new revenue with little to no recurring revenue responsibility

- Fostering highest levels of prospect and customer satisfaction

- Ongoing product and market education and training

- Professional interaction with senior staff at Global 2000 companies

- Professional interaction with other MaxVal team members






Experience

- A minimum of 5+ years SaaS sales experience
Legal sales experience a must

- A proven track record of:
consistent quota attainment or over achievement
successful solution selling to global 2000 firms
complex solution selling
delivering product demonstrations
closing deals greater than $100k

- Excellent writing, presentation and demonstration skills

- BA/BS




Character

- Passionate and energetic about selling technology solutions

- Hungry, self-starting sales individual with career advancement aspirations

- Straightforward and honest with a strong team orientation

- Intelligent, flexible, and passionate about work

- Resourceful and energetic with an innate sense of urgency

- Able to present and communicate technical solutions clearly and concisely

- Understand business concepts and how tech solutions resolve customer pain or create opportunity



Benefits
Base plus commission, including healthcare benefits and 401k plan

OTE will depend upon experience level']

column7:
["Sprinklr is a leading enterprise software company for all customer-facing functions. With advanced AI, Sprinklr's unified customer experience management (Unified-CXM) platform helps companies deliver human experiences to every customer, every time, across any modern channel. Headquartered in New York City with employees around the world, Sprinklr works with more than 1,000 of the world’s most valuable enterprises — global brands like Microsoft, P&G, Samsung and more than 50% of the Fortune 100.", '', 'Learn more about our culture and how we make our employees happier through
The Sprinklr Way
.', '', 'Job Description', 'Customers are connected and empowered like never before. Customers want an immediate, personalized and consistent experience, no matter which channel they choose to engage with a brand. Sprinklr helps brands meet the demands of today’s customers by providing them with the insights they need to make every interaction matter. Sprinklr is a Customer Experience Management (CXM) platform for modern enterprises with 3000+ employees helping the world’s most valuable enterprises make their customers happier.', '', 'Sprinklr
is the world’s leading (CXM) platform. We help organizations listen to customers, learn from them, and show them love across digital channels. We’re one of the fastest-growing software companies, and we work in a fast-paced, high energy and lively environment.', 'Sprinklr connects to over 34 platforms and it is a big challenge to keep our platform current with the latest APIs, ensure our accounts are in good standing, and take advantage of new capabilities to bring additional value to our brand customers. We need someone that knows how to prioritize and bring order to a system like this.', '']

column7:
['Be part of one of the fastest growing Artificial Intelligence (AI) Software As A Service (SaaS) platform for the home services industry. We have such a great demand; we cannot keep up with the leads! This is an opportunity to come in as a Sales, Marketing & Business Development Representative and grow rapidly! Additionally, in this opportunity you can become an expert in AI lead generation software as well as the $500B a year home services industry. The base salary plus commission and Incredible benefits. On plan, you can earn $75k plus your first year!', '', 'Responsibilities', 'As our newest Sales, Marketing & Business Development Representative you will:', 'Learn the ins and outs of Predictive Sales AI’s software tools in order to consult potential clients on the most appropriate program implementations
Research, identify, and tenaciously generate weekly new opportunities via the phone and web
Work directly with our marketing department to convert leads into interested prospects
Qualify/Assess inbound sales inquiries based on your knowledge of our software tools, digital marketing services, and the potential growth of that prospect
Research prospects to identify quality leads in need of our services/software tools
Log important notes and actions within our CRM system
Properly score leads and ask probing questions, all while tracking your progress down the sales pipeline
Book consultative appointments and schedule product demos with our senior level sales executives
Conduct presentations on our lead generation software tools and accompanying client services
Stay up-to-date by utilizing and testing our Business Development Representative lead generation software tools firsthand and researching our customer’s industry
Overall, meet your set number goal of booked appointments and demos', 'Some Characteristics That Define You', 'At Predictive Sales AI, we understand that Sales, Marketing & Business Development Representative attribute their success to much more than just their knowledge base and skill set. Sales requires a certain set of character traits that sets a professional apart from their competitors. Here are just a few of those intangibles that will define you and your success on our team:', "Genuine. Here at Predictive Sales AI we believe that sales is a consultative role, so, understanding clients’ needs and showing them why you genuinely believe that what you’re offering can solve a problem they’re facing is a big part of what makes our team great.
Curious. Not only are you excited to get in front of clients, but you’re eager to learn as much as you can about them and the industries they work in as well.
Honest. At Predictive Sales AI, we know that our software products and services deliver quality and consistent results for our customers. That’s why, when we sell our products, we pride ourselves on our earnest sales techniques and our extensive knowledge to close the deal.
Team Player. You’re our star QB and the Account Executives are your trusted running back. You set them up with that perfect handoff, that ultimately results in a touchdown for Predictive Sales AI.
Bold. Sometimes getting in front of clients and being thrown questions you don’t know the answer to can be frightening. That’s why it’s not only important to study up and gain confidence in your knowledge of Predictive Sales AI 's software and services, but also to instill confidence in yourself.
Active Listener. To talk the talk is a prized skill, but so is listening. We want you to treat this position like a consultative process, one in which our customers have a problem and we have their answer. That means you must be able to sit back and listen to the issues our prospects are having in order to truly understand the products and services that will solve them.
Organized. You will be connecting with many different contacts and prospects. Keeping these conversations straight and knowing when you need to follow up are a key factor in determining your success.", 'Required Skills and Experience', 'On top of those intangible skills you bring to the table, there are many skills that can help improve the efficiencies and success of your sales process. Here are a few of those required skills and experience sets our Business Development Representatives at Predictive Sales AI possess:']

["Why You'll Love This Job", 'Travel. Enjoy creative freedom. Be part of a fun, innovative team. Make an indelible mark as you work closely with industry leaders. Help solve the next big talent challenge. If that sounds like the perfect way to spend a workweek, you should consider this remote Senior Account Executive / Senior Sales Executive position with a cutting-edge Austin-based company focused on helping our clients achieve and maintain high growth through HR, Technology and Employment Branding services!

In this Senior Sales Executive role, you will establish your place among like-minded professionals as you draw upon your knowledge to help clients work toward business solutions centering around employment brand, recruitment marketing, job advertisement, recruiting, retention, employee engagement and other, similar, services. In this remote role, you will divide your time between working from home and traveling to meet with clients who appreciate your insight. Take your place on a close-knit team that supports each other while discovering innovative ways to collaborate. Here, leaders work alongside, not above, their employees, listening to and incorporating ideas sent their way.

If you are eager to be part of a company where you are appreciated and valued, apply for this Senior Sales Executive job opening today!', 'Senior Account Executive / Senior Sales Executive job responsibilities include:
Create and establish prospect relationships in order to identify and sell services
Identify prospects and their place in the industry in order to create potential business relationships
Research and analyze sales options; consultative selling around client need and value propositions
Maintain and preserve client relationships through the initial implementation stage
Stay current with industry trends, competitors and market activities and contribute to overall product development discussions
Recommend solutions and provide long-term value proposition by calculating business case
Create and carry out company standards in order to maintain outstanding service
Sell into the C-Suite level; negotiate final scope and pricing through contract execution', "Skills & Qualifications
Senior Account Executive / Senior Sales Executive required skills & qualifications include:
Bachelor's degree, preferably in marketing or business administration
5+ years of sales experience (B2B) in a data-driven environment, using consultative, value-proposition selling techniques
2+ years experience in HR Technology/SaaS, recruiting, RPO, recruitment marketing and/or a similar industry
Proven sales success selling into high-growth, mid-market organizations and their C-Suite
Experience with full cycle sales process, including building connections, creating client relationships and networking
Strong experience with drafting and negotiating contracts
Willingness/ability to travel as necessary"]

["Withum's rapidly growing Sales & Use tax practice is currently accepting resumes for our Sales Tax Team to participate in a challenging career path. This position can be based out of any of our office locations in the Northeast.
WithumSmith+Brown, P.C., is a forward-thinking, technology-driven advisory and accounting firm, helping clients to Be in a Position of StrengthSM in today's modern business landscape. Withum empowers clients with innovative tools and solutions to address their accounting, tax and overall business management needs. Withum is a place where talent thrives. We recruit only the best and brightest people, with a genuine passion for the business.
Withum's brand is a reflection of our people, our culture and our strength. Withum has become synonymous with teamwork and client service excellence. The cornerstone of our success can truly be accredited to the dedicated professionals who work here every day, whose mission is to help our clients grow and thrive - to be in a position of strength. But our commitment goes beyond our clients as we continue to live the Withum Way, promoting personal and professional growth for all team members, clients, and surrounding communities.
How You'll Spend Your Time:
Participate in multiple sales tax projects to identify and implement process improvements and process streamlining with respect to sales/use tax
Assist with sales tax audits and coordinate with governmental agencies
Conduct tax research and taxation forms using online tax tools
Review and reconcile data reports to be uploaded into Avalara
Prepare and present webinars on different sales tax topics
The Kinds of People We Want to Talk to Have Many of the Following:
Preferred 4 or more years' experience of sales and use tax compliance, audits or related work in public or private accounting, or equivalent experience; preferably with SaaS and/or digitized/online products experience
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university with business background
Preferred licensed CPA, J.D., LL.M., or MST
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Outlook, as well as strong analytical, reporting and data querying skills
Experience with Checkpoint, BNA, Avalara and/or NetSuite preferred
Detail oriented approach to work, confidentiality, good problem-solving skills
Ability to multitask on varying tax issues for multiple clients at a very fast-paced environment
The compensation for this position will vary by location. If you reside in California, Washington State, or Washington, D.C., please see below. In addition to the base compensation, Withum offers a competitive benefits package and bonus program (for eligible roles) based on individual and firm performance. Final offer amounts are based on multiple factors such as the specific role, hiring location, as well as the individual's skills, experience and qualifications. For additional information on our benefits, visit our website at https://www.withum.com/careers/.
California/Washington State ranges are from $75,000 - $115,000
Washington, D.C. ranges are from $80,000 - $90,000
Withum will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, or because he or she is a protected veteran.
#LI-JB1
#LI-Remote"]

column7:
['About CCC', 'CCC Intelligent Solutions is a leading technology company helping to improve the insurance claims process for millions of people. Our award-winning SaaS platform connects more than 30,000 businesses, including insurance carriers, repair facilities, automakers, part suppliers, lenders, and others to streamline the process from start to finish.', 'Our advanced capabilities in AI, IoT, telematics, blockchain, data, and analytics drive continual innovation across our platform, as we work to advance the multi-trillion-dollar P&C insurance economy’s digital transformation.', 'At CCC, our mission is to keep people’s lives moving forward when it matters most. Diversity of experience and perspective are key to our pursuit so we can deliver a future of possibilities for our customers. Find out more about CCC Intelligent Solutions by visiting cccis.com.', '', 'Job Description Summary', 'Are you interested in Growth Strategy, cutting-edge Digital Innovation, with an eye towards owning your own P&L at a fast-growing technology company? If so, this might be the role for you. As part of enterprise strategy team, you will work closely with the Executive Leadership (ELT), including SVP of Corporate Strategy, Product Management, Marketing, to identify and incubate growth opportunities. Your key responsibilities will include performing strategic market analyses, developing growth concepts, building customer pitches, as well as guiding the Innovation Foundry R&D team to rapidly prototype and deploy product concepts. Work will include the full range of corporate strategy, technology innovation, product management, and alliance applications. In this role, you will gain valuable cross-functional experience and insight into CCC’s strategic initiatives. Strong performers will have the ability to take on added responsibility and will have numerous opportunities for career advancement within the company, based on areas of interest and business needs.', 'Job Duties', '', 'Conduct market scans and identify new growth opportunities
Perform competitive analysis in support of CCC’s business priorities
Create business cases for new growth opportunities, working with cross-functional teams
Incubate expansion opportunities including leading R&D team to demonstrate innovations and product concepts
Develop pitch materials for key customer meetings, including new and adjacent markets
Work with cross-functional teams including sales, product management, product development, and finance to help drive execution of business objectives
Provide analytic support for creation of business cases to pursue new investment and potential partnership/acquisition opportunities (as required)']

['We are building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make - every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there is an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation.', 'Global Head of Market Research', "Want to join a dynamic, rapidly growing SaaS company that's disrupting a multi-billion-dollar industry? Avalara is a leading provider of cloud-based tax compliance solutions. We deliver solutions for global transaction taxes, including sales and use, VAT, GST, excise, communications, lodging, and other indirect tax types, that are designed to help businesses achieve and maintain compliance. Our vision is to be the global cloud compliance platform.", 'We seek an experienced and talented market researcher who is passionate about applying market-driven and data-driven strategic and analytical thinking to drive crucial business decisions for our growing compliance platform. As Global Head of Market Research, you will strategize, plan, and execute market research initiatives. You must be comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail. This is a highly visible position that will interact with senior leaders in finance, product management, sales, marketing, and business development across the company. You must be able to quickly formulate strategies and plans backed by data and execute them across many work functions simultaneously.', 'This role reports to the V.P. of Product Marketing.', '', 'Job Responsibilities', 'Manage all stages of quantitative (e.g., surveys) and qualitative (e.g., 1:1 interviews) customer research to answer business questions, including research proposals, methodology design, data collection, data analysis, and reporting.
Synthesize data from different sources (e.g., primary and secondary research) to identify insights and form recommendations.
Communicate research findings and recommendations in clear, concise, and compelling ways to all levels of management.
Own and maintain appropriate market sizing and segmentation data (Total Addressable Market, Serviceable Available Market, Serviceable Obtainable Market, etc.) for the business.', 'Basic Qualifications', "Bachelor's Degree in relevant field (Marketing, Statistics, Business, Economics)
10+ years of experience in quantitative and qualitative market research, including direct experience leading primary research studies across various methodologies: online quantitative studies, focus groups, 1:1s, ethnographies, conjoint analyses, market sizing, and segmentation studies
Ability to lead qualitative research projects from end-to-end: skilled in writing surveys, recruiting a representative sample, and converting the raw results into actionable insights
Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data
Experience presenting metrics and progress to goal to senior leadership"]

['Account Executive (Sales)', '', '', 'CMX1 is looking for a tenured and successful SaaS professional to join our growing sales team. As we expand our go-to-market and customer footprint significantly, we need people who share our hunger and drive to open doors and inspire prospects to partner with us.', '', '', "CMX1 powers excellence in the world's most trusted brands. Our industry-leading enterprise quality management platform has helped companies more efficiently manage quality, risk, and compliance from the supply chain through operations for over a decade. We serve customers in more than 160 countries and 40 languages with plans to rapidly grow the business, taking advantage of new investments and increased operational complexity in the industries we serve. That's where you come in.", '', '', "This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team of sales professionals motivated to create company growth by understanding customer needs, building relationships, and delivering solutions that solve customer pains. Success is in your hands as you'll have the autonomy to lead all sales efforts in your assigned territory–from prospect identification through deal closure. On top of working with a great team, you'll have access to competitive compensation, generous benefits, and a healthy work/life balance. And while CMX1 is located in La Jolla, CA, we also support remote work."]

["BoostUp.ai is a fast growing series A stage company in the bay area, California that is disrupting the way B2B revenue workers do their work. BoostUp's platform combines intelligent data, workflows, collaboration and prescriptive analytics for revenue operations, sales managers, sales reps and customer success - all in one platform.", 'We are looking for a senior b2b product designer to drive the design vision and roadmap. You will work very closely with the founders, customers, product managers and mentor designers to drive the vision of platform and product design - from visual design, interaction design - to the overall product and brand design.', 'Revenue intelligence is a $14B+ market and a new and fast growing category - and a challenging design UI with complex data tables, interactive workflows that need to scale elegantly for small and large customers, display insights in natural language and integrate self serve process builder/orchestration, if then rule engines, query builders and very flexible analytics widgets and build-your-own dashboards.', 'This is a pivotal role for the company and you can have a huge impact in implementing our design system, user research process and design sprints - along with design some of the most innovative screens and flows in the b2b SaaS world today.', 'Founders and leadership at BoostUp really values product design as a driver of product success and ultimately market success.', 'Responsibilities', "Lead and design the user experience of BoostUp's platform and modules
Plan and contribute to roadmap definition for your area in collaboration with cross-functional partners
Research user and business objectives in collaboration with Researchers and Product Managers
Translate user needs and business objectives into designs that help our customers get the job done
Prototype and test the need for, or efficacy of, a solution.
Gather feedback and analyze the overall efficacy of launched solutions to identify pain points and iterate.
Collaborate with your Engineers, Product Managers, Content Designers, Researchers, and leadership team to launch the best experience to customers", '', 'Requirements', '5+ years of experience working in B2B SaaS product design
Comfortable with ambiguity and product complexity
Comfortable working on the end-to-end design process, from research to launch
Portfolio showing ability to simplify complex products with easy-to-use features and a modern, polished visual design style
Ability to make informed design decisions and articulate them simply
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional partners
Know how to balance customer, business needs, and technical feasibility']

['$70000 - $80000 / year', 'We are looking for an experienced customer marketing professional to increase brand awareness, engagement, and sentiment among Vertafore’s customer community. The Customer Marketing Manager is personable and outgoing, with a passion for serving and understanding customers. This role will work closely with other areas of Marketing, partner areas throughout Vertafore, and our external partner customer organization to develop strategies, communications channels, and programs to build customer relationships that will earn us their advocacy in return.

Our ideal candidate is a bridge builder with internal and external stakeholders, a strong and creative communicator, and a proven customer champion. This role is highly visible and cross-functional, requiring close collaboration with customer success, marketing, product management, and our customer partner organization.', 'Core Requirements and Responsibilities:', 'Essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
Work across Marketing to build a cohesive customer marketing program that drives brand awareness and engagement, from strategy to execution
Identify and nurture relationships with customer advocates and industry influencers to amplify brand awareness
Serve as primary liaison for and advance strategic alignment between Vertafore and its partner organization, NetVU
Create multi-channel content—including for social media, email, and web—that delights and engages customers to help them understand the purpose and value of their relationship with Vertafore
Develop and maintain a database of customer advocates who are willing to publicly share their experience in marketing materials
Partner with Product Marketing to build and manage a portfolio of customer success content, such as case studies, testimonials, quotes, and customer videos
Drive marketing efforts for Vertafore’s annual user conference to achieve registration goals and drive excitement in market
Support customer engagement initiatives for events, conferences, awards programs, onboarding, and ongoing nurture campaigns
Analyze results of programs and relationships to determine effectiveness and potential for improvement. Provide regular reports to senior leadership
Route customer feedback/issues to the appropriate team for resolution, and surface feedback trends to management for consideration
Manage programs to drive public customer voice through online reviews and engagement on sites like G2', 'Qualifications:', 'Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field
3-5 years of experience in a customer-oriented role within a B2B SaaS company preferred
Excellent written communication and presentation skills; proven ability to create internal and external content experiences that reflect the customer perspective.
The ability to develop and grow relationships with customers, partners, sales, and marketing counterparts
Excellent project management abilities, with a background in managing cross-functional programs
Ownership mentality and proven ability to meet deadlines, work collaboratively with others, and ensure high-quality deliverables
Problem solver who is proactive, analytical, and innovative
A demonstrated track record of accomplishment in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to manage multiple projects effectively
Experience using social media to engage customers and influencers preferred', 'Additional Requirements and Details:', 'Qualified candidates will be asked to provide previous work samples as part of the interview process.
Travel required up to 25% of the time
Flexible First work environment: team members work from home as often as they’d like, and use our offices for collaboration, community, and team building. #LI-Hybrid
Occasional lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds.
Frequent repetitive hand and arm movements required to operate a computer.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision (working on a computer, etc.).
Frequent sitting and/or standing']

['RealPage is changing the technology real estate industry and our teammates know how to think big and leave their mark. If you want to join a globally progressive and inclusive company devoted to excellence, we are looking for you!', 'We are the leading global provider of software and data analytics to the real estate industry. We navigate clients toward the right decisions with data and technology insights they can only get from RealPage. Serving our clients is our highest priority and RealPage teammates are our greatest asset.', 'Come join a team where your work makes an impact every day!', 'We’re passionate about helping hard-working entrepreneurs grow their property management businesses. We’re a collective of uniquely talented individuals who are at the top of our game and are determined to get better at what we do every day. Our determination to make our customers’ lives better and break records is contagious—you find yourself becoming intensely passionate about the work that we do, even if the property management industry was never on your radar before you got here.', '', "Buildium/RealPage is searching for a Product Management professional that will help lead the design and delivery of user experiences for several areas of the products within Buildium/RealPage's Single Family portfolio offering. This exciting role has visibility with senior leaders across the business, and is within a healthy, growing industry. The role will span multiple functional areas and will have an opportunity to substantively positively impact our customers and our business unit. We are a high-performing, modern Product team, and we're looking for all stars to join us!", 'You’ll be a leader of the Product Management team delivering the core tools and services property managers need to run and scale their businesses. You’ll work closely with the executives and leaders at Buildium to ensure organizational alignment and provide the status of development. You’ll leverage customer knowledge, data, and analytics to help the Product Team make informed prioritization decisions and drive the direction of the product portfolio.', '', "In addition to owning a scrum team yourself, you'll have the opportunity to mentor other teams as well. You’ll collaborate with the team to build, test, and optimize the property management experience. As a Senior Product Manager with Buildium/RealPage, you’ll work with a delivery team to guide a team of passionate UX pros and engineers focused on creating products that our customers love. You’ll become the acknowledged expert on your scrum team with deep knowledge of our customers, the industry, our product, and our business.", 'This position will report to the Senior Director of Product Management.']

column6: ['401(k)', 'Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Parental leave', 'Unlimited paid time off', 'Vision insurance']
column7:
['Join a leading insurtech company that is unlocking the potential of digital insurance to help everyone protect what matters most! Are you up for the challenge?

Sure was founded in 2015 and is the digital insurance platform that empowers brands and carriers to distribute products quickly. Our solutions reach and engage customers wherever they are on their journey. We are on a mission to provide a hassle-free way to buy insurance anywhere by powering insurance carriers and brands with our SaaS platform. Together we are building products that make digital insurance accessible to all.

Culture is everything. Join an incredible team of smart, passionate, collaborative and driven individuals. We empower our teams and promote autonomy and independence wherever we can.
We are remote first. Work from anywhere in the United States. #LI-Remote
Strive for greatness. We’ve been named 13th Fastest Growing Company by Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Best Place to Work in 2022 by Built In and recognized for Transforming the Global Insurance Industry by InsurTech 100.
Funding. In October 2021, we raised $100M in our Series C with a $550M valuation.

We’re growing!
Sure’s General Manager is responsible for end-to-end sales management and will nurture and grow the relationships with Sure’s biggest enterprise customers, helping them unlock the potential of insurance for their business.

This role involves growing our internal partnerships success team by working closely with senior executives on the strategy for each partnership: participating in sales demo proposals and negotiations, partnering with product and engineering on requirements and deployment, and leading customer satisfaction, account growth and renewal. If you love building businesses and relationships, this is the job for you.', "What You'll Do:
Lead the post-sale engagement, problem solving, retention, and growth of your customers, partnering closely with sales and tech teams
Perform a regular cadence of review to align on business priorities, insurance product performance, optimization and expansion opportunities, product roadmaps, usage and insights, surface issues and how to optimize the partnership with Sure
Develop and nurture relationships with our customers and across the Sure organization
Highlight successful business outcomes, defining how it was delivered and identify opportunities to replicate these across the business
Define and manage customer needs and serve as a trusted insurance advisor. You are the customer’s advocate!
Set realistic expectations with clients, through clear documentation and project planning.
Lead onboarding, new project and future roadmap development in concert with Project Management
Drive overall account health including insurance performance, product adoption, usage velocity, account renewals, churn, growth, referrals, cost optimization, and customer satisfaction", 'Who You Are:
10 + years experience in a client-facing role ideally customer success/partner success, managing relationships with large, global and complex organizations, working with a technical product.
5 + years experience leading a team of direct reports
P&L leadership experience preferred
Sophisticated business acumen and understanding of underlying drivers and strategy of our customer’s businesses
Experience guiding technical conversations and persuading others to take action based on requirements and value provided by solutions
Strong analytical skills and operating discipline
Strong executive presence and presentation skills, particularly for in-person/virtual meetings with multiple stakeholders
Experience building joint customer account plans
Proven track record of achieving targets and goals and managing large, complex projects and/or programs
A desire to work with a wide range of people, both internally and externally
The motivation and flexibility to thrive in a high-growth environment
Understanding of text based software (coding, SQL) is desirable
Experience with a/b testing, website conversion design, digital conversion optimization & cohort modeling preferred', 'What we do for you:
Unlimited PTO… no really, we want you to take it!
Mental Health Breaks - company provided meditation app and a weekly wellness hour
WFH stipend to help you work your best while being remote
Countless Medical, Dental and Vision plans … we are an insurtech company after all!
Equity and 401K
Generous parental leave', 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

For more information, visit https://www.sureapp.com/. Follow @SureHQ on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.

Employment at Sure is contingent upon a satisfactory verification of a general and criminal background check and education and employment verification. Upon an offer of employment, all prospective employees may be required to complete an employment application. Any background verifications will be obtained with written consent from the individual.']

['Job Description:', 'Reporting to the CMO, this role will lead our digital marketing and self-serve teams to achieve our awareness, pipeline generation and self-service revenue goals. The 50+ team includes acquisition/performance marketing, digital experience/website/commerce, optimization, and digital revenue. This team is accountable for a large self-service revenue number and the execution of demand generation strategies to achieve pipeline targets for our sales-led business.', 'This person will collaborate with Regional Demand Generation teams as well as centralized Brand, Integrated Marketing, Marketing Operations and Communications teams to foster winning strategies and campaigns. The Marketing Leadership team is full of powerhouses!', 'In this role, you will provide leadership for the teams that work cross-functionally to implement our campaigns and demand gen strategies across: web development, web experience, optimization and testing, web operations and analytics, SEO, paid media, paid search, paid social, email marketing, chat, cart/checkout, etc. You will lead the transformation of our paid channels and digital experience to drive revenue by delivering deep business value across best-in-class digital journeys. Your teams will develop a multiyear global digital marketing strategy, inclusive of GTM strategies driving brand awareness, leads, free to paid conversions, direct purchase and retention across both sales-led B2B and self-service.', "Don't miss out on this special opportunity. Join this highly driven and yet fun and funny Marketing team!", "What You'll Own:", 'Define the vision, strategy, and execution to deliver quarterly and annual awareness, pipeline and self-serve revenue goals
Collaborate effectively with executives and appropriate internal team members to improve strategic digital marketing initiatives
Build and maintain relationships with key internal collaborators to capture digital marketing goals and ensure all marketing tools, collateral and plans are in alignment with the objectives
Increase engagement via a personalized web experience; help shorten the prospect and customer buying process
Collaborate with Regional Marketing leaders on localization strategy and maintain appropriate localized web footprint to support key regional sales and marketing efforts
Partner cross-functionally to develop the email marketing calendar and implement initiatives to further grow our subscriber base
Partner with the Brand team to ensure a consistent brand experience across all web-based engagement points
Keep up to date with and propose new acquisition channels, tools, and tactics', "Experience You'll Need:", '10 years of marketing leadership experience and managing teams
7-10 years working experience in paid marketing / acquisition space for a fast paced B2B SaaS company with a self-serve/commerce segment
Data driven with strong quantitative and analytical skills and think in terms of LTV, return on investment, and your impact on the bottom line of the business
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, often amidst ambiguity
Superb communication and the ability to inspire senior executives, peers, and team with your vision and roadmap
Consistent track record of scaling global digital and performance marketing programs
Critical thinking with a bias towards action and creative solutions, a player-coach, and willingness to pitch in to help your crew accomplish lofty goals
Deep understanding of the user lifecycle and funnel, sales cycle and product lifecycle and their respective pressures on the marketing organization to drive demand and revenue
A MarTech enthusiast; experience with CDP, DMP, identity resolution partners, attribution', 'Bring yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status.

#LI-DF1']

["Do you thrive in a startup vibe? Were you built for a small, nimble, and dynamic team that's ready to win? If you answered yes, we want to talk to you! ShareFile tried to fit into Citrix and we realized it doesn’t fit. We are now going back to our roots as a standalone business unit to focus on our SaaS business—an area where we see growth potential. This business unit is unique, and we certainly aren’t afraid to stand out from the crowd and tackle the bigger competitors.", 'Come join ShareFile! We’re building a team of rock stars to be part of our growth journey and are adding a Sales Development Representative to join our growing ShareFile Sales team. If you enjoy a fun, fast-paced, dynamic environment and want to be part of a collaborative team where you can make a difference—we want to talk to you!', 'Role Overview: You are an exceptional, enthusiastic, soon to be recent college graduate. You are passionate about a career in professional sales. You are excited about technology, you have a positive attitude, and you consistently take the initiative. You have a desire to learn and develop, along with excellent written & verbal communication skills. Your outstanding interpersonal skills allow you to liaise with customers, sales and marketing teams, senior managers, and other business units. You embody the ShareFile core values of Integrity, Respect, Curiosity, Courage, and Unity.', 'The position is a training program, built from the ground up by leaders in the industry, designed to kick-start your sales career, and to help you create a foundation of skills and tools that you can leverage as you advance in your career. You will have access to proven successful sales managers and coaches, along with mentors who are all ready to support and aid in the development of your sales career.', 'Role Responsibilities:', 'Effectively leverage CRM and third-party tools to source qualified prospects
Shadow current sales reps and teams to learn their process and what makes them effective in their roles
Use pre-established procedures and guidelines to respond to requests from internal and end-user customers, partners and distributors via phone, web, and email
Promote a positive team environment by assisting with training and development of novice employees to enhance skills and abilities in performance of their duties
Approach all tasks thoughtfully and professionally
Prioritize workload in order to meet all KPIs, goals, and objectives
Utilize enablement platforms to improve product and positioning knowledge', 'Your Superhero Uniform Includes:', 'Requires limited knowledge of systems and procedures
Follows basic work routines and standards
Typically, does not require advanced education and requires no prior experience', 'Your Superhero Strengths Include:', "Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university (preferred)
Extracurricular campus activities
Participation in sales organizations or sales related internships"]
