column1: Senior Sales Specialist, Network & Security, Federal - Opportunity for Working Remotely Reston, VA
column7:
['Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?', '', 'The world is changing fast! Corporations, governments, schools, hospitals are all feeling immense pressure to offer work from anywhere or buy from anywhere technology. They are in desperate need for an IT infrastructure that lets employees and customers access applications from any device, anywhere, on any cloud, all while being secure. VMware provides the solution. You won’t find another company that offers the breath of innovative technology designed for an unpredictable world. Therefore, you will love selling for one of the most highly regarded brands in the IT and Cloud Services industry. Our 350,000 enterprise and business customers (which includes 98% of Fortune 500) rely on VMware to make their digital transformation possible.', 'As the Networking & Security Specialist, your primary focus is aimed at closing larger strategic business while maintaining sustained transactional sales growth. Collaborating with your peers here at VMware and our entire partner ecosystem to identify, develop, accelerate, up-sell and close transactions is critical. Without you and the work of your partners, the money doesn’t flow in!', 'Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?', "The primary objective of this position is to sell VMware's Virtual Cloud Networking (VCN) solutions to Federal accounts. You will be accountable for quarterly booking targets for selling VMware products (perpetual and SaaS) focusing on network, security, load balancing, and SD-WAN, along with packaged services, and educational offerings.
You will need to orchestrate territory coverage through effective collaboration, leadership, and coaching of internal team/peer specialists and external partners on how to position and close VMware opportunities. You will work closely with top Partner Executives/Sellers across the U.S. including leading VARs, Distributors, Corporate Resellers, OEMs, and Cloud/Hosting Partners.
Your role with include driving account portfolio sales strategy and focus on top accounts and establish sales cadence with the corporate account team
You will solidify existing customer accounts and elevate VMware to a more strategic position
You will help identify and match the VMware NSX solution to the customer’s business needs and technical requirements
6+ years of Selling Enterprise Software is required
4+ years of related network route/switch, network management, and/or network security-based solutions
Must be a US Citizen
Must have TS/SCI Clearances or in process", 'What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?', 'Travel 20-50% of the time meeting with and presenting to current and prospective customers and for internal and customer events/meetings.
Increase customer spending through ‘Whitespace’ and ‘Wallet share’ selling motions in assigned geographies.
Support and provide guidance to both field and partner marketing events to drive demand for our Virtual Cloud Networking products and solutions.
Coordination within an internal set of multi-functional teams such as Client Executives, Systems Engineers, peer Product Specialists, Inside Reps, Field Marketing, Professional Services, and Channel Management and external partners as described previously.
Accurately forecast license bookings, specific products revenue, PSO bookings and new accounts on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis via Salesforce.com', 'What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?', "The hiring manager, Kevin Reed, has over 25 years’ experience on sales teams. His style is very collaborative and inclusive. He has a strong focus on coaching his team to grow themselves and their territory. He demonstrates a strong ethical approach in alignment with VMware's EPIC2 values and expects the same from his team."]

['Who We Are
Each year, 2 billion people across the world are limited by physical pain. By helping people live without pain, they are free to do the things they love most with the people they love—and never miss a moment. This is what we do. We create and design new technologies to solve one of the biggest problems in healthcare: taking care of our Physical Health. Sword Health is the world’s fastest growing digital musculoskeletal (MSK) care provider on a bold mission to free two billion people from acute, chronic, and post-surgical physical pain . Our customers include some of the most progressive Fortune 100 and 500 companies, as well as over 160+ other established businesses across the world.
The Sword program allows members to complete a personalized physical therapy program from the comfort of home, with continued support and supervision from one of our talented Sword specialists. Sword’s personalized care is more effective than traditional standards of care, and has proven to deliver best-in-class clinical results. Since breaking into the market less than two years ago, Sword has worked with insurers, health systems, and employers in the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Australia to make high quality musculoskeletal care accessible to everyone.
This is an opportunity to join Sword during a time of hyper growth and expansion. After our recent $2bn valuation, we’re excited to continue accelerating our impact by scaling with high caliber people with passion, commitment and energy to create and deliver technologies, services and products that drive human progress forward.
We welcome you to join our mission, to make a difference on a grand scale and play a pivotal role with a global team at Sword– working alongside great people pioneering novel products and cutting edge technologies.

A successful Partner Success Manager (PSM) will be able to navigate the changing dynamics of partner support, strategic management, and partnership goals to drive value for Sword and the partner team.

TO DO WHAT:
Serve as the main point of contact and advocate for partners following the initial partnership sales phase.
Define operational strategy and provide day-to-day support to partners throughout the partner lifecycle with the focus of driving enrollment, engagement, and customer renewals.
Work in close collaboration with clinical, operational, and technology teams to successfully represent the needs of the partner portfolio. es and strategies for the selection and integration of clinical solution partners.
Serve as a subject matter expert for Partner Success to aid the ongoing development of ecosystem partnerships by working with senior leadership peers within the Platform and Ecosystem Partnership teams to identify, select, collaborate with Partners to provide Sword R&D with the underlying business case(s).
Ensure the on-time delivery of key reporting and partnership metrics.
Support customer and sales teams with training and materials necessary to understand and promote our partner portfolio.
Create annual/quarterly business reviews with input from sales and other key internal stakeholders.
Our ideal candidate:
3-5 years’ work experience in healthcare partnerships, healthcare consulting, or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) customer success.
Ability to think strategically and systemically while executing methodically
Must have: Previous experience in customer success management, implementation, or consulting.
Entrepreneurial with an ability to create and follow plans, yet flexible enough to respond to change while balancing priorities.
Accountable, proactive, and thoughtful with high attention to detail and strategic problem-solving skills
Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate product vision and roadmap to stakeholders
Interest in the healthcare industry and the challenges/complexities of industry transformation
Desire to contribute to high visibility, strategic projects within the organization', '', '', 'Sword Benefits:
Comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance
Equity Shares
401(k)
Unlimited Vacation
Paid Holidays
Flexible working hours
Work from home
Parental leave
Free Digital Therapist for your family
Sword is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We champion diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. At Sword, we believe that diversity and inclusion among our applicants and team members is critical to our success as a global company. The more inclusive and diverse we are, the bigger our impact will be.']

["About LogRocket

Founded in 2016, LogRocket's goal is to make every experience on the web as perfect as possible. We're solving a huge challenge for product managers and developers - understanding the user experience. LogRocket is the first system that gives these teams complete visibility into their customer's experience using their web apps - through pixel-perfect replays of user sessions and clear insight into logs, errors, and network activity. We've already attracted an elite roster of over 2,500 customers including Reddit, Ikea, and Airbnb, just to name a few. Our focus is on building software with care and craftsmanship and our engineering blog posts offer a taste of that.

Backed by top investors such as Matrix Partners, Battery Ventures, and Delta-V Capital, we've raised $55M in funding and we're eager to bring talented people onboard to support our growth. We're on a mission to improve society's experience with software and that's where you come in.

The Head of Finance will join our executive team to help drive LogRocket’s growth into the future. In this role, you'll be responsible for developing and directing our analytical and financial plans. This person will use their strong analytical and strategic background to optimize our growth and reach our revenue goals.", 'Responsibilities
Work with the executive team and board of directors to measure and optimize the financial performance of LogRocket, ensuring we hit our revenue targets
Partner closely with Sales and Marketing to optimize growth among current and potential customers
Understand the unique levers of our business and how to pull them to drive impact and growth
Own the financial model, forecasting, cash vs. burn, and cap table
Use data to inform decisions on growth areas such as geographies, segments, and partnerships
Design and build reporting systems for senior leadership and other departments to accurately track SaaS KPIs including churn and expansion
Prepare analyses, summaries and reports of financial data on the operating progress of the company
Routinely review revenue cycle metrics to proactively identify and address issues affecting overall performance', 'About You
8+ years relevant work experience in startups, venture capital, private equity, investment banking, or a related field
Strong working knowledge of SaaS metrics and business fundamentals
Strong working knowledge of pricing for SaaS businesses, including bundling, packaging, payment terms, and discounting
Strong ability to synthesize data and information from a variety of sources and translate into effective actionable plans and presentations
Working knowledge of accounting, corporate finance, bookkeeping, contracts, and other operational areas
Approach problems from a first-principles mindset, looking to understand the root of what we are trying to accomplish before we build a solution
Empathetic, low-ego leader who can recruit, manage, and retain a strong team of finance professionals
Clear, concise, and thoughtful written and verbal communication skills', 'Benefits and Perks
Extensive health, dental, and vision benefits
Open vacation policy - we all work hard and take time for ourselves when we need it, no strings attached
Three months of fully-paid parental leave to any employee welcoming a child into their home
401k and commuter benefits
Generous stock options - we all get to own a piece of what we’re building
Regular team outings and activities
Flexible working hours and location
Monthly employee gifts
For those in office, catered lunches throughout the week and a fully stocked kitchen with all your favorite snacks (healthy & non-healthy)', 'Even if you don’t meet all of the listed requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We believe learning is a vital component of success in any role here at LogRocket, and we’re happy to chat with folks from non-traditional backgrounds for our open roles.

LogRocket is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

LogRocket will consider sponsoring visas for applicants in the US that need work authorization.']

['Nevvon is a global healthcare education technology company. We help home care agencies certify caregivers for mandatory annual education compliance through our intuitive and user-centric mobile application. We cross the divide between SAAS and content creation.', 'This is your opportunity to join a rapidly growing team where your contributions will have a direct impact on our team’s success.', 'The Senior Sales executive (hunter) will be responsible to work independently with discipline and motivation to succeed in a virtual environment where you work remotely with coworkers from the comfort of your home. We need an experienced salesperson who has a consultative sales approach, a successful track record growing and onboarding clients with polished presentation skills. You will ultimately be responsible for your own success, ensuring incremental growth in monthly recurring revenue and new logo acquisition, while providing the best sales experience possible for our customers.', 'This role reports to the director of Sales and will work alongside Sales and Marketing.', 'Type of role:', 'Full Time, Permanent', 'Remote', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Develop and nurture relationships
Exceed monthly/quarterly sales targets by driving new opportunities and selling new products into new accounts
Generate short-term results whilst maintaining a long-term perspective to improve overall revenue generation
Partner with customer success to ensure high satisfaction within your accounts
Generate 4 demos a week from outbound and inbound opportunities
Daily effort applied to self and team learning
Maintain clean, up to date and complete pipeline (manage the pipeline of opportunities, from top to bottom of the funnel)
Attending trade exhibitions, conferences and meetings (travel may be required)
Superior demo skills over video conference', 'Other duties as assigned']

['Who We Are', '', 'ABOUT ENOVIS™', 'Enovis Corporation (NYSE: ENOV) is an innovation-driven medical technology growth company dedicated to developing clinically differentiated solutions that generate measurably better patient outcomes and transform workflows. Powered by a culture of continuous improvement, global talent and innovation, the Company’s extensive range of products, services and integrated technologies fuels active lifestyles in orthopedics and beyond. For more information about Enovis, please visit
www.enovis.com
.', '', 'Enovis History', 'In April of 2022, Colfax, which includes orthopedic leader
DJO
, separated from ESAB Corporation and rebranded to Enovis. In recognition of our successful history of growth and innovation, the distinctive “O” in our new Enovis logo was deliberately carried over from our Colfax logo as it represents continuous improvement – a cornerstone of our business’s success that will continue at Enovis. Enovis is poised to become one of the world’s leading medical technology companies', "What You'll Do", 'We are seeking a highly driven Product Director with a background in automated solutions to join our Healthcare Solutions Team. This position is responsible for leading the strategic execution of Marketing and Sales programs and services that have a considerable impact on Company results across multiple product lines, channels, regions and/or Business Units (BUs).', '']

['Here at Crisp, we value the strength in teamwork, and strongly believe that it’s the key to Crisp’s success. By bringing together bright, motivated creators, wherever they live and work, we are leveraging humanity’s diversity of experience and background in order to understand the challenges facing our food supply, and solve them together. Come join us, and help build the type of business you’d like to be a part of.', 'We are a socially conscious, distributed team. We give you the opportunity to solve challenges in the global food industry while living where you’re most comfortable and working in areas where you can help foster and grow the community that you are a part of.', 'The Enterprise Account Executive is one of the most critical and senior individual contributor sales roles at Crisp. Our Enterprise Account Executives are resourceful, customer obsessed and passionate about making our clients successful. Our team works to ensure Crisp data is accessible, usable and valuable across the client’s organization.', 'Enterprise Account Executives lead the strategic business growth for new logos across their assigned territories. From prospecting to closing, Account Executives work directly with potential customers to create business value across multiple personas, continually working to drive revenue opportunities. Enterprise Account Executives will also work hand-in-hand with Customer Success Managers (CSMs), to drive expansion and continual customer engagement.', 'This role reports directly to the VP of Sales with ample opportunity for career growth.', 'Signs of a great candidate for Crisp', 'Collaborative. You know that your colleagues’ perspectives will make our customers successful. Similarly, you use your strengths to help us grow together. You propose ways for us to be more engaged and successful with our customers.
Customer focused. Our customers are at the forefront of your day. You prioritize our customers’ voice to ensure their needs are met.
Ambitious, curious, and resourceful. You are innately curious, and you aren’t afraid to work hard. You are self driven, you take direction well but are able to be creative to find results on your own when asked. You are driven to succeed because your hard work and results make you proud.
Disciplined and reliable. We are a distributed company and you enjoy the benefits of working distributed while consistently delivering what you have committed to. When you hit a snag, you communicate and reset expectations early.
Appreciative of honest feedback. You know that the best way to learn and grow is through constructive feedback delivered kindly. You view feedback given to you as an opportunity to get better and strive to do the same for others.
Work smarter and harder. You often identify a problem, create a solution and bring it to a state of completion - with others, or even on your own. You find ways of eliminating or automating stuff that is uninteresting or wasteful.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Develop and maintain expert knowledge on the features, benefits and application of Crisp’s offering.
Effectively manage a book of accounts, creating reliable forecasts, and working with management to close open pipelines to exceed sales quota.
Understand the competitive landscape within their assigned book of business.
Creatively penetrating new markets, verticals and personas.
Demonstrate a relentless hunter mentality to direct outbound lead sourcing.
Identify opportunities across net new and existing customers.
Work both independently and collaboratively in a fast paced environment.
Manage multiple projects at once and meet deadlines.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Share market insights with product and marketing teams.
Other duties as assigned.', 'Must Haves:']

['Requisition ID
531459', '', "Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps create the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and improve outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at www.medidata.com and follow us @medidata
Our Team:
Your team will be responsible for Medidata's Patient Cloud platform. Our users depend on our products to participate in any clinical trial using web, mobile and sensor-based solutions. We focus on the patient experience and aim to provide engaging solutions that fit into people's everyday lives. We make clinical trials faster by reducing burdens for both patients and study personnel.
We're building our platform on top of a few core principles and technologies:
SaaS-based applications using Ruby, Python, Java and other object-oriented languages
Single page application technologies using React.js
Data intense workflows using PostgresSQL, MySQL or similar relational data stores
Enterprise-class APIs patterns and protocols with REST and GraphQL
Automated development and testing harnesses using Travis, GoCD and cypress.io
Cloud-native infrastructure and deployment services
What we're looking for:
As a Senior Applications Engineer, you are an important part of our team building cloud-native, web applications. You will report to the manager of engineering and work with a team lead on a daily basis. You are a motivated, hands-on developer, passionate about building scalable solutions and will individually contribute in the following ways:
Independently implement solutions for features within your area of expertise including delivering new projects from scratch
Write code that sets the standard for quality and maintainability by following coding best practices and using patterns wherever possible
Demonstrate a holistic mindset when developing new modules with a focus on the big technical picture
Write and review PRs with a focus on ensuring best practices and improving our products.
Communicate and work with leaders to schedule and guide the delivery of features, estimate tasks and follow our Agile development process
Showcase your experience by participating in high impact, challenging engineering problems while raising the standard of quality in our products
Stay current with new technologies and engineering concepts
Follow Medidata's Standard Operating Procedures to ensure all software meets regulatory and company requirements
Requirements (Education & Experience):
Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience with enterprise solutions
At least 3 years of experience building enterprise web or mobile applications
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission under the terms of applicable plan documents, while many of Medidata’s non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Additionally, Medidata provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and should help you care for those who matter most. For that reason, we provide an array of options to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.
The salary range posted below refers only to positions that will be physically based in New York City. As with all roles, Medidata sets ranges based on a number of factors including function, level, candidate expertise and experience, and geographic location. Pay ranges for candidates in locations other than New York City, may differ based on the local market data in that region. The base salary pay range for this position is $135,000to $155,000.
#LI-BS1 #LI-Remote
Equal Employment Opportunity
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Covid Statement
Our Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine."]

['Quality Assurance Specialist', "We are looking for a detail-oriented quality assurance specialist to be in charge of all quality assurance activities. The quality assurance specialist's responsibilities include conducting tests and verifications of software user-interface, developing and implementing quality assurance policies, identifying production, process, or product issues, and presenting solutions.", '', 'To be successful as a quality assurance specialist you should be incredibly detail-oriented, thorough and able to help our company maintain the highest quality standards. You must have a relentless attitude not tolerant of simple errors.', '', 'Typical activities at GRUBBRR include performing reviews of restaurant food menu spelling, image quality, and price matching. With training, the QA Specialist should be able to optimize food order flow for time, price, and appearance.', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Performing routine inspections and quality tests.
Making recommendations for improvement.
Identifying and resolving workflow and production issues.
Addressing and discussing issues and proposed solutions with superiors.
Documenting quality assurance activities and creating audit reports.
Preparing and implementing quality assurance policies and procedures.
Creating training materials and operating manuals.', '']

['Req ID
FY23|R&D|#4806
Location(s)
Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Austin, Texas, USA; Chicago, Illinois, USA; Detroit, Michigan, USA; Miami, Florida, USA; New York City, New York, USA; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA; Portland, Oregon, USA; Salt Lake City, Utah, USA; San Francisco, California, USA; Seattle, Washington, USA;
Work arrangement(s)
Fully Remote (works exclusively from home)', "Your opportunity
The goal of Product Partnerships is to extend the New Relic platform and its value to customers (existing and new) via product integrations that supports our vision to ‘shift left’ while growing new accounts, users, data and increasing adoption! You'll join our Cloud and Product Partnership team. This team works to grow our partnerships and integrations between New Relic and important services such as AWS, Microsoft, Sales Force and some of our new Partners. You'll play a critical role in New Relic's future success!
What you'll do
Collaborate with VP of Product Partnerships and other Product Leaders to establish vision and strategy for Product Partnerships aligned with critical product goals and corporate OKRs, including reporting metrics
Define product integration roadmap(s) in collaboration with Partner’s product teams and internal New Relic stakeholders (Product, Sales, Marketing, and Finance)
Lead / support commercial discussions with partners, Product Legal, and Monetization teams
Lead partner relationship & enablement initiatives across New Relic ecosystem partner types.
Partner with Product teams on POCs and incubations
Recruit, qualify, enable and build partner relationships and serve as the trusted resource for selected partners
Partner onboarding: Work with our Partner Engineering team to build & enable the partner experience to ensure the partner is prepared to articulate the value prop of New Relic’s Observability platform.
Work closely with the Partner Engineering, Partner Enablement, Product and leadership teams to agree upon priorities, roadmaps, and delivery timelines
Update and build playbooks for generating business with partners, working closely with the customer success teams, partner engineering teams, partner operations, account executives and partner marketing
Collect and evangelize partner success journeys internally with sales teams, management, and externally within partner ecosystems
This role requires
2+ years of Product management experience
7+ years of Partner enablement/partner management or business development experience
5+ years of Technical solutions/SaaS software experience (sales or consulting services)
Success working with Product, Finance, Sales, Marketing, and Legal teams
Bonus points if you have
Observability experience
Experience with CI/CD software providers
Customer Adoption / Field experience
MBA preferred", "We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.
We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.
Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic at www.newrelic.com/blog/how-to-relic/future-of-work
Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/FCO%20poster2020.pdf

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.", "Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 200,000 - $ 250,000
Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. The base pay range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high end base pay range for the listed position. This role may be eligible for the corporate bonus plan (or, if a sales role, a commission plan as defined in the sales incentive plan document), participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards that may be applicable. ['Description', 'Semarchy is looking for an energetic Sales Executive to join our growing team. You should be adept at helping enterprise-level prospective clients derive value from our best-of-class solutions and support in the enterprise data space, addressing complex business issues with innovative technology.', 'You’ll work with prospective Data Integration, Master Data Management (MDM), and Data Governance (DG) clients across a North American territory, with primary responsibility including an enviable Northeast US territory. You should be adept at selling to executives such as Chief Data Officer (CDO), Chief Information Officer (CIO), Chief Operating Officer (COO), and senior business leaders. You will have the support of our marketing, lead development, and pre-sales engineering teams, and network of strategic partners.', 'The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience in a B2B enterprise sales position, experience selling Data Integration, MDM, and/or other data-based solutions to global 1,000 firms. You should have a history of consistent sales performance, developing powerful relationships, and working well within a team.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Prospect for new opportunities using your knowledge of the local business environment, professional network, and sales skills to build relationships with potential clients
Partner with internal and client technical resources to build meaningful business cases for new and expanding MDM and Data Integration projects that show value and fast ROI
Identify, discover and define new opportunities for organizations to take advantage of our innovative approach to master data management and data integration by communicating business value
Qualify opportunities from the marketing/lead development team to prepare them for the sales process
Guide prospective clients through the sales process, from solution development through demonstration, proof-of-concept, implementation/deployment planning, to achieving value
Execute smart negotiations with prospective clients that result in win-win solutions for Semarchy and the client organization
Model the logical business case associated with each client opportunity to strategically match and modify requirements to proposed solutions
Evangelize the uniqueness of our value proposition
Collect and document business impact statements while forming powerful references
Partner with strategic Solution Integrators and Technology Partners to deliver value to our clients', '', '', 'Requirements']

['Date: 8th April 2022', 'Location: Boston, MA', 'Job Status: Full Time', 'Summary:', 'RxLogix is a global pharmacovigilance solutions company specializing in innovative software and expert consulting services. Our talented team of business and technology innovators works with Pharmacovigilance and Risk Management Professionals to help increase the compliance, productivity, and quality for the entire Drug Safety value chain. We are business transformers, digital thinkers, tech Innovators, technology revolutionist, business mavericks, driven and open-minded individuals. At RxLogix, our goal is to make the most innovative industry standard software for the life sciences domain.', 'Global PV processes can be complex. Existing tools used to track PV tasks and adverse events are manual, bloated, and complex. To take the next step in PV productivity, we need a fresh start. RxLogix is here to help take that step; to improve the productivity of sponsors, CROs, and sites, to ultimately get medicines to those in need faster.', 'General Purpose:', 'The Software Sales Manager will report directly to the Regional Sales Director for US and Europe of RxLogix.
Managing territory by selling directly into pharmaceutical companies and Contract Research Organizations (CROs).
Build and work the entire sales pipeline from prospecting for new business, to cold-calling, to getting client meetings, to closing business.
Candidate should have a hunger for personal and company success and enjoy working on a high functioning, competitive, and collaborative team.
Our Sales team is responsible for introducing our suite of solutions, to new customers and driving new business for the company in the US and Europe.
Previous pharma experience and clinical trials experience is preferred.
Software Sales Manager will play an important and highly visible role in liaising with key executives in the life sciences industry.
One of our core values is working as a team, and we expect our sales team to live and breathe team collaboration to ensure the team’s and RxLogix success.', 'Essential Duties & Responsibilities', 'Penetrate, profile, qualify and schedule well-qualified appointments with key decision makers within targeted US and EU life science companies
Cold-call, network, and email a high volume of prospects and sales operations leaders, and utilize resources to build and maintain the sales pipeline.
Learn and demonstrate a solid understanding of RxLogix technology, and clearly articulate capabilities and advantages to prospective customers to successfully manage and overcome prospect objections.
Comprehensively introduce and explain our solutions via web demo.
Effectively position and liaise with prospects ranging from end-users, to Directors, to the CX level.
Achieve and exceed monthly sales quotas.
Work closely with the US and EU Sales Director and marketing team members to achieve organizational goals.
Provide continual input to the sales and marketing organizations to refine positioning and adapt to new market opportunities.
Generate new business and sales leads through a mixture of cold calling and following up on marketing campaigns and inbound inquiries.
Work with existing clients to grow their accounts and find referrals.
Schedule meetings with target accounts.
Manage inbound leads.
Make outbound calls to targeted accounts.
Understand programs and offerings and effectively communicate and apply them to each prospect need.']

["We are looking for someone who has experience writing copy for financial marketing and other investment type vehicles
Description
Who we are:
Trellis is the corporate development and business advisory arm of a large network of Corporate Acquirers, Growth Equity Investors, PE, Family Offices and Lenders in a variety of spaces and investment mandates, primarily in Enterprise Software. Trellis supports a number of clients across Family Offices and Private Equity within the realm of Enterprise Software, including two internal premier organizations (Lotus Domaine and Terra Rossa).
As a leading buy-side group, we facilitate growth investments and acquisitions for our investor network. Our team consists of former senior technical executives, founders, private equity, and family office professionals. We specialize in providing technology-enabled origination, deal execution, and business services globally across multiple industries and verticals. It takes knowledge, dedication and focus to make a fine wine.
A Trellis is the framework that holds it all together. We apply the same strategy to our clients' portfolio—we are a hyper focused, private equity consultancy built to grow, advise, partner, and strategize with private equity investors, family offices, corporations, executives, and business owners to address gaps existing in deal origination, revenue acceleration, and overall performance of platform investments
Job Description:
Write e-mail drip sequences and customize e-mails to technology companies with relevant information through research
Research target companies and relate their solutions and executive backgrounds to client requirements and investment theses.
Create messaging and positioning in the market; conduct competitive and market analysis to determine and highlight company and client key differentiators
Work with internal stakeholders to plan, create, and launch creative campaigns and compelling stories around companies
Work closely with sales and sales leadership to enhance and align writing efforts
Requirements:
Strong editorial, proofreading, and English writing skills
Familiarity with keyword research
Experience with social media and content marketing
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure
Passion for writing with an excellent portfolio of work
Preferred Requirements:
Understanding of technology, SaaS and software ecosystem
Understanding of private equity, venture capital ecosystem
Experience with SEO copywriting best practices
Email Marketing & CRM’s
Marketing Automation
Sales Enablement
Skills & Qualifications:
Experience in Enterprise Software industry marketing preferred
Proficient in Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Proven leadership experience carrying out marketing efforts, including planning, prioritizing, and implementing strategy
Strong leadership and communication skills
You are entrepreneurial and work well in a rapidly changing environment
You are creative and innovative
You are customer-centric and can identify and meet customer needs
You have experience working cross-functionally to ensure marketing programs are in line with company objectives
You are metric driven and have the ability to draw insight from industry research and target company executive backgrounds
Masterful organizational, communication, and leadership skills, demonstrated by previous professional success
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Vision insurance
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Commission pay
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
SaaS/Enterprise Software: 1 year (Preferred)
Content marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
SEO: 1 year (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote
Salary
$50,000 - $70,000 per year"]

['City: Dallas', 'Job area: Sales', 'Job field: Sales', 'Seniority Level: Mid-Senior level', 'Date: Jan 15, 2023', '', 'HRS AS A COMPANY
HRS is reinventing the way businesses and governments work, stay and pay in today’s dynamic global marketplace. HRS’ advanced platform technology is extending its reach beyond hospitality to meetings, office space management, payment efficiency and crisis recovery.

Beyond cost savings in the global post-pandemic economy, HRS clients gain from an unrivaled focus on essential aspects including safety, security and satisfaction.

HRS is also recognized for its award-winning Green Stay Initiative, technology that helps corporate hotel programs achieve their NetZero targets, and its groundbreaking Crew & Passengers Solution, which leverages automation to elevate experiences for air and rail operations.

Founded in 1972, HRS works with 35 percent of the global Fortune 500, as well as the world’s leading hotel chains, regional hospitality groups and payment providers.
BUSINESS UNIT
With a strategic roadmap our global sales organization is able to ensure the highest level of consulting, delivery and operational excellence. Furthermore, the kind of top level standards is ensured by applying the global standard methodologies and data-driven quarterly business reviews (QBR) with the clients.
POSITION
We are looking for a talented and competitive Business Development Manager US (m/f/d) who thrives in a fast past and aggressively growing company. The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. This is a great opportunity for an accomplished sales executive with a track record of bringing in new logos and busting quotas.
The ideal candidate can be located at either our New York, Dallas office or remote.

CHALLENGE
Define and execute territory and account sales plans for your assigned geographic territory and then meet and exceed sales quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the assigned territory.
Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move multiple transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline.
Manage and track customer interaction and transactional information in a CRM system
Coordinate pre-sales resources throughout the sales cycle.
Provide presentations, product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers.
Provide regular reporting of prospecting, pipeline and forecast through the CRM system.
Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products.
Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff.
Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.
Identify and flag any product or marketing improvements required to optimize our end customer solutions and engage relevant internal departments.
Other duties as assigned.
FOR THIS EXCITING MISSION YOU ARE EQUIPPED WITH...
Experience in working in a senior sales or consulting role for several years, selling B2B SaaS solutions.
Ability to proactively deliver a new business strategy and actions in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience in engaging with senior management across multiple disciplines within the potential new customer base to ensure maximum understanding and opportunity for success
Strong competency in delivering creative solutions to overcome customer objections and ability to negotiate mutually beneficial commercial contracts
Ability to analyze and interpret complex customer data and using CRM systems as part of the daily role
Fluent in English spoken and written
PERSPECTIVE
Access to a global network of a globally united and mutually responsible “Tribe of Intrapreneurs” that is passionately dedicated to renew the travel industry and while doing so reinvent the ways how businesses stay, work and pay.

Our entrepreneurial driven environment of full ownership and execution focus offers you the playground to contribute to a greater mission, while growing personally and professionally throughout this unique journey. You will continuously learn from a radical culture of retrospectives and continuous improvement and actively contribute to making business life better, smarter and more sustainable.
LOCATION, MOBILITY, INCENTIVE
The attractive remuneration is in line with the market and, in addition to a fixed monthly salary, all necessary work equipment and mobility, will also include an annual or multi-year bonus.', '', '#LI-Remote', 'Req ID: 12464']

["Cofounder (Growth & Customer Development Focus)
We’re adding to our diverse team of experts and are looking to hire those who are committed to building a culture that enables the creation of innovative solutions for our business units and clients.

The Company
As a member of Munich Re's US operations, the Incubator offers the financial strength and stability that comes with being part of the world's preeminent insurance and reinsurance brand. Our risk experts work together to assemble the right mix of products and services to help our clients stay competitive – from traditional reinsurance coverages to niche and specialty reinsurance and insurance products.

The Opportunity
Future focused and always one step ahead
Munich Re US Incubator is looking for an experienced, passionate entrepreneur / intrapreneur with a focus on sales and business development to join an existing venture team and grow a net new B2B SaaS business. Cofounders of more advanced Ventures are responsible for co-leading a specific Venture team in launching and scaling the business to accelerate our enterprise growth initiatives. Cofounders use their entrepreneurial skills and experience along with an experimental mindset, to get to the commercial truth to build out ventures. You can expect a test-and-learn environment, with rapid experimentation to drive progress.

This will be a high profile, high impact opportunity that’s exciting and professionally rewarding.

The ideal candidates will be:
Hands-on doers with experience in building and scaling new businesses
Self-starters, adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity and change
Driven by results to build commercially viable ventures
Passionate about the user/customer needs
Experienced in creating and executing a vision and gaining senior leadership buy-in
Inquisitive and curious, excited about testing out new ideas and concepts using a rigorous, test-and-learn approach
Able to lead through influence and drive business results in an environment with competing priorities
Able to drive progress over perfection but with calculated risk-taking
Analytical thinkers, with the ability to synthesize and simplify complex information to drive progress
Highly adaptable to new methods and ways of working, highly collaborative putting team results over personal gain
Able to navigate organizational matrix, challenging the status quo to drive speed to learning
Passionate about modelling the entrepreneurial mindset and approach
Responsibilities:
Share responsibility with other co-founder(s) to oversee extended team of 20+ with about 3-5 direct reports
Lead the venture’s growth strategy and execution of sales and business development efforts
Act as the venture’s evangelist and spokesperson in marketing outreach and customer development
Oversee and drive growth across lead generation, conversion, retention and referrals
Build and execute a customer acquisition strategy, including offline and online channels, as applicable
Collaborate with the marketing team on creating all necessary collateral to drive sales
Develop tools and techniques to measure and understand the effectiveness of growth initiatives
Leverage startup methodologies to unearth deep customer insights
Utilize best practices in primary and secondary market research, prototyping, and experimentation
Continuously synthesize learnings to collaboratively determine the path forward
Be an internal champion for the innovation process to clearly and effectively model entrepreneurial behaviors
Report to the Incubator Leadership and other key Munich Re stakeholders on the venture’s progress and hurdles to growth
Support the development and execution of strategies to create a scalable business
Qualifications
The successful candidate will possess the following skills/capabilities:
8 to 12+ years of experience in business development, business strategy, product development, and/or sales development in a corporation or startup
Bachelor’s Degree required (in business, marketing, and/or related field), MBA preferred, but not essential
Experience in one or more of the following:
Senior leadership team of a startup during formation and/or commercialization phase
Experience with B2B marketing, communications and sales strategy, including relationship, strategic and/or technical sales
Experience working within and/or managing a team of sales and marketing employees, including carrying an annual ‘book of business’
Knowledge of ESG (environmental, social, and governance) frameworks and or prior experience in the sustainability space would be a big plus
Proven success in breaking down complex problems into hypotheses, developing clear plans for validation, using data to refine concepts
Superior interpersonal, presentation and communication skills across all levels of senior management, including the executive levels.
Able to translate technical/entrepreneurial jargon making it actionable & clear
Proven ability to challenge the status quo and drive innovation, totally comfortable operating in ambiguous and unregimented environments
Highly motivated and action-oriented with strong problem solving and analytical skills

At Munich Re US, we see Diversity and Inclusion as a solution to the challenges and opportunities all around us. Our goal is to foster an inclusive culture and build a workforce that reflects the customers we serve and the communities in which we live and work. We strive to provide a workplace where all of our colleagues feel respected, valued and empowered to achieve their very best every day. We recruit and develop talent with a focus on providing our customers the most innovative products and services.

We are an equal opportunity employer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Additional Information
The base salary range anticipated for this position is $182,900 - $268,200, plus opportunity for company bonus based upon a percentage of eligible pay. In addition, the company makes available a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, 401k match, retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Company Name
Munich Re America Services
Requisition Number
5791BR
Country
United States of America
Employment Type
Full Time
Area of Expertise
Miscellaneous"]

['Our Purpose', '', 'We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a\nculture of inclusion\nfor all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.', '', 'Job Title', '', '', '', '', '']

['Business Development Representative', 'About Paymentus', 'Paymentus was born from a desire to improve the way bills get paid. Vision, innovation and exemplary service have propelled Paymentus to become the leading paperless electronic billing and payment solution on the market, and our proudly serving the needs of many of the largest billers in North America.', 'We know that in order to keep our solutions current and relevant, we need people with the know-how, drive and proclivity for fostering a supremely happy customer experience. Our highly committed, creative employees turned an idea into a secure, SAAS-based Customer Engagement and Payment Platform; one that enables direct-bill organizations to provide a unified customer experience and boost adoption of cost-saving electronic billing and payment services.', 'Recognized by Deloitte to be among the fastest growing North American companies for 4 years, Paymentus consistently strives to develop better, faster, more secure, cost-efficient billing and payment platforms. We continually seek higher value for our customers, in both solutions and service.', 'Summary/Objective', 'Introducing prospects to our portfolio of next generation electronic bill payment solutions - and helping them understand their transformative potential - is the role of the Demand Generation Team.', "Business Development Representatives, the ‘execution’ arm of the Demand Generation team are key members of the go-to-market team, peered with account executives and responsible for the early to mid-stage opportunity development. The Entry Level Business Development role at Payments is an early career role, and an important step on any professional sales executive’s career journey. In this role, you'll become comfortable with account development, engaging high level business and technical decision makers, and the ability to identify and develop opportunities as part of a high performing sales team.", 'Assigned to an industry and a set of named accounts, the BDR function owns progress and success in developing the revenue pipeline in that space.', 'The Business Development Representative has an interest in B2B enterprise back-office technology, and/or FinTech solutions and you demonstrate an acumen for translating product features capabilities into benefits relevant to every member of the buying committee.']

['Req ID
FY23|G&A|#4807

Fully Remote (works exclusively from home), Hybrid (works from home and New Relic office throughout the week), Office (works primarily in a New Relic office)', "Your opportunity
Are you an experienced professional who wants to join a collaborative Finance team looking to build the infrastructure for our next leg of incredible growth? We seek someone who will embrace the challenges and opportunities of joining a fast-growing company aiming to become a $1B enterprise!

We are seeking a finance professional who is proactive and can challenge the norm, but who will also listen to others and collaborate to support the company goals. The Senior FP&A Manager of Analytics reports to the FP&A Director and will be a key partner to the Analytics team! This is a highly visible role that includes frequent interaction with senior management. The Senior FP&A Manager will have the ability to interact effectively across the company and within the Analytics organization.

Opportunity to work from a remote office may be available depending on applicant location.
What you'll do
Be the finance representative and Single Source of Truth for consumption related reporting and forecasting
Act as the Finance business partner to one or more Senior Leadership team members at NR
Drive the weekly/monthly reporting and forecasting activities in conjunction with the Analytics team leaders and objectives and prepare and analyze variances based on actual performance
Own and maintain the company’s mid term consumption revenue model
Own and maintain the accuracy and completeness of finance tables Snowflake
Perform ad hoc analysis on analyzing the health of the company’s install as it relates to consumption, providing meaningful and useful insight to the relevant team member
Create operational improvements in our ability to pull and analyze data from our Enterprise Data Warehouse, with the utilization of Looker
Develop financial models, track, and analyze financial KPIs/OKRs, uncover trends and assess business risks and opportunities to provide recommendations to senior leaders
Manager and Develop one other Analyst direct report
Partner and collaborate with GTM Operations teams to understand each account’s consumption patterns and trends
Prepare succinct and clear executive presentations that simplify complex topics and are often time-sensitive
Put together customized analysis to drive alignment on regional / department goals
Stay current with the latest SaaS industry trends
Ensure quality and accuracy of results
Seek opportunities for operational improvement across the organization
This role requires
7+ years of finance or FP&A experience in the technology sector, specifically SaaS
Analytical and problem-solving skills and experience resolving complex business problems with well-structured analytics and Expert Excel modeling
Ability to adapt to a dynamic, constantly evolving business environment
Outstanding presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities, that will drive alignment and resolution of critical business issues
Strong executive presence and ability to deliver compelling messages to executives to drive effective decision making
High ability to work under pressure with short and squeezed deadlines
Intermediate SQL experience
Experience working with Dashboarding tools such as Looker or Tableau
Bonus points if you have
Experience with Top line forecasting for consumption-based saas business
Demonstrated strategic thought leadership
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives
Team oriented, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible
Proven ability to be decisive and committed regarding decisions affecting the business and the team
Experience with Salesforce, Zuora, and/or Netsuite", "We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. ['The Senior Developer is responsible for providing guidance and direction to Application Development colleagues, along with expert level support for development activities. They work directly with colleagues and clients to develop solutions that leverage technology to meet the needs of the business. The Senior Developer is able to take on expert level development activities to support and maintain .NET applications using C#. This role focuses on both front-end UI and backend business logic. They collaborate with Business Analysts, Project Managers, Product Development, Sales teams, and internal colleagues to build out new products, support existing/new channels of distribution, provide improved solutions for internal colleagues, and correct defects within technology platforms.', '', 'Principal Responsibilities:', 'Facilitates the development process to build out new features in a cloud-based SaaS environment.
Assists other development colleagues at various stages of experience, teaching / coaching through tasks, and assisting in code reviews.
Work with client development teams to facilitate the creation and maintenance of custom integration points between BRP and client.
Serve as a technology expert for clients, vendors, claims administrators, carriers, and internal colleagues.
Build technology solutions to support the sales and service of a variety of insurance products.
Develop and implement solutions that meet web design/client requirements to help build and/or maintain websites through team and individual efforts.
Adapt to new languages, methodologies, and platforms to meet the needs of projects.
Expert level understanding of UI, cross-browser/mobile compatibility, general web functions and standards.
Review existing applications and make changes and/or address application issues.
Maintain, design, build efficient, reusable, and reliable code for .NET based applications with an MVC / JavaScript front end. Basic understanding of security principles and how they apply to E-Commerce applications.
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues to ensure an error-free experience.', '', 'Education, Experience, Skills and Abilities Requirements:', 'Bachelor’s degree in a technology related field preferred', '5+ years equivalent development experience
Strong knowledge of SQL, database design, and ORMs
Experience in utilizing design patterns to build out well organized code product
Experience in performing code reviews and utilizing agile development tools
Experience in using cloud development, in particular Software as a Service
Strong communication and organization skills demonstrated by the ability to lead engagement and problem-solving sessions
Ability to demonstrate the firm’s core values, exuding behavior that is aligned with the corporate culture.', '', 'Special Working Conditions:']

column7: ['', '', '', '', 'When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.', 'We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.', 'Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.', 'We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you would like accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know at +1.888.404.2494, Option 1.', 'Disclaimer:', '']

['VP of Finance and Accounting', 'Full-Time, Exempt', 'Location: Scottsdale, AZ', 'OTE: $130,000 to $160,000', 'The VP of Finance will be a key financial partner for the management team of Lumifi. This new role will be working with the CEO to help build and transform the finance function, with ownership of the investor data and shared information. This role will also be a key strategic partner with the Executive team of the privately-held company to scale growth and execute strategic initiatives. Key responsibilities will include leading the company’s financial planning, forecasting and analysis processes, leading the company’s long-range planning and budgeting cycle, cash flow forecasting, performing business intelligence and preparing management reporting, managing the effective use of finance systems and data management, delivering value-added business analyses, as well as, defining and reporting meaningful financial and operational metrics that lead to insightful, accurate business decision-making. You’ll own FP&A, accounting, and financial operations. Ultimately, your work will enhance our internal decision-making, particularly as it relates to resource allocation. This position is based out of our Scottsdale, AZ office.', 'Primary Duties:', 'FP&A', 'Lead, review, and manage the annual budgeting and forecasting cycle, long-range strategic plan, provide periodic business analysis and provide financial support for strategic initiatives
Review, guide, manage and approve forecasts, monthly performance reviews, periodic business reviews, annual budgets
Design and implement financial planning systems, modeling scenarios, variances and dashboards
Monitor the profitability of product lines and assist in determining the appropriate allocation of resources to growth initiatives.
Create effective performance metrics to drive accountability and ownership within the organization', 'Treasury', 'Responsible for cash flow forecasting and management
Manage liquidity and working capital
Manage banking relationships and wire transfers']

['Sr Implementation & Onboarding Manager', '', '', 'Role: Full Time', 'Location: San Francisco Bay Area, Remote', '', '', 'About us: BoostUp.ai is the first Intelligent Revenue Management Platform built for the digital-selling and remote sales era.', '', '']

['The Vice President of Enterprise Applications is responsible for providing enterprise wide, strategic direction for the Application Development & Support function within Flowers IT. Responsibilities span from cycle planning of business applications through the phases of strategize, architect, select, deploy, operate, evolve, and retire, to working in close collaboration with the other IT Leadership members and/or their teams.
The VP of Enterprise Applications is responsible for the operationalization of IT processes across the company to determine where new development is required or where implementation of packaged solutions is preferred. The VP also rationalizes the enterprise application suite to improve functionality, eliminate redundances and reduce costs.
The scope of responsibilities includes, but is not limited to, SAP applications, 3rd party ‘Enterprise Solutions’, and other traditional IT Application components across Corporate, Bakery/Warehouse Operations, Sales & Marketing, Retail Stores and other transformation-related initiatives throughout the company’s markets.
The VP will lead and manage the relationships and operational integration of third-party managed / Application services Vendors, Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) providers and Cloud vendors. Additionally, this role partners closely with other organizations, project teams/leadership, and stakeholders to ensure that Flowers maximizes the SAP / non-SAP Enterprise Application investments efficiently and consistently in order to support the broader Flowers ecosystem and business needs.
Position requires a leader with the ability to work well with others, harness different skills/experience, and build a strong sense of team.
Position requires a leader with the ability to lead collaboratively across IT and with the business unit on planning and key initiatives or processes.
Job Responsibilities
STRATEGY
Provide leadership, vision, and direction to the applications organization to ensure continued contribution to the company achieving its goals.
Work with CIO and other IT leaders to develop overall IT strategy that enables business strategy.
Define clear application business transformation vision that enables business innovation
Assess the relative impact of IT industry trends to current and future ERP needs and projects.
Drive the vision, strategy, roadmap, and implementation of performance indicators, supporting metrics and trends for the application and SAP solutions.
Interface with business unit executives, BRM, Enterprise Architecture and other IT functional area executives to define Enterprise Application initiatives to address business needs and solutions for improving service efficiency and effectiveness.
PLANNING & GOVERNANCE
Work with the PMO to establish and operate a project portfolio management and budget management process that deploys, tracks, and adjusts program and project resources
Work with the BRM to establish a joint business/IT governance process to prioritize and gain approval for IT investments
Accountable for portfolio life cycle and implementation approach to achieve continuous integration, continuous delivery, and automation through the DevOps pipeline
Operationalize processes to oversee application specifications and deployment strategy
Establish metrics, key performance indicators and service level agreements for driving the performance of IT service delivery
Work with the PMO to support the planning and execution of integration of new technologies into the application landscape
Direct and coach team members in project role responsibilities aligned with PMO standards
Direct the preparation, review and consolidation of IT business plans, budgets, and forecasts.
MANAGEMENT / EXECUTION
Oversee the build / configurations of solutions and specifications based on business goals, user journeys, designs, and technical requirements, in adherence with technical standards, procedures and policies
Proactively research and recommend courses of action to prevent problems and to maintain high application availability service levels for the user community
Drive the performance management of the applications organization (including staffing, budgeting, and other relevant management functions) and hold all application delivery teams accountable for optimizing the cost, risk and value of the suite of applications throughout their life cycle; and ensure that assets achieve their full lifetime cycle value
Develop and manage strategic vendor partnerships to achieve service level, risk, financial and other operational performance goals; developing a collaborative, harmonious environment between our partners and our internal teams in both applications and across IT where relevant; supporting the negotiation of contracts and agreements, as needed
Regularly review IT costs and cost structures for Applications services and products, to assess opportunities to optimize spending
Job Responsibilities
ORGANIZATION
Attract, develop, manage and retain top talent to continually improve enterprise IT capabilities necessary to increase performance of the organization; playing a key role in performance management and compensation processes, role and competency definition, and diversity, equity, and inclusion
Direct teams of technical, professional and management staff in the successful fulfillment of IT service delivery commitments; ensuring a balance between tactical and strategic demands
Develop workforce strategy to meet the organization’s current and future Enterprise Application needs through developing, hiring, and/or sourcing talent, cost effectively
Partner with Human Resources to create learning and development opportunities that are aligned to the organization’s skill and capability needs
Build and nurture a culture that supports learning, collaboration, transparency, and inclusiveness
Ensure compliance with all company policies and procedures (EEO, Sexual Harassment, Sarbanes – Oxley, Safety, etc.)
Perform other duties deemed by management to be an integral part of the job, including, but not limited to fulfillment of work schedules, adherence to attendance policies, and other applicable operating rules, policies, and procedures
Desired Experience
The following experience is considered essential:
10+ years’ experience in IT and business/industry experience of five to seven years of leadership responsibilities in a technology domain.
10 + years managing multiple, large, cross-functional teams or projects, and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders.
10+ years of demonstrated leadership experience building cross-organizational consensus with exposure to technology providers and/or business clients.
10+ years’ leadership experience in areas such as building and leading SAP and adjacent application architecture and governance functions at an enterprise level including the creation of architecture standards, reference architectures and data models.

Desired Education
An undergraduate or postgraduate degree in computer science, engineering, finance, business management or a related field.', 'We offer a competitive salary and an excellent total rewards package. Please reply by 01/25/2023. Resumes are active for 30 days. Interested job seekers who successfully complete the series of pre-screening questions and who appear to possess the basic qualifications for this position may be contacted for a telephone interview.', '', 'Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disability', '', 'If you need assistance with submitting your resume due to a medical condition or disability, please send an e-mail to HR.LSFlowers@flocorp.com.']

column7:
["At Particle Health, we aim to enable simple and secure access to actionable healthcare data for digital health innovators.
We are shaping the new healthcare data exchange and interoperability standard with a user-friendly API platform. We create intuitive experiences for developers, build scalable infrastructure product teams love, drive valuable insights for clinicians, and collaborate with innovative leaders launching data-driven healthcare solutions.
With a recent Series B close led by Canvas Ventures, there's never been a better time to join!
Our customers are the leading digital health companies disrupting and changing the Healthcare industry.
Together, we can #destroythefaxmachine.", 'About the Role:', 'As a Software Engineer at Particle Health, you will work on some of our most challenging technology projects as we continue to push the technology and the industry forward. Distributed healthcare data networks and exchanges are complex spaces to operate: standards and legislation are constantly evolving, data is becoming more available as interoperability standards become widely adopted, and new data providers are continually coming online. You will design, build, and deliver software that drives customer demand for new products and platform capabilities in this space.', 'The primary architectural paradigm of the Engineering Team is event-driven, distributed systems, where decoupled web services communicate with one another over HTTP and Protobufs and where asynchronous messages are sent using queues. Owning a single feature might mean interacting with different benefits.', 'At Particle Health, engineers revolutionize access to electronic medical records and routinely work on industry data standards, massive-scale engineering challenges, and national health technology policy.', 'Areas of Responsibility:', 'Lead and contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around the health data interoperability space.
Design and build advanced automated build, test, and release infrastructure.
Drive adoption of best practices in code health, testing, and maintainability.
Analyze and decompose complex software systems and collaborate to influence design for testability.
Facilitate and contribute to architectural design conversations with other engineering team members.
Partner with cross-functional members of other teams, including Product, Sales Engineering, and Customer Support.', 'Qualifications:', 'Required:', 'Have 4+ years of experience in software engineering at a SaaS or consumer services product company, writing code in the following programming languages: Go, Python, JavaScript, or Node.js.
Experience building technology platforms using a modern cloud infrastructure provider is a must. Particle Health uses Google Cloud Provider (GCP), but experience with any current provider, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure, works for us.
A bias towards action; you make data-driven decisions and deliver code to move the needle on critical technical initiatives.
Can hold others accountable without placing blame while being receptive to feedback from your peers.']
