column7:
["Who We Are

Ontic is a protective intelligence software innovator transforming, expanding and changing how Fortune 500 and emerging enterprises protect employees, customers and assets from physical security threats. Ontic’s SaaS platform helps preserve business continuity and build long-term organizational resilience by collecting and connecting data to create a comprehensive view of potential threats and take necessary actions to mitigate risks. Ontic also provides threat assessment, threat management and strategic intelligence services that include expert training, guidance and program development using best practices and proven protocols. Ontic was named 2022 Global Entrepreneurial Company of the Year by Frost & Sullivan and the top industry innovator among a dozen other vendors in the Frost Radar™: Digital Intelligence Solutions, 2021.

The Ontic Center for Protective Intelligence is a trusted resource for those in the security, safety and protection communities that shares strategies and best practices, insights on current and historical trends and lessons learned through dialogue, discourse and alternative analysis from some of the industry's top practitioners.

As Ontic employees, we put our mission first and value the trust bestowed upon us by our clients to help keep their people safe. We approach both our clients and each other with empathy while focusing on the execution of our strategy. And we have fun doing it.

Who You Are
Ontic is looking for an experienced quota-carrying Enterprise Account Executive to play a key role in accelerating our revenue growth.

As an Ontic Enterprise Account Executive, you will be responsible for generating increased demand for the Ontic product, qualifying new expansion prospects and pitching our products to senior contacts to meet annual targets. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of meeting and exceeding quota targets and ideally have experience in selling SAAS enterprise solutions, preferably in the Corporate Security space. As an individual who both represents Ontic and drives revenue, you must be a self-starting closer who can create a large pipeline of business within a short period of time and work with existing clients as well as new logo opportunities.", "Responsibilities
Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of defined accounts
Provide business development and thought leadership through opportunity identification to grow new business, driving new solutions and incremental business success
Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas
Demonstrate Ontic's platform to audiences ranging from senior Corporate Security and Executive Protection contacts to the end user level
Work with Ontic internal teams to ensure client value realization and 100% retention
Represent Ontic as a domain and product expert at client interactions, industry and corporate events, and through community sites and social media.
As an early team member, excited about shaping an evolving team and welcoming the opportunities associated with it", 'Preferred Qualifications
A proven sales hunter and closer
10+ years of outside enterprise software sales experience
A passion for Ontic’s mission
Strong preference for Corporate Security or Executive Protection acumen
Strong solution selling experience with the aptitude to demonstrate strong product knowledge
Be able to work proactively and as part of a team in a high functioning environment
Outstanding professional presence and business acumen

Salary: $130,000 annual base salary
Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry and are one part of a total compensation package that also includes benefits and other perks at Ontic. This role also includes an uncapped commission plan and a company equity grant.', 'Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Ontic we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Ontic Benefits & Perks
Competitive Salary
Medical, Vision & Dental Benefits
401k
Stock Options
HSA Contribution
Learning Stipend
Flexible PTO Policy
Monthly ME (Mental Escape) day for all employees
Generous Parental Leave policy
Home Office Stipend
Mobile Phone Reimbursement
Home Internet Reimbursement for Remote Employees
Anniversary & Milestone Celebrations

Ontic is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a work environment that celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate against any individual based on race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors protected by applicable law.']

['Ramp is building the next generation of finance tools—from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations—designed to save businesses time and money with every click. Over 12,000 customers cut their expenses by 3.5% per year and close their books 8x faster by switching to the Ramp platform.', 'Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment software in America and enables billions of dollars of purchases each year. Ramp continues to grow quickly, more than doubling its revenue run rate in the first half of 2022.', "Valued at $8.1 billion, Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. Ramp was named Fast Company’s most innovative finance company in 2022 and #5 on LinkedIn Top Startups 2022.", 'About the Role', 'You will be a front-line manager to a group of 5-8 Account Managers who will each manage a book of 50 to 250 customers. You will be responsible for 1:1 coaching and driving the strategy of a new team. Your role will be very cross functional - working with leaders across Sales, Marketing, Ops, Risk, Product, and leadership.', 'What You’ll Do', 'Manage a group of 5-8 Account Managers and provide them with daily 1:1 mentorship
Ensure team exceeds spend activation, product activation, retention, expansion, and customer health goals
Set and maintain a high-performing culture
Improve team output and efficiency over time by finding better ways to utilize systems and processes
Create forecasts and analyze performance data
Report on team performance and forecast to senior leadership
Develop and execute career development and leadership
Oversee the daily activities and quota performance management of individual AMs to ensure key performance metrics are met
Partner with Ops to create and polish existing metrics that evaluate the individual and team’s performance
Build dashboards (in Salesforce / and other tools) to monitor the success of our customers and the performance of the team
Hire and quickly train new AMs on Ramp product knowledge, buyer personas, competition, tools, training, and plenty of role-plays
Coach and mentor your team on sales skills, provide call feedback, and lead enablement sessions
Represent the AM team cross-functionally with leaders of other departments
Establish a library of playbook resources for the AM team
Maintain a high-performance AM team culture and morale (work hard, play hard, rest hard)', "What You'll Need", '4+ years of experience building and leading high-performing quota carrying sales or account management teams with a proven track record of exceeding goal
Success in fast-paced, results-oriented GTM environments, ideally at SaaS companies.
2+ years of quota carrying sales or account management experience as an individual contributor, with proven, consistent track-record exceeding goal. Cross and upsell experience is a plus.
Ability to use data and analytics to make decisions and to help create systems and make process improvement to scale the team and improve efficiency
Strong collaboration and influencing skills demonstrated through superior communication and presentation skills
Excitement for recruiting and a thoughtful approach to team planning and development
Strong ability to articulate contractual, technical, and financial value points to customers, including executive leaders
A strong track record of negotiating, structuring and executing complex sales agreements
Proficient in data-analytics tools like Salesforce, Looker, and Excel
You are known for your tremendous work ethic, service leadership, and commitment', 'Nice to Have']

["Be unstoppable with us!
T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!
The Director of 5G Business Internet Product Development is a strategist, customer evangelist, respected leader of execution, and professional relationship builder who is passionate about driving innovative and transformational business internet solutions. Reporting to the VP of Advanced Wireless Solutions, in this role, you will be ultimately accountable, responsible, and have ownership of T-Mobile's fixed wireless access and connected computing products and services to offer innovative solutions and engage senior leadership across the entirety of industries in T-Mobile’s customer base.

As Director of Business Internet, you will develop a team that conducts market research; generates product requirements; determine specifications; defines the long-term strategy of the product; creates the product road map; helps drive and support technical delivery end to end; define the scope for releases/product increments; partnering with T-Mobile’s Marketing, Sales and Technology teams as well as external partners.

You will also be T-Mobile for Business’s champion and leader for Business Internet where you will build and maintain strong high-level relationships with our current and potential customers. You will drive senior executive relationships through your extensive knowledge and industry solutions. This includes determining the most effective go-to-market and partnership collaboration strategies.

You will work closely with T-Mobile and its partners to facilitate high-level meetings between executives and key stakeholders to promote and advocate for Business Internet business objectives. In addition, you will help deliver customer trials and solutions, working to investigate, collaborate, deploy, and support on-site customer Business Internet use cases, documenting and demonstrating to our customers their return on investment and a realization of the value of T-Mobile’s Business Internet solution portfolio.

Our ideal candidate will have a breadth of industry knowledge and experience including technical/consultative-selling, transformation, and problem-solving skills.

This person will demonstrate exceptional collaboration, communication, strategic, analytical, program development/execution as well as a proven track record of success in function.
Job Responsibilities:
Lead the identification, pursuit, and business development of fixed wireless access and connected compute solutions, partners and prospects to support T-Mobile’s product ecosystem.
Drive GTM and solution motions to industry-leading enterprises across business verticals (industrial, retail, entertainment, venue, transportation, etc.).
Work with leadership and cross-functional peers to formulate and execute against go-to-market strategies.
Build, mentor and lead a team of Product Managers to deliver solutions that meet the business goals of the organization.
Assess and develop new connectivity and compute products and services tied to new &/or under-penetrated verticals of focus.
Build and nurture C-level relationships across key targets to further solidify position and commitment to new prospects and/or partner relationships.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Sales-Operations, Sales, Product Management and Engineering to make accurate, informed decisions.
Understand T-Mobile’s broader corporate strategies to facilitate prioritization of business development initiatives aligned to product roadmap priorities.
Provide executive program oversight and ongoing partner communication.
Work within a driven and highly motivated team to provide a world-class partner experience to T-Mobile’s enterprise and government customers.
Collaborate with key stakeholders in the organization to identify and drive critical business opportunities.
Manage and evolve a roadmap of partnership technical activities based on a strong understanding of Business Internet product managers and customer needs.
Ensure proper collaboration with internal organizations for execution.
Stay current with leading technology businesses and initiatives.
Manage all aspects of technical integration of partnerships ensuring value is created for both parties.
Work Experience:
10 plus years of work experience plus 5 years or more of technology product management and/or solution sales experience preferably in telecommunications or related SaaS/High Tech industry
Understanding and insights into new services and features that can be enabled in next generation fixed wireless technology and/or Enterprise connectivity solutions in wireless or wireline
In-depth subject matter expertise in several core wireless technology-related product areas including wireless RAN technologies (LTE, 5G), mid-band 2.5 GHz Spectrum, cellular chipsets, cellular devices, IP networking, and IP security
Well versed in service-based technology trends, ideally involving licensed and/or un-licensed radio spectrum
Track record in transforming one-time-sale business to recurring service-based business model
Consistent track record of leading large, distributed teams delivering production-quality solutions on a tight schedule
Significant experience in engaging and facilitating dialogue with C-level and senior executives at Fortune 1000 businesses
Excellent communication skills (written/verbal) that are leveraged to address complex business issues, negotiations, and opportunities
Experience-based Issue Resolution skills that facilitate dialogue across all levels of a business including the C-suite
Ability to prioritize deliverables and projects to meet timelines efficiently, to adapt to changes in priorities quickly, and to structure and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously with a focus on a drive to completion and tangible impact
Bachelor’s Degree; Masters Preferred
Ability to travel as necessary
Enough about what you’ve done. Let’s talk about who you are.

Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally, collaborating effectively with a wide variety of internal stakeholders and external agencies
Strong self-starter with the ability to build a network within the organization and ability to manage deadlines and priorities
Success in working in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently and in a strong, collaborative team environment and to deliver on detail as well as strategy
Strong communication and people skills
Agile and Adaptive
Listens and understands a variety of points of view balancing concerns with data for better decision making
Analytical problem solver; applies multiple technical solutions to application operational problems
Collaborative, yet influential
Desire for a high level of responsibility and ownership and ability to work with minimal supervision
#LI-Corporate
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless precluded from doing so by applicable law. The CDC currently defines “fully vaccinated” as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination, and will consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase (1) as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others, or (2) for other reasons under applicable law.
Washington Pay Range: $168,300 - $227,700
The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the state listed. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay may be above or below this range.
At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee’s eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance, while Retail and Business Sales roles are eligible for monthly or quarterly sales incentives. And since we are ALL owners, EVERY employee at T-Mobile is eligible for an Annual Stock Grant. For information about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out https://careers.t-mobile.com/culture-and-benefits/
Travel:
Travel Required (Yes/No):Yes

T-Mobile's Commitment
Never stop growing!
T-Mobile doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward.

If you’d like to receive more information about careers at T-Mobile, sign up for the T-Mobile Talent Community today! https://www.tmobile.careers/profile/join/

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests."]

['', '', 'About the Role', 'As an Enterprise Drone Services Sales Specialist, you will be a primary driver for landing new clients and expanding our business into a variety of commercial industries. You will qualify the increasing volume of inbound leads from marketing activity, while also working within our sales team to actively prospect into strategic accounts. This is a unique opportunity to join and shape a fast-growing sales team and accelerate the growth of ConnexiCore and the commercial UAS drone industry as a whole.', 'Responsibilities', 'Identify new business development opportunities and grow them into stable customers from pre-solicitation through post contract award.
Achieve monthly quotas of leads qualified, meetings set, and opportunities created.
Follow-up with generated leads (including leads from the website, digital campaigns, events, press and other on-going marketing programs) to qualify and deliver leads to the sales team.
Strategically prospect into key account targets, which includes: researching and identifying key contacts and new industry segments, contacting prospects to generate initial interest via phone, email, and other means, and setting meetings.
Attend key industry events to qualify and meet prospects in-person, and communicate the Volatus Aerospace value proposition in a fast-paced tradeshow environment.
Maintain expert knowledge of Volatus Aerospace products and marketing messaging to demonstrate the products and articulate the value propositions effectively and persuasively.
Work closely with the marketing team in developing new ways to increase awareness and evolve and improve the lead qualification process.
Be a strong promoter of our products, services, and brand in the target market.
Stay informed about customer use cases, market opportunities and post-process customer learnings to contribute to strategy development.
Prepare and update account strategy and sales forecasts to show continued penetration, upsell, and expansion opportunities.
Build a pipeline to meet and exceed your sales targets with direct accountability on a quarterly and annual basis.
Develop a deep understanding of your customer’s business, workflows and pain points.
Coordinate with the Operations Team to ensure customer milestones are met.
Gather intelligence on competitor activity.', 'Qualifications', 'Minimum 1 year of successful enterprise software, hardware, or SaaS sales experience.
Strong business acumen and comfort with presenting to, and establishing relationships with, senior-level executives in enterprise-level companies.
Confident, articulate, and professional speaking abilities, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
The ability to demonstrate a strong aptitude for both selling and building lasting relationships with customers.
Comfortable driving both large enterprise opportunities with long sales cycles and dynamically closing smaller faster-paced inbound opportunities.
Fast learner, well structured, persuasive, independent, and at ease negotiating and developing trust.
Familiarity with using a CRM', 'Not required, but a plus', 'Active professionally on social media (primarily LinkedIn).
Cross-functional team player with experience collaborating with Operations, Marketing, and Business Development teams.
Current FAA Part-107 remote pilot certificate
Minimum of 1 year of experience operating various UAV platforms with verifiable flight time.
Experience with a wide variety of sensors, such as Lidar, EO/IR cameras, and multi/hyperspectral.
Experience with DroneDeploy, PIX4D, UgCS, and other photogrammetry software.
Familiarity with US and Canadian Airspace.
Familiarity with GIS, surveying, construction, and critical infrastructure.']

['The Company
Checkbox is a Sequoia-backed technology start-up with a mission to empower anyone to build software. This is important to us because with our rapidly digitising world, we believe the power of digital creation needs to be accessible to everyone, not just IT teams. Seeing non-technical users surprisingly delighted when they are able to create in ways they never thought they ever could using our technology, motivates us. Across the enterprise, users use drag and drop to build their own solutions that automate manual workflows, analysis, and document creation. Since launching the product at the beginning of 2019, we have signed on big brands like Deloitte, Telstra, Allianz and Coca-Cola, winning 14 awards globally. As a team, we have incredible talent that have previously led global SaaS success stories and Co-Founders in the Forbes 30 Under 30 list. As people, we are high performers who are positive, collaborative, open and direct in our communication, and care a lot about this business and each other.
The Position
This role involves working with in-house legal teams to understand their challenges and aligning value from the Checkbox no code workflow automation software to result in license sales. As part of a scaling start-up, you are expected to be a resourceful, independent hunter who is able to effectively qualify and close new opportunities without the backing of a universally known brand or robust sales infrastructure. You will work closely with a Sales Development Representative (SDR) and will be supported by a Pre-Sales Engineer and the Marketing team. You need to be able to confidently and successfully lead, navigate and close a complex sales process involving stakeholders at all levels of the enterprise. The right person for the role will be able to build strong relationships and constructively challenge the thinking of senior decision-makers and champions within legal teams such as the Chief Legal Officer, General Counsel, Head of Legal Operations, as well as stakeholders in IT and procurement.
As one of our first ever US team members, you’ll be given the exciting opportunity to build and contribute to the organization’s go-to-market strategy, culture and success, and will be working closely with the CEO to do so.
In this position, you will:
+ Deliver against quota (license revenue only) with a strong emphasis on new business sales to in-house legal teams
+ Work with your SDR to convert meetings booked into opportunities and new license revenue
+ Forecast, manage, execute & report on your sales plan
+ Log and maintain accurate and detailed reporting and notes on sales activity and opportunities in the CRM
Requirements
The ideal candidate would exhibit the following:
ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS
+ At least 5+ years of experience selling SaaS technology to enterprise companies
+ Proven track record of delivering consistently or exceeding sales quotas
+ Strong experience in consultative, enterprise solution sales
+ Comfortable with objection handling enterprise IT, procurement, and budget objections
+ Have worked as an SDR or worked directly with SDRs
+ Sharp, quick & adaptable learner who is results driven and is a consistent high achiever
+ Able to work resourcefully and independently to deliver results
BONUSES
+ Experience selling software to in-house legal teams
+ Experience selling automation or workflow or low/no code technology
+ Existing network of leads in the corporate in-house legal space
+ Has a legal education background or previous career as a lawyer
Benefits
+ Remote working arrangements
+ Health, vision and dental insurance paid for by company
+ 4 weeks of paid leave
Compensation will vary based on experience but will consist of salary and commission.', 'Want to jump on board?
If you find this exciting and think you have what it takes, we would love to meet you. Please contact us at careers@checkbox.ai with your CV.']

["Be unstoppable with us!
T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!
Sr Product Manager, Partner Integration is a visionary, strategist, analyst, customer evangelist, respected leader of business and technology execution, and professional relationship builder all rolled into a single dynamic package. The Sr Product Manager will be responsible for identifying the intersection of customer problems/unmet needs (an opportunity), technical feasibility, business objectives and leading a cross-functional business and technical team, as well as key stakeholders to deliver against the opportunity.

The Sr Product Manager, Partner Integration will be responsible for partnering with Strategic Partners in identifying, evaluating and prototyping solutions for integration into the TfB Advanced Network Solutions portfolio.
Job Responsibilities:
Leads design, proposal creations, integration, configuration, implementation, enablement and management of the technical solution of trial solution efforts across a portfolio of customers, locations, partners, and ISV’s
Scout, identify and/or create new business opportunities and partnerships: a) identify and analyze complex market/business opportunities, b) evaluate key players and technologies, c) assess customer and market opportunities, d) develop differentiated product/service strategies, and e) create potential economic/financial/business models
Partnering with global system integrators, RAN & core vendors, edge computing solution providers, ISV’s, and driving AI-based end-to-end wireless solutions
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Sales-Operations, Sales, Product Management and Engineering to make accurate, informed decisions
Participate in various internal and external innovation programs, evaluating emerging technologies and formulate recommendations and lead reviews to cross-functional teams
Manage and evolve a roadmap of partnership technical activities based on a strong understanding of 5G ANS and IoT product management and customer needs
Conducts cost-benefit / ROI / NPV analysis, to support decision making.
Stay current with leading technology businesses and initiatives
Anticipates industry trends, direction, innovation, analyses potential impacts or opportunities to customer / product, and incorporates analyses into product process.
Also responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.
Education
Bachelor's Degree
Computer Science, Engineering, IT or equivalent experience required
Experience Required
6+ years experience with a strong background in cellular networks or cloud computing and a deep understanding of Systems Integration
7+ years IT or telecommunications technology product management and/or technical sales experience and/or related SaaS/High Tech industry experience
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required
Technology
Good knowledge of the latest developments in emerging technologies e.g. AI/ML, IoT, AR/VR, Edge computing
Product Management
Experience in delivering large and complex business/technology initiatives as Product Manager or lead technology role.
Communication
Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including executives and non-technical leaders.
Consultative Selling
Strong strategic Consultative Selling and Customer Relationship management experience focusing on Enterprise B2B and B2C partner segments
Business Analysis
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data and use the data to drive decisions.
Integration
Knowledge and experience with integration patterns, API’s, and protocols such as REST, EDI, SOAP, etc.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless precluded from doing so by applicable law. The CDC currently defines “fully vaccinated” as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. And since we are ALL owners, EVERY employee at T-Mobile is eligible for an Annual Stock Grant. Let’s have a conversation; succinct, but specific.', '… If you’ve been a vendor, calling on decision makers for variable ops SaaS, with a 50% “farming” responsibility, who can cross-train on agnostic solutions, including process and business model insights, we’d like to hear of your qualifications and expertise.']

["Who we are:

Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work™.” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Geotab cares about your safety. You may be required to be vaccinated based on the nature of your work (ex: travel requirements) or due to changing local governmental health requirements.

Who you are:

The Senior Product Manager, Insurance will direct product development from conception to launch and is responsible for discovering, developing and carefully cultivating new products and on-going product enhancements that support Geotab’s business models and continued growth in the insurance & risk management industry.

If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader — we would love to hear from you!

What you'll do:

The Senior Product Manager, Insurance will ultimately build Geotab’s customer intelligence by identifying which ideas and opportunities should be promoted into features to support pushing the product strategy forward. For success in this role, reliable problem solving skills, creativity, communication and acute perception are invaluable skills.

The industry specific expertise of the ideal candidate possesses an understanding of any & all areas including insurance telematics (insurtech), risk management, video, safety & claims products. Collaboration will be across insurance companies, brokers, claims and customer fleet organizations in delivering underwriting data and claim supportive solutions.", "How you'll make an impact:
The primary role is to truly understand the infrastructure needed to support the growth of existing and new revenue streams within Geotab, the associated market, and how automotive OEMs can benefit from telematics solutions to improve their business
Perform discovery interviews with prospective & existing partners and customers to identify product gaps and generate new ideas for continuous value add for existing customers, grow market share for new customers & overall improve Geotab’s customer experience
Leverage various research methodologies and market inputs to identify common patterns, pain points, problems to be solved/jobs to be done and use this to identify relevant solution opportunities/product efforts
Support Geotab global strategic initiatives by working with resellers and sales within partnerships across the Geotab reseller network to meet the needs of multinational Geotab prospects.
Prioritize building what matters most by balancing short term sales targets with long term strategic investments for the business
Collaboratively define and drive reporting and monitoring mechanisms against set product outcomes and use as a tool to measure continued success of product efforts (both qualitative and quantitative)
Collaborate with other product managers on designing and executing market feedback loops and incorporate into product planning
Clearly communicate the Why for every product effort and educate other stakeholders on the problems to be solved, business objectives, etc. Leverage this in collaboration with UX designers, developers, data scientists and other stakeholders to do:
Problem & solution validation
Translate the customer needs into user stories, feature epics and work to be done to bring the product effort to life
Work closely with technical project managers toward execution
Collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and internal teams to continuously make improvements to products that are launched.
Focus on the end to end customer journey as part of product planning from the first interaction through to support & post sales activities", "What you'll bring to this role:
5+ years experience in product management and/or customer discovery.
Experience in a SaaS environment is highly valued.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills:
Good listener, empathetic and enjoy interacting with customers
Ability to stitch together disparate insights to uncover common patterns.
Strong presentation skills (in person and virtually) and ability to deliver training effectively
Self starter, resourceful with strong analytical skills with the ability to problem-solve to well-judged decisions
Strategic mindset, with a keen sense of priorities, along with an ability to pivot as the landscape changes.
Strong team player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization
Well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and relationship management skills.
Must stay relevant to technology and should have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands.
Experience with reporting or business analysis.
High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail
Strong organizational skills to be able to manage products through discovery to launch and continuous review
Technical competence using software programs, including, but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.
Experience leveraging customer success tools (i.e., Salesforce) an asset.", "If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

Why job seekers choose Geotab:

Work from home and flex work arrangements
Home office reimbursement program
Baby bonus
Online learning and networking opportunities
Electric vehicle purchase incentive program
Full medical benefits & 4% 401k company matching RSP

The above are offered to full-time permanent employees only

How we work:

At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!

Geotab verifies candidates' eligibility to work in the United States through E-Verify, an internet-based system operated by U.S. Citizen and Immigration Services.

Other employment statements:

Geotab will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

Geotab provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Geotab complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Geotab expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Geotab's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. For more details, view a copy of the EEOC's Know Your Rights poster. Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data."]

column1: Senior Technical Program Manager – Calix Cloud

column7:
['Position Summary:
The Role
We are seeking a self-starter with a ‘hunter’ attitude to establish new account relationships for our rapidly growing Salesforce Consulting business. We focus on mid-market (and above) customers and cover all aspects of Salesforce product implementation. Candidates will be rewarded with aggressive, and competitive, compensation as well as growth opportunities within the company.
What it Takes
A focus on customer success and value realization
A strong presence while dealing with C-level executives
Serve as Xede’s client executive sponsor across across strategy, implementation and managed services engagements
Ability to lead the Client and associated Partners through the Sales Journey leveraging Xede’s thought leaders including Sales Architecture, Industry Expertise, and Professional Services.
Ability to create a strong network with the Salesforce Financial Services Sales teams at the AE, RVP, and AVP levels
Ability to leverage a Sales Quality process designed to be hyper responsive to the market, approving approaches and contracts within hours.
An ability to deliver against a quota while working autonomously
Ability to leverage Xede’s campaigns and thought leadership to grow territory value and provide market feedback to the Financial Services Practice.
A personality that is confident but humble
An entrepreneurial attitude and appetite for dealing with the changes of a startup environment within an established company
Competencies
Experience with Financial services and a firm understanding of banks, insurance, and/or capital markets
A strong understanding of Agile methodology and the ability to communicate the benefits of this approach for SaaS implementations
Education and Experience
2+ years experience in the Salesforce ecosystem; professional services or Salesforce AE experience preferred
Existing network with Salesforce Financial Services Sales preferred
Prior experience in a Sales/Business Development role
Travel
Customer visits in-market
Occasional travel to Headquarters in Troy, Michigan and relevant Salesforce marketing events
Intangible Skills for Success
A commitment to service excellence.
Ability and willingness to work as part of a team.
Be interesting, and interested.']

["Vectra® is the leader in AI-driven threat detection and response for hybrid and multi-cloud enterprises.
The Vectra Platform captures packets and logs across network, public cloud, SaaS, and identity by applying patented security-led AI to surface and prioritize threats for rapid threat response. Vectra's threat detections are powered by a deep understanding of attacker methods and problem-optimized AI algorithms. Alerts uncover attacker methods in action and are correlated across customer environments to expose real attacks. Organizations around the world rely on Vectra to see and stop threats before a breach occurs. For more information, visit www.vectra.ai.", 'In this remote role, the leader of our EMEA’s Field Marketing team will be responsible for developing and executing high impact regional marketing plans that help move accounts through our sales cycle faster and more effectively. This role will report to the Vice President, Global Demand Generation, working closely with sales (direct and indirect) and global marketing teams to deliver campaigns that drive results and expand our local footprint. Specifically, this person will be responsible for:', 'Driving and partnering with regional sales leaders in alignment with company priorities to develop quarterly marketing plans cross all tactics tailored to the immediate needs of local markets and their target accounts.
Identifying growth opportunities and executing programs focused on creating new biz pipeline, shortening sales cycles and build customer loyalty to support cross-selling and up-selling efforts
Develop EMEA’s channel marketing strategy for the region as well as key tactics.
Design and launch scalable programs across the EMEA partner community to generate revenue, foster engagement and to position Vectra as a cybersecurity leader in ‘threat detection & response’.
Play a key role in helping strategic channel partners develop quarterly marketing strategies and plans designed to drive demand and pipeline.
Introducing and testing new programs and styles of account-based marketing strategies to drive demand generation and pipeline with key segments. Programs will include on and offline tactics and span the entire sales cycle, focused by region, and sometimes by vertical.
Understand the global PR strategy and support the regional management of PR agencies including rapid response and local thought leadership content creation.
Serving as the point person for all marketing planning and budgeting activities for the theatre, coordinating closely with functional leaders in corporate teams.
Reporting on results of specific tactics as well as the breadth of the field marketing program in your regions.
Be a strategic partner to Sales leaders and Marketing leadership on key metrics, including marketing performance measurement, budgeting, strategic planning, process definition, and marketing systems and data.
Managing a high performing and diverse regional marketing team.
Evaluating and prioritizing various programs across countries to ensure budget and results are achieved.', 'Qualifications / Requirements:', 'Minimum of 12 years in Marketing with experience in enterprise software, Security and/or Cloud experience desired.
Deep familiarity with the European enterprise B-to-B software market.
Knowledge and experience with modern demand generation and integrated marketing.
B.A. / B.S or equivalent undergraduate degree, relevant technical subject preferred. MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
Very strong written and communications skills – must be able to communicate the value proposition of the company, create original content (case studies, slide decks, white papers, landing pages, etc…), present to a wide range of audiences, from senior executives at customers, to large audiences, to relatively technical people.
Player-coach attitude & results required – Must be enthusiastic about developing the plan, but also doing the work.
Travel may be required throughout EMEAs core countries, with occasional travel to the US.', '', '', 'Vectra provides a comprehensive total rewards package that supports the financial, physical, mental and overall health of our employees and their families. Compensation includes competitive base pay, incentive plan eligibility, and participation in the employee equity plan (stock options). Specific benefits offered varies by location, but commonly include health care insurance, income protection / life insurance, access to retirement savings plans, behavioral & emotional wellness services, generous time away from work, and a comprehensive employee recognition program.
Vectra is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.']

column7:
['Senior Marketing Manager', 'Austin, TX & Atlanta, GA USA
Full-time', '', 'Company Description', 'Tricentis is the global leader in enterprise continuous testing, widely credited for reinventing software testing for DevOps, cloud, and enterprise applications. The Tricentis AI-powered, continuous testing platform provides a new and fundamentally different way to perform software testing. An approach that’s totally automated, fully codeless, and intelligently driven by AI. It addresses both agile development and complex enterprise apps, enabling enterprises to accelerate their digital transformation by dramatically increasing software release speed, reducing costs, and improving software quality. Tricentis has been widely recognized as the leader by all major industry analysts, including being named the leader in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant five years in a row. Tricentis has more than 1,800 customers, including the largest brands in the world, such as McKesson, Accenture, Nationwide Insurance, Allianz, Telstra, Moet-Hennessy-Louis Vuitton, and Vodafone

As we are rapidly expanding, we are looking for a Marketing Manager to support our DevOps business unit. We are in the business of identifying strategic growth opportunities, developing go-to-market plans and driving the execution of the strategic plans. Our company culture is lively and agile, modeling the same DevOps principles we are using to revolutionize the future of software quality for our customers. Our headquarters in Austin, Texas, with a global presence in Austria, Australia, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Germany, Hungary, India, Israel, Netherlands, Singapore, Switzerland, Poland, the UK and United States.', '', 'Who we are looking for', 'The DevOps Marketing Manager will conceptualize, implement and continually innovate marketing programs in partnership with corporate communications, paid media, field marketing, content, marketing operations, web and, most importantly, sales teams. The ideal candidate will thrive at the intersection of creative strategy, campaign deployment, and analytical review. You will have proven expertise marketing to the developer persona and executing campaigns targeted at driving new business as well as expanding the customer base in companies ranging from SMB to large enterprises', '', 'Essential Duties and Responsibilities']

['Riverbed transforms data into actionable insights and accelerates performance so organizations can deliver a seamless digital experience and drive enterprise performance. Riverbed is the only company with the collective richness of telemetry from network to app to end user, that illuminates and then accelerates every digital interaction. Riverbed offers two industry-leading portfolios: Alluvio by Riverbed, a differentiated Unified Observability portfolio that unifies data, insights, and actions across IT, so customers can deliver seamless, secure digital experiences; and Riverbed Acceleration, providing fast, agile, secure acceleration of any app, over any network, to users anywhere.', '', 'Together with our thousands of partners, and market-leading customers globally – including 95% of the FORTUNE 100 –, we empower every click, every digital experience.', 'Position: Senior Product Manager, NetFlow/Dashboard Products', 'Location: Remote

Riverbed enables organizations to maximize performance and visibility for networks and applications, so they can overcome complexity and fully capitalize on their digital and cloud investments. The Riverbed Network and Application Performance Platform enables organizations to visualize, optimize, remediate and accelerate the performance of any network for any application. The platform addresses performance and visibility holistically with best-in-class WAN optimization, network performance management (NPM), application acceleration (including Office 365, SaaS, client and cloud acceleration), and enterprise-grade SD-WAN. Riverbed’s 30,000+ customers include 99% of the Fortune 100.

Your Responsibilities', 'You will be directly responsible for the growth, curation, and ongoing management of Riverbed’s Portal, NetProfiler, Flow Gateway products. This will require conversations with users, buyers, partners, and industry leaders to establish a data-driven market perspective to drive success of your products.
Product Strategy. You will be responsible for developing the product strategy that will lead to product growth, adoption, and continued success for Riverbed NPM products.
You will follow technology trends, talk to customers, establish a plan, and execute on that plan using a data-driven approach. You’ll incorporate user research and usability studies to identify key areas of improvement and coordinate with engineering to deliver those improvements.
Measure Success. You will align with your cross-functional teams on the definition of success by defining, measuring, and tracking OKRs for every initiative. You’ll also define business metrics that provide a short and long-term measure of health and success.
You will coordinate with the product marketing and marketing teams to create content that helps them position and sell Riverbed product to existing, new, and future customers.
Market awareness. You will maintain a measured, clear view of key competitors and the broader landscape and use that knowledge to maintain the appropriate competitive differentiation with the product.
You will lead your teams through scoping and planning exercises that hone in on the most valuable work for our customers that drives growth and revenue.
You will establish a clear 18 month rolling view of features and capabilities that solve customer problems and grow the acquisition, adoption and growth of the Riverbed NPM products for which you are responsible.
You will communicate roadmaps, plans, and status of initiatives narrowly and broadly across the Riverbed business and externally to partners and customers.
Remove Friction. You will identify opportunities to support the business by reducing friction the sales team encounters when positioning and selling our NPM', 'Your Qualifications', '8+ years of product management experience, with demonstrated success in product definition activities for a successful enterprise software vendor
Experience working in the Security / Networking / Visibility space. A track record working with SaaS-delivered applications is a plus.
Strong understanding of agile development methodologies and how to apply, use, and succeed within that and other development models.
Technical experience with the NetFlow protocol and dashboarding tools is essential. The ideal candidate is already knowledgeable about the Riverbed NetProfiler product.
Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal skills to effectively interact and establish immediate credibility with the engineering team, executives, sales, and customers.
Success with defining new products/features (ideally including SaaS software), from concept through introduction
BS Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, or a related field
Ability to clearly articulate the “what”, “why”, and “who” to focus requirement definition, design exploration, and engineering execution on the most important customer value
Proven ability to learn new technologies and product capabilities and then translate them into value propositions. When you fail, you learn. When you succeed, you teach others.
Demonstrated ability to work close with others within and without your team to drive toward clear objectives and results.
Proven ability to learn new technologies and product capabilities and then translate them into value propositions
Comfortable and passionate about technology with a strong record of execution', '', 'LI-WH1']

['FloQast is looking for a leader of Competitive Sales & Enablement Intelligence. You will be responsible for working internally and externally gathering key competitive and market insights and turning these insights into actionable information and strategy across product management, product marketing, and sales.

As the Competitive & Market Intelligence Manager, you will report directly into the Senior Director of Sales Enablement and be responsible for gathering market and competitive data to identify key macro and micro market trends and use this information to help drive winning positioning, messaging and product innovation strategies. You will be responsible to proactively maintain a market intelligence knowledge base and work with external industry analysts and research firms to source valuable insights.

Visa sponsorship is NOT available at this time', "What You'll Do:
Research, analyze and keep up to date on the competitive landscape, solution positioning, and market trends to deliver key insights into our overall product strength vs. competitors
Create compelling collateral in the form of competitive battle cards, technical briefs, and other comparison focused content for use by customer facing teams
Partner with Marketing, Enablement, and Development to continue to highlight and deliver critical market differentiators
Drive the success of customer engagements by assisting our field personnel with competitive differentiation both on a tactical and strategic level
Gather information from FloQast technical resources in engineering, development, and competitive engineering to develop new assets, messaging, and strategies for our field and marketing resources.
Participate in sales calls as requested by field and advise on deal-specific competitive strategies
Align with core marketing stakeholders, to integrate competitive content into relevant marketing activities and programs, and influence marketing and messaging direction", "What You'll Bring:
4+ years of experience (competitive intelligence/market strategy/product marketing) within a hyper growth b2b SaaS organization
Well rounded understanding of the competitive landscape with the proven ability to keep up with industry trends
Creative thinker with strong analytical skills and ability to build new processes
Strong communicator with the ability to interact and present to executives, partners and colleagues
BS/BA Degree in a relevant field", "#LI-Remote
#LI-SM1
#BI-Remote

The base pay range for this position is $115,000 -$145,000. Compensation is not limited to base salary. FloQast values our Total Rewards, and offers a competitive and elaborate Benefits Package including, but not limited to, Medical, Dental, Vision, Family Forming benefits, Life & Disability Insurance, Unlimited Vacation, and participation in our Employee Stock Program. FloQast reserves the right to amend, change, alter, and revise pay ranges and benefits offerings at any time. All applicants acknowledge that by applying to this position you understand that this specific pay range is contingent upon meeting the qualifications and requirements of the role, and for the successful completion of the interview selection and process. It is at the Company's discretion to determine what pay is provided to a candidate within the range associated with the role.

About FloQast www.floqast.com
Recognized as a 2021 Technology Fast 500 by Deloitte, FloQast is the leader in accounting workflow automation created by accountants for accountants. The cloud-based, AI-enhanced software is trusted by more than 1,600 accounting teams, including those at Snowflake, Twilio, Instacart, Zoom, and The Golden State Warriors. In July 2021, FloQast raised a $110 million Series D at a $1.2 billion valuation — and we’re growing!

What We Do
By automating common accounting workflows and helping to streamline and make them more efficient, FloQast is the place where accounting teams want to work so they can focus on what matters most, even when that’s just logging off on time. Whether automating reconciliations, documentation requests, or streamlining recurring accounting processes, such as the month-end close, financial reporting, or payroll, FloQast enhances the way accounting teams already work to help them operate more efficiently.

Here’s Why You Should Apply
When we say our customers’ success is our priority, we’re not lying. Check us out on G2 Crowd and read a few of the 275+ 5-star reviews!

Why do 95% of reviewers on Glassdoor say they would refer FloQast as an employer to a friend? Maintaining a collaborative, open, and fun company culture regardless of where FloQasters are located can be tricky, but we’re up to the task. Check out what actual FloQast employees have to say on Glassdoor.

FloQast offers competitive compensation, stock options, full benefits, and a positive and supportive work environment

FloQast is regularly rated as one of the best places to work:
Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces in 2021
Best Places to Work by LA Business Journal since 2017
Built In’s Best Place to Work in Los Angeles since 2018

Don't meet every single requirement listed on the job ad? We encourage you to consider applying anyway! You may be the right candidate for this role or for our other open roles.

FloQast, Inc is committed to operating fair and unbiased recruitment procedures allowing all applicants an equal opportunity for employment, free from discrimination on the basis of religion, race, sex, age, sexual orientation, disability, color, ethnic or national origin, or any other classification as may be protected by applicable law. We aim to recruit the right people for the jobs we have to offer, and to assess applications on the basis of relevant skills, education, and experience. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to provide a professional and welcoming workplace for all employees."]

['Principal Consultant, Digital Sourcing Solution-1099/Contractor

This is a 1099/Contract position with future employment options. The duration is approximately 4-6 months to start.', 'Wanted: dynamic and creative individuals ready to connect with a like-minded team. You’ll enjoy all the autonomy you need to help our clients make their digital infrastructure faster and more effective. Free reign for free spirits doesn’t mean you’ve got to go it alone. Over 1400 teammates from around the globe are eager to help you out when things get down to wire. Their expertise will put you on the winning path and keep you there. So get ready to kickstart your career with a team that’s connected – connected by freedom.', 'Position Overview', 'This role, reporting into the Sourcing Solution of the Digital practice within the Americas Consulting region, supports one or multiple engagements simultaneously with a small to mid-size team of ISG consultants and advisors. These engagements may be part of a broader program-level engagement, may focus on a specific area, or may span widely across technology, or into components of business operations.', 'This role will also support the development of the Sourcing Solution. While ISG holds a solid point of view with relevant methodologies, structured design approaches, and artifacts, our consultants and advisors are key to assuring continuous improvement of our delivery methods to meet market needs and support sales efforts.', 'Responsibilities', 'Responsible to assist with projects which generate client revenue
Facilitates, evaluates, and confirms the needs of the client business and assist in the assessment of how ISG can solution to provide optimal business benefit
Interacts directly with senior client and technology services provider executives
Assists and/or leads client strategy and IT assessment projects related to specific technologies (e.g. Cloud Services, SaaS platforms, etc.), IT architecture, process, and design ensuring effective alignment of IT investment with business requirements
Serve as trusted advisor to clients and technology service providers in areas of technology expertise, sourcing, project management, financial modeling, executive relationships, leadership, negotiation, administration and marketing
Independently develops project work plans and customizes to meet client specifications as well as estimates staffing, task duration, and client staffing requirements
Performs data metrics analysis, comparison with market data, current state assessments, change readiness, gap and opportunity analysis, delivery model alternatives analysis, and a service delivery strategy
Develops complex financial models and possesses a thorough knowledge of client budgets, the budgeting process, corporate finance at large, or geographically dispersed clients
Develops, leads, and executes all components of sourcing agreements and associated transactions including the services, financial, performance, resource, governance, service delivery and management, and contract terms
Assists in the development of strategy or tactics to move suppliers to the client-desired outcome
Assists post-assessment transactional work including managing the sourcing lifecycle through vendor selection
Participates in the planning and the development of all project deliverables and assumes overall responsibility for staffing, budget, work plans, scope, project milestones, issues management and risk management utilizing ISG’s methods, tools, and templates', 'Required Skillsets', 'This is a remote position based in the US
10+ years of relevant industry, sourcing, or managed services consulting
8+ years participating in large, complex and /or multiple smaller to medium projects simultaneously, highly leveraged and potentially virtual or global teams, consisting of various skill sets, to deliver consulting engagements
5+ years in IT Management, working in a technical delivery role, including in an environment managing or providing delivery leadership for complex operations
Excellent presentation, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to understand complex business problems, synthesize conversations, business solutions, and effectively communicate at all levels of corporate organizations
The ability to listen to clients and interpret business needs into solutions and requirements; match to ISG service offerings; the ability to write both technically and creatively
Subject Matter Expert with deep operational and/or technical knowledge in at least 2 of the following subjects:
Enterprise Agility (DevOps)
Cloud Architecture and Design
Cloud Computing (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS)
Applications and Infrastructure Virtualization
Applications Rationalization and Modernization
Analytics, IOT, Automation
Enterprise Architecture
Applications Development, Maintenance, and Support
Data Center Operations
Managed Network Services
Workplace Services
Service Desk
Or Technology Modernization
Expert knowledge with MS-Office suite of software applications and tools, including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Teams and MS Outlook
Hands-on experience in using contract lifecycle management tools for IT services and for Software and Hardware assets e.g. Ariba, Coupa etc.; contract life cycle management consulting and providing key recommendations for optimizing contracts around IT services, Applications, IT Infrastructure, BPO, Software and Hardware contracts
Bachelors Degree and advanced degree or equivalent experience', 'At ISG, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our communities. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. ISG is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The more diverse and inclusive we are, the better our work will be.']

['Cloud Service Delivery Manager | OPOWER Client Success', 'About the Job:', 'As a Manager in Client Success at Opower, your mandate is to serve as the primary point of contact for your clients. You will own the client relationship end-to-end – including deployment and ongoing delivery of our cutting-edge product suite, build and maintain strong client relationships, and serve as a trusted partner to your clients and our sales, regulatory and marketing teams internal teams to maintain account health. You will lead a cross-functional Client Delivery team of Implementation Engineers, Configuration Analysts, and Client Support Engineers. You will manage delivery timelines, prioritize work, and be ultimately accountable to ensure your extended team delivers on schedule, at the highest quality. You will also bolster our efforts to evangelize the use of behavioral programs and customer engagement to achieve demand side management and customer care outcomes for our clients.', 'This is an ideal job for someone who has a passion for working with clients and software products, exercises sound business judgment, is an effective multi-tasker and a strategic thinker with an extraordinary attention to detail and is passionate about energy efficiency. The successful candidate will be a demonstrated quick learner and self-starter – with the ability to initiate and make difficult calls and also function well within a team environment. The ideal candidate will have a unique ability to communicate a variety of messages to varying audiences, can build relationships effortlessly, is client-focused, and can follow through and get results.', 'When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.', 'We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.', 'Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.', 'We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you would like accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know at +1.888.404.2494, Option 1.', 'Disclaimer:', '']

column1: Senior Manager, Defense Industrial Base and Critical Infrastructure Programs
column7:
['Mclean, VA', "Who Are You?
You describe yourself as a quick learner, self-starter, organized, and self-motivated. You have a bias for action and are meticulous about details. You enjoy being in a customer facing role and can converse easily with all levels of management. You have a passion for continuous learning—you enjoy learning about each customers’ unique pain points and helping them find creative solutions. You are not easily intimidated by a challenge and enjoy wearing multiple hats. You can assess the utility of a technological tool and understand and communicate its functions to both explain and improve it. Your friends and family describe you as friendly but also outgoing and tenacious. You take pride and ownership in your work and enjoy being the face of the professionals in the background. You work well independently or in a cross-functional team. You have experience leading a project, client account and team of professionals.
Skills for Success
Bachelor’s degree or background in a software, technology, political science, international relations, or national security/Federal Government related field.
Strong Microsoft Office skills- particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Oral and written communication is clear and persuasive
Advanced writing and editing abilities
Demonstrates the ability to give confident and informative presentations in person and remotely
Meticulously organized, detail oriented, and maintain detailed and accurate records.
Proven ability to manage project timelines, resources, and tasks
Analytical mindset used to collect and analyze information, problem-solve, and make decisions or informed recommendations to customers
Receives and gives constructive feedback to push the business forward
A Day In The Life- Senior Manager
The daily mission as a Senior Manager is to:
Help your clients achieve success in their unique mission and
Grow Exiger by providing value to your customers and peers
Everything you do revolves around this mission, which means every day is different because your clients’ needs are always changing and evolving. On a given day, you could do any of the following:
Develop a presentation that outlines Exiger’s core technology in support of supply chain security solutions
Onboard new users and brief them on all the capabilities we can provide
Develop new ways to apply Exiger technology based on the client’s mission and work with their internal team to test and roll out
Conduct training (in-person or virtual) on how your clients can apply the technology to their mission
Attend a conference about Supply Chain Risk concerns
Advise your clients on how best to utilize the software and tools they’ve purchased to obtain actionable insight
Conduct initial troubleshooting on any technical issues your clients are having and work with the tech team to resolve
Translate your clients’ needs and mission into products Exiger can offer and confidently propose those ideas to the client
Inquire about a client’s needs and maintain client success by developing trust and rapport
Mentor junior analysts, peers, and leadership and serve as the final review of their work prior to client delivery.
Provide internal trainings or education on Exiger processes or certain subject matter
Serve as a performance manager for junior managers and analysts, guiding their growth and development in their careers and helping them to be more successful
Provide support to the Exiger sales team to highlight accomplishments your clients are experiencing as a thought leader in the SCRM world
Analyze data from Exiger products to make informed recommendations to each customer based on their value drivers
Preferred Qualifications
Defense Industrial Base and US government experience preferred
Current Security Clearance Holder, SECRET or higher OR ability to get and maintain one.
Experience in supply chain risk management (SCRM)
Experience as a Customer Success Manager (CSM) or Project/Program Manager
Benefits
Health. Dental, and Vision Insurance
401K match
Flexible hybrid, in-office or remote, work from home arrangements possible
16 weeks paid maternity/paternity leave
Discretionary time off
Access to holisticly.co, a subscription service that allows you to pick wellness benefits
This position is remote eligible within the United States, excluding residents of California, Colorado, and New York.

Exiger is revolutionizing the way corporations, government agencies and banks manage risk and compliance with a combination of technology-enabled and SaaS solutions. In recognition of the growing volume and complexity of data and regulation, Exiger is committed to creating a more sustainable risk and compliance environment through its holistic and innovative approach to problem solving. Exiger's mission to make the world a safer place to do business drives its award-winning AI technology platform, DDIQ, built to anticipate the market's most pressing needs related to evolving ESG, cyber, financial crime, third-party and supply chain risk. Exiger has won 30+ AI, RegTech and Supply Chain partner awards.
Exiger’s core values are courage, excellence, expertise, innovation, integrity, teamwork and trust.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law."]
