column7:
['ABOUT US

At Vida, we help people get better — and we’re helping the healthcare system get better, too.

Vida provides expert, personalized, on-demand health coaching and programs through a network of experienced health care providers — like dietitians, therapists, and health coaches and leading medical institutions — coupled with an easy-to-use app with award-winning content.

We focus on chronic conditions — like diabetes, depression, and hypertension — which account for 80% of the $3 trillion spent on healthcare in the US.

By combining advanced technology with the top-notch healthcare providers, Vida is breaking down the barriers that have historically kept people from getting the best care. Vida’s cloud-based platform captures real-time data from 100+ devices and apps and delivers AI-driven insights back to employers, health plans, and providers to improve care. We are trusted by Fortune 1000 companies, major national payers, and large providers to enable their employees to live their healthiest lives.

**Vida is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Vida is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Please speak with your recruiter to learn more about where Vida is registered.', 'RESPONSIBILITIES
Generate pipeline using a multi-channel approach to networking and building key professional relationships
Cold outreach utilizing proven tech stack (calls, emails, LinkedIn outreach etc.)
Utilize deep prospecting techniques to enable a personalized approach to engaging prospects
Prospect and build new business opportunities for Strategic Account Sales VP (SR. AE). Sales-ready opportunities/meetings to be booked in-person as well as virtually
Form, build, nurture professional relationships with target contacts at specific accounts
Master key persona-types and industry knowledge; become an industry expert
Partner with assigned Sales VP to develop prospect account strategy and plan for success QoQ
Own and manage pipeline in Salesforce.com
30% travel for in-person events', "QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years B2B or SaaS sales experience required
Must be able to perform in a virtual and remote environment as required
Proven ability to identify and develop new business with prospects and existing accounts, build/maintain relationships with the decision-makers and key influencers
Ability to understand unique prospect needs within the context of the healthcare industry and effectively tailor fit Vida’s solution to their needs
Experience in a fast-paced environment
Experience with Salesforce (SFDC), Outreach, 6sense, Vidyard, Hubspot, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc
Self-motivated with demonstrated strengths in managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, changing environment, and driving them to completion with limited direction
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required", 'BONUS SKILLS
Knowledge of selling to healthcare prospects directly and/or through healthcare Consultants/Brokers
Experience in selling in the healthcare technology space', 'BENEFITS
Competitive compensation with meaningful stock options
Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance (We cover 100% of your premium and 80% for your dependents)
Healthcare FSA Plan
Dependent Care FSA Plans
Commuter and Parking Benefits
401K Program
Flexible PTO Policy
Paid Parental Leave
10 Paid Company Holidays', 'PERKS
We’re a distributed company, so you can work from most US states (We still have a HQ office in San Francisco)
Access to a Vida Health Coach and the full Vida App
New hire home office stipend
Training and leadership development programs
Weekly meetups with team members across the country through our #connectandcommit program
Quarterly All Company Events
Quarterly Team Based Connection Opportunities
Significant opportunities for growth and development as the business grows', '', 'Vida is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Diversity is more than a commitment at Vida—it is the foundation of what we do. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

We seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our platform and those we serve. Vida is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.

We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at Vida in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position will be deemed the sole property of Vida. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Vida as a result of the unsolicited referral.

#LI-remote']

column7:
['Vericast is a premier marketing solutions company that accelerates profitable revenue growth for the 70,000 businesses it serves directly by influencing consumer purchasing and transaction behavior at scale while engaging with over 120 million households daily. We are recognized as leading providers of incentives, advertising, marketing services, transaction solutions, customer data and cross-channel campaign management, and intelligent media delivery that create millions of customer touch points annually for their clients. For more information, visit http://www.vericast.com or follow Vericast on LinkedIn.', 'The Senior Account Executive is responsible for meeting and exceeding revenue objectives and sales goals through new business acquisition. In the position you are responsible for engaging with senior Marketing and Data/IT decision makers at direct brands to understand their 1st party data/customer challenges and sell through NXTDRIVE’s ability to solve for those challenges. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in selling SaaS solutions, an understanding of the 1st party data and digital media/advertising ecosystems, and a passion for learning new technology.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Effectively and independently deliver the NXTDRIVE value proposition - demonstrating a full understanding of the NXTDRIVE platform, the data management landscape, and our unique position within it
Engage VP and executive level contacts at qualified accounts and move them through sales cycle from lead to close.
Develop a sustained pipeline of viable opportunities to exceed quota by actively prospecting via phone, email, marketing lead follow-up, personal relationships, and executive introductions
Serve as “quarterback” for prospect accounts - leveraging internal expertise (data science, media, etc) when needed to move prospects along sales cycle and providing ongoing feedback to Sales Leadership and cross-functional partners
Negotiate contracts with prospect accounts, working closely with Sales Leadership and Finance
Develop and deliver sales proposals and client Requests for Proposal (RFP’s)
Represent NXTDRIVE and Vericast in a professional and ethical manner to clients, prospects, and partners', 'Required Experience:', '8+ years of digital or technology sales experience. Can include digital media execution, AdTech, platform sales (DSP/SSP), publisher or device side.
3+ years of Software as a Service (SaaS), CDP, or MarTech platform sales experience
Demonstrated ability to prescribe, communicate, and sell through software and service solutions
Aptitude and passion for technology – Must be able to complete product demo, credibly discuss technical topics, and simplify/translate complex concepts into business outcomes
Entrepreneurial mindset – Must be able to learn quickly, pivot, and adapt to changes in product and strategy as needed
Proven / consistent track record of success in achieving and exceeding annual quotas and business objectives', 'Education:', "Bachelor's Degree in business management or related field", '', '']

column7:
['About us:
“Companies access the capital markets to raise money that will ultimately drive expansion, innovation, and employment growth, which is why we have built an integrated capital markets platform that will optimize the deal flow process for all market participants.” Greg Ingram, CMG CEO and co-founder.
Capital Markets Gateway (CMG) is a FinTech start-up that is transforming the equity capital markets (ECM). The capital raising process is riddled with inefficiencies and operational risk. CMG is creating a digital marketplace that connects investors and underwriters via a neutral platform that delivers integrated ECM data and analytics. CMG’s platform streamlines workflows and delivers information and analytics in real-time providing users with long-desired speed to market and analysis vital to decision making.
About the team:
The CMG Enterprise Team is responsible for onboarding our clients. Sitting between product, engineering, sales, and customer success, the Enterprise Team must be multifaceted to meet the needs of every relationship.
You are:
A critical thinker who enjoys not just the implementation of solutions, but also understanding the problem, working with others to find the best outcome, and formulating the path forward. You are an engineer who enjoys collaborating, pairing, and sharing knowledge across domains. You have an itch to understand the technical details of application functionality, while also gravitating toward business application and customer interaction.
The role:[DD1] [DK2] [DD3]
CMG’s clients are some of the largest financial institutions in the world. Your role will be to help connect and onboard these clients onto CMG’s platform by working directly with engineering and business stakeholders, both internally and externally. You will be responsible for working collaboratively with the client’s development teams to educate, guide, diagnose, and troubleshoot the integration of CMG’s application into their existing infrastructure.', 'You have
A background in software development.
5+ years of experience as a software engineer building SaaS web applications or in an academic role teaching advanced software engineering
Knowledge and desire to learn CMG’s architecture and best practices (e.g. Eventual Consistency, REST APIs, Object Versioning, Error Handling, Access Control, Encryption)

Experience working with customers to integrate systems.
Implemented efficient and secure integrations which process data to and from multiple systems
Experience and comfort engaging with customers and stakeholders
The ability to explain domains as it is represented through the application
Maintained and expanded knowledge of integration technology

Proven ability to problem solve, diagnose issues and support development efforts.
Created onboarding materials, including integration diagrams
Conducted training sessions/API demos
Create a series of API playbooks (e.g., in postman) to demo to customers
Create API playbooks based on specific customer requests
Monitored usage
Utilize existing DataDog dashboards and logs
Create new DataDog dashboards and alerts to aid in determining how deep the customer has gotten in their integration
Diagnosed customer reported issues
Implementation experience
Partner with customer success on the technical side of account setup
Facilitate upload processes of customer data (like CRM)
Oversee end-to-end customer integrations

Bias towards action.
Focused attitude with a strong attention to documentation and detail.
manage customer expectations proactively and hold both internal and external stakeholders accountable.', '', 'Our values:
We innovate with purpose
We focus on outcomes vs. output
We believe diverse and inclusive teams fuel innovation
We are humble yet candid
We do right by the customer', 'What we offer:
Comprehensive benefits program
401k match
Unlimited time off
Fully remote work environment
Support to further your education
A culture of people first', 'Compensation Information:
The estimated salary range for this role is US$145,000 – US$180,000. The successful candidate’s salary will be determined by non-discriminatory factors such as skills and experience. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in our benefits program including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off and our equity plan.

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form 1-9 information to confirm you are authorized to work in the US.
CMG embraces our ongoing commitment to building a culture reflecting the people, perspectives, and passions it represents. We will accept nothing less than equity, inclusion, and belonging for all. With the only constant in life being change, we will always listen, learn, and improve for the betterment of our teams, customers, and communities. CMG is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.']

['Senior Customer Marketing Manager', '', 'Why YOU want this position', 'Enverus is the leading energy SaaS company delivering highly technical insights and predictive/prescriptive analytics that empower customers to make decisions that increase profit. Enverus’ innovative technologies drive production and investment strategies, enable best practices for energy and commodity trading and risk management, and reduce costs through automated processes across critical business functions.', 'Enverus is a strategic partner to more than 6,000 customers in 50 countries.', 'We are currently seeking a Senior Customer Marketing Manager to join our Marketing team. This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in the world’s most dynamic and fastest-growing sector.', '', 'Performance Objectives', 'Build out, manage, maintain, and support the growth of customer advocates through community, engagement, and social proof platforms', 'Lead the vision for the Consumer Retention product roadmap create best-in-class retention marketing campaigns across all owned channels (email, push, in-app) and promotions
Develop close relationships with marketing, sales, and customer success stakeholders, collaborating on shared initiatives that drive advocacy, engagement, and lifetime value.
Iterate on existing systems and processes to track and increase the frequency of customer advocacy.
Full funnel customer journey analytics & execution (360 Degrees of customer interaction & measured outcomes including target, reach, penetration, experience, conversion, and optimization).
Project manage the end-to-end production of assets from aggregating the demand, tracking the supply, driving the production and activation of customer stories']

column7: ['Title: AVP Pricing and Competitive Product Marketing', 'Job type: Full time', 'Location: Remote', 'Department: Product Marketing', '', 'Want to change the way work…works? This is your moment.', 'RingCentral Glip integrates messaging with video to make conversation, collaboration and connection more meaningful than ever, no matter where or how people want to work.', '', 'Our Marketing team uses data, strategy and creativity to share that story with the world in the most effective, relevant ways possible. As part of the RingCentral Marketing team, you will help plan, coordinate, implement and oversee the ways we share RingCentral’s message with the world. You’ll use data, technology and creativity to target, communicate, measure and adjust with precision— and share the story of a new, reimagined age of business communication with the audiences who want to hear it most.', 'We’re as proud of our working environment as we are of our market success. You’ll find all the training, opportunity and resources you could ever want here - with all the work/life benefits you expect, and none of the micromanagement. RingCentral regularly brings home Best Place To Work awards from locations all over the world, and outstanding company ratings on Glassdoor and Comparably!']

['Mobile Access Sales Engineer
An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Mobile Access Sales Engineer!!
Location: Remote, USA (Preference will be given to candidates in the vicinity of an HID Global office)
Job ID: 14376

We are seeking a Mobile Access Sales Engineer to work in collaboration with the sales organization and particularly with Sales Professionals positioning, selling, and supporting the HID Mobile Access (MA) solution whether client leverage BLE or NFC.

Who are we?
HID Global powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,000 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo

Sales Engineers have a technical and product expert role. They facilitate the business conversation by handling product demonstrations, technical questions and employing themselves to solve business issues through the technical solution. The role of Sales Engineer is a technical one and requires a detailed understanding of Information Technology, Enterprise Infrastructure, Restful API’s, Communication Protocols and Standards. Additionally, the role requires strong business acumen to understand customer needs and pain points and translate them to a high-level solution design leveraging personal expertise and reference architectures for HID MA solution deployments.

As our Sales Engineer, you’ll support HID’s success by:
Working with Sales during the sales cycle to qualify, position, and demonstrate how HID MA implementations help the customer address and exceed their business requirements.
Attending customer workshops and meetings as trusted advisor and subject matter expert on HID MA while helping clients overcome technical objections relating to the acquisition of HID MA.
Leading in-depth technical discussions with partners, clients, and internal resources alike

What we will love about your background:
General programming knowledge, scripting technologies – Python, Batch, Powershell
Working knowledge of latest wireless technologies: Bluetooth/BLE, NFC, UWB, 4G/LTE/5G
Experience with at least one standard security protocol: OAuth, OAuth2, SAML, LDAP
Knowledge of Identity and Access Management (IAM)

Your Experience and Education include:
Bachelor of Science (or equivalent education) in Computing, a Physical Science or Engineering or at least five years of relevant industry experience, comfortable with business and technical aspects.
Experience in IT, IT Security, Mobile Applications, and Networking
Experience with Microsoft Server platforms and/or Linux, SaaS platforms and VMs

Who you are as a Team Member:
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.
Willingness to ‘roll up sleeves’ and dive deep into tactical work when necessary.
Good interpersonal skills, willingness to learn and continue to grow professionally.
Strong team player and ability to work well with others.
You welcome opportunities to incorporate diversity into your work, including valuing different backgrounds, experiences and opinions. You also embrace creating and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging.

Why ?
Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise.
Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive ambitious change.
Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly.

The wage range for this role considers a broad scope of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At HID, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The base salary range in the United States is $108,000 to $134,400. The OTE is up to $168,000.

HID Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Application due
2023-02-01
Function
Sales, Marketing & Product Management
Experience level
Mid-senior level
Location
Austin, Texas, United States
Long Beach, California, United States']

["Avetta's SaaS platform connects the world's leading organizations with qualified suppliers, contractors, and vendors. We bring unmatched visibility to companies through cloud-based technology and human insights. As a result, we foster sustainable growth for businesses and their supply chains. Our SaaS subscription software is used by 85k+ active customers in over 100 countries.", 'SUMMARY', 'The Account Executive owns the primary relationship with prospective Avetta clients before and during their buyer journey. Once a prospect is converted to a client, the Account Executive owns and services the client relationship. The client relationship will be turned over to the Account Management Team for support and expansion once the client account is established.', 'ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:', "New Client Acquisition. The primary goal of the Account Executive is to win new client relationships for Avetta.
The Account Executive will engage in a variety of sales activities.
Weekly focus on business development activities.
Targeted prospecting with their assigned Sales Development Representative.
Trade Show attendance.
Networking.
Conducting on-line Avetta Overview Presentations and Product Demonstrations.
Traveling to client sites within the Account Executives assigned territory and key accounts to conduct in-person meetings.
Supporting New Clients through the initial launch phase and ninety days with Avetta and maximizing revenue and client success.
Weekly participation in 1 on 1's and team calls.
May be required to attend additional trainings, meetings, and seminars.
Performs other duties as assigned.", 'MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:', "Excellent organizational skills. Significant travel, meeting coordination, RFP/RFI/RFQ Response Coordination are required.
Superior Communication. Candidate must demonstrate superior interpersonal communication, and written communication skills.
Strong Public Speaking. Candidate must have the demonstrated ability to speak in front of a group, keeping an audience's attention while communicating complex subject matter. The speaker must appear comfortable and poised.
Self-Motivated. Candidate must have the ability to set and meet goals with little or no supervision from senior management.
Technical Understanding. Candidate must understand and be able to effectively communicate how SaaS model software works on a functional level, including basic ability to demonstrate product capability and overall solution to the client.
Ethical. Candidate must understand and demonstrate Avetta's core values of honesty and integrity. Candidate must be able to make decisions and communicate client recommendations with the Avetta's and the clients' best interest at hand.", 'OTHER DESIRED TRAITS:', 'Excellent time management skills.
Technically sound in computer skills. Familiarity with CRM applications / SalesForce.com.
Problem analysis and problem-solving.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Adaptability and Flexibility.', 'EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:']

['Bright Horizons is seeking a seasoned Product Manager to help take our My Bright Horizons web portal to the next level! Come be part of a great team, a fast-growing product, and a passionate organization focused on making life easier for working families!
If you are dynamic, high-energy, with a sound business acumen and have a passion for building great software you will be an amazing fit! You would draw on results from user research and data analytics, using strong business, technical, and problem-solving skills to create a strong robust product roadmap. Ideally you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, love solving complex problems and are motivated by working on products that help to make life easier for working parents. You are someone with a proven track record of being able to uncover product opportunities, propose solutions, plan and deliver strong results. In this role you will interact regularly with cross-functional teams and are able to communicate succinctly and effectively.
What you will be doing:
Gather and prioritize product requirements to create in support of product roadmap. Translate market requirements into functional specifications (user stories).
Coordinate closely with Engineering & stake holders to drive product vision, define and refine product requirements. Define and prioritize a product backlog. Technical background desirable.
Manage lifecycle of the product from market requirements to product release, implementation, adoption and feedback loop.
Communicate effectively with engineering, sales, marketing, implementation teams and leadership to ensure business and customer goals are met.
Utilize data to understand customer needs and behaviors as well as business objectives, and enable the team to transform that knowledge into product enhancements and new features.
Conduct competitive research and analysis and work with the design team on creating and validating prototypes with usability testing
Drive service improvements to enhance performance and maximize client satisfaction
Collaborate effectively with internal Bright Horizons colleagues to continue driving initiatives.
What we need from you:
5+ years of product management experience
Experience with B2B or B2C, SaaS-based products preferred
Managed healthcare, benefits, and/or outsourcing service experience a plus
Experience with software agile tools, preferably ADO, JIRA. Experience with Pendo a plus.
Strong collaboration, organizational skills, and an understanding of how to develop a product roadmap and backlog.
History of proven results delivering high quality, customer-driven products or features, on time.
Goal-oriented, must be able to demonstrate success, meeting and exceeding business objectives.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to use data to spot and address risks and opportunities.
Self-starter with ability to drive decisions and lead projects from start to finish
Exceptional decision-making, prioritization, and time management skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to build and maintain business relationships across all organizational levels, i.e. peers, vendors, clients
Adaptability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.
Bachelor’s degree is required.', '', 'HAVING TECHNICAL ISSUES WITH YOUR APPLICATION?', 'Contact us at bhrecruit@brighthorizons.com or 855-877-6866', '', 'Bright Horizons is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals without discrimination. Bright Horizons complies with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO – English and EEO – Spanish along with information on the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).', '', 'Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the recruitment helpdesk at 855-877-6866 or bhrecruit@brighthorizons.com. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.']

['Looking to join the positive-minded workplace of an industry leader? Look no further than P2 Energy Solutions (P2). We are the world’s largest and most trusted partner in the oil and gas sector with over 90+ years of experience in data and 30+ years in software. More than 1,700 upstream oil and gas companies around the world rely on us to improve their business processes and augment their corporate performance.', 'As we continue to grow, P2 is recruiting people into a culture that allows employees to be their best selves at every stage in their career journey. We view diversity and inclusion objectives through the same lens as any critical business objective – and we place a high value on our working environment where all people feel respected and are treated fairly. Our inclusive culture is critical to P2’s success in building a firm that hires, develops, and retains extraordinary people.', 'We are looking for a Senior Contracts Admin to join our team! In this role, you will be responsible for and oversee all stages of the contract lifecycle. You will utilize Docusign and document management systems and will be responsible for administering templates, reviewing and editing complex sales contract packages, contract order forms and statements of work, providing first-round responses to customer redlines, negotiating and drafting contract language, maintaining the team work queue, obtaining electronic signatures, contract distribution and enforcing the company’s contract process. This role entails interpreting contract language, validating legacy contracts, working with renewals, sales and sales ops teams, organizing playbook language, and possible communication with customer or procurement non-legal personnel. In the Senior Contracts Administrator role, you may provide guidance and training to other team members on the legal team.', '', 'Duties & Responsibilities:', 'Oversee actions with internal legal teams and outside procurement
Report status of current contract processes to management and stakeholders
Ensure contracting documents are being completed in a timely manner
Provide first-round responses to customer redlines
Assist Corporate Counsel negotiate terms, conditions and pricing, and ensure they are accurately executed on large and complex contracts with minimal assistance from Corporate Counsel.
Obtain electronic signatures, manage internal contract distributions, and ensure legal documents are properly filed
Seeks efficiency through thorough review of processes and leads team/departmental changes', 'Technical Ability:', 'Knowledge of and ability to utilize Microsoft Office, Salesforce.com, Docusign products
Attention to detail and the ability to spot errors and inconsistencies
Strong organizational skills
Ability to work with a team at all levels of a global organization
Exceptional communication skills (oral and written)
Strong understanding of software licensing and common contract negotiation issues
Ability to cross train other team members and provide guidance and oversight to their work
Independent decision-making aptitude in finance and risk allocation terms
Ability to modify existing templates, implement new DocuSign templates, and take full ownership of contract workflow
Adapts easily to competing and shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment
Works efficiently, independently and with minimal supervision and takes ownership and a proactive approach to tasks that need to be completed', 'Qualifications:', '5 - 8 years’ experience in Contracts Administrator or procurement manager role
Negotiating or administering on-premise and SaaS license agreements on the sell side of the business at a software and services organization is a plus
Bachelor’s degree or higher']

['The Group Vice President, Solution Marketing, is a proven senior marketing executive who will oversee the Solution Marketing (SoMa) team, reporting directly to the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). The successful leader will be responsible for scaling the existing SoMa organization by setting the vision and turning it into action. This executive will have built, scaled, or ran Global Solution Marketing teams within the technology space. The GVP will articulate a clear, consistent, and compelling value proposition for our solutions in our target markets, including being the external evangelist for our solutions in the marketplace.', '', 'This role requires a superstar performer to play a pivotal role ensuring that PowerSchool is positioned as the clear SaaS leader in the K-12 space. This executive will lead a team of Solution Marketing professionals to craft world-class positioning, messaging, content, and competitive analysis and be a key spokesperson for PowerSchool at events, in briefings with industry analysts, and in sales cycles. This leader will need to roll up the sleeves to manage and successfully drive projects, working together with the CMO, Product leaders, Sales leadership, and SLTs.', 'Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.', 'Provide world-class deliverables to ensure we differentiate PowerSchool in the market and equip sales team to win. Key deliverables include:', 'Product positioning and messaging for PowerSchool portfolio
Content to enable Sales team
Delivery of content to enable sales and measurement of effectiveness
Competitive positioning', 'Provide ‘Voice of Market’ influence on:', '', 'Product roadmap
Product strategy
Influence product bookings and ARR performance', '']

['About L2L
L2L is a leading SaaS platform for global manufacturers. We help these manufacturers achieve world-
class performance by digitally unifying their people, processes, and machines. Our CMMS solution
(Computerized Maintenance Management System) unifies complex plant processes for over 100,000
users, helping them reduce machine downtime, improve response time to production issues, and reduce
the cost of spare parts and overall maintenance. L2L is backed by M33 Growth, a growth-focused private
equity firm in Boston Massachusetts that provides both capital and resources to develop already-great
businesses into market leaders.
You Will Make an Impact
L2L is looking for Account Executives to grow our successful sales team and capitalize on our strong
momentum. The Account Executive will execute our sales strategy within an assigned region and drive
revenue growth by penetrating the current customer base while also developing new customers. You will
work inside of some of our existing accounts and will also prospect to build new relationships in a set of
assigned named accounts.
Sounds interesting? Then you may be the perfect fit for us.
You Are
Process-oriented, highly motivated self-starter
Your communication skills are top-notch, both over the phone and in email
Humble, Hardy, Hungry, Helpful with a sense of humor and a Big Heart
You Have
Experience selling SaaS with outstanding quota attainment history and track record
3-5 years closing deals and working through complicated procurement and legal processes
Experience prospecting, developing sales opportunities, executing a mutual success plan, can
create urgency, can negotiate and win customers
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Customer-centric, Consultative or Solution selling experience', '', 'You Will
Personally prospect for new sales meetings and opportunities and leverage business from new &
established relationships
Serve as an expert on L2L solution, educate prospects, answer questions, ensure to keep a focus
on solving the customer’s needs, and will advance sales opportunities in your pipeline
Work collaboratively with other departments to ensure full alignment in delivering value to our
prospective customers
Meet and exceed new sales quota goals and overall sales team objectives by running a full sales
cycle to address client challenges and help transform their business
Clearly articulate L2L’s value proposition and return on investment
Strategize, negotiate & close business']

column7: ['Job Category:', '', 'Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!', '', 'Altus Group Limited, a public company listed on the TSX, is a leading Intelligence as a Service provider to the global commercial real estate industry. While headquartered in Canada, Altus Group operates globally through its businesses Altus Analytics and Altus Group Commercial Real Estate Consulting.', '', 'Altus Group is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have any needs that require accommodation, please let us know.', 'Altus Group currently seeks a Senior Commercial Counsel to join its global legal team. This role will be responsible for supporting and guiding matters related to high volume commercial transactions on sophisticated deals and alliances, in support of our Analytics business unit. This leader will be a key member of the legal team with responsibility for directing activities and negotiating our must important commercial transactions in support of Altus Group’s Analytics business goals and objectives.', '', 'Key Responsibilities:']

["At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.", '', 'Broadridge is hiring! We are seeking a Segment Market Sales Executive. This is a quota-carrying position for a seasoned financial services sales professional who has the ability to develop and maintain key client relationships, manage complex sales cycles and execute in the delivery of sales results to contribute directly to annual sales targets. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in financial services and fintech SaaS enterprise sales experience. The ability to establish, develop and maintain senior-level relationships across bank and broker-dealer accounts. Candidate must also have a detailed knowledge of the financial services market, specifically the general workings of wealth management and capital markets broker/dealer operations, as well as exposure to, or experience in, working in a high-performing sales culture, and knowledge of business-to-business sales best practices.', 'We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work remote.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Identify new business opportunities within existing clients by cold calling and leveraging existing internal and external relationships and market products and services to existing client firms.
Independently oversee and complete all aspects of the sales process, from pre-qualification to completion. The position requires high-level interaction with senior management at both the client and Broadridge.
Follow a ""Playbook"" approach that includes the development of business cases and pricing, utilizing complex internal models. Provide direction internally by recommending enhancements to current product set and business processes.
Lead all relative activities and alignment of required resources across Broadridge to ensure the successful and timely closing of sales.
Be accountable for and take ownership of all objectives, deliverables and commitments to these clients and internal stakeholders related to the execution of new business.
Develop strategic account plans to identify opportunities to grow pipeline, sell appropriate Broadridge products and services and maximize revenue.
Maintain a constant awareness of current and planned development of Broadridge products and continuously engaged with clients to keep them abreast of product information.
Provide management with all requested sales reports and supporting correspondence, including the utilization of the sales management tool [Salesforce.com].
Attend trade shows, conferences or other industry-related events to help strengthen existing Broadridge and client relationships, develop new relationships, remain current on industry issues, increase awareness of competitive offerings, and promote Broadridge products and services.
Manage internal resources to provide the necessary expertise and support during the sales process including legal, finance, product specialists, and senior management.', 'Qualifications:', 'BS in business or related field, MBA preferable
Prior success selling to senior level financial services executives. 8-10 years of experience.
10+ years of either Broker-Dealer Operations Experience or Broker-Dealer Sales Experience
Ability to build, foster and maintain key strategic relationships within prospect accounts, including senior client relationships at CxO levels
Ability to work within a collaborative environment to achieve results
Strong investment industry knowledge and existing network of relationships
Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and negotiation skills
Self-starter with attention to detail and strong time and territory management skills', '#LI-MJ1', '']

column7:
['Clozd is a leading provider of technology and services for win-loss analysis. We help our clients uncover the truth about why they win and lose - so they can hone product strategy, refine messaging, enable sales, foster strategic alignment, and win more.

We need team members who can tackle ambiguity, solve complex problems, and delight customers. We hire dynamic employees who take initiative, find ways to simplify and scale, possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, value humility and learning, crave a fast-paced startup environment and never compromise their integrity.

The Product Manager will focus on helping the product & engineering team vet, incubate and launch new big bets (e.g., tech delivered interviews, survey relaunch, etc.) and working cross-functionally to launch scaling efforts (e.g., referral programs, revamp free trial / pilot structure, etc.) The PM will also support the Chief Technology Officer with setting the product roadmap for Clozd.', 'What you will be doing:
Help develop Clozd’s product strategy by leveraging business intelligence, customer insights and market research
Partner with engineering teams to communicate the product vision and enable seamless execution toward that vision
Partner with delivery teams to increase product adoption; develop KPIs to monitor and analyze business performance
Analyze new product opportunities to drive Clozd growth objectives
Lead complex strategic and operational projects with cross-functional partners; drive to implementation and delivery of results. Projects could span strategic, long-term initiatives to near-term operational improvements
Navigate the organization and motivate cross-functional partners to deliver on recommendations and plan
Be a credible and reliable C-level advisor, drive decision-making with our senior executives, prepare and deliver materials to support those decisions
Provide mentorship to other product managers', 'What you should have:
4+ years of work experience preferably in management consulting, SaaS, venture capital, investment banking, or private equity
Data, results and operational excellence-driven with great analytical skills and execution abilities
Strong ability to build productive cross-functional relationships, drive change and interact directly with senior management
Technical background (e.g., software engineering, etc.) strongly preferred', 'Benefits:
Competitive compensation (i.e. salary, bonus, 401k, and equity)
Majority of medical, dental, disability, life, and other insurance paid
Unlimited PTO with a boss that encourages taking time off and using PTO to recharge
10 paid holidays and company shutdown between Christmas and New Years
Reimbursed book club book and lunch, weekly catered lunches, stocked kitchens, quarterly company/department activities, maternity/paternity leave, EAP program, etc.', 'Clozd is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Clozd does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Clozd participates in E-Verify.

All Clozd employees are required to successfully pass a background check upon being hired.']

['VP – Global Demand Generation (United States Based)', '', "At UiPath we see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset, that's why it acts like a compass to us. We're fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that's not just words on the walls.", '', "Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It's an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.", 'We make robots, but we hire people. Would you like to be part of this journey?', '', "Reporting to the Chief Business Officer, the Vice President, Global Demand Generation is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the world’s fastest growing cloud businesses. This proven senior leader will help shape UiPath's growth and vision for now and in the future. S/he will design, execute, and optimize a high-volume, high-impact demand generation and lead nurturing program across all digital and in-person mediums globally to fuel UiPath's growth.", '', 'The Vice President, Global Demand Generation will partner with marketing leadership peers and counterparts in product and sales to deliver strong messaging, value propositions, and campaigns to targeted customer segments and geographies. S/he will lead and motivate a global, ROI-based marketing team and enhance the appropriate infrastructure, measurements, and operational elements to drive and scale a global pipeline. This executive will lead a team of 60+ people and be based near an urban hub with easy travel.']

column7:
['Company Description', 'At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.', "With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2021 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies®.", 'Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.', 'Job Description', 'You will produce new business sales revenue from a SaaS license model. You will accomplish this through account planning, territory planning, researching prospect customers, using business development strategies and completing field-based sales activities within a defined set of prospects, territory or vertical.', 'What you get to do in this role:', 'Develop relationships with multiple C-suite personas (e.g., CFO, CIO, COO, CDO) across all product sales
Oversee client relationship mapping to the account team, orchestrating an account strategy while leading across a broad virtual team (Solutions Consultants, Solutions Specialist, Success resources, Partners and Marketing, etc.)
Be a trusted advisor to your customers by understanding their business and advising on how ServiceNow can help help their IT roadmap
Identify the right specialist/ support resources to bring into a deal, at the right time', '', 'Qualifications']

column7:
['How you will help', 'You will provide exceptional operational and relationship management expertise to HealthVerity’s strategic partner engagements. You will engage in all aspects of HealthVerity strategic partner relationships, including solution development, operational and contractual-related activities. You will help develop and evolve partner and alliance management processes, introducing best practices for relationship management and governance. You will drive internal processes which will enable HealthVerity to be a trusted, responsive partner to a wide variety of partners who serve primarily Government agencies but also the life sciences and broader health care ecosystem. You will coordinate across key internal stakeholders (contracting, operations, engineering and sales) to respond to and expand partner opportunities, consistently seeking and positioning HealthVerity for additional growth opportunities with our growing partner ecosystem.', '', 'What you will do', 'Develop a deep understanding of current and potential government-focused partners in terms of their capabilities and presence at our target Federal Government Agencies (e.g., health-related Agencies such as the CDC, NIH, FDA, CMS and health-related opportunities with DHA and the VA).
Assess strategic and commercial fit of these partners with HealthVerity and prioritize / develop account plans accordingly.
Lead relationship and process management from initial exploratory discussions through negotiations and ultimately operationalize relationships including agreed-upon governance.
Collaborate and coordinate across internal teams to realize partner and alliance strategic priorities to drive value for HealthVerity and our partners. Interface closely with the Sales, Technical Solutions, Real-World Data, Marketing, and Product teams to ensure successful implementation of partnerships and alliances.
Identify opportunities to build upon current / identify new engagements and relationships, including leveraging social networks, direct outreach, and all available methods, positioning HealthVerity for continued growth through our partnership and alliance ecosystem.
Provide feedback internally on market trends, competitive threats, unmet needs, and opportunities to deliver greater value to partners', '', 'About You...', 'You have world-class communication skills, capable of promoting collaboration across HealthVerity’s broad internal and external stakeholder universe across all levels of an organization
You effectively engage, drive discussion and foster accountability outside of immediate influence
You identify opportunities and risks quickly, escalating appropriately with proposed solutions
You are skilled at learning and applying understanding of partner organizations’ structure, influencers, decision-making process
You expertly facilitate conversations between senior executives
You like being part of a team, with a shared set of ambitious goals and objectives
You’re comfortable moving between high-level strategy and in-the-weeds implementation
You’re highly detail oriented, and willing to do the work, not just manage the relationship
You set and manage priorities effectively
You are motivated and energized by finding new opportunities, developing collaborative relationships and winning new business', '', 'Desired Skills and Experience']

['The Opportunity

Density’s mission is to measure and improve our footprint on the world.

We help companies understand how their workplaces are used. We do that by observing behavior in the office through our highly accurate and always anonymous sensors. In other words: where are people actually spending their time?

We translate that data into actionable, opinionated insights that help companies increase the financial and experiential performance of any workplace.

Today, we work with companies ranging from Fortune 1000 to high growth such as Uber, Pinterest, Shopify and Okta, occupying more than 1.25 billion square feet worldwide. And we’re in it for the long game: what if we knew more, created better spaces, and could build cities that worked and felt better?

The Role

Density is looking for a hands-on Product Marketing Manager who enjoys operating at high altitude as much as getting things done. As the single PMM at Density, you own the whole thing: from informing product development through user and competitive intelligence, to driving product adoption through internal and external education, and playing a strong role in sales enablement.

Reporting into the CMO, you’ll work closely with other experts in Product, Marketing, Sales and Customer Success, as well as our CEO.', 'You will:
Help shape our product roadmap by advocating for existing and prospective users, inserting competitive insights, and thinking beyond the launch to ensure ongoing product adoption.
Develop product positioning, messaging and marketing materials based on user and market research.
Guide marketing strategy at the campaign and asset level based on your understanding of Density and its products, our customers, and what they need to succeed.
Develop go-to-market strategies for new products and features, secure buy-in from teams across the company, and then go get it done.', 'You have:
7+ years of experience in product, marketing and/or product marketing at enterprise tech companies. Must-have: start-up experience. Nice to have: hardware-enabled SaaS experience. Bonus points: experience in Workplace or Commercial Real Estate.
An intuitive understanding of personas, what motivates people as decision makers and humans. You’re creative in translating that knowledge to real-life perspectives and marketing assets that help our users.
The analytical chops to pair quantitative data with qualitative customer feedback and build rigorous, differentiated go-to-market strategies.
Strong storytelling and writing skills. You see the forest through the trees and can segment, organize and prioritize stories to maximum relevance and tell them in a clear, compelling way.
The passion to really dig into our industry by talking to customers, going to conferences, and nerding out on third party research.', 'We offer:
Excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, mental and reproductive health, 401K, equity, Flex Fridays, Remote Friendly, unlimited and mandatory PTO and more.
A company environment full of fun, smart, talented and legitimately kind teammates. Our culture powers everything we do and we work hard to nurture it by bringing on the right humans.
A team hailing from innovators like Apple, LinkedIn, Stripe, Meraki, Flexport, WeWork, NASA & beyond.
$227M raised from investors including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund and Upfront Ventures.
The chance to change the built world as we know it.']

column1: Senior Trade & Investment Officer, Technology - New England
column7:
['Job Description (Roles and Responsibilities)
Main Purpose of Job:
Be part of the Department for International Trade’s (DIT) mission to drive more trade and investment between North America and the UK. With a mature, high spending consumer market and an open, liberal economy, world-class talent and a business-friendly regulatory environment, the UK is the leading destination for foreign investment in Europe, and the second highest investment destination in the world. The UK is also the world’s sixth largest exporter and the second largest services exporter.
We employ over 150 people across North America, all united by our vision of a future where we champion open and fair global trading that drives growth, creates better jobs and higher wages, and improves living standards in the UK and around the world. We seek talented team members with the passion and drive to help us in our mission to build a global appetite for British goods and services; drive investment; negotiate trade deals and open up markets; improve international trading standards and fight unfair trading practices (see www.gov.uk/DIT).
Based in Cambridge MA, the Senior Trade & Investment Officer for technology will proactively identify opportunities in the US for market ready UK companies to achieve new business, and work with companies seeking to launch into, or expand in, the UK market. You will be part of the North America technology team providing key account management within the region in addition to providing strategic advice and assistance to companies. You will also be a valued contributor to the Cambridge based regional team, and work closely with colleagues based around the UK.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Provide a comprehensive account management service to key US clients in the technology industry (including software, hardware and emerging tech) looking to maintain or grow their footprint in the UK.
Successfully build and manage a pipeline of New England based growing tech companies and projects that have the potential to bring high-value jobs and R&D to the UK.
Help high-growth and innovative UK companies to develop US market entry strategies and/or grow US market share; and support established UK companies in market to address any concerns around US trade policy or market access barriers.
Build and maintain a strong network in the technology sector in Boston, including with US and UK business leaders, trade associations, and other key buyers/partners.
Develop and implement high impact, targeted marketing programs and events in conjunction with stakeholder partners to build our brand awareness, promote key messaging, and showcase UK competitiveness in technology.
Keep pace with market trends, incentives and centres of excellence in North America and the UK to identify commercial opportunities and provide informed advice to clients.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to deliver high-impact programming, including developing and hosting round tables, seminars and trade missions, and contributing to Ministerial and other VIP visit programs.
Assist with cross-team projects to advance UK economic and trade policy goals.
Manage one business development associate.
Other duties as assigned.
Resources Managed:
Manage events and travel budgets', 'Essential qualifications, skills and experience
Professional experience, gained within a business development, sales, or economic development role, ideally in a related sector.
Knowledge of one or more key industries or technologies: AI & ML; Data Analytics; Cybersecurity; B2B & Enterprise SaaS; Telecoms & 5G; Quantum Technologies, Web3 Technologies..
Knowledge of market trends in the US and preferably in the UK
Excellent stakeholder management abilities
Excellent interpersonal, presentation and networking skills
Excellent management and collaboration skills with the ability to deliver results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail
An excellent network of industry contacts and the ability to develop new networks with senior business and industry leaders.
In-depth knowledge of local tech ecosystem and willingness to represent the British Government in the New England tech community.
Must be able to attend events outside of office hours and undertake travel in the US and internationally up to 10% of your time.
An understanding of international relations and UK Government policy preferred.
As a valued member of our team, we will help you to achieve your goals through continuous professional development
Under US State Department requirements, the UK Government in the US may only employ, as non-diplomatic staff, persons who are US citizens, US Permanent Residents or A visa holders with EAD cards*. If you hold a visa other than an A visa you are not currently eligible to work at our office. Please refer to our website for information on exceptions to this policy at www.gov.uk/government/world/usa. All selected candidates are subject to background checks and will require a security clearance prior to starting work. A visas are acceptable at the Embassy and Consulates. The UK Mission to the UN (UKMIS) accepts G visas, and British Defence Staff (BDS) outposts accept A or NATO visas.', '', 'Required behaviours
Making Effective Decisions, Managing a Quality Service, Delivering at Pace, Communicating and Influencing, Working Together', 'Application deadline Application deadline - day Application deadline - month Application deadline - year
29 January 2023', 'Grade
Higher Executive Officer (HEO)', 'Type of Position
Full-time, Permanent', 'Working hours per week
40', 'Region
Americas, Caribbean & Overseas Territories', 'Country/Territory
United States']

['Life at MX

We are driven by our moral imperative to advance mankind - and it all starts with our people, product and purpose. We always carry a deep sense of drive and passion with us. If you thrive in a challenging work environment, surrounded by incredible team members who will help you grow, MX is the right place for you.

Come build with us and be part of an award-winning company that’s helping create meaningful and lasting change in the financial industry.', '', 'MX is looking to add a Director of Pricing and Monetization strategy. This person will be a key leader in partnering with the Product, Go-To-Market and Client Segment teams in the development and implementation of MX’s pricing and packaging strategy. Key responsibilities will be establishing pricing structures, pricing analyses (including but not limited to profitability and unit cost), track price performance, build organizational capabilities, and communicate key pricing insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other relevant stakeholders in support of the business’ overall revenue and operating income goals.', '', 'Job Duties', 'Monitor trends in sales and the market to draw conclusions about performance in order to recommend improvements to pricing strategies and tactics
Analyze multiple variables such as customer segmentation, customer life cycle, different sales motions/GTM strategies/customer profiles when developing targeted pricing opportunities
Balance business objectives while supporting product and GTM/Client Segment teams
Develop and maintain financial models in designing packaging and pricing to incur competitive position in the market and market penetration
Act as subject matter expert, supporting marketing, product, engineering, client segment teams, deal desk and professional services
Translate business needs into analysis that provide insight, knowledge and understanding of customers, products and segments
Own governance of new SKUs, unit type, price change implementation and discount and renewal strategy
Partner with product team to conduct market tests on pricing changes
Perform other ad-hoc analysis as assigned', '', 'Job Requirements', '7+ years of quantitative pricing experience
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative subject (finance, economics, statistics)
Strong ability to manage multiple stakeholder expectations, timelines, and deliverables
Proven experience in building and implementing pricing tools, systems and processes
Strong analytical skills in statistical and financial modeling
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, ability to persuade, communicate vision and execution across all levels of the organization', '']

column7:
["We enable advertisers’ performance campaigns with timely, powerful ad creatives that deliver Creative ROI™. Our global network of creative centers of excellence specializes in high technology creative production, such as CGI. We are known for world-class ideation and creative production through our network of talented creative hubs as human creativity cannot be supplanted by machines. Some of the world’s largest online advertisers work with us to improve their campaigns leveraging performance design.

You are:
A Big (Online) Game Hunter: You have excellent contacts with the top 300 publishers in the online game industry, having sold software products to key accounts in the past. Finding new and creative ways to prospects excites you. You are driven by the hunt and have the tenacity to reach out to a high volume of potential clients in a methodical manner on a regular basis.
A Builder: Build relationships by building trust. Behave like a true Client Partner (with flavors of a consultant, and industry and technical maven). You seem to intimately understand the client’s organization, culture and specific needs. You have earned the right to sell to your clients.
A Closer: Set big goals and drive towards those. You have expertise in identifying, developing, progressing, negotiating and closing large, most complex, leading edge, high-risk opportunities, planning and leading negotiations with the highest levels of client management. You are not afraid of tough conversations and overcoming objections.
Action Orientated: You don't wait for someone to tell you what to do. If there is a problem, you solve it. Take a risk, fail fast, learn, and move forward.
You Will:
Build senior level relationships within the top 300 global gaming publishers
Create and execute a thorough and methodical prospecting strategy
Create and deliver sales pitches
Close deals
Meet and exceed monthly sales goals

About You:
Business Degree from a university that matters
Proficient in standard business software and sales CRM applications.
8 Years enterprise SaaS or media sales experience in the gaming industry
Excellent International Business English Proficiency both written and oral.
Experience walking prospective clients through product demos via conference calls.
If you are a self-starter and can multi-task this is a great place for you.", '', '', 'Creadit’s team is comprised of data-driven innovators and disrupters. We think creatively, work efficiently, and contribute consistently. Our people are located in Austin, Denmark, Los Angeles, London, New York, Singapore, Tokyo and Ukraine, and are all passionate about our work and our product.']

column1: Presales Operations and Enablement Director - Remote
column7:
['Azul Careers', "Presales Operations and Enablement Director - Remote
Sales
United States
Description
Azul Systems, Inc. is the only company 100% focused on Java. Our strategy is to make Azul the heart of every modern cloud enterprise by prioritizing our customers’ success, maintaining our unwavering commitment to innovation and excellence, and advancing Java through community leadership.
Azul is a fast-growing, remote-first organization that provides plenty of opportunities to broaden your skills, try new things and advance your career.
Azul is well-suited to thrive in challenging market conditions due to our long history of innovation, happy customer base and strong financial position. We are looking to hire impact-makers with growth mindsets who are passionate about solving customer challenges around cloud cost optimization, performance-driven applications and anything related to Java. We invite you to explore career opportunities with the world’s largest commercial provider of OpenJDK and be part of an exciting moment in our journey.

The Role
Our Presales Operations and Enablement Director is tasked with supporting the day-to-day activities of the presales team, such as recruiting, onboarding, ongoing training, career development planning, resource planning, and process administration. This is an exciting role that demands initiative and enthusiasm. This position will report to the Senior Director, Global Presales.
This role requires proven ability in operational excellence with strong strategic thinking, project management, and process improvement skills, an outstanding track record for driving results, and foundational understanding of sales and presales processes and tools.

About You (key responsibilities)
These may include but are not limited to:
Support presales leadership
Maintain smooth day-to-day execution and reporting of presales activities
Mange all aspects of internal communications with the Global Presales team
Find and address skills gaps
Optimize internal processes
Manage development of onboarding materials
Manage onboarding of new hires
Manage ongoing training of presales team
Develop and manage presales processes
Manage presales content repositories
Consolidate and report Field issues and product enhancement requests
Assess and report on deal wins and losses
Advise on improvements to discovery, qualification, and technical validation Field activities
Qualifications
10+ years' experience with pre-sales engagements and/or customer technical management
Team management experience required
Extensive enterprise software or SaaS experience required
Project management experience preferred
Bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering, advanced degree preferred
Excellent presentation and technical writing skills
Communicates effectively at different levels
Attention to detail and very organized
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders and drive critical business decisions

What we Offer
Comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages
Equity Program
Referral Program
Work-life balance

Our Culture & Values:
Maniacal Customer Focus
Innovation & Excellence
Initiative & Courage
Impact & Influence
Integrity & Transparency
Diversity, Inclusion & Teamwork
Azul Systems, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or family status, age, disability, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by Federal or State law or local ordinance.
Later"]

You will have an opportunity to make a difference.", '', '']

['The Director of Professional Services is responsible for leading and managing Cloud for Good’s nonprofit or education consulting teams. They manage teams of consultants, lead projects as engagement managers, and direct the services practice in partnership with other leadership team members.
Successful candidates will be highly experienced in deploying Salesforce solutions for nonprofit or higher education organizations. They will also have excellent leadership and people management experience, strong project management skills, and the ability to juggle multiple priorities at the same time.
Location: Virtual: Home-based office in the USA or Canada.
Work Authorization: Citizens or Permanent Residents of USA or Canada. Cannot provide Visa sponsorship
Travel: 10 -15% – Internal and Client Facing
Responsibilities
Manages a team of professional services staff, providing coaching and professional development through periodic 1:1 and team meetings.
Manage a team of professional services staff, providing coaching and professional development through regular 1:1 and team meetings.
Participate in consulting projects as a senior resource (Engagement Manager, Project Manager). Maintain a billable quota of 10-20%
Participate in the performance management process through goal setting and performance reviews for staff
Support the resource planning, cross-company visibility, and profitability model for professional services through direct project management and for monitoring projects under your team’s responsibility
Support pre-sales and sales processes through scoping, thought partnership, and interactions with potential clients.
Support the development of scalable implementation models to support Cloud for Good’s client base
Monitor and message internal expectations on key business metrics such as delivery of service, client satisfaction, and system performance
Work with clients and engagement teams to anticipate project risks, resolve issues, consistently meet deadlines and achieve 100% client satisfaction
Gather feedback and best practices from client engagements to improve and refine Cloud for Good’s Service Offerings
Collaborate with all functional areas of the business to ensure effective knowledge sharing and team participation in Cloud For Good’s growth
Act as a role model for Cloud for Good’s culture and values – actively build positive team culture
Serve as a public face for Cloud for Good. You may be asked to assist in marketing activities, such as writing blogs, participating in digital and in-person events and writing customer success stories.
Maintain high levels of current skills in software-as-a-service (SaaS) architecture, solution design, and salesforce.com technologies and best practices
Serve as a member of Cloud for Good’s Leadership Team

Qualifications and Education Requirements
6+ years experience in client services, and/or consulting services.
3+ years experience managing Salesforce implementations or services engagements in a consultative model.
Minimum 3 years managing customer deployment and/or professional services engagements in a consultative model.
Experience in Agile Delivery Methodology
Demonstrated experience developing and implementing professional services best practices.
Prior experience managing staff in a project or professional services environment.
Must show a commitment to customer satisfaction.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent education/experience required.

Preferred Skills
Salesforce Partner Track Certification (Consulting certification)
Proven experience leading clients and engagement teams through complex solution implementations.
Ability to lead simultaneous initiatives in an entrepreneurial culture.
Multi-task-oriented with desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong, proactive leadership skills.
Additional Notes
Travel dependent on requirements. Typical travel engagements post-Covid will include Managerial and Executive meetings, business travel for strategic sales or client engagements, and requested attendance to industry events.

Equal Employment Opportunity
Cloud for Good provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, disability, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy status, amnesty, veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state and local laws. Cloud for Good complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.
Apply Now

Your cover letter should include:
Why you’d like to work for us
Why you think you’d connect with our clients
Your unique experience and qualifications that make you the best candidate

No Calls Please!']
