column7:
['Company Description', 'At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.', "With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies® 2022.", 'Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.', 'Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.', 'Job Description', 'Come join the Global Cloud Services team and work with a talented group of people building our next-generation Cloud Automation platform. Within Global Cloud Services, this team is responsible for providing a stable, scalable, resilient and secure Control Center through managing the Platform and Infrastructure Orchestration services, CMDB, ITOM Discovery, data governance & Security for ServiceNow Cloud.', "We're looking for a passionate Sr. Staff Product Manager who can help us define product vision and provide thought leadership to our organization.", 'What you get to do in this role:', 'Lead product strategy that sets us up for success as we look to grow to $16B+ in revenue
Communicate product priorities and build consensus
Assume leadership responsibilities as an accountable owner who is committed to the outcome regardless of the role or organizational boundaries
Work with multiple global teams to guide projects through development and bring high-quality products to life
Communicate complex problems into easily understood requirements and provide solutions
Develop multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the needs of different audiences
Lead the promotion of efforts across different groups of team members, along with the ability to influence inside and outside of your team.']

['Fortinet is expanding Deal Desk Function that goes beyond the current deal support or pricing support. The Deal Desk team makes a difference by providing a mechanism to support non-standard deal requests and helping sales navigate between various office functions. This allows Sales to focus on customer facing activities, while the Deals Desk helps coordinate interactions with internal teams as needed. The Deal Desk expert, LATAM will be responsible for collaborating very closely with the LATAM Field Sales Team, Sales Operations, Legal, Finance, Accounting and Product Management as well as other internal stakeholders to ensure that the Field Sales Teams have the support needed to achieve Organizational goals.', 'Responsibilities:', 'In the Sales Finance organization, the Finance Deal Desk expert, LATAM partners with LATAM Sales to structure highly complex transactions, often with global deployments.
Be a trusted finance business partner to the SVP of LATAM Sales and work closely with the sales leadership team in our Sunrise, Florida office
Analyze sales deals for financial impact; Special pricing, Margin analysis, scenario analysis and deal structuring for revenue and gross margins
Build business cases for investment accounts to gain Executive support and remain an active player throughout the sales cycle and exhibit professionalism.
Develop quotes for Enterprise license agreements (ELA) and assist pricing team with proposals to large enterprise customers
Support ad hoc reporting and financial projects; provide input and recommendations for streamlining processes and making process improvements
Work cross-functionally with internal customers and stakeholders for input.
Influence discount improvements through competitive intelligence and developing a subject matter expertise and to provide support where needed.
Engage closely with Legal to support nonstandard commercial terms and conditions with proper approvals in place.
Work with stakeholders who manage daily quote approval process, non-standard deal requirements, etc.
Ensure compliance with published sales and business approval policies and serve as an escalation point to business leaders with proper rationale.
Display senior level influence to gain organizational support for any necessary process, pricing and deal changes.', '', 'Required Skills', '12+ years’ experience in supporting global organizations; operating a finance deal desk role and/or Sales finance experience running contractual negotiations and a team responsible for contractual negotiation.
Thorough understanding of all industry standard and non-standard hardware and software selling models, including subscription, SaaS, term, on demand, consumption and etc.
Good understanding of revenue recognition requirements.
Strong and active listening skills and overall communication skills, both written and verbal.
Demonstrated ability and willingness to take initiative in owning, dealing with and resolving problems on a logical basis.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure, prioritize tasks and managing it well.
Flexibility to adapt to constant change, detail oriented, thorough and responsive.
Self-starter demonstrated ability to work independently in a team environment.
Fluent in English and Spanish; MBA desired.', 'Fortinet has been built on diversity. Our company is a diverse workplace resulting from an integrated team with true international representation and contributors with a variety of talents, backgrounds, experiences, and approaches. We have an equal and transparent selection process, you will be considered regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, or disability. In fact, if you have any disability that requires for us to do any accommodation, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com.', '#LI-PC4']

We meet together 1-2 times per quarter as a leadership team at HQ.', 'What are we doing at Uscreen?', 'Uscreen is a growing (and profitable) bootstrapped product-led SaaS business revolutionizing the way that video-based entrepreneurs & creators monetize their content.', 'Uscreen provides an all-in-one video membership platform. We empower video-based entrepreneurs to monetize subscriptions, communities, courses, and live-streamed events across platforms (web, mobile, & TV).', '25,000+ video creators sell, market, manage, & grow their businesses with Uscreen — and they generate hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue doing it.', 'As the Director of Finance, you will lead our new Finance Team and report to our COO You’ll work cross-functionally with product, go-to-market, and people operations to support growth at Uscreen. And you’ll partner closely with the Exec Team on strategic planning.', 'As the operational Finance Team lead, you’ll be responsible for three core functions:', 'Accounting (past)\nFinancial Operations (present)\nFP&A (future)']

column7:
['Sr Data and Reporting Analyst', 'LeadVenture’s OEM partnerships team is searching for our “go-to” person for reporting and analytics. We’re looking for someone who is intellectually curious, enjoys numbers and telling a story with the numbers. You’ll use your systems knowledge and analytical skills to find business opportunities in the data and collaborate with internal partners including our business development and strategy teams. This role reports directly to the Senior Director, Revenue Operations.



Only candidates residing within 90 miles in either Southern California, Austin Texas, or Portland Oregon will be considered for this position.', 'Here is more of what you’ll get to do:', 'Access, evaluate, curate and deliver data at speed with high degree of confidence.
Understand and unpack the data to get to the “whys” and the “hows”
Understand the systems we use and provides insights and recommendations on how to utilize them effectively
Partner with our business development teams on proposals, pricing, margins
Work with multiple data sets in various locations to aggregate for summarized dashboard ease of interpretation and provide actionable direction
Help determine effective and actionable KPIs
Be a subject matter expert on reporting suite with revenue ops, product, and potentially finance.
Support business development activities during all stages of the sales funnel and lifecycle. (Pre-sales, Funnel, Post-sales).
Support organizing the team to help produce relevant business deliverables', 'You’ll thrive in this role if you have:', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a field of study related to the role.
5+ years’ experience building and maintaining advanced dashboards with data visualization tools
Experience working with analytical tools (e.g., Power BI, Salesforce, Excel, Microsoft CRM, Google Analytics)
Strong communication skills and ability to establish credibility and trust with cross functional departments and internal partners
Strong problem-solving skills, enthusiasm and confidence in your abilities", 'Location:', 'Southern California, Portland OR, or Austin Texas
Hybrid role, 50% remote
Willingness to travel up 25% of the time (at least 1x month if outside of SoCal area); more so during initial employment period for training', 'Compensation:', '$85,000 -$105,000 based on experience']

['Type of Employee: Full Time', 'Druva enables cyber, data and operational resilience for every organization with the Data Resiliency Cloud, the industry’s first and only at scale SaaS solution. Customers can radically simplify data protection, streamline data governance, and gain data visibility and insights as they accelerate cloud adoption. Druva pioneered a SaaS-based approach to eliminate complex infrastructure and related management costs, and deliver data resilience via a single platform spanning multiple geographies and clouds.', 'Druva is trusted by thousands of enterprises, including 60 of Fortune 500, to make data more resilient and accelerate their journey to the cloud. Visit druva.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.', 'The Role & The Team:', 'This is a field and customer facing product management role. You will collaborate with our cross-functional customers facing teams to interact with our 3000+ customer base to understand their data security and governance needs and bring back insights, ideas for the roadmap. Specific areas of responsibility include:', 'Working with the product managers, marketing team to build key product marketing collateral and
deliver field sales team training.
Customer interaction for product demos, roadmap presentations, product feedback and escalations
Analyze product telemetry to develop insights for product roadmap and drive product adoption
Explore new product features, concepts and develop comprehensive market/product requirements
Respond to industry analyst questionnaires, surveys and develop analyst facing presentations', 'The security & governance product lines are experiencing rapid growth and this is a key role with significant
scope for impact, visibility.', 'What We Are Looking For:', '7-10 years of building, shipping B2B SaaS products
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, MBA would be a plus
Functional experience, track record as PM/PO
Experience in working in the security domain (Endpoint/Cloud/Network Security, Anti-malware, Security Operations (SIEM/XDR))
Highly technical background with an ability to dive deep into products, technology, UX.
Highly analytical with an ability to understand metrics, develop a data driven point-of-view
Excellent PM presence with clear written, verbal communication skills
Hustler with a sense of urgency and a can-do attitude. Track record of iterating, taking ownership and driving products from concept to execution
Experience working in high growth, startup environments']

column7: ['Job Title: Lead, Sales Management', 'Job Number: IMS20222408-89418', 'Job Location: Hybrid Based Out of St. Petersburg, FL - Remote a Possibility', 'Job Description:', 'Primary Purpose of the Job', 'L3Harris Commercial Aviation operates an agile and rapidly evolving Digital and Data Services business, providing outsourced flight data monitoring, analytic services and SaaS to aircraft operators worldwide. We are seeking a Lead, Sales Manager to grow our existing flight data services business and to support the establishment, roll out and sale of a range of new SaaS solutions into the aviation domain.', 'The successful candidate will report to the Global Sales Director for Digital and Data and be responsible for the growth of our existing Flight Data Services business as well as playing a key part in supporting business growth across a range of new SaaS products, targeting airline and MRO clients.', 'The candidate will be pivotal in developing business strategy, identifying and qualifying new business opportunities and interfacing with customers to close contract orders and meet annual operating and growth plans.', 'The Organization - L3Harris', 'L3Harris Commercial Aviation’s Digital and Data Services business provides outsourced flight data monitoring and analytic services and SaaS to aircraft operators worldwide. Using our flight data processing and analytics software we ensure that our customers achieve an improvement in flight safety and cost of operations.']

column7:
['Say hello to possibilities.', 'It’s not every day that you consider starting a new career. We’re RingCentral, and we’re happy that someone as talented as you are considering this role.', '', 'First, a little about us, we’re a global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We are fundamentally changing the nature of human interaction—giving people the freedom to connect powerfully and personally from anywhere, at any time, on any device.', '', 'We’re a $2 billion company that’s growing annually and we’re expanding our Global Operations Team to make sure we stay ahead of the competition.', '', 'We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who will engage with Customer Support and Success organizations to understand business processes, use case flows and user needs from business systems, drill into the details to analyze complex processes and translate them into business and functional requirements. You will be responsible for documenting detailed business requirements, defining project scope and objectives, systems configuration, testing, implementation, continuous improvement, and ongoing support. To ensure we provide optimal service to our business partners, you will have a deep understanding of customer operations and process, experience documenting process flows and methodologies along with a strong analytical and data modeling background. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Manager of Digital Operations.', 'Lead requirements gathering sessions and interview cross functional Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to elicit business requirements
Analyze existing and future state business processes, systems and flows of data to identify and drive opportunities for improvement
Partner with business leaders and product managers to define and track objectives and key results
Leverage a strong understanding of Salesforce Sales Cloud to design and oversee the implementations of technology solutions to support Customer Support, Customer Success & Professional Services
Develop and maintain documentation of new and existing business processes and related systems
Partner with business, internal and external technology teams to define associated system requirements and solutions
Participate in systems implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution)
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, decompose high-level information into details, synthesize low-level information into a general understanding
Be proactive and take initiative to gather information, investigate gaps/issues, identifies potential solutions and present to both Business and IT stakeholders
Work closely with vendors, implementation partners, architects, developers and business units to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction
Work with various teams to develop project milestones and timelines for development, UAT, production validation and go live
Support delivery of reporting, dashboards and business intelligence capabilities through partnership with IT and Business
Lead and perform data management and migration activities
Manage user training and timely communications in accordance with project timelines', '']

['About Certara', 'Certara accelerates medicines using proprietary biosimulation software, technology and services to transform traditional drug discovery and development. Its clients include more than 2,000 biopharmaceutical companies, academic institutions and regulatory agencies across 62 countries.', '', 'Certara is hiring a Global Account Manager (GAM) for our Software division, focusing on driving growth for Certara Software’s existing and future solutions. The Global Account Manager will be responsible for managing all customer-facing activities within a named account list of the world’s largest Life Sciences companies. In this role, you will build and maintain a thorough understanding of Certara software solutions and services, working closely to manage and grow, not only existing business, but developing new business by selling all Certara Software solutions by helping the top life sciences industry influencers transform their business. This is accomplished through extracting value from our innovative solutions resulting in organizational transformation, digitalization and accelerating science. The role requires industry knowledge including: competitive landscape, solution linkage by identifying customer challenges, understanding and uncovering key requirements and properly positioning our software solutions within your assigned accounts.', '', 'This role requires strong initiative, self-motivation and collaborative skills to work with core team members, other Certara divisions and Certara strategic partners (Accenture, ZS, Cognizent etc.) to drive value and grow business. The ideal candidate for this position will possess a strong complex sales aptitude and a willingness to grow sales utilizing complex sales and consultative methodologies and other modern selling approaches.', '', 'You will build virtual global teams to develop, coordinate, and implement plans designed to increase existing business and create/capture new opportunities worldwide within your accounts. As part of the sales approach virtual teams will assist you in conducting Business Value Assessments within your named accounts to help them build a business case based on value approaches resulting in Value Identification, Value Delivery, Value Realization and Value Measurement. You must be keenly aware of organizational growth initiatives related to the life science market and target customer segments, as well as Certara’s potential to meet customer needs with software solutions and services.', 'Establish multiple-level contacts within assigned accounts by presenting to, consulting with, and cultivating relationships at all influencers levels including C-level executives.
Qualify assigned companies and contacts to understand key needs/challenges through identification, discovery, planning and account/stakeholders qualifications; develop and effective “Stakeholder’s Analysis” and execute on the “People Plan” to effectively move “detractors to supporter” as one example.Understand the “political” landscape and influencer model as part of this critical skill.
Grow sales by successfully initiating client contacts, generate new leads within your accounts (Whitespace Analysis), and building a strong pipeline of new business/growth from lead qualification to closing. Generate new interesting in Solutions with Account Based Marketing approaches.
Develop account specific solution strategies, activities and presentations and contribute to the RFP/RFI response and proposal process, developing appropriate value based win strategies based on your knowledge of the account.
Experience in implementing effective Governance models between solution providers/partners and customers resulting in true strategic “partnerships”.', '']

['Oracle Retail Senior Consultant', '', '', '', '', "Work You'll Do", '', '', '', 'Identifying, writing and managing business requirements.\nContributing to the functional and technical design, prototyping, and process design stages of implementations (including scenario design, flow mapping).\nSupporting configurations, customization, reports and interfaces, testing and user training.']

['Allergan Data Labs is on a mission to transform the Allergan Aesthetics beauty business at AbbVie, one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world. Our iconic brands include Botox, CoolSculpting, Juvéderm, and more.', 'Allergan Data Labs is on a mission to transform the Allergan Aesthetics beauty business at Abbvie, one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world. Our iconic brands include Botox, CoolSculpting, Juvéderm and more. The medical aesthetics business is ripe for rapid growth and disruption, and we are looking for an experienced Associate Director, Allē Business Strategy to add to our high performing team to do just that.', 'Our team has successfully launched a new and innovative technology platform, Allē, which serves millions of consumers, tens of thousands of aesthetics providers and thousands of colleagues throughout the US. Since its launch in November 2020, Allē has delivered curated promotions, personalized experiences and had millions of consumers use it as part of their beauty journey. Now, we are looking for an experienced business strategist to collaborate with cross functional teams and take a data driven approach in helping to shape & execute Allē Business Strategy to include new market expansion, product partnerships, and new strategic initiatives.', "We're looking for candidates who are interested in working within a technology startup-oriented environment, while having the backing of a large company. If that's you, please read on.", 'As an Associate Director of Allē Business Strategy, you will report to the Director of Strategy in collaborating with senior stakeholders across the business to guide our Allē Business Strategy focused on aesthetics and beauty service providers (providers).', '', '', 'You Will', 'Represent Providers in informing Allē Business Strategy in annual business planning and quarterly business reviews to surface insights for proactive decision making in collaboration with Product, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and Data Science teams
Develop comprehensive, data-backed assessments and business cases to validate and prioritize strategic initiatives for the provider market
Build relationships across the business to drive cross-functional collaboration
Build, monitor, and report Allē Business KPIs to track Business Strategy Plan and measure the performance and impact of our product / strategic initiatives on Allergan business from a provider perspective
Work to intimately understand the voice of the customer and translate that into prioritization and organization of initiatives
Convert analyses of product usage patterns, feature adoption, go-to-market performance, and customer churn into strategic, high-impact insights', 'Required Experience & Skills']

column7:
['The Key Account Manager is to grow and maintain our Key Accounts. An ideal Key Account Manager must build strong relationships with relevant stakeholders to champion new applications, provide inroads for growth and expansion, and service existing business. They will be the lead point of contact for assigned Key Accounts, manage expectations while balancing resources, and leverage internal support to promote account success. Expansion of usage and account growth will be the primary focus of a KAM through connection with new business units and new relationships.', 'Key Account Manager Duties and Responsibilities
Developing a solid and trusting relationship between major key clients and company
Resolving key client issues and complaints
Developing a complete understanding of key account needs
Anticipating key account changes and improvements
Managing communications between key clients and internal teams
Managing account team assigned to each client – leaning on regional support
Strategic planning to improve client results
Negotiating contracts with the client
Understand and work within budget cycles to provide US and Intl Sales Managers forecast of Key Accounts
Establishing and overseeing Annual Recurring Revenue and tracking results against forecast
Working with design, sales team, creative, advertising, logistics, managers, marketing, and team members from other departments dedicated to the same client account to ensure the highest quality of materials are being produced and all client needs met
Collaborating with the sales team and partners to maximize profit by up-selling or cross-selling
Planning and presenting reports on account progress, goals, and quarterly initiatives to share with team members, stakeholders, and possible use in future case studies or company training
Meeting all client needs and deliverables according to proposed timelines
Working with Customer Success team to analyze client data to provide customer relationship management through Quarterly Reviews
Expanding relationships and bringing in new work through new products or gaps', "Key Account Manager Requirements and Qualifications
Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
Goal-oriented, organized team player
Encouraging to team and staff; able to mentor and lead
Self-motivated and self-directed
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills
In-depth understanding of company key clients and their position in the industry
Eager to expand the company with new sales, clients, and territories
Able to analyze data and sales statistics and translate results into better solutions
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, business administration, sales, or relevant field; Master's degree preferred
7-10 years previous work experience in sales, management, key account management
Drilling or Completions background preferred
SaaS Solution Selling background encourage
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; must be a listener, a presenter, and a people-person
Basic computer skills, and experience with CRM software and the Microsoft Office Suite, with emphasis on superior Excel skills.
Strong negotiation skills, with ability follow-through on client contracts
Ability to multitask and manage more than one client account
Proven results of delivering client solutions and meeting sales goals"]

column7: ['About NCR', 'NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a leading software- and services-led enterprise provider in the financial, retail and hospitality industries. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with 36,000 employees globally. NCR is a trademark of NCR Corporation in the United States and other countries.', '', 'POSITION SUMMARY:', '', 'The role is responsible for acting as a liaison between Product Management, Customers, and Sales. The successful individual will have strong customer empathy and knowledge of the SaaS delivery model.', '', 'This is a dynamic role switching daily between driving strategic objectives in new solution areas or with clients to solicit solution and operational feedback', '', 'This role also the CX team on evaluating NPS scores, at risk clients, and operational efficiencies.']

["Smarking is a leading provider of enterprise software and data technology solutions for the massively overlooked $655B global parking industry. With the post pandemic recovery across the industry, Smarking's Automated Yield Management (AYM) - the first Machine Learning (ML) based dynamic pricing engine in the parking industry - is gaining rapidly growing traction and requires systematic scaling to meet the market needs.
This is an excellent position for a highly capable software engineer who's passionate about scaling backend infrastructure, building and improving data and ML pipelines, refining machine learning algorithms, expanding integrations with our partners, and taking the Smarking AYM to the next level.

Reporting directly to the CTO, the Sr. ML & Data Engineer will work with state-of-the-industry technologies including Python, Postgres, Flask, Docker, Redis, ElasticSearch, Airflow, Terraform, and AWS services such as EC2, S3, RDS, and ECS, and lead major engineering efforts that immediately impact our business and operations. Our infrastructure is cloud native, and we are moving towards a server less architecture.", 'KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead and execute mission critical software projects
Scale Smarking AYM, an ML powered dynamic pricing engine on AWS
Develop new integrations for AYM
Refine ML algorithms for different industry cases
Develop API and UI for end user facing manipulation of the pricing platform
Other project opportunities may include: building distributed systems for real-time data streaming, anomaly detection, predictive analytics; scaling databases and backend services to handle rapidly growing data volume and API requests; expanding data integrations; and building internal tooling for data warehouses.', 'QUALIFICATIONS (EXPERIENCE)
5+ years professional software engineering experience
2+ years working on a SAAS product
Desire to learn new technologies
Strong experience with backend technologies including Python, Flask, Postgres, SqlAlchemy, Celery, Airflow
Experience with data transformation, cleansing, and manipulation.
Production-level experience with machine learning is a big plus.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Knowledge about front-end stack (Javascript/CSS/React/Typescript) is a plus.', '', '', 'QUALIFICATIONS (CHARACTER)
Hungry for responsibility, impact, and growth
Humble, open-minded, and curious to learn
Team first
Strong sense of ownership
Treat others with respect, empathy, and constructive candor', 'COMPENSATION
Competitive salary and equity.
100% coverage of medical, dental, and vision insurances.
401K plan with 3% company hard match.
$100 monthly data plan.
$60 per month gym membership (or other physical activity)
Unlimited paid time off.
Expenses for setting up home-office.', "About Smarking

Smarking is a group of passionate MIT PhDs, data scientists, Silicon Valley engineers, and battle-tested business professionals, committed to enable highly efficient urban mobility by building the digital infrastructure for the massively overlooked $655B global parking industry ($131B in the US).

Smarking is hired by organizations like Brookfield Properties, City of Miami, ABM Industry Groups, and many other enterprise industry leaders to turn their parking data into business results. Smarking's dynamic pricing engine has been creating 40%-400% revenue uplift for online parking sales at parking facilities in Chicago, NYC, Boston, and many other cities, without any manual involvement required from property managers, leveraging fully automatic algorithm-driven yield management technologies similar to the airline and hotel industries.

By providing the very first business intelligence and yield management enterprise SaaS to the parking industry, Smarking is establishing itself as an emerging leader in the US parking market. Smarking currently works with 2,500+ parking locations cross North America, based in San Francisco, and backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures and Y Combinator."]

column1: Imaging Digital Solutions Modality Vice President USCAN
column7:
['Job Description Summary', '', '', '', 'Job Description', 'Responsibilities', 'Lead segmentation and product strategy across the Imaging Digital Solutions (IDS) portfolio for the USCAN region; responsible for driving growth and attaining annual Operating Plan for profitable orders (TCV) and recurring revenue (ACV)
Develop value propositions and sales strategy for the IDS product portfolio (NPI execution, renewals, enhancements, etc.) using customer input, clinical data and design principles; communicates value proposition across the USCAN Regions
Owns strategies and tactics to drive IDS penetration across the USCAN markets:
Provide input to the formulation of the yearly business planning cycles within their Strategic Business Unit and Geographical Region (e.g. WWPP, Growth Playbook, & SII)
Understand market dynamics and competitive trends across the USCAN markets while driving an understanding of the IDS strategy throughout the field', 'Prioritizes NPI activation to focus effort on NPIs that will drive the most growth while ensuring there is a comprehensive set of sales tools, configurations, pricing, and messaging to activate
Accountable for timely and accurate forecasting of pipeline and sales per the normal reporting cycles within the Product Business unit and Geographical Region
Support in driving Key Opinion Leader relationships and evidence generation for internal and external marketing purposes
Collaborate with IT Professional Services team to align demand and forecasts with product schedules
Own and curate the product training of our sales teams
Accountable for positive leadership and culture of the team through ongoing direction, coaching, and career development of leaders; strong demonstration of GEHC leadership behaviors', '', 'Qualifications']

column7:
['Requisition ID
531084', '', "Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps generate the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and optimize outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at www.medidata.com and follow us @medidata.
Your Mission:
The Professional Services Operational Advisor is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) role focusing on advising and mentoring our clients/partners during and after implementation of Medidata Clinical Cloud Products on our Unified Platform. Using your operational experience in Clinical Operations and/or Clinical Data Management you will be a key member of the Medidata Professional Services team driving the successful implementation and adoption of one or more Medidata Clinical Cloud Products within our Partners.
Key activities performed by the Professional Services Operational Advisor will include:
Provide strategic input, guidance, advice, knowledge and best practices to support Clients in driving implementation and adoption of Medidata Clinical Cloud Products
Advise clients/partners for implementation or study conduct which may include training delivery
Establish “Trusted Advisor” Partner relationship through effective consultation
Provide operational expertise during and after process and build enablement activities
Lead and deliver new release overviews, knowledge transfer and risk assessments in providing operational input and support to the implementation of new releases
Develop and maintain relationships with SMEs
Attend Key Operational Meetings in support of Medidata Rave RTSM
Work closely with the relevant Sales team members to support further adoption of product across the platform
Where appropriate develop operational specific materials to support the use of Medidata Rave RTSM
The Professional Services Operational Advisor is responsible for maintaining a high-level of expertise for Rave RTSM.
They are expected to invest approximately 15% of their time in the following key internal Medidata activities:
Maintain individual Product and Industry expertise by attending regular Product Training and external industry training, e.g. conferences.
Represent Professional Services team in Product Adoption and Optimization (PAO) workstreams and initiatives; sharing knowledge back to the full Professional Services team
Along with the RTSM Technical Advisor, lead the maintenance and development of the Accreditation program for Rave RTSM ensuring it is kept up to date and relevant with new release information
Support training of wider Professional Services team to enhance Product and Industry knowledge across team
Collate and maintain list of defect and enhancements that require addressing by Medidata Product teams
Provide operational insight to defect and enhancement requests Provide operational input to Medidata's implementation process, best practices and collateral roadmaps ensuring that Professional Services team is represented
Attend specific Product Forums related to Medidata Clinical Cloud Products Ensure SOPs and other process documents are up to date
Work with Medidata Academy on the development of collateral material.
The Professional Services Operational Advisor will collaborate with the following teams: PAO, Professional Services teams, Operational Excellence, Sales and Marketing, Customer Success, RnD/Product teams, Global Education
Your Competencies:
The successful candidate will have:
Ability to challenge processes that are inefficient or counterproductive and establish/deploy new processes to improve efficiency, strong change management and collaboration skills.
Extensive knowledge of clinical research (pharma, device and/or biotech sectors) and the function of RTSM/IRT and a solid understanding of Clinical Research SaaS technology. Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication (public speaking and teaching), presentation and writing skills
Proven ability to successfully work independently on new projects and initiatives while also being able to collaborate with others when needed to achieve goals Ability to overcome obstacles, troubleshoot and reach resolutions
Willingness for 15-25% national/international travel time
In addition, the candidate will:
Be self-motivated
Demonstrate they can work independently
Seen to take initiative and demonstrate responsibility and accountability
Your Education & Experience:
8+ years’ experience from Clinical Operations and/or Clinical Data Management roles in Sponsor, CRO or other equivalent organizations
Degree required or equivalent experience
Leading change & strategic thinking
Creating/leading strategic initiatives
Leading teams - both internal and customer - during the implementation of a 'change management (or other)' initiatives
Consulting/advising customers
Senior/Exec level engagement with customers - and internal stakeholders
Involvement in the selling process - and making presentations to customers
As with all roles, Medidata sets ranges based on a number of factors including function, level, candidate expertise and experience, and geographic location.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the NYC Metro Area is $114,750.00 to 147,844.00.
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the California Bay Area is $121,500.00 to 162,000.00 .
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in the Boston Metro Area is $113,250.00 to 151,000.00 .
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in Texas or Ohio is $101,250 to 135,000.00 .
The salary range for positions that will be physically based in all other locations within the United States is $102,750.00 to 140,000.00 .
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission on the terms of applicable plan documents, and many of Medidata’s non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Medidata believes that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and provides best-in-class benefits, including medical, dental, life and disability insurance; 401(k) matching; unlimited paid time off (subject to management discretion); and 10 paid holidays per year.
#LI-TC1
#LI-Remote
Equal Employment Opportunity
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.
Covid Statement
Our Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine."]

Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.", '', 'We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions. If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you."]

column1: Business Development Executive, RFID & Inventory Visibility Solutions (remote)
column7:
['Job Details', 'What you will do', 'Sensormatic Solutions, a division of Johnson Controls, brings together diverse data and insights with our intelligent operating platform that is crafted to drive improved shopper experiences and Retail outcomes. Our innovative solutions (Loss Prevention, ShopperTrak and Inventory Intelligence) drive improved customer experiences and enable retailers to build streamlined shopping.

The Business Development Executive, within the Digital Solutions and Inventory Intelligence team, will generate leads and secure business with new and existing, high-revenue retailers. The impactful B2B seller will drive revenue from brick-and-mortar retailers and target Retail senior leaders in Information Technology, Store Operations, Loss Prevention, and Finance to deliver our value propositions in RFID and Digital Solutions.

Are you an experienced sales professional with SaaS experience ready to directly impact a growing business? Come join Sensormatic Solutions today and help transform the Retail industry!', 'NOTE: This is a virtual/remote position considering candidates who reside within the United States.', 'How you will do it', '', 'Qualify major opportunities and drive a consistent sales strategy (value messaging, relationship approach, competitive differentiation).
Drive demand generation activities by playing a key role in devising strategies to promote Sensormatic Solutions into tangible business results.
Plan, direct, and lead sales and marketing activities to continually reflect customer trends, market fluctuations, and changes in business practices/technology.
Establish relationships with key decision makers within the Retail vertical.
Sell and present solutions across the entire solution portfolio, while establishing and articulating innovations and growth opportunities specific to Digital and RFID-based solutions.', 'What we look for
Required', '', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field of study.
Minimum 5+ years of B2B experience selling software (SaaS), technology, or RFID solutions.
Proven track record of generating new logo and new opportunity customers.
Clear, effective communication.
Experience selling into the Retail vertical is preferred.']

column1: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer with Sales Aptitude
column7:
['(Texas)
Position Summary: The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer works closely with the engineering, development, operations and sales teams to provide highly available and fault tolerant IaaS, PaaS and Saas cloud service solutions to enterprise customers. By leveraging multiple cloud technologies from a variety of vendors to provide a true cloud-agnostic solution, the Cloud Infrastructure Engineer produces and owns scalable and reliable solutions with automated tools to provision hosts within multiple disparate cloud infrastructures.
Job Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:
Provide senior architectural leadership to all phases of the cloud program, including the Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS) and cloud application architecture subprograms
Review customer requirements; research and recommend possible solutions.
Develop cost cases including hardware, software and labor to transition from the current environment to the proposed solution
Work closely with internal sales team and external clients in consultative selling role.
Understand client business requirements, issues and priorities, and develop a solution that advances client business strategy
Provide on-site and/or remote escalation and troubleshooting support, and serve on-call on a rotational basis
Develop and deliver customized cloud Paas, Iaas, and Saas solutions to clients
Create and maintain technical documentation for operational readiness
Build, tune, troubleshoot and document systems in high availability clusters
Create and maintain security best practices
Create custom automation for host provisioning on various cloud platforms
Configure and maintain virtual networking, including load balancers, firewalls and switches
Create and maintain production tools for day-to-day operations and 24×7 monitoring
Participate in significant architectural decisions about the next iterations of the cloud
Take ownership of important components of the architecture that powers our cloud and the clouds of our clients
Provide troubleshooting expertise for virtualization performance and other issues
Train and educate sales colleagues about various cloud technologies
Drive automation and provisioning throughout the entire IT environment
Solve business needs with technology by evaluating different technology options and vendor products
Provide Proof-of-Concept (POC) environment and advising on design and implementation approaches to assess the feasibility of solutions and demonstrate to our clients how technology can be leveraged
Basic Required Skills and Experience/Minimum Experience/Minimum Job Qualifications:
Strong communication skills, customer-centric, and comfortable in a sales support role as needed
Assist in preparing and delivering product presentations to customers and prospects during customer meetings and marketing seminars and live demonstrations of cloud-based products, services and solutions
Minimum 4 years of experience working in cloud infrastructure architecture
Minimum 4 years of experience working in a sales support/consulting position and solution selling
Minimum 4 years of experience working with Line of Business (LOB) and IT client executives effectively in a collaborative role
Minimum years of experience developing customer proposals, technical presentations and landscape diagrams
Working knowledge of numerous cloud-based products and services and a willingness to maintain cutting-edge knowledge of cloud-based technology going forward
Experience in working with C-level clients effectively in a collaborative role
If you are interested in this position, please download and send your completed application to Careers@liquidnetworx.com.']

["Product Manager- Embryo Options
CooperSurgical, Inc
Naperville, IL - REMOTE
Job Summary
The Product Manager is responsible to execute the go-to-market requirements for patient software solutions including Embryo Options, Freeze, Donor and any added products developed utilizing SAAS (software as a service) solutions for CooperSurgical.
Under general product direction, the Product Manager receives projects, generates marketing requirements, decides specification, cross-functional management of product timelines and market readiness for CooperSurgical patient software solutions. Marcoms preparation, market requirements, new development builds and product features requires the Product Manager to identify requirements, execute project management and ensure prompt deliverables for market entry, existing customer requests and new features. This role will become the knowledge expert and main liaison between marketing and sales, development, and customer success.
You Will:
Aid with marketing scope, requirements, and deliverables
Ensure project execution delivers marketing commitments
Execute the Marcoms roadmap with focus on product readiness and deliverables
Cross functional relationships with Customer Success and IT Development
Execute and support ERP/CRM requirements
Implement brand changes, requirements and improvements for website, software products and ensure cohesive language and branding for the complete Cooper Surgical solutions
Maintain and Grow Product and Feature Roadmap across multiple products
Project manage international country and launch readiness plans
Manage all development items for execution, timeline, and product fit
Help with scope and manage all requirements as directed for new market entry
Execute integration requirements for new product features between multiple Cooper Surgical businesses
Support the financial requirements and scope analysis for global commercialization
Work with Customer Success, EO Senior Director, and Cooper Software Director to ensure complete product operations
Deliver implementation plan and aid with New-Product implementation
Work with IT to execute product features, new products, and enhancements road map
Work with IT to execute marketing requirements alongside bi-weekly software sprints
Travel Requirements: Willingness to travel (60-90 days) with international travel requirements.
You Have:
Bachelors or equivalent required
Software certifications in relevant SAAS, Microsoft, AOS preferred
>3 years experience with software product management
Successful experience with software implementations
Microsoft Office ability with strong Excel and SharePoint skills
SAAS experience preferred
Strong organizational skills
Ability to multi-task and support multiple project timelines
Willingness to learn and engage multiple business and operations
Ability to deliver on time and within scope
Collaborator with an eagerness to cross-function with Development, IT and Customer Success
Remote with preference for residence within Naperville or Livingston NJ
Fast-paced product development
Robust sales pipeline and implementation
Cross-function collaboration amoung multiple buisneses
About CooperSurgical:
CooperSurgical is a leader in manufacturing and marketing multiple trusted and innovative brands that assist clinicians in improving the health of women, babies and families worldwide. Through an aggressive growth and diversification strategy, CooperSurgical has evolved its portfolio of over 600 products to include products and services used primarily by obstetricians and gynecologists in surgical and medical procedures wherever they occur: in hospitals, surgical centers, medical offices and fertility clinics.
For U.S. locations that require disclosure of compensation, the starting base pay for this role is between $150,000 and $200,000. The actual base pay includes many factors and is subject to change and modification in the future. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation and benefits.
Our Benefits:
As an employee of CooperSurgical, you'll receive an outstanding total compensation plan. As we believe your compensation goes beyond your paycheck, we offer a great compensation package, medical coverage, 401(k), parental leave, fertility benefits, paid time off for vacation, personal, sick and holidays, and multiple other perks and benefits. Please visit us at www.coopersurgical.com to learn more about CooperSurgical and the benefits of becoming a member of our team.
To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of CooperSurgical about this opening. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at CooperSurgical via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of CooperSurgical, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by CooperSurgical for this position and a valid agreement with CooperSurgical is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the CooperSurgical agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace."]

['Senior Strategic Consultant- B2B', '', 'Reporting to the Director of Strategic Consulting, the Senior Strategic Consultant is a Trusted Advisor; to our prospects, our customers, our teammates, our account managers, our delivery team, and our product management team. As a member of our dynamic team, you are the heartbeat of our go-to-market strategy with responsibility for the pre-sales process. You will collaborate across the organization to create a vision of how PROS will increase our prospect’s margin and revenue in a multi-channel world. As a Strategic Consultant, you will develop compelling business cases, create personalized solutions that resonate with the prospect, and demonstrate our software applications in conveying to customers how our solutions will solve their challenges.', '', 'A Day in the Life of the Senior Strategic Consultant- About the role:', 'Communicator: Communication is key! Presenting to our prospects and customers on the benefits of our strategic pricing solutions and how they fit into the organizations strategy is a core function. Trust is a crucial aspect of the relationship, and Strategic Consultants must be credible partners, demonstrating industry domain knowledge and “the art of the possible” using software and smart applications to increase their profits. Listening is one of the most important skills you will leverage as a team member and partner. You will be asked to quickly learn our prospects’ business models and make prescriptive recommendations.', '', 'Relentless Executor: Time kills all deals. You must hustle and stay hungry to win in this business. PROS Strategic Consultants never stop moving forward and driving sales execution. You must help to lead the customer on the need to change, providing new insights into their business, driving solution demos and constructing compelling value case to drive quantifiable revenue or margin improvements for our prospects. You will consult with our Solutions Engineering Team on how to execute personalized product demos for our prospects. Together, the Strategic Consultant and the Executive Account Manager will consistently move the needle in this role to achieve the sales targets.', '', 'Business Strategist: Price is the most impactful lever on profitability. Optimizing that price and delivering it to the customer in a frictionless manner is the name of our game. Thought leadership in business strategy, industry, sales effectiveness, and technology platforms is a critical aspect of your role as a Strategic Consultant. Delivering the ultimate end to end customer experience is what we do, and you will strategize with the internal teams to make that happen.']

['Come and be an integral part of the Oracle Sales Organization!', 'As an Oracle Sales Representative/Consultant, you will leverage the Oracle reputation and sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. We seek self-motivated team players who excel at cultivating strategic relationships while developing new business. You will need strong business acumen and a successful track record of selling to C–level executives, including the ability to translate client needs into appropriate technology solutions. If you have a record of success in sales or sales consulting in hardware, software or SaaS solutions to Fortune 2000 companies we would love to hear from you!', 'Drive and motivation to sell Oracle Technical Professional / Consulting Services full-time. This is a direct sales role.', 'This is a senior level role, comparable to a seasoned Sr. Manager/Associate Partner in the big five model.', 'We are searching for experienced / seasoned Oracle Professional Services / Consulting Services Sales Reps who are successfully selling Oracle consulting/professional services.', 'Come and be an integral part of the Oracle Sales Organization!', 'As an Oracle Sales Representative/Consultant, you will leverage the Oracle reputation and sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. We seek self-motivated team players who excel at cultivating strategic relationships while developing new business. You will need strong business acumen and a successful track record of selling to C–level executives, including the ability to translate client needs into appropriate technology solutions. If you have a record of success in sales or sales consulting in hardware, software or SaaS solutions to Fortune 2000 companies we would love to hear from you!', 'Drive and motivation to sell Oracle Technical Professional / Consulting Services full-time. This is a direct sales role.', 'This is a senior level role, comparable to a seasoned Sr. Manager/Associate Partner in the big five model.', 'We are searching for experienced / seasoned Oracle Professional Services / Consulting Services Sales Reps who are successfully selling Oracle consulting/professional services.']

['Hi, We’re AppFolio.', 'We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based powerhouse that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating.', '', 'We love where we work, and you can, too.', '', 'As a Solution Engineer, you work closely and enable our SMB, Mid Market and Enterprise sales teams with a variety of internal strategy and customer-focused services to assist in achieving bookings goals. This senior level, requires you to be a subject matter expert in this technical selling role working closely with AppFolio Property Manager leadership making decisions that will impact the Property Management Industry.', '', 'You will be responsible for technical aspects of proposed solutions working in close partnership with our APM Sales team. You will drive sales with technical acumen, product expertise, product demonstrations, sales ability and a superior customer focus. SE’s participate as part of the sales team to achieve or exceed revenue targets.', '', 'The ideal candidate brings property management and/or experience selling, demonstrating, supporting, implementing or working closely with SaaS applications. The ability to build extraordinary relationships with customers, team members and cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales Operations and Product Teams is critical. Also has a passion for customer satisfaction, an affinity for details and possesses a record of independent action.']

['Territory Manager', 'Efficient Engineering is when a PLAN becomes EPLAN', 'EPLAN Software & Services LLC provides software and service solutions in the fields of electrical, automation, and mechatronics engineering. The company develops one of the world’s leading design software solutions for machine and panel builders. We continually evolve the business with help from our Marketing, Sales, and Professional Services Teams as we grow our presence in the North American Markets.', 'As a Territory Manager, you will be selling EPLAN Software & Services. You will need to balance the management of existing customers while building a pipeline of new business. You will work closely with our national consulting engineering team to provide detail-specific solutions for our customers. We need someone who enjoys identifying opportunities, providing solutions, and closing business.', 'You will contribute by analyzing customer facilities and requirements to help drive their business needs through the EPLAN platform. Additionally;', 'Represent and communicate EPLAN’s overall Software and training product line to potential and current customer base.
Assess customer needs and partner with EPLAN’s professional service specialists to provide a full scope of product solutions.
Service existing accounts, obtaining orders, and establishing new accounts by calling on existing or potential accounts in an assigned territory
Focus sales efforts by studying existing accounts and past issues. Pitch and adjust the content of sales presentations through the study of accounts
Keep management informed by submitting monthly activity-results reports and territory analyses
Help to monitor competitive publications by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, and accounts
Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, and making recommendations to management
Attend networking events within your assigned territory
Responsible for increasing sales and market share within a defined territory through measures of daily contact with customers, follow-up on potential leads, and cold calling.
Work closely with the inside sales team to provide timely and profitable quotes.
Assist in the development of the annual business plan and coordinate its implementation.
Keep management apprised of market trends and sales opportunities
Work in conjunction with local distributors.
Other duties as assigned.', 'What we are looking for is an Territory Manager with the ability to passionately promote and display their industry knowledge to an expansive clientele as we strive to grow our business.', 'We are looking for someone with a bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or a degree in Business Administration/Marketing along with relevant experience
We are looking for 5 years of experience selling Enterprise SaaS platforms
You have strong knowledge of the CAE/CAD marketplace and engineering applications
We preferred candidates with experience in the industrial automation industry
You have strong interpersonal skills and are going to show your proven ability to develop and build strong relationships with c-level and senior management of clients
We need someone who is highly proficient in their computer skills including internet, CRM, email, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and has a complete understanding of consultative and solution selling strategies', 'What we offer is an opportunity to be a part of a team that increases the optimization and efficiency of CAD/CAE professionals worldwide. Our goal is to develop long-term and meaningful loyal relationships where our inspiration and creativity result in our competitive advantage. We enjoy all the benefits of an International company quickly growing in the US.', 'EPLAN Software & Service LLC is an EOE employer part of the owner-operated Friedhelm Loh Group. All individuals, including minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. FLSA Exempt (Not eligible for overtime).']

column7:
['OXIO is the first NeoTelco. We are building the world’s largest, most accessible, and insightful Telecom network. Our platform empowers anyone to spin up their own carrier from a browser, scaling and supporting you as you scale your network to millions of users.

We ensure that users and devices are connected, and stay connected wherever they go: Cross- country, carrier, or cellular technology. We help them pay less for mobile data. This technology is provided through our Carrier-as-a-Service platform: BrandVNO, a fully customizable telecom service. In addition, we enable clients of our service to extract the value from telecom data - enriching their customer experience, business intelligence, and product understanding in the many markets in which we operate.

Key Responsibilities
Using our technology stack we collect a massive amount of valuable data from our telecom, app, and payment services. This data translates into actionable insights for OXIO and our customers. You will be the first dedicated Product Manager to lead the vision of the products built around this data stack. As such you will be responsible for:
Developing products that always have data privacy of the data subject top of mind
Lead the vision, roadmap, and execution of OXIO’s Business Intelligence Product (BrandIQ) as well as OXIO’s Data Rewards Module (BrandVNO)
Understanding company objectives and partner with internal teams (e.g., sales, customer success, engineering, data scientists, etc.) to gather requirements and make prioritization decisions
Understanding market trends and needs
Executing on the roadmap by working closely with Product designers, Engineers, and the other teams
Clearly communicate product strategy to diverse stakeholders

Key Qualifications
5+ years as a product manager
Technical depth to collaborate with Data Science & Engineering teams
Strong oral and written communication skills as well as proven ability to work with cross functional stakeholders
Experience with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR / CCPA), and how it applies to customer data collection and processing
Knowledge of databases, SQL and business intelligence tools

Nice to have
Previous experience in a SaaS companyPrivacy certifications (e.g., IAPP)
Experience working in a B2B2C environments
Data analytics experience
Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau / Sisense
Working knowledge of Jira, Asana, and other similar tools

Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in New York. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, OXIO offers equity (where applicable), and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, and paid leave (including PTO) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in New York is: $140,000-$165,000.', 'Our culture and team

At OXIO, we put our people first. Some of our core values and approaches include:

Creating a fun environment that empowers you
Thinking about how to do things better, not how its been done
Show up for your team, be early, don’t whine or complain without a solution (Pete Carrol)
Everything has a DRI (Directly Responsible Individual) – ownership and accountability matter
OKR’s at the bottom should reflect OKR’s at the top
Don’t get stressed about the future not happening fast enough: you alone can help change it
You have the power to change one of the most important and dominant industries in modern times
Management must lead by example with work ethic, empathy, and high expectations
Our success is built on our unique and disruptive products, provided not only to our enterprise customers, but also to their own customer base
We are a diverse and inclusive organisation that values diverse points of view and opinions. We believe in empowering individuals, but also realize that team collaboration drives our business forward
OXIO has a strong technology centric culture, starting with our CEO who has led 2 startups in the space into successful exits.
Our organization is distributed with Headquarters in New York City and offices in Montreal, Mexico City and Sao Paulo
Being global and distributed, English fluency ensures we can all communicate, but we place importance on understanding and embracing cultural diversity.

Benefits

Be a sub-100 team member at a fast growing start-up
Have a big impact relative to a small role in larger tech organization
Mentorship and improvement opportunities
Career path and growth in individual contributor (IC) tracks as well as management tracks
Competitive healthcare benefits according to country
Competitive compensation and a stock option incentive program to ensure long term alignment within the company
International organization that enables you to work across boundaries, travel to different locations, and enjoy the dynamics of a rapidly growing startup']
