['General Information
Req #
WD00044900
Career area:
Legal
Country/Region:
United States of America
State:
North Carolina
City:
Morrisville
Date:
Tuesday, January 10, 2023
Working time:
Full-time
Additional Locations:', '', 'Why Work at Lenovo
Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology that builds a brighter, more sustainable and inclusive future for our customers, colleagues, communities, and the planet.

And we go big. No, not big—huge.

We’re not just a US$70 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re transforming the world through intelligent transformation, offering the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices, infrastructure, and solutions. With more than 71,500 employees doing business in 180 markets, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.

The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...', 'Description and Requirements
Job Description:
Lenovo is seeking a Lead Senior Counsel, for its Legal Center of Excellence (“Legal COE”) Leading the North America COE team, reporting directly to the Legal COE Director. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing leadership and oversight to a team of capable attorneys/paralegals. The team’s main responsibility is to provide contract legal support in business-critical transactional processes, which include drafting, negotiation, management and execution of its commercial agreements. The Lead Senior Counsel, Legal is also expected to play an integral role in executing a global strategy for the transformation of Lenovo’s contracting capabilities across different jurisdictions, Business Units and functional areas.
You will be expected to work as the Legal COE point of contact within the region for contracts involving primarily sales and marketing, but that may also include supply chain (e.g., direct and indirect procurement). Communicating effectively about legal and business matters, providing good risk/benefit analysis and guidance to internal stakeholders are key skills to be leveraged when supporting complex agreements including: Sales and Services Agreements (including DaaS, SaaS and others), Bids and RFPs, Purchase, subcontracting, licensing, reseller and channel agreements, NDAs, and SOWs. Experience with Governmental Contracting (Locals, State, Federal) is mandatory.
You are expected to play a key role in the development and deployment of contract management capabilities for Lenovo, including supporting the adoption of a new Contract Lifecycle Management technology solution and the applicable workflows and key performance indicators. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining multiple contract templates, playbooks, document retention policies, as well as training and contributing with the development of self-help solutions to end-users. The person will collaborate with internal and outside counsel, technology experts, marketing and sales leads, product developers as well as with Lenovo’s customers and suppliers as needed.
Job Requirements
Contract Drafting and Negotiation
J.D. from an accredited law school
8+ years of legal experience (may be concurrent with leading a team) in drafting, reviewing, and negotiating a variety of agreements, particularly within the technology industry, including some familiarity with Governmental procurement
Experience reviewing and analyzing businesses while developing and communicating creative solutions and mitigation strategies for key negotiation points
Team Management
3+ years of experience leading and managing a team
Implementing and following standard operating procedures for the key processes driven by the area
Ability to assign and oversee work streams through analysis of a team’s skill and experience
Strong coaching skills
Experience managing people in remote locations
Preferred Requirements:
Client Relationship Development/Management
Proven track record in building strong, trust-based relationships with diverse client groups
Ability to interface with customers and members of large organizations
Comfort around running Steering Groups and reporting on performance to clients
Demonstrate an ability to thrive in a large, global company while coordinating the efforts of a large cross-functional group of internal stakeholders
Drive for Continuous Improvement
Quick to identify and resolve issues in collaboration with client and team members
Proficiency in utilizing contract management technology for client/company reporting, workflow management, and team performance metrics
Possesses an appetite for innovation, driving efficiencies by developing playbooks, templates, etc.
Experience in change management as a result of implementation of company-wide policies and procedures
Strong communication and presentation skills will be necessary to explain complex matters to business partners in a manner that is readily understandable in order to ensure well-informed business decisions
Collaborative Spirit
Proven ability to work collaboratively with different internal groups/functions
Demonstrated ability to work well with all levels of an organization to provide excellent client service

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.
Lenovo adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy for US-based employees. As a condition of employment, employees must adhere to Lenovo’s US Vaccination Policy and be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to any applicable accommodations. To be fully vaccinated means individuals must receive the full series of a vaccine either approved by the FDA or WHO and listed by the CDC (e.g. two dose of the Moderna, AstraZeneca or Pfizer-BioNTech vaccines; or one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine). This applies to all US-based employees, contractors and interns, regardless of work location. As a condition of employment, you must provide proof that you are fully vaccinated or follow Lenovo’s accommodation process.', '', 'Multiple Countries (Posting Locations)
United States of America']

column1: Senior Director Product Management, Business Intelligence Technologies
column7:
['Company Overview', 'ConcertAI’s mission is to accelerate insights, advance research, and improve patient outcomes in oncology and across life sciences. ConcertAI’s leading real-world evidence, AI technology and software-as-a-service solutions support healthcare decision-making across clinical research & development through commercialization. Top biopharma sponsors, clinical research organizations, healthcare providers and institutions rely on ConcertAI’s evidence-generation and digital transformation capabilities to advance precision medicine and medical innovation.', '', 'Role Summary', 'ConcertAI is an entrepreneurial environment where vision, operating with urgency, and patient centricity are core values. We follow an “incubation” approach to solution creation where we rely on smaller teams to create, secure early lighthouse client adoption, and rapidly innovate. As multiple lighthouse clients adopt, we scale quickly for broader market execution. This requires our executives and product owners alike to be comfortable as visionaries and strategic thinkers as well as practical “doers” across all aspects of product ownership/development/management.', '', 'Reporting to the Head, Technology Innovation, the Sr Product Director should have a demonstrated history of defining, launching, and scaling Business intelligence and Reporting solutions for pharma commercial functions, ideally with a patient centric emphasis. These solutions should have advanced specific objectives of patient identification for treatment eligibility, confirming of onboarding to treatment, supporting patient adherence – all in service of furthering patient outcomes.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Responsible for the vision, design, management, thought leadership, and sales support of CAI’s Business intelligence and Reporting offerings
Work with the Sr Management Team to advance solutions through our defined incubation process and ultimately deliver on the business plan, including annual bookings & revenue targets for new and existing SaaS solutions
Regularly engage clients in support of BI solutions supporting client satisfaction, sales opportunities, and development of new capabilities to meet client’s evolving needs.
Lead the team responsible for the development, implementation, and operations of our BI technology suite.']

['Job Type: Full-time
Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions.
We’re looking for a talented professional with a remarkably positive attitude who wants to change the world for the better.
With our Streamlyne Research eRA, we have great momentum, ambitious growth plans, and amazing innovations. We need an outstanding Sales Manager who can end-to-end sales activities for Streamlyne Research eRA. Some travel is required.
There is no cap on the earning potential.


Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.
Responsibilities
Selling our software subscriptions and related implementation services
Meet the quotas and targets that are specific for this role
Own and update the sales pipeline as well as provide weekly updates
Visit, email, and phone prospects to convert them into qualified prospects
Increase revenue and market share with specific targets
Create and deliver effective presentations to articulate our compelling value proposition
Effectively understand and meet prospects’ complex business requirements
Develop strategies to have differentiators and increase our win-rate
Manage the entire response process of RFP/RFI/RFQs and all other types of prospect communications
Execute strategies for team selling to respond to prospects’ needs with members of the team from marketing, product management, and software development
Maintain and update the company CRM system. Ensure that the CRM data is accurate and the single version of truth
Work with marketing to effectively execute marketing and branding campaigns
Generate weekly and monthly sales reports and ensure customer success by identifying and following through on upsell opportunities
Maintain goal-result alignment by working with the senior management
Qualify and prioritize leads and set up demonstrations of our product
Acquire an exceptional volume of leads and inquiries at conferences and other venues
Be an evangelist for Streamlyne and its projects
Qualifications
Positive attitude, self-motivated and creative. Loves challenges and relationship-based selling.
A great communicator with impressive phone presence who is genuinely interested in solving problems.
A College degree (preferably in a related area)
At least 2+ years of experience as part of a sales organization selling SaaS products to medium to large size complex organizations
Experience in education technology, SaaS ERP and/or Research Administration is a big plus
Full sales cycle skills, including research, discovery, software demonstrations, pricing, and negotiation
Proven track record of consistently exceeding quotas and ranking in the top-tier of the sales force
Ability to cut through barriers to get to multiple decision makers and departments within an account
Strong communication skills with those at the VP and Senior Director level
Excellent business writing, oral communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to map and report prospects decision cycle, from identification to finalizing contracts
Benefits
Medical
Vision
Dental
401k
Travel
We also offer stock options to key employees after a period of excellent performance and value creation.
Compensation:
Commensurate with experience and past performance. Base salary plus a commission. The commission plan has no cap, potentially leading to very high compensation.
Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.']

['CHICAGO, ILLINOIS /
SALES /
FULL-TIME
/ HYBRID', 'We’re Phrasee and we help brands Get the magic words that make them millions.

Our mission is to deliver state-of-the-art technology that arms marketers with the right message... for the right person... every time.

Phrasee generates and optimizes on-brand marketing messages in real-time, to maximize customer engagement. For marketers, putting the right message in front of the right person at the right time is a proven way to drive better engagement and incremental revenue.

Phrasee makes this easy, scalable, and automated by using its AI to generate on-brand messages in real-time that are optimized for greater conversions. The world’s largest B2C-focused companies trust Phrasee to transform the performance of their marketing communications across all digital channels.

From email and SMS to web and social campaigns, Phrasee’s AI-powered messages ensure brands deliver a unified and consistent customer experience.

We have an exciting opportunity to join the Sales team at Phrasee, an innovative AI company that works with many of the world’s largest consumer brands and retailers. Our solutions enable these organizations to generate, optimize and analyse on-brand marketing messages to maximize customer engagement.
As a Phrasee Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will generate interest in Phrasee’s solutions by having high-level conversations with senior marketing executives about their business and marketing challenges. You’ll be responsible for top-of-funnel pipeline generation and will work with Phrasee’s Account Executives to prospect into Enterprise accounts to generate qualified new business opportunities.

The SDR position is based (hybrid) in our Chicago office and often leads to more senior roles within our Sales and Customer Success teams. This will provide you with an amazing opportunity to learn face-to-face from our awesome sales and marketing teams as well as providing the flexibility and convenience of home working.
As a Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to:
Be a subject matter expert on Phrasee’s AI solutions, as well as the competitive landscape.
Strategize with account executives on approach to developing new business opportunities.
Creatively research targeted accounts to identify key contacts and critical account information prior to a prospecting call.
Communicate Phrasee’s vision and value proposition to C-/VP/Director level decision makers within target accounts, using value-based selling techniques.
Input and maintain account data effectively and efficiently in our CRM.
You are:
Are not afraid to learn and communicate new ideas to prospective enterprise customers.
Bring a positive "can-do" attitude towards work and life.
Have a strong desire to be a top performer within a winning team.
Are comfortable working collaboratively with customers and colleagues in a highly visible role.
Enjoy being part of a fast-paced work environment, where your curiosity, creativity and intellect will be rewarded.
Have a sincere interest in B2C Marketing and AI tech and a desire to work in the SaaS, Marketing Tech and/or AI sector.
Know your way around a computer and applications like MS Office or G-Suite.
Minimum 2 years of relevant, commercial work experience, preferably in a customer-facing role.
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of relevant work experience.
What we're offering:
20 days’ vacation + 10 public holidays + additional day for every year of tenure up to 25 days.
401k matching up to 3%.
️- Up to 100% contribution to Medical, Vision and Dental cover.
2pm Friday finish in August.
Enhanced maternity and paternity leave.
A fun, friendly, and comfortable working environment.
❤️ - Dedicated Wellness month
– Mac or Dell laptop. Your choice!
A culture of autonomy, inclusivity and high-energy.
The opportunity to work with next-generation AI that is quickly becoming a must-have for marketing teams.
The time and to space think and to do things right. Our team is a democracy. Everybody has a voice in how things are done.
Uncapped commission
– The chance to work for a young, scale up company with and AWESOME team and culture, and a cutting-edge product that actually shows the value of AI!
This role is Chicago-based, but hybrid (2-3 days a week in the office if not traveling).
✈️ - We will require travel as needed to achieve goals (likely not more than 10%, given the current business climate).']

column1: Senior Product Marketing Manager | GTM, Accounting Channel
column7:
['Ramp is building the next generation of finance tools—from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations—designed to save businesses time and money with every click. Over 12,000 customers cut their expenses by 3.5% per year and close their books 8x faster by switching to the Ramp platform.', 'Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment software in America and enables billions of dollars of purchases each year. Ramp continues to grow quickly, more than doubling its revenue run rate in the first half of 2022.', "Valued at $8.1 billion, Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. Ramp was named Fast Company’s most innovative finance company in 2022 and #5 on LinkedIn Top Startups 2022.", "About the Role

As a Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for owning the go-to-market strategy and execution of our accounting channel across messaging and positioning, accountant persona research, product launches to accounting channel, and sales enablement.

Additionally, you’ll partner closely with the Product, Marketing, Channel Sales, and Customer Success team to drive channel growth through integrated campaigns, lifecycle marketing, events, content creation, and customer education. Ramp's Accounting Channel is composed of accountant partners and firms who recommend Ramp's Corporate Card and Spend Management solution to their clients. Success relies on partners having thorough product knowledge, marketing resources and training. The ideal candidate for this role is business-minded, strategic and has experience in partner and channel marketing.", 'Lead, develop and execute the go-to-market strategy for Ramp’s Accounting Channel function within Product Marketing
Be Ramp’s accountant persona expert, developing deep market, industry, competitive, and buyer research to translate Ramp’s products and value propositions to our accounting audience
Launch all of Ramp’s products and releases to our accounting firm partners and their clients
Enable our accounting channel sales team and accounting firm partners on our product portfolio through the creation of sales enablement, collateral and programs
Drive product awareness, partner lead acquisition, partner conversion, partner client referrals, and partner-driven revenue through the cross-functional development of industry thought leadership, content creation, events and webinars assets, integrated campaigns, and lifecycle marketing
Be a spokesperson, evangelist, and presenter for our accounting firm partners and their clients across events, webinars, and critical customer engagements
Support in the creation partner education resource materials and certification programs to ensure partner product knowledge expertise', 'What You’ll Need', '5+ years of relevant experience in product marketing, channel strategy, partner marketing, or growth marketing in B2B SaaS or within the accounting industry
Industry expert and veteran of channel sales and partner marketing strategies, including a proven track record of creating and executing go-to-market plans for new products and features
Experience developing and delivering training and enablement programs for channel partners and sales teams
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including public speaking experience
Strong technical acumen and ability to simplify complex concepts for various audiences
Proven ability to drive cross-functional initiatives, achieve stakeholder buy-in, and make decisions
Strong analytical skills and experience using data to inform decisions
Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment and comfort within a highly cross-functional role', 'Nice To Haves', 'MBA or BS in economics, computer science, MIS, or related STEM field
Experience working in hyper-growth startups and/or technology companies
Domain expertise in the financial and accounting software space', 'Compensation']

column7:
['SUMMARY', "We are searching for an exceptional enterprise salesperson to focus on new and expansion business from Large Tier prospects and customers. The successful candidate will understand their customers' business objectives and act as their trusted advisor for using MasterControl effectively in the product life cycle. They will gather customer feedback and requests and work with internal teams to help align our strategy to create customer value. This individual needs to communicate effectively across multiple departments and customers, have the ability to understand technical issues, and enjoys the challenges of providing excellent customer service in a fast paced environment.", 'RESPONSIBILITIES', "Ownership of the full sales cycle from lead to close
Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers
Foster new relationships for MasterConrol through outbound efforts
Help educate customers on the value of MasterControl throughout the product life cycle
Navigate key decision makers to build MasterControl buy-in within organizations
Identify customer needs and collaborate with MasterControl teammates to ensure customer success with special emphasis on signup, upgrade, and renewal
Initiate, negotiate and close new and renewal contracts with customers
Communicate and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, onboarding, and technical inquiries
Monitor and identify adoption and utilization trends
Provide recommendations based on customer's business needs and usage patterns
Conduct periodic customer health-checks with an emphasis on customer happiness", 'REQUIREMENTS:', "8+ years of Enterprise Account Executive experience
Relevant sales experience, preferably in a SaaS organization
Industry knowledge and experience in Pharmaceutical or Medical Device
Experience managing a pipeline and closing large contract
Excellent communication skills both with customers and within an organization
Proven negotiation and closing skills
Strong track record of navigating within large and mid-market organizations
Ability to develop senior level relationships quickly and effectively
Experience presenting to senior managers and the C-suite
Ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously at various stages of the buying process
Takes an active interest in increasing customer satisfaction and deepening customer relationships
Ability to be flexible and adaptive
Bachelor's degree required
Some travel required", '', 'PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS', 'Ability to work non-standard hours on occasion, when necessary.
Ability to operate a computer and work at a desk for extended periods of time.', 'About MasterControl:']

["Feedzai is the world's first RiskOps platform for financial risk management, and the market leader in safeguarding global commerce with today's most advanced cloud-based risk management platform, powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence. Feedzai is securing the transition to a cashless world while enabling digital trust in every transaction and payment type. The world's largest banks, processors, and retailers trust Feedzai to protect trillions of dollars and manage risk while improving the customer experience for everyday users, without compromising privacy. Feedzai is a Series D company and has raised $282M to date. With a valuation of +$1.5B, the company's technology protects 900 million people in 190 countries.", "The Marketing Team is empowered to spark change daily with MAP - Mastery in their role, Autonomy to make decisions, and a Purpose to make the world a safer place for all consumers. Using cutting-edge tech and delivering best-in-class content, they influence the trajectory of our company. It's this team spirit and trust in each other that let us go further together. This team has two simple goals: 1. Everyone in the world knows about the Feedzai brand 2. Making sure our sales team is busy. Join Us!", 'You:', 'You are a highly experienced Field Marketing Professional with more than ten years of experience in SaaS technology, preferably the fintech sector, in Senior Manager roles providing leadership and execution on all aspects of the marketing function.', 'Your experience includes:', 'Regional digital marketing and advertising
Digital and live events
Demand generation programs
Sales enablement assets
Localized PR and Analyst relations
Analytics
Measurement tools for planning successful programs', "You can work as an individual contributor but believes in sharing information and transparency and enjoys collaborating with the broader team. You excel at being organized and prioritizing marketing programs to align with the company's strategy. You will work directly with every North American Account Executive and collaborate with the broader marketing team. As a result, you can identify, facilitate, and implement successful regional marketing programs and measure the effectiveness of the programs, both qualitative and quantitative.", 'Your Day to Day:', 'Communicates and supports global marketing programs and initiatives in the region
Regionalized marketing, gathers feedback from the field for regional marketing initiatives
Identifies and manages localized digital and live events
Supports / leads ABM strategy
Manage localized advertising, associations, PR, and social
Supports customer and channel marketing strategy', 'You Have & You Know-how:']

column1: CSG Product Management Sr Manager/Director - Success Plans
column7: ['To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.', '', 'Job Category', '', 'Job Details', 'Department Description:', 'The Customer Success Group’s (CSG) Offer Management team is a product management organization responsible for Salesforce’s Customer Success Plan offer portfolio (Standard, Premier, and Signature Success Plans) with which we enable our customers to realize value from their Salesforce technology investments. We work backward from the customer to address their needs across all segments (Small Business, Commercial, and Enterprise). The team is the “voice of the customer and market” to the rest of the CSG organization and we work across all functions within CSG and the Salesforce product organizations to continuously enhance the Success Plans offer portfolio customer value and customer experience.', 'Role Description:', 'The Salesforce Success Plans deliver value to customers with a combination of people, process, and technology capabilities. We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join our Customer Success Plan product management team, with specific responsibility to deliver customer value by driving the portfolio features enabled by innovative technologies.', 'Responsibilities:']

['Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation. We empower the world’s most innovative companies to deliver transformational products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software solutions, we help our customers solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Whether you are a software developer, product engineer, sales team member, or part of our corporate team, at Ansys we know that by embracing what makes us each unique, we become collectively better.', '', 'Summary / Role Purpose', '', 'The Director of Strategic Partnerships is responsible for leading key top-tier partnerships at Ansys. This includes managing existing engagements to increase business value as well as seeking new opportunities to expand these partnerships. These relationships are key to Ansys’ business growth and have significant visibility with the executive management teams of both companies. This person will manage selected strategic partnerships in alignment with the strategic priorities and goals of the company. Success in this role will be measured by delivering on the agreed-upon goals and metrics of the partnership, driving both short-term and long-term objectives. You will be working closely with other internal stakeholders – including Ansys sales, product, corporate strategy, and marketing teams, as well as Ansys senior management to ensure success of the partnership(s).', '', 'Key Duties and Responsibilities', '', 'Proactively manage the strategic partnership(s) to deliver on business targets
Define and reinforce Ansys requirements related to the strategic partners in alignment with senior management goals
Influence a team of senior sales and technology professionals (ANSYS and partners)
Develop and iterate upon appropriate go-to-market plans in coordination with ANSYS business or product requirements
Look for opportunities to expand the partnership(s) to other business areas, industries, geographies in support of Ansys’ growth strategy
Prioritize sales and product investments, and measure ROI results
Orchestrate the execution of all elements of the partnership agreement
Ensure that effective internal processes and legal frameworks are in place to manage and govern the partnership(s)
Represent Ansys as an industry leader with partners, customers, and other audiences
Ensure that our strategic partnerships and partnership processes are appropriately visible both internally and externally', '']

column1: Product Manager, Staff - MSP/ Network as a Service

column4: ['110 Rose Orchard Way, San Jose, CA 95134', 'Full-time']
column7:
['Founded in 2007, Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) continues to transform enterprise security for the modern era. Born and built in the cloud, Zscaler envisions a world in which the exchange of information is always seamless and secure.

Today, Zscaler is accelerating digital transformation so customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange protects over 6,000 customers of all sizes and industries by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location. Distributed across more than 150 data centers globally, the Zero Trust Exchange is the world’s largest in-line cloud security platform, powering over 250 billion transactions per day.

Zscaler enables the world’s leading organizations to securely transform their networks and
applications for a mobile and cloud first world. Zscaler’s platform secures users, workloads and IoT/OT devices through a cloud architecture that optimizes digital experience and reduces risk, cost and complexity by eliminating the need for traditional networking and security investments like firewalls, VPNs and MPLS. Its flagship Zscaler Internet Access (ZIA) provides superior cyberthreat protection and data protection, as well as fast, direct connectivity to the internet and SaaS applications. Used in more than 185 countries, Zscaler protects thousands of enterprises and government agencies from cyberattacks and data loss, including 40%+ of the Fortune 500 and 30%+ of the Global 2000.', "We are looking for a Sr. Product Marketing Manager to drive product marketing areas for Zscaler Private Access (ZPA), the industry's first and most deployed Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) offering. You will work with the best in business, and we need you to bring the best of your passion and creativity to make the team even better. In this position you own all elements of the marketing function as it relates to your area and drive success measurably. The person must also have a creative flair, project management and planning skill, sales understanding, and ability to work collaboratively across the organization. In this role, you will help us meet the requirements of our rapidly growing customer base and be game changers in the security space. The ideal candidate will have worked in a high growth software company where they have driven marketing initiatives, created compelling content, organized events and been an evangelist for their product area.", 'Key responsibilities:', 'Lead the execution of a cross-functional GTM strategy to help Zscaler’s ZTNA continue being the leader in the space and to grow market share further
Amplify Zscaler’s brand as an innovator and leader in the ZTNA & Security Service Edge (SSE) category.
Create high-impact content that aligns to the buyer’s journey.
Work with the broader marketing team on programs to accelerate market awareness, demand generation, and product revenue growth
Enable the sales and partner organization to effectively communicate Zscaler’s differentiated value proposition', '', '5+ years of experience in product marketing positions.
Experience working in enterprise software-as-a-service companies, preferably in security or networking
Outstanding communication and collaboration skills', '', 'The Zscaler Culture
We are playing in a rapidly growing 20B + TAM and huge market mega-shifts that leads directly to Zscaler; tracking a growth path similar to Salesforce, Workday, & ServiceNow. People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated, and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

What You Can Expect From Us:', 'An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
Competitive salary and benefits, including equity
The pace and excitement of working for a Silicon Valley Unicorn', 'Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available at http://www.zscaler.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

#LI-MM6']

['BigSpring is an AI-powered work readiness platform that gets people job-ready, not test-ready. The platform creates work-ready talent at a pace with rapidly evolving market needs. BigSpring’s reach extends globally to over a million learners with customers such as Google, Facebook, Uber, Amazon, Samsung, AXA Insurance, Sotheby’s, Tata Group and others. BigSpring has been selected by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer 2020 (past recipients included Google, Twitter, Airbnb, and Palantir).

ABOUT THE ROLE
Business Development Manager BDR/SDR Team Manager will focus on: (1) Leading a team of SDRs/ BDRs to create qualified opportunities for the sales team, (2) Train other members of the SDR/BDR team, and (3) take on operational and administrative tasks to help the SDR/BDR team perform and exceed expectations. You are a source of knowledge and best practices amongst the SDRs/BDRs, and help to train, onboard, and mentor new SDRs/BDRs with the help of the Sales Development Enablement team.
In this role you’ll:
Train other members of the SDR Team to identify, contact, and create qualified opportunities
Ensure SDR Team members improve performance and abilities over time by providing coaching and feedback in recurring weekly 1:1s
Plan for hiring and onboarding new SDR.
Work closely with the Demand Gen team to provide feedback on MQLs and campaigns
Work closely with Sales and other members of the SDR Leadership team to improve opportunity management and qualification processes
Work closely with Sales, Senior SDR Manager/Director, to identify areas of improvement for the SDR Teams
Work in collaboration with Content, Marketing Program Managers, and Product Marketing to develop effective messaging to convert inbound interest into qualified pipeline
Accurately forecasts weekly, monthly, quarterly attainment
What you’ll bring to the team:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a BDR role with experience leading and growing a BDR team in a hands-on management/player-coach capacity.
Track record of achieving lead generation quotas within a company selling enterprise software (Saas).
Hands-on experience with multiple prospecting techniques and channels.
Experience with marketing & sales tools such as CRM, Chat, Marketing Automation, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, HubSpot and Data Management tools.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to deliver presentations to executive management.
Why you’ll love working here:
You’ll be part of an innovation-driven, high-growth company on a mission to improve people’s lives
Competitive compensation package with equity
Exceptional medical, vision and dental coverage
Flexible vacation and PTO
Female Founder/CEO
Supportive, highly collaborative team environment
Bi-Weekly Learning Sessions
BigSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. BigSpring does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. You must have authorization to work in the location the position is posted.']

column1: VP Business Development & Sales – North America
column7:
['VP Business Development & Sales – North America
Based in the US (REMOTE, preferably West Coast) with good accessibility to travel to the West, Central, the VP Business
Development & Sales will identify and qualify opportunities within the account territory; will have experience in the IoT or
InfoSec markets, understand the dynamics and factors working for a software and SaaS based company, can develop
Partner and Ecosystem based selling models, can sell business applications solutions to prospective customers; manage and
drive sales opportunities through strategic selling; negotiate and close business; and manage the business relationship with
clients. Extensive travel may be required.

Responsibilities:
Prospect, forecast, resource allocation, and planning of new business deals. Develop solution proposals encompassing all
aspects of the Device Authority software solution. Advise customer on ROI using business drivers while presenting product
sales presentations. Participate in the creation, presentation and sale of a complete value proposition via the telephone,
internet, webinar and customer meetings. Negotiate pricing and contractual terms to close sale as required. Thoroughly
qualify all leads and sales opportunities. Present Device Authority’s solution in a compelling, positive, and professional way.
Work as part of a virtual team. Sell to C-level senior executives and have a track record of structuring and closing six figure
plus sized deals. Reporting to: North America President Sales
Desired Skills and Experience
You are a top-tier sales executive, experienced in selling to the OEM market. A prior track record within the IoT and M2M
space is extremely advantageous. You are motivated by being an integral part of the adoption of cutting-edge security
technologies. You can develop contracts and working with OEMs and similar partners; you enjoy educating customers about
the way that your company’s technology will improve their performance, top- and bottom-lines. In addition, you are results
focused and action oriented. Experience selling through channel partners is plus.

At Device Authority, you will continue your track record in building, managing, and delivering high performing sales results
and teams. You will play a critical role driving a significant share of revenue for us. This is a key role in the rapid growth and
development of an innovative player in the InfoSec software space. You will have an opportunity to join the company at an
early stage and help form, create and enjoy the roller coaster ride to global recognition, status and success.

Qualifications/Skills:
Enjoyment of the startup culture with all its growth and change; flexible personality.
BSc/BA and a minimum of 8+ year of relevant business experience.
8+ years direct sales experience, selling SaaS and/or enterprise software to VP, SVP, and C-Level Executives.
Software experience is a must, preferable IoT and/or InfoSec or Data Security selling and market experience.
Have the ability to develop, drive and execute sales and marketing development programs with OEMs and partners.
OEM, IoT Platform & Service providers, SI, MNO/MVNO experience desired, as well as business development', '', 'experience as they form a core part of the Go to Market strategy.
Able to create leads from your own prospecting efforts, leveraging your contacts and existing accounts and
partners, as well as follow up company led initiatives and opportunities.
Experience building a pipeline and qualifying and identifying deals that you can close. Results driven and able to
achieve/exceed monthly/quarterly/annual sales quotas.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal with internal/external clients. Consistent overachievement of
quota and revenue goals in a comparable role.
Has the drive and self-motivation to be based from home but very active and visible in this exciting IoT marketplace.
Extensive travel will be required for this position, particularly across the United States, surrounding territories, and
sometimes Europe & APAC.
You are a proven, successful sales person, with the ability to sell solutions (not a product) to C-level executives or
line of business.
Ability to play in a team environment with the ability to work independently and remotely from other members of
your team.
Ability to accurately forecast, manage a staged sales process, and work with marketing on MQL to SQL conversions.
Exceptional management, interpersonal, written and presentation skills.



About this company:
Device Authority is the leading provider of IoT IAM. Our KeyScaler™
platform provides trust for IoT devices and the IoT ecosystem, to
address the challenges of securing the Internet of Things. KeyScaler™
uses breakthrough technology including Dynamic Device Key
Generation (DDKG) and PKI Signature+ that delivers unrivalled
simplicity and trust to IoT devices. This solution delivers automated
device provisioning, authentication, credential management and policy
based end-to-end data privacy/encryption. Healthcare, Energy,
Automotive, Retail, Agriculture, and Government verticals are our
focus

With offices in California, US and Reading, UK, Device Authority
partners with the leading IoT ecosystem providers, including AWS,
EnTrust, HID Global, Intel, Microsoft, PTC & Thales Security.
Keep updated by visiting www. deviceauthority.com and following
@DeviceAuthority on Twitter.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our
company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color,
national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status, or disability status.

Please submit applications to careers@deviceauthority.com or apply on the LinkedIn link for the open posting.
UK Head Office North America Office
Fora, Thames Tower, 12677 Alcosta Blvd
Station Road, Suite 250
San Ramon, CA 94583
Reading, RG1 1LX USA']

column1: Sr. Lead IT Systems Engineer - AppDynamics - Work From Home
column7:
['About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.', "The Role
Join a team of monitoring and event management engineers leading a new rollout of AppDynamics. This will require building a new instance, integrating with our existing event management system, working with internal and external customers to configure and update appropriate monitoring, and ongoing patching/maintenance of the system.
The engineer will exercise significant latitude to translate the needs of the business into system capabilities. Perform research and development activities to support future IT business strategies. Work closely with internal customers by consulting and recommending solutions.
The Main Responsibilities
Candidate will be expected to provide expertise, design input, and recommendations on best practices as we deploy a new instance of AppDynamics.
Implement best practices in areas of AppDynamics configuration as Lumen onboards new customers.
Work with architecture, business, and delivery teams to determine strategic direction for APM platform
Work closely with other team members on tools such as Zabbix and Watson AIOps to provide a complete monitoring solution and end to end event management for our clients.
Partner with the automation team and internal customers to find opportunities for self-healing automations.
Work with internal compliance organizations to ensure that all applications meet requirements
Develop and maintain documentation for our tools and work with our frontline engineers to ensure they can address most common issues with our platform.
Participate in initiatives and projects to develop new and existing monitoring platform (e.g. Strategic IT Roadmaps, Technology Strategies & Roadmaps, architecture positions, enterprise data management and governance)
Provide occasional 3rd level, off hours support for monitoring and event management tools
What We Look For in a Candidate
Required Skills
Expert level hands on experience with AppDynamics
Experience with at least of the following: Zabbix, Watson AIOps/NOI/Netcool, SevOne
Experience with various monitoring technologies such as webhooks, SNMP, ICMP, syslog, MIBs
Strong familiarity with SAAS deployments and supporting architecture.
Experience with scripting, particularly Python or PERL
RHEL administration experience
Network connectivity troubleshooting experience. Understand network protocols TCP/IP, HTTP, ICMP
Understanding of web services- SOAP/REST
Desired Skills
5+ working with an enterprise monitoring application to monitor network devices and servers.
5+ systems administration (Linux)
Experience with IBM Netcool/NOI/Watson AIOps
Experience integrating with Confluent Kafka
Experience working with databases and writing SQL queries
Experience working with data center operations teams
Experience managing or supporting a large enterprise network with business-critical applications
Experience working with third party vendors for application support with emphasis on the following tools: Zabbix, IBM Netcool/NOI/Watson AIOps, SevOne, BigPanda, Kafka
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and relevant experience
6 + years related experience

['General Information
Req #
WD00044900

Legal

United States of America

North Carolina

Tuesday, January 10, 2023

Additional Locations:', '', 'Why Work at Lenovo
Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology that builds a brighter, more sustainable and inclusive future for our customers, colleagues, communities, and the planet.

And we go big. No, not big—huge.

We’re not just a US$70 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re transforming the world through intelligent transformation, offering the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices, infrastructure, and solutions. With more than 71,500 employees doing business in 180 markets, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.

The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...', 'Description and Requirements
Job Description:
Lenovo is seeking a Lead Senior Counsel, for its Legal Center of Excellence (“Legal COE”) Leading the North America COE team, reporting directly to the Legal COE Director. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing leadership and oversight to a team of capable attorneys/paralegals. The team’s main responsibility is to provide contract legal support in business-critical transactional processes, which include drafting, negotiation, management and execution of its commercial agreements. The Lead Senior Counsel, Legal is also expected to play an integral role in executing a global strategy for the transformation of Lenovo’s contracting capabilities across different jurisdictions, Business Units and functional areas.
You will be expected to work as the Legal COE point of contact within the region for contracts involving primarily sales and marketing, but that may also include supply chain (e.g., direct and indirect procurement). Communicating effectively about legal and business matters, providing good risk/benefit analysis and guidance to internal stakeholders are key skills to be leveraged when supporting complex agreements including: Sales and Services Agreements (including DaaS, SaaS and others), Bids and RFPs, Purchase, subcontracting, licensing, reseller and channel agreements, NDAs, and SOWs. Experience with Governmental Contracting (Locals, State, Federal) is mandatory.
You are expected to play a key role in the development and deployment of contract management capabilities for Lenovo, including supporting the adoption of a new Contract Lifecycle Management technology solution and the applicable workflows and key performance indicators. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining multiple contract templates, playbooks, document retention policies, as well as training and contributing with the development of self-help solutions to end-users. The person will collaborate with internal and outside counsel, technology experts, marketing and sales leads, product developers as well as with Lenovo’s customers and suppliers as needed.
Job Requirements
Contract Drafting and Negotiation
J.D. from an accredited law school
8+ years of legal experience (may be concurrent with leading a team) in drafting, reviewing, and negotiating a variety of agreements, particularly within the technology industry, including some familiarity with Governmental procurement
Experience reviewing and analyzing businesses while developing and communicating creative solutions and mitigation strategies for key negotiation points
Team Management
3+ years of experience leading and managing a team
Implementing and following standard operating procedures for the key processes driven by the area
Ability to assign and oversee work streams through analysis of a team’s skill and experience
Strong coaching skills
Experience managing people in remote locations
Preferred Requirements:
Client Relationship Development/Management
Proven track record in building strong, trust-based relationships with diverse client groups
Ability to interface with customers and members of large organizations
Comfort around running Steering Groups and reporting on performance to clients
Demonstrate an ability to thrive in a large, global company while coordinating the efforts of a large cross-functional group of internal stakeholders
Drive for Continuous Improvement
Quick to identify and resolve issues in collaboration with client and team members
Proficiency in utilizing contract management technology for client/company reporting, workflow management, and team performance metrics
Possesses an appetite for innovation, driving efficiencies by developing playbooks, templates, etc.
Experience in change management as a result of implementation of company-wide policies and procedures
Strong communication and presentation skills will be necessary to explain complex matters to business partners in a manner that is readily understandable in order to ensure well-informed business decisions
Collaborative Spirit
Proven ability to work collaboratively with different internal groups/functions
Demonstrated ability to work well with all levels of an organization to provide excellent client service

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.
Lenovo adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy for US-based employees. As a condition of employment, employees must adhere to Lenovo’s US Vaccination Policy and be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to any applicable accommodations. To be fully vaccinated means individuals must receive the full series of a vaccine either approved by the FDA or WHO and listed by the CDC (e.g. two dose of the Moderna, AstraZeneca or Pfizer-BioNTech vaccines; or one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine). This applies to all US-based employees, contractors and interns, regardless of work location. As a condition of employment, you must provide proof that you are fully vaccinated or follow Lenovo’s accommodation process.', '', 'Multiple Countries (Posting Locations)
United States of America']

column1: Senior Director Product Management, Business Intelligence Technologies
column7:
['Company Overview', 'ConcertAI’s mission is to accelerate insights, advance research, and improve patient outcomes in oncology and across life sciences. ConcertAI’s leading real-world evidence, AI technology and software-as-a-service solutions support healthcare decision-making across clinical research & development through commercialization. Top biopharma sponsors, clinical research organizations, healthcare providers and institutions rely on ConcertAI’s evidence-generation and digital transformation capabilities to advance precision medicine and medical innovation.', '', 'Role Summary', 'ConcertAI is an entrepreneurial environment where vision, operating with urgency, and patient centricity are core values. We follow an “incubation” approach to solution creation where we rely on smaller teams to create, secure early lighthouse client adoption, and rapidly innovate. As multiple lighthouse clients adopt, we scale quickly for broader market execution. This requires our executives and product owners alike to be comfortable as visionaries and strategic thinkers as well as practical “doers” across all aspects of product ownership/development/management.', '', 'Reporting to the Head, Technology Innovation, the Sr Product Director should have a demonstrated history of defining, launching, and scaling Business intelligence and Reporting solutions for pharma commercial functions, ideally with a patient centric emphasis. These solutions should have advanced specific objectives of patient identification for treatment eligibility, confirming of onboarding to treatment, supporting patient adherence – all in service of furthering patient outcomes.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Responsible for the vision, design, management, thought leadership, and sales support of CAI’s Business intelligence and Reporting offerings
Work with the Sr Management Team to advance solutions through our defined incubation process and ultimately deliver on the business plan, including annual bookings & revenue targets for new and existing SaaS solutions
Regularly engage clients in support of BI solutions supporting client satisfaction, sales opportunities, and development of new capabilities to meet client’s evolving needs.
Lead the team responsible for the development, implementation, and operations of our BI technology suite.']

['Job Type: Full-time
Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions.
We’re looking for a talented professional with a remarkably positive attitude who wants to change the world for the better.
With our Streamlyne Research eRA, we have great momentum, ambitious growth plans, and amazing innovations. We need an outstanding Sales Manager who can end-to-end sales activities for Streamlyne Research eRA. Some travel is required.
There is no cap on the earning potential.


Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.
Responsibilities
Selling our software subscriptions and related implementation services
Meet the quotas and targets that are specific for this role
Own and update the sales pipeline as well as provide weekly updates
Visit, email, and phone prospects to convert them into qualified prospects
Increase revenue and market share with specific targets
Create and deliver effective presentations to articulate our compelling value proposition
Effectively understand and meet prospects’ complex business requirements
Develop strategies to have differentiators and increase our win-rate
Manage the entire response process of RFP/RFI/RFQs and all other types of prospect communications
Execute strategies for team selling to respond to prospects’ needs with members of the team from marketing, product management, and software development
Maintain and update the company CRM system. Ensure that the CRM data is accurate and the single version of truth
Work with marketing to effectively execute marketing and branding campaigns
Generate weekly and monthly sales reports and ensure customer success by identifying and following through on upsell opportunities
Maintain goal-result alignment by working with the senior management
Qualify and prioritize leads and set up demonstrations of our product
Acquire an exceptional volume of leads and inquiries at conferences and other venues
Be an evangelist for Streamlyne and its projects
Qualifications
Positive attitude, self-motivated and creative. Loves challenges and relationship-based selling.
A great communicator with impressive phone presence who is genuinely interested in solving problems.
A College degree (preferably in a related area)
At least 2+ years of experience as part of a sales organization selling SaaS products to medium to large size complex organizations
Experience in education technology, SaaS ERP and/or Research Administration is a big plus
Full sales cycle skills, including research, discovery, software demonstrations, pricing, and negotiation
Proven track record of consistently exceeding quotas and ranking in the top-tier of the sales force
Ability to cut through barriers to get to multiple decision makers and departments within an account
Strong communication skills with those at the VP and Senior Director level
Excellent business writing, oral communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to map and report prospects decision cycle, from identification to finalizing contracts
Benefits
Medical
Vision
Dental
401k
Travel
We also offer stock options to key employees after a period of excellent performance and value creation.
Compensation:
Commensurate with experience and past performance. Base salary plus a commission. The commission plan has no cap, potentially leading to very high compensation.
Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.']
